Hebrew: דִּבְרֵ֥י יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ בֶּן־חִלְקִיָּ֑הוּ מִן־הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּעֲנָת֔וֹת בְּאֶ֖רֶץ בִּנְיָמִֽן׃
Translated: The words of Jeremiah son of Hilkiah, one of the priests at Anathoth in the territory of Benjamin.
Transliteration: diverey yiremeyahu ven-chilekiyahu min-hakhohaniym asher vaanatvot veerets vineyamin

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר הָיָ֤ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלָ֔יו בִּימֵ֛י יֹאשִׁיָּ֥הוּ בֶן־אָמ֖וֹן מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה בִּשְׁלֹשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה שָׁנָ֖ה לְמׇלְכֽוֹ׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to him in the days of King Josiah son of Amon of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign,
Transliteration: asher hayah devar-yehovah elayv viymey yoshiyahu ven-amvon melekhe yehudah vishelosh-eshereh shanah lemׇlekhvo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בִּימֵ֨י יְהוֹיָקִ֤ים בֶּן־יֹאשִׁיָּ֙הוּ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה עַד־תֹּם֙ עַשְׁתֵּ֣י עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֔ה לְצִדְקִיָּ֥הוּ בֶן־יֹאשִׁיָּ֖הוּ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה עַד־גְּל֥וֹת יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַחֲמִישִֽׁי׃ {פ}
Translated: and throughout the days of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah, and until the end of the eleventh year of King Zedekiah son of Josiah of Judah, when Jerusalem went into exile in the fifth month.
Transliteration: vayehiy viymey yehvoyakiym ven-yoshiyahu melekhe yehudah ad-tom ashetey eshereh shanah letsidekiyahu ven-yoshiyahu melekhe yehudah ad-gelvot yerushala͏im vachodesh hachamiyshiy {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בְּטֶ֨רֶם (אצורך) [אֶצׇּרְךָ֤] בַבֶּ֙טֶן֙ יְדַעְתִּ֔יךָ וּבְטֶ֛רֶם תֵּצֵ֥א מֵרֶ֖חֶם הִקְדַּשְׁתִּ֑יךָ נָבִ֥יא לַגּוֹיִ֖ם נְתַתִּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Before I created you in the womb, I selected you;
Before you were born, I consecrated you;
I appointed you a prophet concerning the nations.
Transliteration: veterem (tsvrkh) [etsׇrekha] vaveten yedaetiykha uveterem tetse merechem hikedashetiykha naviy lagvoyim netatiykha

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֗ר אֲהָהּ֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הִנֵּ֥ה לֹֽא־יָדַ֖עְתִּי דַּבֵּ֑ר כִּי־נַ֖עַר אָנֹֽכִי׃ {ס}
Translated:
I replied:
Ah, my Sovereign GOD!
I don’t know how to speak,
For I am still a boy.
Transliteration: vaomar ahah adonay yehovih hineh lo-yadaetiy daver khiy-naar anokhiy {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלַ֔י אַל־תֹּאמַ֖ר נַ֣עַר אָנֹ֑כִי כִּ֠י עַֽל־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֶֽשְׁלָחֲךָ֙ תֵּלֵ֔ךְ וְאֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲצַוְּךָ֖ תְּדַבֵּֽר׃
Translated:
And GOD said to me:
Do not say, “I am still a boy,”
But go wherever I send you
And speak whatever I command you.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay al-tomar naar anokhiy khiy al-khׇl-asher eshelachakha telekhe veet khׇl-asher atsavekha tedaver

Hebrew: אַל־תִּירָ֖א מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם כִּֽי־אִתְּךָ֥ אֲנִ֛י לְהַצִּלֶ֖ךָ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Have no fear of them,
For I am with you to deliver you
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: al-tiyra mifeneyhem khiy-itekha aniy lehatsilekha neum-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־יָד֔וֹ וַיַּגַּ֖ע עַל־פִּ֑י וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלַ֔י הִנֵּ֛ה נָתַ֥תִּי דְבָרַ֖י בְּפִֽיךָ׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> reached out and touched my mouth, and G<small>OD</small> said to me: Herewith I put My words into your mouth.
Transliteration: vayishelach yehovah et-yadvo vayaga al-fiy vayomer yehovah elay hineh natatiy devaray vefiykha

Hebrew: רְאֵ֞ה הִפְקַדְתִּ֣יךָ ׀ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֗ה עַל־הַגּוֹיִם֙ וְעַל־הַמַּמְלָכ֔וֹת לִנְת֥וֹשׁ וְלִנְת֖וֹץ וּלְהַאֲבִ֣יד וְלַהֲר֑וֹס לִבְנ֖וֹת וְלִנְטֽוֹעַ׃ {פ}
Translated:
See, I appoint you this day
Over nations and kingdoms:
To uproot and to pull down,
To destroy and to overthrow,
To build and to plant.
Transliteration: reeh hifekadetiykha hayyvom hazeh al-hagvoyim veal-hamamelakhvot linetvosh velinetvots ulehaaviyd velaharvos livenvot velinetvoa {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י דְבַר־יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלַ֣י לֵאמֹ֔ר מָה־אַתָּ֥ה רֹאֶ֖ה יִרְמְיָ֑הוּ וָאֹמַ֕ר מַקֵּ֥ל שָׁקֵ֖ד אֲנִ֥י רֹאֶֽה׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me: What do you see, Jeremiah? I replied: I see a branch of an almond tree.
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor mah-atah roeh yiremeyahu vaomar makel shaked aniy roeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֵלַ֖י הֵיטַ֣בְתָּ לִרְא֑וֹת כִּֽי־שֹׁקֵ֥ד אֲנִ֛י עַל־דְּבָרִ֖י לַעֲשֹׂתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
GOD said to me:
You have seen right,
For I am watchful to bring My word to pass.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay heytaveta lirevot khiy-shoked aniy al-devariy laashotvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֨י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֤ה <small>׀</small> אֵלַי֙ שֵׁנִ֣ית לֵאמֹ֔ר מָ֥ה אַתָּ֖ה רֹאֶ֑ה וָאֹמַ֗ר סִ֤יר נָפ֙וּחַ֙ אֲנִ֣י רֹאֶ֔ה וּפָנָ֖יו מִפְּנֵ֥י צָפֽוֹנָה׃
Translated:
And the word of GOD came to me a second time: What do you see? I replied:
I see a steaming pot,
Tipped away from the north.
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah <small></small> elay sheniyt lemor mah atah roeh vaomar siyr nafucha aniy roeh ufanayv mifeney tsafvonah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלָ֑י מִצָּפוֹן֙ תִּפָּתַ֣ח הָרָעָ֔ה עַ֥ל כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֖י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
And GOD said to me:
From the north shall disaster break loose
Upon all the inhabitants of the land!
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay mitsafvon tifatach haraah al khׇl-yoshevey haarets

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ הִנְנִ֣י קֹרֵ֗א לְכׇֽל־מִשְׁפְּח֛וֹת מַמְלְכ֥וֹת צָפ֖וֹנָה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וּבָ֡אוּ וְֽנָתְנוּ֩ אִ֨ישׁ כִּסְא֜וֹ פֶּ֣תַח ׀ שַׁעֲרֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם וְעַ֤ל כׇּל־חוֹמֹתֶ֙יהָ֙ סָבִ֔יב וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־עָרֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated:
For I am summoning all the peoples
Of the kingdoms of the north
—declares GOD.
They shall come, and shall each set up a throne
Before the gates of Jerusalem,
Against its walls round about,
And against all the towns of Judah.
Transliteration: khiy hineniy kore lekhׇl-mishefechvot mamelekhvot tsafvonah neum-yehovah uvau venatenu iysh khisevo fetach shaarey yerushala͏im veal khׇl-chvomoteyha saviyv veal khׇl-arey yehudah

Hebrew: וְדִבַּרְתִּ֤י מִשְׁפָּטַי֙ אוֹתָ֔ם עַ֖ל כׇּל־רָעָתָ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲזָב֗וּנִי וַֽיְקַטְּרוּ֙ לֵאלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲו֖וּ לְמַעֲשֵׂ֥י יְדֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
And I will argue My case against them
For all their wickedness:
They have forsaken Me
And sacrificed to other gods
And worshiped the works of their hands.
Transliteration: vedivaretiy mishefatay votam al khׇl-raatam asher azavuniy vayekateru lelohiym acheriym vayishetachavu lemaashey yedeyhem

Hebrew: וְאַתָּה֙ תֶּאְזֹ֣ר מׇתְנֶ֔יךָ וְקַמְתָּ֙ וְדִבַּרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י אֲצַוֶּ֑ךָּ אַל־תֵּחַת֙ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם פֶּֽן־אֲחִתְּךָ֖ לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
So you, gird up your loins,
Arise and speak to them
All that I command you.
Do not break down before them,
Lest I break you before them.
Transliteration: veatah teezor mׇteneykha vekameta vedivareta aleyhem et khׇl-asher anokhiy atsavekha al-techat mifeneyhem fen-achitekha lifeneyhem

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֞י הִנֵּ֧ה נְתַתִּ֣יךָ הַיּ֗וֹם לְעִ֨יר מִבְצָ֜ר וּלְעַמּ֥וּד בַּרְזֶ֛ל וּלְחֹמ֥וֹת נְחֹ֖שֶׁת עַל־כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ לְמַלְכֵ֤י יְהוּדָה֙ לְשָׂרֶ֔יהָ לְכֹהֲנֶ֖יהָ וּלְעַ֥ם הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
I make you this day
A fortified city,
And an iron pillar,
And bronze walls
Against the whole land—
Against Judah’s kings and officers,
And against its priests and citizens.
Transliteration: vaaniy hineh netatiykha hayyvom leiyr mivetsar uleamud varezel ulechomvot nechoshet al-khׇl-haarets lemalekhey yehudah leshareyha lekhohaneyha uleam haarets

Hebrew: וְנִלְחֲמ֥וּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ וְלֹא־י֣וּכְלוּ לָ֑ךְ כִּי־אִתְּךָ֥ אֲנִ֛י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֖ה לְהַצִּילֶֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
They will attack you,
But they shall not overcome you;
For I am with you—declares GOD—to save you.
Transliteration: venilechamu eleykha velo-yukhelu lakhe khiy-itekha aniy neum-yehovah lehatsiylekha {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me, saying,
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: הָלֹ֡ךְ וְֽקָרָ֩אתָ֩ בְאׇזְנֵ֨י יְרוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם לֵאמֹ֗ר כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה זָכַ֤רְתִּי לָךְ֙ חֶ֣סֶד נְעוּרַ֔יִךְ אַהֲבַ֖ת כְּלוּלֹתָ֑יִךְ לֶכְתֵּ֤ךְ אַֽחֲרַי֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר בְּאֶ֖רֶץ לֹ֥א זְרוּעָֽה׃
Translated:
Go proclaim to Jerusalem: Thus said GOD:
I accounted to your favor
The devotion of your youth,
Your love as a bride—
How you followed Me in the wilderness,
In a land not sown.
Transliteration: halokhe vekarata veׇzeney yerushala͏im lemor khoh amar yehovah zakharetiy lakhe chesed neurayiikhe ahavat khelulotayiikhe lekhetekhe acharay vamidevar veerets lo zeruah

Hebrew: קֹ֤דֶשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה רֵאשִׁ֖ית תְּבוּאָתֹ֑ה כׇּל־אֹכְלָ֣יו יֶאְשָׁ֔מוּ רָעָ֛ה תָּבֹ֥א אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Israel was holy to GOD,
The first fruits of God’s harvest.
All who ate of it were held guilty;
Disaster befell them
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: kodesh yisherael layhovah reshiyt tevuatoh khׇl-okhelayv yeeshamu raah tavo aleyhem neum-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֥וּ דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה בֵּ֣ית יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְכׇֽל־מִשְׁפְּח֖וֹת בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Hear the word of GOD, O House of Jacob,
Every clan of the House of Israel!
Transliteration: shimeu devar-yehovah veyt yaakov vekhׇl-mishefechvot veyt yisherael

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה מַה־מָּצְא֨וּ אֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֥ם בִּי֙ עָ֔וֶל כִּ֥י רָחֲק֖וּ מֵעָלָ֑י וַיֵּ֥לְכ֛וּ אַחֲרֵ֥י הַהֶ֖בֶל וַיֶּהְבָּֽלוּ׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
What wrong did your ancestors find in Me
That they abandoned Me
And went after delusion and were deluded?
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah mah-matseu avvoteykhem viy avel khiy rachaku mealay vayelekhu acharey hahevel vayehevalu

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א אָֽמְר֔וּ אַיֵּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה הַמַּעֲלֶ֥ה אֹתָ֖נוּ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם הַמּוֹלִ֨יךְ אֹתָ֜נוּ בַּמִּדְבָּ֗ר בְּאֶ֨רֶץ עֲרָבָ֤ה וְשׁוּחָה֙ בְּאֶ֙רֶץ֙ צִיָּ֣ה וְצַלְמָ֔וֶת בְּאֶ֗רֶץ לֹא־עָ֤בַר בָּהּ֙ אִ֔ישׁ וְלֹא־יָשַׁ֥ב אָדָ֖ם שָֽׁם׃
Translated:
They never asked themselves, “Where is GOD,
Who brought us up from the land of Egypt,
Who led us through the wilderness,
A land of deserts and pits,
A land of drought and darkness,
A land nobody had traversed,
Where no human being had dwelt?”
Transliteration: velo ameru ayeh yehovah hamaaleh otanu meerets mitserayiim hamvoliykhe otanu vamidevar veerets aravah veshuchah veerets tsiyah vetsalemavet veerets lo-avar vah iysh velo-yashav adam sham

Hebrew: וָאָבִ֤יא אֶתְכֶם֙ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַכַּרְמֶ֔ל לֶאֱכֹ֥ל פִּרְיָ֖הּ וְטוּבָ֑הּ וַתָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ וַתְּטַמְּא֣וּ אֶת־אַרְצִ֔י וְנַחֲלָתִ֥י שַׂמְתֶּ֖ם לְתוֹעֵבָֽה׃
Translated:
I brought you to this country of farmland
To enjoy its fruit and its bounty;
But you came and defiled My land,
You made My possession abhorrent.
Transliteration: vaaviy etekhem el-erets hakharemel leekhol fireyah vetuvah vatavou vatetameu et-aretsiy venachalatiy shametem letvoevah

Hebrew: הַכֹּהֲנִ֗ים לֹ֤א אָֽמְרוּ֙ אַיֵּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה וְתֹפְשֵׂ֤י הַתּוֹרָה֙ לֹ֣א יְדָע֔וּנִי וְהָרֹעִ֖ים פָּ֣שְׁעוּ בִ֑י וְהַנְּבִאִים֙ נִבְּא֣וּ בַבַּ֔עַל וְאַחֲרֵ֥י לֹֽא־יוֹעִ֖לוּ הָלָֽכוּ׃
Translated:
The priests never asked themselves, “Where is GOD?”
The guardians of the Teaching ignored Me;
The rulers rebelled against Me,
And the prophets prophesied by Baal
And followed what can do no good.
Transliteration: hakhohaniym lo ameru ayeh yehovah vetofeshey hatvorah lo yedauniy veharoiym fasheu viy vehaneviiym niveu vavaal veacharey lo-yvoilu halakhu

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן עֹ֛ד אָרִ֥יב אִתְּכֶ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאֶת־בְּנֵ֥י בְנֵיכֶ֖ם אָרִֽיב׃
Translated:
Oh, I will go on accusing you
—declares GOD—
And I will accuse your children’s children!
Transliteration: lakhen od ariyv itekhem neum-yehovah veet-veney veneykhem ariyv

Hebrew: כִּ֣י עִבְר֞וּ אִיֵּ֤י כִתִּיִּים֙ וּרְא֔וּ וְקֵדָ֛ר שִׁלְח֥וּ וְהִֽתְבּוֹנְנ֖וּ מְאֹ֑ד וּרְא֕וּ הֵ֥ן הָיְתָ֖ה כָּזֹֽאת׃
Translated:
Just cross over to the isles of the Kittim and look,
Send to Kedar and observe carefully;
See if aught like this has ever happened:
Transliteration: khiy iveru iyey khitiyiym ureu vekedar shilechu vehitevvonenu meod ureu hen hayetah khazot

Hebrew: הַהֵימִ֥יר גּוֹי֙ אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְהֵ֖מָּה לֹ֣א אֱלֹהִ֑ים וְעַמִּ֛י הֵמִ֥יר כְּבוֹד֖וֹ בְּל֥וֹא יוֹעִֽיל׃
Translated:
Has any nation changed its gods
Even though they are no-gods?
But My people has exchanged its glory
For what can do no good.
Transliteration: haheymiyr gvoy Elohim vehemah lo Elohim veamiy hemiyr khevvodvo velvo yvoiyl

Hebrew: שֹׁ֥מּוּ שָׁמַ֖יִם עַל־זֹ֑את וְשַׂעֲר֛וּ חׇרְב֥וּ מְאֹ֖ד נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Be appalled, O heavens, at this;
Be horrified, utterly dazed!
—says GOD.
Transliteration: shomu shamayiim al-zot veshaaru chׇrevu meod neum-yehovah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־שְׁתַּ֥יִם רָע֖וֹת עָשָׂ֣ה עַמִּ֑י אֹתִ֨י עָזְב֜וּ מְק֣וֹר ׀ מַ֣יִם חַיִּ֗ים לַחְצֹ֤ב לָהֶם֙ בֹּאר֔וֹת בֹּארֹת֙ נִשְׁבָּרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יָכִ֖לוּ הַמָּֽיִם׃
Translated:
For My people have done a twofold wrong:
They have forsaken Me, the Fount of living waters,
And hewed out for themselves cisterns, broken cisterns,
That cannot even hold water.
Transliteration: khiy-shetayiim ravot ashah amiy otiy azevu mekvor mayiim chayiym lachetsov lahem vorvot vorot nishevariym asher lo-yakhilu hamayiim

Hebrew: הַעֶ֙בֶד֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אִם־יְלִ֥יד בַּ֖יִת ה֑וּא מַדּ֖וּעַ הָיָ֥ה לָבַֽז׃
Translated:
Is Israel a bondman?
Is he a home-born slave?
Then why is he given over to plunder?
Transliteration: haeved yisherael im-yeliyd vayiit hu madua hayah lavaz

Hebrew: עָלָיו֙ יִשְׁאֲג֣וּ כְפִרִ֔ים נָתְנ֖וּ קוֹלָ֑ם וַיָּשִׁ֤יתוּ אַרְצוֹ֙ לְשַׁמָּ֔ה עָרָ֥יו (נצתה) [נִצְּת֖וּ] מִבְּלִ֥י יֹשֵֽׁב׃
Translated:
Lions have roared over him,
Have raised their cries.
They have made his land a waste,
His cities desolate, without inhabitants.
Transliteration: alayv yisheagu khefiriym natenu kvolam vayashiytu aretsvo leshamah arayv (ntsth) [nitsetu] miveliy yoshev

Hebrew: גַּם־בְּנֵי־נֹ֖ף (ותחפנס) [וְתַחְפַּנְחֵ֑ס] יִרְע֖וּךְ קׇדְקֹֽד׃
Translated:
Those, too, in Noph and Tahpanhes
Will lay bare your head.
Transliteration: gam-veney-nof (vtchfns) [vetachefaneches] yireukhe kׇdekod

Hebrew: הֲלוֹא־זֹ֖את תַּעֲשֶׂה־לָּ֑ךְ עׇזְבֵךְ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהַ֔יִךְ בְּעֵ֖ת מוֹלִכֵ֥ךְ בַּדָּֽרֶךְ׃
Translated:
See, that is the price you have paid
For forsaking the ETERNAL your God
Who led you in the way.
Transliteration: halvo-zot taasheh-lakhe ׇzevekhe et-yehovah elohayiikhe veet mvolikhekhe vadarekhe

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה מַה־לָּךְ֙ לְדֶ֣רֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם לִשְׁתּ֖וֹת מֵ֣י שִׁח֑וֹר וּמַה־לָּךְ֙ לְדֶ֣רֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר לִשְׁתּ֖וֹת מֵ֥י נָהָֽר׃
Translated:
What, then, is the good of your going to Egypt
To drink the waters of the Nile?
And what is the good of your going to Assyria
To drink the waters of the Euphrates?
Transliteration: veatah mah-lakhe lederekhe mitserayiim lishetvot mey shichvor umah-lakhe lederekhe ashur lishetvot mey nahar

Hebrew: תְּיַסְּרֵ֣ךְ רָעָתֵ֗ךְ וּמְשֻׁבוֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ תּֽוֹכִחֻ֔ךְ וּדְעִ֤י וּרְאִי֙ כִּֽי־רַ֣ע וָמָ֔ר עׇזְבֵ֖ךְ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑יִךְ וְלֹ֤א פַחְדָּתִי֙ אֵלַ֔יִךְ נְאֻם־אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִ֖ה צְבָאֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Let your misfortune reprove you,
Let your afflictions rebuke you;
Mark well how bad and bitter it is
That you forsake the ETERNAL your God,
That awe for Me is not in you
—declares my Sovereign GOD of Hosts.
Transliteration: teyaserekhe raatekhe umeshuvvotayiikhe tvokhichukhe udeiy ureiy khiy-ra vamar ׇzevekhe et-yehovah elohayiikhe velo fachedatiy elayiikhe neum-adonay yehovih tsevavot

Hebrew: כִּ֣י מֵעוֹלָ֞ם שָׁבַ֣רְתִּי עֻלֵּ֗ךְ נִתַּ֙קְתִּי֙ מוֹסְרוֹתַ֔יִךְ וַתֹּאמְרִ֖י לֹ֣א (אעבוד) [אֶעֱב֑וֹר] כִּ֣י עַֽל־כׇּל־גִּבְעָ֞ה גְּבֹהָ֗ה וְתַ֙חַת֙ כׇּל־עֵ֣ץ רַעֲנָ֔ן אַ֖תְּ צֹעָ֥ה זֹנָֽה׃
Translated:
For long ago you broke your yoke,
Tore off your yoke-bands,
And said, “I will not work!”
On every high hill and under every verdant tree,
You recline as a whore.
Transliteration: khiy mevolam shavaretiy ulekhe nitaketiy mvoservotayiikhe vatomeriy lo (vvd) [eevvor] khiy al-khׇl-giveah gevohah vetachat khׇl-ets raanan ate tsoah zonah

Hebrew: וְאָֽנֹכִי֙ נְטַעְתִּ֣יךְ שׂוֹרֵ֔ק כֻּלֹּ֖ה זֶ֣רַע אֱמֶ֑ת וְאֵיךְ֙ נֶהְפַּ֣כְתְּ לִ֔י סוּרֵ֖י הַגֶּ֥פֶן נׇכְרִיָּֽה׃
Translated:
I planted you with noble vines,
All with choicest seed;
Alas, I find you changed
Into a base, an alien vine!
Transliteration: veanokhiy netaetiykhe shvorek khuloh zera emet veeykhe nehefakhete liy surey hagefen nׇkheriyah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אִם־תְּכַבְּסִי֙ בַּנֶּ֔תֶר וְתַרְבִּי־לָ֖ךְ בֹּרִ֑ית נִכְתָּ֤ם עֲוֺנֵךְ֙ לְפָנַ֔י נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated:
Though you wash with natron
And use much lye,
Your guilt is ingrained before Me
—declares my Sovereign GOD.
Transliteration: khiy im-tekhavesiy vaneter vetareviy-lakhe voriyt nikhetam avonekhe lefanay neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: אֵ֣יךְ תֹּאמְרִ֞י לֹ֣א נִטְמֵ֗אתִי אַחֲרֵ֤י הַבְּעָלִים֙ לֹ֣א הָלַ֔כְתִּי רְאִ֤י דַרְכֵּךְ֙ בַּגַּ֔יְא דְּעִ֖י מֶ֣ה עָשִׂ֑ית בִּכְרָ֥ה קַלָּ֖ה מְשָׂרֶ֥כֶת דְּרָכֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
How can you say, “I am not defiled,
I have not gone after the Baalim”?
Look at your deeds in the Valley,
Consider what you have done!
Like a lustful she-camel,
Restlessly running about,
Transliteration: eykhe tomeriy lo nitemetiy acharey havealiym lo halakhetiy reiy darekhekhe vagaye deiy meh ashiyt vikherah kalah mesharekhet derakheyha

Hebrew: פֶּ֣רֶה ׀ לִמֻּ֣ד מִדְבָּ֗ר בְּאַוַּ֤ת (נפשו) [נַפְשָׁהּ֙] שָׁאֲפָ֣ה ר֔וּחַ תַּאֲנָתָ֖הּ מִ֣י יְשִׁיבֶ֑נָּה כׇּל־מְבַקְשֶׁ֙יהָ֙ לֹ֣א יִיעָ֔פוּ בְּחׇדְשָׁ֖הּ יִמְצָאֽוּנְהָ׃
Translated:
Or like a wild ass used to the desert,
Snuffing the wind in her eagerness,
Whose passion none can restrain,
None that seek her need grow weary—
In her season, they’ll find her!
Transliteration: fereh limud midevar veavat (nfshv) [nafeshah] shaafah rucha taanatah miy yeshiyvenah khׇl-mevakesheyha lo yiyafu vechׇdeshah yimetsauneha

Hebrew: מִנְעִ֤י רַגְלֵךְ֙ מִיָּחֵ֔ף (וגורנך) [וּגְרוֹנֵ֖ךְ] מִצִּמְאָ֑ה וַתֹּאמְרִ֣י נוֹאָ֔שׁ ל֕וֹא כִּֽי־אָהַ֥בְתִּי זָרִ֖ים וְאַחֲרֵיהֶ֥ם אֵלֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
Save your foot from going bare,
And your throat from thirst.
But you say, “It is no use.
No, I love the strangers,
And after them I must go.”
Transliteration: mineiy ragelekhe miyachef (vgvrnkh) [ugervonekhe] mitsimeah vatomeriy nvoash lvo khiy-ahavetiy zariym veachareyhem elekhe

Hebrew: כְּבֹ֤שֶׁת גַּנָּב֙ כִּ֣י יִמָּצֵ֔א כֵּ֥ן הֹבִ֖ישׁוּ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הֵ֤מָּה מַלְכֵיהֶם֙ שָׂרֵיהֶ֔ם וְכֹהֲנֵיהֶ֖ם וּנְבִיאֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Like a thief chagrined when caught,
So is the House of Israel chagrined—
They, their kings, their officers,
And their priests and prophets.
Transliteration: khevoshet ganav khiy yimatse khen hoviyshu veyt yisherael hemah malekheyhem shareyhem vekhohaneyhem uneviyeyhem

Hebrew: אֹמְרִ֨ים לָעֵ֜ץ אָ֣בִי אַ֗תָּה וְלָאֶ֙בֶן֙ אַ֣תְּ (ילדתני) [יְלִדְתָּ֔נוּ] כִּֽי־פָנ֥וּ אֵלַ֛י עֹ֖רֶף וְלֹ֣א פָנִ֑ים וּבְעֵ֤ת רָעָתָם֙ יֹֽאמְר֔וּ ק֖וּמָה וְהוֹשִׁיעֵֽנוּ׃
Translated:
They said to wood, “You are my father,”
To stone, “You gave birth to me,”
While to Me they turned their backs
And not their faces.
But in their hour of calamity they cry,
“Arise and save us!”
Transliteration: omeriym laets aviy atah velaeven ate (yldtny) [yelidetanu] khiy-fanu elay oref velo faniym uveet raatam yomeru kumah vehvoshiyenu

Hebrew: וְאַיֵּ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֣יתָ לָּ֔ךְ יָק֕וּמוּ אִם־יוֹשִׁיע֖וּךָ בְּעֵ֣ת רָעָתֶ֑ךָ כִּ֚י מִסְפַּ֣ר עָרֶ֔יךָ הָי֥וּ אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ יְהוּדָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
And where are those gods
You made for yourself?
Let them arise and save you, if they can,
In your hour of calamity.
For your gods have become, O Judah,
As many as your towns!
Transliteration: veayeh eloheykha asher ashiyta lakhe yakumu im-yvoshiyukha veet raatekha khiy misefar areykha hayu eloheykha yehudah {s}

Hebrew: לָ֥מָּה תָרִ֖יבוּ אֵלָ֑י כֻּלְּכֶ֛ם פְּשַׁעְתֶּ֥ם בִּ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Why do you call Me to account?
You have all rebelled against Me
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: lamah tariyvu elay khulekhem feshaetem viy neum-yehovah

Hebrew: לַשָּׁוְא֙ הִכֵּ֣יתִי אֶת־בְּנֵיכֶ֔ם מוּסָ֖ר לֹ֣א לָקָ֑חוּ אָכְלָ֧ה חַרְבְּכֶ֛ם נְבִיאֵיכֶ֖ם כְּאַרְיֵ֥ה מַשְׁחִֽית׃
Translated:
To no purpose did I smite your children;
They would not accept correction.
Your sword has devoured your prophets
Like a ravening lion.
Transliteration: lashave hikheytiy et-veneykhem musar lo lakachu akhelah charevekhem neviyeykhem kheareeih mashechiyt

Hebrew: הַדּ֗וֹר אַתֶּם֙ רְא֣וּ דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה הֲמִדְבָּ֤ר הָיִ֙יתִי֙ לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אִ֛ם אֶ֥רֶץ מַאְפֵּ֖לְיָ֑ה מַדּ֜וּעַ אָמְר֤וּ עַמִּי֙ רַ֔דְנוּ לֽוֹא־נָב֥וֹא ע֖וֹד אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
O generation, behold the word of GOD!
Have I been like a desert to Israel,
Or like a land of deep gloom?
Then why do My people say, “We have broken loose,
We will not come to You anymore?”
Transliteration: hadvor atem reu devar-yehovah hamidevar hayiytiy leyisherael im erets maefeleyah madua ameru amiy radenu lvo-navvo vod eleykha

Hebrew: הֲתִשְׁכַּ֤ח בְּתוּלָה֙ עֶדְיָ֔הּ כַּלָּ֖ה קִשֻּׁרֶ֑יהָ וְעַמִּ֣י שְׁכֵח֔וּנִי יָמִ֖ים אֵ֥ין מִסְפָּֽר׃
Translated:
Can a maiden forget her jewels,
A bride her adornments?
Yet My people have forgotten Me—
Days without number.
Transliteration: hatishekhach vetulah edeyah khalah kishureyha veamiy shekhechuniy yamiym eyn misefar

Hebrew: מַה־תֵּיטִ֥בִי דַרְכֵּ֖ךְ לְבַקֵּ֣שׁ אַהֲבָ֑ה לָכֵן֙ גַּ֣ם אֶת־הָרָע֔וֹת (למדתי) [לִמַּ֖דְתְּ] אֶת־דְּרָכָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
How skillfully you plan your way
To seek out love!
Why, you have even taught
The worst of women your ways.
Transliteration: mah-teytiviy darekhekhe levakesh ahavah lakhen gam et-haravot (lmdty) [limadete] et-derakhayiikhe

Hebrew: גַּ֤ם בִּכְנָפַ֙יִךְ֙ נִמְצְא֔וּ דַּ֛ם נַפְשׁ֥וֹת אֶבְיוֹנִ֖ים נְקִיִּ֑ים לֹֽא־בַמַּחְתֶּ֥רֶת מְצָאתִ֖ים כִּ֥י עַל־כׇּל־אֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated:
Moreover, on your garments is found
The lifeblood of the innocent poor—
You did not catch them breaking in.
Yet, despite all these things,
Transliteration: gam vikhenafayiikhe nimetseu dam nafeshvot eveyvoniym nekiyiym lo-vamacheteret metsatiym khiy al-khׇl-eleh

Hebrew: וַתֹּֽאמְרִי֙ כִּ֣י נִקֵּ֔יתִי אַ֛ךְ שָׁ֥ב אַפּ֖וֹ מִמֶּ֑נִּי הִנְנִי֙ נִשְׁפָּ֣ט אוֹתָ֔ךְ עַל־אׇמְרֵ֖ךְ לֹ֥א חָטָֽאתִי׃
Translated:
You say, “I have been acquitted;
Surely, God’s anger has turned away from me.”
Lo, I will bring you to judgment
For saying, “I have not sinned.”
Transliteration: vatomeriy khiy nikeytiy akhe shav afvo mimeniy hineniy nishefat votakhe al-ׇmerekhe lo chatatiy

Hebrew: מַה־תֵּזְלִ֥י מְאֹ֖ד לְשַׁנּ֣וֹת אֶת־דַּרְכֵּ֑ךְ גַּ֤ם מִמִּצְרַ֙יִם֙ תֵּבֹ֔שִׁי כַּאֲשֶׁר־בֹּ֖שְׁתְּ מֵאַשּֽׁוּר׃
Translated:
How you cheapen yourself,
By changing your course!
You shall be put to shame through Egypt,
Just as you were put to shame through Assyria.
Transliteration: mah-tezeliy meod leshanvot et-darekhekhe gam mimitserayiim tevoshiy khaasher-voshete meashur

Hebrew: גַּ֣ם מֵאֵ֥ת זֶה֙ תֵּֽצְאִ֔י וְיָדַ֖יִךְ עַל־רֹאשֵׁ֑ךְ כִּֽי־מָאַ֤ס יְהֹוָה֙ בְּמִבְטַחַ֔יִךְ וְלֹ֥א תַצְלִ֖יחִי לָהֶֽם׃
Translated:
From this way, too, you will come out
With your hands on your head;
For GOD has rejected those you trust,
You will not prosper with them.
Transliteration: gam meet zeh tetseiy veyadayiikhe al-roshekhe khiy-maas yehovah vemivetachayiikhe velo tatseliychiy lahem

Hebrew: לֵאמֹ֡ר הֵ֣ן יְשַׁלַּ֣ח אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־אִשְׁתּוֹ֩ וְהָלְכָ֨ה מֵאִתּ֜וֹ וְהָיְתָ֣ה לְאִישׁ־אַחֵ֗ר הֲיָשׁ֤וּב אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ ע֔וֹד הֲל֛וֹא חָנ֥וֹף תֶּחֱנַ֖ף הָאָ֣רֶץ הַהִ֑יא וְאַ֗תְּ זָנִית֙ רֵעִ֣ים רַבִּ֔ים וְשׁ֥וֹב אֵלַ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: [The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me] as follows: If a man divorces his wife, and she leaves him and gets married to another man, can he ever go back to her? Would not such a land be defiled? Now you have whored with many lovers: can you return to Me?—says G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: lemor hen yeshalach iysh et-ishetvo vehalekhah meitvo vehayetah leiysh-acher hayashuv eleyha vod halvo chanvof techenaf haarets hahiy veate zaniyt reiym raviym veshvov elay neum-yehovah

Hebrew: שְׂאִי־עֵינַ֨יִךְ עַל־שְׁפָיִ֜ם וּרְאִ֗י אֵיפֹה֙ לֹ֣א (שגלת) [שֻׁכַּ֔בְתְּ] עַל־דְּרָכִים֙ יָשַׁ֣בְתְּ לָהֶ֔ם כַּעֲרָבִ֖י בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וַתַּחֲנִ֣יפִי אֶ֔רֶץ בִּזְנוּתַ֖יִךְ וּבְרָעָתֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
Look up to the bare heights, and see:
Where have they not lain with you?
You waited for them on the roadside
Like a bandit in the wilderness.
And you defiled the land
With your whoring and your debauchery.
Transliteration: sheiy-eynayiikhe al-shefayim ureiy eyfoh lo (shglt) [shukhavete] al-derakhiym yashavete lahem khaaraviy vamidevar vatachaniyfiy erets vizenutayiikhe uveraatekhe

Hebrew: וַיִּמָּנְע֣וּ רְבִבִ֔ים וּמַלְק֖וֹשׁ ל֣וֹא הָיָ֑ה וּמֵ֨צַח אִשָּׁ֤ה זוֹנָה֙ הָ֣יָה לָ֔ךְ מֵאַ֖נְתְּ הִכָּלֵֽם׃
Translated:
And when showers were withheld
And the late rains did not come,
You had the brazenness of a streetwalker,
You refused to be ashamed.
Transliteration: vayimaneu reviviym umalekvosh lvo hayah umetsach ishah zvonah hayah lakhe meanete hikhalem

Hebrew: הֲל֣וֹא מֵעַ֔תָּה (קראתי) [קָרָ֥את] לִ֖י אָבִ֑י אַלּ֥וּף נְעֻרַ֖י אָֽתָּה׃
Translated:
Just now you called to Me, “Father!
You are the Companion of my youth.
Transliteration: halvo meatah (krty) [karat] liy aviy aluf neuray atah

Hebrew: הֲיִנְטֹ֣ר לְעוֹלָ֔ם אִם־יִשְׁמֹ֖ר לָנֶ֑צַח הִנֵּ֥ה דִבַּ֛רְתְּ וַתַּעֲשִׂ֥י הָרָע֖וֹת וַתּוּכָֽל׃ {פ}
Translated:
Does one hate for all time?
Does one rage forever?”
That is how you spoke;
You did wrong, and had your way.
Transliteration: hayinetor levolam im-yishemor lanetsach hineh divarete vataashiy haravot vatukhal {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י בִּימֵי֙ יֹאשִׁיָּ֣הוּ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ הֲֽרָאִ֔יתָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשְׂתָ֖ה מְשֻׁבָ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הֹלְכָ֨ה הִ֜יא עַל־כׇּל־הַ֣ר גָּבֹ֗הַּ וְאֶל־תַּ֛חַת כׇּל־עֵ֥ץ רַעֲנָ֖ן וַתִּזְנִי־שָֽׁם׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> said to me in the days of King Josiah: Have you seen what Rebel Israel did, going to every high mountain and under every leafy tree, and whoring there?
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay viymey yoshiyahu hamelekhe haraiyta asher ashetah meshuvah yisherael holekhah hiy al-khׇl-har gavoha veel-tachat khׇl-ets raanan vatizeniy-sham

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֗ר אַחֲרֵ֨י עֲשׂוֹתָ֧הּ אֶת־כׇּל־אֵ֛לֶּה אֵלַ֥י תָּשׁ֖וּב וְלֹא־שָׁ֑בָה (ותראה) [וַתֵּ֛רֶא] בָּגוֹדָ֥ה אֲחוֹתָ֖הּ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: I thought: After she has done all these things, she will come back to Me. But she did not come back; and her sister, Faithless Judah, saw it.
Transliteration: vaomar acharey ashvotah et-khׇl-eleh elay tashuv velo-shavah (vtrh) [vatere] vagvodah achvotah yehudah

Hebrew: וָאֵ֗רֶא כִּ֤י עַל־כׇּל־אֹדוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נִֽאֲפָה֙ מְשֻׁבָ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שִׁלַּחְתִּ֕יהָ וָאֶתֵּ֛ן אֶת־סֵ֥פֶר כְּרִיתֻתֶ֖יהָ אֵלֶ֑יהָ וְלֹ֨א יָרְאָ֜ה בֹּגֵדָ֤ה יְהוּדָה֙ אֲחוֹתָ֔הּ וַתֵּ֖לֶךְ וַתִּ֥זֶן גַּם־הִֽיא׃
Translated: I noted: Because Rebel Israel had committed adultery, I cast her off and handed her a bill of divorce; yet her sister, Faithless Judah, was not afraid—she too went and whored.
Transliteration: vaere khiy al-khׇl-odvot asher niafah meshuvah yisherael shilachetiyha vaeten et-sefer kheriytuteyha eleyha velo yareah vogedah yehudah achvotah vatelekhe vatizen gam-hiy

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ מִקֹּ֣ל זְנוּתָ֔הּ וַתֶּחֱנַ֖ף אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַתִּנְאַ֥ף אֶת־הָאֶ֖בֶן וְאֶת־הָעֵֽץ׃
Translated: Indeed, the land was defiled by her casual immorality, as she committed adultery with stone and with wood.
Transliteration: vehayah mikol zenutah vatechenaf et-haarets vatineaf et-haeven veet-haets

Hebrew: וְגַם־בְּכׇל־זֹ֗את לֹא־שָׁ֨בָה אֵלַ֜י בָּגוֹדָ֧ה אֲחוֹתָ֛הּ יְהוּדָ֖ה בְּכׇל־לִבָּ֑הּ כִּ֥י אִם־בְּשֶׁ֖קֶר נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: And after all that, her sister, Faithless Judah, did not return to Me wholeheartedly, but insincerely—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vegam-vekhׇl-zot lo-shavah elay vagvodah achvotah yehudah vekhׇl-livah khiy im-vesheker neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלַ֔י צִדְּקָ֥ה נַפְשָׁ֖הּ מְשֻׁבָ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מִבֹּגֵדָ֖ה יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> said to me: Rebel Israel has shown herself more in the right than Faithless Judah.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay tsidekah nafeshah meshuvah yisherael mivogedah yehudah

Hebrew: הָלֹ֡ךְ וְֽקָרָ֩אתָ֩ אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֨ים הָאֵ֜לֶּה צָפ֗וֹנָה וְ֠אָמַרְתָּ֠ שׁ֣וּבָה מְשֻׁבָ֤ה יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה לוֹא־אַפִּ֥יל פָּנַ֖י בָּכֶ֑ם כִּֽי־חָסִ֤יד אֲנִי֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה לֹ֥א אֶטּ֖וֹר לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: Go, make this proclamation toward the north, and say: Turn back, O Rebel Israel—declares G<small>OD</small>. I will not look on you in anger, for I am compassionate—declares G<small>OD</small>; I do not bear a grudge for all time.
Transliteration: halokhe vekarata et-hadevariym haeleh tsafvonah veamareta shuvah meshuvah yisherael neum-yehovah lvo-afiyl fanay vakhem khiy-chasiyd aniy neum-yehovah lo etvor levolam

Hebrew: אַ֚ךְ דְּעִ֣י עֲוֺנֵ֔ךְ כִּ֛י בַּיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהַ֖יִךְ פָּשָׁ֑עַתְּ וַתְּפַזְּרִ֨י אֶת־דְּרָכַ֜יִךְ לַזָּרִ֗ים תַּ֚חַת כׇּל־עֵ֣ץ רַעֲנָ֔ן וּבְקוֹלִ֥י לֹֽא־שְׁמַעְתֶּ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Only recognize your sin; for you have transgressed against the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God, and scattered your favors among strangers under every leafy tree, and you have not heeded Me—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: akhe deiy avonekhe khiy vayhovah elohayiikhe fashaate vatefazeriy et-derakhayiikhe lazariym tachat khׇl-ets raanan uvekvoliy lo-shemaetem neum-yehovah

Hebrew: שׁ֣וּבוּ בָנִ֤ים שֽׁוֹבָבִים֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֥י אָנֹכִ֖י בָּעַ֣לְתִּי בָכֶ֑ם וְלָקַחְתִּ֨י אֶתְכֶ֜ם אֶחָ֣ד מֵעִ֗יר וּשְׁנַ֙יִם֙ מִמִּשְׁפָּחָ֔ה וְהֵבֵאתִ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם צִיּֽוֹן׃
Translated: Turn back, rebellious children—declares G<small>OD</small>. Since I have espoused you, I will take you, one from a town and two from a clan, and bring you to Zion.
Transliteration: shuvu vaniym shvovaviym neum-yehovah khiy anokhiy vaaletiy vakhem velakachetiy etekhem echad meiyr ushenayiim mimishefachah vehevetiy etekhem tsiyyvon

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֥י לָכֶ֛ם רֹעִ֖ים כְּלִבִּ֑י וְרָע֥וּ אֶתְכֶ֖ם דֵּעָ֥ה וְהַשְׂכֵּֽיל׃
Translated: And I will give you shepherds after My own heart, who will pasture you with knowledge and skill.
Transliteration: venatatiy lakhem roiym kheliviy verau etekhem deah vehashekheyl

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֡ה כִּ֣י תִרְבּוּ֩ וּפְרִיתֶ֨ם בָּאָ֜רֶץ בַּיָּמִ֤ים הָהֵ֙מָּה֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה לֹא־יֹ֣אמְרוּ ע֗וֹד אֲרוֹן֙ בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְלֹ֥א יַעֲלֶ֖ה עַל־לֵ֑ב וְלֹ֤א יִזְכְּרוּ־בוֹ֙ וְלֹ֣א יִפְקֹ֔דוּ וְלֹ֥א יֵעָשֶׂ֖ה עֽוֹד׃
Translated: And when you increase and are fertile in the land, in those days—declares G<small>OD</small>—people shall no longer speak of the Ark of the Covenant of G<small>OD</small>, nor shall it come to mind. They shall not mention it, or miss it, or make another.
Transliteration: vehayah khiy tirevu uferiytem vaarets vayamiym hahemah neum-yehovah lo-yomeru vod arvon veriyt-yehovah velo yaaleh al-lev velo yizekheru-vvo velo yifekodu velo eiasheh vod

Hebrew: בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֗יא יִקְרְא֤וּ לִירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ כִּסֵּ֣א יְהֹוָ֔ה וְנִקְו֨וּ אֵלֶ֧יהָ כׇֽל־הַגּוֹיִ֛ם לְשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה לִירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְלֹא־יֵלְכ֣וּ ע֔וֹד אַחֲרֵ֕י שְׁרִר֖וּת לִבָּ֥ם הָרָֽע׃ {ס}
Translated: At that time, they shall call Jerusalem “G<small>OD</small>’s Throne,” and all nations shall assemble there, in the name of G<small>OD</small>, at Jerusalem. They shall no longer follow the willfulness of their evil hearts.
Transliteration: vaet hahiy yikereu liyrushala͏im khise yehovah venikevu eleyha khׇl-hagvoyim leshem yehovah liyrushala͏im velo-eilekhu vod acharey sherirut livam hara {s}

Hebrew: בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֔מָּה יֵלְכ֥וּ בֵית־יְהוּדָ֖ה עַל־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְיָבֹ֤אוּ יַחְדָּו֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ צָפ֔וֹן עַל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִנְחַ֖לְתִּי אֶת־אֲבוֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: In those days, the House of Judah shall go with the House of Israel; they shall come together from the land of the north to the land I gave your ancestors as a possession.
Transliteration: vayamiym hahemah eilekhu veyt-yehudah al-veyt yisherael veyavou yachedav meerets tsafvon al-haarets asher hinechaletiy et-avvoteykhem

Hebrew: וְאָנֹכִ֣י אָמַ֗רְתִּי אֵ֚יךְ אֲשִׁיתֵ֣ךְ בַּבָּנִ֔ים וְאֶתֶּן־לָךְ֙ אֶ֣רֶץ חֶמְדָּ֔ה נַחֲלַ֥ת צְבִ֖י צִבְא֣וֹת גּוֹיִ֑ם וָאֹמַ֗ר אָבִי֙ (תקראו) [תִּקְרְאִי־]לִ֔י וּמֵאַחֲרַ֖י לֹ֥א (תשובו) [תָשֽׁוּבִי]׃
Translated: I had resolved to adopt you as My child, and I gave you a desirable land—the fairest heritage of all the nations; and I thought you would surely call Me “Father,” and never cease to be loyal to Me.
Transliteration: veanokhiy amaretiy eykhe ashiytekhe vavaniym veeten-lakhe erets chemedah nachalat tseviy tsivevot gvoyim vaomar aviy (tkrv) [tikereiy-]liy umeacharay lo (tshvvv) [tashuviy]

Hebrew: אָכֵ֛ן בָּגְדָ֥ה אִשָּׁ֖ה מֵרֵעָ֑הּ כֵּ֣ן בְּגַדְתֶּ֥ם בִּ֛י בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Instead, you have broken faith with Me, as a woman breaks faith with a paramour, O House of Israel—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: akhen vagedah ishah mereah khen vegadetem viy veyt yisherael neum-yehovah

Hebrew: ק֚וֹל עַל־שְׁפָיִ֣ים נִשְׁמָ֔ע בְּכִ֥י תַחֲנוּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּ֤י הֶעֱווּ֙ אֶת־דַּרְכָּ֔ם שָׁכְח֖וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Hark! On the bare heights is heard
The suppliant weeping of the people of Israel,
For they have gone a crooked way,
Ignoring the ETERNAL their God.
Transliteration: kvol al-shefayiym nishema vekhiy tachanuney veney yisherael khiy heevu et-darekham shakhechu et-yehovah eloheyhem

Hebrew: שׁ֚וּבוּ בָּנִ֣ים שׁוֹבָבִ֔ים אֶרְפָּ֖ה מְשׁוּבֹתֵיכֶ֑ם הִנְנוּ֙ אָתָ֣נוּ לָ֔ךְ כִּ֥י אַתָּ֖ה יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
Turn back, O rebellious children,
I will heal your afflictions!
“Here we are, we come to You,
For You, O ETERNAL One, are our God!
Transliteration: shuvu vaniym shvovaviym erefah meshuvoteykhem hinenu atanu lakhe khiy atah yehovah eloheynu

Hebrew: אָכֵ֥ן לַשֶּׁ֛קֶר מִגְּבָע֖וֹת הָמ֣וֹן הָרִ֑ים אָכֵן֙ בַּיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ תְּשׁוּעַ֖ת יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Surely, futility comes from the hills,
Confusion from the mountains.
Only through the ETERNAL our God
Is there deliverance for Israel.
Transliteration: akhen lasheker migevavot hamvon hariym akhen vayhovah eloheynu teshuat yisherael

Hebrew: וְהַבֹּ֗שֶׁת אָ֥כְלָ֛ה אֶת־יְגִ֥יעַ אֲבוֹתֵ֖ינוּ מִנְּעוּרֵ֑ינוּ אֶת־צֹאנָם֙ וְאֶת־בְּקָרָ֔ם אֶת־בְּנֵיהֶ֖ם וְאֶת־בְּנוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
But the Shameful Thing has consumed
The possessions of our ancestors ever since our youth—
Their flocks and herds,
Their sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vehavoshet akhelah et-yegiya avvoteynu mineureynu et-tsonam veet-vekaram et-veneyhem veet-venvoteyhem

Hebrew: נִשְׁכְּבָ֣ה בְּבׇשְׁתֵּ֗נוּ וּֽתְכַסֵּ֘נוּ֮ כְּלִמָּתֵ֒נוּ֒ כִּי֩ לַיהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֵ֜ינוּ חָטָ֗אנוּ אֲנַ֙חְנוּ֙ וַאֲבוֹתֵ֔ינוּ מִנְּעוּרֵ֖ינוּ וְעַד־הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וְלֹ֣א שָׁמַ֔עְנוּ בְּק֖וֹל יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Let us lie down in our shame,
Let our disgrace cover us;
For we have sinned against the ETERNAL our God,
We and our ancestors from our youth to this day,
And we have not heeded the ETERNAL our God.”
Transliteration: nishekhevah vevׇshetenu utekhasenu khelimatenu khiy layhovah eloheynu chatanu anachenu vaavvoteynu mineureynu vead-hayyvom hazeh velo shamaenu vekvol yehovah eloheynu {s}

Hebrew: אִם־תָּשׁ֨וּב יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל <small>׀</small> נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֛ה אֵלַ֖י תָּשׁ֑וּב וְאִם־תָּסִ֧יר שִׁקּוּצֶ֛יךָ מִפָּנַ֖י וְלֹ֥א תָנֽוּד׃
Translated:
If you return, O Israel
—declares GOD—
If you return to Me,
If you remove your abominations from My presence
And do not waver,
Transliteration: im-tashuv yisherael <small></small> neum-yehovah elay tashuv veim-tasiyr shikutseykha mifanay velo tanud

Hebrew: וְנִשְׁבַּ֙עְתָּ֙ חַי־יְהֹוָ֔ה בֶּאֱמֶ֖ת בְּמִשְׁפָּ֣ט וּבִצְדָקָ֑ה וְהִתְבָּ֥רְכוּ ב֛וֹ גּוֹיִ֖ם וּב֥וֹ יִתְהַלָּֽלוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
And swear, “As GOD lives,”
In sincerity, justice, and righteousness—
Nations shall bless themselves by you
And praise themselves by you.
Transliteration: venishevaeta chay-yehovah veemet vemishefat uvitsedakah vehitevarekhu vvo gvoyim uvvo yitehalalu {s}

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה לְאִ֤ישׁ יְהוּדָה֙ וְלִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם נִ֥ירוּ לָכֶ֖ם נִ֑יר וְאַֽל־תִּזְרְע֖וּ אֶל־קֹצִֽים׃
Translated:
For thus said GOD to the citizenry of Judah and to Jerusalem:
Break up the untilled ground,
And do not sow among thorns.
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah leiysh yehudah veliyrushala͏im niyru lakhem niyr veal-tizereu el-kotsiym

Hebrew: הִמֹּ֣לוּ לַיהֹוָ֗ה וְהָסִ֙רוּ֙ עׇרְל֣וֹת לְבַבְכֶ֔ם אִ֥ישׁ יְהוּדָ֖ה וְיֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם פֶּן־תֵּצֵ֨א כָאֵ֜שׁ חֲמָתִ֗י וּבָֽעֲרָה֙ וְאֵ֣ין מְכַבֶּ֔ה מִפְּנֵ֖י רֹ֥עַ מַעַלְלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Open your hearts to GOD,
Remove the thickening about your hearts—
O citizenry of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem—
Lest My wrath break forth like fire,
And burn, with none to quench it,
Because of your wicked acts.
Transliteration: himolu layhovah vehasiru ׇrelvot levavekhem iysh yehudah veyoshevey yerushala͏im fen-tetse khaesh chamatiy uvaarah veeyn mekhaveh mifeney roa maaleleykhem

Hebrew: הַגִּ֣ידוּ בִֽיהוּדָ֗ה וּבִירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ הַשְׁמִ֔יעוּ וְאִמְר֕וּ (ותקעו) [תִּקְע֥וּ] שׁוֹפָ֖ר בָּאָ֑רֶץ קִרְא֤וּ מַלְאוּ֙ וְאִמְר֔וּ הֵאָסְפ֥וּ וְנָב֖וֹאָה אֶל־עָרֵ֥י הַמִּבְצָֽר׃
Translated:
Proclaim in Judah,
Announce in Jerusalem,
And say:
“Blow the horn in the land!”
Shout aloud and say:
“Assemble, and let us go
Into the fortified cities!”
Transliteration: hagiydu viyhudah uviyrushala͏im hashemiyu veimeru (vtkv) [tikeu] shvofar vaarets kireu maleu veimeru heasefu venavvoah el-arey hamivetsar

Hebrew: שְׂאוּ־נֵ֣ס צִיּ֔וֹנָה הָעִ֖יזוּ אַֽל־תַּעֲמֹ֑דוּ כִּ֣י רָעָ֗ה אָנֹכִ֛י מֵבִ֥יא מִצָּפ֖וֹן וְשֶׁ֥בֶר גָּדֽוֹל׃
Translated:
Set up a signpost: To Zion.
Take refuge, do not delay!
For I bring evil from the north,
And great disaster.
Transliteration: sheu-nes tsiyyvonah haiyzu al-taamodu khiy raah anokhiy meviy mitsafvon veshever gadvol

Hebrew: עָלָ֤ה אַרְיֵה֙ מִֽסֻּבְּכ֔וֹ וּמַשְׁחִ֣ית גּוֹיִ֔ם נָסַ֖ע יָצָ֣א מִמְּקֹמ֑וֹ לָשׂ֤וּם אַרְצֵךְ֙ לְשַׁמָּ֔ה עָרַ֥יִךְ תִּצֶּ֖ינָה מֵאֵ֥ין יוֹשֵֽׁב׃
Translated:
The lion has come up from its thicket:
The destroyer of nations has set out,
Has departed from its place,
To make your land a desolation;
Your cities shall be ruined,
Without inhabitants.
Transliteration: alah areeih misuvekhvo umashechiyt gvoyim nasa yatsa mimekomvo lashum aretsekhe leshamah arayiikhe titseynah meeyn yvoshev

Hebrew: עַל־זֹ֛את חִגְר֥וּ שַׂקִּ֖ים סִפְד֣וּ וְהֵילִ֑ילוּ כִּ֥י לֹֽא־שָׁ֛ב חֲר֥וֹן אַף־יְהֹוָ֖ה מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
For this, put on sackcloth,
Mourn and wail;
For GOD’s blazing anger
Has not turned away from us.
Transliteration: al-zot chigeru shakiym sifedu veheyliylu khiy lo-shav charvon af-yehovah mimenu {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה בַיּוֹם־הַהוּא֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה יֹאבַ֥ד לֵב־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ וְלֵ֣ב הַשָּׂרִ֑ים וְנָשַׁ֙מּוּ֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים וְהַנְּבִאִ֖ים יִתְמָֽהוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
And in that day
—declares GOD—
The mind of the king
And the mind of the nobles shall fail,
The priests shall be appalled,
And the prophets shall stand aghast.
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom-hahu neum-yehovah yovad lev-hamelekhe velev hashariym venashamu hakhohaniym vehaneviiym yitemahu {s}

Hebrew: וָֽאֹמַ֞ר אֲהָ֣הּ ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה אָכֵן֩ הַשֵּׁ֨א הִשֵּׁ֜אתָ לָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ וְלִירוּשָׁלַ֣͏ִם לֵאמֹ֔ר שָׁל֖וֹם יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם וְנָגְעָ֥ה חֶ֖רֶב עַד־הַנָּֽפֶשׁ׃
Translated:
And I said: Ah, my Sovereign GOD! Surely You have deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying:
It shall be well with you—
Yet the sword threatens the very life!
Transliteration: vaomar ahah adonay yehovih akhen hashe hisheta laam hazeh veliyrushala͏im lemor shalvom yiheyeh lakhem venageah cherev ad-hanafesh

Hebrew: בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֗יא יֵאָמֵ֤ר לָעָם־הַזֶּה֙ וְלִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם ר֣וּחַ צַ֤ח שְׁפָיִם֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר דֶּ֖רֶךְ בַּת־עַמִּ֑י ל֥וֹא לִזְר֖וֹת וְל֥וֹא לְהָבַֽר׃
Translated:
At that time, it shall be said concerning this people and Jerusalem:
The conduct of My poor people is like searing wind
From the bare heights of the desert—
It will not serve to winnow or to fan.
Transliteration: vaet hahiy eiamer laam-hazeh veliyrushala͏im rucha tsach shefayim vamidevar derekhe vat-amiy lvo lizervot velvo lehavar

Hebrew: ר֧וּחַ מָלֵ֛א מֵאֵ֖לֶּה יָ֣בוֹא לִ֑י עַתָּ֕ה גַּם־אֲנִ֛י אֲדַבֵּ֥ר מִשְׁפָּטִ֖ים אוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
A full blast from them comes against Me:
Now I in turn will bring charges against them.
Transliteration: rucha male meeleh yavvo liy atah gam-aniy adaver mishefatiym votam

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ כַּעֲנָנִ֣ים יַעֲלֶ֗ה וְכַסּוּפָה֙ מַרְכְּבוֹתָ֔יו קַלּ֥וּ מִנְּשָׁרִ֖ים סוּסָ֑יו א֥וֹי לָ֖נוּ כִּ֥י שֻׁדָּֽדְנוּ׃
Translated:
Lo, the destroyer ascends like clouds,
Its chariots are like a whirlwind,
Its horses are swifter than eagles.
Woe to us, we are ruined!
Transliteration: hineh khaananiym yaaleh vekhasufah marekhevvotayv kalu mineshariym susayv voy lanu khiy shudadenu

Hebrew: כַּבְּסִ֨י מֵרָעָ֤ה לִבֵּךְ֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם לְמַ֖עַן תִּוָּשֵׁ֑עִי עַד־מָתַ֛י תָּלִ֥ין בְּקִרְבֵּ֖ךְ מַחְשְׁב֥וֹת אוֹנֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
Wash your heart clean of wickedness,
O Jerusalem, that you may be rescued.
How long will you harbor within you
Your evil designs?
Transliteration: khavesiy meraah livekhe yerushala͏im lemaan tivasheiy ad-matay taliyn vekirevekhe macheshevvot vonekhe

Hebrew: כִּ֛י ק֥וֹל מַגִּ֖יד מִדָּ֑ן וּמַשְׁמִ֥יעַ אָ֖וֶן מֵהַ֥ר אֶפְרָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Hark, one proclaims from Dan
And announces calamity from Mount Ephraim!
Transliteration: khiy kvol magiyd midan umashemiya aven mehar eferayiim

Hebrew: הַזְכִּ֣ירוּ לַגּוֹיִ֗ם הִנֵּה֙ הַשְׁמִ֣יעוּ עַל־יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם נֹצְרִ֥ים בָּאִ֖ים מֵאֶ֣רֶץ הַמֶּרְחָ֑ק וַֽיִּתְּנ֛וּ עַל־עָרֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה קוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
Tell the nations: Here they are!
Announce concerning Jerusalem:
Watchers are coming from a distant land,
They raise their voices against the towns of Judah.
Transliteration: hazekhiyru lagvoyim hineh hashemiyu al-yerushala͏im notseriym vaiym meerets hamerechak vayitenu al-arey yehudah kvolam

Hebrew: כְּשֹׁמְרֵ֣י שָׂדַ֔י הָי֥וּ עָלֶ֖יהָ מִסָּבִ֑יב כִּי־אֹתִ֥י מָרָ֖תָה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Like guards of fields, they surround her on every side.
For she has rebelled against Me
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: kheshomerey shaday hayu aleyha misaviyv khiy-otiy maratah neum-yehovah

Hebrew: דַּרְכֵּךְ֙ וּמַ֣עֲלָלַ֔יִךְ עָשׂ֥וֹ אֵ֖לֶּה לָ֑ךְ זֹ֤את רָעָתֵךְ֙ כִּ֣י מָ֔ר כִּ֥י נָגַ֖ע עַד־לִבֵּֽךְ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Your conduct and your acts
Have brought this upon you;
This is your bitter punishment;
It pierces your very heart.
Transliteration: darekhekhe umaalalayiikhe ashvo eleh lakhe zot raatekhe khiy mar khiy naga ad-livekhe {f}

Hebrew: מֵעַ֣י ׀ מֵעַ֨י ׀ [אוֹחִ֜ילָה] (אחולה) קִיר֥וֹת לִבִּ֛י הֹמֶה־לִּ֥י לִבִּ֖י לֹ֣א אַחֲרִ֑שׁ כִּ֣י ק֤וֹל שׁוֹפָר֙ (שמעתי) [שָׁמַ֣עַתְּ] נַפְשִׁ֔י תְּרוּעַ֖ת מִלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
Oh, my suffering, my suffering!
How I writhe!
Oh, the walls of my heart!
My heart moans within me,
I cannot be silent;
For I hear the blare of horns,
Alarms of war.
Transliteration: meay meay [vochiylah] (chvlh) kiyrvot liviy homeh-liy liviy lo acharish khiy kvol shvofar (shmty) [shamaate] nafeshiy teruat milechamah

Hebrew: שֶׁ֤בֶר עַל־שֶׁ֙בֶר֙ נִקְרָ֔א כִּ֥י שֻׁדְּדָ֖ה כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ פִּתְאֹם֙ שֻׁדְּד֣וּ אֹֽהָלַ֔י רֶ֖גַע יְרִיעֹתָֽי׃
Translated:
Disaster overtakes disaster,
For all the land has been ravaged.
Suddenly my tents have been ravaged,
In a moment, my tent cloths.
Transliteration: shever al-shever nikera khiy shudedah khׇl-haarets fiteom shudedu ohalay rega yeriyotay

Hebrew: עַד־מָתַ֖י אֶרְאֶה־נֵּ֑ס אֶשְׁמְעָ֖ה ק֥וֹל שׁוֹפָֽר׃ {פ}
Translated:
How long must I see standards
And hear the blare of horns?
Transliteration: ad-matay ereeh-nes eshemeah kvol shvofar {f}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ אֱוִ֣יל עַמִּ֗י אוֹתִי֙ לֹ֣א יָדָ֔עוּ בָּנִ֤ים סְכָלִים֙ הֵ֔מָּה וְלֹ֥א נְבוֹנִ֖ים הֵ֑מָּה חֲכָמִ֥ים הֵ֙מָּה֙ לְהָרַ֔ע וּלְהֵיטִ֖יב לֹ֥א יָדָֽעוּ׃
Translated:
For My people are stupid,
They give Me no heed;
They are foolish children,
They are not intelligent.
They are clever at doing wrong,
But unable to do right.
Transliteration: khiy eviyl amiy votiy lo yadau vaniym sekhaliym hemah velo nevvoniym hemah chakhamiym hemah lehara uleheytiyv lo yadau

Hebrew: רָאִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְהִנֵּה־תֹ֖הוּ וָבֹ֑הוּ וְאֶל־הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וְאֵ֥ין אוֹרָֽם׃
Translated:
I look at the earth,
It is unformed and void;
At the skies,
And their light is gone.
Transliteration: raiytiy et-haarets vehineh-tohu vavohu veel-hashamayiim veeyn voram

Hebrew: רָאִ֙יתִי֙ הֶהָרִ֔ים וְהִנֵּ֖ה רֹעֲשִׁ֑ים וְכׇל־הַגְּבָע֖וֹת הִתְקַלְקָֽלוּ׃
Translated:
I look at the mountains,
They are quaking;
And all the hills are rocking.
Transliteration: raiytiy hehariym vehineh roashiym vekhׇl-hagevavot hitekalekalu

Hebrew: רָאִ֕יתִי וְהִנֵּ֖ה אֵ֣ין הָאָדָ֑ם וְכׇל־ע֥וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם נָדָֽדוּ׃
Translated:
I look: no human is left,
And all the birds of the sky have fled.
Transliteration: raiytiy vehineh eyn haadam vekhׇl-vof hashamayiim nadadu

Hebrew: רָאִ֕יתִי וְהִנֵּ֥ה הַכַּרְמֶ֖ל הַמִּדְבָּ֑ר וְכׇל־עָרָ֗יו נִתְּצוּ֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה מִפְּנֵ֖י חֲר֥וֹן אַפּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
I look: the farmland is desert,
And all its towns are in ruin—
Because of GOD,
Because of God’s blazing anger.
Transliteration: raiytiy vehineh hakharemel hamidevar vekhׇl-arayv nitetsu mifeney yehovah mifeney charvon afvo {s}

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹה֙ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה שְׁמָמָ֥ה תִֽהְיֶ֖ה כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְכָלָ֖ה לֹ֥א אֶעֱשֶֽׂה׃
Translated:
(For thus said GOD:
The whole land shall be desolate,
But I will not make an end of it.)
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah shemamah tiheyeh khׇl-haarets vekhalah lo eesheh

Hebrew: עַל־זֹאת֙ תֶּאֱבַ֣ל הָאָ֔רֶץ וְקָדְר֥וּ הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם מִמָּ֑עַל עַ֤ל כִּֽי־דִבַּ֙רְתִּי֙ זַמֹּ֔תִי וְלֹ֥א נִחַ֖מְתִּי וְלֹא־אָשׁ֥וּב מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
Translated:
For this the earth mourns,
And skies are dark above—
Because I have spoken, I have planned,
And I will not relent or turn back from it.
Transliteration: al-zot teeval haarets vekaderu hashamayiim mimaal al khiy-divaretiy zamotiy velo nichametiy velo-ashuv mimenah

Hebrew: מִקּ֨וֹל פָּרָ֜שׁ וְרֹ֣מֵה קֶ֗שֶׁת בֹּרַ֙חַת֙ כׇּל־הָעִ֔יר בָּ֚אוּ בֶּעָבִ֔ים וּבַכֵּפִ֖ים עָל֑וּ כׇּל־הָעִ֣יר עֲזוּבָ֔ה וְאֵין־יוֹשֵׁ֥ב בָּהֵ֖ן אִֽישׁ׃
Translated:
At the shout of horseman and bowman
The whole city flees.
They enter the thickets,
They clamber up the rocks.
The whole city is deserted,
Nobody remains there.
Transliteration: mikvol farash veromeh keshet vorachat khׇl-haiyr vau veaviym uvakhefiym alu khׇl-haiyr azuvah veeyn-yvoshev vahen iysh

Hebrew: (ואתי) [וְאַ֨תְּ] שָׁד֜וּד מַֽה־תַּעֲשִׂ֗י כִּֽי־תִלְבְּשִׁ֨י שָׁנִ֜י כִּֽי־תַעְדִּ֣י עֲדִֽי־זָהָ֗ב כִּֽי־תִקְרְעִ֤י בַפּוּךְ֙ עֵינַ֔יִךְ לַשָּׁ֖וְא תִּתְיַפִּ֑י מָאֲסוּ־בָ֥ךְ עֹגְבִ֖ים נַפְשֵׁ֥ךְ יְבַקֵּֽשׁוּ׃
Translated:
And you, who are doomed to ruin,
What do you accomplish by wearing crimson,
By decking yourself in jewels of gold,
By enlarging your eyes with kohl?
You beautify yourself in vain:
Lovers despise you,
They seek your life!
Transliteration: (vty) [veate] shadud mah-taashiy khiy-tileveshiy shaniy khiy-taediy adiy-zahav khiy-tikereiy vafukhe eynayiikhe lashave titeyafiy maasu-vakhe ogeviym nafeshekhe yevakeshu

Hebrew: כִּי֩ ק֨וֹל כְּחוֹלָ֜ה שָׁמַ֗עְתִּי צָרָה֙ כְּמַבְכִּירָ֔ה ק֧וֹל בַּת־צִיּ֛וֹן תִּתְיַפֵּ֖חַ תְּפָרֵ֣שׂ כַּפֶּ֑יהָ אֽוֹי־נָ֣א לִ֔י כִּֽי־עָיְפָ֥ה נַפְשִׁ֖י לְהֹרְגִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated:
I hear a voice as of one in travail,
Anguish as of a woman bearing her first child,
The voice of Fair Zion
Panting, stretching out her hands:
“Alas for me! I faint
Before the killers!”
Transliteration: khiy kvol khechvolah shamaetiy tsarah khemavekhiyrah kvol vat-tsiyyvon titeyafecha tefaresh khafeyha voy-na liy khiy-ayefah nafeshiy lehoregiym {f}

Hebrew: שׁוֹטְט֞וּ בְּחוּצ֣וֹת יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם וּרְאוּ־נָ֤א וּדְעוּ֙ וּבַקְשׁ֣וּ בִרְחוֹבוֹתֶ֔יהָ אִם־תִּמְצְא֣וּ אִ֔ישׁ אִם־יֵ֛שׁ עֹשֶׂ֥ה מִשְׁפָּ֖ט מְבַקֵּ֣שׁ אֱמוּנָ֑ה וְאֶסְלַ֖ח לָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Roam the streets of Jerusalem,
Search its squares,
Look about and take note:
You will not find anyone engaged;
There is no one who acts justly,
Who seeks integrity—
That I should pardon her.
Transliteration: shvotetu vechutsvot yerushala͏im ureu-na udeu uvakeshu virechvovvoteyha im-timetseu iysh im-eish osheh mishefat mevakesh emunah veeselach lah

Hebrew: וְאִ֥ם חַי־יְהֹוָ֖ה יֹאמֵ֑רוּ לָכֵ֥ן לַשֶּׁ֖קֶר יִשָּׁבֵֽעוּ׃
Translated:
Even when they say, “As GOD lives,”
They are sure to be swearing falsely.
Transliteration: veim chay-yehovah yomeru lakhen lasheker yishaveu

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֗ה עֵינֶ֘יךָ֮ הֲל֣וֹא לֶאֱמוּנָה֒ הִכִּ֤יתָה אֹתָם֙ וְֽלֹא־חָ֔לוּ כִּלִּיתָ֕ם מֵאֲנ֖וּ קַ֣חַת מוּסָ֑ר חִזְּק֤וּ פְנֵיהֶם֙ מִסֶּ֔לַע מֵאֲנ֖וּ לָשֽׁוּב׃
Translated:
O ETERNAL One, Your eyes look for integrity.
You have struck them, but they sensed no pain;
You have consumed them, but they would accept no discipline.
They made their faces harder than rock,
They refused to turn back.
Transliteration: yehovah eyneykha halvo leemunah hikhiytah otam velo-chalu khiliytam meanu kachat musar chizeku feneyhem misela meanu lashuv

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֣י אָמַ֔רְתִּי אַךְ־דַּלִּ֖ים הֵ֑ם נוֹאֲל֕וּ כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָֽדְעוּ֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה מִשְׁפַּ֖ט אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Then I thought: These are just poor folk;
They act foolishly;
For they do not know the way of GOD,
The rules of their God.
Transliteration: vaaniy amaretiy akhe-daliym hem nvoalu khiy lo yadeu derekhe yehovah mishefat eloheyhem

Hebrew: אֵֽלְכָה־לִּ֤י אֶל־הַגְּדֹלִים֙ וַאֲדַבְּרָ֣ה אוֹתָ֔ם כִּ֣י הֵ֗מָּה יָֽדְעוּ֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה מִשְׁפַּ֖ט אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם אַ֣ךְ הֵ֤מָּה יַחְדָּו֙ שָׁ֣בְרוּ עֹ֔ל נִתְּק֖וּ מוֹסֵרֽוֹת׃
Translated:
So I will go to the wealthy
And speak with them:
Surely they know the way of GOD,
The rules of their God.
But they as well had broken the yoke,
Had snapped the bonds.
Transliteration: elekhah-liy el-hagedoliym vaadaverah votam khiy hemah yadeu derekhe yehovah mishefat eloheyhem akhe hemah yachedav shaveru ol niteku mvoservot

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּן֩ הִכָּ֨ם אַרְיֵ֜ה מִיַּ֗עַר זְאֵ֤ב עֲרָבוֹת֙ יְשׇׁדְדֵ֔ם נָמֵ֤ר שֹׁקֵד֙ עַל־עָ֣רֵיהֶ֔ם כׇּל־הַיּוֹצֵ֥א מֵהֵ֖נָּה יִטָּרֵ֑ף כִּ֤י רַבּוּ֙ פִּשְׁעֵיהֶ֔ם עָצְמ֖וּ מְשֻׁבוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Therefore,
The lion of the forest strikes them down,
The wolf of the desert ravages them.
A leopard lies in wait by their towns;
Whoever leaves them will be torn in pieces.
For their transgressions are many,
Their rebellious acts unnumbered.
Transliteration: al-khen hikham areeih miyaar zeev aravvot yeshׇdedem namer shoked al-areyhem khׇl-hayyvotse mehenah yitaref khiy ravu fisheeyhem atsemu meshuvvoteyhem

Hebrew: אֵ֤י לָזֹאת֙ (אסלוח) [אֶֽסְלַֽח־]לָ֔ךְ בָּנַ֣יִךְ עֲזָב֔וּנִי וַיִּשָּׁבְע֖וּ בְּלֹ֣א אֱלֹהִ֑ים וָאַשְׂבִּ֤עַ אוֹתָם֙ וַיִּנְאָ֔פוּ וּבֵ֥ית זוֹנָ֖ה יִתְגּוֹדָֽדוּ׃
Translated:
Why should I forgive you?
Your children have forsaken Me
And sworn by no-gods.
When I fed them their fill,
They committed adultery
And went trooping to the prostitute’s house.
Transliteration: ey lazot (slvch) [eselach-]lakhe vanayiikhe azavuniy vayishaveu velo Elohim vaashevia votam vayineafu uveyt zvonah yitegvodadu

Hebrew: סוּסִ֥ים מְיֻזָּנִ֖ים מַשְׁכִּ֣ים הָי֑וּ אִ֛ישׁ אֶל־אֵ֥שֶׁת רֵעֵ֖הוּ יִצְהָֽלוּ׃
Translated:
They were well-fed, lusty stallions,
Each neighing at another’s wife.
Transliteration: susiym meyuzaniym mashekhiym hayu iysh el-eshet reehu yitsehalu

Hebrew: הַעַל־אֵ֥לֶּה לֽוֹא־אֶפְקֹ֖ד נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאִם֙ בְּג֣וֹי אֲשֶׁר־כָּזֶ֔ה לֹ֥א תִתְנַקֵּ֖ם נַפְשִֽׁי׃ {ס}
Translated:
Shall I not punish such deeds?
—says GOD—
Shall I not bring retribution
On a nation such as this?
Transliteration: haal-eleh lvo-efekod neum-yehovah veim vegvoy asher-khazeh lo titenakem nafeshiy {s}

Hebrew: עֲל֤וּ בְשָׁרוֹתֶ֙יהָ֙ וְשַׁחֵ֔תוּ וְכָלָ֖ה אַֽל־תַּעֲשׂ֑וּ הָסִ֙ירוּ֙ נְטִ֣ישׁוֹתֶ֔יהָ כִּ֛י ל֥וֹא לַיהֹוָ֖ה הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated:
Go up among her vines and destroy;
Lop off her trailing branches,
For they are not of GOD.
(But do not make an end.)
Transliteration: alu vesharvoteyha veshachetu vekhalah al-taashu hasiyru netiyshvoteyha khiy lvo layhovah hemah

Hebrew: כִּי֩ בָג֨וֹד בָּגְד֜וּ בִּ֗י בֵּ֧ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל וּבֵ֥ית יְהוּדָ֖ה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
For the House of Israel and the House of Judah
Have betrayed Me
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: khiy vagvod vagedu viy veyt yisherael uveyt yehudah neum-yehovah

Hebrew: כִּֽחֲשׁוּ֙ בַּיהֹוָ֔ה וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ לוֹא־ה֑וּא וְלֹֽא־תָב֤וֹא עָלֵ֙ינוּ֙ רָעָ֔ה וְחֶ֥רֶב וְרָעָ֖ב ל֥וֹא נִרְאֶֽה׃
Translated:
They have been false to GOD
And said: “It is not so!
No trouble shall come upon us,
We shall not see sword or famine.
Transliteration: khichashu vayhovah vayomeru lvo-hu velo-tavvo aleynu raah vecherev veraav lvo nireeh

Hebrew: וְהַנְּבִיאִים֙ יִהְי֣וּ לְר֔וּחַ וְהַדִּבֵּ֖ר אֵ֣ין בָּהֶ֑ם כֹּ֥ה יֵעָשֶׂ֖ה לָהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
The prophets shall prove mere wind
For the Word is not in them;
Thus-and-thus shall be done to them!”
Transliteration: vehaneviyiym yiheyu lerucha vehadiver eyn vahem khoh eiasheh lahem {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י צְבָא֔וֹת יַ֚עַן דַּבֶּרְכֶ֔ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּ֑ה הִנְנִ֣י נֹתֵן֩ דְּבָרַ֨י בְּפִ֜יךָ לְאֵ֗שׁ וְהָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֛ה עֵצִ֖ים וַאֲכָלָֽתַם׃
Translated:
Assuredly, thus said GOD,
The God of Hosts:
Because they said that,
I am putting My words into your mouth as fire,
And this people shall be firewood,
Which it will consume.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah elohey tsevavot yaan daverekhem et-hadavar hazeh hineniy noten devaray vefiykha leesh vehaam hazeh etsiym vaakhalatam

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֣י מֵבִיא֩ עֲלֵיכֶ֨ם גּ֧וֹי מִמֶּרְחָ֛ק בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה גּ֣וֹי ׀ אֵיתָ֣ן ה֗וּא גּ֤וֹי מֵֽעוֹלָם֙ ה֔וּא גּ֚וֹי לֹא־תֵדַ֣ע לְשֹׁנ֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א תִשְׁמַ֖ע מַה־יְדַבֵּֽר׃
Translated:
Lo, I am bringing against you, O House of Israel,
A nation from afar
—declares GOD;
It is an enduring nation,
It is an ancient nation;
A nation whose language you do not know—
You will not understand what they say.
Transliteration: hineniy meviy aleykhem gvoy mimerechak veyt yisherael neum-yehovah gvoy eytan hu gvoy mevolam hu gvoy lo-teda leshonvo velo tishema mah-yedaver

Hebrew: אַשְׁפָּת֖וֹ כְּקֶ֣בֶר פָּת֑וּחַ כֻּלָּ֖ם גִּבּוֹרִֽים׃
Translated:
Their quivers are like a yawning grave—
They are all mighty warriors.
Transliteration: ashefatvo khekever fatucha khulam givvoriym

Hebrew: וְאָכַ֨ל קְצִֽירְךָ֜ וְלַחְמֶ֗ךָ יֹֽאכְלוּ֙ בָּנֶ֣יךָ וּבְנוֹתֶ֔יךָ יֹאכַ֤ל צֹֽאנְךָ֙ וּבְקָרֶ֔ךָ יֹאכַ֥ל גַּפְנְךָ֖ וּתְאֵנָתֶ֑ךָ יְרֹשֵׁ֞שׁ עָרֵ֣י מִבְצָרֶ֗יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתָּ֛ה בֹּטֵ֥חַ בָּהֵ֖נָּה בֶּחָֽרֶב׃
Translated:
They will devour your harvest and food,
They will devour your sons and daughters,
They will devour your flocks and herds,
They will devour your vines and fig trees.
They will batter down with the sword
The fortified towns on which you rely.
Transliteration: veakhal ketsiyrekha velachemekha yokhelu vaneykha uvenvoteykha yokhal tsonekha uvekarekha yokhal gafenekha uteenatekha yeroshesh arey mivetsareykha asher atah votecha vahenah vecharev

Hebrew: וְגַ֛ם בַּיָּמִ֥ים הָהֵ֖מָּה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹא־אֶעֱשֶׂ֥ה אִתְּכֶ֖ם כָּלָֽה׃
Translated: But even in those days—declares G<small>OD</small>—I will not make an end of you.
Transliteration: vegam vayamiym hahemah neum-yehovah lo-eesheh itekhem khalah

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ כִּ֣י תֹאמְר֔וּ תַּ֣חַת מֶ֗ה עָשָׂ֨ה יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵ֛ינוּ לָ֖נוּ אֶת־כׇּל־אֵ֑לֶּה וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר עֲזַבְתֶּ֤ם אוֹתִי֙ וַתַּעַבְד֞וּ אֱלֹהֵ֤י נֵכָר֙ בְּאַרְצְכֶ֔ם כֵּ֚ן תַּעַבְד֣וּ זָרִ֔ים בְּאֶ֖רֶץ לֹ֥א לָכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: And when they ask, “Because of what did the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God do all these things?” you shall answer them, “Because you forsook Me and served alien gods on your own land, you will have to serve foreigners in a land not your own.”
Transliteration: vehayah khiy tomeru tachat meh ashah yehovah eloheynu lanu et-khׇl-eleh veamareta aleyhem khaasher azavetem votiy vataavedu elohey nekhar vearetsekhem khen taavedu zariym veerets lo lakhem {f}

Hebrew: הַגִּ֥ידוּ זֹ֖את בְּבֵ֣ית יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְהַשְׁמִיע֥וּהָ בִיהוּדָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated:
Proclaim this to the House of Jacob
And announce it in Judah:
Transliteration: hagiydu zot veveyt yaakov vehashemiyuha viyhudah lemor

Hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ־נָ֣א זֹ֔את עַ֥ם סָכָ֖ל וְאֵ֣ין לֵ֑ב עֵינַ֤יִם לָהֶם֙ וְלֹ֣א יִרְא֔וּ אׇזְנַ֥יִם לָהֶ֖ם וְלֹ֥א יִשְׁמָֽעוּ׃
Translated:
Hear this, O foolish people,
Devoid of intelligence,
That have eyes but can’t see,
That have ears but can’t hear!
Transliteration: shimeu-na zot am sakhal veeyn lev eynayiim lahem velo yireu ׇzenayiim lahem velo yishemau

Hebrew: הַאוֹתִ֨י לֹא־תִירָ֜אוּ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֗ה אִ֤ם מִפָּנַי֙ לֹ֣א תָחִ֔ילוּ אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֤מְתִּי חוֹל֙ גְּב֣וּל לַיָּ֔ם חׇק־עוֹלָ֖ם וְלֹ֣א יַעַבְרֶ֑נְהוּ וַיִּֽתְגָּעֲשׁוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א יוּכָ֔לוּ וְהָמ֥וּ גַלָּ֖יו וְלֹ֥א יַעַבְרֻֽנְהוּ׃
Translated:
Should you not revere Me
—says GOD—
Should you not tremble before Me,
Who set the sand as a boundary to the sea,
As a limit for all time, not to be transgressed?
Though its waves toss, they cannot prevail;
Though they roar, they cannot pass it.
Transliteration: havotiy lo-tiyrau neum-yehovah im mifanay lo tachiylu asher-shametiy chvol gevul layam chׇk-volam velo yaaverenehu vayitegaashu velo yukhalu vehamu galayv velo yaaverunehu

Hebrew: וְלָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ הָיָ֔ה לֵ֖ב סוֹרֵ֣ר וּמוֹרֶ֑ה סָ֖רוּ וַיֵּלֵֽכוּ׃
Translated:
Yet this people has a wayward and defiant heart;
They have turned aside and gone their way.
Transliteration: velaam hazeh hayah lev svorer umvoreh saru vayelekhu

Hebrew: וְלֽוֹא־אָמְר֣וּ בִלְבָבָ֗ם נִ֤ירָא נָא֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ הַנֹּתֵ֗ן גֶּ֛שֶׁם (וירה) [יוֹרֶ֥ה] וּמַלְק֖וֹשׁ בְּעִתּ֑וֹ שְׁבֻעֹ֛ת חֻקּ֥וֹת קָצִ֖יר יִשְׁמׇר־לָֽנוּ׃
Translated:
They have not said to themselves,
“Let us revere the ETERNAL our God,
Who gives the rain,
The early and late rain in season,
Who keeps for our benefit
The weeks appointed for harvest.”
Transliteration: velvo-ameru vilevavam niyra na et-yehovah eloheynu hanoten geshem (vyrh) [yvoreh] umalekvosh veitvo shevuot chukvot katsiyr yishemׇr-lanu

Hebrew: עֲוֺנוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם הִטּוּ־אֵ֑לֶּה וְחַטֹּ֣אותֵיכֶ֔ם מָנְע֥וּ הַטּ֖וֹב מִכֶּֽם׃
Translated:
It is your iniquities that have diverted these things,
Your sins that have withheld the bounty from you.
Transliteration: avonvoteykhem hitu-eleh vechatovteykhem maneu hatvov mikhem

Hebrew: כִּֽי־נִמְצְא֥וּ בְעַמִּ֖י רְשָׁעִ֑ים יָשׁוּר֙ כְּשַׁ֣ךְ יְקוּשִׁ֔ים הִצִּ֥יבוּ מַשְׁחִ֖ית אֲנָשִׁ֥ים יִלְכֹּֽדוּ׃
Translated:
For among My people are found evildoers,
Who lurk, like fowlers lying in wait;
They set up a trap to catch other people.
Transliteration: khiy-nimetseu veamiy reshaiym yashur kheshakhe yekushiym hitsiyvu mashechiyt anashiym yilekhodu

Hebrew: כִּכְלוּב֙ מָ֣לֵא ע֔וֹף כֵּ֥ן בָּתֵּיהֶ֖ם מְלֵאִ֣ים מִרְמָ֑ה עַל־כֵּ֥ן גָּדְל֖וּ וַֽיַּעֲשִֽׁירוּ׃
Translated:
As a cage is full of birds,
So their houses are full of guile;
That is why they have grown so wealthy.
Transliteration: khikheluv male vof khen vateyhem meleiym miremah al-khen gadelu vayaashiyru

Hebrew: שָֽׁמְנ֣וּ עָֽשְׁת֗וּ גַּ֚ם עָבְר֣וּ דִבְרֵי־רָ֔ע דִּ֣ין לֹא־דָ֔נוּ דִּ֥ין יָת֖וֹם וְיַצְלִ֑יחוּ וּמִשְׁפַּ֥ט אֶבְיוֹנִ֖ים לֹ֥א שָׁפָֽטוּ׃
Translated:
They have become fat and sleek;
They pass beyond the bounds of wickedness,
And they prosper.
They will not judge the case of the orphan,
Nor give a hearing to the plea of the needy.
Transliteration: shamenu ashetu gam averu diverey-ra diyn lo-danu diyn yatvom veyatseliychu umishefat eveyvoniym lo shafatu

Hebrew: הַעַל־אֵ֥לֶּה לֹֽא־אֶפְקֹ֖ד נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה אִ֚ם בְּג֣וֹי אֲשֶׁר־כָּזֶ֔ה לֹ֥א תִתְנַקֵּ֖ם נַפְשִֽׁי׃ {ס}
Translated:
Shall I not punish such deeds
—says GOD—
Shall I not bring retribution
On a nation such as this?
Transliteration: haal-eleh lo-efekod neum-yehovah im vegvoy asher-khazeh lo titenakem nafeshiy {s}

Hebrew: שַׁמָּה֙ וְשַׁ֣עֲרוּרָ֔ה נִהְיְתָ֖ה בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
An appalling, horrible thing
Has happened in the land:
Transliteration: shamah veshaarurah niheyetah vaarets

Hebrew: הַנְּבִאִ֞ים נִבְּא֣וּ בַשֶּׁ֗קֶר וְהַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ יִרְדּ֣וּ עַל־יְדֵיהֶ֔ם וְעַמִּ֖י אָ֣הֲבוּ כֵ֑ן וּמַֽה־תַּעֲשׂ֖וּ לְאַחֲרִיתָֽהּ׃
Translated:
The prophets prophesy falsely,
And the priests rule accordingly;
And My people like it so.
But what will you do at the end of it?
Transliteration: haneviiym niveu vasheker vehakhohaniym yiredu al-yedeyhem veamiy ahavu khen umah-taashu leachariytah

Hebrew: הָעִ֣זוּ ׀ בְּנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֗ן מִקֶּ֙רֶב֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וּבִתְק֙וֹעַ֙ תִּקְע֣וּ שׁוֹפָ֔ר וְעַל־בֵּ֥ית הַכֶּ֖רֶם שְׂא֣וּ מַשְׂאֵ֑ת כִּ֥י רָעָ֛ה נִשְׁקְפָ֥ה מִצָּפ֖וֹן וְשֶׁ֥בֶר גָּדֽוֹל׃
Translated:
Flee for refuge, O people of Benjamin,
Out of the midst of Jerusalem!
Blow the horn in Tekoa,
Set up a signal at Beth-haccerem!
For evil is appearing from the north,
And great disaster.
Transliteration: haizu veney vineyamin mikerev yerushala͏im uvitekvoa tikeu shvofar veal-veyt hakherem sheu masheet khiy raah nishekefah mitsafvon veshever gadvol

Hebrew: הַנָּוָה֙ וְהַמְּעֻנָּגָ֔ה דָּמִ֖יתִי בַּת־צִיּֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Fair Zion, the lovely and delicate,
I will destroy.
Transliteration: hanavah vehameunagah damiytiy vat-tsiyyvon

Hebrew: אֵלֶ֛יהָ יָבֹ֥אוּ רֹעִ֖ים וְעֶדְרֵיהֶ֑ם תָּקְע֨וּ עָלֶ֤יהָ אֹֽהָלִים֙ סָבִ֔יב רָע֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ אֶת־יָדֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Against her come shepherds with their flocks,
They pitch tents all around her;
Each grazes the sheep under his care.
Transliteration: eleyha yavou roiym veedereyhem takeu aleyha ohaliym saviyv rau iysh et-yadvo

Hebrew: קַדְּשׁ֤וּ עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ מִלְחָמָ֔ה ק֖וּמוּ וְנַעֲלֶ֣ה בַֽצׇּהֳרָ֑יִם א֥וֹי לָ֙נוּ֙ כִּֽי־פָנָ֣ה הַיּ֔וֹם כִּ֥י יִנָּט֖וּ צִלְלֵי־עָֽרֶב׃
Translated:
Prepare for battle against her:
“Up! we will attack at noon.”
“Alas for us! for day is declining,
The shadows of evening grow long.”
Transliteration: kadeshu aleyha milechamah kumu venaaleh vatsׇhorayiim voy lanu khiy-fanah hayyvom khiy yinatu tsileley-arev

Hebrew: ק֚וּמוּ וְנַעֲלֶ֣ה בַלָּ֔יְלָה וְנַשְׁחִ֖יתָה אַרְמְנוֹתֶֽיהָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
“Up! let us attack by night,
And wreck her fortresses.”
Transliteration: kumu venaaleh valayelah venashechiytah aremenvoteyha {f}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֤ה אָמַר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת כִּרְת֣וּ עֵצָ֔הֿ וְשִׁפְכ֥וּ עַל־יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם סֹֽלְלָ֑ה הִ֚יא הָעִ֣יר הׇפְקַ֔ד כֻּלָּ֖הּ עֹ֥שֶׁק בְּקִרְבָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
For thus said GOD of Hosts:
Hew down her trees,
And raise a siege mound against Jerusalem.
She is the city destined for punishment;
Only fraud is found in her midst.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar yehovah tsevavot khiretu etsahֿ veshifekhu al-yerushala͏im solelah hiy haiyr hׇfekad khulah oshek vekirevah

Hebrew: כְּהָקִ֥יר (בור) [בַּ֙יִר֙] מֵימֶ֔יהָ כֵּ֖ן הֵקֵ֣רָה רָעָתָ֑הּ חָמָ֣ס וָ֠שֹׁ֠ד יִשָּׁ֨מַע בָּ֧הּ עַל־פָּנַ֛י תָּמִ֖יד חֳלִ֥י וּמַכָּֽה׃
Translated:
As a well flows with water,
So she flows with wickedness.
Lawlessness and rapine are heard in her;
Before Me constantly are sickness and wounds.
Transliteration: khehakiyr (vvr) [vayiir] meymeyha khen hekerah raatah chamas vashod yishama vah al-fanay tamiyd choliy umakhah

Hebrew: הִוָּֽסְרִי֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם פֶּן־תֵּקַ֥ע נַפְשִׁ֖י מִמֵּ֑ךְ פֶּן־אֲשִׂימֵ֣ךְ שְׁמָמָ֔ה אֶ֖רֶץ ל֥וֹא נוֹשָֽׁבָה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Accept rebuke, O Jerusalem,
Lest I come to loathe you,
Lest I make you a desolation,
An uninhabited land.
Transliteration: hivaseriy yerushala͏im fen-teka nafeshiy mimekhe fen-ashiymekhe shemamah erets lvo nvoshavah {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת עוֹלֵ֛ל יְעוֹלְל֥וּ כַגֶּ֖פֶן שְׁאֵרִ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הָשֵׁב֙ יָֽדְךָ֔ כְּבוֹצֵ֖ר עַל־סַלְסִלּֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD of Hosts:
Let them glean over and over, as a vine,
The remnant of Israel.
Pass your hand again,
Like a vintager,
Over its branches.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah tsevavot volel yevolelu khagefen sheeriyt yisherael hashev yadekha khevvotser al-salesilvot

Hebrew: עַל־מִ֨י אֲדַבְּרָ֤ה וְאָעִ֙ידָה֙ וְיִשְׁמָ֔עוּ הִנֵּה֙ עֲרֵלָ֣ה אׇזְנָ֔ם וְלֹ֥א יוּכְל֖וּ לְהַקְשִׁ֑יב הִנֵּ֣ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֗ה הָיָ֥ה לָהֶ֛ם לְחֶרְפָּ֖ה לֹ֥א יַחְפְּצוּ־בֽוֹ׃
Translated:
To whom shall I speak,
Give warning that they may hear?
Their ears are blocked
And they cannot listen.
See, the word of GOD has become for them
An object of scorn; they will have none of it.
Transliteration: al-miy adaverah veaiydah veyishemau hineh arelah ׇzenam velo yukhelu lehakeshiyv hineh devar-yehovah hayah lahem lecherefah lo yachefetsu-vvo

Hebrew: וְאֵת֩ חֲמַ֨ת יְהֹוָ֤ה <small>׀</small> מָלֵ֙אתִי֙ נִלְאֵ֣יתִי הָכִ֔יל שְׁפֹ֤ךְ עַל־עוֹלָל֙ בַּח֔וּץ וְעַ֛ל ס֥וֹד בַּחוּרִ֖ים יַחְדָּ֑ו כִּֽי־גַם־אִ֤ישׁ עִם־אִשָּׁה֙ יִלָּכֵ֔דוּ זָקֵ֖ן עִם־מְלֵ֥א יָמִֽים׃
Translated:
But I am filled with GOD’s wrath,
I cannot hold it in.
Pour it on the infant in the street,
And on the company of youths gathered together!
Yes, men and women alike shall be captured,
Elders and those of advanced years.
Transliteration: veet chamat yehovah <small></small> maletiy nileeytiy hakhiyl shefokhe al-volal vachuts veal svod vachuriym yachedav khiy-gam-iysh im-ishah yilakhedu zaken im-mele yamiym

Hebrew: וְנָסַ֤בּוּ בָֽתֵּיהֶם֙ לַאֲחֵרִ֔ים שָׂד֥וֹת וְנָשִׁ֖ים יַחְדָּ֑ו כִּֽי־אַטֶּ֧ה אֶת־יָדִ֛י עַל־יֹשְׁבֵ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Their houses shall pass to others,
Fields and wives as well,
For I will stretch out My arm
Against the inhabitants of the country
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: venasavu vateyhem laacheriym shadvot venashiym yachedav khiy-ateh et-yadiy al-yoshevey haarets neum-yehovah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י מִקְּטַנָּם֙ וְעַד־גְּדוֹלָ֔ם כֻּלּ֖וֹ בּוֹצֵ֣עַ בָּ֑צַע וּמִנָּבִיא֙ וְעַד־כֹּהֵ֔ן כֻּלּ֖וֹ עֹ֥שֶׂה שָּֽׁקֶר׃
Translated:
For from the smallest to the greatest,
They are all greedy for gain;
Priest and prophet alike,
They all act falsely.
Transliteration: khiy miketanam vead-gedvolam khulvo vvotsea vatsa uminaviy vead-khohen khulvo osheh shaker

Hebrew: וַֽיְרַפְּא֞וּ אֶת־שֶׁ֤בֶר עַמִּי֙ עַל־נְקַלָּ֔ה לֵאמֹ֖ר שָׁל֣וֹם <small>׀</small> שָׁל֑וֹם וְאֵ֖ין שָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated:
They offer healing offhand
For the wounds of My people,
Saying, “All is well, all is well,”
When nothing is well.
Transliteration: vayerafeu et-shever amiy al-nekalah lemor shalvom <small></small> shalvom veeyn shalvom

Hebrew: הֹבִ֕ישׁוּ כִּ֥י תוֹעֵבָ֖ה עָשׂ֑וּ גַּם־בּ֣וֹשׁ לֹֽא־יֵב֗וֹשׁוּ גַּם־הַכְלִים֙ לֹ֣א יָדָ֔עוּ לָכֵ֞ן יִפְּל֧וּ בַנֹּפְלִ֛ים בְּעֵת־פְּקַדְתִּ֥ים יִכָּשְׁל֖וּ אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
They have acted shamefully;
They have done abhorrent things—
Yet they do not feel shame,
And they cannot be made to blush.
Assuredly, they shall fall among the falling,
They shall stumble at the time when I punish them
—said GOD.
Transliteration: hoviyshu khiy tvoevah ashu gam-vvosh lo-eivvoshu gam-hakheliym lo yadau lakhen yifelu vanofeliym veet-fekadetiym yikhashelu amar yehovah {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֡ה עִמְדוּ֩ עַל־דְּרָכִ֨ים וּרְא֜וּ וְשַׁאֲל֣וּ ׀ לִנְתִב֣וֹת עוֹלָ֗ם אֵי־זֶ֨ה דֶ֤רֶךְ הַטּוֹב֙ וּלְכוּ־בָ֔הּ וּמִצְא֥וּ מַרְגּ֖וֹעַ לְנַפְשְׁכֶ֑ם וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ לֹ֥א נֵלֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
Stand by the roads and consider,
Inquire about ancient paths:
Which is the road to happiness?
Travel it, and find tranquility for yourselves.
But they said, “We will not.”
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah imedu al-derakhiym ureu veshaalu linetivvot volam ey-zeh derekhe hatvov ulekhu-vah umitseu maregvoa lenafeshekhem vayomeru lo nelekhe

Hebrew: וַהֲקִמֹתִ֤י עֲלֵיכֶם֙ צֹפִ֔ים הַקְשִׁ֖יבוּ לְק֣וֹל שׁוֹפָ֑ר וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ לֹ֥א נַקְשִֽׁיב׃
Translated:
And I raised up lookouts for you:
“Hearken to the sound of the horn!”
But they said, “We will not.”
Transliteration: vahakimotiy aleykhem tsofiym hakeshiyvu lekvol shvofar vayomeru lo nakeshiyv

Hebrew: לָכֵ֖ן שִׁמְע֣וּ הַגּוֹיִ֑ם וּדְעִ֥י עֵדָ֖ה אֶת־אֲשֶׁר־בָּֽם׃
Translated:
Hear well, O nations,
And know, O community, what is in store for them.
Transliteration: lakhen shimeu hagvoyim udeiy edah et-asher-vam

Hebrew: שִׁמְעִ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י מֵבִ֥יא רָעָ֛ה אֶל־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה פְּרִ֣י מַחְשְׁבוֹתָ֑ם כִּ֤י עַל־דְּבָרַי֙ לֹ֣א הִקְשִׁ֔יבוּ וְתוֹרָתִ֖י וַיִּמְאֲסוּ־בָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Hear, O earth!
I am going to bring disaster upon this people,
The outcome of their own schemes;
For they would not hearken to My words,
And they rejected My Instruction.
Transliteration: shimeiy haarets hineh anokhiy meviy raah el-haam hazeh feriy macheshevvotam khiy al-devaray lo hikeshiyvu vetvoratiy vayimeasu-vah

Hebrew: לָמָּה־זֶּ֨ה לִ֤י לְבוֹנָה֙ מִשְּׁבָ֣א תָב֔וֹא וְקָנֶ֥ה הַטּ֖וֹב מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מֶרְחָ֑ק עֹלֽוֹתֵיכֶם֙ לֹ֣א לְרָצ֔וֹן וְזִבְחֵיכֶ֖ם לֹא־עָ֥רְבוּ לִֽי׃
Translated:
What need have I of frankincense
That comes from Sheba,
Or fragrant cane from a distant land?
Your burnt offerings are not acceptable
And your sacrifices are not pleasing to Me.
Transliteration: lamah-zeh liy levvonah misheva tavvo vekaneh hatvov meerets merechak olvoteykhem lo leratsvon vezivecheykhem lo-arevu liy

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנְנִ֥י נֹתֵ֛ן אֶל־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה מִכְשֹׁלִ֑ים וְכָ֣שְׁלוּ בָ֠ם אָב֨וֹת וּבָנִ֥ים יַחְדָּ֛ו שָׁכֵ֥ן וְרֵע֖וֹ (יאבדו) [וְאָבָֽדוּ]׃ {פ}
Translated:
Assuredly, thus said GOD:
I shall put before this people stumbling blocks
Over which they shall stumble—
Parents and children alike,
Neighbor and friend shall perish.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar yehovah hineniy noten el-haam hazeh mikhesholiym vekhashelu vam avvot uvaniym yachedav shakhen verevo (yvdv) [veavadu] {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנֵּ֛ה עַ֥ם בָּ֖א מֵאֶ֣רֶץ צָפ֑וֹן וְג֣וֹי גָּד֔וֹל יֵע֖וֹר מִיַּרְכְּתֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
See, a people comes from the northland,
A great nation is roused
From the remotest parts of the earth.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah hineh am va meerets tsafvon vegvoy gadvol eivor miyarekhetey-arets

Hebrew: קֶ֣שֶׁת וְכִיד֞וֹן יַחֲזִ֗יקוּ אַכְזָרִ֥י הוּא֙ וְלֹ֣א יְרַחֵ֔מוּ קוֹלָם֙ כַּיָּ֣ם יֶהֱמֶ֔ה וְעַל־סוּסִ֖ים יִרְכָּ֑בוּ עָר֗וּךְ כְּאִישׁ֙ לַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה עָלַ֖יִךְ בַּת־צִיּֽוֹן׃
Translated:
They grasp the bow and javelin;
They are cruel, they show no mercy;
The sound of them is like the roaring sea.
They ride upon horses,
Accoutered like a man for battle,
Against you, O Fair Zion!
Transliteration: keshet vekhiydvon yachaziyku akhezariy hu velo yerachemu kvolam khayam yehemeh veal-susiym yirekhavu arukhe kheiysh lamilechamah alayiikhe vat-tsiyyvon

Hebrew: שָׁמַ֥עְנוּ אֶת־שׇׁמְע֖וֹ רָפ֣וּ יָדֵ֑ינוּ צָרָה֙ הֶחֱזִקַ֔תְנוּ חִ֖יל כַּיּֽוֹלֵדָֽה׃
Translated:
“We have heard the report of them,
Our hands fail;
Pain seizes us,
Agony like a woman in childbirth.
Transliteration: shamaenu et-shׇmevo rafu yadeynu tsarah hechezikatenu chiyl khayyvoledah

Hebrew: אַל־[תֵּֽצְאוּ֙] (תצאי) הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה וּבַדֶּ֖רֶךְ אַל־[תֵּלֵ֑כוּ] (תלכי) כִּ֚י חֶ֣רֶב לְאֹיֵ֔ב מָג֖וֹר מִסָּבִֽיב׃
Translated:
Do not go out into the country,
Do not walk the roads!
For the sword of the enemy is there,
Terror on every side.”
Transliteration: al-[tetseu] (ttsy) hashadeh uvaderekhe al-[telekhu] (tlkhy) khiy cherev leoeiv magvor misaviyv

Hebrew: בַּת־עַמִּ֤י חִגְרִי־שָׂק֙ וְהִתְפַּלְּשִׁ֣י בָאֵ֔פֶר אֵ֤בֶל יָחִיד֙ עֲשִׂ֣י לָ֔ךְ מִסְפַּ֖ד תַּמְרוּרִ֑ים כִּ֣י פִתְאֹ֔ם יָבֹ֥א הַשֹּׁדֵ֖ד עָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
My poor people,
Put on sackcloth
And strew dust on yourselves!
Mourn, as for an only child;
Wail bitterly,
For suddenly the destroyer
Is coming upon us.
Transliteration: vat-amiy chigeriy-shak vehitefaleshiy vaefer evel yachiyd ashiy lakhe misefad tameruriym khiy fiteom yavo hashoded aleynu

Hebrew: בָּח֛וֹן נְתַתִּ֥יךָ בְעַמִּ֖י מִבְצָ֑ר וְתֵדַ֕ע וּבָחַנְתָּ֖ אֶת־דַּרְכָּֽם׃
Translated:
I have made you an assayer of My people
—A refiner—
You are to note and assay their ways.
Transliteration: vachvon netatiykha veamiy mivetsar veteda uvachaneta et-darekham

Hebrew: כֻּלָּם֙ סָרֵ֣י סוֹרְרִ֔ים הֹלְכֵ֥י רָכִ֖יל נְחֹ֣שֶׁת וּבַרְזֶ֑ל כֻּלָּ֥ם מַשְׁחִיתִ֖ים הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated:
They are copper and iron:
They are all stubbornly defiant;
They deal basely
All of them act corruptly.
Transliteration: khulam sarey svoreriym holekhey rakhiyl nechoshet uvarezel khulam mashechiytiym hemah

Hebrew: נָחַ֣ר מַפֻּ֔חַ (מאשתם) [מֵאֵ֖שׁ תַּ֣ם] עֹפָ֑רֶת לַשָּׁוְא֙ צָרַ֣ף צָר֔וֹף וְרָעִ֖ים לֹ֥א נִתָּֽקוּ׃
Translated:
The bellows puff;
The lead is consumed by fire.
Yet the smelter smelts to no purpose—
The dross is not separated out.
Transliteration: nachar mafucha (mshtm) [meesh tam] ofaret lashave tsaraf tsarvof veraiym lo nitaku

Hebrew: כֶּ֣סֶף נִמְאָ֔ס קָרְא֖וּ לָהֶ֑ם כִּֽי־מָאַ֥ס יְהֹוָ֖ה בָּהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
They are called “rejected silver,”
For GOD has rejected them.
Transliteration: khesef nimeas kareu lahem khiy-maas yehovah vahem {f}

Hebrew: הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָיָ֣ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ מֵאֵ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word that came to Jeremiah from G<small>OD</small>:
Transliteration: hadavar asher hayah el-yiremeyahu meet yehovah lemor

Hebrew: עֲמֹ֗ד בְּשַׁ֙עַר֙ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה וְקָרָ֣אתָ שָּׁ֔ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּ֑ה וְאָמַרְתָּ֞ שִׁמְע֣וּ דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֗ה כׇּל־יְהוּדָה֙ הַבָּאִים֙ בַּשְּׁעָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה לְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֖ת לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Stand at the gate of the House of G<small>OD</small>, and there proclaim this word: Hear the word of G<small>OD</small>, all you of Judah who enter these gates to worship G<small>OD</small>!
Transliteration: amod veshaar veyt yehovah vekarata sham et-hadavar hazeh veamareta shimeu devar-yehovah khׇl-yehudah havaiym vasheariym haeleh lehishetachavot layhovah {s}

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־אָמַ֞ר יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הֵיטִ֥יבוּ דַרְכֵיכֶ֖ם וּמַעַלְלֵיכֶ֑ם וַאֲשַׁכְּנָ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם בַּמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: Mend your ways and your actions, and I will let you dwell in this place.
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael heytiyvu darekheykhem umaaleleykhem vaashakhenah etekhem vamakvom hazeh

Hebrew: אַל־תִּבְטְח֣וּ לָכֶ֔ם אֶל־דִּבְרֵ֥י הַשֶּׁ֖קֶר לֵאמֹ֑ר הֵיכַ֤ל יְהֹוָה֙ הֵיכַ֣ל יְהֹוָ֔ה הֵיכַ֥ל יְהֹוָ֖ה הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: Don’t put your trust in illusions and say, “The Temple of G<small>OD</small>, the Temple of G<small>OD</small>, the Temple of G<small>OD</small> are these [buildings].”
Transliteration: al-tivetechu lakhem el-diverey hasheker lemor heykhal yehovah heykhal yehovah heykhal yehovah hemah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אִם־הֵיטֵיב֙ תֵּיטִ֔יבוּ אֶת־דַּרְכֵיכֶ֖ם וְאֶת־מַעַלְלֵיכֶ֑ם אִם־עָשׂ֤וֹ תַֽעֲשׂוּ֙ מִשְׁפָּ֔ט בֵּ֥ין אִ֖ישׁ וּבֵ֥ין רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: No, if you really mend your ways and your actions; if you execute justice between one party and another;
Transliteration: khiy im-heyteyv teytiyvu et-darekheykhem veet-maaleleykhem im-ashvo taashu mishefat veyn iysh uveyn reehu

Hebrew: גֵּ֣ר יָת֤וֹם וְאַלְמָנָה֙ לֹ֣א תַעֲשֹׁ֔קוּ וְדָ֣ם נָקִ֔י אַֽל־תִּשְׁפְּכ֖וּ בַּמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וְאַחֲרֵ֨י אֱלֹהִ֧ים אֲחֵרִ֛ים לֹ֥א תֵלְכ֖וּ לְרַ֥ע לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: if you do not oppress the stranger, the orphan, and the widow; if you do not shed the blood of the innocent in this place; if you do not follow other gods, to your own hurt—
Transliteration: ger yatvom vealemanah lo taashoku vedam nakiy al-tishefekhu vamakvom hazeh veacharey Elohim acheriym lo telekhu lera lakhem

Hebrew: וְשִׁכַּנְתִּ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ בַּמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה בָּאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לַאֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם לְמִן־עוֹלָ֖ם וְעַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: then only will I let you dwell in this place, in the land that I gave to your ancestors for all time.
Transliteration: veshikhanetiy etekhem vamakvom hazeh vaarets asher natatiy laavvoteykhem lemin-volam vead-volam

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה אַתֶּם֙ בֹּטְחִ֣ים לָכֶ֔ם עַל־דִּבְרֵ֖י הַשָּׁ֑קֶר לְבִלְתִּ֖י הוֹעִֽיל׃
Translated: See, you are relying on illusions that are of no avail.
Transliteration: hineh atem votechiym lakhem al-diverey hashaker leviletiy hvoiyl

Hebrew: הֲגָנֹ֤ב <small>׀</small> רָצֹ֙חַ֙ וְֽנָאֹ֔ף וְהִשָּׁבֵ֥עַ לַשֶּׁ֖קֶר וְקַטֵּ֣ר לַבָּ֑עַל וְהָלֹ֗ךְ אַחֲרֵ֛י אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יְדַעְתֶּֽם׃
Translated: Will you steal and murder and commit adultery and swear falsely, and sacrifice to Baal, and follow other gods whom you have not experienced,
Transliteration: haganov <small></small> ratsocha venaof vehishavea lasheker vekater lavaal vehalokhe acharey Elohim acheriym asher lo-yedaetem

Hebrew: וּבָאתֶ֞ם וַעֲמַדְתֶּ֣ם לְפָנַ֗י בַּבַּ֤יִת הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִקְרָֽא־שְׁמִ֣י עָלָ֔יו וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֖ם נִצַּ֑לְנוּ לְמַ֣עַן עֲשׂ֔וֹת אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַתּוֹעֵב֖וֹת הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: and then come and stand before Me in this House that bears My name and say, “We are safe”?—[Safe] to do all these abhorrent things!
Transliteration: uvatem vaamadetem lefanay vavayiit hazeh asher nikera-shemiy alayv vaamaretem nitsalenu lemaan ashvot et khׇl-hatvoevvot haeleh

Hebrew: הַֽמְעָרַ֣ת פָּרִצִ֗ים הָיָ֨ה הַבַּ֧יִת הַזֶּ֛ה אֲשֶׁר־נִקְרָֽא־שְׁמִ֥י עָלָ֖יו בְּעֵינֵיכֶ֑ם גַּ֧ם אָנֹכִ֛י הִנֵּ֥ה רָאִ֖יתִי נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Do you consider this House, which bears My name, to be a den of thieves? As for Me, I have been watching—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: hamearat faritsiym hayah havayiit hazeh asher-nikera-shemiy alayv veeyneykhem gam anokhiy hineh raiytiy neum-yehovah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לְכוּ־נָ֗א אֶל־מְקוֹמִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּשִׁיל֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֨ר שִׁכַּ֧נְתִּֽי שְׁמִ֛י שָׁ֖ם בָּרִֽאשׁוֹנָ֑ה וּרְאוּ֙ אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֣יתִי ל֔וֹ מִפְּנֵ֕י רָעַ֖ת עַמִּ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Just go to My place at Shiloh, where I had established My name formerly, and see what I did to it because of the wickedness of My people Israel.
Transliteration: khiy lekhu-na el-mekvomiy asher veshiylvo asher shikhanetiy shemiy sham varishvonah ureu et asher-ashiytiy lvo mifeney raat amiy yisherael

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה יַ֧עַן עֲשׂוֹתְכֶ֛ם אֶת־כׇּל־הַמַּעֲשִׂ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וָאֲדַבֵּ֨ר אֲלֵיכֶ֜ם הַשְׁכֵּ֤ם וְדַבֵּר֙ וְלֹ֣א שְׁמַעְתֶּ֔ם וָאֶקְרָ֥א אֶתְכֶ֖ם וְלֹ֥א עֲנִיתֶֽם׃
Translated: And now, because you do all these things—declares G<small>OD</small>—and though I spoke to you persistently, you would not listen; and though I called to you, you would not respond—
Transliteration: veatah yaan ashvotekhem et-khׇl-hamaashiym haeleh neum-yehovah vaadaver aleykhem hashekhem vedaver velo shemaetem vaekera etekhem velo aniytem

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֜יתִי לַבַּ֣יִת ׀ אֲשֶׁ֧ר נִֽקְרָא־שְׁמִ֣י עָלָ֗יו אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתֶּם֙ בֹּטְחִ֣ים בּ֔וֹ וְלַ֨מָּק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תִּי לָכֶ֖ם וְלַאֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֖יתִי לְשִׁלֽוֹ׃
Translated: therefore I will do to the House that bears My name, on which you rely, and to the place that I gave you and your ancestors, just what I did to Shiloh.
Transliteration: veashiytiy lavayiit asher nikera-shemiy alayv asher atem votechiym vvo velamakvom asher-natatiy lakhem velaavvoteykhem khaasher ashiytiy leshilvo

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁלַכְתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵעַ֣ל פָּנָ֑י כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר הִשְׁלַ֙כְתִּי֙ אֶת־כׇּל־אֲחֵיכֶ֔ם אֵ֖ת כׇּל־זֶ֥רַע אֶפְרָֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated: And I will cast you out of My presence as I cast out your kinsfolk, the whole brood of Ephraim.
Transliteration: vehishelakhetiy etekhem meal fanay khaasher hishelakhetiy et-khׇl-acheykhem et khׇl-zera eferayiim {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֞ה אַל־תִּתְפַּלֵּ֣ל ׀ בְּעַד־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֗ה וְאַל־תִּשָּׂ֧א בַעֲדָ֛ם רִנָּ֥ה וּתְפִלָּ֖ה וְאַל־תִּפְגַּע־בִּ֑י כִּֽי־אֵינֶ֥נִּי שֹׁמֵ֖עַ אֹתָֽךְ׃
Translated: As for you, do not pray for this people, do not raise a cry of prayer on their behalf, do not plead with Me; for I will not listen to you.
Transliteration: veatah al-titefalel vead-haam hazeh veal-tisha vaadam rinah utefilah veal-tifega-viy khiy-eyneniy shomea otakhe

Hebrew: הַאֵינְךָ֣ רֹאֶ֔ה מָ֛ה הֵ֥מָּה עֹשִׂ֖ים בְּעָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה וּבְחֻצ֖וֹת יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Don’t you see what they are doing in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
Transliteration: haeynekha roeh mah hemah oshiym vearey yehudah uvechutsvot yerushala͏im

Hebrew: הַבָּנִ֞ים מְלַקְּטִ֣ים עֵצִ֗ים וְהָאָבוֹת֙ מְבַעֲרִ֣ים אֶת־הָאֵ֔שׁ וְהַנָּשִׁ֖ים לָשׁ֣וֹת בָּצֵ֑ק לַעֲשׂ֨וֹת כַּוָּנִ֜ים לִמְלֶ֣כֶת הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם וְהַסֵּ֤ךְ נְסָכִים֙ לֵאלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים לְמַ֖עַן הַכְעִסֵֽנִי׃
Translated: The children gather sticks, the fathers build the fire, and the mothers knead dough, to make cakes for the Queen of Heaven, and they pour libations to other gods, to vex Me.
Transliteration: havaniym melaketiym etsiym vehaavvot mevaariym et-haesh vehanashiym lashvot vatsek laashvot khavaniym limelekhet hashamayiim vehasekhe nesakhiym lelohiym acheriym lemaan hakheiseniy

Hebrew: הַאֹתִ֛י הֵ֥ם מַכְעִסִ֖ים נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה הֲל֣וֹא אֹתָ֔ם לְמַ֖עַן בֹּ֥שֶׁת פְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Is it Me they are vexing?—says G<small>OD</small>. It is rather themselves, to their own disgrace.
Transliteration: haotiy hem makheisiym neum-yehovah halvo otam lemaan voshet feneyhem

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה הִנֵּ֨ה אַפִּ֤י וַחֲמָתִי֙ נִתֶּ֙כֶת֙ אֶל־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה עַל־הָאָדָם֙ וְעַל־הַבְּהֵמָ֔ה וְעַל־עֵ֥ץ הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה וְעַל־פְּרִ֣י הָאֲדָמָ֑ה וּבָעֲרָ֖ה וְלֹ֥א תִכְבֶּֽה׃ {פ}
