Translated: Assuredly, thus said my Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: My wrath and My fury will be poured out upon this place, on human beings and on animals, on the trees of the field and the fruit of the soil. It shall burn, with none to quench it.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar adonay yehovih hineh afiy vachamatiy nitekhet el-hamakvom hazeh al-haadam veal-havehemah veal-ets hashadeh veal-feriy haadamah uvaarah velo tikheveh {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֛ר יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עֹלוֹתֵיכֶ֛ם סְפ֥וּ עַל־זִבְחֵיכֶ֖ם וְאִכְל֥וּ בָשָֽׂר׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: Add your burnt offerings to your other sacrifices and eat the meat!
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael olvoteykhem sefu al-zivecheykhem veikhelu vashar

Hebrew: כִּ֠י לֹֽא־דִבַּ֤רְתִּי אֶת־אֲבֽוֹתֵיכֶם֙ וְלֹ֣א צִוִּיתִ֔ים בְּי֛וֹם (הוציא) [הוֹצִיאִ֥י] אוֹתָ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם עַל־דִּבְרֵ֥י עוֹלָ֖ה וָזָֽבַח׃
Translated: For when I freed your ancestors from the land of Egypt, I did not speak with them or command them concerning burnt offerings or sacrifice.
Transliteration: khiy lo-divaretiy et-avvoteykhem velo tsiviytiym veyvom (hvtsy) [hvotsiyiy] votam meerets mitserayiim al-diverey volah vazavach

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אִֽם־אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַ֠זֶּ֠ה צִוִּ֨יתִי אוֹתָ֤ם לֵאמֹר֙ שִׁמְע֣וּ בְקוֹלִ֔י וְהָיִ֤יתִי לָכֶם֙ לֵֽאלֹהִ֔ים וְאַתֶּ֖ם תִּֽהְיוּ־לִ֣י לְעָ֑ם וַהֲלַכְתֶּ֗ם בְּכׇל־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲצַוֶּ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם לְמַ֖עַן יִיטַ֥ב לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: But this is what I commanded them: Do My bidding, that I may be your God and you may be My people; walk only in the way that I enjoin upon you, that it may go well with you.
Transliteration: khiy im-et-hadavar hazeh tsiviytiy votam lemor shimeu vekvoliy vehayiytiy lakhem lelohiym veatem tiheyu-liy leam vahalakhetem vekhׇl-haderekhe asher atsaveh etekhem lemaan yiytav lakhem

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א שָֽׁמְעוּ֙ וְלֹא־הִטּ֣וּ אֶת־אׇזְנָ֔ם וַיֵּֽלְכוּ֙ בְּמֹ֣עֵצ֔וֹת בִּשְׁרִר֖וּת לִבָּ֣ם הָרָ֑ע וַיִּהְי֥וּ לְאָח֖וֹר וְלֹ֥א לְפָנִֽים׃
Translated: Yet they did not listen or give ear; they followed their own counsels, the willfulness of their evil hearts. They have gone backward, not forward,
Transliteration: velo shameu velo-hitu et-ׇzenam vayelekhu vemoetsvot visherirut livam hara vayiheyu leachvor velo lefaniym

Hebrew: לְמִן־הַיּ֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָצְא֤וּ אֲבֽוֹתֵיכֶם֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וָאֶשְׁלַ֤ח אֲלֵיכֶם֙ אֶת־כׇּל־עֲבָדַ֣י הַנְּבִיאִ֔ים י֖וֹם הַשְׁכֵּ֥ם וְשָׁלֹֽחַ׃
Translated: from the day your ancestors left the land of Egypt until today. And though I kept sending all My servants, the prophets, to them daily and persistently,
Transliteration: lemin-hayyvom asher yatseu avvoteykhem meerets mitserayiim ad hayyvom hazeh vaeshelach aleykhem et-khׇl-avaday haneviyiym yvom hashekhem veshalocha

Hebrew: וְל֤וֹא שָֽׁמְעוּ֙ אֵלַ֔י וְלֹ֥א הִטּ֖וּ אֶת־אׇזְנָ֑ם וַיַּקְשׁוּ֙ אֶת־עׇרְפָּ֔ם הֵרֵ֖עוּ מֵאֲבוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: they would not listen to Me or give ear. They stiffened their necks, they acted worse than their ancestors.
Transliteration: velvo shameu elay velo hitu et-ׇzenam vayakeshu et-ׇrefam hereu meavvotam

Hebrew: וְדִבַּרְתָּ֤ אֲלֵיהֶם֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וְלֹ֥א יִשְׁמְע֖וּ אֵלֶ֑יךָ וְקָרָ֥אתָ אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם וְלֹ֥א יַעֲנֽוּכָה׃
Translated: You shall say all these things to them, but they will not listen to you; you shall call to them, but they will not respond to you.
Transliteration: vedivareta aleyhem et-khׇl-hadevariym haeleh velo yishemeu eleykha vekarata aleyhem velo yaanukhah

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם זֶ֤ה הַגּוֹי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֽוֹא־שָׁמְע֗וּ בְּקוֹל֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֔יו וְלֹ֥א לָקְח֖וּ מוּסָ֑ר אָֽבְדָה֙ הָאֱמוּנָ֔ה וְנִכְרְתָ֖ה מִפִּיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Then say to them: This is the nation that would not obey the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God, that would not accept rebuke. Faithfulness has perished, vanished from their mouths.
Transliteration: veamareta aleyhem zeh hagvoy asher lvo-shameu vekvol yehovah elohayv velo lakechu musar avedah haemunah venikheretah mifiyhem {s}

Hebrew: גׇּזִּ֤י נִזְרֵךְ֙ וְֽהַשְׁלִ֔יכִי וּשְׂאִ֥י עַל־שְׁפָיִ֖ם קִינָ֑ה כִּ֚י מָאַ֣ס יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיִּטֹּ֖שׁ אֶת־דּ֥וֹר עֶבְרָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Shear your locks and cast them away,
Take up a lament on the heights,
For GOD has spurned and cast off
The brood that provoked such wrath.
Transliteration: gׇziy nizerekhe vehasheliykhiy usheiy al-shefayim kiynah khiy maas yehovah vayitosh et-dvor everatvo

Hebrew: כִּי־עָשׂ֨וּ בְנֵי־יְהוּדָ֥ה הָרַ֛ע בְּעֵינַ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה שָׂ֣מוּ שִׁקּוּצֵיהֶ֗ם בַּבַּ֛יִת אֲשֶׁר־נִקְרָֽא־שְׁמִ֥י עָלָ֖יו לְטַמְּאֽוֹ׃
Translated: For the people of Judah have done what displeases Me—declares G<small>OD</small>. They have set up their abominations in the House that is called by My name, and they have defiled it.
Transliteration: khiy-ashu veney-yehudah hara veeynay neum-yehovah shamu shikutseyhem vavayiit asher-nikera-shemiy alayv letamevo

Hebrew: וּבָנ֞וּ בָּמ֣וֹת הַתֹּ֗פֶת אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּגֵ֣יא בֶן־הִנֹּ֔ם לִשְׂרֹ֛ף אֶת־בְּנֵיהֶ֥ם וְאֶת־בְּנֹתֵיהֶ֖ם בָּאֵ֑שׁ אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א צִוִּ֔יתִי וְלֹ֥א עָלְתָ֖ה עַל־לִבִּֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: And they have built the shrines of Topheth in the Valley of Ben-hinnom to burn their sons and daughters in fire—which I never commanded, which never came to My mind.
Transliteration: uvanu vamvot hatofet asher vegey ven-hinom lisherof et-veneyhem veet-venoteyhem vaesh asher lo tsiviytiy velo aletah al-liviy {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן הִנֵּֽה־יָמִ֤ים בָּאִים֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְלֹא־יֵאָמֵ֨ר ע֤וֹד הַתֹּ֙פֶת֙ וְגֵ֣יא בֶן־הִנֹּ֔ם כִּ֖י אִם־גֵּ֣יא הַהֲרֵגָ֑ה וְקָבְר֥וּ בְתֹ֖פֶת מֵאֵ֥ין מָקֽוֹם׃
Translated: Assuredly, a time is coming—declares G<small>OD</small>—when this people shall no longer speak of Topheth or the Valley of Ben-hinnom, but of the Valley of Slaughter; and they shall bury in Topheth until no room is left.
Transliteration: lakhen hineh-yamiym vaiym neum-yehovah velo-eiamer vod hatofet vegey ven-hinom khiy im-gey haharegah vekaveru vetofet meeyn makvom

Hebrew: וְֽהָ֨יְתָ֜ה נִבְלַ֨ת הָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ לְמַֽאֲכָ֔ל לְע֥וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וּלְבֶהֱמַ֣ת הָאָ֑רֶץ וְאֵ֖ין מַחֲרִֽיד׃
Translated: The carcasses of this people shall be food for the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth, with none to frighten them off.
Transliteration: vehayetah nivelat haam hazeh lemaakhal levof hashamayiim ulevehemat haarets veeyn machariyd

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁבַּתִּ֣י ׀ מֵעָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֗ה וּמֵֽחֻצוֹת֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם ק֤וֹל שָׂשׂוֹן֙ וְק֣וֹל שִׂמְחָ֔ה ק֥וֹל חָתָ֖ן וְק֣וֹל כַּלָּ֑ה כִּ֥י לְחׇרְבָּ֖ה תִּהְיֶ֥ה הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: And I will silence in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem the sound of mirth and gladness, the voice of bridegroom and bride. For the whole land shall fall to ruin.
Transliteration: vehishevatiy mearey yehudah umechutsvot yerushala͏im kvol shashvon vekvol shimechah kvol chatan vekvol khalah khiy lechׇrevah tiheyeh haarets

Hebrew: בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֣יא נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֡ה (ויציאו) [יוֹצִ֣יאוּ] אֶת־עַצְמ֣וֹת מַלְכֵי־יְהוּדָ֣ה וְאֶת־עַצְמוֹת־שָׂרָיו֩ וְאֶת־עַצְמ֨וֹת הַכֹּהֲנִ֜ים וְאֵ֣ת ׀ עַצְמ֣וֹת הַנְּבִיאִ֗ים וְאֵ֛ת עַצְמ֥וֹת יוֹשְׁבֵֽי־יְרוּשָׁלָ֖͏ִם מִקִּבְרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: At that time—declares G<small>OD</small>—the bones of the kings of Judah, of its officers, of the priests, of the prophets, and of the inhabitants of Jerusalem shall be taken out of their graves
Transliteration: vaet hahiy neum-yehovah (vytsyv) [yvotsiyu] et-atsemvot malekhey-yehudah veet-atsemvot-sharayv veet-atsemvot hakhohaniym veet atsemvot haneviyiym veet atsemvot yvoshevey-yerushala͏im mikivereyhem

Hebrew: וּשְׁטָחוּם֩ לַשֶּׁ֨מֶשׁ וְלַיָּרֵ֜חַ וּלְכֹ֣ל ׀ צְבָ֣א הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֲהֵב֜וּם וַאֲשֶׁ֤ר עֲבָדוּם֙ וַֽאֲשֶׁר֙ הָלְכ֣וּ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֔ם וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר דְּרָשׁ֔וּם וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר הִֽשְׁתַּחֲו֖וּ לָהֶ֑ם לֹ֤א יֵאָֽסְפוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א יִקָּבֵ֔רוּ לְדֹ֛מֶן עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָ֖ה יִהְיֽוּ׃
Translated: and exposed to the sun, the moon, and all the host of heaven that they loved and served and followed, to which they turned and bowed down. They shall not be gathered for reburial; they shall become dung upon the face of the earth.
Transliteration: ushetachum lashemesh velayarecha ulekhol tseva hashamayiim asher ahevum vaasher avadum vaasher halekhu achareyhem vaasher derashum vaasher hishetachavu lahem lo eiasefu velo yikaveru ledomen al-feney haadamah yiheyu

Hebrew: וְנִבְחַ֥ר מָ֙וֶת֙ מֵחַיִּ֔ים לְכֹ֗ל הַשְּׁאֵרִית֙ הַנִּשְׁאָרִ֔ים מִן־הַמִּשְׁפָּחָ֥ה הָרָעָ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את בְּכׇל־הַמְּקֹמ֤וֹת הַנִּשְׁאָרִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִדַּחְתִּ֣ים שָׁ֔ם נְאֻ֖ם יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: And death shall be preferable to life for all that are left of this wicked folk, in all the other places to which I shall banish them—declares G<small>OD</small> of Hosts.
Transliteration: venivechar mavet mechayiym lekhol hasheeriyt hanisheariym min-hamishefachah haraah hazot vekhׇl-hamekomvot hanisheariym asher hidachetiym sham neum yehovah tsevavot {s}

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הֲיִפְּל֖וּ וְלֹ֣א יָק֑וּמוּ אִם־יָשׁ֖וּב וְלֹ֥א יָשֽׁוּב׃
Translated:
Say to them: Thus said GOD:
When people fall, do they not get up again?
If they turn aside, do they not turn back?
Transliteration: veamareta aleyhem khoh amar yehovah hayifelu velo yakumu im-yashuv velo yashuv

Hebrew: מַדּ֨וּעַ שׁוֹבְבָ֜ה הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֛ה יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם מְשֻׁבָ֣ה נִצַּ֑חַת הֶחֱזִ֙יקוּ֙ בַּתַּרְמִ֔ת מֵאֲנ֖וּ לָשֽׁוּב׃
Translated:
Why is this people—Jerusalem—rebellious
With a persistent rebellion?
They cling to deceit,
They refuse to return.
Transliteration: madua shvovevah haam hazeh yerushala͏im meshuvah nitsachat hecheziyku vataremit meanu lashuv

Hebrew: הִקְשַׁ֤בְתִּי וָֽאֶשְׁמָע֙ לוֹא־כֵ֣ן יְדַבֵּ֔רוּ אֵ֣ין אִ֗ישׁ נִחָם֙ עַל־רָ֣עָת֔וֹ לֵאמֹ֖ר מֶ֣ה עָשִׂ֑יתִי כֻּלֹּ֗ה שָׁ֚ב (במרצותם) [בִּמְר֣וּצָתָ֔ם] כְּס֥וּס שׁוֹטֵ֖ף בַּמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
I have listened and heard:
They do not speak honestly.
No one regrets their own wickedness
And says, “What have I done!”
They all persist in their wayward course
Like a steed dashing forward in the fray.
Transliteration: hikeshavetiy vaeshema lvo-khen yedaveru eyn iysh nicham al-raatvo lemor meh ashiytiy khuloh shav (vmrtsvtm) [vimerutsatam] khesus shvotef vamilechamah

Hebrew: גַּם־חֲסִידָ֣ה בַשָּׁמַ֗יִם יָֽדְעָה֙ מוֹעֲדֶ֔יהָ וְתֹ֤ר (וסוס) [וְסִיס֙] וְעָג֔וּר שָׁמְר֖וּ אֶת־עֵ֣ת בֹּאָ֑נָה וְעַמִּ֕י לֹ֣א יָדְע֔וּ אֵ֖ת מִשְׁפַּ֥ט יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Even the stork in the sky knows its seasons,
And the turtledove, swift, and crane
Keep the time of their coming;
But My people pay no heed
To GOD’s law.
Transliteration: gam-chasiydah vashamayiim yadeah mvoadeyha vetor (vsvs) [vesiys] veagur shameru et-et voanah veamiy lo yadeu et mishefat yehovah

Hebrew: אֵיכָ֤ה תֹֽאמְרוּ֙ חֲכָמִ֣ים אֲנַ֔חְנוּ וְתוֹרַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה אִתָּ֑נוּ אָכֵן֙ הִנֵּ֣ה לַשֶּׁ֣קֶר עָשָׂ֔ה עֵ֖ט שֶׁ֥קֶר סֹפְרִֽים׃
Translated:
How can you say, “We are wise,
And we possess GOD’s Instruction”?
Assuredly, for naught has the pen labored,
For naught the scribes!
Transliteration: eykhah tomeru chakhamiym anachenu vetvorat yehovah itanu akhen hineh lasheker ashah et sheker soferiym

Hebrew: הֹבִ֣שׁוּ חֲכָמִ֔ים חַ֖תּוּ וַיִּלָּכֵ֑דוּ הִנֵּ֤ה בִדְבַר־יְהֹוָה֙ מָאָ֔סוּ וְחׇכְמַ֥ת מֶ֖ה לָהֶֽם׃
Translated:
The wise men shall be put to shame,
Shall be dismayed and caught;
See, they reject the word of GOD,
So their wisdom amounts to nothing.
Transliteration: hovishu chakhamiym chatu vayilakhedu hineh videvar-yehovah maasu vechׇkhemat meh lahem

Hebrew: לָכֵן֩ אֶתֵּ֨ן אֶת־נְשֵׁיהֶ֜ם לַאֲחֵרִ֗ים שְׂדֽוֹתֵיהֶם֙ לְי֣וֹרְשִׁ֔ים כִּ֤י מִקָּטֹן֙ וְעַד־גָּד֔וֹל כֻּלֹּ֖ה בֹּצֵ֣עַ בָּ֑צַע מִנָּבִיא֙ וְעַד־כֹּהֵ֔ן כֻּלֹּ֖ה עֹ֥שֶׂה שָּֽׁקֶר׃
Translated:
Assuredly, I will give their wives to others,
And their fields to dispossessors;
For from the smallest to the greatest,
They are all greedy for gain;
Priest and prophet alike,
They all act falsely.
Transliteration: lakhen eten et-nesheyhem laacheriym shedvoteyhem leyvoreshiym khiy mikaton vead-gadvol khuloh votsea vatsa minaviy vead-khohen khuloh osheh shaker

Hebrew: וַיְרַפּ֞וּ אֶת־שֶׁ֤בֶר בַּת־עַמִּי֙ עַל־נְקַלָּ֔ה לֵאמֹ֖ר שָׁל֣וֹם <small>׀</small> שָׁל֑וֹם וְאֵ֖ין שָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated:
They offer healing offhand
For the wounds of My poor people,
Saying, “All is well, all is well,”
When nothing is well.
Transliteration: vayerafu et-shever vat-amiy al-nekalah lemor shalvom <small></small> shalvom veeyn shalvom

Hebrew: הֹבִ֕שׁוּ כִּ֥י תוֹעֵבָ֖ה עָשׂ֑וּ גַּם־בּ֣וֹשׁ לֹֽא־יֵבֹ֗שׁוּ וְהִכָּלֵם֙ לֹ֣א יָדָ֔עוּ לָכֵ֞ן יִפְּל֣וּ בַנֹּפְלִ֗ים בְּעֵ֧ת פְּקֻדָּתָ֛ם יִכָּשְׁל֖וּ אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
They have acted shamefully;
They have done abhorrent things—
Yet they do not feel shame,
They cannot be made to blush.
Assuredly, they shall fall among the falling,
They shall stumble at the time of their doom
—said GOD.
Transliteration: hovishu khiy tvoevah ashu gam-vvosh lo-eivoshu vehikhalem lo yadau lakhen yifelu vanofeliym veet fekudatam yikhashelu amar yehovah {f}

Hebrew: אָסֹ֥ף אֲסִיפֵ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה אֵין֩ עֲנָבִ֨ים בַּגֶּ֜פֶן וְאֵ֧ין תְּאֵנִ֣ים בַּתְּאֵנָ֗ה וְהֶעָלֶה֙ נָבֵ֔ל וָאֶתֵּ֥ן לָהֶ֖ם יַעַבְרֽוּם׃
Translated:
I will make an end of them
—declares GOD:
No grapes left on the vine,
No figs on the fig tree,
The leaves all withered;
Whatever I have given them is gone.
Transliteration: asof asiyfem neum-yehovah eyn anaviym vagefen veeyn teeniym vateenah vehealeh navel vaeten lahem yaaverum

Hebrew: עַל־מָה֙ אֲנַ֣חְנוּ יֹֽשְׁבִ֔ים הֵאָסְפ֗וּ וְנָב֛וֹא אֶל־עָרֵ֥י הַמִּבְצָ֖ר וְנִדְּמָה־שָּׁ֑ם כִּי֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֵ֤ינוּ הֲדִמָּ֙נוּ֙ וַיַּשְׁקֵ֣נוּ מֵי־רֹ֔אשׁ כִּ֥י חָטָ֖אנוּ לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Why are we sitting by?
Let us gather into the fortified cities
And meet our doom there.
For the ETERNAL our God has doomed us—
And has made us drink a bitter draft,
Because we sinned against GOD.
Transliteration: al-mah anachenu yosheviym heasefu venavvo el-arey hamivetsar venidemah-sham khiy yehovah eloheynu hadimanu vayashekenu mey-rosh khiy chatanu layhovah

Hebrew: קַוֵּ֥ה לְשָׁל֖וֹם וְאֵ֣ין ט֑וֹב לְעֵ֥ת מַרְפֵּ֖ה וְהִנֵּ֥ה בְעָתָֽה׃
Translated:
We hoped for good fortune, but no happiness came;
For a time of relief—instead there is terror!
Transliteration: kaveh leshalvom veeyn tvov leet marefeh vehineh veatah

Hebrew: מִדָּ֤ן נִשְׁמַע֙ נַחְרַ֣ת סוּסָ֔יו מִקּוֹל֙ מִצְהֲל֣וֹת אַבִּירָ֔יו רָעֲשָׁ֖ה כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיָּב֗וֹאוּ וַיֹּֽאכְלוּ֙ אֶ֣רֶץ וּמְלוֹאָ֔הּ עִ֖יר וְיֹ֥שְׁבֵי בָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
The snorting of their horses was heard from Dan;
At the loud neighing of their steeds
The whole land quaked.
They came and devoured the land and what was in it,
The towns and those who dwelt in them.
Transliteration: midan nishema nacherat susayv mikvol mitsehalvot aviyrayv raashah khׇl-haarets vayavvou vayokhelu erets umelvoah iyr veyoshevey vah {f}

Hebrew: כִּי֩ הִנְנִ֨י מְשַׁלֵּ֜חַ בָּכֶ֗ם נְחָשִׁים֙ צִפְעֹנִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵין־לָהֶ֖ם לָ֑חַשׁ וְנִשְּׁכ֥וּ אֶתְכֶ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Lo, I will send serpents against you,
Adders that cannot be charmed,
And they shall bite you
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: khiy hineniy meshalecha vakhem nechashiym tsifeoniym asher eyn-lahem lachash venishekhu etekhem neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: מַבְלִ֥יגִיתִ֖י עֲלֵ֣י יָג֑וֹן עָלַ֖י לִבִּ֥י דַוָּֽי׃
Translated:
When in grief I would seek comfort,
My heart is sick within me.
Transliteration: maveliygiytiy aley yagvon alay liviy davay

Hebrew: הִנֵּה־ק֞וֹל שַֽׁוְעַ֣ת בַּת־עַמִּ֗י מֵאֶ֙רֶץ֙ מַרְחַקִּ֔ים הַֽיהֹוָה֙ אֵ֣ין בְּצִיּ֔וֹן אִם־מַלְכָּ֖הּ אֵ֣ין בָּ֑הּ מַדּ֗וּעַ הִכְעִס֛וּנִי בִּפְסִלֵיהֶ֖ם בְּהַבְלֵ֥י נֵכָֽר׃
Translated:
“Is not GOD in Zion?
Is not her Sovereign in her midst?
Why then did they anger Me with their images,
With alien futilities?”
Hark! The outcry of my poor people
From the land far and wide:
Transliteration: hineh-kvol shaveat vat-amiy meerets marechakiym hayhovah eyn vetsiyyvon im-malekhah eyn vah madua hikheisuniy vifesileyhem vehaveley nekhar

Hebrew: עָבַ֥ר קָצִ֖יר כָּ֣לָה קָ֑יִץ וַאֲנַ֖חְנוּ ל֥וֹא נוֹשָֽׁעְנוּ׃
Translated:
“Harvest is past,
Summer is gone,
But we have not been saved.”
Transliteration: avar katsiyr khalah kayiits vaanachenu lvo nvoshaenu

Hebrew: עַל־שֶׁ֥בֶר בַּת־עַמִּ֖י הׇשְׁבָּ֑רְתִּי קָדַ֕רְתִּי שַׁמָּ֖ה הֶחֱזִקָֽתְנִי׃
Translated:
Because my people is shattered I am shattered;
I am dejected, seized by desolation.
Transliteration: al-shever vat-amiy hׇshevaretiy kadaretiy shamah hechezikateniy

Hebrew: הַצֳּרִי֙ אֵ֣ין בְּגִלְעָ֔ד אִם־רֹפֵ֖א אֵ֣ין שָׁ֑ם כִּ֗י מַדּ֙וּעַ֙ לֹ֣א עָֽלְתָ֔ה אֲרֻכַ֖ת בַּת־עַמִּֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
Is there no balm in Gilead?
Can no physician be found?
Why has healing not yet
Come to my poor people?
Transliteration: hatsoriy eyn vegilead im-rofe eyn sham khiy madua lo aletah arukhat vat-amiy {s}

Hebrew: מִֽי־יִתֵּ֤ן רֹאשִׁי֙ מַ֔יִם וְעֵינִ֖י מְק֣וֹר דִּמְעָ֑ה וְאֶבְכֶּה֙ יוֹמָ֣ם וָלַ֔יְלָה אֵ֖ת חַֽלְלֵ֥י בַת־עַמִּֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
Oh, that my head were water,
My eyes a fount of tears!
Then would I weep day and night
For the slain of my poor people.
Transliteration: miy-yiten roshiy mayiim veeyniy mekvor dimeah veevekheh yvomam valayelah et chaleley vat-amiy {s}

Hebrew: מִֽי־יִתְּנֵ֣נִי בַמִּדְבָּ֗ר מְלוֹן֙ אֹֽרְחִ֔ים וְאֶֽעֶזְבָה֙ אֶת־עַמִּ֔י וְאֵלְכָ֖ה מֵאִתָּ֑ם כִּ֤י כֻלָּם֙ מְנָ֣אֲפִ֔ים עֲצֶ֖רֶת בֹּגְדִֽים׃
Translated:
Oh, to be in the desert,
At an encampment for wayfarers!
Oh, to leave my people,
To go away from them—
For they are all adulterers,
A band of rogues.
Transliteration: miy-yiteneniy vamidevar melvon orechiym veeezevah et-amiy veelekhah meitam khiy khulam menaafiym atseret vogediym

Hebrew: וַֽיַּדְרְכ֤וּ אֶת־לְשׁוֹנָם֙ קַשְׁתָּ֣ם שֶׁ֔קֶר וְלֹ֥א לֶאֱמוּנָ֖ה גָּבְר֣וּ בָאָ֑רֶץ כִּי֩ מֵרָעָ֨ה אֶל־רָעָ֧ה <small>׀</small> יָצָ֛אוּ וְאֹתִ֥י לֹא־יָדָ֖עוּ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
They bend their tongues like bows;
They are valorous in the land
For treachery, not for honesty;
They advance from evil to evil.
And they do not heed Me
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: vayaderekhu et-leshvonam kashetam sheker velo leemunah gaveru vaarets khiy meraah el-raah <small></small> yatsau veotiy lo-yadau neum-yehovah

Hebrew: אִ֤ישׁ מֵרֵעֵ֙הוּ֙ הִשָּׁמֵ֔רוּ וְעַל־כׇּל־אָ֖ח אַל־תִּבְטָ֑חוּ כִּ֤י כׇל־אָח֙ עָק֣וֹב יַעְקֹ֔ב וְכׇל־רֵ֖עַ רָכִ֥יל יַהֲלֹֽךְ׃
Translated:
Each of you, beware of your friend!
Trust not even your kinsfolk!
For every sibling takes advantage,
Every friend deals basely.
Transliteration: iysh mereehu hishameru veal-khׇl-ach al-tivetachu khiy khׇl-ach akvov yaekov vekhׇl-rea rakhiyl yahalokhe

Hebrew: וְאִ֤ישׁ בְּרֵעֵ֙הוּ֙ יְהָתֵ֔לּוּ וֶאֱמֶ֖ת לֹ֣א יְדַבֵּ֑רוּ לִמְּד֧וּ לְשׁוֹנָ֛ם דַּבֶּר־שֶׁ֖קֶר הַעֲוֵ֥ה נִלְאֽוּ׃
Translated:
They all cheat each other,
They will not speak truth;
They have trained their tongues to speak falsely;
They wear themselves out working iniquity.
Transliteration: veiysh vereehu yehatelu veemet lo yedaveru limedu leshvonam daver-sheker haaveh nileu

Hebrew: שִׁבְתְּךָ֖ בְּת֣וֹךְ מִרְמָ֑ה בְּמִרְמָ֛ה מֵאֲנ֥וּ דַעַת־אוֹתִ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
You dwell in the midst of deceit.
In their deceit, they refuse to heed Me
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: shivetekha vetvokhe miremah vemiremah meanu daat-votiy neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת הִנְנִ֥י צוֹרְפָ֖ם וּבְחַנְתִּ֑ים כִּי־אֵ֣יךְ אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֔ה מִפְּנֵ֖י בַּת־עַמִּֽי׃
Translated:
Assuredly, thus said GOD of Hosts:
Lo, I shall smelt and assay them—
For what else can I do because of My poor people?
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar yehovah tsevavot hineniy tsvorefam uvechanetiym khiy-eykhe eesheh mifeney vat-amiy

Hebrew: חֵ֥ץ (שוחט) [שָׁח֛וּט] לְשׁוֹנָ֖ם מִרְמָ֣ה דִבֵּ֑ר בְּפִ֗יו שָׁל֤וֹם אֶת־רֵעֵ֙הוּ֙ יְדַבֵּ֔ר וּבְקִרְבּ֖וֹ יָשִׂ֥ים אׇרְבּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Their tongue is a sharpened arrow,
They use their mouths to deceive.
They speak to their fellows in friendship,
But lay an ambush for them in their hearts.
Transliteration: chets (shvcht) [shachut] leshvonam miremah diver vefiyv shalvom et-reehu yedaver uvekirevvo yashiym ׇrevvo

Hebrew: הַעַל־אֵ֥לֶּה לֹא־אֶפְקׇד־בָּ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה אִ֚ם בְּג֣וֹי אֲשֶׁר־כָּזֶ֔ה לֹ֥א תִתְנַקֵּ֖ם נַפְשִֽׁי׃ {ס}
Translated:
Shall I not punish them for such deeds?
—says GOD—
Shall I not bring retribution
On such a nation as this?
Transliteration: haal-eleh lo-efekׇd-vam neum-yehovah im vegvoy asher-khazeh lo titenakem nafeshiy {s}

Hebrew: עַל־הֶ֨הָרִ֜ים אֶשָּׂ֧א בְכִ֣י וָנֶ֗הִי וְעַל־נְא֤וֹת מִדְבָּר֙ קִינָ֔ה כִּ֤י נִצְּתוּ֙ מִבְּלִי־אִ֣ישׁ עֹבֵ֔ר וְלֹ֥א שָׁמְע֖וּ ק֣וֹל מִקְנֶ֑ה מֵע֤וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ וְעַד־בְּהֵמָ֔ה נָדְד֖וּ הָלָֽכוּ׃
Translated:
For the mountains I take up weeping and wailing,
For the pastures in the wilderness, a dirge.
They are laid waste; nobody passes through,
And no sound of cattle is heard.
Birds of the sky and beasts as well
Have fled and are gone.
Transliteration: al-hehariym esha vekhiy vanehiy veal-nevot midevar kiynah khiy nitsetu miveliy-iysh over velo shameu kvol mikeneh mevof hashamayiim vead-vehemah nadedu halakhu

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֧י אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלַ֛͏ִם לְגַלִּ֖ים מְע֣וֹן תַּנִּ֑ים וְאֶת־עָרֵ֧י יְהוּדָ֛ה אֶתֵּ֥ן שְׁמָמָ֖ה מִבְּלִ֥י יוֹשֵֽׁב׃ {ס}
Translated:
I will turn Jerusalem into rubble,
Into dens for jackals;
And I will make the towns of Judah
A desolation without inhabitants.
Transliteration: venatatiy et-yerushala͏im legaliym mevon taniym veet-arey yehudah eten shemamah miveliy yvoshev {s}

Hebrew: מִֽי־הָאִ֤ישׁ הֶחָכָם֙ וְיָבֵ֣ן אֶת־זֹ֔את וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר פִּֽי־יְהֹוָ֛ה אֵלָ֖יו וְיַגִּדָ֑הּ עַל־מָה֙ אָבְדָ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ נִצְּתָ֥ה כַמִּדְבָּ֖ר מִבְּלִ֥י עֹבֵֽר׃ {ס}
Translated:
Is anybody so wise
As to understand this?
To whom has GOD’s mouth spoken,
So that it can be related:
Why is the land in ruins,
Laid waste like a wilderness,
With none passing through?
Transliteration: miy-haiysh hechakham veyaven et-zot vaasher diver fiy-yehovah elayv veyagidah al-mah avedah haarets nitsetah khamidevar miveliy over {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־עׇזְבָם֙ אֶת־תּ֣וֹרָתִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לִפְנֵיהֶ֑ם וְלֹא־שָׁמְע֥וּ בְקוֹלִ֖י וְלֹא־הָ֥לְכוּ בָֽהּ׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> replied: Because they forsook the Teaching I had set before them. They did not obey Me and they did not follow it,
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah al-ׇzevam et-tvoratiy asher natatiy lifeneyhem velo-shameu vekvoliy velo-halekhu vah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לְכ֔וּ אַחֲרֵ֖י שְׁרִר֣וּת לִבָּ֑ם וְאַֽחֲרֵי֙ הַבְּעָלִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לִמְּד֖וּם אֲבוֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: but followed their own willful heart and followed the Baalim, as their ancestors had taught them.
Transliteration: vayelekhu acharey sherirut livam veacharey havealiym asher limedum avvotam {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הִנְנִ֧י מַאֲכִילָ֛ם אֶת־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה לַעֲנָ֑ה וְהִשְׁקִיתִ֖ים מֵי־רֹֽאשׁ׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to feed that people wormwood and make them drink a bitter draft.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael hineniy maakhiylam et-haam hazeh laanah vehishekiytiym mey-rosh

Hebrew: וַהֲפִֽצוֹתִים֙ בַּגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א יָדְע֔וּ הֵ֖מָּה וַאֲבוֹתָ֑ם וְשִׁלַּחְתִּ֤י אַֽחֲרֵיהֶם֙ אֶת־הַחֶ֔רֶב עַ֥ד כַּלּוֹתִ֖י אוֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: I will scatter them among nations that they and their ancestors never knew; and I will dispatch the sword after them until I have consumed them.
Transliteration: vahafitsvotiym vagvoyim asher lo yadeu hemah vaavvotam veshilachetiy achareyhem et-hacherev ad khalvotiy votam {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת הִתְבּ֥וֹנְנ֛וּ וְקִרְא֥וּ לַמְקוֹנְנ֖וֹת וּתְבוֹאֶ֑ינָה וְאֶל־הַחֲכָמ֥וֹת שִׁלְח֖וּ וְתָבֽוֹאנָה׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD of Hosts:
Listen!
Summon the dirge-singers, let them come;
Send for the skilled women, let them come.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah tsevavot hitevvonenu vekireu lamekvonenvot utevvoeynah veel-hachakhamvot shilechu vetavvonah

Hebrew: וּתְמַהֵ֕רְנָה וְתִשֶּׂ֥נָה עָלֵ֖ינוּ נֶ֑הִי וְתֵרַ֤דְנָה עֵינֵ֙ינוּ֙ דִּמְעָ֔ה וְעַפְעַפֵּ֖ינוּ יִזְּלוּ־מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Let them quickly start a wailing for us,
That our eyes may run with tears,
Our pupils flow with water.
Transliteration: utemaherenah vetishenah aleynu nehiy veteradenah eyneynu dimeah veafeafeynu yizelu-mayiim

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ק֥וֹל נְהִ֛י נִשְׁמַ֥ע מִצִּיּ֖וֹן אֵ֣יךְ שֻׁדָּ֑דְנוּ בֹּ֤שְׁנֽוּ מְאֹד֙ כִּֽי־עָזַ֣בְנוּ אָ֔רֶץ כִּ֥י הִשְׁלִ֖יכוּ מִשְׁכְּנוֹתֵֽינוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
For the sound of wailing
Is heard from Zion:
How we are despoiled!
How greatly we are shamed!
Ah, we must leave our land,
Abandon our dwellings!
Transliteration: khiy kvol nehiy nishema mitsiyyvon eykhe shudadenu voshenu meod khiy-azavenu arets khiy hisheliykhu mishekhenvoteynu {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־שְׁמַ֤עְנָה נָשִׁים֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְתִקַּ֥ח אׇזְנְכֶ֖ם דְּבַר־פִּ֑יו וְלַמֵּ֤דְנָה בְנֽוֹתֵיכֶם֙ נֶ֔הִי וְאִשָּׁ֥ה רְעוּתָ֖הּ קִינָֽה׃
Translated:
Hear, O women, the word of GOD,
Let your ears receive the divine word,
And teach your daughters wailing,
And one another lamentation.
Transliteration: khiy-shemaenah nashiym devar-yehovah vetikach ׇzenekhem devar-fiyv velamedenah venvoteykhem nehiy veishah reutah kiynah

Hebrew: כִּי־עָ֤לָֽה מָ֙וֶת֙ בְּחַלּוֹנֵ֔ינוּ בָּ֖א בְּאַרְמְנוֹתֵ֑ינוּ לְהַכְרִ֤ית עוֹלָל֙ מִח֔וּץ בַּחוּרִ֖ים מֵרְחֹבֽוֹת׃
Translated:
For death has climbed through our windows,
Has entered our fortresses,
To cut off babes from the streets,
Young men from the squares.
Transliteration: khiy-alah mavet vechalvoneynu va vearemenvoteynu lehakheriyt volal michuts vachuriym merechovvot

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֗ר כֹּ֚ה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְנָֽפְלָה֙ נִבְלַ֣ת הָאָדָ֔ם כְּדֹ֖מֶן עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה וּכְעָמִ֛יר מֵאַחֲרֵ֥י הַקֹּצֵ֖ר וְאֵ֥ין מְאַסֵּֽף׃ {ס}
Translated:
Speak thus—says GOD:
People’s carcasses shall lie
Like dung upon the fields,
Like sheaves behind the reaper,
With none to pick them up.
Transliteration: daver khoh neum-yehovah venafelah nivelat haadam khedomen al-feney hashadeh ukheamiyr meacharey hakotser veeyn measef {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אַל־יִתְהַלֵּ֤ל חָכָם֙ בְּחׇכְמָת֔וֹ וְאַל־יִתְהַלֵּ֥ל הַגִּבּ֖וֹר בִּגְבוּרָת֑וֹ אַל־יִתְהַלֵּ֥ל עָשִׁ֖יר בְּעׇשְׁרֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
Let not the wise glory in their wisdom;
Let not the strong glory in their strength;
Let not the rich glory in their riches.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah al-yitehalel chakham vechׇkhematvo veal-yitehalel hagivvor vigevuratvo al-yitehalel ashiyr veׇshervo

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־בְּזֹ֞את יִתְהַלֵּ֣ל הַמִּתְהַלֵּ֗ל הַשְׂכֵּל֮ וְיָדֹ֣עַ אוֹתִי֒ כִּ֚י אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה עֹ֥שֶׂה חֶ֛סֶד מִשְׁפָּ֥ט וּצְדָקָ֖ה בָּאָ֑רֶץ כִּֽי־בְאֵ֥לֶּה חָפַ֖צְתִּי נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
But only in this should one glory:
In being earnestly devoted to Me.
For I GOD act with kindness,
Justice, and equity in the world;
For in these I delight
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: khiy im-vezot yitehalel hamitehalel hashekhel veyadoa votiy khiy aniy yehovah osheh chesed mishefat utsedakah vaarets khiy-veeleh chafatsetiy neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֛ה יָמִ֥ים בָּאִ֖ים נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וּפָ֣קַדְתִּ֔י עַל־כׇּל־מ֖וּל בְּעׇרְלָֽה׃
Translated: Lo, days are coming—declares G<small>OD</small>—when I will take note of everyone circumcised in the foreskin:
Transliteration: hineh yamiym vaiym neum-yehovah ufakadetiy al-khׇl-mul veׇrelah

Hebrew: עַל־מִצְרַ֣יִם וְעַל־יְהוּדָ֗ה וְעַל־אֱד֞וֹם וְעַל־בְּנֵ֤י עַמּוֹן֙ וְעַל־מוֹאָ֔ב וְעַל֙ כׇּל־קְצוּצֵ֣י פֵאָ֔ה הַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר כִּ֤י כׇל־הַגּוֹיִם֙ עֲרֵלִ֔ים וְכׇל־בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַרְלֵי־לֵֽב׃ {פ}
Translated: of Egypt, Judah, Edom, the Ammonites, Moab, and all the desert dwellers who have the hair of their temples clipped. For all these nations are uncircumcised, but all the House of Israel are uncircumcised of heart.
Transliteration: al-mitserayiim veal-yehudah veal-edvom veal-veney amvon veal-mvoav veal khׇl-ketsutsey feah hayosheviym vamidevar khiy khׇl-hagvoyim areliym vekhׇl-veyt yisherael areley-lev {f}

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֣וּ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Hear the word that GOD has spoken to you, O House of Israel!
Transliteration: shimeu et-hadavar asher diver yehovah aleykhem veyt yisherael

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶל־דֶּ֤רֶךְ הַגּוֹיִם֙ אַל־תִּלְמָ֔דוּ וּמֵאֹת֥וֹת הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם אַל־תֵּחָ֑תּוּ כִּי־יֵחַ֥תּוּ הַגּוֹיִ֖ם מֵהֵֽמָּה׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
Do not learn to go the way of the nations,
And do not be dismayed by portents in the sky;
Let the nations be dismayed by them!
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah el-derekhe hagvoyim al-tilemadu umeotvot hashamayiim al-techatu khiy-eichatu hagvoyim mehemah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־חֻקּ֥וֹת הָעַמִּ֖ים הֶ֣בֶל ה֑וּא כִּי־עֵץ֙ מִיַּ֣עַר כְּרָת֔וֹ מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יְדֵי־חָרָ֖שׁ בַּֽמַּעֲצָֽד׃
Translated:
For the laws of the nations are delusions:
For it is the work of a craftsman’s hands.
He cuts down a tree in the forest with an ax,
Transliteration: khiy-chukvot haamiym hevel hu khiy-ets miyaar kheratvo maasheh yedey-charash vamaatsad

Hebrew: בְּכֶ֥סֶף וּבְזָהָ֖ב יְיַפֵּ֑הוּ בְּמַסְמְר֧וֹת וּבְמַקָּב֛וֹת יְחַזְּק֖וּם וְל֥וֹא יָפִֽיק׃
Translated:
He adorns it with silver and gold,
He fastens it with nails and hammer,
So that it does not totter.
Transliteration: vekhesef uvezahav yeyafehu vemasemervot uvemakavvot yechazekum velvo yafiyk

Hebrew: כְּתֹ֨מֶר מִקְשָׁ֥ה הֵ֙מָּה֙ וְלֹ֣א יְדַבֵּ֔רוּ נָשׂ֥וֹא יִנָּשׂ֖וּא כִּ֣י לֹ֣א יִצְעָ֑דוּ אַל־תִּֽירְא֤וּ מֵהֶם֙ כִּי־לֹ֣א יָרֵ֔עוּ וְגַם־הֵיטֵ֖יב אֵ֥ין אוֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
They are like a scarecrow in a cucumber patch,
They cannot speak.
They have to be carried,
For they cannot walk.
Be not afraid of them, for they can do no harm;
Nor is it in them to do any good.
Transliteration: khetomer mikeshah hemah velo yedaveru nashvo yinashu khiy lo yitseadu al-tiyreu mehem khiy-lo yareu vegam-heyteyv eyn votam {f}

Hebrew: מֵאֵ֥ין כָּמ֖וֹךָ יְהֹוָ֑ה גָּד֥וֹל אַתָּ֛ה וְגָד֥וֹל שִׁמְךָ֖ בִּגְבוּרָֽה׃
Translated:
O ETERNAL One, there is none like You!
You are great and Your name is great in power.
Transliteration: meeyn khamvokha yehovah gadvol atah vegadvol shimekha vigevurah

Hebrew: מִ֣י לֹ֤א יִרָֽאֲךָ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ הַגּוֹיִ֔ם כִּ֥י לְךָ֖ יָאָ֑תָה כִּ֣י בְכׇל־חַכְמֵ֧י הַגּוֹיִ֛ם וּבְכׇל־מַלְכוּתָ֖ם מֵאֵ֥ין כָּמֽוֹךָ׃
Translated:
Who would not revere You, O Sovereign of the nations?
For that is Your due,
Since among all the wise of the nations
And among all their royalty
There is none like You.
Transliteration: miy lo yiraakha melekhe hagvoyim khiy lekha yaatah khiy vekhׇl-chakhemey hagvoyim uvekhׇl-malekhutam meeyn khamvokha

Hebrew: וּבְאַחַ֖ת יִבְעֲר֣וּ וְיִכְסָ֑לוּ מוּסַ֥ר הֲבָלִ֖ים עֵ֥ץ הֽוּא׃
Translated:
But they are both dull and foolish;
[Their] doctrine is but delusion;
It is a piece of wood,
Transliteration: uveachat yivearu veyikhesalu musar havaliym ets hu

Hebrew: כֶּ֣סֶף מְרֻקָּ֞ע מִתַּרְשִׁ֣ישׁ יוּבָ֗א וְזָהָב֙ מֵֽאוּפָ֔ז מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חָרָ֖שׁ וִידֵ֣י צוֹרֵ֑ף תְּכֵ֤לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָן֙ לְבוּשָׁ֔ם מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֲכָמִ֖ים כֻּלָּֽם׃
Translated:
Silver beaten flat, that is brought from Tarshish,
And gold from Uphaz,
The work of a craftsman and the goldsmith’s hands;
Their clothing is blue and purple,
All of them are the product of skilled workers.
Transliteration: khesef meruka mitareshiysh yuva vezahav meufaz maasheh charash viydey tsvoref tekhelet vearegaman levusham maasheh chakhamiym khulam

Hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהִים֙ אֱמֶ֔ת הֽוּא־אֱלֹהִ֥ים חַיִּ֖ים וּמֶ֣לֶךְ עוֹלָ֑ם מִקִּצְפּוֹ֙ תִּרְעַ֣שׁ הָאָ֔רֶץ וְלֹא־יָכִ֥לוּ גוֹיִ֖ם זַעְמֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
But the ETERNAL is truly God—
A living God,
The everlasting Sovereign.
At God’s wrath, the earth quakes,
And nations cannot endure such rage.
Transliteration: vayhovah Elohim emet hu-Elohim chayiym umelekhe volam mikitsefvo tireash haarets velo-yakhilu gvoyim zaemvo {f}

Hebrew: כִּדְנָה֙ תֵּאמְר֣וּן לְה֔וֹם אֱלָ֣הַיָּ֔א דִּֽי־שְׁמַיָּ֥א וְאַרְקָ֖א לָ֣א עֲבַ֑דוּ יֵאבַ֧דוּ מֵאַרְעָ֛א וּמִן־תְּח֥וֹת שְׁמַיָּ֖א אֵֽלֶּה׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus shall you say to them: Let the gods, who did not make heaven and earth, perish from the earth and from under these heavens.
Transliteration: khidenah temerun lehvom elahaya diy-shemaya veareka la avadu eivadu mearea umin-techvot shemaya eleh {s}

Hebrew: עֹשֵׂ֥ה אֶ֙רֶץ֙ בְּכֹח֔וֹ מֵכִ֥ין תֵּבֵ֖ל בְּחׇכְמָת֑וֹ וּבִתְבוּנָת֖וֹ נָטָ֥ה שָׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated:
[God] made the earth by might,
Established the world by wisdom,
And with understanding stretched out the skies.
Transliteration: osheh erets vekhochvo mekhiyn tevel vechׇkhematvo uvitevunatvo natah shamayiim

Hebrew: לְק֨וֹל תִּתּ֜וֹ הֲמ֥וֹן מַ֙יִם֙ בַּשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַיַּעֲלֶ֥ה נְשִׂאִ֖ים מִקְצֵ֣ה (ארץ) [הָאָ֑רֶץ] בְּרָקִ֤ים לַמָּטָר֙ עָשָׂ֔ה וַיּ֥וֹצֵא ר֖וּחַ מֵאֹצְרֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
When [God] bellows,
There is a rumbling of water in the skies;
Vapors rise from the end of the earth,
Lightning accompanies the rain,
And wind is brought forth from God’s treasuries.
Transliteration: lekvol titvo hamvon mayiim vashamayiim vayaaleh neshiiym miketseh (rts) [haarets] verakiym lamatar ashah vayyvotse rucha meotserotayv

Hebrew: נִבְעַ֤ר כׇּל־אָדָם֙ מִדַּ֔עַת הֹבִ֥ישׁ כׇּל־צוֹרֵ֖ף מִפָּ֑סֶל כִּ֛י שֶׁ֥קֶר נִסְכּ֖וֹ וְלֹא־ר֥וּחַ בָּֽם׃
Translated:
Every mortal is proved dull, without knowledge;
Every goldsmith is put to shame because of the idol,
For their molten images are a deceit—
There is no breath in them.
Transliteration: nivear khׇl-adam midaat hoviysh khׇl-tsvoref mifasel khiy sheker nisekhvo velo-rucha vam

Hebrew: הֶ֣בֶל הֵ֔מָּה מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה תַּעְתֻּעִ֑ים בְּעֵ֥ת פְּקֻדָּתָ֖ם יֹאבֵֽדוּ׃
Translated:
They are delusion, a work of mockery;
In their hour of doom, they shall perish.
Transliteration: hevel hemah maasheh taetuiym veet fekudatam yovedu

Hebrew: לֹֽא־כְאֵ֜לֶּה חֵ֣לֶק יַעֲקֹ֗ב כִּֽי־יוֹצֵ֤ר הַכֹּל֙ ה֔וּא וְיִ֨שְׂרָאֵ֔ל שֵׁ֖בֶט נַחֲלָת֑וֹ יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת שְׁמֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Not like these is the Portion of Jacob—
The One who formed all things,
With Israel as a permanent possession—
Whose name is GOD of Hosts.
Transliteration: lo-kheeleh chelek yaakov khiy-yvotser hakhol hu veyisherael shevet nachalatvo yehovah tsevavot shemvo {s}

Hebrew: אִסְפִּ֥י מֵאֶ֖רֶץ כִּנְעָתֵ֑ךְ (ישבתי) [יֹשֶׁ֖בֶת] בַּמָּצֽוֹר׃ {ס}
Translated:
Gather up your bundle from the ground,
You who dwell under siege!
Transliteration: isefiy meerets khineatekhe (yshvty) [yoshevet] vamatsvor {s}

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹה֙ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנְנִ֥י קוֹלֵ֛עַ אֶת־יוֹשְׁבֵ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ בַּפַּ֣עַם הַזֹּ֑את וַהֲצֵרֹ֥תִי לָהֶ֖ם לְמַ֥עַן יִמְצָֽאוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: For thus said G<small>OD</small>: I will fling away the inhabitants of the land this time: I will harass them so that they shall feel it.
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah hineniy kvolea et-yvoshevey haarets vafaam hazot vahatserotiy lahem lemaan yimetsau {s}

Hebrew: א֥וֹי לִי֙ עַל־שִׁבְרִ֔י נַחְלָ֖ה מַכָּתִ֑י וַאֲנִ֣י אָמַ֔רְתִּי אַ֛ךְ זֶ֥ה חֳלִ֖י וְאֶשָּׂאֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
Woe unto me for my hurt,
My wound is severe!
I thought, “This is but a sickness
And I must bear it.”
Transliteration: voy liy al-shiveriy nachelah makhatiy vaaniy amaretiy akhe zeh choliy veeshaenu

Hebrew: אׇהֳלִ֣י שֻׁדָּ֔ד וְכׇל־מֵיתָרַ֖י נִתָּ֑קוּ בָּנַ֤י יְצָאֻ֙נִי֙ וְאֵינָ֔ם אֵין־נֹטֶ֥ה עוֹד֙ אׇֽהֳלִ֔י וּמֵקִ֖ים יְרִיעוֹתָֽי׃
Translated:
My tents are ravaged,
All my tent cords are broken.
My children have gone forth from me
And are no more;
No one is left to stretch out my tents
And hang my tent cloths.
Transliteration: ׇholiy shudad vekhׇl-meytaray nitaku vanay yetsauniy veeynam eyn-noteh vod ׇholiy umekiym yeriyvotay

Hebrew: כִּ֤י נִבְעֲרוּ֙ הָרֹעִ֔ים וְאֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה לֹ֣א דָרָ֑שׁוּ עַל־כֵּן֙ לֹ֣א הִשְׂכִּ֔ילוּ וְכׇל־מַרְעִיתָ֖ם נָפֽוֹצָה׃ {פ}
Translated:
For the shepherds are dull
And did not seek GOD;
Therefore they have not prospered
And all their flock is scattered.
Transliteration: khiy nivearu haroiym veet-yehovah lo darashu al-khen lo hishekhiylu vekhׇl-mareiytam nafvotsah {f}

Hebrew: ק֤וֹל שְׁמוּעָה֙ הִנֵּ֣ה בָאָ֔ה וְרַ֥עַשׁ גָּד֖וֹל מֵאֶ֣רֶץ צָפ֑וֹן לָשׂ֞וּם אֶת־עָרֵ֧י יְהוּדָ֛ה שְׁמָמָ֖ה מְע֥וֹן תַּנִּֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
Hark, a noise! It is coming,
A great commotion out of the north,
That the towns of Judah may be made a desolation,
A haunt of jackals.
Transliteration: kvol shemuah hineh vaah veraash gadvol meerets tsafvon lashum et-arey yehudah shemamah mevon taniym {s}

Hebrew: יָדַ֣עְתִּי יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֛י לֹ֥א לָאָדָ֖ם דַּרְכּ֑וֹ לֹֽא־לְאִ֣ישׁ הֹלֵ֔ךְ וְהָכִ֖ין אֶֽת־צַעֲדֽוֹ׃
Translated:
I know, O ETERNAL One, that mortals’ road is not theirs [to choose],
That people, as they walk, cannot direct their own steps.
Transliteration: yadaetiy yehovah khiy lo laadam darekhvo lo-leiysh holekhe vehakhiyn et-tsaadvo

Hebrew: יַסְּרֵ֥נִי יְהֹוָ֖ה אַךְ־בְּמִשְׁפָּ֑ט אַל־בְּאַפְּךָ֖ פֶּן־תַּמְעִטֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Chastise me, O ETERNAL One, but in measure;
Not in Your wrath, lest You reduce me to naught.
Transliteration: yasereniy yehovah akhe-vemishefat al-veafekha fen-tameiteniy

Hebrew: שְׁפֹ֣ךְ חֲמָתְךָ֗ עַל־הַגּוֹיִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־יְדָע֔וּךָ וְעַל֙ מִשְׁפָּח֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּשִׁמְךָ֖ לֹ֣א קָרָ֑אוּ כִּֽי־אָכְל֣וּ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֗ב וַאֲכָלֻ֙הוּ֙ וַיְכַלֻּ֔הוּ וְאֶת־נָוֵ֖הוּ הֵשַֽׁמּוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Pour out Your wrath on the nations who have not heeded You,
Upon the clans that have not invoked Your name.
For they have devoured Jacob,
Have devoured and consumed him,
And have laid desolate his homesteads.
Transliteration: shefokhe chamatekha al-hagvoyim asher lo-yedaukha veal mishefachvot asher veshimekha lo karau khiy-akhelu et-yaakov vaakhaluhu vayekhaluhu veet-navehu heshamu {f}

Hebrew: הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָיָ֣ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ מֵאֵ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word that came to Jeremiah from G<small>OD</small>:
Transliteration: hadavar asher hayah el-yiremeyahu meet yehovah lemor

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֕וּ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֖י הַבְּרִ֣ית הַזֹּ֑את וְדִבַּרְתֶּם֙ אֶל־אִ֣ישׁ יְהוּדָ֔ה וְעַל־יֹשְׁבֵ֖י יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: “Hear the terms of this covenant, and recite them to the citizenry of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem!
Transliteration: shimeu et-diverey haveriyt hazot vedivaretem el-iysh yehudah veal-yoshevey yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם כֹּֽה־אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אָר֣וּר הָאִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א יִשְׁמַ֔ע אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֖י הַבְּרִ֥ית הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: And say to them, Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: Cursed be anyone who will not obey the terms of this covenant,
Transliteration: veamareta aleyhem khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael arur haiysh asher lo yishema et-diverey haveriyt hazot

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּ֣יתִי אֶת־אֲבֽוֹתֵיכֶ֡ם בְּי֣וֹם הוֹצִיאִֽי־אוֹתָ֣ם מֵאֶֽרֶץ־מִצְרַ֩יִם֩ מִכּ֨וּר הַבַּרְזֶ֜ל לֵאמֹ֗ר שִׁמְע֤וּ בְקוֹלִי֙ וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֣ם אוֹתָ֔ם כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־אֲצַוֶּ֖ה אֶתְכֶ֑ם וִהְיִ֤יתֶם לִי֙ לְעָ֔ם וְאָ֣נֹכִ֔י אֶהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: which I enjoined upon your ancestors when I freed them from the land of Egypt, the iron crucible, saying, ‘Obey Me and observe them, just as I command you, that you may be My people and I may be your God’—
Transliteration: asher tsiviytiy et-avvoteykhem veyvom hvotsiyiy-votam meerets-mitserayiim mikhur havarezel lemor shimeu vekvoliy vaashiytem votam khekhol asher-atsaveh etekhem viheyiytem liy leam veanokhiy eheyeh lakhem lelohiym

Hebrew: לְמַ֩עַן֩ הָקִ֨ים אֶת־הַשְּׁבוּעָ֜ה אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֣עְתִּי לַאֲבֽוֹתֵיכֶ֗ם לָתֵ֤ת לָהֶם֙ אֶ֣רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֛ב וּדְבַ֖שׁ כַּיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וָאַ֥עַן וָאֹמַ֖ר אָמֵ֥ן ׀ יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: in order to fulfill the oath that I swore to your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as is now the case.” And I responded, “Amen, E<small>TERNAL</small> One.”
Transliteration: lemaan hakiym et-hashevuah asher-nishevaetiy laavvoteykhem latet lahem erets zavat chalav udevash khayyvom hazeh vaaan vaomar amen yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלַ֔י קְרָ֨א אֶת־כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֤ים הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ בְּעָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וּבְחֻצ֥וֹת יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם לֵאמֹ֑ר שִׁמְע֗וּ אֶת־דִּבְרֵי֙ הַבְּרִ֣ית הַזֹּ֔את וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> said to me, “Proclaim all these things through the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem: Hear the terms of this covenant, and perform them.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay kera et-khׇl-hadevariym haeleh vearey yehudah uvechutsvot yerushala͏im lemor shimeu et-diverey haveriyt hazot vaashiytem votam

Hebrew: כִּי֩ הָעֵ֨ד הַעִדֹ֜תִי בַּאֲבֽוֹתֵיכֶ֗ם בְּיוֹם֩ הַעֲלוֹתִ֨י אוֹתָ֜ם מֵאֶ֤רֶץ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ וְעַד־הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה הַשְׁכֵּ֥ם וְהָעֵ֖ד לֵאמֹ֑ר שִׁמְע֖וּ בְּקוֹלִֽי׃
Translated: For I have repeatedly and persistently warned your ancestors from the time I brought them out of Egypt to this day, saying: Obey My commands.
Transliteration: khiy haed haidotiy vaavvoteykhem veyvom haalvotiy votam meerets mitserayiim vead-hayyvom hazeh hashekhem vehaed lemor shimeu vekvoliy

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א שָֽׁמְעוּ֙ וְלֹא־הִטּ֣וּ אֶת־אׇזְנָ֔ם וַיֵּ֣לְכ֔וּ אִ֕ישׁ בִּשְׁרִיר֖וּת לִבָּ֣ם הָרָ֑ע וָאָבִ֨יא עֲלֵיהֶ֜ם אֶֽת־כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֧י הַבְּרִית־הַזֹּ֛את אֲשֶׁר־צִוִּ֥יתִי לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת וְלֹ֥א עָשֽׂוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: But they would not listen or give ear; they all followed the willfulness of their evil hearts. So I have brought upon them all the terms of this covenant, because they did not do what I commanded them to do.”
Transliteration: velo shameu velo-hitu et-ׇzenam vayelekhu iysh visheriyrut livam hara vaaviy aleyhem et-khׇl-diverey haveriyt-hazot asher-tsiviytiy laashvot velo ashu {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלָ֑י נִֽמְצָא־קֶ֙שֶׁר֙ בְּאִ֣ישׁ יְהוּדָ֔ה וּבְיֹשְׁבֵ֖י יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> said to me, “A conspiracy exists among the citizenry of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay nimetsa-kesher veiysh yehudah uveyoshevey yerushala͏im

Hebrew: שָׁ֩בוּ֩ עַל־עֲוֺנֹ֨ת אֲבוֹתָ֜ם הָרִאשֹׁנִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר מֵֽאֲנוּ֙ לִשְׁמ֣וֹעַ אֶת־דְּבָרַ֔י וְהֵ֣מָּה הָלְכ֗וּ אַחֲרֵ֛י אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִ֖ים לְעׇבְדָ֑ם הֵפֵ֤רוּ בֵֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וּבֵ֣ית יְהוּדָ֔ה אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֕י אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּרַ֖תִּי אֶת־אֲבוֹתָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: They have returned to the iniquities of their ancestors of old, who refused to heed My words. They, too, have followed other gods and served them. The House of Israel and the House of Judah have broken the covenant that I made with their ancestors.”
Transliteration: shavu al-avonot avvotam harishoniym asher meanu lishemvoa et-devaray vehemah halekhu acharey Elohim acheriym leׇvedam heferu veyt-yisherael uveyt yehudah et-veriytiy asher kharatiy et-avvotam {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנְנִ֨י מֵבִ֤יא אֲלֵיהֶם֙ רָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יוּכְל֖וּ לָצֵ֣את מִמֶּ֑נָּה וְזָעֲק֣וּ אֵלַ֔י וְלֹ֥א אֶשְׁמַ֖ע אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said G<small>OD</small>: I am going to bring upon them disaster from which they will not be able to escape. Then they will cry out to me, but I will not listen to them.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar yehovah hineniy meviy aleyhem raah asher lo-yukhelu latset mimenah vezaaku elay velo eshema aleyhem

Hebrew: וְֽהָלְכ֞וּ עָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֗ה וְיֹֽשְׁבֵי֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְזָֽעֲקוּ֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֛ר הֵ֥ם מְקַטְּרִ֖ים לָהֶ֑ם וְהוֹשֵׁ֛עַ לֹא־יוֹשִׁ֥יעוּ לָהֶ֖ם בְּעֵ֥ת רָעָתָֽם׃
Translated: And the townspeople of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem will go and cry out to the gods to which they sacrifice; but they will not be able to rescue them in their time of disaster.
Transliteration: vehalekhu arey yehudah veyoshevey yerushala͏im vezaaku el-haElohimm asher hem mekateriym lahem vehvoshea lo-yvoshiyu lahem veet raatam

Hebrew: כִּ֚י מִסְפַּ֣ר עָרֶ֔יךָ הָי֥וּ אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ יְהוּדָ֑ה וּמִסְפַּ֞ר חֻצ֣וֹת יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם שַׂמְתֶּ֤ם מִזְבְּחוֹת֙ לַבֹּ֔שֶׁת מִזְבְּח֖וֹת לְקַטֵּ֥ר לַבָּֽעַל׃ {ס}
Translated: For your gods have become as many as your towns, O Judah, and you have set up as many altars to Shame as there are streets in Jerusalem—altars for sacrifice to Baal.
Transliteration: khiy misefar areykha hayu eloheykha yehudah umisefar chutsvot yerushala͏im shametem mizevechvot lavoshet mizevechvot lekater lavaal {s}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֗ה אַל־תִּתְפַּלֵּל֙ בְּעַד־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה וְאַל־תִּשָּׂ֥א בַעֲדָ֖ם רִנָּ֣ה וּתְפִלָּ֑ה כִּ֣י ׀ אֵינֶ֣נִּי שֹׁמֵ֗עַ בְּעֵ֛ת קׇרְאָ֥ם אֵלַ֖י בְּעַ֥ד רָעָתָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: As for you, do not pray for this people, do not raise a cry of prayer on their behalf; for I will not listen when they call to Me on account of their disaster.
Transliteration: veatah al-titefalel vead-haam hazeh veal-tisha vaadam rinah utefilah khiy eyneniy shomea veet kׇream elay vead raatam {s}

Hebrew: מֶ֣ה לִידִידִ֞י בְּבֵיתִ֗י עֲשׂוֹתָ֤הּ הַֽמְזִמָּ֙תָה֙ הָרַבִּ֔ים וּבְשַׂר־קֹ֖דֶשׁ יַעַבְר֣וּ מֵעָלָ֑יִךְ כִּ֥י רָעָתֵ֖כִי אָ֥ז תַּעֲלֹֽזִי׃
Translated:
Why should My beloved be in My House,
Who executes so many vile designs?
The sacral flesh will pass away from you,
For you exult while performing your evil deeds.
Transliteration: meh liydiydiy veveytiy ashvotah hamezimatah haraviym uveshar-kodesh yaaveru mealayiikhe khiy raatekhiy az taaloziy

Hebrew: זַ֤יִת רַֽעֲנָן֙ יְפֵ֣ה פְרִי־תֹ֔אַר קָרָ֥א יְהֹוָ֖ה שְׁמֵ֑ךְ לְק֣וֹל ׀ הֲמוּלָּ֣ה גְדֹלָ֗ה הִצִּ֥ית אֵשׁ֙ עָלֶ֔יהָ וְרָע֖וּ דָּלִיּוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
GOD named you
“Verdant olive tree,
Fair, with choice fruit.”
But with a great roaring sound
[God] has set it on fire,
And its boughs are broken.
Transliteration: zayiit raanan yefeh feriy-toar kara yehovah shemekhe lekvol hamulah gedolah hitsiyt esh aleyha verau daliyyvotayv

Hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ הַנּוֹטֵ֣עַ אוֹתָ֔ךְ דִּבֶּ֥ר עָלַ֖יִךְ רָעָ֑ה בִּ֠גְלַ֠ל רָעַ֨ת בֵּֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל וּבֵ֣ית יְהוּדָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשׂ֥וּ לָהֶ֛ם לְהַכְעִסֵ֖נִי לְקַטֵּ֥ר לַבָּֽעַל׃ {פ}
Translated: G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, who planted you, has decreed disaster for you, because of the evil wrought by the House of Israel and the House of Judah, who angered Me by sacrificing to Baal.
Transliteration: vayhovah tsevavot hanvotea votakhe diver alayiikhe raah vigelal raat veyt-yisherael uveyt yehudah asher ashu lahem lehakheiseniy lekater lavaal {f}

Hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֥ה הוֹדִיעַ֖נִי וָאֵדָ֑עָה אָ֖ז הִרְאִיתַ֥נִי מַעַלְלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
GOD informed me, and I knew—
Then You let me see their deeds.
Transliteration: vayhovah hvodiyaniy vaedaah az hireiytaniy maaleleyhem

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֕י כְּכֶ֥בֶשׂ אַלּ֖וּף יוּבַ֣ל לִטְב֑וֹחַ וְלֹֽא־יָדַ֜עְתִּי כִּֽי־עָלַ֣י ׀ חָשְׁב֣וּ מַחֲשָׁב֗וֹת נַשְׁחִ֨יתָה עֵ֤ץ בְּלַחְמוֹ֙ וְנִכְרְתֶ֙נּוּ֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ חַיִּ֔ים וּשְׁמ֖וֹ לֹא־יִזָּכֵ֥ר עֽוֹד׃
Translated:
For I was like a docile lamb
Led to the slaughter;
I did not realize
That it was against me
They fashioned their plots:
“Let us destroy the tree with its fruit,
Let us cut him off from the land of the living.
That his name be remembered no more!”
Transliteration: vaaniy khekhevesh aluf yuval litevvocha velo-yadaetiy khiy-alay chashevu machashavvot nashechiytah ets velachemvo venikheretenu meerets chayiym ushemvo lo-yizakher vod

Hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ שֹׁפֵ֣ט צֶ֔דֶק בֹּחֵ֥ן כְּלָי֖וֹת וָלֵ֑ב אֶרְאֶ֤ה נִקְמָֽתְךָ֙ מֵהֶ֔ם כִּ֥י אֵלֶ֖יךָ גִּלִּ֥יתִי אֶת־רִיבִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
O GOD of Hosts, O just Judge,
Who test the thoughts and the mind,
Let me see Your retribution upon them,
For I lay my case before You.
Transliteration: vayhovah tsevavot shofet tsedek vochen khelayvot valev ereeh nikematekha mehem khiy eleykha giliytiy et-riyviy {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ עַל־אַנְשֵׁ֣י עֲנָת֔וֹת הַֽמְבַקְשִׁ֥ים אֶֽת־נַפְשְׁךָ֖ לֵאמֹ֑ר לֹ֤א תִנָּבֵא֙ בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה וְלֹ֥א תָמ֖וּת בְּיָדֵֽנוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: Assuredly, thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts concerning the people of Anathoth who seek your life and say, “You must not prophesy anymore in the name of G<small>OD</small>, or you will die by our hand”—
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah al-aneshey anatvot hamevakeshiym et-nafeshekha lemor lo tinave veshem yehovah velo tamut veyadenu {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת הִנְנִ֥י פֹקֵ֖ד עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם הַבַּחוּרִים֙ יָמֻ֣תוּ בַחֶ֔רֶב בְּנֵיהֶם֙ וּבְנ֣וֹתֵיהֶ֔ם יָמֻ֖תוּ בָּרָעָֽב׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts: “I am going to deal with them: the young men shall die by the sword, their boys and girls shall die by famine.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar yehovah tsevavot hineniy foked aleyhem havachuriym yamutu vacherev veneyhem uvenvoteyhem yamutu varaav

Hebrew: וּשְׁאֵרִ֕ית לֹ֥א תִהְיֶ֖ה לָהֶ֑ם כִּי־אָבִ֥יא רָעָ֛ה אֶל־אַנְשֵׁ֥י עֲנָת֖וֹת שְׁנַ֥ת פְּקֻדָּתָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: No remnant shall be left of them, for I will bring disaster on the people of Anathoth, the year of their doom.”
Transliteration: usheeriyt lo tiheyeh lahem khiy-aviy raah el-aneshey anatvot shenat fekudatam {s}

Hebrew: צַדִּ֤יק אַתָּה֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֥י אָרִ֖יב אֵלֶ֑יךָ אַ֤ךְ מִשְׁפָּטִים֙ אֲדַבֵּ֣ר אֹתָ֔ךְ מַדּ֗וּעַ דֶּ֤רֶךְ רְשָׁעִים֙ צָלֵ֔חָה שָׁל֖וּ כׇּל־בֹּ֥גְדֵי בָֽגֶד׃
Translated:
You will win, O ETERNAL One, if I make claim against You,
Yet I shall present charges against You:
Why does the way of the wicked prosper?
Why are the workers of treachery at ease?
Transliteration: tsadiyk atah yehovah khiy ariyv eleykha akhe mishefatiym adaver otakhe madua derekhe reshaiym tsalechah shalu khׇl-vogedey vaged

Hebrew: נְטַעְתָּם֙ גַּם־שֹׁרָ֔שׁוּ יֵלְכ֖וּ גַּם־עָ֣שׂוּ פֶ֑רִי קָר֤וֹב אַתָּה֙ בְּפִיהֶ֔ם וְרָח֖וֹק מִכִּלְיוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
You have planted them, and they have taken root,
They spread, they even bear fruit.
You are present in their mouths,
But far from their thoughts.
Transliteration: netaetam gam-shorashu eilekhu gam-ashu feriy karvov atah vefiyhem verachvok mikhileyvoteyhem

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ יְדַעְתָּ֔נִי תִּרְאֵ֕נִי וּבָחַנְתָּ֥ לִבִּ֖י אִתָּ֑ךְ הַתִּקֵם֙ כְּצֹ֣אן לְטִבְחָ֔ה וְהַקְדִּשֵׁ֖ם לְי֥וֹם הֲרֵגָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Yet You, ETERNAL One, have noted and observed me;
You have tested my heart, and found it with You.
Drive them out like sheep to the slaughter,
Prepare them for the day of slaying!
Transliteration: veatah yehovah yedaetaniy tireeniy uvachaneta liviy itakhe hatikem khetson letivechah vehakedishem leyvom haregah {f}

Hebrew: עַד־מָתַי֙ תֶּאֱבַ֣ל הָאָ֔רֶץ וְעֵ֥שֶׂב כׇּל־הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה יִיבָ֑שׁ מֵרָעַ֣ת יֹֽשְׁבֵי־בָ֗הּ סָפְתָ֤ה בְהֵמוֹת֙ וָע֔וֹף כִּ֣י אָֽמְר֔וּ לֹ֥א יִרְאֶ֖ה אֶת־אַחֲרִיתֵֽנוּ׃
Translated:
How long must the land languish,
And the grass of all the countryside dry up?
Must beasts and birds perish,
Because of the evil of its inhabitants,
Who say, “[God] will not look upon our future”?
Transliteration: ad-matay teeval haarets veeshev khׇl-hashadeh yiyvash meraat yoshevey-vah safetah vehemvot vavof khiy ameru lo yireeh et-achariytenu

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אֶת־רַגְלִ֥ים <small>׀</small> רַ֙צְתָּה֙ וַיַּלְא֔וּךָ וְאֵ֥יךְ תְּתַחֲרֶ֖ה אֶת־הַסּוּסִ֑ים וּבְאֶ֤רֶץ שָׁלוֹם֙ אַתָּ֣ה בוֹטֵ֔חַ וְאֵ֥יךְ תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בִּגְא֥וֹן הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated:
If you race with the foot-runners and they exhaust you,
How then can you compete with horses?
If you are secure only in a tranquil land,
How will you fare in the jungle of the Jordan?
Transliteration: khiy et-rageliym <small></small> ratsetah vayaleukha veeykhe tetachareh et-hasusiym uveerets shalvom atah vvotecha veeykhe taasheh vigevon hayareden

Hebrew: כִּ֧י גַם־אַחֶ֣יךָ וּבֵית־אָבִ֗יךָ גַּם־הֵ֙מָּה֙ בָּ֣גְדוּ בָ֔ךְ גַּם־הֵ֛מָּה קָרְא֥וּ אַחֲרֶ֖יךָ מָלֵ֑א אַל־תַּאֲמֵ֣ן בָּ֔ם כִּֽי־יְדַבְּר֥וּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ טוֹבֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated:
For even your own kin and your father’s house—
Even they are treacherous toward you;
They cry after you as a mob.
Do not believe them
When they speak cordially to you.
Transliteration: khiy gam-acheykha uveyt-aviykha gam-hemah vagedu vakhe gam-hemah kareu achareykha male al-taamen vam khiy-yedaveru eleykha tvovvot {s}

Hebrew: עָזַ֙בְתִּי֙ אֶת־בֵּיתִ֔י נָטַ֖שְׁתִּי אֶת־נַחֲלָתִ֑י נָתַ֛תִּי אֶת־יְדִד֥וּת נַפְשִׁ֖י בְּכַ֥ף אֹיְבֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
I have abandoned My House,
I have deserted My possession,
I have given over My dearly beloved
Into the hands of her enemies.
Transliteration: azavetiy et-veytiy natashetiy et-nachalatiy natatiy et-yedidut nafeshiy vekhaf oyeveyha

Hebrew: הָיְתָה־לִּ֥י נַחֲלָתִ֖י כְּאַרְיֵ֣ה בַיָּ֑עַר נָתְנָ֥ה עָלַ֛י בְּקוֹלָ֖הּ עַל־כֵּ֥ן שְׂנֵאתִֽיהָ׃
Translated:
My own people acted toward Me
Like a lion in the forest;
She raised her voice against Me—
Therefore I have rejected her.
Transliteration: hayetah-liy nachalatiy kheareeih vayaar natenah alay vekvolah al-khen shenetiyha

Hebrew: הַעַ֨יִט צָב֤וּעַ נַֽחֲלָתִי֙ לִ֔י הַעַ֖יִט סָבִ֣יב עָלֶ֑יהָ לְכ֗וּ אִסְפ֛וּ כׇּל־חַיַּ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה הֵתָ֥יוּ לְאׇכְלָֽה׃
Translated:
My own people acts toward Me
Like a bird of prey [or] a hyena;
Let the birds of prey surround her!
Go, gather all the wild beasts,
Bring them to devour!
Transliteration: haayiit tsavua nachalatiy liy haayiit saviyv aleyha lekhu isefu khׇl-chayat hashadeh hetayu leׇkhelah

Hebrew: רֹעִ֤ים רַבִּים֙ שִׁחֲת֣וּ כַרְמִ֔י בֹּסְס֖וּ אֶת־חֶלְקָתִ֑י נָ֥תְנ֛וּ אֶת־חֶלְקַ֥ת חֶמְדָּתִ֖י לְמִדְבַּ֥ר שְׁמָמָֽה׃
Translated:
Many shepherds have destroyed My vineyard,
Have trampled My field,
Have made My delightful field
A desolate wilderness.
Transliteration: roiym raviym shichatu kharemiy vosesu et-chelekatiy natenu et-chelekat chemedatiy lemidevar shemamah

Hebrew: שָׂמָהּ֙ לִשְׁמָמָ֔ה אָבְלָ֥ה עָלַ֖י שְׁמֵמָ֑ה נָשַׁ֙מָּה֙ כׇּל־הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּ֛י אֵ֥ין אִ֖ישׁ שָׂ֥ם עַל־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
They have made her a desolation;
Desolate, she pours out grief to Me.
The whole land is laid desolate,
But nobody gives it thought.
Transliteration: shamah lishemamah avelah alay shememah nashamah khׇl-haarets khiy eyn iysh sham al-lev

Hebrew: עַֽל־כׇּל־שְׁפָיִ֣ם בַּמִּדְבָּ֗ר בָּ֚אוּ שֹֽׁדְדִ֔ים כִּ֣י חֶ֤רֶב לַֽיהֹוָה֙ אֹֽכְלָ֔ה מִקְצֵה־אֶ֖רֶץ וְעַד־קְצֵ֣ה הָאָ֑רֶץ אֵ֥ין שָׁל֖וֹם לְכׇל־בָּשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated:
Spoilers have come
Upon all the bare heights of the wilderness.
For a sword of GOD devours
From one end of the land to the other;
No flesh is safe.
Transliteration: al-khׇl-shefayim vamidevar vau shodediym khiy cherev layhovah okhelah miketseh-erets vead-ketseh haarets eyn shalvom lekhׇl-vashar {s}

Hebrew: זָרְע֤וּ חִטִּים֙ וְקֹצִ֣ים קָצָ֔רוּ נֶחְל֖וּ לֹ֣א יוֹעִ֑לוּ וּבֹ֙שׁוּ֙ מִתְּבוּאֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם מֵחֲר֖וֹן אַף־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
They have sown wheat and reaped thorns,
They have endured pain to no avail.
Be shamed, then, by your harvest—
By GOD’s blazing wrath!
Transliteration: zareu chitiym vekotsiym katsaru nechelu lo yvoilu uvoshu mitevuoteykhem mecharvon af-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה עַל־כׇּל־שְׁכֵנַי֙ הָֽרָעִ֔ים הַנֹּֽגְעִים֙ בַּֽנַּחֲלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־הִנְחַ֥לְתִּי אֶת־עַמִּ֖י אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הִנְנִ֤י נֹֽתְשָׁם֙ מֵעַ֣ל אַדְמָתָ֔ם וְאֶת־בֵּ֥ית יְהוּדָ֖ה אֶתּ֥וֹשׁ מִתּוֹכָֽם׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: As for My wicked neighbors who encroach on the heritage that I gave to My people Israel—I am going to uproot them from their soil, and I will uproot the House of Judah out of the midst of them.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah al-khׇl-shekhenay haraiym hanogeiym vanachalah asher-hinechaletiy et-amiy et-yisherael hineniy notesham meal adematam veet-veyt yehudah etvosh mitvokham

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה אַֽחֲרֵי֙ נׇתְשִׁ֣י אוֹתָ֔ם אָשׁ֖וּב וְרִחַמְתִּ֑ים וַהֲשִׁבֹתִ֛ים אִ֥ישׁ לְנַחֲלָת֖וֹ וְאִ֥ישׁ לְאַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then, after I have uprooted them, I will take them back into favor, and restore them all to their own inheritance and their own land.
Transliteration: vehayah acharey nׇteshiy votam ashuv verichametiym vahashivotiym iysh lenachalatvo veiysh learetsvo

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֡ה אִם־לָמֹ֣ד יִלְמְדוּ֩ אֶת־דַּֽרְכֵ֨י עַמִּ֜י לְהִשָּׁבֵ֤עַ בִּשְׁמִי֙ חַי־יְהֹוָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר לִמְּדוּ֙ אֶת־עַמִּ֔י לְהִשָּׁבֵ֖עַ בַּבָּ֑עַל וְנִבְנ֖וּ בְּת֥וֹךְ עַמִּֽי׃
Translated: And if they learn the ways of My people, to swear by My name—“As G<small>OD</small> lives”—just as they once taught My people to swear by Baal, then they shall be built up in the midst of My people.
Transliteration: vehayah im-lamod yilemedu et-darekhey amiy lehishavea vishemiy chay-yehovah khaasher limedu et-amiy lehishavea vavaal venivenu vetvokhe amiy

Hebrew: וְאִ֖ם לֹ֣א יִשְׁמָ֑עוּ וְנָ֨תַשְׁתִּ֜י אֶת־הַגּ֥וֹי הַה֛וּא נָת֥וֹשׁ וְאַבֵּ֖ד נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: But if they do not give heed, I will tear out that nation, tear it out and destroy it—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: veim lo yishemau venatashetiy et-hagvoy hahu natvosh veaved neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י הָל֞וֹךְ וְקָנִ֤יתָ לְּךָ֙ אֵז֣וֹר פִּשְׁתִּ֔ים וְשַׂמְתּ֖וֹ עַל־מׇתְנֶ֑יךָ וּבַמַּ֖יִם לֹ֥א תְבִאֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: Thus G<small>OD</small> said to me: “Go buy yourself a loincloth of linen, and put it around your loins, but do not dip it into water.”
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah elay halvokhe vekaniyta lekha ezvor fishetiym veshametvo al-mׇteneykha uvamayiim lo teviehu

Hebrew: וָאֶקְנֶ֥ה אֶת־הָאֵז֖וֹר כִּדְבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה וָאָשִׂ֖ם עַל־מׇתְנָֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: So I bought the loincloth in accordance with G<small>OD</small>’s command, and put it about my loins.
Transliteration: vaekeneh et-haezvor khidevar yehovah vaashim al-mׇtenay {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֧י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֛ה אֵלַ֖י שֵׁנִ֥ית לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: And the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me a second time:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay sheniyt lemor

Hebrew: קַ֧ח אֶת־הָאֵז֛וֹר אֲשֶׁ֥ר קָנִ֖יתָ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־מׇתְנֶ֑יךָ וְקוּם֙ לֵ֣ךְ פְּרָ֔תָה וְטׇמְנֵ֥הוּ שָׁ֖ם בִּנְקִ֥יק הַסָּֽלַע׃
Translated: “Take the loincloth that you bought, which is about your loins, and go at once to Perath and cover it up there in a cleft of the rock.”
Transliteration: kach et-haezvor asher kaniyta asher al-mׇteneykha vekum lekhe feratah vetׇmenehu sham vinekiyk hasala

Hebrew: וָאֵלֵ֕ךְ וָאֶטְמְנֵ֖הוּ בִּפְרָ֑ת כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אוֹתִֽי׃
Translated: I went and buried it at Perath, as G<small>OD</small> had commanded me.
Transliteration: vaelekhe vaetemenehu viferat khaasher tsivah yehovah votiy

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י מִקֵּ֖ץ יָמִ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י ק֚וּם לֵ֣ךְ פְּרָ֔תָה וְקַ֤ח מִשָּׁם֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֵז֔וֹר אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּיתִ֖יךָ לְטׇמְנוֹ־שָֽׁם׃
Translated: Then, after a long time, G<small>OD</small> said to me, “Go at once to Perath and take there the loincloth that I commanded you to bury there.”
Transliteration: vayehiy mikets yamiym raviym vayomer yehovah elay kum lekhe feratah vekach misham et-haezvor asher tsiviytiykha letׇmenvo-sham

Hebrew: וָאֵלֵ֣ךְ פְּרָ֔תָה וָאֶחְפֹּ֗ר וָֽאֶקַּח֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֵז֔וֹר מִן־הַמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־טְמַנְתִּ֣יו שָׁ֑מָּה וְהִנֵּה֙ נִשְׁחַ֣ת הָאֵז֔וֹר לֹ֥א יִצְלַ֖ח לַכֹּֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: So I went to Perath and dug up the loincloth from the place where I had buried it; and found the loincloth ruined; it was not good for anything.
Transliteration: vaelekhe feratah vaechefor vaekach et-haezvor min-hamakvom asher-temanetiyv shamah vehineh nishechat haezvor lo yitselach lakhol {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: כֹּ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה כָּ֠כָה אַשְׁחִ֞ית אֶת־גְּא֧וֹן יְהוּדָ֛ה וְאֶת־גְּא֥וֹן יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם הָרָֽב׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Even so will I ruin the overweening pride of Judah and Jerusalem.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah khakhah ashechiyt et-gevon yehudah veet-gevon yerushala͏im harav

Hebrew: הָעָם֩ הַזֶּ֨ה הָרָ֜ע הַֽמֵּאֲנִ֣ים ׀ לִשְׁמ֣וֹעַ אֶת־דְּבָרַ֗י הַהֹֽלְכִים֙ בִּשְׁרִר֣וּת לִבָּ֔ם וַיֵּלְכ֗וּ אַֽחֲרֵי֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים לְעׇבְדָ֖ם וּלְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֣ת לָהֶ֑ם וִיהִי֙ כָּאֵז֣וֹר הַזֶּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יִצְלַ֖ח לַכֹּֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: This wicked people who refuse to heed My bidding, who follow the willfulness of their own hearts, who follow other gods and serve them and worship them, shall become like that loincloth, which is not good for anything.
Transliteration: haam hazeh hara hameaniym lishemvoa et-devaray haholekhiym visherirut livam vayelekhu acharey Elohim acheriym leׇvedam ulehishetachavot lahem viyhiy khaezvor hazeh asher lo-yitselach lakhol {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֡י כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ יִדְבַּ֨ק הָאֵז֜וֹר אֶל־מׇתְנֵי־אִ֗ישׁ כֵּ֣ן הִדְבַּ֣קְתִּי אֵ֠לַ֠י אֶת־כׇּל־בֵּ֨ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל וְאֶת־כׇּל־בֵּ֤ית יְהוּדָה֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה לִֽהְי֥וֹת לִי֙ לְעָ֔ם וּלְשֵׁ֥ם וְלִתְהִלָּ֖ה וּלְתִפְאָ֑רֶת וְלֹ֖א שָׁמֵֽעוּ׃
Translated: For as a loincloth clings close to a man’s loins, so I brought close to Me the whole House of Israel and the whole House of Judah—declares G<small>OD</small>—that they might be My people, for fame, and praise, and splendor. But they would not obey.
Transliteration: khiy khaasher yidevak haezvor el-mׇteney-iysh khen hidevaketiy elay et-khׇl-veyt yisherael veet-khׇl-veyt yehudah neum-yehovah liheyvot liy leam uleshem velitehilah uletifearet velo shameu

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֨ אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֗ה {ס} כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כׇּל־נֵ֖בֶל יִמָּ֣לֵא יָ֑יִן וְאָמְר֣וּ אֵלֶ֔יךָ הֲיָדֹ֙עַ֙ לֹ֣א נֵדַ֔ע כִּ֥י כׇל־נֵ֖בֶל יִמָּ֥לֵא יָֽיִן׃
Translated: And speak this word to them: Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: “Every jar should be filled with wine.” And when they say to you, “Don’t we know that every jar should be filled with wine?”
Transliteration: veamareta aleyhem et-hadavar hazeh {s} khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael khׇl-nevel yimale yayiin veameru eleykha hayadoa lo neda khiy khׇl-nevel yimale yayiin

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֨ אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם כֹּֽה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה הִנְנִ֣י מְמַלֵּ֣א אֶת־כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָ֪רֶץ הַזֹּ֟את וְאֶת־הַמְּלָכִ֣ים הַיֹּשְׁבִים֩ לְדָוִ֨ד עַל־כִּסְא֜וֹ וְאֶת־הַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים וְאֶת־הַנְּבִאִ֗ים וְאֵ֛ת כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֥י יְרוּשָׁלָ֖͏ִם שִׁכָּרֽוֹן׃
Translated: say to them, “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: I am going to fill with drunkenness all the inhabitants of this land, and the kings who sit on the throne of David, and the priests and the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: veamareta aleyhem khoh-amar yehovah hineniy memale et-khׇl-yoshevey haarets hazot veet-hamelakhiym hayosheviym ledavid al-khisevo veet-hakhohaniym veet-haneviiym veet khׇl-yoshevey yerushala͏im shikharvon

Hebrew: וְנִפַּצְתִּים֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֜יו וְהָאָב֧וֹת וְהַבָּנִ֛ים יַחְדָּ֖ו נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹֽא־אֶחְמ֧וֹל וְלֹא־אָח֛וּס וְלֹ֥א אֲרַחֵ֖ם מֵהַשְׁחִיתָֽם׃
Translated: And I will smash them one against the other, parents and children alike—declares G<small>OD</small>; no pity, compassion, or mercy will stop Me from destroying them.”
Transliteration: venifatsetiym iysh el-achiyv vehaavvot vehavaniym yachedav neum-yehovah lo-echemvol velo-achus velo arachem mehashechiytam

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֥וּ וְהַאֲזִ֖ינוּ אַל־תִּגְבָּ֑הוּ כִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבֵּֽר׃
Translated:
Attend and give ear; be not haughty,
For GOD has spoken.
Transliteration: shimeu vehaaziynu al-tigevahu khiy yehovah diver

Hebrew: תְּנוּ֩ לַיהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֤ם כָּבוֹד֙ בְּטֶ֣רֶם יַחְשִׁ֔ךְ וּבְטֶ֛רֶם יִֽתְנַגְּפ֥וּ רַגְלֵיכֶ֖ם עַל־הָ֣רֵי נָ֑שֶׁף וְקִוִּיתֶ֤ם לְאוֹר֙ וְשָׂמָ֣הּ לְצַלְמָ֔וֶת (ישית) [וְשִׁ֖ית] לַעֲרָפֶֽל׃
Translated:
Give honor to the ETERNAL your God
Before darkness descends,
Before your feet stumble
On the mountains in shadow—
When you hope for light,
And it is turned to darkness
And becomes deep gloom.
Transliteration: tenu layhovah eloheykhem khavvod veterem yacheshikhe uveterem yitenagefu rageleykhem al-harey nashef vekiviytem levor veshamah letsalemavet (yshyt) [veshiyt] laarafel

Hebrew: וְאִם֙ לֹ֣א תִשְׁמָע֔וּהָ בְּמִסְתָּרִ֥ים תִּבְכֶּֽה־נַפְשִׁ֖י מִפְּנֵ֣י גֵוָ֑ה וְדָמֹ֨עַ תִּדְמַ֜ע וְתֵרַ֤ד עֵינִי֙ דִּמְעָ֔ה כִּ֥י נִשְׁבָּ֖ה עֵ֥דֶר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
For if you will not give heed,
My inmost self must weep,
Because of your arrogance;
My eye must stream and flow
With copious tears,
Because GOD’s flock
Is taken captive.
Transliteration: veim lo tishemauha vemisetariym tivekheh-nafeshiy mifeney gevah vedamoa tidema veterad eyniy dimeah khiy nishevah eder yehovah {s}

Hebrew: אֱמֹ֥ר לַמֶּ֛לֶךְ וְלַגְּבִירָ֖ה הַשְׁפִּ֣ילוּ שֵׁ֑בוּ כִּ֤י יָרַד֙ מַרְאֲשׁ֣וֹתֵיכֶ֔ם עֲטֶ֖רֶת תִּֽפְאַרְתְּכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Say to the king and the queen mother,
“Sit in a lowly spot;
For your diadems are abased,
Your glorious crowns.”
Transliteration: emor lamelekhe velageviyrah hashefiylu shevu khiy yarad mareashvoteykhem ateret tifearetekhem

Hebrew: עָרֵ֥י הַנֶּ֛גֶב סֻגְּר֖וּ וְאֵ֣ין פֹּתֵ֑חַ הׇגְלָ֧ת יְהוּדָ֛ה כֻּלָּ֖הּ הׇגְלָ֥ת שְׁלוֹמִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
The cities of the Negeb are shut,
There is no one to open them;
Judah is exiled completely,
All of it exiled.
Transliteration: arey hanegev sugeru veeyn fotecha hׇgelat yehudah khulah hׇgelat shelvomiym {s}

Hebrew: (שאי) [שְׂא֤וּ] עֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ (וראי) [וּרְא֔וּ] הַבָּאִ֖ים מִצָּפ֑וֹן אַיֵּ֗ה הָעֵ֙דֶר֙ נִתַּן־לָ֔ךְ צֹ֖אן תִּפְאַרְתֵּֽךְ׃
Translated:
Raise your eyes and behold
Those who come from the north:
Where are the sheep entrusted to you,
The flock you took pride in?
Transliteration: (shy) [sheu] eyneykhem (vry) [ureu] havaiym mitsafvon ayeh haeder nitan-lakhe tson tifearetekhe

Hebrew: מַה־תֹּֽאמְרִי֙ כִּֽי־יִפְקֹ֣ד עָלַ֔יִךְ וְ֠אַ֠תְּ לִמַּ֨דְתְּ אֹתָ֥ם עָלַ֛יִךְ אַלֻּפִ֖ים לְרֹ֑אשׁ הֲל֤וֹא חֲבָלִים֙ יֹֽאחֱז֔וּךְ כְּמ֖וֹ אֵ֥שֶׁת לֵדָֽה׃
Translated:
What will you say when they appoint as your heads
Those among you whom you trained to be tame?
Shall not pangs seize you
Like a woman in childbirth?
Transliteration: mah-tomeriy khiy-yifekod alayiikhe veate limadete otam alayiikhe alufiym lerosh halvo chavaliym yochezukhe khemvo eshet ledah

Hebrew: וְכִ֤י תֹֽאמְרִי֙ בִּלְבָבֵ֔ךְ מַדּ֖וּעַ קְרָאֻ֣נִי אֵ֑לֶּה בְּרֹ֧ב עֲוֺנֵ֛ךְ נִגְל֥וּ שׁוּלַ֖יִךְ נֶחְמְס֥וּ עֲקֵבָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
And when you ask yourself,
“Why have these things befallen me?”
It is because of your great iniquity
That your skirts are lifted up,
Your limbs exposed.
Transliteration: vekhiy tomeriy vilevavekhe madua kerauniy eleh verov avonekhe nigelu shulayiikhe nechemesu akevayiikhe

Hebrew: הֲיַהֲפֹ֤ךְ כּוּשִׁי֙ עוֹר֔וֹ וְנָמֵ֖ר חֲבַרְבֻּרֹתָ֑יו גַּם־אַתֶּם֙ תּוּכְל֣וּ לְהֵיטִ֔יב לִמֻּדֵ֖י הָרֵֽעַ׃
Translated:
Can the Cushites change their skin,
Or leopards their spots?
Just as much can you do good,
Who are practiced in doing evil!
Transliteration: hayahafokhe khushiy vorvo venamer chavarevurotayv gam-atem tukhelu leheytiyv limudey harea

Hebrew: וַאֲפִיצֵ֖ם כְּקַשׁ־עוֹבֵ֑ר לְר֖וּחַ מִדְבָּֽר׃
Translated:
So I will scatter you like straw that flies
Before the desert wind.
Transliteration: vaafiytsem khekash-vover lerucha midevar

Hebrew: זֶ֣ה גוֹרָלֵ֧ךְ מְנָת־מִדַּ֛יִךְ מֵאִתִּ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר֙ שָׁכַ֣חַתְּ אוֹתִ֔י וַֽתִּבְטְחִ֖י בַּשָּֽׁקֶר׃
Translated:
This shall be your lot,
Your measured portion from Me
—declares GOD.
Because you forgot Me
And trusted in falsehood,
Transliteration: zeh gvoralekhe menat-midayiikhe meitiy neum-yehovah asher shakhachate votiy vativetechiy vashaker

Hebrew: וְגַם־אֲנִ֛י חָשַׂ֥פְתִּי שׁוּלַ֖יִךְ עַל־פָּנָ֑יִךְ וְנִרְאָ֖ה קְלוֹנֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
I in turn will lift your skirts over your face
And your shame shall be seen.
Transliteration: vegam-aniy chashafetiy shulayiikhe al-fanayiikhe venireah kelvonekhe

Hebrew: נִאֻפַ֤יִךְ וּמִצְהֲלוֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ זִמַּ֣ת זְנוּתֵ֔ךְ עַל־גְּבָעוֹת֙ בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה רָאִ֖יתִי שִׁקּוּצָ֑יִךְ א֥וֹי לָךְ֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם לֹ֣א תִטְהֲרִ֔י אַחֲרֵ֥י מָתַ֖י עֹֽד׃ {ס}
Translated:
I behold your adulteries,
Your lustful neighing,
Your unbridled depravity, your vile acts
On the hills of the countryside.
Woe to you, O Jerusalem,
Who will not be pure!
How much longer shall it be?
Transliteration: niufayiikhe umitsehalvotayiikhe zimat zenutekhe al-gevavot vashadeh raiytiy shikutsayiikhe voy lakhe yerushala͏im lo titehariy acharey matay od {s}

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר הָיָ֤ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָה֙ אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ עַל־דִּבְרֵ֖י הַבַּצָּרֽוֹת׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> that came to Jeremiah concerning the droughts.
Transliteration: asher hayah devar-yehovah el-yiremeyahu al-diverey havatsarvot

Hebrew: אָבְלָ֣ה יְהוּדָ֔ה וּשְׁעָרֶ֥יהָ אֻמְלְל֖וּ קָדְר֣וּ לָאָ֑רֶץ וְ<small>צִ</small>וְחַ֥ת יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם עָלָֽתָה׃
Translated:
Judah is in mourning,
Her settlements languish.
They are bowed to the ground,
And the outcry of Jerusalem rises.
Transliteration: avelah yehudah usheareyha umelelu kaderu laarets ve<small>tsi</small>vechat yerushala͏im alatah

Hebrew: וְאַדִּ֣רֵיהֶ֔ם שָׁלְח֥וּ (צעוריהם) [צְעִֽירֵיהֶ֖ם] לַמָּ֑יִם בָּ֣אוּ עַל־גֵּבִ֞ים לֹא־מָ֣צְאוּ מַ֗יִם שָׁ֤בוּ כְלֵיהֶם֙ רֵיקָ֔ם בֹּ֥שׁוּ וְהׇכְלְמ֖וּ וְחָפ֥וּ רֹאשָֽׁם׃
Translated:
Their nobles sent their servants for water;
They came to the cisterns, they found no water.
They returned, their vessels empty.
They are shamed and humiliated,
They cover their heads.
Transliteration: veadireyhem shalechu (tsvryhm) [tseiyreyhem] lamayiim vau al-geviym lo-matseu mayiim shavu kheleyhem reykam voshu vehׇkhelemu vechafu rosham

Hebrew: בַּעֲב֤וּר הָֽאֲדָמָה֙ חַ֔תָּה כִּ֛י לֹא־הָיָ֥ה גֶ֖שֶׁם בָּאָ֑רֶץ בֹּ֥שׁוּ אִכָּרִ֖ים חָפ֥וּ רֹאשָֽׁם׃
Translated:
Because of the ground there is dismay,
For there has been no rain on the earth.
The plowers are shamed,
They cover their heads.
Transliteration: vaavur haadamah chatah khiy lo-hayah geshem vaarets voshu ikhariym chafu rosham

Hebrew: כִּ֤י גַם־אַיֶּ֙לֶת֙ בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה יָלְדָ֖ה וְעָז֑וֹב כִּ֥י לֹֽא־הָיָ֖ה דֶּֽשֶׁא׃
Translated:
Even the hind in the field
Forsakes her newborn fawn,
Because there is no grass.
Transliteration: khiy gam-ayelet vashadeh yaledah veazvov khiy lo-hayah deshe

Hebrew: וּפְרָאִים֙ עָמְד֣וּ עַל־שְׁפָיִ֔ם שָׁאֲפ֥וּ ר֖וּחַ כַּתַּנִּ֑ים כָּל֥וּ עֵינֵיהֶ֖ם כִּי־אֵ֥ין עֵֽשֶׂב׃
Translated:
And the wild asses stand on the bare heights,
Snuffing the air like jackals;
Their eyes pine,
Because there is no herbage.
Transliteration: uferaiym amedu al-shefayim shaafu rucha khataniym khalu eyneyhem khiy-eyn eshev

Hebrew: אִם־עֲוֺנֵ֙ינוּ֙ עָ֣נוּ בָ֔נוּ יְהֹוָ֕ה עֲשֵׂ֖ה לְמַ֣עַן שְׁמֶ֑ךָ כִּי־רַבּ֥וּ מְשׁוּבֹתֵ֖ינוּ לְךָ֥ חָטָֽאנוּ׃
Translated:
Though our iniquities testify against us,
Act, O ETERNAL One, for the sake of Your name;
Though our rebellions are many
And we have sinned against You.
Transliteration: im-avoneynu anu vanu yehovah asheh lemaan shemekha khiy-ravu meshuvoteynu lekha chatanu

Hebrew: מִקְוֵה֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מוֹשִׁיע֖וֹ בְּעֵ֣ת צָרָ֑ה לָ֤מָּה תִֽהְיֶה֙ כְּגֵ֣ר בָּאָ֔רֶץ וּכְאֹרֵ֖חַ נָטָ֥ה לָלֽוּן׃
Translated:
O Hope of Israel,
Its deliverer in time of trouble,
Why are You like a stranger in the land,
Like a traveler who stops only for the night?
Transliteration: mikeveh yisherael mvoshiyvo veet tsarah lamah tiheyeh kheger vaarets ukheorecha natah lalun

Hebrew: לָ֤מָּה תִֽהְיֶה֙ כְּאִ֣ישׁ נִדְהָ֔ם כְּגִבּ֖וֹר לֹא־יוּכַ֣ל לְהוֹשִׁ֑יעַ וְאַתָּ֧ה בְקִרְבֵּ֣נוּ יְהֹוָ֗ה וְשִׁמְךָ֛ עָלֵ֥ינוּ נִקְרָ֖א אַל־תַּנִּחֵֽנוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Why are You like a man who is stunned,
Like a warrior who cannot give victory?
Yet You are in our midst, O ETERNAL One,
And Your name is attached to us—
Do not forsake us!
Transliteration: lamah tiheyeh kheiysh nideham khegivvor lo-yukhal lehvoshiya veatah vekirevenu yehovah veshimekha aleynu nikera al-tanichenu {s}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֗ה כֵּ֤ן אָֽהֲבוּ֙ לָנ֔וּעַ רַגְלֵיהֶ֖ם לֹ֣א חָשָׂ֑כוּ וַֽיהֹוָה֙ לֹ֣א רָצָ֔ם עַתָּה֙ יִזְכֹּ֣ר עֲוֺנָ֔ם וְיִפְקֹ֖ד חַטֹּאתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small> concerning this people: “Truly, they love to stray, they have not restrained their feet; so G<small>OD</small> has no pleasure in them. Now their iniquity will be recalled—and their sin punished.”
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah laam hazeh khen ahavu lanua rageleyhem lo chashakhu vayhovah lo ratsam atah yizekhor avonam veyifekod chatotam {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלָ֑י אַל־תִּתְפַּלֵּ֛ל בְּעַד־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה לְטוֹבָֽה׃
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> said to me, “Do not pray for the benefit of this people.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay al-titefalel vead-haam hazeh letvovah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י יָצֻ֗מוּ אֵינֶ֤נִּי שֹׁמֵ֙עַ֙ אֶל־רִנָּתָ֔ם וְכִ֧י יַעֲל֛וּ עֹלָ֥ה וּמִנְחָ֖ה אֵינֶ֣נִּי רֹצָ֑ם כִּ֗י בַּחֶ֙רֶב֙ וּבָרָעָ֣ב וּבַדֶּ֔בֶר אָנֹכִ֖י מְכַלֶּ֥ה אוֹתָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: When they fast, I will not listen to their outcry; and when they present burnt offering and grain offering, I will not accept them. I will exterminate them by war, famine, and disease.”
Transliteration: khiy yatsumu eyneniy shomea el-rinatam vekhiy yaalu olah uminechah eyneniy rotsam khiy vacherev uvaraav uvadever anokhiy mekhaleh votam {s}

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֞ר אֲהָ֣הּ ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה הִנֵּ֨ה הַנְּבִאִ֜ים אֹמְרִ֤ים לָהֶם֙ לֹא־תִרְא֣וּ חֶ֔רֶב וְרָעָ֖ב לֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם כִּֽי־שְׁל֤וֹם אֱמֶת֙ אֶתֵּ֣ן לָכֶ֔ם בַּמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: I said, “Ah, my Sovereign G<small>OD</small>! The prophets are saying to them, ‘You shall not see the sword, famine shall not come upon you, but I will give you unfailing security in this place.’”
Transliteration: vaomar ahah adonay yehovih hineh haneviiym omeriym lahem lo-tireu cherev veraav lo-yiheyeh lakhem khiy-shelvom emet eten lakhem vamakvom hazeh {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י שֶׁ֚קֶר הַנְּבִאִים֙ נִבְּאִ֣ים בִּשְׁמִ֔י לֹ֤א שְׁלַחְתִּים֙ וְלֹ֣א צִוִּיתִ֔ים וְלֹ֥א דִבַּ֖רְתִּי אֲלֵיהֶ֑ם חֲז֨וֹן שֶׁ֜קֶר וְקֶ֤סֶם (ואלול ותרמות) [וֶאֱלִיל֙ וְתַרְמִ֣ית] לִבָּ֔ם הֵ֖מָּה מִֽתְנַבְּאִ֥ים לָכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: G<small>OD</small> replied: It is a lie that the prophets utter in My name. I have not sent them or commanded them. I have not spoken to them. A lying vision, an empty divination, the deceit of their own contriving—that is what they prophesy to you!
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay sheker haneviiym niveiym vishemiy lo shelachetiym velo tsiviytiym velo divaretiy aleyhem chazvon sheker vekesem (vlvl vtrmvt) [veeliyl vetaremiyt] livam hemah mitenaveiym lakhem {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה עַֽל־הַנְּבִאִ֞ים הַנִּבְּאִ֣ים בִּשְׁמִי֮ וַאֲנִ֣י לֹֽא־שְׁלַחְתִּים֒ וְהֵ֙מָּה֙ אֹֽמְרִ֔ים חֶ֣רֶב וְרָעָ֔ב לֹ֥א יִהְיֶ֖ה בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את בַּחֶ֤רֶב וּבָֽרָעָב֙ יִתַּ֔מּוּ הַנְּבִאִ֖ים הָהֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said G<small>OD</small> concerning the prophets who prophesy in My name though I have not sent them, and who say, “Sword and famine shall not befall this land”; those very prophets shall perish by sword and famine.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah al-haneviiym haniveiym vishemiy vaaniy lo-shelachetiym vehemah omeriym cherev veraav lo yiheyeh vaarets hazot vacherev uvaraav yitamu haneviiym hahemah

Hebrew: וְהָעָ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֣מָּה נִבְּאִ֣ים לָהֶ֡ם יִהְי֣וּ מֻשְׁלָכִים֩ בְּחֻצ֨וֹת יְרוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם מִפְּנֵ֣י ׀ הָרָעָ֣ב וְהַחֶ֗רֶב וְאֵ֤ין מְקַבֵּר֙ לָהֵ֔מָּה הֵ֣מָּה נְשֵׁיהֶ֔ם וּבְנֵיהֶ֖ם וּבְנֹתֵיהֶ֑ם וְשָׁפַכְתִּ֥י עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם אֶת־רָעָתָֽם׃
Translated: And the assembly to whom they prophesy shall be left lying in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword, with none to bury them—they, their wives, their sons, and their daughters. I will pour out upon them [the requital of] their wickedness.
Transliteration: vehaam asher-hemah niveiym lahem yiheyu mushelakhiym vechutsvot yerushala͏im mifeney haraav vehacherev veeyn mekaver lahemah hemah nesheyhem uveneyhem uvenoteyhem veshafakhetiy aleyhem et-raatam

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֤ אֲלֵיהֶם֙ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה תֵּרַ֨דְנָה עֵינַ֥י דִּמְעָ֛ה לַ֥יְלָה וְיוֹמָ֖ם וְאַל־תִּדְמֶ֑ינָה כִּי֩ שֶׁ֨בֶר גָּד֜וֹל נִשְׁבְּרָ֗ה בְּתוּלַת֙ בַּת־עַמִּ֔י מַכָּ֖ה נַחְלָ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
And do you speak to them thus:
Let my eyes run with tears,
Day and night let them not cease,
For my hapless people has suffered
A grievous injury, a very painful wound.
Transliteration: veamareta aleyhem et-hadavar hazeh teradenah eynay dimeah layelah veyvomam veal-tidemeynah khiy shever gadvol nisheverah vetulat vat-amiy makhah nachelah meod

Hebrew: אִם־יָצָ֣אתִי הַשָּׂדֶ֗ה וְהִנֵּה֙ חַלְלֵי־חֶ֔רֶב וְאִם֙ בָּ֣אתִי הָעִ֔יר וְהִנֵּ֖ה תַּחֲלוּאֵ֣י רָעָ֑ב כִּֽי־גַם־נָבִ֧יא גַם־כֹּהֵ֛ן סָחֲר֥וּ אֶל־אֶ֖רֶץ וְלֹ֥א יָדָֽעוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
If I go out to the country—
Lo, the slain of the sword.
If I enter the city—
Lo, those who are sick with famine.
Both priest and prophet roam the land,
They know not where.
Transliteration: im-yatsatiy hashadeh vehineh chaleley-cherev veim vatiy haiyr vehineh tachaluey raav khiy-gam-naviy gam-khohen sacharu el-erets velo yadau {s}

Hebrew: הֲמָאֹ֨ס מָאַ֜סְתָּ אֶת־יְהוּדָ֗ה אִם־בְּצִיּוֹן֙ גָּעֲלָ֣ה נַפְשֶׁ֔ךָ מַדּ֙וּעַ֙ הִכִּיתָ֔נוּ וְאֵ֥ין לָ֖נוּ מַרְפֵּ֑א קַוֵּ֤ה לְשָׁלוֹם֙ וְאֵ֣ין ט֔וֹב וּלְעֵ֥ת מַרְפֵּ֖א וְהִנֵּ֥ה בְעָתָֽה׃
Translated:
Have You, then, rejected Judah?
Have You spurned Zion?
Why have You smitten us
So that there is no cure?
Why do we hope for happiness,
But find no good;
For a time of healing,
And meet terror instead?
Transliteration: hamaos maaseta et-yehudah im-vetsiyyvon gaalah nafeshekha madua hikhiytanu veeyn lanu marefe kaveh leshalvom veeyn tvov uleet marefe vehineh veatah

Hebrew: יָדַ֧עְנוּ יְהֹוָ֛ה רִשְׁעֵ֖נוּ עֲוֺ֣ן אֲבוֹתֵ֑ינוּ כִּ֥י חָטָ֖אנוּ לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
We acknowledge our wickedness, O ETERNAL One—
The iniquity of our ancestors—
For we have sinned against You.
Transliteration: yadaenu yehovah risheenu avon avvoteynu khiy chatanu lakhe

Hebrew: אַל־תִּנְאַץ֙ לְמַ֣עַן שִׁמְךָ֔ אַל־תְּנַבֵּ֖ל כִּסֵּ֣א כְבוֹדֶ֑ךָ זְכֹ֕ר אַל־תָּפֵ֥ר בְּרִיתְךָ֖ אִתָּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
For Your name’s sake, do not disown us;
Do not dishonor Your glorious throne.
Remember, do not annul Your covenant with us.
Transliteration: al-tineats lemaan shimekha al-tenavel khise khevvodekha zekhor al-tafer veriytekha itanu

Hebrew: הֲיֵ֨שׁ בְּהַבְלֵ֤י הַגּוֹיִם֙ מַגְשִׁמִ֔ים וְאִם־הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם יִתְּנ֣וּ רְבִבִ֑ים הֲלֹ֨א אַתָּה־ה֜וּא יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ וּנְקַוֶּה־לָּ֔ךְ כִּֽי־אַתָּ֥ה עָשִׂ֖יתָ אֶת־כׇּל־אֵֽלֶּה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Can any of the false gods of the nations give rain?
Can the skies of themselves give showers?
Only You can, O ETERNAL One our God!
So we hope in You,
For only You made all these things.
Transliteration: haeish vehaveley hagvoyim mageshimiym veim-hashamayiim yitenu reviviym halo atah-hu yehovah eloheynu unekaveh-lakhe khiy-atah ashiyta et-khׇl-eleh {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלַ֔י אִם־יַעֲמֹ֨ד מֹשֶׁ֤ה וּשְׁמוּאֵל֙ לְפָנַ֔י אֵ֥ין נַפְשִׁ֖י אֶל־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה שַׁלַּ֥ח מֵעַל־פָּנַ֖י וְיֵצֵֽאוּ׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> said to me, “Even if Moses and Samuel were to intercede with Me, I would not be won over to that people. Dismiss them from My presence, and let them go forth!
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay im-yaamod mosheh ushemuel lefanay eyn nafeshiy el-haam hazeh shalach meal-fanay veeitseu

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֛ה כִּי־יֹאמְר֥וּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ אָ֣נָה נֵצֵ֑א וְאָמַרְתָּ֨ אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר לַמָּ֤וֶת לַמָּ֙וֶת֙ וַאֲשֶׁ֤ר לַחֶ֙רֶב֙ לַחֶ֔רֶב וַאֲשֶׁ֤ר לָרָעָב֙ לָרָעָ֔ב וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר לַשְּׁבִ֖י לַשֶּֽׁבִי׃
Translated:
And if they ask you, ‘To what shall we go forth?’ answer them, ‘Thus said GOD:
Those destined for the plague, to the plague;
Those destined for the sword, to the sword;
Those destined for famine, to famine;
Those destined for captivity, to captivity.
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-yomeru eleykha anah netse veamareta aleyhem khoh-amar yehovah asher lamavet lamavet vaasher lacherev lacherev vaasher laraav laraav vaasher lasheviy lasheviy

Hebrew: וּפָקַדְתִּ֨י עֲלֵיהֶ֜ם אַרְבַּ֤ע מִשְׁפָּחוֹת֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶת־הַחֶ֣רֶב לַהֲרֹ֔ג וְאֶת־הַכְּלָבִ֖ים לִסְחֹ֑ב וְאֶת־ע֧וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֛יִם וְאֶת־בֶּהֱמַ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ לֶאֱכֹ֥ל וּלְהַשְׁחִֽית׃
Translated: And I will appoint over them four kinds [of punishment]—declares G<small>OD</small>—the sword to slay, the dogs to drag, the birds of the sky, and the beasts of the earth to devour and destroy.
Transliteration: ufakadetiy aleyhem areva mishefachvot neum-yehovah et-hacherev laharog veet-hakhelaviym lisechov veet-vof hashamayiim veet-vehemat haarets leekhol ulehashechiyt

Hebrew: וּנְתַתִּ֣ים (לזועה) [לְזַעֲוָ֔ה] לְכֹ֖ל מַמְלְכ֣וֹת הָאָ֑רֶץ בִּ֠גְלַ֠ל מְנַשֶּׁ֤ה בֶן־יְחִזְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה עַ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֖ה בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: I will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth, on account of King Manasseh son of Hezekiah of Judah, and of what he did in Jerusalem.’”
Transliteration: unetatiym (lzvh) [lezaavah] lekhol mamelekhvot haarets vigelal menasheh ven-yechizekiyahu melekhe yehudah al asher-ashah viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: כִּ֠י מִֽי־יַחְמֹ֤ל עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וּמִ֖י יָנ֣וּד לָ֑ךְ וּמִ֣י יָס֔וּר לִשְׁאֹ֥ל לְשָׁלֹ֖ם לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
But who will pity you, O Jerusalem,
Who will console you?
Who will turn aside to inquire
About your welfare?
Transliteration: khiy miy-yachemol alayiikhe yerushala͏im umiy yanud lakhe umiy yasur lisheol leshalom lakhe
