Hebrew: אַ֣תְּ נָטַ֥שְׁתְּ אֹתִ֛י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֖ה אָח֣וֹר תֵּלֵ֑כִי וָאַ֨ט אֶת־יָדִ֤י עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ וָֽאַשְׁחִיתֵ֔ךְ נִלְאֵ֖יתִי הִנָּחֵֽם׃
Translated:
You cast Me off
—declares GOD—
You go ever backward.
So I have stretched out My hand to destroy you;
I cannot relent.
Transliteration: ate natashete otiy neum-yehovah achvor telekhiy vaat et-yadiy alayiikhe vaashechiytekhe nileeytiy hinachem

Hebrew: וָאֶזְרֵ֥ם בְּמִזְרֶ֖ה בְּשַׁעֲרֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ שִׁכַּ֤לְתִּי אִבַּ֙דְתִּי֙ אֶת־עַמִּ֔י מִדַּרְכֵיהֶ֖ם לוֹא־שָֽׁבוּ׃
Translated:
I will scatter them as with a winnowing fork
Through the settlements of the earth.
I will bereave, I will destroy My people,
For they would not turn back from their ways.
Transliteration: vaezerem vemizereh veshaarey haarets shikhaletiy ivadetiy et-amiy midarekheyhem lvo-shavu

Hebrew: עָֽצְמוּ־לִ֤י אַלְמְנוֹתָו֙ מֵח֣וֹל יַמִּ֔ים הֵבֵ֨אתִי לָהֶ֥ם עַל־אֵ֛ם בָּח֖וּר שֹׁדֵ֣ד בַּֽצׇּהֳרָ֑יִם הִפַּ֤לְתִּי עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ פִּתְאֹ֔ם עִ֖יר וּבֶהָלֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Their widows shall be more numerous
Than the sands of the seas.
I will bring against them—
Young men and mothers together—
A destroyer at noonday.
I will bring down suddenly upon them
Alarm and terror.
Transliteration: atsemu-liy alemenvotav mechvol yamiym hevetiy lahem al-em vachur shoded vatsׇhorayiim hifaletiy aleyha fiteom iyr uvehalvot

Hebrew: אֻמְלְלָ֞ה יֹלֶ֣דֶת הַשִּׁבְעָ֗ה נָפְחָ֥ה נַפְשָׁ֛הּ (באה) [בָּ֥א] שִׁמְשָׁ֛הּ בְּעֹ֥ד יוֹמָ֖ם בּ֣וֹשָׁה וְחָפֵ֑רָה וּשְׁאֵרִיתָ֗ם לַחֶ֧רֶב אֶתֵּ֛ן לִפְנֵ֥י אֹיְבֵיהֶ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
She who bore seven is forlorn,
Utterly disconsolate;
Her sun has set while it is still day,
She is shamed and humiliated.
The remnant of them I will deliver to the sword,
To the power of their enemies
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: umelelah yoledet hashiveah nafechah nafeshah (vh) [va] shimeshah veod yvomam vvoshah vechaferah usheeriytam lacherev eten lifeney oyeveyhem neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: אֽוֹי־לִ֣י אִמִּ֔י כִּ֣י יְלִדְתִּ֗נִי אִ֥ישׁ רִ֛יב וְאִ֥ישׁ מָד֖וֹן לְכׇל־הָאָ֑רֶץ לֹֽא־נָשִׁ֥יתִי וְלֹא־נָֽשׁוּ־בִ֖י כֻּלֹּ֥ה מְקַֽלְלַֽוְנִי׃ {ס}
Translated:
Woe is me, my mother, that you ever bore me—
A man of conflict and strife with all the land!
I have not lent,
And I have not borrowed;
Yet everyone curses me.
Transliteration: voy-liy imiy khiy yelidetiniy iysh riyv veiysh madvon lekhׇl-haarets lo-nashiytiy velo-nashu-viy khuloh mekalelaveniy {s}

Hebrew: אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אִם־לֹ֥א (שרותך) [שֵׁרִיתִ֖יךָ] לְט֑וֹב אִם־ל֣וֹא ׀ הִפְגַּ֣עְתִּֽי בְךָ֗ בְּעֵ֥ת רָעָ֛ה וּבְעֵ֥ת צָרָ֖ה אֶת־הָאֹיֵֽב׃
Translated:
GOD said:
Surely, a mere remnant of you
Will I spare for a better fate!
By the enemy from the north
In a time of distress and a time of disaster,
Surely, I will have you struck down!
Transliteration: amar yehovah im-lo (shrvtkh) [sheriytiykha] letvov im-lvo hifegaetiy vekha veet raah uveet tsarah et-haoeiv

Hebrew: הֲיָרֹ֨עַ בַּרְזֶ֧ל <small>׀</small> בַּרְזֶ֛ל מִצָּפ֖וֹן וּנְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: Can iron break iron and bronze?
Transliteration: hayaroa varezel <small></small> varezel mitsafvon unechoshet

Hebrew: חֵילְךָ֧ וְאוֹצְרוֹתֶ֛יךָ לָבַ֥ז אֶתֵּ֖ן לֹ֣א בִמְחִ֑יר וּבְכׇל־חַטֹּאותֶ֖יךָ וּבְכׇל־גְּבוּלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I will hand over your wealth and your treasures
As a spoil, free of charge,
Because of all your sins throughout your territory.
Transliteration: cheylekha vevotservoteykha lavaz eten lo vimechiyr uvekhׇl-chatovteykha uvekhׇl-gevuleykha

Hebrew: וְהַֽעֲבַרְתִּי֙ אֶת־אֹ֣יְבֶ֔יךָ בְּאֶ֖רֶץ לֹ֣א יָדָ֑עְתָּ כִּי־אֵ֛שׁ קָדְחָ֥ה בְאַפִּ֖י עֲלֵיכֶ֥ם תּוּקָֽד׃ {ס}
Translated:
And I will bring your enemies
By way of a land you have not known.
For a fire has flared in My wrath,
It blazes against you.
Transliteration: vehaavaretiy et-oyeveykha veerets lo yadaeta khiy-esh kadechah veafiy aleykhem tukad {s}

Hebrew: אַתָּ֧ה יָדַ֣עְתָּ יְהֹוָ֗ה זׇכְרֵ֤נִי וּפׇקְדֵ֙נִי֙ וְהִנָּ֤קֶם לִי֙ מֵרֹ֣דְפַ֔י אַל־לְאֶ֥רֶךְ אַפְּךָ֖ תִּקָּחֵ֑נִי דַּ֕ע שְׂאֵתִ֥י עָלֶ֖יךָ חֶרְפָּֽה׃
Translated:
O ETERNAL One, you know—
Remember me and take thought of me,
Avenge me on those who persecute me;
Do not yield to Your patience,
Do not let me perish!
Consider how I have borne insult
On Your account.
Transliteration: atah yadaeta yehovah zׇkhereniy ufׇkedeniy vehinakem liy merodefay al-leerekhe afekha tikacheniy da sheetiy aleykha cherefah

Hebrew: נִמְצְא֤וּ דְבָרֶ֙יךָ֙ וָאֹ֣כְלֵ֔ם וַיְהִ֤י (דבריך) [דְבָֽרְךָ֙] לִ֔י לְשָׂשׂ֖וֹן וּלְשִׂמְחַ֣ת לְבָבִ֑י כִּֽי־נִקְרָ֤א שִׁמְךָ֙ עָלַ֔י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י צְבָאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated:
When Your words were offered, I devoured them;
Your word brought me the delight and joy
Of knowing that Your name is attached to me,
O ETERNAL One, God of Hosts.
Transliteration: nimetseu devareykha vaokhelem vayehiy (dvrykh) [devarekha] liy leshashvon uleshimechat levaviy khiy-nikera shimekha alay yehovah elohey tsevavot {s}

Hebrew: לֹא־יָשַׁ֥בְתִּי בְסוֹד־מְשַׂחֲקִ֖ים וָאֶעְלֹ֑ז מִפְּנֵ֤י יָֽדְךָ֙ בָּדָ֣ד יָשַׁ֔בְתִּי כִּי־זַ֖עַם מִלֵּאתָֽנִי׃
Translated:
I have not sat in the company of revelers
And made merry!
I have sat lonely because of Your hand upon me,
For You have filled me with gloom.
Transliteration: lo-yashavetiy vesvod-meshachakiym vaeeloz mifeney yadekha vadad yashavetiy khiy-zaam miletaniy

Hebrew: לָ֣מָּה הָיָ֤ה כְאֵבִי֙ נֶ֔צַח וּמַכָּתִ֖י אֲנוּשָׁ֑ה מֵֽאֲנָה֙ הֵרָפֵ֔א הָי֨וֹ תִהְיֶ֥ה לִי֙ כְּמ֣וֹ אַכְזָ֔ב מַ֖יִם לֹ֥א נֶאֱמָֽנוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Why must my pain be endless,
My wound incurable,
Resistant to healing?
You have been to me like a spring that fails,
Like waters that cannot be relied on.
Transliteration: lamah hayah kheeviy netsach umakhatiy anushah meanah herafe hayvo tiheyeh liy khemvo akhezav mayiim lo neemanu {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אִם־תָּשׁ֤וּב וַאֲשִֽׁיבְךָ֙ לְפָנַ֣י תַּעֲמֹ֔ד וְאִם־תּוֹצִ֥יא יָקָ֛ר מִזּוֹלֵ֖ל כְּפִ֣י תִֽהְיֶ֑ה יָשֻׁ֤בוּ הֵ֙מָּה֙ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְאַתָּ֖ה לֹא־תָשׁ֥וּב אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Assuredly, thus said GOD:
If you turn back, I shall take you back
And you shall stand before Me;
If you produce what is noble
Out of the worthless,
You shall be My spokesman.
They shall come back to you,
Not you to them.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah im-tashuv vaashiyvekha lefanay taamod veim-tvotsiy yakar mizvolel khefiy tiheyeh yashuvu hemah eleykha veatah lo-tashuv aleyhem

Hebrew: וּנְתַתִּ֜יךָ לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֗ה לְחוֹמַ֤ת נְחֹ֙שֶׁת֙ בְּצוּרָ֔ה וְנִלְחֲמ֥וּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ וְלֹא־י֣וּכְלוּ לָ֑ךְ כִּֽי־אִתְּךָ֥ אֲנִ֛י לְהוֹשִׁיעֲךָ֥ וּלְהַצִּילֶ֖ךָ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Against this people I will make you
As a fortified wall of bronze:
They will attack you,
But they shall not overcome you,
For I am with you to deliver and save you
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: unetatiykha laam hazeh lechvomat nechoshet vetsurah venilechamu eleykha velo-yukhelu lakhe khiy-itekha aniy lehvoshiyakha ulehatsiylekha neum-yehovah

Hebrew: וְהִצַּלְתִּ֖יךָ מִיַּ֣ד רָעִ֑ים וּפְדִתִ֖יךָ מִכַּ֥ף עָרִצִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
I will save you from the hands of the wicked
And rescue you from the clutches of the violent.
Transliteration: vehitsaletiykha miyad raiym ufeditiykha mikhaf aritsiym {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: לֹא־תִקַּ֥ח לְךָ֖ אִשָּׁ֑ה וְלֹֽא־יִהְי֤וּ לְךָ֙ בָּנִ֣ים וּבָנ֔וֹת בַּמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: You are not to marry and not to have sons and daughters in this place.
Transliteration: lo-tikach lekha ishah velo-yiheyu lekha vaniym uvanvot vamakvom hazeh {s}

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה עַל־הַבָּנִים֙ וְעַל־הַבָּנ֔וֹת הַיִּלּוֹדִ֖ים בַּמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וְעַֽל־אִמֹּתָ֞ם הַיֹּלְד֣וֹת אוֹתָ֗ם וְעַל־אֲבוֹתָ֛ם הַמּוֹלִדִ֥ים אוֹתָ֖ם בָּאָ֥רֶץ הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: For thus said G<small>OD</small> concerning any sons and daughters that may be born in this place, and concerning the mothers who bear them, and concerning the fathers who beget them in this land:
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah al-havaniym veal-havanvot hayilvodiym vamakvom hazeh veal-imotam hayoledvot votam veal-avvotam hamvolidiym votam vaarets hazot

Hebrew: מְמוֹתֵ֨י תַחֲלֻאִ֜ים יָמֻ֗תוּ לֹ֤א יִסָּֽפְדוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א יִקָּבֵ֔רוּ לְדֹ֛מֶן עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָ֖ה יִהְי֑וּ וּבַחֶ֤רֶב וּבָֽרָעָב֙ יִכְל֔וּ וְהָיְתָ֤ה נִבְלָתָם֙ לְמַאֲכָ֔ל לְע֥וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וּלְבֶהֱמַ֥ת הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
Translated: They shall die gruesome deaths. They shall not be lamented or buried; they shall be like dung on the surface of the ground. They shall be consumed by the sword and by famine, and their corpses shall be food for the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth.
Transliteration: memvotey tachaluiym yamutu lo yisafedu velo yikaveru ledomen al-feney haadamah yiheyu uvacherev uvaraav yikhelu vehayetah nivelatam lemaakhal levof hashamayiim ulevehemat haarets {s}

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אַל־תָּבוֹא֙ בֵּ֣ית מַרְזֵ֔חַ וְאַל־תֵּלֵ֣ךְ לִסְפּ֔וֹד וְאַל־תָּנֹ֖ד לָהֶ֑ם כִּֽי־אָסַ֨פְתִּי אֶת־שְׁלוֹמִ֜י מֵאֵ֨ת הָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶת־הַחֶ֖סֶד וְאֶת־הָרַחֲמִֽים׃
Translated:
For thus said GOD:
Do not enter a house of mourning,
Do not go to lament and to condole with them;
For I have withdrawn My favor from that people
—declares GOD—
My kindness and compassion.
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah al-tavvo veyt marezecha veal-telekhe lisefvod veal-tanod lahem khiy-asafetiy et-shelvomiy meet haam hazeh neum-yehovah et-hachesed veet-harachamiym

Hebrew: וּמֵ֨תוּ גְדֹלִ֧ים וּקְטַנִּ֛ים בָּאָ֥רֶץ הַזֹּ֖את לֹ֣א יִקָּבֵ֑רוּ וְלֹא־יִסְפְּד֣וּ לָהֶ֔ם וְלֹ֣א יִתְגֹּדַ֔ד וְלֹ֥א יִקָּרֵ֖חַ לָהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Great and small alike shall die in this land,
They shall not be buried; no one shall lament them,
Nor gash and tonsure themselves for them.
Transliteration: umetu gedoliym uketaniym vaarets hazot lo yikaveru velo-yisefedu lahem velo yitegodad velo yikarecha lahem

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יִפְרְס֥וּ לָהֶ֛ם עַל־אֵ֖בֶל לְנַחֲמ֣וֹ עַל־מֵ֑ת וְלֹֽא־יַשְׁק֤וּ אוֹתָם֙ כּ֣וֹס תַּנְחוּמִ֔ים עַל־אָבִ֖יו וְעַל־אִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
They shall not break bread for a mourner
To offer comfort for a death,
Nor offer one a cup of consolation
For the loss of their father or mother.
Transliteration: velo-yiferesu lahem al-evel lenachamvo al-met velo-yasheku votam khvos tanechumiym al-aviyv veal-imvo

Hebrew: וּבֵית־מִשְׁתֶּ֥ה לֹֽא־תָב֖וֹא לָשֶׁ֣בֶת אוֹתָ֑ם לֶאֱכֹ֖ל וְלִשְׁתּֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated:
Nor shall you enter a house of feasting,
To sit down with them to eat and drink.
Transliteration: uveyt-misheteh lo-tavvo lashevet votam leekhol velishetvot {f}

Hebrew: כִּי֩ כֹ֨ה אָמַ֜ר יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הִנְנִ֨י מַשְׁבִּ֜ית מִן־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּ֛ה לְעֵינֵיכֶ֖ם וּבִימֵיכֶ֑ם ק֤וֹל שָׂשׂוֹן֙ וְק֣וֹל שִׂמְחָ֔ה ק֥וֹל חָתָ֖ן וְק֥וֹל כַּלָּֽה׃
Translated: For thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to banish from this place, in your days and before your eyes, the sound of mirth and gladness, the voice of bridegroom and bride.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael hineniy masheviyt min-hamakvom hazeh leeyneykhem uviymeykhem kvol shashvon vekvol shimechah kvol chatan vekvol khalah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כִּ֤י תַגִּיד֙ לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וְאָמְר֣וּ אֵלֶ֗יךָ עַל־מֶה֩ דִבֶּ֨ר יְהֹוָ֤ה עָלֵ֙ינוּ֙ אֵ֣ת כׇּל־הָרָעָ֤ה הַגְּדוֹלָה֙ הַזֹּ֔את וּמֶ֤ה עֲוֺנֵ֙נוּ֙ וּמֶ֣ה חַטָּאתֵ֔נוּ אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָטָ֖אנוּ לַיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: And when you announce all these things to that people, and they ask you, “Why has G<small>OD</small> decreed upon us all this fearful evil? What is the iniquity and what the sin that we have committed against the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God?”
Transliteration: vehayah khiy tagiyd laam hazeh et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh veameru eleykha al-meh diver yehovah aleynu et khׇl-haraah hagedvolah hazot umeh avonenu umeh chatatenu asher chatanu layhovah eloheynu

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם עַל֩ אֲשֶׁר־עָזְב֨וּ אֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֤ם אוֹתִי֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיֵּלְכ֗וּ אַֽחֲרֵי֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וַיַּעַבְד֖וּם וַיִּשְׁתַּחֲו֣וּ לָהֶ֑ם וְאֹתִ֣י עָזָ֔בוּ וְאֶת־תּוֹרָתִ֖י לֹ֥א שָׁמָֽרוּ׃
Translated: say to them, “Because your ancestors deserted Me—declares G<small>OD</small>—and followed other gods and served them and worshiped them; they deserted Me and did not keep My Instruction.
Transliteration: veamareta aleyhem al asher-azevu avvoteykhem votiy neum-yehovah vayelekhu acharey Elohim acheriym vayaavedum vayishetachavu lahem veotiy azavu veet-tvoratiy lo shamaru

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֛ם הֲרֵעֹתֶ֥ם לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת מֵאֲבֽוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם וְהִנְּכֶ֣ם הֹלְכִ֗ים אִ֚ישׁ אַֽחֲרֵי֙ שְׁרִר֣וּת לִבּֽוֹ־הָרָ֔ע לְבִלְתִּ֖י שְׁמֹ֥עַ אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: And you have acted worse than your ancestors, every one of you following the willfulness of their own evil heart and paying no heed to Me.
Transliteration: veatem hareotem laashvot meavvoteykhem vehinekhem holekhiym iysh acharey sherirut livvo-hara leviletiy shemoa elay

Hebrew: וְהֵטַלְתִּ֣י אֶתְכֶ֗ם מֵעַל֙ הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את עַל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א יְדַעְתֶּ֔ם אַתֶּ֖ם וַאֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם וַעֲבַדְתֶּם־שָׁ֞ם אֶת־אֱלֹהִ֤ים אֲחֵרִים֙ יוֹמָ֣ם וָלַ֔יְלָה אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־אֶתֵּ֥ן לָכֶ֖ם חֲנִינָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Therefore I will hurl you out of this land to a land that neither you nor your ancestors have known, and there you will serve other gods, day and night; for I will show you no mercy.”
Transliteration: vehetaletiy etekhem meal haarets hazot al-haarets asher lo yedaetem atem vaavvoteykhem vaavadetem-sham et-Elohim acheriym yvomam valayelah asher lo-eten lakhem chaniynah {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֛ן הִנֵּה־יָמִ֥ים בָּאִ֖ים נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹא־יֵאָמֵ֥ר עוֹד֙ חַי־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר הֶעֱלָ֛ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Assuredly, a time is coming—declares G<small>OD</small>—when it shall no more be said, “As G<small>OD</small> lives who brought the Israelites out of the land of Egypt,”
Transliteration: lakhen hineh-yamiym vaiym neum-yehovah velo-eiamer vod chay-yehovah asher heelah et-veney yisherael meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־חַי־יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֶעֱלָ֜ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ צָפ֔וֹן וּמִכֹּל֙ הָאֲרָצ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִדִּיחָ֖ם שָׁ֑מָּה וַהֲשִֽׁבֹתִים֙ עַל־אַדְמָתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לַאֲבוֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: but rather, “As G<small>OD</small> lives who brought the Israelites out of the northland, and out of all the lands to which they had been banished.” For I will bring them back to their land, which I gave to their ancestors.
Transliteration: khiy im-chay-yehovah asher heelah et-veney yisherael meerets tsafvon umikhol haaratsvot asher hidiycham shamah vahashivotiym al-adematam asher natatiy laavvotam {f}

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֨י שֹׁלֵ֜חַ (לדוגים) [לְדַיָּגִ֥ים] רַבִּ֛ים נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֖ה וְדִיג֑וּם וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֗ן אֶשְׁלַח֙ לְרַבִּ֣ים צַיָּדִ֔ים וְצָד֞וּם מֵעַ֤ל כׇּל־הַר֙ וּמֵעַ֣ל כׇּל־גִּבְעָ֔ה וּמִנְּקִיקֵ֖י הַסְּלָעִֽים׃
Translated:
Lo, I am sending for many fishermen
—declares GOD—
And they shall haul them out;
And after that I will send for many hunters,
And they shall hunt them
Out of every mountain and out of every hill
And out of the clefts of the rocks.
Transliteration: hineniy sholecha (ldvgym) [ledayagiym] raviym neum-yehovah vediygum veacharey-khen eshelach leraviym tsayadiym vetsadum meal khׇl-har umeal khׇl-giveah uminekiykey haselaiym

Hebrew: כִּ֤י עֵינַי֙ עַל־כׇּל־דַּרְכֵיהֶ֔ם לֹ֥א נִסְתְּר֖וּ מִלְּפָנָ֑י וְלֹֽא־נִצְפַּ֥ן עֲוֺנָ֖ם מִנֶּ֥גֶד עֵינָֽי׃
Translated:
For My eyes are on all their ways,
They are not hidden from My presence,
Their iniquity is not concealed from My sight.
Transliteration: khiy eynay al-khׇl-darekheyhem lo niseteru milefanay velo-nitsefan avonam mineged eynay

Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּמְתִּ֣י רִאשׁוֹנָ֗ה מִשְׁנֵ֤ה עֲוֺנָם֙ וְחַטָּאתָ֔ם עַ֖ל חַלְּלָ֣ם אֶת־אַרְצִ֑י בְּנִבְלַ֤ת שִׁקּֽוּצֵיהֶם֙ וְתוֹעֲב֣וֹתֵיהֶ֔ם מָלְא֖וּ אֶת־נַחֲלָתִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
I will pay them in full—
Nay, doubly for their iniquity and their sins—
Because they have defiled My land
With the corpses of their abominations,
And have filled My own possession
With their abhorrent things.
Transliteration: veshilametiy rishvonah misheneh avonam vechatatam al chalelam et-aretsiy venivelat shikutseyhem vetvoavvoteyhem maleu et-nachalatiy {f}

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֞ה עֻזִּ֧י וּמָעֻזִּ֛י וּמְנוּסִ֖י בְּי֣וֹם צָרָ֑ה אֵלֶ֗יךָ גּוֹיִ֤ם יָבֹ֙אוּ֙ מֵֽאַפְסֵי־אָ֔רֶץ וְיֹאמְר֗וּ אַךְ־שֶׁ֙קֶר֙ נָחֲל֣וּ אֲבוֹתֵ֔ינוּ הֶ֖בֶל וְאֵֽין־בָּ֥ם מוֹעִֽיל׃
Translated:
O ETERNAL One, my strength and my stronghold,
My refuge in a day of trouble,
To You nations shall come
From the ends of the earth and say:
Our ancestors inherited utter delusions,
Things that are futile and worthless.
Transliteration: yehovah uziy umauziy umenusiy veyvom tsarah eleykha gvoyim yavou meafesey-arets veyomeru akhe-sheker nachalu avvoteynu hevel veeyn-vam mvoiyl

Hebrew: הֲיַעֲשֶׂה־לּ֥וֹ אָדָ֖ם אֱלֹהִ֑ים וְהֵ֖מָּה לֹ֥א אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
Can mortals make gods for themselves?
No-gods are they!
Transliteration: hayaasheh-lvo adam Elohim vehemah lo Elohim

Hebrew: לָכֵן֙ הִנְנִ֣י מֽוֹדִיעָ֔ם בַּפַּ֣עַם הַזֹּ֔את אוֹדִיעֵ֥ם אֶת־יָדִ֖י וְאֶת־גְּבוּרָתִ֑י וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּֽי־שְׁמִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Assuredly, I will teach them,
Once and for all I will teach them
My power and My might.
And they shall learn that My name is GOD.
Transliteration: lakhen hineniy mvodiyam vafaam hazot vodiyem et-yadiy veet-gevuratiy veyadeu khiy-shemiy yehovah {s}

Hebrew: חַטַּ֣את יְהוּדָ֗ה כְּתוּבָ֛ה בְּעֵ֥ט בַּרְזֶ֖ל בְּצִפֹּ֣רֶן שָׁמִ֑יר חֲרוּשָׁה֙ עַל־ל֣וּחַ לִבָּ֔ם וּלְקַרְנ֖וֹת מִזְבְּחוֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
The guilt of Judah is inscribed
With a stylus of iron,
Engraved with an adamant point
On the tablet of their hearts,
And on the horns of their altars,
Transliteration: chatat yehudah khetuvah veet varezel vetsiforen shamiyr charushah al-lucha livam ulekarenvot mizevechvoteykhem

Hebrew: כִּזְכֹּ֤ר בְּנֵיהֶם֙ מִזְבְּחוֹתָ֔ם וַאֲשֵׁרֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־עֵ֣ץ רַעֲנָ֑ן עַ֖ל גְּבָע֥וֹת הַגְּבֹהֽוֹת׃
Translated:
While their children remember
Their altars and sacred posts,
By verdant trees,
Upon lofty hills.
Transliteration: khizekhor veneyhem mizevechvotam vaashereyhem al-ets raanan al gevavot hagevohvot

Hebrew: הֲרָרִי֙ בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה חֵילְךָ֥ כׇל־אוֹצְרוֹתֶ֖יךָ לָבַ֣ז אֶתֵּ֑ן בָּמֹתֶ֕יךָ בְּחַטָּ֖את בְּכׇל־גְּבוּלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Because of the sin of your shrines
Throughout your borders,
I will make your rampart a heap in the field,
And all your treasures a spoil.
Transliteration: harariy vashadeh cheylekha khׇl-votservoteykha lavaz eten vamoteykha vechatat vekhׇl-gevuleykha

Hebrew: וְשָׁמַטְתָּ֗ה וּבְךָ֙ מִנַּחֲלָֽתְךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָתַ֣תִּי לָ֔ךְ וְהַעֲבַדְתִּ֙יךָ֙ אֶת־אֹ֣יְבֶ֔יךָ בָּאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־יָדָ֑עְתָּ כִּֽי־אֵ֛שׁ קְדַחְתֶּ֥ם בְּאַפִּ֖י עַד־עוֹלָ֥ם תּוּקָֽד׃ {ס}
Translated:
You will forfeit, by your own act,
The inheritance I have given you;
I will make you a slave to your enemies
In a land you have never known.
For you have kindled the flame of My wrath
That shall burn for all time.
Transliteration: veshamatetah uvekha minachalatekha asher natatiy lakhe vehaavadetiykha et-oyeveykha vaarets asher lo-yadaeta khiy-esh kedachetem veafiy ad-volam tukad {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אָר֤וּר הַגֶּ֙בֶר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִבְטַ֣ח בָּאָדָ֔ם וְשָׂ֥ם בָּשָׂ֖ר זְרֹע֑וֹ וּמִן־יְהֹוָ֖ה יָס֥וּר לִבּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
Cursed is the man who trusts in mortals,
Who makes mere flesh his strength,
And turns his thoughts from GOD.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah arur hagever asher yivetach vaadam vesham vashar zerovo umin-yehovah yasur livvo

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ כְּעַרְעָ֣ר בָּעֲרָבָ֔ה וְלֹ֥א יִרְאֶ֖ה כִּֽי־יָ֣בוֹא ט֑וֹב וְשָׁכַ֤ן חֲרֵרִים֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר אֶ֥רֶץ מְלֵחָ֖ה וְלֹ֥א תֵשֵֽׁב׃ {ס}
Translated:
He shall be like a bush in the desert,
Which does not sense the coming of good:
It is set in the scorched places of the wilderness,
In a barren land without inhabitant.
Transliteration: vehayah khearear vaaravah velo yireeh khiy-yavvo tvov veshakhan chareriym vamidevar erets melechah velo teshev {s}

Hebrew: בָּר֣וּךְ הַגֶּ֔בֶר אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִבְטַ֖ח בַּיהֹוָ֑ה וְהָיָ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה מִבְטַחֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Blessed is the man who trusts in GOD,
Whose trust is GOD alone.
Transliteration: varukhe hagever asher yivetach vayhovah vehayah yehovah mivetachvo

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה כְּעֵ֣ץ ׀ שָׁת֣וּל עַל־מַ֗יִם וְעַל־יוּבַל֙ יְשַׁלַּ֣ח שׇׁרָשָׁ֔יו וְלֹ֤א (ירא) [יִרְאֶה֙] כִּי־יָ֣בֹא חֹ֔ם וְהָיָ֥ה עָלֵ֖הוּ רַעֲנָ֑ן וּבִשְׁנַ֤ת בַּצֹּ֙רֶת֙ לֹ֣א יִדְאָ֔ג וְלֹ֥א יָמִ֖ישׁ מֵעֲשׂ֥וֹת פֶּֽרִי׃
Translated:
He shall be like a tree planted by waters,
Sending forth its roots by a stream:
It does not sense the coming of heat,
Its leaves are ever fresh;
It has no care in a year of drought,
It does not cease to yield fruit.
Transliteration: vehayah kheets shatul al-mayiim veal-yuval yeshalach shׇrashayv velo (yr) [yireeh] khiy-yavo chom vehayah alehu raanan uvishenat vatsoret lo yideag velo yamiysh meashvot feriy

Hebrew: עָקֹ֥ב הַלֵּ֛ב מִכֹּ֖ל וְאָנֻ֣שׁ ה֑וּא מִ֖י יֵדָעֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
Most devious is the heart;
It is perverse—who can fathom it?
Transliteration: akov halev mikhol veanush hu miy eidaenu

Hebrew: אֲנִ֧י יְהֹוָ֛ה חֹקֵ֥ר לֵ֖ב בֹּחֵ֣ן כְּלָי֑וֹת וְלָתֵ֤ת לְאִישׁ֙ כִּדְרָכָ֔ו כִּפְרִ֖י מַעֲלָלָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated:
I GOD probe the heart,
Search the mind—
To repay each person according to their own ways,
With the proper fruit of their deeds.
Transliteration: aniy yehovah choker lev vochen khelayvot velatet leiysh khiderakhav khiferiy maalalayv {s}

Hebrew: קֹרֵ֤א דָגַר֙ וְלֹ֣א יָלָ֔ד עֹ֥שֶׂה עֹ֖שֶׁר וְלֹ֣א בְמִשְׁפָּ֑ט בַּחֲצִ֤י יָמָו֙ יַעַזְבֶ֔נּוּ וּבְאַחֲרִית֖וֹ יִהְיֶ֥ה נָבָֽל׃
Translated:
Like a partridge hatching what she did not lay
So are those who amass wealth by unjust means;
In mid-life it will leave them,
And in the end they will be proved fools.
Transliteration: kore dagar velo yalad osheh osher velo vemishefat vachatsiy yamav yaazevenu uveachariytvo yiheyeh naval

Hebrew: כִּסֵּ֣א כָב֔וֹד מָר֖וֹם מֵרִאשׁ֑וֹן מְק֖וֹם מִקְדָּשֵֽׁנוּ׃
Translated:
O Throne of Glory exalted from of old,
Our Sacred Shrine!
Transliteration: khise khavvod marvom merishvon mekvom mikedashenu

Hebrew: מִקְוֵ֤ה יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה כׇּל־עֹזְבֶ֖יךָ יֵבֹ֑שׁוּ (יסורי) [וְסוּרַי֙] בָּאָ֣רֶץ יִכָּתֵ֔בוּ כִּ֥י עָזְב֛וּ מְק֥וֹר מַֽיִם־חַיִּ֖ים אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
O Hope of Israel! O ETERNAL One!
All who forsake You shall be put to shame,
Those in the land who turn from You
Shall be doomed,
For they have forsaken GOD,
The Fount of living waters.
Transliteration: mikeveh yisherael yehovah khׇl-ozeveykha eivoshu (ysvry) [vesuray] vaarets yikhatevu khiy azevu mekvor mayiim-chayiym et-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: רְפָאֵ֤נִי יְהֹוָה֙ וְאֵ֣רָפֵ֔א הוֹשִׁיעֵ֖נִי וְאִוָּשֵׁ֑עָה כִּ֥י תְהִלָּתִ֖י אָֽתָּה׃
Translated:
Heal me, O ETERNAL One, and let me be healed;
Save me, and let me be saved;
For You are my glory.
Transliteration: refaeniy yehovah veerafe hvoshiyeniy veivasheah khiy tehilatiy atah

Hebrew: הִנֵּה־הֵ֕מָּה אֹמְרִ֖ים אֵלָ֑י אַיֵּ֥ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה יָ֥בוֹא נָֽא׃
Translated:
See, they say to me:
“Where is GOD’s prediction?
Let it come to pass!”
Transliteration: hineh-hemah omeriym elay ayeh devar-yehovah yavvo na

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֞י לֹא־אַ֣צְתִּי ׀ מֵרֹעֶ֣ה אַחֲרֶ֗יךָ וְי֥וֹם אָנ֛וּשׁ לֹ֥א הִתְאַוֵּ֖יתִי אַתָּ֣ה יָדָ֑עְתָּ מוֹצָ֣א שְׂפָתַ֔י נֹ֥כַח פָּנֶ֖יךָ הָיָֽה׃
Translated:
But I have not evaded
Being a shepherd in your service,
Nor have I longed for the fatal day.
You know the utterances of my lips,
They were ever before You.
Transliteration: vaaniy lo-atsetiy meroeh achareykha veyvom anush lo hiteaveytiy atah yadaeta mvotsa shefatay nokhach faneykha hayah

Hebrew: אַל־תִּֽהְיֵה־לִ֖י לִמְחִתָּ֑ה מַחֲסִי־אַ֖תָּה בְּי֥וֹם רָעָֽה׃
Translated:
Do not be a cause of dismay to me;
You are my refuge in a day of calamity.
Transliteration: al-tiheeih-liy limechitah machasiy-atah veyvom raah

Hebrew: יֵבֹ֤שׁוּ רֹֽדְפַי֙ וְאַל־אֵבֹ֣שָׁה אָ֔נִי יֵחַ֣תּוּ הֵ֔מָּה וְאַל־אֵחַ֖תָּה אָ֑נִי הָבִ֤יא עֲלֵיהֶם֙ י֣וֹם רָעָ֔ה וּמִשְׁנֶ֥ה שִׁבָּר֖וֹן שׇׁבְרֵֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
Let my persecutors be shamed,
And let not me be shamed;
Let them be dismayed,
And let not me be dismayed.
Bring on them the day of disaster,
And shatter them with double destruction.
Transliteration: eivoshu rodefay veal-evoshah aniy eichatu hemah veal-echatah aniy haviy aleyhem yvom raah umisheneh shivarvon shׇverem {s}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י הָלֹ֤ךְ וְעָֽמַדְתָּ֙ בְּשַׁ֣עַר בְּנֵֽי־[הָעָ֔ם] (עם) אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָבֹ֤אוּ בוֹ֙ מַלְכֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וַאֲשֶׁ֖ר יֵ֣צְאוּ ב֑וֹ וּבְכֹ֖ל שַׁעֲרֵ֥י יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small> to me: Go and stand in the People’s Gate, by which the kings of Judah enter and by which they go forth, and in all the gates of Jerusalem,
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah elay halokhe veamadeta veshaar veney-[haam] (m) asher yavou vvo malekhey yehudah vaasher eitseu vvo uvekhol shaarey yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲ֠לֵיהֶ֠ם שִׁמְע֨וּ דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֜ה מַלְכֵ֤י יְהוּדָה֙ וְכׇל־יְהוּדָ֔ה וְכֹ֖ל יֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם הַבָּאִ֖ים בַּשְּׁעָרִ֥ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: and say to them: Hear the word of G<small>OD</small>, O kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem who enter by these gates!
Transliteration: veamareta aleyhem shimeu devar-yehovah malekhey yehudah vekhׇl-yehudah vekhol yoshevey yerushala͏im havaiym vasheariym haeleh

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִשָּׁמְר֖וּ בְּנַפְשׁוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם וְאַל־תִּשְׂא֤וּ מַשָּׂא֙ בְּי֣וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֔ת וַהֲבֵאתֶ֖ם בְּשַׁעֲרֵ֥י יְרֽוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Guard yourselves for your own sake against carrying burdens on the sabbath day, and bringing them through the gates of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah hishameru venafeshvoteykhem veal-tisheu masha veyvom hashavat vahavetem veshaarey yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וְלֹא־תוֹצִ֨יאוּ מַשָּׂ֤א מִבָּֽתֵּיכֶם֙ בְּי֣וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֔ת וְכׇל־מְלָאכָ֖ה לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֑וּ וְקִדַּשְׁתֶּם֙ אֶת־י֣וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֔ת כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּ֖יתִי אֶת־אֲבוֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Nor shall you carry out burdens from your houses on the sabbath day, or do any work, but you shall hallow the sabbath day, as I commanded your ancestors.
Transliteration: velo-tvotsiyu masha mivateykhem veyvom hashavat vekhׇl-melakhah lo taashu vekidashetem et-yvom hashavat khaasher tsiviytiy et-avvoteykhem

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א שָׁמְע֔וּ וְלֹ֥א הִטּ֖וּ אֶת־אׇזְנָ֑ם וַיַּקְשׁוּ֙ אֶת־עׇרְפָּ֔ם לְבִלְתִּ֣י (שומע) [שְׁמ֔וֹעַ] וּלְבִלְתִּ֖י קַ֥חַת מוּסָֽר׃
Translated: (But they would not listen or turn their ear; they stiffened their necks and would not pay heed or accept discipline.)
Transliteration: velo shameu velo hitu et-ׇzenam vayakeshu et-ׇrefam leviletiy (shvm) [shemvoa] uleviletiy kachat musar

Hebrew: וְ֠הָיָ֠ה אִם־שָׁמֹ֨עַ תִּשְׁמְע֤וּן אֵלַי֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה לְבִלְתִּ֣י ׀ הָבִ֣יא מַשָּׂ֗א בְּשַׁעֲרֵ֛י הָעִ֥יר הַזֹּ֖את בְּי֣וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֑ת וּלְקַדֵּשׁ֙ אֶת־י֣וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֔ת לְבִלְתִּ֥י עֲשֽׂוֹת־בֹּ֖ה כׇּל־מְלָאכָֽה׃
Translated: If you obey Me—declares G<small>OD</small>—and do not bring in burdens through the gates of this city on the sabbath day, but hallow the sabbath day and do no work on it,
Transliteration: vehayah im-shamoa tishemeun elay neum-yehovah leviletiy haviy masha veshaarey haiyr hazot veyvom hashavat ulekadesh et-yvom hashavat leviletiy ashvot-voh khׇl-melakhah

Hebrew: וּבָ֣אוּ בְשַׁעֲרֵ֣י הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֡את מְלָכִ֣ים ׀ וְשָׂרִ֡ים יֹשְׁבִים֩ עַל־כִּסֵּ֨א דָוִ֜ד רֹכְבִ֣ים ׀ בָּרֶ֣כֶב וּבַסּוּסִ֗ים הֵ֚מָּה וְשָׂ֣רֵיהֶ֔ם אִ֥ישׁ יְהוּדָ֖ה וְיֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְיָשְׁבָ֥ה הָעִיר־הַזֹּ֖את לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: then through the gates of this city shall enter kings who sit upon the throne of David, with their officers—riding on chariots and horses, they and their officers—and the citizenry of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem. And this city shall be inhabited for all time.
Transliteration: uvau veshaarey haiyr hazot melakhiym veshariym yosheviym al-khise david rokheviym varekhev uvasusiym hemah veshareyhem iysh yehudah veyoshevey yerushala͏im veyashevah haiyr-hazot levolam

Hebrew: וּבָ֣אוּ מֵעָרֵֽי־יְ֠הוּדָ֠ה וּמִסְּבִיב֨וֹת יְרוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם וּמֵאֶ֣רֶץ בִּנְיָמִ֗ן וּמִן־הַשְּׁפֵלָ֤ה וּמִן־הָהָר֙ וּמִן־הַנֶּ֔גֶב מְבִאִ֛ים עוֹלָ֥ה וְזֶ֖בַח וּמִנְחָ֣ה וּלְבוֹנָ֑ה וּמְבִאֵ֥י תוֹדָ֖ה בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And people shall come from the towns of Judah and from the environs of Jerusalem, and from the land of Benjamin, and from the Shephelah, and from the hill country, and from the Negeb, bringing burnt offerings and sacrifices, grain offerings and frankincense, and bringing offerings of thanksgiving to the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: uvau mearey-yehudah umiseviyvvot yerushala͏im umeerets vineyamin umin-hashefelah umin-hahar umin-hanegev meviiym volah vezevach uminechah ulevvonah umeviey tvodah veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֨א תִשְׁמְע֜וּ אֵלַ֗י לְקַדֵּשׁ֙ אֶת־י֣וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֔ת וּלְבִלְתִּ֣י ׀ שְׂאֵ֣ת מַשָּׂ֗א וּבֹ֛א בְּשַׁעֲרֵ֥י יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בְּי֣וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֑ת וְהִצַּ֧תִּי אֵ֣שׁ בִּשְׁעָרֶ֗יהָ וְאָ֥כְלָ֛ה אַרְמְנ֥וֹת יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם וְלֹ֥א תִכְבֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: But if you do not obey My command to hallow the sabbath day and to carry in no burdens through the gates of Jerusalem on the sabbath day, then I will set fire to its gates; it shall consume the fortresses of Jerusalem and it shall not be extinguished.
Transliteration: veim-lo tishemeu elay lekadesh et-yvom hashavat uleviletiy sheet masha uvo veshaarey yerushala͏im veyvom hashavat vehitsatiy esh visheareyha veakhelah aremenvot yerushala͏im velo tikheveh {f}

Hebrew: הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָיָ֣ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ מֵאֵ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word that came to Jeremiah from G<small>OD</small>:
Transliteration: hadavar asher hayah el-yiremeyahu meet yehovah lemor

Hebrew: ק֥וּם וְיָרַדְתָּ֖ בֵּ֣ית הַיּוֹצֵ֑ר וְשָׁ֖מָּה אַשְׁמִיעֲךָ֥ אֶת־דְּבָרָֽי׃
Translated: “Go down to the house of a potter, and there I will impart My words to you.”
Transliteration: kum veyaradeta veyt hayyvotser veshamah ashemiyakha et-devaray

Hebrew: וָאֵרֵ֖ד בֵּ֣ית הַיּוֹצֵ֑ר (והנהו) [וְהִנֵּה־ה֛וּא] עֹשֶׂ֥ה מְלָאכָ֖ה עַל־הָאׇבְנָֽיִם׃
Translated: So I went down to the house of a potter, and found him working at the wheel.
Transliteration: vaered veyt hayyvotser (vhnhv) [vehineh-hu] osheh melakhah al-haׇvenayiim

Hebrew: וְנִשְׁחַ֣ת הַכְּלִ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר ה֥וּא עֹשֶׂ֛ה בַּחֹ֖מֶר בְּיַ֣ד הַיּוֹצֵ֑ר וְשָׁ֗ב וַֽיַּעֲשֵׂ֙הוּ֙ כְּלִ֣י אַחֵ֔ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יָשַׁ֛ר בְּעֵינֵ֥י הַיּוֹצֵ֖ר לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: And if the vessel he was making was spoiled, as happens to clay in the potter’s hands, he would make it into another vessel, such as the potter saw fit to make.
Transliteration: venishechat hakheliy asher hu osheh vachomer veyad hayyvotser veshav vayaashehu kheliy acher khaasher yashar veeyney hayyvotser laashvot {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֽוֹר׃
Translated: Then the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemvor

Hebrew: הֲכַיּוֹצֵ֨ר הַזֶּ֜ה לֹא־אוּכַ֨ל לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת לָכֶ֛ם בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה הִנֵּ֤ה כַחֹ֙מֶר֙ בְּיַ֣ד הַיּוֹצֵ֔ר כֵּן־אַתֶּ֥ם בְּיָדִ֖י בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: O House of Israel, can I not deal with you like this potter?—says G<small>OD</small>. Just like clay in the hands of the potter, so are you in My hands, O House of Israel!
Transliteration: hakhayyvotser hazeh lo-ukhal laashvot lakhem veyt yisherael neum-yehovah hineh khachomer veyad hayyvotser khen-atem veyadiy veyt yisherael {s}

Hebrew: רֶ֣גַע אֲדַבֵּ֔ר עַל־גּ֖וֹי וְעַל־מַמְלָכָ֑ה לִנְת֥וֹשׁ וְלִנְת֖וֹץ וּֽלְהַאֲבִֽיד׃
Translated: At one moment I may decree that a nation or a kingdom shall be uprooted and pulled down and destroyed;
Transliteration: rega adaver al-gvoy veal-mamelakhah linetvosh velinetvots ulehaaviyd

Hebrew: וְשָׁב֙ הַגּ֣וֹי הַה֔וּא מֵרָ֣עָת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי עָלָ֑יו וְנִֽחַמְתִּי֙ עַל־הָ֣רָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָשַׁ֖בְתִּי לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת לֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: but if that nation against which I made the decree turns back from its wickedness, I change My mind concerning the punishment I planned to bring on it.
Transliteration: veshav hagvoy hahu meraatvo asher divaretiy alayv venichametiy al-haraah asher chashavetiy laashvot lvo {s}

Hebrew: וְרֶ֣גַע אֲדַבֵּ֔ר עַל־גּ֖וֹי וְעַל־מַמְלָכָ֑ה לִבְנ֖וֹת וְלִנְטֽוֹעַ׃
Translated: At another moment I may decree that a nation or a kingdom shall be built and planted;
Transliteration: verega adaver al-gvoy veal-mamelakhah livenvot velinetvoa

Hebrew: וְעָשָׂ֤ה (הרעה) [הָרַע֙] בְּעֵינַ֔י לְבִלְתִּ֖י שְׁמֹ֣עַ בְּקוֹלִ֑י וְנִֽחַמְתִּי֙ עַל־הַטּוֹבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָמַ֖רְתִּי לְהֵיטִ֥יב אוֹתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: but if it does what is displeasing to Me and does not obey Me, then I change My mind concerning the good I planned to bestow upon it.
Transliteration: veashah (hrh) [hara] veeynay leviletiy shemoa vekvoliy venichametiy al-hatvovah asher amaretiy leheytiyv votvo {s}

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֡ה אֱמׇר־נָ֣א אֶל־אִישׁ־יְהוּדָה֩ וְעַל־יוֹשְׁבֵ֨י יְרוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם לֵאמֹ֗ר כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י יוֹצֵ֤ר עֲלֵיכֶם֙ רָעָ֔ה וְחֹשֵׁ֥ב עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם מַחֲשָׁבָ֑ה שׁ֣וּבוּ נָ֗א אִ֚ישׁ מִדַּרְכּ֣וֹ הָרָעָ֔ה וְהֵיטִ֥יבוּ דַרְכֵיכֶ֖ם וּמַעַלְלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: And now, say to the citizenry of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: I am devising disaster for you and laying plans against you. Turn back, each of you, from your wicked ways, and mend your ways and your actions!
Transliteration: veatah emׇr-na el-iysh-yehudah veal-yvoshevey yerushala͏im lemor khoh amar yehovah hineh anokhiy yvotser aleykhem raah vechoshev aleykhem machashavah shuvu na iysh midarekhvo haraah veheytiyvu darekheykhem umaaleleykhem

Hebrew: וְאָמְר֖וּ נוֹאָ֑שׁ כִּֽי־אַחֲרֵ֤י מַחְשְׁבוֹתֵ֙ינוּ֙ נֵלֵ֔ךְ וְאִ֛ישׁ שְׁרִר֥וּת לִבּֽוֹ־הָרָ֖ע נַעֲשֶֽׂה׃ {פ}
Translated: But they will say, “It is no use. We will keep on following our own plans; each of us will act in the willfulness of our own evil heart.”
Transliteration: veameru nvoash khiy-acharey macheshevvoteynu nelekhe veiysh sherirut livvo-hara naasheh {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה שַֽׁאֲלוּ־נָא֙ בַּגּוֹיִ֔ם מִ֥י שָׁמַ֖ע כָּאֵ֑לֶּה שַֽׁעֲרֻרִת֙ עָשְׂתָ֣ה מְאֹ֔ד בְּתוּלַ֖ת יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Assuredly, thus said GOD:
Inquire among the nations:
Who has heard anything like this?
Maiden Israel has done
A most horrible thing.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar yehovah shaalu-na vagvoyim miy shama khaeleh shaarurit ashetah meod vetulat yisherael

Hebrew: הֲיַעֲזֹ֥ב מִצּ֛וּר שָׂדַ֖י שֶׁ֣לֶג לְבָנ֑וֹן אִם־יִנָּֽתְשׁ֗וּ מַ֛יִם זָרִ֥ים קָרִ֖ים נוֹזְלִֽים׃
Translated:
Does one forsake Lebanon snow
From the mountainous rocks?
Does one abandon cool water
Flowing from afar?
Transliteration: hayaazov mitsur shaday sheleg levanvon im-yinateshu mayiim zariym kariym nvozeliym

Hebrew: כִּֽי־שְׁכֵחֻ֥נִי עַמִּ֖י לַשָּׁ֣וְא יְקַטֵּ֑רוּ וַיַּכְשִׁל֤וּם בְּדַרְכֵיהֶם֙ שְׁבִילֵ֣י עוֹלָ֔ם לָלֶ֣כֶת נְתִיב֔וֹת דֶּ֖רֶךְ לֹ֥א סְלוּלָֽה׃
Translated:
Yet My people have forgotten Me:
They sacrifice to a delusion:
They are made to stumble in their ways—
The ancient paths—
And to walk instead on byways,
On a road not built up.
Transliteration: khiy-shekhechuniy amiy lashave yekateru vayakheshilum vedarekheyhem sheviyley volam lalekhet netiyvvot derekhe lo selulah

Hebrew: לָשׂ֥וּם אַרְצָ֛ם לְשַׁמָּ֖ה (שרוקת) [שְׁרִיק֣וֹת] עוֹלָ֑ם כֹּ֚ל עוֹבֵ֣ר עָלֶ֔יהָ יִשֹּׁ֖ם וְיָנִ֥יד בְּרֹאשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
So their land will become a desolation,
An object of hissing for all time.
Every passerby will be appalled
And will shake their head.
Transliteration: lashum aretsam leshamah (shrvkt) [sheriykvot] volam khol vover aleyha yishom veyaniyd veroshvo

Hebrew: כְּרוּחַ־קָדִ֥ים אֲפִיצֵ֖ם לִפְנֵ֣י אוֹיֵ֑ב עֹ֧רֶף וְלֹֽא־פָנִ֛ים אֶרְאֵ֖ם בְּי֥וֹם אֵידָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
Like the east wind, I will scatter them
Before the enemy.
I will look upon their back, not their face,
In their day of disaster.
Transliteration: kherucha-kadiym afiytsem lifeney voeiv oref velo-faniym ereem veyvom eydam {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ לְכ֨וּ וְנַחְשְׁבָ֥ה עַֽל־יִרְמְיָ֘הוּ֮ מַחֲשָׁבוֹת֒ כִּי֩ לֹא־תֹאבַ֨ד תּוֹרָ֜ה מִכֹּהֵ֗ן וְעֵצָה֙ מֵחָכָ֔ם וְדָבָ֖ר מִנָּבִ֑יא לְכוּ֙ וְנַכֵּ֣הוּ בַלָּשׁ֔וֹן וְאַל־נַקְשִׁ֖יבָה אֶל־כׇּל־דְּבָרָֽיו׃
Translated: They said, “Come let us devise a plot against Jeremiah—for instruction shall not fail from the priest, nor counsel from the wise, nor oracle from the prophet. Come, let us strike him with the tongue, and we shall no longer have to listen to all those words of his.”
Transliteration: vayomeru lekhu venacheshevah al-yiremeyahu machashavvot khiy lo-tovad tvorah mikhohen veetsah mechakham vedavar minaviy lekhu venakhehu valashvon veal-nakeshiyvah el-khׇl-devarayv

Hebrew: הַקְשִׁ֥יבָה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלָ֑י וּשְׁמַ֖ע לְק֥וֹל יְרִיבָֽי׃
Translated:
Listen to me, O ETERNAL One—
And take note of what my enemies say!
Transliteration: hakeshiyvah yehovah elay ushema lekvol yeriyvay

Hebrew: הַיְשֻׁלַּ֤ם תַּֽחַת־טוֹבָה֙ רָעָ֔ה כִּי־כָר֥וּ שׁוּחָ֖ה לְנַפְשִׁ֑י זְכֹ֣ר ׀ עׇמְדִ֣י לְפָנֶ֗יךָ לְדַבֵּ֤ר עֲלֵיהֶם֙ טוֹבָ֔ה לְהָשִׁ֥יב אֶת־חֲמָתְךָ֖ מֵהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Should good be repaid with evil?
Yet they have dug a pit for me.
Remember how I stood before You
To plead in their behalf,
To turn Your anger away from them!
Transliteration: hayeshulam tachat-tvovah raah khiy-kharu shuchah lenafeshiy zekhor ׇmediy lefaneykha ledaver aleyhem tvovah lehashiyv et-chamatekha mehem

Hebrew: לָכֵן֩ תֵּ֨ן אֶת־בְּנֵיהֶ֜ם לָרָעָ֗ב וְהַגִּרֵם֮ עַל־יְדֵי־חֶ֒רֶב֒ וְתִהְיֶ֨נָה נְשֵׁיהֶ֤ם שַׁכֻּלוֹת֙ וְאַלְמָנ֔וֹת וְאַ֨נְשֵׁיהֶ֔ם יִהְי֖וּ הֲרֻ֣גֵי מָ֑וֶת בַּח֣וּרֵיהֶ֔ם מֻכֵּי־חֶ֖רֶב בַּמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
Oh, give their children over to famine,
Mow them down by the sword.
Let their wives be bereaved
Of children and husbands,
Let their men be struck down by the plague,
And their young men be slain in battle by the sword.
Transliteration: lakhen ten et-veneyhem laraav vehagirem al-yedey-cherev vetiheyenah nesheyhem shakhulvot vealemanvot veanesheyhem yiheyu harugey mavet vachureyhem mukhey-cherev vamilechamah

Hebrew: תִּשָּׁמַ֤ע זְעָקָה֙ מִבָּ֣תֵּיהֶ֔ם כִּֽי־תָבִ֧יא עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם גְּד֖וּד פִּתְאֹ֑ם כִּֽי־כָר֤וּ (שיחה) [שׁוּחָה֙] לְלׇכְדֵ֔נִי וּפַחִ֖ים טָמְנ֥וּ לְרַגְלָֽי׃
Translated:
Let an outcry be heard from their houses
When You bring sudden marauders against them;
For they have dug a pit to trap me,
And laid snares for my feet.
Transliteration: tishama zeakah mivateyhem khiy-taviy aleyhem gedud fiteom khiy-kharu (shychh) [shuchah] lelׇkhedeniy ufachiym tamenu leragelay

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה יְ֠הֹוָ֠ה יָדַ֜עְתָּ אֶֽת־כׇּל־עֲצָתָ֤ם עָלַי֙ לַמָּ֔וֶת אַל־תְּכַפֵּר֙ עַל־עֲוֺנָ֔ם וְחַטָּאתָ֖ם מִלְּפָנֶ֣יךָ אַל־תֶּ֑מְחִי (והיו) [וְיִהְי֤וּ] מֻכְשָׁלִים֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ בְּעֵ֥ת אַפְּךָ֖ עֲשֵׂ֥ה בָהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
O ETERNAL One, You know
All their plots to kill me.
Do not pardon their iniquity,
Do not blot out their guilt from Your presence.
Let them be made to stumble before You—
Act against them in Your hour of wrath!
Transliteration: veatah yehovah yadaeta et-khׇl-atsatam alay lamavet al-tekhafer al-avonam vechatatam milefaneykha al-temechiy (vhyv) [veyiheyu] mukheshaliym lefaneykha veet afekha asheh vahem {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הָלֹ֛ךְ וְקָנִ֥יתָ בַקְבֻּ֖ק יוֹצֵ֣ר חָ֑רֶשׂ וּמִזִּקְנֵ֣י הָעָ֔ם וּמִזִּקְנֵ֖י הַכֹּהֲנִֽים׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Go buy a jug of potter’s ware. And [take] some of the elders of the people and the priests,
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah halokhe vekaniyta vakevuk yvotser charesh umizikeney haam umizikeney hakhohaniym

Hebrew: וְיָצָ֙אתָ֙ אֶל־גֵּ֣יא בֶן־הִנֹּ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֕ר פֶּ֖תַח שַׁ֣עַר (החרסות) [הַחַרְסִ֑ית] וְקָרָ֣אתָ שָּׁ֔ם אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁר־אֲדַבֵּ֥ר אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: and go out to the Valley of Ben-hinnom—at the entrance of the Harsith Gate—and proclaim there the words that I will speak to you.
Transliteration: veyatsata el-gey ven-hinom asher fetach shaar (hchrsvt) [hacharesiyt] vekarata sham et-hadevariym asher-adaver eleykha

Hebrew: וְאָֽמַרְתָּ֙ שִׁמְע֣וּ דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה מַלְכֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וְיֹשְׁבֵ֖י יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם כֹּֽה־אָמַר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה צְבָא֜וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הִנְנִ֨י מֵבִ֤יא רָעָה֙ עַל־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר כׇּל־שֹׁמְעָ֖הּ תִּצַּ֥לְנָה אׇזְנָֽיו׃
Translated: Say: “Hear the word of G<small>OD</small>, O kings of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem! Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to bring such disaster upon this place that the ears of all who hear about it will tingle.
Transliteration: veamareta shimeu devar-yehovah malekhey yehudah veyoshevey yerushala͏im khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael hineniy meviy raah al-hamakvom hazeh asher khׇl-shomeah titsalenah ׇzenayv

Hebrew: יַ֣עַן ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲזָבֻ֗נִי וַֽיְנַכְּר֞וּ אֶת־הַמָּק֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ וַיְקַטְּרוּ־בוֹ֙ לֵאלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹא־יְדָע֛וּם הֵ֥מָּה וַאֲבוֹתֵיהֶ֖ם וּמַלְכֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה וּמָ֥לְא֛וּ אֶת־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה דַּ֥ם נְקִיִּֽם׃
Translated: For they and their ancestors and the kings of Judah have forsaken Me, and have made this place alien [to Me]; they have sacrificed in it to other gods whom they have not experienced, and they have filled this place with the blood of the innocent.
Transliteration: yaan asher azavuniy vayenakheru et-hamakvom hazeh vayekateru-vvo lelohiym acheriym asher lo-yedaum hemah vaavvoteyhem umalekhey yehudah umaleu et-hamakvom hazeh dam nekiyim

Hebrew: וּבָנ֞וּ אֶת־בָּמ֣וֹת הַבַּ֗עַל לִשְׂרֹ֧ף אֶת־בְּנֵיהֶ֛ם בָּאֵ֖שׁ עֹל֣וֹת לַבָּ֑עַל אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־צִוִּ֙יתִי֙ וְלֹ֣א דִבַּ֔רְתִּי וְלֹ֥א עָלְתָ֖ה עַל־לִבִּֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: They have built shrines to Baal, to put their children to the fire as burnt offerings to Baal—which I never commanded, never decreed, and which never came to My mind.
Transliteration: uvanu et-vamvot havaal lisherof et-veneyhem vaesh olvot lavaal asher lo-tsiviytiy velo divaretiy velo aletah al-liviy {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן הִנֵּֽה־יָמִ֤ים בָּאִים֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְלֹא־יִקָּרֵא֩ לַמָּק֨וֹם הַזֶּ֥ה ע֛וֹד הַתֹּ֖פֶת וְגֵ֣יא בֶן־הִנֹּ֑ם כִּ֖י אִם־גֵּ֥יא הַהֲרֵגָֽה׃
Translated: Assuredly, a time is coming—declares G<small>OD</small>—when this place shall no longer be called Topheth or Valley of Ben-hinnom, but Valley of Slaughter.
Transliteration: lakhen hineh-yamiym vaiym neum-yehovah velo-yikare lamakvom hazeh vod hatofet vegey ven-hinom khiy im-gey haharegah

Hebrew: וּ֠בַקֹּתִ֠י אֶת־עֲצַ֨ת יְהוּדָ֤ה וִירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ בַּמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה וְהִפַּלְתִּ֤ים בַּחֶ֙רֶב֙ לִפְנֵ֣י אֹֽיְבֵיהֶ֔ם וּבְיַ֖ד מְבַקְשֵׁ֣י נַפְשָׁ֑ם וְנָתַתִּ֤י אֶת־נִבְלָתָם֙ לְמַֽאֲכָ֔ל לְע֥וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וּלְבֶהֱמַ֥ת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: “And I will frustrate the plans of Judah and Jerusalem in this place. I will cause them to fall by the sword before their enemies, by the hand of those who seek their lives; and I will give their carcasses as food to the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth.
Transliteration: uvakotiy et-atsat yehudah viyrushala͏im vamakvom hazeh vehifaletiym vacherev lifeney oyeveyhem uveyad mevakeshey nafesham venatatiy et-nivelatam lemaakhal levof hashamayiim ulevehemat haarets

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּי֙ אֶת־הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את לְשַׁמָּ֖ה וְלִשְׁרֵקָ֑ה כֹּ֚ל עֹבֵ֣ר עָלֶ֔יהָ יִשֹּׁ֥ם וְיִשְׁרֹ֖ק עַל־כׇּל־מַכֹּתֶֽהָ׃
Translated: And I will make this city an object of horror and hissing; everyone who passes by it will be appalled and will hiss over all its wounds.
Transliteration: veshametiy et-haiyr hazot leshamah velisherekah khol over aleyha yishom veyisherok al-khׇl-makhoteha

Hebrew: וְהַאֲכַלְתִּ֞ים אֶת־בְּשַׂ֣ר בְּנֵיהֶ֗ם וְאֵת֙ בְּשַׂ֣ר בְּנֹתֵיהֶ֔ם וְאִ֥ישׁ בְּשַׂר־רֵעֵ֖הוּ יֹאכֵ֑לוּ בְּמָצוֹר֙ וּבְמָצ֔וֹק אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָצִ֧יקוּ לָהֶ֛ם אֹיְבֵיהֶ֖ם וּמְבַקְשֵׁ֥י נַפְשָֽׁם׃
Translated: And I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters, and they shall devour one another’s flesh—because of the desperate straits to which they will be reduced by their enemies, who seek their life.”
Transliteration: vehaakhaletiym et-veshar veneyhem veet veshar venoteyhem veiysh veshar-reehu yokhelu vematsvor uvematsvok asher yatsiyku lahem oyeveyhem umevakeshey nafesham

Hebrew: וְשָׁבַרְתָּ֖ הַבַּקְבֻּ֑ק לְעֵינֵי֙ הָאֲנָשִׁ֔ים הַהֹלְכִ֖ים אוֹתָֽךְ׃
Translated: Then you shall smash the jug in the sight of those who go with you,
Transliteration: veshavareta havakevuk leeyney haanashiym haholekhiym votakhe

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֨ אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֗וֹת כָּ֣כָה אֶשְׁבֹּ֞ר אֶת־הָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ וְאֶת־הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר יִשְׁבֹּר֙ אֶת־כְּלִ֣י הַיּוֹצֵ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־יוּכַ֥ל לְהֵרָפֵ֖ה ע֑וֹד וּבְתֹ֣פֶת יִקְבְּר֔וּ מֵאֵ֥ין מָק֖וֹם לִקְבּֽוֹר׃
Translated: and say to them: “Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts: So will I smash this people and this city, as one smashes a potter’s vessel, which can never be mended. And they shall bury in Topheth until no room is left for burying.
Transliteration: veamareta aleyhem khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot khakhah eshevor et-haam hazeh veet-haiyr hazot khaasher yishevor et-kheliy hayyvotser asher lo-yukhal leherafeh vod uvetofet yikeveru meeyn makvom likevvor

Hebrew: כֵּֽן־אֶעֱשֶׂ֞ה לַמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּ֛ה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֖ה וּלְיֽוֹשְׁבָ֑יו וְלָתֵ֛ת אֶת־הָעִ֥יר הַזֹּ֖את כְּתֹֽפֶת׃
Translated: That is what I will do to this place and its inhabitants—declares G<small>OD</small>. I will make this city like Topheth:
Transliteration: khen-eesheh lamakvom hazeh neum-yehovah uleyvoshevayv velatet et-haiyr hazot khetofet

Hebrew: וְהָי֞וּ בָּתֵּ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם וּבָתֵּי֙ מַלְכֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה כִּמְק֥וֹם הַתֹּ֖פֶת הַטְּמֵאִ֑ים לְכֹ֣ל הַבָּתִּ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר קִטְּר֜וּ עַל־גַּגֹּֽתֵיהֶם֙ לְכֹל֙ צְבָ֣א הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְהַסֵּ֥ךְ נְסָכִ֖ים לֵאלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: the houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah shall be impure, like that place Topheth—all the houses on the roofs of which offerings were made to the whole host of heaven and libations were poured out to other gods.”
Transliteration: vehayu vatey yerushala͏im uvatey malekhey yehudah khimekvom hatofet hatemeiym lekhol havatiym asher kiteru al-gagoteyhem lekhol tseva hashamayiim vehasekhe nesakhiym lelohiym acheriym {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א יִרְמְיָ֙הוּ֙ מֵֽהַתֹּ֔פֶת אֲשֶׁ֨ר שְׁלָח֧וֹ יְהֹוָ֛ה שָׁ֖ם לְהִנָּבֵ֑א וַֽיַּעֲמֹד֙ בַּחֲצַ֣ר בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֶל־כׇּל־הָעָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: When Jeremiah returned from Topheth, where G<small>OD</small> had sent him to prophesy, he stood in the court of the House of G<small>OD</small> and said to all the people:
Transliteration: vayavo yiremeyahu mehatofet asher shelachvo yehovah sham lehinave vayaamod vachatsar veyt-yehovah vayomer el-khׇl-haam {s}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הִנְנִ֨י מֵבִ֜י אֶל־הָעִ֤יר הַזֹּאת֙ וְעַל־כׇּל־עָרֶ֔יהָ אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הָ֣רָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי עָלֶ֑יהָ כִּ֤י הִקְשׁוּ֙ אֶת־עׇרְפָּ֔ם לְבִלְתִּ֖י שְׁמ֥וֹעַ אֶת־דְּבָרָֽי׃
Translated: “Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to bring upon this city and upon all its villages all the disaster that I have decreed against it, for they have stiffened their necks and refused to heed My words.”
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael hineniy meviy el-haiyr hazot veal-khׇl-areyha et khׇl-haraah asher divaretiy aleyha khiy hikeshu et-ׇrefam leviletiy shemvoa et-devaray

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע פַּשְׁחוּר֙ בֶּן־אִמֵּ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְהוּא־פָקִ֥יד נָגִ֖יד בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה אֶֽת־יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ נִבָּ֖א אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: Pashhur son of Immer, the priest who was chief officer of the House of G<small>OD</small>, heard Jeremiah prophesy these things.
Transliteration: vayishema fashechur ven-imer hakhohen vehu-fakiyd nagiyd veveyt yehovah et-yiremeyahu niva et-hadevariym haeleh

Hebrew: וַיַּכֶּ֣ה פַשְׁח֔וּר אֵ֖ת יִרְמְיָ֣הוּ הַנָּבִ֑יא וַיִּתֵּ֨ן אֹת֜וֹ עַל־הַמַּהְפֶּ֗כֶת אֲשֶׁ֨ר בְּשַׁ֤עַר בִּנְיָמִן֙ הָֽעֶלְי֔וֹן אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּבֵ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Pashhur thereupon had Jeremiah flogged and put in the cell at the Upper Benjamin Gate in the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayakheh fashechur et yiremeyahu hanaviy vayiten otvo al-hamahefekhet asher veshaar vineyamin haeleyvon asher veveyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֔ת וַיֹּצֵ֥א פַשְׁח֛וּר אֶֽת־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ מִן־הַמַּהְפָּ֑כֶת וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו יִרְמְיָ֗הוּ לֹ֤א פַשְׁחוּר֙ קָרָ֤א יְהֹוָה֙ שְׁמֶ֔ךָ כִּ֖י אִם־מָג֥וֹר מִסָּבִֽיב׃ {ס}
Translated:
The next day, Pashhur released Jeremiah from the cell.
But Jeremiah said to him, “GOD has named you not Pashhur, but Magor-missabib.
Transliteration: vayehiy mimׇchorat vayotse fashechur et-yiremeyahu min-hamahefakhet vayomer elayv yiremeyahu lo fashechur kara yehovah shemekha khiy im-magvor misaviyv {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֣ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֡ה הִנְנִי֩ נֹתֶנְךָ֨ לְמָג֜וֹר לְךָ֣ וּלְכׇל־אֹהֲבֶ֗יךָ וְנָ֥פְל֛וּ בְּחֶ֥רֶב אֹיְבֵיהֶ֖ם וְעֵינֶ֣יךָ רֹא֑וֹת וְאֶת־כׇּל־יְהוּדָ֗ה אֶתֵּן֙ בְּיַ֣ד מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֔ל וְהִגְלָ֥ם בָּבֶ֖לָה וְהִכָּ֥ם בֶּחָֽרֶב׃
Translated: For thus said G<small>OD</small>: I am going to deliver you and all your friends over to terror: they will fall by the sword of their enemies while you look on. I will deliver all Judah into the hands of the king of Babylon; he will exile them to Babylon or put them to the sword.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar yehovah hineniy notenekha lemagvor lekha ulekhׇl-ohaveykha venafelu vecherev oyeveyhem veeyneykha rovot veet-khׇl-yehudah eten veyad melekhe-vavel vehigelam vavelah vehikham vecharev

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֗י אֶת־כׇּל־חֹ֙סֶן֙ הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את וְאֶת־כׇּל־יְגִיעָ֖הּ וְאֶת־כׇּל־יְקָרָ֑הּ וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־אוֹצְר֜וֹת מַלְכֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֗ה אֶתֵּן֙ בְּיַ֣ד אֹֽיְבֵיהֶ֔ם וּבְזָזוּם֙ וּלְקָח֔וּם וֶהֱבִיא֖וּם בָּבֶֽלָה׃
Translated: And I will deliver all the wealth, all the riches, and all the prized possessions of this city, and I will also deliver all the treasures of the kings of Judah into the hands of their enemies: they shall seize them as plunder and carry them off to Babylon.
Transliteration: venatatiy et-khׇl-chosen haiyr hazot veet-khׇl-yegiyah veet-khׇl-yekarah veet khׇl-votservot malekhey yehudah eten veyad oyeveyhem uvezazum ulekachum veheviyum vavelah

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה פַשְׁח֗וּר וְכֹל֙ יֹשְׁבֵ֣י בֵיתֶ֔ךָ תֵּלְכ֖וּ בַּשֶּׁ֑בִי וּבָבֶ֣ל תָּב֗וֹא וְשָׁ֤ם תָּמוּת֙ וְשָׁ֣ם תִּקָּבֵ֔ר אַתָּה֙ וְכׇל־אֹֽהֲבֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁר־נִבֵּ֥אתָ לָהֶ֖ם בַּשָּֽׁקֶר׃ {פ}
Translated: As for you, Pashhur, and all who live in your house, you shall go into captivity. You shall come to Babylon; there you shall die and there you shall be buried, and so shall all your friends to whom you prophesied falsely.”
Transliteration: veatah fashechur vekhol yoshevey veytekha telekhu vasheviy uvavel tavvo vesham tamut vesham tikaver atah vekhׇl-ohaveykha asher-niveta lahem vashaker {f}

Hebrew: פִּתִּיתַ֤נִי יְהֹוָה֙ וָאֶפָּ֔ת חֲזַקְתַּ֖נִי וַתּוּכָ֑ל הָיִ֤יתִי לִשְׂחוֹק֙ כׇּל־הַיּ֔וֹם כֻּלֹּ֖ה לֹעֵ֥ג לִֽי׃
Translated:
You enticed me, O ETERNAL One, and I was enticed;
You overpowered me and You prevailed.
I have become a constant laughingstock,
Everyone jeers at me.
Transliteration: fitiytaniy yehovah vaefat chazaketaniy vatukhal hayiytiy lishechvok khׇl-hayyvom khuloh loeg liy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־מִדֵּ֤י אֲדַבֵּר֙ אֶזְעָ֔ק חָמָ֥ס וָשֹׁ֖ד אֶקְרָ֑א כִּֽי־הָיָ֨ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֥ה לִ֛י לְחֶרְפָּ֥ה וּלְקֶ֖לֶס כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated:
For every time I speak, I must cry out,
Must shout, “Lawlessness and rapine!”
For the word of GOD causes me
Constant disgrace and contempt.
Transliteration: khiy-midey adaver ezeak chamas vashod ekera khiy-hayah devar-yehovah liy lecherefah ulekeles khׇl-hayyvom

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתִּ֣י לֹֽא־אֶזְכְּרֶ֗נּוּ וְלֹֽא־אֲדַבֵּ֥ר עוֹד֙ בִּשְׁמ֔וֹ וְהָיָ֤ה בְלִבִּי֙ כְּאֵ֣שׁ בֹּעֶ֔רֶת עָצֻ֖ר בְּעַצְמֹתָ֑י וְנִלְאֵ֥יתִי כַּֽלְכֵ֖ל וְלֹ֥א אוּכָֽל׃
Translated:
I thought, “I will not mention it,
No more will I speak in God’s name”—
But [the divine word] was like a raging fire in my heart,
Shut up in my bones;
I could not hold it in, I was helpless.
Transliteration: veamaretiy lo-ezekherenu velo-adaver vod vishemvo vehayah veliviy kheesh voeret atsur veatsemotay venileeytiy khalekhel velo ukhal

Hebrew: כִּ֣י שָׁמַ֜עְתִּי דִּבַּ֣ת רַבִּים֮ מָג֣וֹר מִסָּבִיב֒ הַגִּ֙ידוּ֙ וְנַגִּידֶ֔נּוּ כֹּ֚ל אֱנ֣וֹשׁ שְׁלֹמִ֔י שֹׁמְרֵ֖י צַלְעִ֑י אוּלַ֤י יְפֻתֶּה֙ וְנ֣וּכְלָה ל֔וֹ וְנִקְחָ֥ה נִקְמָתֵ֖נוּ מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
I heard the whispers of the crowd—
Terror all around:
“Inform! Let us inform against him!”
All my [supposed] friends
Are waiting for me to stumble:
“Perhaps he can be entrapped,
And we can prevail against him
And take our vengeance on him.”
Transliteration: khiy shamaetiy divat raviym magvor misaviyv hagiydu venagiydenu khol envosh shelomiy shomerey tsaleiy ulay yefuteh venukhelah lvo venikechah nikematenu mimenu

Hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֤ה אוֹתִי֙ כְּגִבּ֣וֹר עָרִ֔יץ עַל־כֵּ֛ן רֹדְפַ֥י יִכָּשְׁל֖וּ וְלֹ֣א יֻכָ֑לוּ בֹּ֤שֽׁוּ מְאֹד֙ כִּי־לֹ֣א הִשְׂכִּ֔ילוּ כְּלִמַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם לֹ֥א תִשָּׁכֵֽחַ׃
Translated:
But GOD is with me like a mighty warrior;
Therefore my persecutors shall stumble;
They shall not prevail and shall not succeed.
They shall be utterly shamed
With a humiliation for all time,
Which shall not be forgotten.
Transliteration: vayhovah votiy khegivvor ariyts al-khen rodefay yikhashelu velo yukhalu voshu meod khiy-lo hishekhiylu khelimat volam lo tishakhecha

Hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ בֹּחֵ֣ן צַדִּ֔יק רֹאֶ֥ה כְלָי֖וֹת וָלֵ֑ב אֶרְאֶ֤ה נִקְמָֽתְךָ֙ מֵהֶ֔ם כִּ֥י אֵלֶ֖יךָ גִּלִּ֥יתִי אֶת־רִיבִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
O GOD of Hosts, You who test the righteous,
Who examine the heart and the mind,
Let me see Your retribution upon them,
For I lay my case before You.
Transliteration: vayhovah tsevavot vochen tsadiyk roeh khelayvot valev ereeh nikematekha mehem khiy eleykha giliytiy et-riyviy {s}

Hebrew: שִׁ֚ירוּ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה הַֽלְל֖וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֥י הִצִּ֛יל אֶת־נֶ֥פֶשׁ אֶבְי֖וֹן מִיַּ֥ד מְרֵעִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
Sing unto GOD,
Praise GOD—
Who has rescued the needy
From the hands of evildoers!
Transliteration: shiyru layhovah halelu et-yehovah khiy hitsiyl et-nefesh eveyvon miyad mereiym {s}

Hebrew: אָר֣וּר הַיּ֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֻלַּ֖דְתִּי בּ֑וֹ י֛וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יְלָדַ֥תְנִי אִמִּ֖י אַל־יְהִ֥י בָרֽוּךְ׃
Translated:
Accursed be the day
That I was born!
Let not the day be blessed
When my mother bore me!
Transliteration: arur hayyvom asher yuladetiy vvo yvom asher-yeladateniy imiy al-yehiy varukhe

Hebrew: אָר֣וּר הָאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר בִּשַּׂ֤ר אֶת־אָבִי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר יֻֽלַּד־לְךָ֖ בֵּ֣ן זָכָ֑ר שַׂמֵּ֖חַ שִׂמְּחָֽהוּ׃
Translated:
Accursed be the man
Who brought my father the news
And said, “A boy
Is born to you,”
And gave him such joy!
Transliteration: arur haiysh asher vishar et-aviy lemor yulad-lekha ven zakhar shamecha shimechahu

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ הָאִ֣ישׁ הַה֔וּא כֶּעָרִ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־הָפַ֥ךְ יְהֹוָ֖ה וְלֹ֣א נִחָ֑ם וְשָׁמַ֤ע זְעָקָה֙ בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וּתְרוּעָ֖ה בְּעֵ֥ת צׇהֳרָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Let that man become like the cities
That GOD overthrew without relenting!
Let him hear shrieks in the morning
And battle shouts at noontide—
Transliteration: vehayah haiysh hahu kheariym asher-hafakhe yehovah velo nicham veshama zeakah vavoker uteruah veet tsׇhorayiim

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־מוֹתְתַ֖נִי מֵרָ֑חֶם וַתְּהִי־לִ֤י אִמִּי֙ קִבְרִ֔י וְרַחְמָ֖הֿ הֲרַ֥ת עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
Because [God] did not kill me before birth
So that my mother might be my grave,
And her womb big [with me] for all time.
Transliteration: asher lo-mvotetaniy merachem vatehiy-liy imiy kiveriy verachemahֿ harat volam

Hebrew: לָ֤מָּה זֶּה֙ מֵרֶ֣חֶם יָצָ֔אתִי לִרְא֥וֹת עָמָ֖ל וְיָג֑וֹן וַיִּכְל֥וּ בְּבֹ֖שֶׁת יָמָֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
Why did I ever issue from the womb,
To see misery and woe,
To spend all my days in shame!
Transliteration: lamah zeh merechem yatsatiy lirevot amal veyagvon vayikhelu vevoshet yamay {f}

Hebrew: הַדָּבָ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֥ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה בִּשְׁלֹ֨חַ אֵלָ֜יו הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ צִדְקִיָּ֗הוּ אֶת־פַּשְׁחוּר֙ בֶּן־מַלְכִּיָּ֔ה וְאֶת־צְפַנְיָ֧ה בֶן־מַעֲשֵׂיָ֛ה הַכֹּהֵ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word that came to Jeremiah from G<small>OD</small>—when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur son of Malchiah and the priest Zephaniah, son of Maaseiah, to say,
Transliteration: hadavar asher-hayah el-yiremeyahu meet yehovah vishelocha elayv hamelekhe tsidekiyahu et-fashechur ven-malekhiyah veet-tsefaneyah ven-maasheyah hakhohen lemor

Hebrew: דְּרׇשׁ־נָ֤א בַעֲדֵ֙נוּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֛י נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֥ר מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל נִלְחָ֣ם עָלֵ֑ינוּ אוּלַי֩ יַעֲשֶׂ֨ה יְהֹוָ֤ה אוֹתָ֙נוּ֙ כְּכׇל־נִפְלְאֹתָ֔יו וְיַעֲלֶ֖ה מֵעָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: “Please inquire of G<small>OD</small> on our behalf, for King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon is attacking us. Perhaps G<small>OD</small> will act for our sake in accordance with all the prior wonders, so that he will withdraw from us.”
Transliteration: derׇsh-na vaadenu et-yehovah khiy nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel nilecham aleynu ulay yaasheh yehovah votanu khekhׇl-nifeleotayv veyaaleh mealeynu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ אֲלֵיהֶ֑ם כֹּ֥ה תֹאמְרֻ֖ן אֶל־צִדְקִיָּֽהוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Jeremiah answered them, “Thus shall you say to Zedekiah:
Transliteration: vayomer yiremeyahu aleyhem khoh tomerun el-tsidekiyahu {s}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הִנְנִ֣י מֵסֵב֮ אֶת־כְּלֵ֣י הַמִּלְחָמָה֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּיֶדְכֶם֒ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתֶּ֜ם נִלְחָמִ֣ים בָּ֗ם אֶת־מֶ֤לֶךְ בָּבֶל֙ וְאֶת־הַכַּשְׂדִּ֔ים הַצָּרִ֣ים עֲלֵיכֶ֔ם מִח֖וּץ לַחוֹמָ֑ה וְאָסַפְתִּ֣י אוֹתָ֔ם אֶל־תּ֖וֹךְ הָעִ֥יר הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: I am going to turn around the weapons in your hands with which you are battling outside the wall against those who are besieging you—the king of Babylon and the Chaldeans—and I will take them into the midst of this city;
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael hineniy mesev et-kheley hamilechamah asher veyedekhem asher atem nilechamiym vam et-melekhe vavel veet-hakhashediym hatsariym aleykhem michuts lachvomah veasafetiy votam el-tvokhe haiyr hazot

Hebrew: וְנִלְחַמְתִּ֤י אֲנִי֙ אִתְּכֶ֔ם בְּיָ֥ד נְטוּיָ֖ה וּבִזְר֣וֹעַ חֲזָקָ֑ה וּבְאַ֥ף וּבְחֵמָ֖ה וּבְקֶ֥צֶף גָּדֽוֹל׃
Translated: and I Myself will battle against you with an outstretched mighty arm, with anger and rage and great wrath.
Transliteration: venilechametiy aniy itekhem veyad netuyah uvizervoa chazakah uveaf uvechemah uveketsef gadvol

Hebrew: וְהִכֵּיתִ֗י אֶת־יֽוֹשְׁבֵי֙ הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את וְאֶת־הָאָדָ֖ם וְאֶת־הַבְּהֵמָ֑ה בְּדֶ֥בֶר גָּד֖וֹל יָמֻֽתוּ׃
Translated: I will strike the inhabitants of this city, both human and animal: they shall die by a terrible pestilence.
Transliteration: vehikheytiy et-yvoshevey haiyr hazot veet-haadam veet-havehemah vedever gadvol yamutu

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֣ן נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֡ה אֶתֵּ֣ן אֶת־צִדְקִיָּ֣הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֣ה וְאֶת־עֲבָדָ֣יו ׀ וְאֶת־הָעָ֡ם וְאֶת־הַנִּשְׁאָרִים֩ בָּעִ֨יר הַזֹּ֜את מִן־הַדֶּ֣בֶר ׀ מִן־הַחֶ֣רֶב וּמִן־הָרָעָ֗ב בְּיַד֙ נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֣ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֔ל וּבְיַד֙ אֹֽיְבֵיהֶ֔ם וּבְיַ֖ד מְבַקְשֵׁ֣י נַפְשָׁ֑ם וְהִכָּ֣ם לְפִי־חֶ֔רֶב לֹא־יָח֣וּס עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם וְלֹ֥א יַחְמֹ֖ל וְלֹ֥א יְרַחֵֽם׃
Translated: And then—declares G<small>OD</small>—I will deliver King Zedekiah of Judah and his courtiers and the people—those in this city who survive the pestilence, the sword, and the famine—into the hands of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, into the hands of their enemies, into the hands of those who seek their lives. He will put them to the sword without pity, without compassion, without mercy.
Transliteration: veacharey-khen neum-yehovah eten et-tsidekiyahu melekhe-yehudah veet-avadayv veet-haam veet-hanisheariym vaiyr hazot min-hadever min-hacherev umin-haraav veyad nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel uveyad oyeveyhem uveyad mevakeshey nafesham vehikham lefiy-cherev lo-yachus aleyhem velo yachemol velo yerachem

Hebrew: וְאֶל־הָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ תֹּאמַ֔ר כֹּ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה הִנְנִ֤י נֹתֵן֙ לִפְנֵיכֶ֔ם אֶת־דֶּ֥רֶךְ הַחַיִּ֖ים וְאֶת־דֶּ֥רֶךְ הַמָּֽוֶת׃
Translated: “And to this people you shall say: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: I set before you the way of life and the way of death.
Transliteration: veel-haam hazeh tomar khoh amar yehovah hineniy noten lifeneykhem et-derekhe hachayiym veet-derekhe hamavet

Hebrew: הַיֹּשֵׁב֙ בָּעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את יָמ֕וּת בַּחֶ֖רֶב וּבָרָעָ֣ב וּבַדָּ֑בֶר וְהַיּוֹצֵא֩ וְנָפַ֨ל עַל־הַכַּשְׂדִּ֜ים הַצָּרִ֤ים עֲלֵיכֶם֙ (יחיה) [וְחָיָ֔ה] וְהָיְתָה־לּ֥וֹ נַפְשׁ֖וֹ לְשָׁלָֽל׃
Translated: Whoever remains in this city shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence; but whoever leaves and goes over to the Chaldeans who are besieging you shall live; he shall at least gain his life.
Transliteration: hayoshev vaiyr hazot yamut vacherev uvaraav uvadaver vehayyvotse venafal al-hakhashediym hatsariym aleykhem (ychyh) [vechayah] vehayetah-lvo nafeshvo leshalal

Hebrew: כִּ֣י שַׂ֣מְתִּי פָ֠נַי בָּעִ֨יר הַזֹּ֧את לְרָעָ֛ה וְלֹ֥א לְטוֹבָ֖ה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּיַד־מֶ֤לֶךְ בָּבֶל֙ תִּנָּתֵ֔ן וּשְׂרָפָ֖הּ בָּאֵֽשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated: For I have set My face against this city for evil and not for good—declares G<small>OD</small>. It shall be delivered into the hands of the king of Babylon, who will destroy it by fire.”
Transliteration: khiy shametiy fanay vaiyr hazot leraah velo letvovah neum-yehovah veyad-melekhe vavel tinaten usherafah vaesh {s}

Hebrew: וּלְבֵית֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה שִׁמְע֖וּ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: To the House of the king of Judah: Hear the word of G<small>OD</small>!
Transliteration: uleveyt melekhe yehudah shimeu devar-yehovah

Hebrew: בֵּ֣ית דָּוִ֗ד כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה דִּ֤ינוּ לַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ מִשְׁפָּ֔ט וְהַצִּ֥ילוּ גָז֖וּל מִיַּ֣ד עוֹשֵׁ֑ק פֶּן־תֵּצֵ֨א כָאֵ֜שׁ חֲמָתִ֗י וּבָֽעֲרָה֙ וְאֵ֣ין מְכַבֶּ֔ה מִפְּנֵ֖י רֹ֥עַ (מעלליהם) [מַעַלְלֵיכֶֽם]׃
Translated:
O House of David, thus said GOD:
Render just verdicts
Morning by morning;
Rescue from the defrauder
Anyone who is robbed.
Else My wrath will break forth like fire
And burn, with none to quench it,
Because of your wicked acts.
Transliteration: veyt david khoh amar yehovah diynu lavoker mishefat vehatsiylu gazul miyad voshek fen-tetse khaesh chamatiy uvaarah veeyn mekhaveh mifeney roa (mllyhm) [maaleleykhem]

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֨י אֵלַ֜יִךְ יֹשֶׁ֧בֶת הָעֵ֛מֶק צ֥וּר הַמִּישֹׁ֖ר נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה הָאֹֽמְרִים֙ מִֽי־יֵחַ֣ת עָלֵ֔ינוּ וּמִ֥י יָב֖וֹא בִּמְעוֹנוֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
I will deal with you, O inhabitants of the valley,
O rock of the plain—declares GOD—
You who say, “Who can come down against us?
Who can get into our lairs?”
Transliteration: hineniy elayiikhe yoshevet haemek tsur hamiyshor neum-yehovah haomeriym miy-eichat aleynu umiy yavvo vimevonvoteynu

Hebrew: וּפָקַדְתִּ֧י עֲלֵיכֶ֛ם כִּפְרִ֥י מַעַלְלֵיכֶ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְהִצַּ֤תִּי אֵשׁ֙ בְּיַעְרָ֔הּ וְאָכְלָ֖ה כׇּל־סְבִיבֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
I will punish you according to your deeds
—declares GOD.
I will set fire to its forest;
It shall consume all that is around it.
Transliteration: ufakadetiy aleykhem khiferiy maaleleykhem neum-yehovah vehitsatiy esh veyaerah veakhelah khׇl-seviyveyha

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה רֵ֖ד בֵּֽית־מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה וְדִבַּרְתָּ֣ שָׁ֔ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Go down to the palace of the king of Judah, where you shall utter this word.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah red veyt-melekhe yehudah vedivareta sham et-hadavar hazeh

Hebrew: וְאָֽמַרְתָּ֙ שְׁמַ֣ע דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה הַיֹּשֵׁ֖ב עַל־כִּסֵּ֣א דָוִ֑ד אַתָּ֤ה וַעֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ וְעַמְּךָ֔ הַבָּאִ֖ים בַּשְּׁעָרִ֥ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: Say: “Hear the word of G<small>OD</small>: O king of Judah, you who sit on the throne of David, and your courtiers and your subjects who enter these gates!
Transliteration: veamareta shema devar-yehovah melekhe yehudah hayoshev al-khise david atah vaavadeykha veamekha havaiym vasheariym haeleh

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה עֲשׂ֤וּ מִשְׁפָּט֙ וּצְדָקָ֔ה וְהַצִּ֥ילוּ גָז֖וּל מִיַּ֣ד עָשׁ֑וֹק וְגֵר֩ יָת֨וֹם וְאַלְמָנָ֤ה אַל־תֹּנוּ֙ אַל־תַּחְמֹ֔סוּ וְדָ֣ם נָקִ֔י אַֽל־תִּשְׁפְּכ֖וּ בַּמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Do what is just and right; rescue from the defrauder anyone who is robbed; do not wrong the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow; commit no lawless act, and do not shed the blood of the innocent in this place.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah ashu mishefat utsedakah vehatsiylu gazul miyad ashvok veger yatvom vealemanah al-tonu al-tachemosu vedam nakiy al-tishefekhu vamakvom hazeh

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אִם־עָשׂוֹ֙ תַּעֲשׂ֔וּ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּ֑ה וּבָ֣אוּ בְשַׁעֲרֵ֣י הַבַּ֣יִת הַזֶּ֡ה מְלָכִים֩ יֹשְׁבִ֨ים לְדָוִ֜ד עַל־כִּסְא֗וֹ רֹֽכְבִים֙ בָּרֶ֣כֶב וּבַסּוּסִ֔ים ה֥וּא וַעֲבָדָ֖ו וְעַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: For if you fulfill this command, then through the gates of this palace shall enter kings of David’s line who sit upon his throne, riding horse-drawn chariots, with their courtiers and their subjects.
Transliteration: khiy im-ashvo taashu et-hadavar hazeh uvau veshaarey havayiit hazeh melakhiym yosheviym ledavid al-khisevo rokheviym varekhev uvasusiym hu vaavadav veamvo

Hebrew: וְאִם֙ לֹ֣א תִשְׁמְע֔וּ אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה בִּ֤י נִשְׁבַּ֙עְתִּי֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּֽי־לְחׇרְבָּ֥ה יִֽהְיֶ֖ה הַבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: But if you do not heed these commands, I swear by Myself—declares G<small>OD</small>—that this palace shall become a ruin.”
Transliteration: veim lo tishemeu et-hadevariym haeleh viy nishevaetiy neum-yehovah khiy-lechׇrevah yiheyeh havayiit hazeh {f}

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה עַל־בֵּית֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה גִּלְעָ֥ד אַתָּ֛ה לִ֖י רֹ֣אשׁ הַלְּבָנ֑וֹן אִם־לֹ֤א אֲשִֽׁיתְךָ֙ מִדְבָּ֔ר עָרִ֖ים לֹ֥א (נושבה) [נוֹשָֽׁבוּ]׃
Translated:
For thus said GOD concerning the royal palace of Judah:
You are as Gilead to Me,
As the summit of Lebanon;
But I will make you a desert,
Uninhabited towns.
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah al-veyt melekhe yehudah gilead atah liy rosh halevanvon im-lo ashiytekha midevar ariym lo (nvshvh) [nvoshavu]

Hebrew: וְקִדַּשְׁתִּ֥י עָלֶ֛יךָ מַשְׁחִתִ֖ים אִ֣ישׁ וְכֵלָ֑יו וְכָֽרְתוּ֙ מִבְחַ֣ר אֲרָזֶ֔יךָ וְהִפִּ֖ילוּ עַל־הָאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
I will appoint destroyers against you,
Each with his tools;
They shall cut down your choicest cedars
And make them fall into the fire.
Transliteration: vekidashetiy aleykha mashechitiym iysh vekhelayv vekharetu mivechar arazeykha vehifiylu al-haesh

Hebrew: וְעָֽבְרוּ֙ גּוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֔ים עַ֖ל הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֑את וְאָֽמְרוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֔הוּ עַל־מֶ֨ה עָשָׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ כָּ֔כָה לָעִ֥יר הַגְּדוֹלָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: And when many nations pass by this city and people ask one another, “Why did G<small>OD</small> do thus to that great city?”
Transliteration: veaveru gvoyim raviym al haiyr hazot veameru iysh el-reehu al-meh ashah yehovah khakhah laiyr hagedvolah hazot

Hebrew: וְאָ֣מְר֔וּ עַ֚ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָזְב֔וּ אֶת־בְּרִ֥ית יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲו֛וּ לֵאלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִ֖ים וַיַּעַבְדֽוּם׃ {ס}
Translated: the reply will be, “Because they forsook the covenant with the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God and bowed down to other gods and served them.”
Transliteration: veameru al asher azevu et-veriyt yehovah eloheyhem vayishetachavu lelohiym acheriym vayaavedum {s}

Hebrew: אַל־תִּבְכּ֣וּ לְמֵ֔ת וְאַל־תָּנֻ֖דוּ ל֑וֹ בְּכ֤וּ בָכוֹ֙ לַהֹלֵ֔ךְ כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָשׁוּב֙ ע֔וֹד וְרָאָ֖ה אֶת־אֶ֥רֶץ מוֹלַדְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Do not weep for the dead
And do not lament for him;
Weep rather for him who is leaving,
For he shall never come back
To see the land of his birth!
Transliteration: al-tivekhu lemet veal-tanudu lvo vekhu vakhvo laholekhe khiy lo yashuv vod veraah et-erets mvoladetvo

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֣ה אָֽמַר־יְ֠הֹוָ֠ה אֶל־שַׁלֻּ֨ם בֶּן־יֹאשִׁיָּ֜הוּ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֗ה הַמֹּלֵךְ֙ תַּ֚חַת יֹאשִׁיָּ֣הוּ אָבִ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָצָ֖א מִן־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה לֹא־יָשׁ֥וּב שָׁ֖ם עֽוֹד׃
Translated: For thus said G<small>OD</small> concerning Shallum son of King Josiah of Judah, who succeeded his father Josiah as king, but who has gone forth from this place: He shall never come back.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar-yehovah el-shalum ven-yoshiyahu melekhe yehudah hamolekhe tachat yoshiyahu aviyv asher yatsa min-hamakvom hazeh lo-yashuv sham vod

Hebrew: כִּ֗י בִּמְק֛וֹם אֲשֶׁר־הִגְל֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ שָׁ֣ם יָמ֑וּת וְאֶת־הָאָ֥רֶץ הַזֹּ֖את לֹא־יִרְאֶ֥ה עֽוֹד׃ {ס}
Translated: He shall die in the place to which he was exiled, and he shall not see this land again.
Transliteration: khiy vimekvom asher-higelu otvo sham yamut veet-haarets hazot lo-yireeh vod {s}

Hebrew: ה֣וֹי בֹּנֶ֤ה בֵיתוֹ֙ בְּֽלֹא־צֶ֔דֶק וַעֲלִיּוֹתָ֖יו בְּלֹ֣א מִשְׁפָּ֑ט בְּרֵעֵ֙הוּ֙ יַעֲבֹ֣ד חִנָּ֔ם וּפֹעֲל֖וֹ לֹ֥א יִתֶּן־לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Ha! He who builds his house with unfairness
And his upper chambers with injustice,
Who makes his neighbors work without pay
And does not give them their wages,
Transliteration: hvoy voneh veytvo velo-tsedek vaaliyyvotayv velo mishefat vereehu yaavod chinam ufoalvo lo yiten-lvo

Hebrew: הָאֹמֵ֗ר אֶבְנֶה־לִּי֙ בֵּ֣ית מִדּ֔וֹת וַעֲלִיּ֖וֹת מְרֻוָּחִ֑ים וְקָ֤רַֽע לוֹ֙ חַלּוֹנָ֔י וְסָפ֣וּן בָּאָ֔רֶז וּמָשׁ֖וֹחַ בַּשָּׁשַֽׁר׃
Translated:
Who thinks: I will build me a vast palace
With spacious upper chambers,
Provided with windows,
Paneled in cedar,
Painted with vermilion!
Transliteration: haomer eveneh-liy veyt midvot vaaliyyvot meruvachiym vekara lvo chalvonay vesafun vaarez umashvocha vashashar

Hebrew: הֲתִֽמְלֹ֔ךְ כִּ֥י אַתָּ֖ה מְתַחֲרֶ֣ה בָאָ֑רֶז אָבִ֜יךָ הֲל֧וֹא אָכַ֣ל וְשָׁתָ֗ה וְעָשָׂ֤ה מִשְׁפָּט֙ וּצְדָקָ֔ה אָ֖ז ט֥וֹב לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Do you think you are more a king
Because you compete in cedar?
Your father ate and drank
And dispensed justice and equity—
Then all went well with him.
Transliteration: hatimelokhe khiy atah metachareh vaarez aviykha halvo akhal veshatah veashah mishefat utsedakah az tvov lvo

Hebrew: דָּ֛ן דִּין־עָנִ֥י וְאֶבְי֖וֹן אָ֣ז ט֑וֹב הֲלוֹא־הִ֛יא הַדַּ֥עַת אֹתִ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
He upheld the rights of the poor and needy—
Then all was well.
That is truly heeding Me
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: dan diyn-aniy veeveyvon az tvov halvo-hiy hadaat otiy neum-yehovah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אֵ֤ין עֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ וְלִבְּךָ֔ כִּ֖י אִם־עַל־בִּצְעֶ֑ךָ וְעַ֤ל דַּֽם־הַנָּקִי֙ לִשְׁפּ֔וֹךְ וְעַל־הָעֹ֥שֶׁק וְעַל־הַמְּרוּצָ֖ה לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated:
But your eyes and your mind are only
On ill-gotten gains,
On shedding the blood of the innocent,
On committing fraud and violence.
Transliteration: khiy eyn eyneykha velivekha khiy im-al-vitseekha veal dam-hanakiy lishefvokhe veal-haoshek veal-hamerutsah laashvot {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶל־יְהוֹיָקִ֤ים בֶּן־יֹאשִׁיָּ֙הוּ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה לֹא־יִסְפְּד֣וּ ל֔וֹ ה֥וֹי אָחִ֖י וְה֣וֹי אָח֑וֹת לֹא־יִסְפְּד֣וּ ל֔וֹ ה֥וֹי אָד֖וֹן וְה֥וֹי הֹדֹֽה׃
Translated:
Assuredly, thus said GOD concerning Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah:
They shall not mourn for him,
“Ah, brother! Ah, sister!”
They shall not mourn for him,
“Ah, lord! Ah, his majesty!”
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah el-yehvoyakiym ven-yoshiyahu melekhe yehudah lo-yisefedu lvo hvoy achiy vehvoy achvot lo-yisefedu lvo hvoy advon vehvoy hodoh

Hebrew: קְבוּרַ֥ת חֲמ֖וֹר יִקָּבֵ֑ר סָח֣וֹב וְהַשְׁלֵ֔ךְ מֵהָ֖לְאָה לְשַׁעֲרֵ֥י יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated:
He shall have the burial of a donkey,
Dragged out and left lying
Outside the gates of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: kevurat chamvor yikaver sachvov vehashelekhe mehaleah leshaarey yerushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: עֲלִ֤י הַלְּבָנוֹן֙ וּֽצְעָ֔קִי וּבַבָּשָׁ֖ן תְּנִ֣י קוֹלֵ֑ךְ וְצַֽעֲקִי֙ מֵעֲבָרִ֔ים כִּ֥י נִשְׁבְּר֖וּ כׇּל־מְאַהֲבָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
Climb Lebanon and cry out,
Raise your voice in Bashan,
Cry out from Abarim,
For all your lovers are crushed.
Transliteration: aliy halevanvon utseakiy uvavashan teniy kvolekhe vetsaakiy meavariym khiy nisheveru khׇl-meahavayiikhe

Hebrew: דִּבַּ֤רְתִּי אֵלַ֙יִךְ֙ בְּשַׁלְוֺתַ֔יִךְ אָמַ֖רְתְּ לֹ֣א אֶשְׁמָ֑ע זֶ֤ה דַרְכֵּךְ֙ מִנְּעוּרַ֔יִךְ כִּ֥י לֹא־שָׁמַ֖עַתְּ בְּקוֹלִֽי׃
Translated:
I spoke to you when you were prosperous;
You said, “I will not listen.”
That was your way ever since your youth,
You would not heed Me.
Transliteration: divaretiy elayiikhe veshalevotayiikhe amarete lo eshema zeh darekhekhe mineurayiikhe khiy lo-shamaate vekvoliy

Hebrew: כׇּל־רֹעַ֙יִךְ֙ תִּרְעֶה־ר֔וּחַ וּֽמְאַהֲבַ֖יִךְ בַּשְּׁבִ֣י יֵלֵ֑כוּ כִּ֣י אָ֤ז תֵּבֹ֙שִׁי֙ וְנִכְלַ֔מְתְּ מִכֹּ֖ל רָעָתֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
All your shepherds shall be devoured by the wind,
And your lovers shall go into captivity.
Then you shall be shamed and humiliated
Because of all your depravity.
Transliteration: khׇl-roayiikhe tireeh-rucha umeahavayiikhe vasheviy eilekhu khiy az tevoshiy venikhelamete mikhol raatekhe

Hebrew: (ישבתי) [יֹשַׁבְתְּ֙] בַּלְּבָנ֔וֹן (מקננתי) [מְקֻנַּ֖נְתְּ] בָּאֲרָזִ֑ים מַה־נֵּחַנְתְּ֙ בְּבֹא־לָ֣ךְ חֲבָלִ֔ים חִ֖יל כַּיֹּלֵדָֽה׃
Translated:
You who dwell in Lebanon,
Nestled among the cedars,
How much grace will you have
When pains come upon you,
Travail as in childbirth!
Transliteration: (yshvty) [yoshavete] valevanvon (mknnty) [mekunanete] vaaraziym mah-nechanete vevo-lakhe chavaliym chiyl khayoledah

Hebrew: חַי־אָ֘נִי֮ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָה֒ כִּ֣י אִם־יִהְיֶ֞ה כׇּנְיָ֤הוּ בֶן־יְהֽוֹיָקִים֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה חוֹתָ֖ם עַל־יַ֣ד יְמִינִ֑י כִּ֥י מִשָּׁ֖ם אֶתְּקֶֽנְךָּ׃
Translated: As I live—declares G<small>OD</small>—if you, O King Coniah, son of Jehoiakim, of Judah, were a signet on my right hand, I would tear you off even from there.
Transliteration: chay-aniy neum-yehovah khiy im-yiheyeh khׇneyahu ven-yehvoyakiym melekhe yehudah chvotam al-yad yemiyniy khiy misham etekenekha

Hebrew: וּנְתַתִּ֗יךָ בְּיַד֙ מְבַקְשֵׁ֣י נַפְשֶׁ֔ךָ וּבְיַ֛ד אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה יָג֖וֹר מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם וּבְיַ֛ד נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֥ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל וּבְיַ֥ד הַכַּשְׂדִּֽים׃
Translated: I will deliver you into the hands of those who seek your life, into the hands of those you dread, into the hands of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon and into the hands of the Chaldeans.
Transliteration: unetatiykha veyad mevakeshey nafeshekha uveyad asher-atah yagvor mifeneyhem uveyad nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel uveyad hakhashediym

Hebrew: וְהֵטַלְתִּ֣י אֹתְךָ֗ וְאֶֽת־אִמְּךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יְלָדַ֔תְךָ עַ֚ל הָאָ֣רֶץ אַחֶ֔רֶת אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יֻלַּדְתֶּ֖ם שָׁ֑ם וְשָׁ֖ם תָּמֽוּתוּ׃
Translated: I will hurl you and the mother who bore you into another land, where you were not born; there you shall both die.
Transliteration: vehetaletiy otekha veet-imekha asher yeladatekha al haarets acheret asher lo-yuladetem sham vesham tamutu

Hebrew: וְעַל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֛ם מְנַשְּׂאִ֥ים אֶת־נַפְשָׁ֖ם לָשׁ֣וּב שָׁ֑ם שָׁ֖מָּה לֹ֥א יָשֽׁוּבוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: They shall not return to the land that they yearn to come back to.
Transliteration: veal-haarets asher-hem menasheiym et-nafesham lashuv sham shamah lo yashuvu {f}

Hebrew: הַעֶ֨צֶב נִבְזֶ֜ה נָפ֗וּץ הָאִ֤ישׁ הַזֶּה֙ כׇּנְיָ֔הוּ אִ֨ם־כְּלִ֔י אֵ֥ין חֵ֖פֶץ בּ֑וֹ מַדּ֤וּעַ הֽוּטְלוּ֙ ה֣וּא וְזַרְע֔וֹ וְהֻ֨שְׁלְכ֔וּ עַל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יָדָֽעוּ׃
Translated:
Is this man Coniah
A wretched broken pot,
A vessel no one wants?
Why are he and his offspring hurled out,
And cast away in a land they knew not?
Transliteration: haetsev nivezeh nafuts haiysh hazeh khׇneyahu im-kheliy eyn chefets vvo madua hutelu hu vezarevo vehushelekhu al-haarets asher lo-yadau

Hebrew: אֶ֥רֶץ אֶ֖רֶץ אָ֑רֶץ שִׁמְעִ֖י דְּבַר־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
O land, land, land,
Hear the word of GOD!
Transliteration: erets erets arets shimeiy devar-yehovah

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה כִּתְב֞וּ אֶת־הָאִ֤ישׁ הַזֶּה֙ עֲרִירִ֔י גֶּ֖בֶר לֹא־יִצְלַ֣ח בְּיָמָ֑יו כִּי֩ לֹ֨א יִצְלַ֜ח מִזַּרְע֗וֹ אִ֚ישׁ יֹשֵׁב֙ עַל־כִּסֵּ֣א דָוִ֔ד וּמֹשֵׁ֥ל ע֖וֹד בִּיהוּדָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
Record this man as without succession,
One who shall never be found acceptable;
For none of his offspring shall be accepted
To sit on the throne of David
And to rule again in Judah.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah khitevu et-haiysh hazeh ariyriy gever lo-yitselach veyamayv khiy lo yitselach mizarevo iysh yoshev al-khise david umoshel vod viyhudah {f}

Hebrew: ה֣וֹי רֹעִ֗ים מְאַבְּדִ֧ים וּמְפִצִ֛ים אֶת־צֹ֥אן מַרְעִיתִ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Ah, shepherds who let the flock of My pasture stray and scatter!—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: hvoy roiym meavediym umefitsiym et-tson mareiytiy neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: לָ֠כֵ֠ן כֹּה־אָמַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל עַֽל־הָרֹעִים֮ הָרֹעִ֣ים אֶת־עַמִּי֒ אַתֶּ֞ם הֲפִצֹתֶ֤ם אֶת־צֹאנִי֙ וַתַּדִּח֔וּם וְלֹ֥א פְקַדְתֶּ֖ם אֹתָ֑ם הִנְנִ֨י פֹקֵ֧ד עֲלֵיכֶ֛ם אֶת־רֹ֥עַ מַעַלְלֵיכֶ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, concerning the shepherds who should tend My people: It is you who let My flock scatter and go astray. You gave no thought to them, but I am going to give thought to you, for your wicked acts—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael al-haroiym haroiym et-amiy atem hafitsotem et-tsoniy vatadichum velo fekadetem otam hineniy foked aleykhem et-roa maaleleykhem neum-yehovah

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י אֲקַבֵּץ֙ אֶת־שְׁאֵרִ֣ית צֹאנִ֔י מִכֹּל֙ הָאֲרָצ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁר־הִדַּ֥חְתִּי אֹתָ֖ם שָׁ֑ם וַהֲשִׁבֹתִ֥י אֶתְהֶ֛ן עַל־נְוֵהֶ֖ן וּפָר֥וּ וְרָבֽוּ׃
Translated: And I Myself will gather the remnant of My flock from all the lands to which I have banished them, and I will bring them back to their pasture, where they shall be fertile and increase.
Transliteration: vaaniy akavets et-sheeriyt tsoniy mikhol haaratsvot asher-hidachetiy otam sham vahashivotiy etehen al-nevehen ufaru veravu

Hebrew: וַהֲקִמֹתִ֧י עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם רֹעִ֖ים וְרָע֑וּם וְלֹא־יִֽירְא֨וּ ע֧וֹד וְלֹא־יֵחַ֛תּוּ וְלֹ֥א יִפָּקֵ֖דוּ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: And I will appoint over them shepherds who will tend them; they shall no longer fear or be dismayed, and none of them shall be missing—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vahakimotiy aleyhem roiym veraum velo-yiyreu vod velo-eichatu velo yifakedu neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֨ה יָמִ֤ים בָּאִים֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַהֲקִמֹתִ֥י לְדָוִ֖ד צֶ֣מַח צַדִּ֑יק וּמָ֤לַךְ מֶ֙לֶךְ֙ וְהִשְׂכִּ֔יל וְעָשָׂ֛ה מִשְׁפָּ֥ט וּצְדָקָ֖ה בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: See, a time is coming—declares G<small>OD</small>—when I will raise up a true branch of David’s line. He shall reign as king and shall prosper, and he shall do what is just and right in the land.
Transliteration: hineh yamiym vaiym neum-yehovah vahakimotiy ledavid tsemach tsadiyk umalakhe melekhe vehishekhiyl veashah mishefat utsedakah vaarets

Hebrew: בְּיָמָיו֙ תִּוָּשַׁ֣ע יְהוּדָ֔ה וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל יִשְׁכֹּ֣ן לָבֶ֑טַח וְזֶה־שְּׁמ֥וֹ אֲֽשֶׁר־יִקְרְא֖וֹ יְהֹוָ֥ה ׀ צִדְקֵֽנוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: In his days Judah shall be delivered and Israel shall dwell secure. And this is the name by which he shall be called: “G<small>OD</small> is our Vindicator.”
Transliteration: veyamayv tivasha yehudah veyisherael yishekhon lavetach vezeh-shemvo asher-yikerevo yehovah tsidekenu {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֛ן הִנֵּה־יָמִ֥ים בָּאִ֖ים נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹא־יֹ֤אמְרוּ עוֹד֙ חַי־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר הֶעֱלָ֛ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Assuredly, a time is coming—declares G<small>OD</small>—when it shall no more be said, “As G<small>OD</small> lives, who brought the Israelites out of the land of Egypt,”
Transliteration: lakhen hineh-yamiym vaiym neum-yehovah velo-yomeru vod chay-yehovah asher heelah et-veney yisherael meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־חַי־יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֶעֱלָה֩ וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵבִ֜יא אֶת־זֶ֨רַע בֵּ֤ית יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ צָפ֔וֹנָה וּמִכֹּל֙ הָאֲרָצ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִדַּחְתִּ֖ים שָׁ֑ם וְיָשְׁב֖וּ עַל־אַדְמָתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: but rather, “As G<small>OD</small> lives, who brought out and led the offspring of the House of Israel from the northland and from all the lands to which I have banished them.” And they shall dwell upon their own soil.
Transliteration: khiy im-chay-yehovah asher heelah vaasher heviy et-zera veyt yisherael meerets tsafvonah umikhol haaratsvot asher hidachetiym sham veyashevu al-adematam {f}

Hebrew: לַנְּבִאִ֞ים נִשְׁבַּ֧ר לִבִּ֣י בְקִרְבִּ֗י רָֽחֲפוּ֙ כׇּל־עַצְמוֹתַ֔י הָיִ֙יתִי֙ כְּאִ֣ישׁ שִׁכּ֔וֹר וּכְגֶ֖בֶר עֲבָ֣רוֹ יָ֑יִן מִפְּנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וּמִפְּנֵ֖י דִּבְרֵ֥י קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
Concerning the prophets.
My heart is crushed within me,
All my bones are trembling;
I have become like someone drunk,
Like one overcome by wine—
Because of GOD and because of God’s holy word.
Transliteration: laneviiym nishevar liviy vekireviy rachafu khׇl-atsemvotay hayiytiy kheiysh shikhvor ukhegever avarvo yayiin mifeney yehovah umifeney diverey kׇdeshvo
