Hebrew: כִּ֤י מְנָֽאֲפִים֙ מָלְאָ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּֽי־מִפְּנֵ֤י אָלָה֙ אָבְלָ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ יָבְשׁ֖וּ נְא֣וֹת מִדְבָּ֑ר וַתְּהִ֤י מְרֽוּצָתָם֙ רָעָ֔ה וּגְבוּרָתָ֖ם לֹא־כֵֽן׃
Translated:
For the land is full of adulterers,
The land mourns because of a curse;
The pastures of the wilderness are dried up.
For they run to do evil,
They strain to do wrong.
Transliteration: khiy menaafiym maleah haarets khiy-mifeney alah avelah haarets yaveshu nevot midevar vatehiy merutsatam raah ugevuratam lo-khen

Hebrew: כִּֽי־גַם־נָבִ֥יא גַם־כֹּהֵ֖ן חָנֵ֑פוּ גַּם־בְּבֵיתִ֛י מָצָ֥אתִי רָעָתָ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
For both prophet and priest are godless;
Even in My House I find their wickedness
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: khiy-gam-naviy gam-khohen chanefu gam-veveytiy matsatiy raatam neum-yehovah

Hebrew: לָכֵן֩ יִהְיֶ֨ה דַרְכָּ֜ם לָהֶ֗ם כַּחֲלַקְלַקּוֹת֙ בָּאֲפֵלָ֔ה יִדַּ֖חוּ וְנָ֣פְלוּ בָ֑הּ כִּי־אָבִ֨יא עֲלֵיהֶ֥ם רָעָ֛ה שְׁנַ֥ת פְּקֻדָּתָ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
Their path shall become
Like slippery ground;
They shall be thrust into darkness
And there they shall fall;
For I will bring disaster upon them,
The year of their doom
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: lakhen yiheyeh darekham lahem khachalakelakvot vaafelah yidachu venafelu vah khiy-aviy aleyhem raah shenat fekudatam neum-yehovah

Hebrew: וּבִנְבִיאֵ֥י שֹׁמְר֖וֹן רָאִ֣יתִי תִפְלָ֑ה הִנַּבְּא֣וּ בַבַּ֔עַל וַיַּתְע֥וּ אֶת־עַמִּ֖י אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
In the prophets of Samaria
I saw a repulsive thing:
They prophesied by Baal
And led My people Israel astray.
Transliteration: uvineviyey shomervon raiytiy tifelah hinaveu vavaal vayateu et-amiy et-yisherael

Hebrew: וּבִנְבִאֵ֨י יְרוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם רָאִ֣יתִי שַׁעֲרוּרָ֗ה נָא֞וֹף וְהָלֹ֤ךְ בַּשֶּׁ֙קֶר֙ וְחִזְּקוּ֙ יְדֵ֣י מְרֵעִ֔ים לְבִ֨לְתִּי־שָׁ֔בוּ אִ֖ישׁ מֵרָעָת֑וֹ הָיוּ־לִ֤י כֻלָּם֙ כִּסְדֹ֔ם וְיֹשְׁבֶ֖יהָ כַּעֲמֹרָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
But what I see in the prophets of Jerusalem
Is something horrifying:
Adultery and false dealing.
They encourage evildoers,
So that no one turns back from their own wickedness.
To Me they are all like Sodom,
And [all] its inhabitants like Gomorrah.
Transliteration: uvineviey yerushala͏im raiytiy shaarurah navof vehalokhe vasheker vechizeku yedey mereiym leviletiy-shavu iysh meraatvo hayu-liy khulam khisedom veyosheveyha khaamorah {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן כֹּה־אָמַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ עַל־הַנְּבִאִ֔ים הִנְנִ֨י מַאֲכִ֤יל אוֹתָם֙ לַעֲנָ֔ה וְהִשְׁקִתִ֖ים מֵי־רֹ֑אשׁ כִּ֗י מֵאֵת֙ נְבִיאֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם יָצְאָ֥ה חֲנֻפָּ֖ה לְכׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Assuredly, thus said GOD of Hosts concerning the prophets:
I am going to make them eat wormwood
And drink a bitter draft;
For from the prophets of Jerusalem
Godlessness has gone forth to the whole land.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot al-haneviiym hineniy maakhiyl votam laanah vehishekitiym mey-rosh khiy meet neviyey yerushala͏im yatseah chanufah lekhׇl-haarets {f}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֗וֹת אַֽל־תִּשְׁמְע֞וּ עַל־דִּבְרֵ֤י הַנְּבִאִים֙ הַנִּבְּאִ֣ים לָכֶ֔ם מַהְבִּלִ֥ים הֵ֖מָּה אֶתְכֶ֑ם חֲז֤וֹן לִבָּם֙ יְדַבֵּ֔רוּ לֹ֖א מִפִּ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD of Hosts:
Do not listen to the words of the prophets
Who prophesy to you.
They are deluding you,
The prophecies they speak are from their own minds,
Not from the mouth of GOD.
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot al-tishemeu al-diverey haneviiym haniveiym lakhem maheviliym hemah etekhem chazvon livam yedaveru lo mifiy yehovah

Hebrew: אֹמְרִ֤ים אָמוֹר֙ לִֽמְנַאֲצַ֔י דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה שָׁל֖וֹם יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם וְ֠כֹ֠ל הֹלֵ֞ךְ בִּשְׁרִר֤וּת לִבּוֹ֙ אָֽמְר֔וּ לֹא־תָב֥וֹא עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם רָעָֽה׃
Translated:
They declare to those who despise Me:
GOD has said:
“All shall be well with you”;
And to all who follow their willful hearts they say:
“No evil shall befall you.”
Transliteration: omeriym amvor limenaatsay diver yehovah shalvom yiheyeh lakhem vekhol holekhe visherirut livvo ameru lo-tavvo aleykhem raah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י מִ֤י עָמַד֙ בְּס֣וֹד יְהֹוָ֔ה וְיֵ֖רֶא וְיִשְׁמַ֣ע אֶת־דְּבָר֑וֹ מִי־הִקְשִׁ֥יב (דברי) [דְּבָר֖וֹ] וַיִּשְׁמָֽע׃ {ס}
Translated:
But he who has stood in GOD’s council,
And seen, and heard God’s word—
He who has listened to that word must obey.
Transliteration: khiy miy amad vesvod yehovah veeire veyishema et-devarvo miy-hikeshiyv (dvry) [devarvo] vayishema {s}

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ סַעֲרַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֗ה חֵמָה֙ יָֽצְאָ֔ה וְסַ֖עַר מִתְחוֹלֵ֑ל עַ֛ל רֹ֥אשׁ רְשָׁעִ֖ים יָחֽוּל׃
Translated:
Lo, GOD’s storm goes forth in fury,
A whirling storm,
It shall whirl down upon the heads of the wicked.
Transliteration: hineh saarat yehovah chemah yatseah vesaar mitechvolel al rosh reshaiym yachul

Hebrew: לֹ֤א יָשׁוּב֙ אַף־יְהֹוָ֔ה עַד־עֲשֹׂת֥וֹ וְעַד־הֲקִימ֖וֹ מְזִמּ֣וֹת לִבּ֑וֹ בְּאַֽחֲרִית֙ הַיָּמִ֔ים תִּתְבּ֥וֹנְנוּ בָ֖הּ בִּינָֽה׃
Translated:
The anger of GOD shall not turn back
Till it has fulfilled and completed God’s purposes.
In the days to come
You shall clearly perceive it.
Transliteration: lo yashuv af-yehovah ad-ashotvo vead-hakiymvo mezimvot livvo veachariyt hayamiym titevvonenu vah viynah

Hebrew: לֹא־שָׁלַ֥חְתִּי אֶת־הַנְּבִאִ֖ים וְהֵ֣ם רָ֑צוּ לֹא־דִבַּ֥רְתִּי אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם וְהֵ֥ם נִבָּֽאוּ׃
Translated:
I did not send those prophets,
But they rushed in;
I did not speak to them,
Yet they prophesied.
Transliteration: lo-shalachetiy et-haneviiym vehem ratsu lo-divaretiy aleyhem vehem nivau

Hebrew: וְאִם־עָמְד֖וּ בְּסוֹדִ֑י וְיַשְׁמִ֤עוּ דְבָרַי֙ אֶת־עַמִּ֔י וִֽישִׁבוּם֙ מִדַּרְכָּ֣ם הָרָ֔ע וּמֵרֹ֖עַ מַעַלְלֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
If they have stood in My council,
Let them announce My words to My people
And make them turn back
From their evil ways and wicked acts.
Transliteration: veim-amedu vesvodiy veyashemiu devaray et-amiy viyshivum midarekham hara umeroa maaleleyhem {s}

Hebrew: הַאֱלֹהֵ֧י מִקָּרֹ֛ב אָ֖נִי נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹ֥א אֱלֹהֵ֖י מֵרָחֹֽק׃
Translated:
Am I only a God near at hand
—says GOD—
And not a God far away?
Transliteration: haelohey mikarov aniy neum-yehovah velo elohey merachok

Hebrew: אִם־יִסָּתֵ֨ר אִ֧ישׁ בַּמִּסְתָּרִ֛ים וַאֲנִ֥י לֹֽא־אֶרְאֶ֖נּוּ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה הֲל֨וֹא אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֧יִם וְאֶת־הָאָ֛רֶץ אֲנִ֥י מָלֵ֖א נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
If somebody enters a hiding place,
Do I not see them?
—says GOD.
For I fill both heaven and earth
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: im-yisater iysh vamisetariym vaaniy lo-ereenu neum-yehovah halvo et-hashamayiim veet-haarets aniy male neum-yehovah

Hebrew: שָׁמַ֗עְתִּי אֵ֤ת אֲשֶׁר־אָֽמְרוּ֙ הַנְּבִאִ֔ים הַֽנִּבְּאִ֥ים בִּשְׁמִ֛י שֶׁ֖קֶר לֵאמֹ֑ר חָלַ֖מְתִּי חָלָֽמְתִּי׃
Translated: I have heard what the prophets say, who prophesy falsely in My name: “I had a dream, I had a dream.”
Transliteration: shamaetiy et asher-ameru haneviiym haniveiym vishemiy sheker lemor chalametiy chalametiy

Hebrew: עַד־מָתַ֗י הֲיֵ֛שׁ בְּלֵ֥ב הַנְּבִאִ֖ים נִבְּאֵ֣י הַשָּׁ֑קֶר וּנְבִיאֵ֖י תַּרְמִ֥ת לִבָּֽם׃
Translated: How long will there be in the minds of the prophets who prophesy falsehood—the prophets of their own deceitful minds—
Transliteration: ad-matay haeish velev haneviiym niveey hashaker uneviyey taremit livam

Hebrew: הַחֹשְׁבִ֗ים לְהַשְׁכִּ֤יחַ אֶת־עַמִּי֙ שְׁמִ֔י בַּחֲל֣וֹמֹתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְסַפְּר֖וּ אִ֣ישׁ לְרֵעֵ֑הוּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר שָׁכְח֧וּ אֲבוֹתָ֛ם אֶת־שְׁמִ֖י בַּבָּֽעַל׃
Translated: the plan to make My people forget My name, by means of the dreams that they tell each other, just as their ancestors forgot My name because of Baal?
Transliteration: hachosheviym lehashekhiycha et-amiy shemiy vachalvomotam asher yesaferu iysh lereehu khaasher shakhechu avvotam et-shemiy vavaal

Hebrew: הַנָּבִ֞יא אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֤וֹ חֲלוֹם֙ יְסַפֵּ֣ר חֲל֔וֹם וַאֲשֶׁ֤ר דְּבָרִי֙ אִתּ֔וֹ יְדַבֵּ֥ר דְּבָרִ֖י אֱמֶ֑ת מַה־לַתֶּ֥בֶן אֶת־הַבָּ֖ר נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Let the prophet who has a dream tell the dream; and let the one who has received My word report My word faithfully! How can straw be compared to grain?—says G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: hanaviy asher-itvo chalvom yesafer chalvom vaasher devariy itvo yedaver devariy emet mah-lateven et-havar neum-yehovah

Hebrew: הֲל֨וֹא כֹ֧ה דְבָרִ֛י כָּאֵ֖שׁ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וּכְפַטִּ֖ישׁ יְפֹ֥צֵֽץ סָֽלַע׃ {ס}
Translated: Behold, My word is like fire—declares G<small>OD</small>—and like a hammer that shatters rock!
Transliteration: halvo khoh devariy khaesh neum-yehovah ukhefatiysh yefotsets sala {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֛ן הִנְנִ֥י עַל־הַנְּבִאִ֖ים נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה מְגַנְּבֵ֣י דְבָרַ֔י אִ֖ישׁ מֵאֵ֥ת רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: Assuredly, I am going to deal with the prophets—declares G<small>OD</small>—who steal My words from one another.
Transliteration: lakhen hineniy al-haneviiym neum-yehovah meganevey devaray iysh meet reehu

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֥י עַל־הַנְּבִיאִ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה הַלֹּקְחִ֣ים לְשׁוֹנָ֔ם וַֽיִּנְאֲמ֖וּ נְאֻֽם׃
Translated: I am going to deal with the prophets—declares G<small>OD</small>—who wag their tongues and make oracular utterances.
Transliteration: hineniy al-haneviyim neum-yehovah halokechiym leshvonam vayineamu neum

Hebrew: הִ֠נְנִ֠י עַֽל־נִבְּאֵ֞י חֲלֹמ֥וֹת שֶׁ֙קֶר֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַֽיְסַפְּרוּם֙ וַיַּתְע֣וּ אֶת־עַמִּ֔י בְּשִׁקְרֵיהֶ֖ם וּבְפַחֲזוּתָ֑ם וְאָנֹכִ֨י לֹֽא־שְׁלַחְתִּ֜ים וְלֹ֣א צִוִּיתִ֗ים וְהוֹעֵ֛יל לֹא־יוֹעִ֥ילוּ לָעָם־הַזֶּ֖ה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: I am going to deal with those who prophesy lying dreams—declares G<small>OD</small>—who relate them to lead My people astray with their reckless lies, when I did not send them or command them. They do this people no good—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: hineniy al-niveey chalomvot sheker neum-yehovah vayesaferum vayateu et-amiy veshikereyhem uvefachazutam veanokhiy lo-shelachetiym velo tsiviytiym vehvoeyl lo-yvoiylu laam-hazeh neum-yehovah

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִשְׁאָלְךָ֩ הָעָ֨ם הַזֶּ֜ה אֽוֹ־הַנָּבִ֤יא אֽוֹ־כֹהֵן֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר מַה־מַּשָּׂ֖א יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאָמַרְתָּ֤ אֲלֵיהֶם֙ אֶת־מַה־מַּשָּׂ֔א וְנָטַשְׁתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And when this people—or a prophet or a priest—asks you, “What is the burden of G<small>OD</small>?” you shall answer them, “What is the burden? I will cast you off”—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yishealekha haam hazeh vo-hanaviy vo-khohen lemor mah-masha yehovah veamareta aleyhem et-mah-masha venatashetiy etekhem neum-yehovah

Hebrew: וְהַנָּבִ֤יא וְהַכֹּהֵן֙ וְהָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֹאמַ֖ר מַשָּׂ֣א יְהֹוָ֑ה וּפָקַדְתִּ֛י עַל־הָאִ֥ישׁ הַה֖וּא וְעַל־בֵּיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: As for the prophet or priest or layperson who shall say “the burden of G<small>OD</small>,” I will punish them and their household.
Transliteration: vehanaviy vehakhohen vehaam asher yomar masha yehovah ufakadetiy al-haiysh hahu veal-veytvo

Hebrew: כֹּ֥ה תֹאמְר֛וּ אִ֥ישׁ עַל־רֵעֵ֖הוּ וְאִ֣ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֑יו מֶה־עָנָ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה וּמַה־דִּבֶּ֖ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Thus you shall all speak to your neighbors and to your kin, “What has G<small>OD</small> answered?” or “What has G<small>OD</small> spoken?”
Transliteration: khoh tomeru iysh al-reehu veiysh el-achiyv meh-anah yehovah umah-diver yehovah

Hebrew: וּמַשָּׂ֥א יְהֹוָ֖ה לֹ֣א תִזְכְּרוּ־ע֑וֹד כִּ֣י הַמַּשָּׂ֗א יִֽהְיֶה֙ לְאִ֣ישׁ דְּבָר֔וֹ וַהֲפַכְתֶּ֗ם אֶת־דִּבְרֵי֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים חַיִּ֔ים יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: But do not mention “the burden of G<small>OD</small>” anymore. Does anyone regard their own word as a “burden,” that you pervert the words of the living God, G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, our God?
Transliteration: umasha yehovah lo tizekheru-vod khiy hamasha yiheyeh leiysh devarvo vahafakhetem et-diverey Elohim chayiym yehovah tsevavot eloheynu

Hebrew: כֹּ֥ה תֹאמַ֖ר אֶל־הַנָּבִ֑יא מֶה־עָנָ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה וּמַה־דִּבֶּ֖ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Thus you shall speak to the prophet: “What did G<small>OD</small> answer you?” or “What did G<small>OD</small> speak?”
Transliteration: khoh tomar el-hanaviy meh-anakhe yehovah umah-diver yehovah

Hebrew: וְאִם־מַשָּׂ֣א יְהֹוָה֮ תֹּאמֵ֒רוּ֒ לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה יַ֧עַן אֲמׇרְכֶ֛ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֖ה מַשָּׂ֣א יְהֹוָ֑ה וָאֶשְׁלַ֤ח אֲלֵיכֶם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹ֥א תֹאמְר֖וּ מַשָּׂ֥א יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: But if you say “the burden of G<small>OD</small>”—assuredly, thus said G<small>OD</small>: Because you said this thing, “the burden of G<small>OD</small>,” whereas I sent word to you not to say “the burden of G<small>OD</small>,”
Transliteration: veim-masha yehovah tomeru lakhen khoh amar yehovah yaan amׇrekhem et-hadavar hazeh masha yehovah vaeshelach aleykhem lemor lo tomeru masha yehovah

Hebrew: לָכֵ֣ן הִנְנִ֔י וְנָשִׁ֥יתִי אֶתְכֶ֖ם נָשֹׁ֑א וְנָטַשְׁתִּ֣י אֶתְכֶ֗ם וְאֶת־הָעִיר֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֧תִּי לָכֶ֛ם וְלַאֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם מֵעַ֥ל פָּנָֽי׃
Translated: I will utterly forget you and I will cast you away from My presence, together with the city that I gave to you and your ancestors.
Transliteration: lakhen hineniy venashiytiy etekhem nasho venatashetiy etekhem veet-haiyr asher natatiy lakhem velaavvoteykhem meal fanay

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֥י עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם חֶרְפַּ֣ת עוֹלָ֑ם וּכְלִמּ֣וּת עוֹלָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר לֹ֥א תִשָּׁכֵֽחַ׃ {פ}
Translated: And I will lay upon you a disgrace for all time, shame for all time, which shall never be forgotten.
Transliteration: venatatiy aleykhem cherefat volam ukhelimut volam asher lo tishakhecha {f}

Hebrew: הִרְאַ֘נִי֮ יְהֹוָה֒ וְהִנֵּ֗ה שְׁנֵי֙ דּוּדָאֵ֣י תְאֵנִ֔ים מוּעָדִ֕ים לִפְנֵ֖י הֵיכַ֣ל יְהֹוָ֑ה אַחֲרֵ֣י הַגְל֣וֹת נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֣ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֡ל אֶת־יְכׇנְיָ֣הוּ בֶן־יְהוֹיָקִ֣ים מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָה֩ וְאֶת־שָׂרֵ֨י יְהוּדָ֜ה וְאֶת־הֶחָרָ֤שׁ וְאֶת־הַמַּסְגֵּר֙ מִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וַיְבִאֵ֖ם בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> showed me two baskets of figs, placed in front of the Temple of G<small>OD</small>. This was after King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon had exiled King Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim of Judah, and the officials of Judah, and the artisans and smiths, and had brought them from Jerusalem to Babylon.
Transliteration: hireaniy yehovah vehineh sheney dudaey teeniym muadiym lifeney heykhal yehovah acharey hagelvot nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel et-yekhׇneyahu ven-yehvoyakiym melekhe-yehudah veet-sharey yehudah veet-hecharash veet-hamaseger miyrushala͏im vayeviem vavel

Hebrew: הַדּ֣וּד אֶחָ֗ד תְּאֵנִים֙ טֹב֣וֹת מְאֹ֔ד כִּתְאֵנֵ֖י הַבַּכֻּר֑וֹת וְהַדּ֣וּד אֶחָ֗ד תְּאֵנִים֙ רָע֣וֹת מְאֹ֔ד אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־תֵאָכַ֖לְנָה מֵרֹֽעַ׃ {פ}
Translated: One basket contained very good figs, like first-ripened figs, and the other basket contained very bad figs, so bad that they could not be eaten.
Transliteration: hadud echad teeniym tovvot meod khiteeney havakhurvot vehadud echad teeniym ravot meod asher lo-teakhalenah meroa {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י מָה־אַתָּ֤ה רֹאֶה֙ יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ וָאֹמַ֖ר תְּאֵנִ֑ים הַתְּאֵנִ֤ים הַטֹּבוֹת֙ טֹב֣וֹת מְאֹ֔ד וְהָֽרָעוֹת֙ רָע֣וֹת מְאֹ֔ד אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־תֵאָכַ֖לְנָה מֵרֹֽעַ׃ {פ}
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> said to me, “What do you see, Jeremiah?” I answered, “Figs—the good ones are very good, and the bad ones very bad, so bad that they cannot be eaten.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay mah-atah roeh yiremeyahu vaomar teeniym hateeniym hatovvot tovvot meod veharavot ravot meod asher lo-teakhalenah meroa {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Then the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כַּתְּאֵנִ֥ים הַטֹּב֖וֹת הָאֵ֑לֶּה כֵּֽן־אַכִּ֞יר אֶת־גָּל֣וּת יְהוּדָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר שִׁלַּ֜חְתִּי מִן־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּ֛ה אֶ֥רֶץ כַּשְׂדִּ֖ים לְטוֹבָֽה׃
Translated: Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: As with these good figs, so will I single out for good the Judean exiles whom I have driven out from this place to the land of the Chaldeans.
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael khateeniym hatovvot haeleh khen-akhiyr et-galut yehudah asher shilachetiy min-hamakvom hazeh erets khashediym letvovah

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֨י עֵינִ֤י עֲלֵיהֶם֙ לְטוֹבָ֔ה וַהֲשִׁבֹתִ֖ים עַל־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את וּבְנִיתִים֙ וְלֹ֣א אֶהֱרֹ֔ס וּנְטַעְתִּ֖ים וְלֹ֥א אֶתּֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated: I will look upon them favorably, and I will bring them back to this land; I will build them and not overthrow them; I will plant them and not uproot them.
Transliteration: veshametiy eyniy aleyhem letvovah vahashivotiym al-haarets hazot uveniytiym velo eheros unetaetiym velo etvosh

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּי֩ לָהֶ֨ם לֵ֜ב לָדַ֣עַת אֹתִ֗י כִּ֚י אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהָיוּ־לִ֣י לְעָ֔ם וְאָ֣נֹכִ֔י אֶהְיֶ֥ה לָהֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִ֑ים כִּֽי־יָשֻׁ֥בוּ אֵלַ֖י בְּכׇל־לִבָּֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: And I will give them the understanding to acknowledge Me, for I am G<small>OD</small>. And they shall be My people and I will be their God, when they turn back to Me with all their heart.
Transliteration: venatatiy lahem lev ladaat otiy khiy aniy yehovah vehayu-liy leam veanokhiy eheyeh lahem lelohiym khiy-yashuvu elay vekhׇl-livam {s}

Hebrew: וְכַתְּאֵנִים֙ הָרָע֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־תֵאָכַ֖לְנָה מֵרֹ֑עַ כִּי־כֹ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה כֵּ֣ן אֶ֠תֵּ֠ן אֶת־צִדְקִיָּ֨הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֤ה וְאֶת־שָׂרָיו֙ וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שְׁאֵרִ֣ית יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם הַנִּשְׁאָרִים֙ בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את וְהַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: And like the bad figs, which are so bad that they cannot be eaten—thus said G<small>OD</small>—so will I treat King Zedekiah of Judah and his officials and the remnant of Jerusalem that is left in this land, and those who are living in the land of Egypt:
Transliteration: vekhateeniym haravot asher lo-teakhalenah meroa khiy-khoh amar yehovah khen eten et-tsidekiyahu melekhe-yehudah veet-sharayv veet sheeriyt yerushala͏im hanisheariym vaarets hazot vehayosheviym veerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וּנְתַתִּים֙ (לזועה) [לְזַעֲוָ֣ה] לְרָעָ֔ה לְכֹ֖ל מַמְלְכ֣וֹת הָאָ֑רֶץ לְחֶרְפָּ֤ה וּלְמָשָׁל֙ לִשְׁנִינָ֣ה וְלִקְלָלָ֔ה בְּכׇל־הַמְּקֹמ֖וֹת אֲשֶֽׁר־אַדִּיחֵ֥ם שָֽׁם׃
Translated: I will make them a horror—an evil—to all the kingdoms of the earth, a disgrace and a proverb, a byword and a curse in all the places to which I banish them.
Transliteration: unetatiym (lzvh) [lezaavah] leraah lekhol mamelekhvot haarets lecherefah ulemashal lisheniynah velikelalah vekhׇl-hamekomvot asher-adiychem sham

Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּ֣חְתִּי בָ֔ם אֶת־הַחֶ֖רֶב אֶת־הָרָעָ֣ב וְאֶת־הַדָּ֑בֶר עַד־תֻּמָּם֙ מֵעַ֣ל הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תִּי לָהֶ֖ם וְלַאֲבוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: I will send the sword, famine, and pestilence against them until they are exterminated from the land that I gave to them and their ancestors.
Transliteration: veshilachetiy vam et-hacherev et-haraav veet-hadaver ad-tumam meal haadamah asher-natatiy lahem velaavvoteyhem {f}

Hebrew: הַדָּבָ֞ר אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֤ה עַֽל־יִרְמְיָ֙הוּ֙ עַל־כׇּל־עַ֣ם יְהוּדָ֔ה בַּשָּׁנָה֙ הָֽרְבִעִ֔ית לִיהוֹיָקִ֥ים בֶּן־יֹאשִׁיָּ֖הוּ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה הִ֗יא הַשָּׁנָה֙ הָרִ֣אשֹׁנִ֔ית לִנְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֖ר מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah, in the fourth year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah, which was the first year of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon.
Transliteration: hadavar asher-hayah al-yiremeyahu al-khׇl-am yehudah vashanah hareviiyt liyhvoyakiym ven-yoshiyahu melekhe yehudah hiy hashanah harishoniyt linevukhaderetsar melekhe vavel

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֜ר יִרְמְיָ֤הוּ הַנָּבִיא֙ עַל־כׇּל־עַ֣ם יְהוּדָ֔ה וְאֶ֛ל כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֥י יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: This is what the prophet Jeremiah said to all the people of Judah and to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem:
Transliteration: asher diver yiremeyahu hanaviy al-khׇl-am yehudah veel khׇl-yoshevey yerushala͏im lemor

Hebrew: מִן־שְׁלֹ֣שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֡ה לְיֹאשִׁיָּ֣הוּ בֶן־אָמוֹן֩ מֶ֨לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֜ה וְעַ֣ד ׀ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֗ה זֶ֚ה שָׁלֹ֤שׁ וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה הָיָ֥ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלָ֑י וָאֲדַבֵּ֧ר אֲלֵיכֶ֛ם אַשְׁכֵּ֥ים וְדַבֵּ֖ר וְלֹ֥א שְׁמַעְתֶּֽם׃
Translated: From the thirteenth year of King Josiah son of Amon of Judah, to this day—these twenty-three years—the word of G<small>OD</small> has come to me. I have spoken to you persistently, but you would not listen.
Transliteration: min-shelosh eshereh shanah leyoshiyahu ven-amvon melekhe yehudah vead hayyvom hazeh zeh shalosh veesheriym shanah hayah devar-yehovah elay vaadaver aleykhem ashekheym vedaver velo shemaetem

Hebrew: וְשָׁלַח֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֲלֵיכֶ֜ם אֶֽת־כׇּל־עֲבָדָ֧יו הַנְּבִאִ֛ים הַשְׁכֵּ֥ם וְשָׁלֹ֖חַ וְלֹ֣א שְׁמַעְתֶּ֑ם וְלֹא־הִטִּיתֶ֥ם אֶֽת־אׇזְנְכֶ֖ם לִשְׁמֹֽעַ׃
Translated: Moreover, G<small>OD</small> constantly sent all his servants the prophets to you, but you would not listen or incline your ears to hear
Transliteration: veshalach yehovah aleykhem et-khׇl-avadayv haneviiym hashekhem veshalocha velo shemaetem velo-hitiytem et-ׇzenekhem lishemoa

Hebrew: לֵאמֹ֗ר שֽׁוּבוּ־נָ֞א אִ֣ישׁ מִדַּרְכּ֤וֹ הָרָעָה֙ וּמֵרֹ֣עַ מַעַלְלֵיכֶ֔ם וּשְׁבוּ֙ עַל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה לָכֶ֖ם וְלַאֲבֽוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם לְמִן־עוֹלָ֖ם וְעַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: when they said, “Turn back, every one, from your evil ways and your wicked acts, that you may remain throughout the ages on the soil that G<small>OD</small> gave to you and your ancestors.
Transliteration: lemor shuvu-na iysh midarekhvo haraah umeroa maaleleykhem ushevu al-haadamah asher natan yehovah lakhem velaavvoteykhem lemin-volam vead-volam

Hebrew: וְאַל־תֵּלְכ֗וּ אַֽחֲרֵי֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים לְעׇבְדָ֖ם וּלְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֣ת לָהֶ֑ם וְלֹֽא־תַכְעִ֤יסוּ אוֹתִי֙ בְּמַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יְדֵיכֶ֔ם וְלֹ֥א אָרַ֖ע לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: Do not follow other gods, to serve them and worship them. Do not vex Me with what your own hands have made, and I will not bring disaster upon you.”
Transliteration: veal-telekhu acharey Elohim acheriym leׇvedam ulehishetachavot lahem velo-takheiysu votiy vemaasheh yedeykhem velo ara lakhem

Hebrew: וְלֹא־שְׁמַעְתֶּ֥ם אֵלַ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה לְמַ֧עַן (הכעסוני) [הַכְעִיסֵ֛נִי] בְּמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יְדֵיכֶ֖ם לְרַ֥ע לָכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: But you would not listen to Me—declares G<small>OD</small>—but vexed Me with what your hands made, to your own hurt.
Transliteration: velo-shemaetem elay neum-yehovah lemaan (hkhsvny) [hakheiyseniy] vemaasheh yedeykhem lera lakhem {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֕ן כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֑וֹת יַ֕עַן אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־שְׁמַעְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־דְּבָרָֽי׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts: Because you would not listen to My words,
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar yehovah tsevavot yaan asher lo-shemaetem et-devaray

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֣י שֹׁלֵ֡חַ וְלָקַחְתִּי֩ אֶת־כׇּל־מִשְׁפְּח֨וֹת צָפ֜וֹן נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֗ה וְאֶל־נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֣ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶל֮ עַבְדִּי֒ וַהֲבִ֨אֹתִ֜ים עַל־הָאָ֤רֶץ הַזֹּאת֙ וְעַל־יֹ֣שְׁבֶ֔יהָ וְעַ֛ל כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֥ם הָאֵ֖לֶּה סָבִ֑יב וְהַ֣חֲרַמְתִּ֔ים וְשַׂמְתִּים֙ לְשַׁמָּ֣ה וְלִשְׁרֵקָ֔ה וּלְחׇרְב֖וֹת עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: I am going to send for all the peoples of the north—declares G<small>OD</small>—and for My servant, King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, and bring them against this land and its inhabitants, and against all those nations round about. I will exterminate them and make them a desolation, an object of hissing—ruins for all time.
Transliteration: hineniy sholecha velakachetiy et-khׇl-mishefechvot tsafvon neum-yehovah veel-nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel avediy vahaviotiym al-haarets hazot veal-yosheveyha veal khׇl-hagvoyim haeleh saviyv vehacharametiym veshametiym leshamah velisherekah ulechׇrevvot volam

Hebrew: וְהַאֲבַדְתִּ֣י מֵהֶ֗ם ק֤וֹל שָׂשׂוֹן֙ וְק֣וֹל שִׂמְחָ֔ה ק֥וֹל חָתָ֖ן וְק֣וֹל כַּלָּ֑ה ק֥וֹל רֵחַ֖יִם וְא֥וֹר נֵֽר׃
Translated: And I will banish from them the sound of mirth and gladness, the voice of bridegroom and bride, and the sound of the mill and the light of the lamp.
Transliteration: vehaavadetiy mehem kvol shashvon vekvol shimechah kvol chatan vekvol khalah kvol rechayiim vevor ner

Hebrew: וְהָֽיְתָה֙ כׇּל־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את לְחׇרְבָּ֖ה לְשַׁמָּ֑ה וְעָ֨בְד֜וּ הַגּוֹיִ֥ם הָאֵ֛לֶּה אֶת־מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶ֖ל שִׁבְעִ֥ים שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated:
This whole land shall be a desolate ruin.
And those nations shall serve the king of Babylon seventy years.
Transliteration: vehayetah khׇl-haarets hazot lechׇrevah leshamah veavedu hagvoyim haeleh et-melekhe vavel shiveiym shanah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה כִמְלֹ֣אות שִׁבְעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֡ה אֶפְקֹ֣ד עַל־מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶל֩ וְעַל־הַגּ֨וֹי הַה֧וּא נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־עֲוֺנָ֖ם וְעַל־אֶ֣רֶץ כַּשְׂדִּ֑ים וְשַׂמְתִּ֥י אֹת֖וֹ לְשִֽׁמְמ֥וֹת עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: When the seventy years are over, I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation and the land of the Chaldeans for their sins—declares G<small>OD</small>—and I will make it a desolation for all time.
Transliteration: vehayah khimelovt shiveiym shanah efekod al-melekhe-vavel veal-hagvoy hahu neum-yehovah et-avonam veal-erets khashediym veshametiy otvo leshimemvot volam

Hebrew: (והבאותי) [וְהֵֽבֵאתִי֙] עַל־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַהִ֔יא אֶת־כׇּל־דְּבָרַ֖י אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֣רְתִּי עָלֶ֑יהָ אֵ֤ת כׇּל־הַכָּתוּב֙ בַּסֵּ֣פֶר הַזֶּ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נִבָּ֥א יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ עַל־כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: And I will bring upon that land all that I have decreed against it, all that is recorded in this book—that which Jeremiah prophesied against all the nations.
Transliteration: (vhvvty) [vehevetiy] al-haarets hahiy et-khׇl-devaray asher-divaretiy aleyha et khׇl-hakhatuv vasefer hazeh asher-niva yiremeyahu al-khׇl-hagvoyim

Hebrew: כִּ֣י עָֽבְדוּ־בָ֤ם גַּם־הֵ֙מָּה֙ גּוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֔ים וּמְלָכִ֖ים גְּדוֹלִ֑ים וְשִׁלַּמְתִּ֥י לָהֶ֛ם כְּפׇעֳלָ֖ם וּכְמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יְדֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: For they too shall be enslaved by many nations and great kings; and I will requite them according to their acts and according to their conduct.
Transliteration: khiy avedu-vam gam-hemah gvoyim raviym umelakhiym gedvoliym veshilametiy lahem khefׇolam ukhemaasheh yedeyhem {f}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹה֩ אָמַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֵלַ֔י קַ֠ח אֶת־כּ֨וֹס הַיַּ֧יִן הַחֵמָ֛ה הַזֹּ֖את מִיָּדִ֑י וְהִשְׁקִיתָ֤ה אֹתוֹ֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י שֹׁלֵ֥חַ אוֹתְךָ֖ אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: For thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, to me: “Take from My hand this cup of wine—of wrath—and make all the nations to whom I send you drink of it.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar yehovah elohey yisherael elay kach et-khvos hayayiin hachemah hazot miyadiy vehishekiytah otvo et-khׇl-hagvoyim asher anokhiy sholecha votekha aleyhem

Hebrew: וְשָׁת֕וּ וְהִֽתְגֹּעֲשׁ֖וּ וְהִתְהֹלָ֑לוּ מִפְּנֵ֣י הַחֶ֔רֶב אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י שֹׁלֵ֖חַ בֵּינֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Let them drink and retch and act crazy, because of the sword that I am sending among them.”
Transliteration: veshatu vehitegoashu vehiteholalu mifeney hacherev asher anokhiy sholecha veynotam

Hebrew: וָאֶקַּ֥ח אֶת־הַכּ֖וֹס מִיַּ֣ד יְהֹוָ֑ה וָֽאַשְׁקֶה֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־שְׁלָחַ֥נִי יְהֹוָ֖ה אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: So I took the cup from G<small>OD</small>’s hand and gave drink to all the nations to whom G<small>OD</small> had sent me:
Transliteration: vaekach et-hakhvos miyad yehovah vaashekeh et-khׇl-hagvoyim asher-shelachaniy yehovah aleyhem

Hebrew: אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ וְאֶת־עָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וְאֶת־מְלָכֶ֖יהָ אֶת־שָׂרֶ֑יהָ לָתֵ֨ת אֹתָ֜ם לְחׇרְבָּ֧ה לְשַׁמָּ֛ה לִשְׁרֵקָ֥ה וְלִקְלָלָ֖ה כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Jerusalem and the towns of Judah, and its kings and officials, to make them a desolate ruin, an object of hissing and a curse—as is now the case;
Transliteration: et-yerushala͏im veet-arey yehudah veet-melakheyha et-shareyha latet otam lechׇrevah leshamah lisherekah velikelalah khayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֧ה מֶלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֛יִם וְאֶת־עֲבָדָ֥יו וְאֶת־שָׂרָ֖יו וְאֶת־כׇּל־עַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Pharaoh king of Egypt, his courtiers, his officials, and all his people;
Transliteration: et-fareoh melekhe-mitserayiim veet-avadayv veet-sharayv veet-khׇl-amvo

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־הָעֶ֔רֶב וְאֵ֕ת כׇּל־מַלְכֵ֖י אֶ֣רֶץ הָע֑וּץ וְאֵ֗ת כׇּל־מַלְכֵי֙ אֶ֣רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וְאֶת־אַשְׁקְל֤וֹן וְאֶת־עַזָּה֙ וְאֶת־עֶקְר֔וֹן וְאֵ֖ת שְׁאֵרִ֥ית אַשְׁדּֽוֹד׃
Translated: all the mixed peoples; all the kings of the land of Uz; all the kings of the land of the Philistines—Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and what is left of Ashdod;
Transliteration: veet khׇl-haerev veet khׇl-malekhey erets hauts veet khׇl-malekhey erets felishetiym veet-ashekelvon veet-azah veet-ekervon veet sheeriyt ashedvod

Hebrew: אֶת־אֱד֥וֹם וְאֶת־מוֹאָ֖ב וְאֶת־בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: Edom, Moab, and Ammon;
Transliteration: et-edvom veet-mvoav veet-veney amvon

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־מַלְכֵי־צֹ֔ר וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־מַלְכֵ֣י צִיד֑וֹן וְאֵת֙ מַלְכֵ֣י הָאִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּעֵ֥בֶר הַיָּֽם׃
Translated: all the kings of Tyre and all the kings of Sidon, and all the kings of the coastland across the sea;
Transliteration: veet khׇl-malekhey-tsor veet khׇl-malekhey tsiydvon veet malekhey haiy asher veever hayam

Hebrew: וְאֶת־דְּדָ֤ן וְאֶת־תֵּימָא֙ וְאֶת־בּ֔וּז וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־קְצוּצֵ֥י פֵאָֽה׃
Translated: Dedan, Tema, and Buz, and all those who have their hair clipped;
Transliteration: veet-dedan veet-teyma veet-vuz veet khׇl-ketsutsey feah

Hebrew: וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־מַלְכֵ֣י עֲרָ֑ב וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־מַלְכֵ֣י הָעֶ֔רֶב הַשֹּׁכְנִ֖ים בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: all the kings of Arabia, and all the kings of the mixed peoples who live in the desert;
Transliteration: veet khׇl-malekhey arav veet khׇl-malekhey haerev hashokheniym vamidevar

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת ׀ כׇּל־מַלְכֵ֣י זִמְרִ֗י וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־מַלְכֵ֣י עֵילָ֔ם וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־מַלְכֵ֥י מָדָֽי׃
Translated: all the kings of Zimri and all the kings of Elam and all the kings of Media;
Transliteration: veet khׇl-malekhey zimeriy veet khׇl-malekhey eylam veet khׇl-malekhey maday

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת ׀ כׇּל־מַלְכֵ֣י הַצָּפ֗וֹן הַקְּרֹבִ֤ים וְהָרְחֹקִים֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֔יו וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־הַמַּמְלְכ֣וֹת הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הָאֲדָמָ֑ה וּמֶ֥לֶךְ שֵׁשַׁ֖ךְ יִשְׁתֶּ֥ה אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: all the kings of the north, whether far from or close to each other—all the royal lands that are on the earth. And last of all, the king of Sheshach shall drink.
Transliteration: veet khׇl-malekhey hatsafvon hakeroviym veharechokiym iysh el-achiyv veet khׇl-hamamelekhvot haarets asher al-feney haadamah umelekhe sheshakhe yisheteh achareyhem

Hebrew:
וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֡ם {פ}
כֹּה־אָמַר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה צְבָא֜וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל שְׁת֤וּ וְשִׁכְרוּ֙ וּקְי֔וּ וְנִפְל֖וּ וְלֹ֣א תָק֑וּמוּ מִפְּנֵ֣י הַחֶ֔רֶב אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י שֹׁלֵ֖חַ בֵּינֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Say to them: “Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: Drink and get drunk and vomit; fall and never rise again, because of the sword that I send among you.”
Transliteration:
veamareta aleyhem {f}
khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael shetu veshikheru ukeyu venifelu velo takumu mifeney hacherev asher anokhiy sholecha veyneykhem

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כִּ֧י יְמָאֲנ֛וּ לָקַחַת־הַכּ֥וֹס מִיָּדְךָ֖ לִשְׁתּ֑וֹת וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֛ר יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת שָׁת֥וֹ תִשְׁתּֽוּ׃
Translated: And if they refuse to take the cup from your hand and drink, say to them, “Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts: You must drink!
Transliteration: vehayah khiy yemaanu lakachat-hakhvos miyadekha lishetvot veamareta aleyhem khoh amar yehovah tsevavot shatvo tishetu

Hebrew: כִּי֩ הִנֵּ֨ה בָעִ֜יר אֲשֶׁ֧ר נִֽקְרָא־שְׁמִ֣י עָלֶ֗יהָ אָֽנֹכִי֙ מֵחֵ֣ל לְהָרַ֔ע וְאַתֶּ֖ם הִנָּקֵ֣ה תִנָּק֑וּ לֹ֣א תִנָּק֔וּ כִּ֣י חֶ֗רֶב אֲנִ֤י קֹרֵא֙ עַל־כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ נְאֻ֖ם יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָאֽוֹת׃
Translated: If I am bringing the punishment first on the city that bears My name, do you expect to go unpunished? You will not go unpunished, for I am summoning the sword against all the inhabitants of the earth—declares G<small>OD</small> of Hosts.”
Transliteration: khiy hineh vaiyr asher nikera-shemiy aleyha anokhiy mechel lehara veatem hinakeh tinaku lo tinaku khiy cherev aniy kore al-khׇl-yoshevey haarets neum yehovah tsevavot

Hebrew: וְאַתָּה֙ תִּנָּבֵ֣א אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם יְהֹוָ֞ה מִמָּר֤וֹם יִשְׁאָג֙ וּמִמְּע֤וֹן קׇדְשׁוֹ֙ יִתֵּ֣ן קוֹל֔וֹ שָׁאֹ֤ג יִשְׁאַג֙ עַל־נָוֵ֔הוּ הֵידָד֙ כְּדֹרְכִ֣ים יַעֲנֶ֔ה אֶ֥ל כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֖י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
You are to prophesy all those things to them, and then say to them:
GOD roars from on high,
And bellows from the holy dwelling—
Roaring aloud over the [earthly] abode
And uttering shouts like the grape-treaders—
Against all the dwellers on earth.
Transliteration: veatah tinave aleyhem et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh veamareta aleyhem yehovah mimarvom yisheag umimevon kׇdeshvo yiten kvolvo shaog yisheag al-navehu heydad khedorekhiym yaaneh el khׇl-yoshevey haarets

Hebrew: בָּ֤א שָׁאוֹן֙ עַד־קְצֵ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּ֣י רִ֤יב לַיהֹוָה֙ בַּגּוֹיִ֔ם נִשְׁפָּ֥ט ה֖וּא לְכׇל־בָּשָׂ֑ר הָרְשָׁעִ֛ים נְתָנָ֥ם לַחֶ֖רֶב נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Tumult has reached the ends of the earth,
For GOD has a case against the nations,
And contends with all flesh—
Delivering the wicked to the sword
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: va shavon ad-ketseh haarets khiy riyv layhovah vagvoyim nishefat hu lekhׇl-vashar hareshaiym netanam lacherev neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת הִנֵּ֥ה רָעָ֛ה יֹצֵ֖את מִגּ֣וֹי אֶל־גּ֑וֹי וְסַ֣עַר גָּד֔וֹל יֵע֖וֹר מִיַּרְכְּתֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD of Hosts:
Disaster goes forth
From nation to nation;
A great storm is unleashed
From the remotest parts of earth.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah tsevavot hineh raah yotset migvoy el-gvoy vesaar gadvol eivor miyarekhetey-arets

Hebrew: וְהָי֞וּ חַֽלְלֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא מִקְצֵ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ וְעַד־קְצֵ֣ה הָאָ֑רֶץ לֹ֣א יִסָּפְד֗וּ וְלֹ֤א יֵאָֽסְפוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א יִקָּבֵ֔רוּ לְדֹ֛מֶן עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָ֖ה יִֽהְיֽוּ׃
Translated: In that day, the earth shall be strewn with the slain of G<small>OD</small> from one end to the other. They shall not be mourned, or gathered and buried; they shall become dung upon the face of the earth.
Transliteration: vehayu chaleley yehovah vayyvom hahu miketseh haarets vead-ketseh haarets lo yisafedu velo eiasefu velo yikaveru ledomen al-feney haadamah yiheyu

Hebrew: הֵילִ֨ילוּ הָרֹעִ֜ים וְזַעֲק֗וּ וְהִֽתְפַּלְּשׁוּ֙ אַדִּירֵ֣י הַצֹּ֔אן כִּי־מָלְא֥וּ יְמֵיכֶ֖ם לִטְב֑וֹחַ וּתְפוֹצ֣וֹתִיכֶ֔ם וּנְפַלְתֶּ֖ם כִּכְלִ֥י חֶמְדָּֽה׃
Translated:
Howl, you shepherds, and yell,
Strew [dust] on yourselves, you lords of the flock!
For the day of your slaughter draws near.
I will break you in pieces,
And you shall fall like a precious vessel.
Transliteration: heyliylu haroiym vezaaku vehitefaleshu adiyrey hatson khiy-maleu yemeykhem litevvocha utefvotsvotiykhem unefaletem khikheliy chemedah

Hebrew: וְאָבַ֥ד מָנ֖וֹס מִן־הָרֹעִ֑ים וּפְלֵיטָ֖ה מֵאַדִּירֵ֥י הַצֹּֽאן׃
Translated:
Flight shall fail the shepherds,
And escape, the lords of the flock.
Transliteration: veavad manvos min-haroiym ufeleytah meadiyrey hatson

Hebrew: ק֚וֹל צַעֲקַ֣ת הָרֹעִ֔ים וִֽילְלַ֖ת אַדִּירֵ֣י הַצֹּ֑אן כִּֽי־שֹׁדֵ֥ד יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מַרְעִיתָֽם׃
Translated:
Hark, the outcry of the shepherds,
And the howls of the lords of the flock!
For GOD is ravaging their pasture.
Transliteration: kvol tsaakat haroiym viylelat adiyrey hatson khiy-shoded yehovah et-mareiytam

Hebrew: וְנָדַ֖מּוּ נְא֣וֹת הַשָּׁל֑וֹם מִפְּנֵ֖י חֲר֥וֹן אַף־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
The peaceful meadows shall be wiped out
By GOD’s fierce wrath.
Transliteration: venadamu nevot hashalvom mifeney charvon af-yehovah

Hebrew: עָזַ֥ב כַּכְּפִ֖יר סֻכּ֑וֹ כִּֽי־הָיְתָ֤ה אַרְצָם֙ לְשַׁמָּ֔ה מִפְּנֵי֙ חֲר֣וֹן הַיּוֹנָ֔ה וּמִפְּנֵ֖י חֲר֥וֹן אַפּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Like a lion [God] has gone forth from the lair;
The land has become a desolation,
Because of the oppressive wrath,
Because of such fierce anger.
Transliteration: azav khakhefiyr sukhvo khiy-hayetah aretsam leshamah mifeney charvon hayyvonah umifeney charvon afvo {f}

Hebrew: בְּרֵאשִׁ֗ית מַמְלְכ֛וּת יְהוֹיָקִ֥ים בֶּן־יֹאשִׁיָּ֖הוּ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה הָיָה֙ הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה מֵאֵ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: At the beginning of the reign of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah, this word came from G<small>OD</small>:
Transliteration: vereshiyt mamelekhut yehvoyakiym ven-yoshiyahu melekhe yehudah hayah hadavar hazeh meet yehovah lemor

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה עֲמֹד֮ בַּחֲצַ֣ר בֵּית־יְהֹוָה֒ וְדִבַּרְתָּ֞ עַל־כׇּל־עָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֗ה הַבָּאִים֙ לְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֣ת בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּיתִ֖יךָ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵיהֶ֑ם אַל־תִּגְרַ֖ע דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Stand in the court of the House of G<small>OD</small>, and speak to [the inhabitants of] all the towns of Judah, who are coming to worship in the House of G<small>OD</small>, all the words that I command you to speak to them. Do not omit anything.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah amod vachatsar veyt-yehovah vedivareta al-khׇl-arey yehudah havaiym lehishetachavot veyt-yehovah et khׇl-hadevariym asher tsiviytiykha ledaver aleyhem al-tigera davar

Hebrew: אוּלַ֣י יִשְׁמְע֔וּ וְיָשֻׁ֕בוּ אִ֖ישׁ מִדַּרְכּ֣וֹ הָרָעָ֑ה וְנִחַמְתִּ֣י אֶל־הָרָעָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֤י חֹשֵׁב֙ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת לָהֶ֔ם מִפְּנֵ֖י רֹ֥עַ מַעַלְלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Perhaps they will listen and turn back, each from their own evil way, that I may renounce the punishment I am planning to bring upon them for their wicked acts.
Transliteration: ulay yishemeu veyashuvu iysh midarekhvo haraah venichametiy el-haraah asher anokhiy choshev laashvot lahem mifeney roa maaleleyhem

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם כֹּ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה אִם־לֹ֤א תִשְׁמְעוּ֙ אֵלַ֔י לָלֶ֙כֶת֙ בְּת֣וֹרָתִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לִפְנֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: “Say to them: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: If you do not obey Me, abiding by the Teaching that I have set before you,
Transliteration: veamareta aleyhem khoh amar yehovah im-lo tishemeu elay lalekhet vetvoratiy asher natatiy lifeneykhem

Hebrew: לִשְׁמֹ֗עַ עַל־דִּבְרֵי֙ עֲבָדַ֣י הַנְּבִאִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י שֹׁלֵ֣חַ אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם וְהַשְׁכֵּ֥ם וְשָׁלֹ֖חַ וְלֹ֥א שְׁמַעְתֶּֽם׃
Translated: heeding the words of My servants the prophets whom I have been sending to you persistently—but you have not heeded—
Transliteration: lishemoa al-diverey avaday haneviiym asher anokhiy sholecha aleykhem vehashekhem veshalocha velo shemaetem

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֛י אֶת־הַבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּ֖ה כְּשִׁלֹ֑ה וְאֶת־הָעִ֤יר (הזאתה) [הַזֹּאת֙] אֶתֵּ֣ן לִקְלָלָ֔ה לְכֹ֖ל גּוֹיֵ֥ הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated: then I will make this House like Shiloh, and I will make this city a curse for all the nations of earth.”
Transliteration: venatatiy et-havayiit hazeh kheshiloh veet-haiyr (hzth) [hazot] eten likelalah lekhol gvoei haarets {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֛וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֥ים וְהַנְּבִאִ֖ים וְכׇל־הָעָ֑ם אֶֽת־יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ מְדַבֵּ֛ר אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה בְּבֵ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The priests and prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayishemeu hakhohaniym vehaneviiym vekhׇl-haam et-yiremeyahu medaver et-hadevariym haeleh veveyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כְּכַלּ֣וֹת יִרְמְיָ֗הוּ לְדַבֵּר֙ אֵ֣ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה לְדַבֵּ֖ר אֶל־כׇּל־הָעָ֑ם וַיִּתְפְּשׂ֨וּ אֹת֜וֹ הַכֹּהֲנִ֧ים וְהַנְּבִיאִ֛ים וְכׇל־הָעָ֥ם לֵאמֹ֖ר מ֥וֹת תָּמֽוּת׃
Translated: And when Jeremiah finished speaking all that G<small>OD</small> had commanded him to speak to all the people, the priests and the prophets and all the people seized him, shouting, “You shall die!
Transliteration: vayehiy khekhalvot yiremeyahu ledaver et khׇl-asher-tsivah yehovah ledaver el-khׇl-haam vayitefeshu otvo hakhohaniym vehaneviyiym vekhׇl-haam lemor mvot tamut

Hebrew: מַדּ֩וּעַ֩ נִבֵּ֨יתָ בְשֵׁם־יְהֹוָ֜ה לֵאמֹ֗ר כְּשִׁלוֹ֙ יִֽהְיֶה֙ הַבַּ֣יִת הַזֶּ֔ה וְהָעִ֥יר הַזֹּ֛את תֶּחֱרַ֖ב מֵאֵ֣ין יוֹשֵׁ֑ב וַיִּקָּהֵ֧ל כׇּל־הָעָ֛ם אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ בְּבֵ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: How dare you prophesy in the name of G<small>OD</small> that this House shall become like Shiloh and this city be made desolate, without inhabitants?” And all the people crowded about Jeremiah in the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: madua niveyta veshem-yehovah lemor kheshilvo yiheyeh havayiit hazeh vehaiyr hazot techerav meeyn yvoshev vayikahel khׇl-haam el-yiremeyahu veveyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֣וּ ׀ שָׂרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֗ה אֵ֚ת הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וַיַּעֲל֥וּ מִבֵּית־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֵּ֥שְׁב֛וּ בְּפֶ֥תַח שַֽׁעַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה הֶחָדָֽשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated: When the officials of Judah heard about this, they went up from the king’s palace to the House of G<small>OD</small> and held a session at the entrance of the New Gate of the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayishemeu sharey yehudah et hadevariym haeleh vayaalu miveyt-hamelekhe veyt yehovah vayeshevu vefetach shaar-yehovah hechadash {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמְר֜וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֤ים וְהַנְּבִאִים֙ אֶל־הַשָּׂרִ֔ים וְאֶל־כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר מִשְׁפַּט־מָ֙וֶת֙ לָאִ֣ישׁ הַזֶּ֔ה כִּ֤י נִבָּא֙ אֶל־הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר שְׁמַעְתֶּ֖ם בְּאׇזְנֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: The priests and prophets said to the officials and to all the people, “This man deserves the death penalty, for he has prophesied against this city, as you yourselves have heard.”
Transliteration: vayomeru hakhohaniym vehaneviiym el-hashariym veel-khׇl-haam lemor mishefat-mavet laiysh hazeh khiy niva el-haiyr hazot khaasher shemaetem veׇzeneykhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יִרְמְיָ֙הוּ֙ אֶל־כׇּל־הַשָּׂרִ֔ים וְאֶל־כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר יְהֹוָ֣ה שְׁלָחַ֗נִי לְהִנָּבֵ֞א אֶל־הַבַּ֤יִת הַזֶּה֙ וְאֶל־הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר שְׁמַעְתֶּֽם׃
Translated: Jeremiah said to the officials and to all the people, “It was G<small>OD</small> who sent me to prophesy against this House and this city all the words you heard.
Transliteration: vayomer yiremeyahu el-khׇl-hashariym veel-khׇl-haam lemor yehovah shelachaniy lehinave el-havayiit hazeh veel-haiyr hazot et khׇl-hadevariym asher shemaetem

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הֵיטִ֤יבוּ דַרְכֵיכֶם֙ וּמַ֣עַלְלֵיכֶ֔ם וְשִׁמְע֕וּ בְּק֖וֹל יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם וְיִנָּחֵ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־הָ֣רָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֖ר עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Therefore mend your ways and your acts, and heed the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God, that G<small>OD</small> may renounce the punishment that has been decreed for you.
Transliteration: veatah heytiyvu darekheykhem umaaleleykhem veshimeu vekvol yehovah eloheykhem veyinachem yehovah el-haraah asher diver aleykhem

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֖י הִנְנִ֣י בְיֶדְכֶ֑ם עֲשׂוּ־לִ֛י כַּטּ֥וֹב וְכַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: As for me, I am in your hands: do to me what seems good and right to you.
Transliteration: vaaniy hineniy veyedekhem ashu-liy khatvov vekhayashar veeyneykhem

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ ׀ יָדֹ֣עַ תֵּדְע֗וּ כִּ֣י אִם־מְמִתִ֣ים אַתֶּם֮ אֹתִי֒ כִּי־דָ֣ם נָקִ֗י אַתֶּם֙ נֹתְנִ֣ים עֲלֵיכֶ֔ם וְאֶל־הָעִ֥יר הַזֹּ֖את וְאֶל־יֹשְׁבֶ֑יהָ כִּ֣י בֶאֱמֶ֗ת שְׁלָחַ֤נִי יְהֹוָה֙ עֲלֵיכֶ֔ם לְדַבֵּר֙ בְּאׇזְנֵיכֶ֔ם אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃ {ס}
Translated: But know that if you put me to death, you and this city and its inhabitants will be guilty of shedding an innocent’s blood. For in truth G<small>OD</small> has sent me to you, to speak all these words to you.”
Transliteration: akhe yadoa tedeu khiy im-memitiym atem otiy khiy-dam nakiy atem noteniym aleykhem veel-haiyr hazot veel-yosheveyha khiy veemet shelachaniy yehovah aleykhem ledaver veׇzeneykhem et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ הַשָּׂרִים֙ וְכׇל־הָעָ֔ם אֶל־הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים וְאֶל־הַנְּבִיאִ֑ים אֵין־לָאִ֤ישׁ הַזֶּה֙ מִשְׁפַּט־מָ֔וֶת כִּ֗י בְּשֵׁ֛ם יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ דִּבֶּ֥ר אֵלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: Then the officials and all the people said to the priests and prophets, “This man does not deserve the death penalty, for he spoke to us in the name of the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God.”
Transliteration: vayomeru hashariym vekhׇl-haam el-hakhohaniym veel-haneviyiym eyn-laiysh hazeh mishefat-mavet khiy veshem yehovah eloheynu diver eleynu

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֣מוּ אֲנָשִׁ֔ים מִזִּקְנֵ֖י הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֶֽל־כׇּל־קְהַ֥ל הָעָ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: And some of the elders of the land arose and said to the entire assemblage of the people,
Transliteration: vayakumu anashiym mizikeney haarets vayomeru el-khׇl-kehal haam lemor

Hebrew: (מיכיה) [מִיכָה֙] הַמּ֣וֹרַשְׁתִּ֔י הָיָ֣ה נִבָּ֔א בִּימֵ֖י חִזְקִיָּ֣הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶל־כׇּל־עַם֩ יְהוּדָ֨ה לֵאמֹ֜ר כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֗וֹת צִיּ֞וֹן שָׂדֶ֤ה תֵחָרֵשׁ֙ וִירוּשָׁלַ֙יִם֙ עִיִּ֣ים תִּֽהְיֶ֔ה וְהַ֥ר הַבַּ֖יִת לְבָמ֥וֹת יָֽעַר׃
Translated:
“Micah the Morashtite, who prophesied in the days of King Hezekiah of Judah, said to all the people of Judah: ‘Thus said GOD of Hosts:
Zion shall be plowed as a field,
Jerusalem shall become heaps of ruins
And the Temple Mount a shrine in the woods.’
Transliteration: (mykhyh) [miykhah] hamvorashetiy hayah niva viymey chizekiyahu melekhe-yehudah vayomer el-khׇl-am yehudah lemor khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot tsiyyvon shadeh techaresh viyrushalayiim iyiym tiheyeh vehar havayiit levamvot yaar

Hebrew: הֶהָמֵ֣ת הֱ֠מִתֻ֠הוּ חִזְקִיָּ֨הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֜ה וְכׇל־יְהוּדָ֗ה הֲלֹא֮ יָרֵ֣א אֶת־יְהֹוָה֒ וַיְחַל֙ אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיִּנָּ֣חֶם יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־הָרָעָ֖ה אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֣ר עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וַאֲנַ֗חְנוּ עֹשִׂ֛ים רָעָ֥ה גְדוֹלָ֖ה עַל־נַפְשׁוֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: Did King Hezekiah of Judah, and all Judah, put him to death? Did he not rather fear G<small>OD</small> and implore G<small>OD</small>, so that G<small>OD</small> renounced the punishment He had decreed against them? We are about to do great injury to ourselves!”
Transliteration: hehamet hemituhu chizekiyahu melekhe-yehudah vekhׇl-yehudah halo yare et-yehovah vayechal et-feney yehovah vayinachem yehovah el-haraah asher-diver aleyhem vaanachenu oshiym raah gedvolah al-nafeshvoteynu

Hebrew: וְגַם־אִ֗ישׁ הָיָ֤ה מִתְנַבֵּא֙ בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה אוּרִיָּ֙הוּ֙ בֶּֽן־שְׁמַעְיָ֔הוּ מִקִּרְיַ֖ת הַיְּעָרִ֑ים וַיִּנָּבֵ֞א עַל־הָעִ֤יר הַזֹּאת֙ וְעַל־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את כְּכֹ֖ל דִּבְרֵ֥י יִרְמְיָֽהוּ׃
Translated: There was also a man prophesying in the name of G<small>OD</small>, Uriah son of Shemaiah from Kiriath-jearim, who prophesied against this city and this land the same things as Jeremiah.
Transliteration: vegam-iysh hayah mitenave veshem yehovah uriyahu ven-shemaeyahu mikireyat hayeariym vayinave al-haiyr hazot veal-haarets hazot khekhol diverey yiremeyahu

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע הַמֶּֽלֶךְ־יְ֠הוֹיָקִ֠ים וְכׇל־גִּבּוֹרָ֤יו וְכׇל־הַשָּׂרִים֙ אֶת־דְּבָרָ֔יו וַיְבַקֵּ֥שׁ הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ הֲמִית֑וֹ וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע אוּרִיָּ֙הוּ֙ וַיִּרָ֔א וַיִּבְרַ֖ח וַיָּבֹ֥א מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: King Jehoiakim and all his warriors and all the officials heard about his address, and the king wanted to put him to death. Uriah heard of this and fled in fear, and came to Egypt.
Transliteration: vayishema hamelekhe-yehvoyakiym vekhׇl-givvorayv vekhׇl-hashariym et-devarayv vayevakesh hamelekhe hamiytvo vayishema uriyahu vayira vayiverach vayavo mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֞ח הַמֶּ֧לֶךְ יְהוֹיָקִ֛ים אֲנָשִׁ֖ים מִצְרָ֑יִם אֵ֣ת אֶלְנָתָ֧ן בֶּן־עַכְבּ֛וֹר וַאֲנָשִׁ֥ים אִתּ֖וֹ אֶל־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: But King Jehoiakim sent agents—Elnathan son of Achbor and several men under him—to Egypt.
Transliteration: vayishelach hamelekhe yehvoyakiym anashiym mitserayiim et elenatan ven-akhevvor vaanashiym itvo el-mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצִ֨יאוּ אֶת־אוּרִיָּ֜הוּ מִמִּצְרַ֗יִם וַיְבִאֻ֙הוּ֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ יְהוֹיָקִ֔ים וַיַּכֵּ֖הוּ בֶּחָ֑רֶב וַיַּשְׁלֵךְ֙ אֶת־נִבְלָת֔וֹ אֶל־קִבְרֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י הָעָֽם׃
Translated: They took Uriah out of Egypt and brought him to King Jehoiakim, who had him put to the sword and his body thrown into the burial place of the common people.
Transliteration: vayyvotsiyu et-uriyahu mimitserayiim vayeviuhu el-hamelekhe yehvoyakiym vayakhehu vecharev vayashelekhe et-nivelatvo el-kiverey veney haam

Hebrew: אַ֗ךְ יַ֚ד אֲחִיקָ֣ם בֶּן־שָׁפָ֔ן הָיְתָ֖ה אֶֽת־יִרְמְיָ֑הוּ לְבִלְתִּ֛י תֵּת־אֹת֥וֹ בְיַד־הָעָ֖ם לַהֲמִיתֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: However, Ahikam son of Shaphan protected Jeremiah, so that he was not handed over to the people for execution.
Transliteration: akhe yad achiykam ven-shafan hayetah et-yiremeyahu leviletiy tet-otvo veyad-haam lahamiytvo {f}

Hebrew: בְּרֵאשִׁ֗ית מַמְלֶ֛כֶת יְהוֹיָקִ֥ם בֶּן־יֹאושִׁיָּ֖הוּ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה הָיָ֞ה הַדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֔ה מֵאֵ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: At the beginning of the reign of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from G<small>OD</small>:
Transliteration: vereshiyt mamelekhet yehvoyakim ven-yovshiyahu melekhe yehudah hayah hadavar hazeh el-yiremeyah meet yehovah lemor

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלַ֔י עֲשֵׂ֣ה לְךָ֔ מוֹסֵר֖וֹת וּמֹט֑וֹת וּנְתַתָּ֖ם עַל־צַוָּארֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small> to me: Make for yourself thongs and bars of a yoke, and put them on your neck.
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah elay asheh lekha mvoservot umotvot unetatam al-tsavarekha

Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּחְתָּם֩ אֶל־מֶ֨לֶךְ אֱד֜וֹם וְאֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ מוֹאָ֗ב וְאֶל־מֶ֙לֶךְ֙ בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן וְאֶל־מֶ֥לֶךְ צֹ֖ר וְאֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ צִיד֑וֹן בְּיַ֤ד מַלְאָכִים֙ הַבָּאִ֣ים יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם אֶל־צִדְקִיָּ֖הוּ מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: And send them to the king of Edom, the king of Moab, the king of the Ammonites, the king of Tyre, and the king of Sidon, by envoys who have come to King Zedekiah of Judah in Jerusalem;
Transliteration: veshilachetam el-melekhe edvom veel-melekhe mvoav veel-melekhe veney amvon veel-melekhe tsor veel-melekhe tsiydvon veyad maleakhiym havaiym yerushala͏im el-tsidekiyahu melekhe yehudah

Hebrew: וְצִוִּיתָ֣ אֹתָ֔ם אֶל־אֲדֹנֵיהֶ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כֹּ֥ה תֹאמְר֖וּ אֶל־אֲדֹנֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: and give them this charge to their masters: Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: Say this to your masters:
Transliteration: vetsiviyta otam el-adoneyhem lemor khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael khoh tomeru el-adoneykhem

Hebrew: אָנֹכִ֞י עָשִׂ֣יתִי אֶת־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֶת־הָאָדָ֤ם וְאֶת־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ בְּכֹחִי֙ הַגָּד֔וֹל וּבִזְרוֹעִ֖י הַנְּטוּיָ֑ה וּנְתַתִּ֕יהָ לַאֲשֶׁ֖ר יָשַׁ֥ר בְּעֵינָֽי׃
Translated: “It is I who made the earth, and the humans and animals that are on the earth, by My great might and My outstretched arm; and I give it to whomever I deem proper.
Transliteration: anokhiy ashiytiy et-haarets et-haadam veet-havehemah asher al-feney haarets vekhochiy hagadvol uvizervoiy hanetuyah unetatiyha laasher yashar veeynay

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה אָֽנֹכִי֙ נָתַ֙תִּי֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָאֲרָצ֣וֹת הָאֵ֔לֶּה בְּיַ֛ד נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּ֥ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל עַבְדִּ֑י וְגַם֙ אֶת־חַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה נָתַ֥תִּי ל֖וֹ לְעׇבְדֽוֹ׃
Translated: I herewith deliver all these lands to My servant, King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon; I even give him the wild beasts to serve him.
Transliteration: veatah anokhiy natatiy et-khׇl-haaratsvot haeleh veyad nevukhadenetsar melekhe-vavel avediy vegam et-chayat hashadeh natatiy lvo leׇvedvo

Hebrew: וְעָבְד֤וּ אֹתוֹ֙ כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם וְאֶת־בְּנ֖וֹ וְאֶֽת־בֶּן־בְּנ֑וֹ עַ֣ד בֹּא־עֵ֤ת אַרְצוֹ֙ גַּם־ה֔וּא וְעָ֤בְדוּ בוֹ֙ גּוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֔ים וּמְלָכִ֖ים גְּדֹלִֽים׃
Translated: All nations shall serve him, his son and his grandson—until the turn of his own land comes, when many nations and great kings shall subjugate him.
Transliteration: veavedu otvo khׇl-hagvoyim veet-venvo veet-ven-venvo ad vo-et aretsvo gam-hu veavedu vvo gvoyim raviym umelakhiym gedoliym

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה הַגּ֜וֹי וְהַמַּמְלָכָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־יַעַבְד֤וּ אֹתוֹ֙ אֶת־נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּ֣ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֔ל וְאֵ֨ת אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־יִתֵּן֙ אֶת־צַוָּאר֔וֹ בְּעֹ֖ל מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֑ל בַּחֶ֩רֶב֩ וּבָרָעָ֨ב וּבַדֶּ֜בֶר אֶפְקֹ֨ד עַל־הַגּ֤וֹי הַהוּא֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה עַד־תֻּמִּ֥י אֹתָ֖ם בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: The nation or kingdom that does not serve him—King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon—and does not put its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, that nation I will visit—declares G<small>OD</small>—with sword, famine, and pestilence, until I have destroyed it by his hands.
Transliteration: vehayah hagvoy vehamamelakhah asher lo-yaavedu otvo et-nevukhadenetsar melekhe-vavel veet asher lo-yiten et-tsavarvo veol melekhe vavel vacherev uvaraav uvadever efekod al-hagvoy hahu neum-yehovah ad-tumiy otam veyadvo

Hebrew: וְ֠אַתֶּ֠ם אַל־תִּשְׁמְע֨וּ אֶל־נְבִיאֵיכֶ֜ם וְאֶל־קֹסְמֵיכֶ֗ם וְאֶל֙ חֲלֹמֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וְאֶל־עֹנְנֵיכֶ֖ם וְאֶל־כַּשָּׁפֵיכֶ֑ם אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֞ם אֹמְרִ֤ים אֲלֵיכֶם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹ֥א תַעַבְד֖וּ אֶת־מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: As for you, give no heed to your prophets, augurs, dreamers, diviners, and sorcerers, who say to you, ‘Do not serve the king of Babylon.’
Transliteration: veatem al-tishemeu el-neviyeykhem veel-kosemeykhem veel chalomoteykhem veel-oneneykhem veel-khashafeykhem asher-hem omeriym aleykhem lemor lo taavedu et-melekhe vavel

Hebrew: כִּ֣י שֶׁ֔קֶר הֵ֖ם נִבְּאִ֣ים לָכֶ֑ם לְמַ֨עַן הַרְחִ֤יק אֶתְכֶם֙ מֵעַ֣ל אַדְמַתְכֶ֔ם וְהִדַּחְתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם וַאֲבַדְתֶּֽם׃
Translated: For they prophesy falsely to you—with the result that you shall be banished from your land; I will drive you out and you shall perish.
Transliteration: khiy sheker hem niveiym lakhem lemaan harechiyk etekhem meal adematekhem vehidachetiy etekhem vaavadetem

Hebrew: וְהַגּ֗וֹי אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָבִ֧יא אֶת־צַוָּאר֛וֹ בְּעֹ֥ל מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל וַעֲבָד֑וֹ וְהִנַּחְתִּ֤יו עַל־אַדְמָתוֹ֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַעֲבָדָ֖הּ וְיָ֥שַׁב בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: But the nation that puts its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, and serves him, will be left by Me on its own soil—declares G<small>OD</small>—to till it and dwell on it.”
Transliteration: vehagvoy asher yaviy et-tsavarvo veol melekhe-vavel vaavadvo vehinachetiyv al-adematvo neum-yehovah vaavadah veyashav vah

Hebrew: וְאֶל־צִדְקִיָּ֤ה מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָה֙ דִּבַּ֔רְתִּי כְּכׇל־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה לֵאמֹ֑ר הָבִ֨יאוּ אֶת־צַוְּארֵיכֶ֜ם בְּעֹ֣ל מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֗ל וְעִבְד֥וּ אֹת֛וֹ וְעַמּ֖וֹ וִֽחְיֽוּ׃
Translated: I also spoke to King Zedekiah of Judah in just the same way: “Put your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon; serve him and his people, and live!
Transliteration: veel-tsidekiyah melekhe-yehudah divaretiy khekhׇl-hadevariym haeleh lemor haviyu et-tsavereykhem veol melekhe-vavel veivedu otvo veamvo vicheyu

Hebrew: לָ֤מָּה תָמ֙וּתוּ֙ אַתָּ֣ה וְעַמֶּ֔ךָ בַּחֶ֖רֶב בָּרָעָ֣ב וּבַדָּ֑בֶר כַּֽאֲשֶׁר֙ דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־הַגּ֕וֹי אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יַעֲבֹ֖ד אֶת־מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: Otherwise you will die together with your people, by sword, famine, and pestilence, as G<small>OD</small> has decreed against any nation that does not serve the king of Babylon.
Transliteration: lamah tamutu atah veamekha vacherev varaav uvadaver khaasher diver yehovah el-hagvoy asher lo-yaavod et-melekhe vavel

Hebrew: וְאַֽל־תִּשְׁמְע֞וּ אֶל־דִּבְרֵ֣י הַנְּבִאִ֗ים הָאֹמְרִ֤ים אֲלֵיכֶם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹ֥א תַעַבְד֖וּ אֶת־מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֑ל כִּ֣י שֶׁ֔קֶר הֵ֖ם נִבְּאִ֥ים לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: Give no heed to the words of the prophets who say to you, ‘Do not serve the king of Babylon,’ for they prophesy falsely to you.
Transliteration: veal-tishemeu el-diverey haneviiym haomeriym aleykhem lemor lo taavedu et-melekhe vavel khiy sheker hem niveiym lakhem

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֤א שְׁלַחְתִּים֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהֵ֛ם נִבְּאִ֥ים בִּשְׁמִ֖י לַשָּׁ֑קֶר לְמַ֨עַן הַדִּיחִ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ וַאֲבַדְתֶּ֔ם אַתֶּ֕ם וְהַנְּבִאִ֖ים הַֽנִּבְּאִ֥ים לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: I have not sent them—declares G<small>OD</small>—and they prophesy falsely in My name, with the result that I will drive you out and you shall perish, together with the prophets who prophesy to you.”
Transliteration: khiy lo shelachetiym neum-yehovah vehem niveiym vishemiy lashaker lemaan hadiychiy etekhem vaavadetem atem vehaneviiym haniveiym lakhem

Hebrew: וְאֶל־הַכֹּהֲנִים֩ וְאֶל־כׇּל־הָעָ֨ם הַזֶּ֜ה דִּבַּ֣רְתִּי לֵאמֹ֗ר כֹּה֮ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָה֒ אַֽל־תִּשְׁמְע֞וּ אֶל־דִּבְרֵ֣י נְבִיאֵיכֶ֗ם הַֽנִּבְּאִ֤ים לָכֶם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הִנֵּ֨ה כְלֵ֧י בֵית־יְהֹוָ֛ה מוּשָׁבִ֥ים מִבָּבֶ֖לָה עַתָּ֣ה מְהֵרָ֑ה כִּ֣י שֶׁ֔קֶר הֵ֖מָּה נִבְּאִ֥ים לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: And to the priests and to all that people I said: “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Give no heed to the words of the prophets who prophesy to you, ‘The vessels of the House of G<small>OD</small> shall shortly be brought back from Babylon,’ for they prophesy falsely to you.
Transliteration: veel-hakhohaniym veel-khׇl-haam hazeh divaretiy lemor khoh amar yehovah al-tishemeu el-diverey neviyeykhem haniveiym lakhem lemor hineh kheley veyt-yehovah mushaviym mivavelah atah meherah khiy sheker hemah niveiym lakhem

Hebrew: אַל־תִּשְׁמְע֣וּ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם עִבְד֥וּ אֶת־מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל וִֽחְי֑וּ לָ֧מָּה תִֽהְיֶ֛ה הָעִ֥יר הַזֹּ֖את חׇרְבָּֽה׃
Translated: Give them no heed. Serve the king of Babylon, and live! Otherwise this city shall become a ruin.
Transliteration: al-tishemeu aleyhem ivedu et-melekhe-vavel vicheyu lamah tiheyeh haiyr hazot chׇrevah

Hebrew: וְאִם־נְבִאִ֣ים הֵ֔ם וְאִם־יֵ֥שׁ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אִתָּ֑ם יִפְגְּעוּ־נָא֙ בַּיהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת לְבִלְתִּי־בֹ֜אוּ הַכֵּלִ֣ים ׀ הַנּוֹתָרִ֣ים בְּבֵית־יְהֹוָ֗ה וּבֵ֨ית מֶ֧לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֛ה וּבִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בָּבֶֽלָה׃
Translated: If they are really prophets and the word of G<small>OD</small> is with them, let them intercede with G<small>OD</small> of Hosts not to let the vessels remaining in the House of G<small>OD</small>, in the royal palace of Judah, and in Jerusalem, go to Babylon!
Transliteration: veim-neviiym hem veim-eish devar-yehovah itam yifegeu-na vayhovah tsevavot leviletiy-vou hakheliym hanvotariym veveyt-yehovah uveyt melekhe yehudah uviyrushala͏im vavelah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֤ה אָמַר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת אֶל־הָֽעַמֻּדִ֔ים וְעַל־הַיָּ֖ם וְעַל־הַמְּכֹנ֑וֹת וְעַל֙ יֶ֣תֶר הַכֵּלִ֔ים הַנּוֹתָרִ֖ים בָּעִ֥יר הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: “For thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts concerning the columns, the tank, the stands, and the rest of the vessels remaining in this city,
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar yehovah tsevavot el-haamudiym veal-hayam veal-hamekhonvot veal yeter hakheliym hanvotariym vaiyr hazot

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־לְקָחָ֗ם נְבֽוּכַדְנֶאצַּר֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֔ל בַּ֠גְלוֹת֠וֹ אֶת־[יְכׇנְיָ֨ה] (יכוניה) בֶן־יְהוֹיָקִ֧ים מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֛ה מִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בָּבֶ֑לָה וְאֵ֛ת כׇּל־חֹרֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה וִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: which King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon did not take when he exiled King Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, with all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem;
Transliteration: asher lo-lekacham nevukhadenetsar melekhe vavel vagelvotvo et-[yekhׇneyah] (ykhvnyh) ven-yehvoyakiym melekhe-yehudah miyrushala͏im vavelah veet khׇl-chorey yehudah viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֥ה אָמַ֛ר יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עַל־הַכֵּלִ֗ים הַנּֽוֹתָרִים֙ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה וּבֵ֥ית מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֖ה וִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: for thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel, concerning the vessels remaining in the House of G<small>OD</small>, in the royal palace of Judah, and in Jerusalem:
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael al-hakheliym hanvotariym veyt yehovah uveyt melekhe-yehudah viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: בָּבֶ֥לָה יוּבָ֖אוּ וְשָׁ֣מָּה יִֽהְי֑וּ עַ֠ד י֣וֹם פׇּקְדִ֤י אֹתָם֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהַֽעֲלִיתִים֙ וַהֲשִׁ֣יבֹתִ֔ים אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: They shall be brought to Babylon, and there they shall remain, until I take note of them—declares G<small>OD</small> of Hosts—and bring them up and restore them to this place.”
Transliteration: vavelah yuvau veshamah yiheyu ad yvom fׇkediy otam neum-yehovah vehaaliytiym vahashiyvotiym el-hamakvom hazeh {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּשָּׁנָ֣ה הַהִ֗יא בְּרֵאשִׁית֙ מַמְלֶ֙כֶת֙ צִדְקִיָּ֣ה מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֔ה (בשנת) [בַּשָּׁנָה֙] הָרְבִעִ֔ית בַּחֹ֖דֶשׁ הַחֲמִישִׁ֑י אָמַ֣ר אֵלַ֡י חֲנַנְיָה֩ בֶן־עַזּ֨וּר הַנָּבִ֜יא אֲשֶׁ֤ר מִגִּבְעוֹן֙ בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה לְעֵינֵ֧י הַכֹּהֲנִ֛ים וְכׇל־הָעָ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: That year, early in the reign of King Zedekiah of Judah, in the fifth month of the fourth year, the prophet Hananiah son of Azzur, who was from Gibeon, spoke to me in the House of G<small>OD</small>, in the presence of the priests and all the people. He said:
Transliteration: vayehiy vashanah hahiy vereshiyt mamelekhet tsidekiyah melekhe-yehudah (vshnt) [vashanah] hareviiyt vachodesh hachamiyshiy amar elay chananeyah ven-azur hanaviy asher migivevon veveyt yehovah leeyney hakhohaniym vekhׇl-haam lemor

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר יְהֹוָ֧ה צְבָא֛וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר שָׁבַ֕רְתִּי אֶת־עֹ֖ל מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: “Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: I hereby break the yoke of the king of Babylon.
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael lemor shavaretiy et-ol melekhe vavel

Hebrew: בְּע֣וֹד ׀ שְׁנָתַ֣יִם יָמִ֗ים אֲנִ֤י מֵשִׁיב֙ אֶל־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה אֶֽת־כׇּל־כְּלֵ֖י בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר לָקַ֜ח נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּ֤ר מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶל֙ מִן־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה וַיְבִיאֵ֖ם בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: In two years, I will restore to this place all the vessels of the House of G<small>OD</small> that King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon took from this place and brought to Babylon.
Transliteration: vevod shenatayiim yamiym aniy meshiyv el-hamakvom hazeh et-khׇl-kheley veyt yehovah asher lakach nevukhadenetsar melekhe-vavel min-hamakvom hazeh vayeviyem vavel

Hebrew: וְאֶת־יְכׇנְיָ֣ה בֶן־יְהוֹיָקִ֣ים מֶלֶךְ־יְ֠הוּדָ֠ה וְאֶת־כׇּל־גָּל֨וּת יְהוּדָ֜ה הַבָּאִ֣ים בָּבֶ֗לָה אֲנִ֥י מֵשִׁ֛יב אֶל־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֣י אֶשְׁבֹּ֔ר אֶת־עֹ֖ל מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: And I will bring back to this place King Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim of Judah, and all the Judean exiles who went to Babylon—declares G<small>OD</small>. Yes, I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.”
Transliteration: veet-yekhׇneyah ven-yehvoyakiym melekhe-yehudah veet-khׇl-galut yehudah havaiym vavelah aniy meshiyv el-hamakvom hazeh neum-yehovah khiy eshevor et-ol melekhe vavel

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יִרְמְיָ֣ה הַנָּבִ֔יא אֶל־חֲנַנְיָ֖ה הַנָּבִ֑יא לְעֵינֵ֤י הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ וּלְעֵינֵ֣י כׇל־הָעָ֔ם הָעֹמְדִ֖ים בְּבֵ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Then the prophet Jeremiah answered the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests and of all the people who were standing in the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayomer yiremeyah hanaviy el-chananeyah hanaviy leeyney hakhohaniym uleeyney khׇl-haam haomediym veveyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יִרְמְיָ֣ה הַנָּבִ֔יא אָמֵ֕ן כֵּ֖ן יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה יְהֹוָ֑ה יָקֵ֤ם יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־דְּבָרֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִבֵּ֗אתָ לְהָשִׁ֞יב כְּלֵ֤י בֵית־יְהֹוָה֙ וְכׇל־הַגּוֹלָ֔ה מִבָּבֶ֖ל אֶל־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: The prophet Jeremiah said: “Amen! May G<small>OD</small> do so! May G<small>OD</small> fulfill what you have prophesied and bring back from Babylon to this place the vessels of the House of G<small>OD</small> and all the exiles!
Transliteration: vayomer yiremeyah hanaviy amen khen yaasheh yehovah yakem yehovah et-devareykha asher niveta lehashiyv kheley veyt-yehovah vekhׇl-hagvolah mivavel el-hamakvom hazeh

Hebrew: אַךְ־שְׁמַֽע־נָא֙ הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י דֹּבֵ֣ר בְּאׇזְנֶ֑יךָ וּבְאׇזְנֵ֖י כׇּל־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: But just listen to this word that I address to you and to all the people:
Transliteration: akhe-shema-na hadavar hazeh asher anokhiy dover veׇzeneykha uveׇzeney khׇl-haam

Hebrew: הַנְּבִיאִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר הָי֧וּ לְפָנַ֛י וּלְפָנֶ֖יךָ מִן־הָעוֹלָ֑ם וַיִּנָּ֨בְא֜וּ אֶל־אֲרָצ֤וֹת רַבּוֹת֙ וְעַל־מַמְלָכ֣וֹת גְּדֹל֔וֹת לְמִלְחָמָ֖ה וּלְרָעָ֥ה וּלְדָֽבֶר׃
Translated: The prophets who lived before you and me from ancient times prophesied war, disaster, and pestilence against many lands and great kingdoms.
Transliteration: haneviyiym asher hayu lefanay ulefaneykha min-havolam vayinaveu el-aratsvot ravvot veal-mamelakhvot gedolvot lemilechamah uleraah uledaver

Hebrew: הַנָּבִ֕יא אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִנָּבֵ֖א לְשָׁל֑וֹם בְּבֹא֙ דְּבַ֣ר הַנָּבִ֔יא יִוָּדַע֙ הַנָּבִ֔יא אֲשֶׁר־שְׁלָח֥וֹ יְהֹוָ֖ה בֶּאֱמֶֽת׃
Translated: So if a prophet prophesies good fortune, then only when the word of the prophet comes true can it be known that G<small>OD</small> really sent him.”
Transliteration: hanaviy asher yinave leshalvom vevo devar hanaviy yivada hanaviy asher-shelachvo yehovah veemet

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֞ח חֲנַנְיָ֤ה הַנָּבִיא֙ אֶת־הַמּוֹטָ֔ה מֵעַ֕ל צַוַּ֖אר יִרְמְיָ֣ה הַנָּבִ֑יא וַֽיִּשְׁבְּרֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: But the prophet Hananiah removed the bar from the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, and broke it;
Transliteration: vayikach chananeyah hanaviy et-hamvotah meal tsavar yiremeyah hanaviy vayisheverehu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר חֲנַנְיָה֩ לְעֵינֵ֨י כׇל־הָעָ֜ם לֵאמֹ֗ר כֹּה֮ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָה֒ כָּ֣כָה אֶשְׁבֹּ֞ר אֶת־עֹ֣ל ׀ נְבֻכַדְנֶאצַּ֣ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֗ל בְּעוֹד֙ שְׁנָתַ֣יִם יָמִ֔ים מֵעַ֕ל צַוַּ֖אר כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֑ם וַיֵּ֛לֶךְ יִרְמְיָ֥ה הַנָּבִ֖יא לְדַרְכּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: and Hananiah said in the presence of all the people, “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: So will I break the yoke of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon from off the necks of all the nations, in two years.” And the prophet Jeremiah went on his way.
Transliteration: vayomer chananeyah leeyney khׇl-haam lemor khoh amar yehovah khakhah eshevor et-ol nevukhadenetsar melekhe-vavel vevod shenatayiim yamiym meal tsavar khׇl-hagvoyim vayelekhe yiremeyah hanaviy ledarekhvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֑ה אַ֠חֲרֵ֠י שְׁב֞וֹר חֲנַנְיָ֤ה הַנָּבִיא֙ אֶת־הַמּוֹטָ֔ה מֵעַ֗ל צַוַּ֛אר יִרְמְיָ֥ה הַנָּבִ֖יא לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: After the prophet Hananiah had broken the bar from off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, the word of G<small>OD</small> came to Jeremiah:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-yiremeyah acharey shevvor chananeyah hanaviy et-hamvotah meal tsavar yiremeyah hanaviy lemor

Hebrew: הָלוֹךְ֩ וְאָמַרְתָּ֨ אֶל־חֲנַנְיָ֜ה לֵאמֹ֗ר כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה מוֹטֹ֥ת עֵ֖ץ שָׁבָ֑רְתָּ וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ תַחְתֵּיהֶ֖ן מֹט֥וֹת בַּרְזֶֽל׃
Translated: “Go say to Hananiah: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: You broke bars of wood, but you shall make bars of iron instead.
Transliteration: halvokhe veamareta el-chananeyah lemor khoh amar yehovah mvotot ets shavareta veashiyta tacheteyhen motvot varezel

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹֽה־אָמַר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה צְבָא֜וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל עֹ֣ל בַּרְזֶ֡ל נָתַ֜תִּי עַל־צַוַּ֣אר ׀ כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֣ם הָאֵ֗לֶּה לַעֲבֹ֛ד אֶת־נְבֻכַדְנֶאצַּ֥ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל וַעֲבָדֻ֑הוּ וְגַ֛ם אֶת־חַיַּ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה נָתַ֥תִּי לֽוֹ׃
Translated: For thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: I have put an iron yoke upon the necks of all those nations, that they may serve King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon—and serve him they shall! I have even given the wild beasts to him.”
Transliteration: khiy khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael ol varezel natatiy al-tsavar khׇl-hagvoyim haeleh laavod et-nevukhadenetsar melekhe-vavel vaavaduhu vegam et-chayat hashadeh natatiy lvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יִרְמְיָ֧ה הַנָּבִ֛יא אֶל־חֲנַנְיָ֥ה הַנָּבִ֖יא שְׁמַֽע־נָ֣א חֲנַנְיָ֑ה לֹא־שְׁלָחֲךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֔ה וְאַתָּ֗ה הִבְטַ֛חְתָּ אֶת־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה עַל־שָֽׁקֶר׃
Translated: And the prophet Jeremiah said to the prophet Hananiah, “Listen, Hananiah! G<small>OD</small> did not send you, and you have given this people lying assurances.
Transliteration: vayomer yiremeyah hanaviy el-chananeyah hanaviy shema-na chananeyah lo-shelachakha yehovah veatah hivetacheta et-haam hazeh al-shaker

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנְנִי֙ מְשַֽׁלֵּחֲךָ֔ מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֣י הָאֲדָמָ֑ה הַשָּׁנָה֙ אַתָּ֣ה מֵ֔ת כִּי־סָרָ֥ה דִבַּ֖רְתָּ אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said G<small>OD</small>: I am going to banish you from off the earth. This year you shall die, for you have urged disloyalty to G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar yehovah hineniy meshalechakha meal feney haadamah hashanah atah met khiy-sarah divareta el-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֛מׇת חֲנַנְיָ֥ה הַנָּבִ֖יא בַּשָּׁנָ֣ה הַהִ֑יא בַּחֹ֖דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: And the prophet Hananiah died that year, in the seventh month.
Transliteration: vayamׇt chananeyah hanaviy vashanah hahiy vachodesh hasheviyiy {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ דִּבְרֵ֣י הַסֵּ֔פֶר אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁלַ֛ח יִרְמְיָ֥ה הַנָּבִ֖יא מִירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם אֶל־יֶ֜תֶר זִקְנֵ֣י הַגּוֹלָ֗ה וְאֶל־הַכֹּהֲנִ֤ים וְאֶל־הַנְּבִיאִים֙ וְאֶל־כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֶגְלָ֧ה נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּ֛ר מִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בָּבֶֽלָה׃
Translated: This is the text of the letter that the prophet Jeremiah sent from Jerusalem to the priests, the prophets, the rest of the elders of the exile community, and to all the people whom Nebuchadnezzar had exiled from Jerusalem to Babylon—
Transliteration: veeleh diverey hasefer asher shalach yiremeyah hanaviy miyrushala͏im el-yeter zikeney hagvolah veel-hakhohaniym veel-haneviyiym veel-khׇl-haam asher hegelah nevukhadenetsar miyrushala͏im vavelah

Hebrew: אַחֲרֵ֣י צֵ֣את יְכׇנְיָֽה־הַ֠מֶּ֠לֶךְ וְהַגְּבִירָ֨ה וְהַסָּרִיסִ֜ים שָׂרֵ֨י יְהוּדָ֧ה וִירוּשָׁלַ֛͏ִם וְהֶחָרָ֥שׁ וְהַמַּסְגֵּ֖ר מִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: after King Jeconiah, the queen mother, the eunuchs, the officials of Judah and Jerusalem, and the artisans and smiths had left Jerusalem.
Transliteration: acharey tset yekhׇneyah-hamelekhe vehageviyrah vehasariysiym sharey yehudah viyrushala͏im vehecharash vehamaseger miyrushala͏im

Hebrew: בְּיַד֙ אֶלְעָשָׂ֣ה בֶן־שָׁפָ֔ן וּגְמַרְיָ֖ה בֶּן־חִלְקִיָּ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר שָׁלַ֜ח צִדְקִיָּ֣ה מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֗ה אֶל־נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּ֛ר מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶ֖ל בָּבֶ֥לָה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: [The letter was sent] through Elasah son of Shaphan and Gemariah son of Hilkiah, whom King Zedekiah of Judah had dispatched to Babylon, to King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon.
Transliteration: veyad eleashah ven-shafan ugemareyah ven-chilekiyah asher shalach tsidekiyah melekhe-yehudah el-nevukhadenetsar melekhe vavel vavelah lemor

Hebrew: כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֛ר יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לְכׇ֨ל־הַגּוֹלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־הִגְלֵ֥יתִי מִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בָּבֶֽלָה׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel, to the whole community that I exiled from Jerusalem to Babylon:
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael lekhׇl-hagvolah asher-higeleytiy miyrushala͏im vavelah

Hebrew: בְּנ֥וּ בָתִּ֖ים וְשֵׁ֑בוּ וְנִטְע֣וּ גַנּ֔וֹת וְאִכְל֖וּ אֶת־פִּרְיָֽן׃
Translated: Build houses and live in them, plant gardens and eat their fruit.
Transliteration: venu vatiym veshevu veniteu ganvot veikhelu et-fireyan

Hebrew: קְח֣וּ נָשִׁ֗ים וְהוֹלִ֘ידוּ֮ בָּנִ֣ים וּבָנוֹת֒ וּקְח֨וּ לִבְנֵיכֶ֜ם נָשִׁ֗ים וְאֶת־בְּנֽוֹתֵיכֶם֙ תְּנ֣וּ לַאֲנָשִׁ֔ים וְתֵלַ֖דְנָה בָּנִ֣ים וּבָנ֑וֹת וּרְבוּ־שָׁ֖ם וְאַל־תִּמְעָֽטוּ׃
Translated: You should take wives and beget sons and daughters; and you should take wives for your sons, and give your daughters to husbands, that they may bear sons and daughters. Multiply there, do not decrease.
Transliteration: kechu nashiym vehvoliydu vaniym uvanvot ukechu liveneykhem nashiym veet-venvoteykhem tenu laanashiym veteladenah vaniym uvanvot urevu-sham veal-timeatu

Hebrew: וְדִרְשׁ֞וּ אֶת־שְׁל֣וֹם הָעִ֗יר אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִגְלֵ֤יתִי אֶתְכֶם֙ שָׁ֔מָּה וְהִתְפַּֽלְל֥וּ בַעֲדָ֖הּ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֣י בִשְׁלוֹמָ֔הּ יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם שָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: And seek the welfare of the city to which I have exiled you and pray to G<small>OD</small> in its behalf; for in its prosperity you shall prosper.
Transliteration: vedireshu et-shelvom haiyr asher higeleytiy etekhem shamah vehitefalelu vaadah el-yehovah khiy vishelvomah yiheyeh lakhem shalvom

Hebrew: כִּי֩ כֹ֨ה אָמַ֜ר יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַל־יַשִּׁ֧יאוּ לָכֶ֛ם נְבִיאֵיכֶ֥ם אֲשֶׁר־בְּקִרְבְּכֶ֖ם וְקֹסְמֵיכֶ֑ם וְאַֽל־תִּשְׁמְעוּ֙ אֶל־חֲלֹמֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֖ם מַחְלְמִֽים׃
Translated: For thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: Let not the prophets and diviners in your midst deceive you, and pay no heed to the dreams they dream.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael al-yashiyu lakhem neviyeykhem asher-vekirevekhem vekosemeykhem veal-tishemeu el-chalomoteykhem asher atem machelemiym

Hebrew: כִּ֣י בְשֶׁ֔קֶר הֵ֛ם נִבְּאִ֥ים לָכֶ֖ם בִּשְׁמִ֑י לֹ֥א שְׁלַחְתִּ֖ים נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: For they prophesy to you in My name falsely; I did not send them—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: khiy vesheker hem niveiym lakhem vishemiy lo shelachetiym neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־כֹה֙ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֠י לְפִ֞י מְלֹ֧את לְבָבֶ֛ל שִׁבְעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה אֶפְקֹ֣ד אֶתְכֶ֑ם וַהֲקִמֹתִ֤י עֲלֵיכֶם֙ אֶת־דְּבָרִ֣י הַטּ֔וֹב לְהָשִׁ֣יב אֶתְכֶ֔ם אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: For thus said G<small>OD</small>: When Babylon’s seventy years are over, I will take note of you, and I will fulfill to you My promise of favor—to bring you back to this place.
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah khiy lefiy melot levavel shiveiym shanah efekod etekhem vahakimotiy aleykhem et-devariy hatvov lehashiyv etekhem el-hamakvom hazeh

Hebrew: כִּי֩ אָנֹכִ֨י יָדַ֜עְתִּי אֶת־הַמַּחֲשָׁבֹ֗ת אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י חֹשֵׁ֥ב עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה מַחְשְׁב֤וֹת שָׁלוֹם֙ וְלֹ֣א לְרָעָ֔ה לָתֵ֥ת לָכֶ֖ם אַחֲרִ֥ית וְתִקְוָֽה׃
Translated: For I am mindful of the plans I have made concerning you—declares G<small>OD</small>—plans for your welfare, not for disaster, to give you a hopeful future.
Transliteration: khiy anokhiy yadaetiy et-hamachashavot asher anokhiy choshev aleykhem neum-yehovah macheshevvot shalvom velo leraah latet lakhem achariyt vetikevah

Hebrew: וּקְרָאתֶ֤ם אֹתִי֙ וַֽהֲלַכְתֶּ֔ם וְהִתְפַּלַּלְתֶּ֖ם אֵלָ֑י וְשָׁמַעְתִּ֖י אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: When you call Me, and come and pray to Me, I will give heed to you.
Transliteration: ukeratem otiy vahalakhetem vehitefalaletem elay veshamaetiy aleykhem

Hebrew: וּבִקַּשְׁתֶּ֥ם אֹתִ֖י וּמְצָאתֶ֑ם כִּ֥י תִדְרְשֻׁ֖נִי בְּכׇל־לְבַבְכֶֽם׃
Translated: You will search for Me and find Me, if only you seek Me wholeheartedly.
Transliteration: uvikashetem otiy umetsatem khiy tidereshuniy vekhׇl-levavekhem

Hebrew: וְנִמְצֵ֣אתִי לָכֶם֮ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָה֒ וְשַׁבְתִּ֣י אֶת־[שְׁבוּתְכֶ֗ם] (שביתכם) וְקִבַּצְתִּ֣י אֶ֠תְכֶ֠ם מִֽכׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֞ם וּמִכׇּל־הַמְּקוֹמ֗וֹת אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִדַּ֧חְתִּי אֶתְכֶ֛ם שָׁ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַהֲשִׁבֹתִ֣י אֶתְכֶ֔ם אֶ֨ל־הַמָּק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁר־הִגְלֵ֥יתִי אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִשָּֽׁם׃
Translated: I will be at hand for you—declares G<small>OD</small>—and I will restore your fortunes. And I will gather you from all the nations and from all the places to which I have banished you—declares G<small>OD</small>—and I will bring you back to the place from which I have exiled you.
Transliteration: venimetsetiy lakhem neum-yehovah veshavetiy et-[shevutekhem] (shvytkhm) vekivatsetiy etekhem mikhׇl-hagvoyim umikhׇl-hamekvomvot asher hidachetiy etekhem sham neum-yehovah vahashivotiy etekhem el-hamakvom asher-higeleytiy etekhem misham

Hebrew: כִּ֖י אֲמַרְתֶּ֑ם הֵקִ֨ים לָ֧נוּ יְהֹוָ֛ה נְבִאִ֖ים בָּבֶֽלָה׃ {ס}
Translated: But you say, “G<small>OD</small> has raised up prophets for us in Babylon.”
Transliteration: khiy amaretem hekiym lanu yehovah neviiym vavelah {s}

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶל־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ הַיּוֹשֵׁב֙ אֶל־כִּסֵּ֣א דָוִ֔ד וְאֶ֨ל־כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם הַיּוֹשֵׁ֖ב בָּעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֑את אֲחֵיכֶ֕ם אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹֽא־יָצְא֥וּ אִתְּכֶ֖ם בַּגּוֹלָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small> concerning the king who sits on the throne of David, and concerning all the people who dwell in this city, your kinsfolk who did not go out with you into exile—
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah el-hamelekhe hayyvoshev el-khise david veel-khׇl-haam hayyvoshev vaiyr hazot acheykhem asher lo-yatseu itekhem vagvolah {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת הִנְנִי֙ מְשַׁלֵּ֣חַ בָּ֔ם אֶת־הַחֶ֖רֶב אֶת־הָרָעָ֣ב וְאֶת־הַדָּ֑בֶר וְנָתַתִּ֣י אוֹתָ֗ם כַּתְּאֵנִים֙ הַשֹּׁ֣עָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־תֵאָכַ֖לְנָה מֵרֹֽעַ׃
Translated: thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts: I am going to let loose sword, famine, and pestilence against them and I will treat them as loathsome figs, so bad that they cannot be eaten.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah tsevavot hineniy meshalecha vam et-hacherev et-haraav veet-hadaver venatatiy votam khateeniym hashoariym asher lo-teakhalenah meroa

Hebrew: וְרָֽדַפְתִּי֙ אַֽחֲרֵיהֶ֔ם בַּחֶ֖רֶב בָּרָעָ֣ב וּבַדָּ֑בֶר וּנְתַתִּ֨ים (לזועה) [לְזַעֲוָ֜ה] לְכֹ֣ל ׀ מַמְלְכ֣וֹת הָאָ֗רֶץ לְאָלָ֤ה וּלְשַׁמָּה֙ וְלִשְׁרֵקָ֣ה וּלְחֶרְפָּ֔ה בְּכׇל־הַגּוֹיִ֖ם אֲשֶׁר־הִדַּחְתִּ֥ים שָֽׁם׃
Translated: I will pursue them with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence; and I will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth, an execration and an object of horror and hissing and scorn among all the nations to which I shall banish them,
Transliteration: veradafetiy achareyhem vacherev varaav uvadaver unetatiym (lzvh) [lezaavah] lekhol mamelekhvot haarets lealah uleshamah velisherekah ulecherefah vekhׇl-hagvoyim asher-hidachetiym sham

Hebrew: תַּ֛חַת אֲשֶֽׁר־לֹא־שָׁמְע֥וּ אֶל־דְּבָרַ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר֩ שָׁלַ֨חְתִּי אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם אֶת־עֲבָדַ֤י הַנְּבִאִים֙ הַשְׁכֵּ֣ם וְשָׁלֹ֔חַ וְלֹ֥א שְׁמַעְתֶּ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: because they did not heed My words—declares G<small>OD</small>—when I persistently sent to them My servants, the prophets, and they did not heed—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: tachat asher-lo-shameu el-devaray neum-yehovah asher shalachetiy aleyhem et-avaday haneviiym hashekhem veshalocha velo shemaetem neum-yehovah

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֖ם שִׁמְע֣וּ דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֑ה כׇּ֨ל־הַגּוֹלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־שִׁלַּ֥חְתִּי מִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בָּבֶֽלָה׃ {ס}
Translated: But you, the whole exile community that I banished from Jerusalem to Babylon, hear the word of G<small>OD</small>!
Transliteration: veatem shimeu devar-yehovah khׇl-hagvolah asher-shilachetiy miyrushala͏im vavelah {s}

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־אָמַר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה צְבָא֜וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֶל־אַחְאָ֤ב בֶּן־קֽוֹלָיָה֙ וְאֶל־צִדְקִיָּ֣הוּ בֶן־מַֽעֲשֵׂיָ֔ה הַֽנִּבְּאִ֥ים לָכֶ֛ם בִּשְׁמִ֖י שָׁ֑קֶר הִנְנִ֣י ׀ נֹתֵ֣ן אֹתָ֗ם בְּיַד֙ נְבֽוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֣ר מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֔ל וְהִכָּ֖ם לְעֵינֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel, concerning Ahab son of Kolaiah and Zedekiah son of Maaseiah, who prophesy falsely to you in My name: I am going to deliver them into the hands of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, and he shall put them to death before your eyes.
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael el-acheav ven-kvolayah veel-tsidekiyahu ven-maasheyah haniveiym lakhem vishemiy shaker hineniy noten otam veyad nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel vehikham leeyneykhem

Hebrew: וְלֻקַּ֤ח מֵהֶם֙ קְלָלָ֔ה לְכֹל֙ גָּל֣וּת יְהוּדָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּבָבֶ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר יְשִֽׂמְךָ֤ יְהֹוָה֙ כְּצִדְקִיָּ֣הוּ וּכְאֶחָ֔ב אֲשֶׁר־קָלָ֥ם מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: And the whole community of Judah in Babylonia shall use a curse derived from their fate: “May God make you like Zedekiah and Ahab, whom the king of Babylon consigned to the flames!”—
Transliteration: velukach mehem kelalah lekhol galut yehudah asher vevavel lemor yeshimekha yehovah khetsidekiyahu ukheechav asher-kalam melekhe-vavel vaesh

Hebrew: יַ֡עַן אֲשֶׁר֩ עָשׂ֨וּ נְבָלָ֜ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וַיְנַֽאֲפוּ֙ אֶת־נְשֵׁ֣י רֵֽעֵיהֶ֔ם וַיְדַבְּר֨וּ דָבָ֤ר בִּשְׁמִי֙ שֶׁ֔קֶר אֲשֶׁ֖ר ל֣וֹא צִוִּיתִ֑ם וְאָנֹכִ֛י (הוידע) [הַיּוֹדֵ֥עַ] וָעֵ֖ד נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: because they did vile things in Israel, committing adultery with the wives of their fellows and speaking in My name false words that I had not commanded them. I am the One who knows and bears witness—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: yaan asher ashu nevalah veyisherael vayenaafu et-neshey reeyhem vayedaveru davar vishemiy sheker asher lvo tsiviytim veanokhiy (hvyd) [hayyvodea] vaed neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וְאֶל־שְׁמַעְיָ֥הוּ הַנֶּחֱלָמִ֖י תֹּאמַ֥ר לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite you shall say:
Transliteration: veel-shemaeyahu hanechelamiy tomar lemor

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־אָמַ֞ר יְהֹוָ֧ה צְבָא֛וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר יַ֡עַן אֲשֶׁ֣ר אַתָּה֩ שָׁלַ֨חְתָּ בְשִׁמְכָ֜ה סְפָרִ֗ים אֶל־כׇּל־הָעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּירוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְאֶל־צְפַנְיָ֤ה בֶן־מַֽעֲשֵׂיָה֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְאֶ֥ל כׇּל־הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: Because you sent letters in your own name to all the people in Jerusalem, to Zephaniah son of Maaseiah and to the rest of the priests, as follows,
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael lemor yaan asher atah shalacheta veshimekhah sefariym el-khׇl-haam asher viyrushala͏im veel-tsefaneyah ven-maasheyah hakhohen veel khׇl-hakhohaniym lemor

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֞ה נְתָנְךָ֣ כֹהֵ֗ן תַּ֚חַת יְהוֹיָדָ֣ע הַכֹּהֵ֔ן לִֽהְי֤וֹת פְּקִדִים֙ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה לְכׇל־אִ֥ישׁ מְשֻׁגָּ֖ע וּמִתְנַבֵּ֑א וְנָתַתָּ֥ה אֹת֛וֹ אֶל־הַמַּהְפֶּ֖כֶת וְאֶל־הַצִּינֹֽק׃
Translated: “G<small>OD</small> appointed you priest in place of the priest Jehoiada, to exercise authority in the House of G<small>OD</small> over every maniac who wants to play the prophet, to put them into the stocks and into the pillory.
