Transliteration: yehovah netanekha khohen tachat yehvoyada hakhohen liheyvot fekidiym veyt yehovah lekhׇl-iysh meshuga umitenave venatatah otvo el-hamahefekhet veel-hatsiynok

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה לָ֚מָּה לֹ֣א גָעַ֔רְתָּ בְּיִרְמְיָ֖הוּ הָֽעַנְּתֹתִ֑י הַמִּתְנַבֵּ֖א לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: Now why have you not rebuked Jeremiah the Anathothite, who plays the prophet among you?
Transliteration: veatah lamah lo gaareta veyiremeyahu haanetotiy hamitenave lakhem

Hebrew: כִּ֣י עַל־כֵּ֞ן שָׁלַ֥ח אֵלֵ֛ינוּ בָּבֶ֥ל לֵאמֹ֖ר אֲרֻכָּ֣ה הִ֑יא בְּנ֤וּ בָתִּים֙ וְשֵׁ֔בוּ וְנִטְע֣וּ גַנּ֔וֹת וְאִכְל֖וּ אֶת־פְּרִיהֶֽן׃
Translated: For he has actually sent a message to us in Babylon to this effect: It will be a long time. Build houses and live in them, plant gardens and enjoy their fruit.”—
Transliteration: khiy al-khen shalach eleynu vavel lemor arukhah hiy venu vatiym veshevu veniteu ganvot veikhelu et-feriyhen

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֛א צְפַנְיָ֥ה הַכֹּהֵ֖ן אֶת־הַסֵּ֣פֶר הַזֶּ֑ה בְּאׇזְנֵ֖י יִרְמְיָ֥הוּ הַנָּבִֽיא׃ {פ}
Translated: When the priest Zephaniah read this letter in the hearing of the prophet Jeremiah,
Transliteration: vayikera tsefaneyah hakhohen et-hasefer hazeh veׇzeney yiremeyahu hanaviy {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: the word of G<small>OD</small> came to Jeremiah:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-yiremeyahu lemor

Hebrew: שְׁלַ֤ח עַל־כׇּל־הַגּוֹלָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־שְׁמַעְיָ֖ה הַנֶּחֱלָמִ֑י יַ֡עַן אֲשֶׁר֩ נִבָּ֨א לָכֶ֜ם שְׁמַעְיָ֗ה וַֽאֲנִי֙ לֹ֣א שְׁלַחְתִּ֔יו וַיַּבְטַ֥ח אֶתְכֶ֖ם עַל־שָֽׁקֶר׃
Translated: Send a message to the entire exile community: “Thus said G<small>OD</small> concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite: Because Shemaiah prophesied to you, though I did not send him, and made you false promises,
Transliteration: shelach al-khׇl-hagvolah lemor khoh amar yehovah el-shemaeyah hanechelamiy yaan asher niva lakhem shemaeyah vaaniy lo shelachetiyv vayavetach etekhem al-shaker

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן כֹּֽה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה הִנְנִ֨י פֹקֵ֜ד עַל־שְׁמַעְיָ֣ה הַנֶּחֱלָמִי֮ וְעַל־זַרְעוֹ֒ לֹא־יִהְיֶ֨ה ל֜וֹ אִ֣ישׁ ׀ יוֹשֵׁ֣ב ׀ בְּתוֹךְ־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֗ה וְלֹֽא־יִרְאֶ֥ה בַטּ֛וֹב אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֥י עֹשֶֽׂה־לְעַמִּ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּֽי־סָרָ֥ה דִבֶּ֖ר עַל־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: assuredly, thus said G<small>OD</small>: I am going to punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite and his offspring. There shall be no one of his line dwelling among this people or seeing the good things I am going to do for My people—declares G<small>OD</small>—for he has urged disloyalty toward G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah hineniy foked al-shemaeyah hanechelamiy veal-zarevo lo-yiheyeh lvo iysh yvoshev vetvokhe-haam hazeh velo-yireeh vatvov asher-aniy osheh-leamiy neum-yehovah khiy-sarah diver al-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָיָ֣ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ מֵאֵ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word that came to Jeremiah from G<small>OD</small>:
Transliteration: hadavar asher hayah el-yiremeyahu meet yehovah lemor

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־אָמַ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר כְּתׇב־לְךָ֗ אֵ֧ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֥רְתִּי אֵלֶ֖יךָ אֶל־סֵֽפֶר׃
Translated: Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: Write down in a scroll all the words that I have spoken to you.
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael lemor khetׇv-lekha et khׇl-hadevariym asher-divaretiy eleykha el-sefer

Hebrew: כִּ֠י הִנֵּ֨ה יָמִ֤ים בָּאִים֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְ֠שַׁבְתִּ֠י אֶת־שְׁב֨וּת עַמִּ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל וִֽיהוּדָ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה וַהֲשִׁבֹתִ֗ים אֶל־הָאָ֛רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תִּי לַאֲבוֹתָ֖ם וִֽירֵשֽׁוּהָ׃ {פ}
Translated: For days are coming—declares G<small>OD</small>—when I will restore the fortunes of My people Israel and Judah, said G<small>OD</small>; and I will bring them back to the land that I gave their ancestors, and they shall possess it.
Transliteration: khiy hineh yamiym vaiym neum-yehovah veshavetiy et-shevut amiy yisherael viyhudah amar yehovah vahashivotiym el-haarets asher-natatiy laavvotam viyreshuha {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣לֶּה הַדְּבָרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְאֶל־יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: And these are the words that G<small>OD</small> spoke concerning Israel and Judah:
Transliteration: veeleh hadevariym asher diver yehovah el-yisherael veel-yehudah

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹה֙ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה ק֥וֹל חֲרָדָ֖ה שָׁמָ֑עְנוּ פַּ֖חַד וְאֵ֥ין שָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
We have heard cries of panic,
Terror without relief.
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah kvol charadah shamaenu fachad veeyn shalvom

Hebrew: שַׁאֲלוּ־נָ֣א וּרְא֔וּ אִם־יֹלֵ֖ד זָכָ֑ר מַדּ֩וּעַ֩ רָאִ֨יתִי כׇל־גֶּ֜בֶר יָדָ֤יו עַל־חֲלָצָיו֙ כַּיּ֣וֹלֵדָ֔ה וְנֶהֶפְכ֥וּ כׇל־פָּנִ֖ים לְיֵרָקֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Ask and see:
Surely males do not bear young!
Why then do I see every man
With his hands on his loins
Like a woman in labor?
Why have all faces turned pale?
Transliteration: shaalu-na ureu im-yoled zakhar madua raiytiy khׇl-gever yadayv al-chalatsayv khayyvoledah venehefekhu khׇl-faniym leeirakvon

Hebrew: ה֗וֹי כִּ֥י גָד֛וֹל הַיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא מֵאַ֣יִן כָּמֹ֑הוּ וְעֵֽת־צָרָ֥ה הִיא֙ לְיַֽעֲקֹ֔ב וּמִמֶּ֖נָּה יִוָּשֵֽׁעַ׃
Translated:
Ah, that day is awesome;
There is none like it!
It is a time of trouble for Jacob,
But he shall be delivered from it.
Transliteration: hvoy khiy gadvol hayyvom hahu meayiin khamohu veet-tsarah hiy leyaakov umimenah yivashea

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֩ בַיּ֨וֹם הַה֜וּא נְאֻ֣ם ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֗וֹת אֶשְׁבֹּ֤ר עֻלּוֹ֙ מֵעַ֣ל צַוָּארֶ֔ךָ וּמוֹסְרוֹתֶ֖יךָ אֲנַתֵּ֑ק וְלֹא־יַעַבְדוּ־ב֥וֹ ע֖וֹד זָרִֽים׃
Translated: In that day—declares G<small>OD</small> of Hosts—I will break the yoke from off your neck and I will rip off your bonds. Strangers shall no longer make slaves of them;
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu neum yehovah tsevavot eshevor ulvo meal tsavarekha umvoservoteykha anatek velo-yaavedu-vvo vod zariym

Hebrew: וְעָ֣בְד֔וּ אֵ֖ת יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיהֶ֑ם וְאֵת֙ דָּוִ֣ד מַלְכָּ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָקִ֖ים לָהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: instead, they shall serve the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God and David, the king whom I will raise up for them.
Transliteration: veavedu et yehovah eloheyhem veet david malekham asher akiym lahem {s}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֡ה אַל־תִּירָא֩ עַבְדִּ֨י יַעֲקֹ֤ב נְאֻם־יְהֹוָה֙ וְאַל־תֵּחַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֠י הִנְנִ֤י מוֹשִֽׁיעֲךָ֙ מֵֽרָח֔וֹק וְאֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֖ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ שִׁבְיָ֑ם וְשָׁ֧ב יַעֲקֹ֛ב וְשָׁקַ֥ט וְשַׁאֲנַ֖ן וְאֵ֥ין מַחֲרִֽיד׃
Translated:
But you,
Have no fear, My servant Jacob
—declares GOD—
Be not dismayed, O Israel!
I will deliver you from far away,
Your folk from their land of captivity.
And Jacob shall again have calm
And quiet with none to trouble him;
Transliteration: veatah al-tiyra avediy yaakov neum-yehovah veal-techat yisherael khiy hineniy mvoshiyakha merachvok veet-zareakha meerets shiveyam veshav yaakov veshakat veshaanan veeyn machariyd

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אִתְּךָ֥ אֲנִ֛י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֖ה לְהֽוֹשִׁיעֶ֑ךָ כִּי֩ אֶעֱשֶׂ֨ה כָלָ֜ה בְּכׇֽל־הַגּוֹיִ֣ם ׀ אֲשֶׁ֧ר הֲפִצוֹתִ֣יךָ שָּׁ֗ם אַ֤ךְ אֹֽתְךָ֙ לֹֽא־אֶעֱשֶׂ֣ה כָלָ֔ה וְיִסַּרְתִּ֙יךָ֙ לַמִּשְׁפָּ֔ט וְנַקֵּ֖ה לֹ֥א אֲנַקֶּֽךָּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
For I am with you to deliver you
—declares GOD.
I will make an end of all the nations
Among which I have dispersed you;
But I will not make an end of you!
I will not leave you unpunished,
But will chastise you in measure.
Transliteration: khiy-itekha aniy neum-yehovah lehvoshiyekha khiy eesheh khalah vekhׇl-hagvoyim asher hafitsvotiykha sham akhe otekha lo-eesheh khalah veyisaretiykha lamishefat venakeh lo anakekha {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֥ה אָמַ֛ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אָנ֣וּשׁ לְשִׁבְרֵ֑ךְ נַחְלָ֖ה מַכָּתֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
For thus said GOD:
Your injury is incurable,
Your wound severe;
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar yehovah anush leshiverekhe nachelah makhatekhe

Hebrew: אֵֽין־דָּ֥ן דִּינֵ֖ךְ לְמָז֑וֹר רְפֻא֥וֹת תְּעָלָ֖ה אֵ֥ין לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
No one pleads for the healing of your sickness,
There is no remedy, no recovery for you.
Transliteration: eyn-dan diynekhe lemazvor refuvot tealah eyn lakhe

Hebrew: כׇּל־מְאַהֲבַ֣יִךְ שְׁכֵח֔וּךְ אוֹתָ֖ךְ לֹ֣א יִדְרֹ֑שׁוּ כִּי֩ מַכַּ֨ת אוֹיֵ֤ב הִכִּיתִיךְ֙ מוּסַ֣ר אַכְזָרִ֔י עַ֚ל רֹ֣ב עֲוֺנֵ֔ךְ עָצְמ֖וּ חַטֹּאתָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
All your lovers have forgotten you,
They do not seek you out;
For I have struck you as an enemy strikes,
With cruel chastisement,
Because your iniquity was so great
And your sins so many.
Transliteration: khׇl-meahavayiikhe shekhechukhe votakhe lo yideroshu khiy makhat voeiv hikhiytiykhe musar akhezariy al rov avonekhe atsemu chatotayiikhe

Hebrew: מַה־תִּזְעַק֙ עַל־שִׁבְרֵ֔ךְ אָנ֖וּשׁ מַכְאֹבֵ֑ךְ עַ֣ל ׀ רֹ֣ב עֲוֺנֵ֗ךְ עָֽצְמוּ֙ חַטֹּאתַ֔יִךְ עָשִׂ֥יתִי אֵ֖לֶּה לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
Why cry out over your injury,
That your wound is incurable?
I did these things to you
Because your iniquity was so great
And your sins so many.
Transliteration: mah-tizeak al-shiverekhe anush makheovekhe al rov avonekhe atsemu chatotayiikhe ashiytiy eleh lakhe

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן כׇּל־אֹכְלַ֙יִךְ֙ יֵאָכֵ֔לוּ וְכׇל־צָרַ֥יִךְ כֻּלָּ֖ם בַּשְּׁבִ֣י יֵלֵ֑כוּ וְהָי֤וּ שֹׁאסַ֙יִךְ֙ לִמְשִׁסָּ֔ה וְכׇל־בֹּזְזַ֖יִךְ אֶתֵּ֥ן לָבַֽז׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
All who wanted to devour you shall be devoured,
And every one of your foes shall go into captivity;
Those who despoiled you shall be despoiled,
And all who pillaged you I will give up to pillage.
Transliteration: lakhen khׇl-okhelayiikhe eiakhelu vekhׇl-tsarayiikhe khulam vasheviy eilekhu vehayu shosayiikhe limeshisah vekhׇl-vozezayiikhe eten lavaz

Hebrew: כִּי֩ אַעֲלֶ֨ה אֲרֻכָ֥ה לָ֛ךְ וּמִמַּכּוֹתַ֥יִךְ אֶרְפָּאֵ֖ךְ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֤י נִדָּחָה֙ קָ֣רְאוּ לָ֔ךְ צִיּ֣וֹן הִ֔יא דֹּרֵ֖שׁ אֵ֥ין לָֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
But I will bring healing to you
And cure you of your wounds
—declares GOD.
Though they called you “Outcast,
That Zion whom no one seeks out,”
Transliteration: khiy aaleh arukhah lakhe umimakhvotayiikhe erefaekhe neum-yehovah khiy nidachah kareu lakhe tsiyyvon hiy doresh eyn lah {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה הִנְנִי־שָׁב֙ שְׁבוּת֙ אׇהֳלֵ֣י יַֽעֲק֔וֹב וּמִשְׁכְּנֹתָ֖יו אֲרַחֵ֑ם וְנִבְנְתָ֥ה עִיר֙ עַל־תִּלָּ֔הּ וְאַרְמ֖וֹן עַל־מִשְׁפָּט֥וֹ יֵשֵֽׁב׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
I will restore the fortunes of Jacob’s tents
And have compassion upon his dwellings.
The city shall be rebuilt on its mound,
And the fortress in its proper place.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah hineniy-shav shevut ׇholey yaakvov umishekhenotayv arachem venivenetah iyr al-tilah vearemvon al-mishefatvo eishev

Hebrew: וְיָצָ֥א מֵהֶ֛ם תּוֹדָ֖ה וְק֣וֹל מְשַׂחֲקִ֑ים וְהִרְבִּתִים֙ וְלֹ֣א יִמְעָ֔טוּ וְהִכְבַּדְתִּ֖ים וְלֹ֥א יִצְעָֽרוּ׃
Translated:
From them shall issue thanksgiving
And the sound of dancers.
I will multiply them,
And they shall not be few;
I will make them honored,
And they shall not be humbled.
Transliteration: veyatsa mehem tvodah vekvol meshachakiym vehirevitiym velo yimeatu vehikhevadetiym velo yitsearu

Hebrew: וְהָי֤וּ בָנָיו֙ כְּקֶ֔דֶם וַעֲדָת֖וֹ לְפָנַ֣י תִּכּ֑וֹן וּפָ֣קַדְתִּ֔י עַ֖ל כׇּל־לֹחֲצָֽיו׃
Translated:
His children shall be as of old,
And his community shall be established by My grace;
And I will deal with all his oppressors.
Transliteration: vehayu vanayv khekedem vaadatvo lefanay tikhvon ufakadetiy al khׇl-lochatsayv

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה אַדִּיר֜וֹ מִמֶּ֗נּוּ וּמֹֽשְׁלוֹ֙ מִקִּרְבּ֣וֹ יֵצֵ֔א וְהִקְרַבְתִּ֖יו וְנִגַּ֣שׁ אֵלָ֑י כִּי֩ מִ֨י הוּא־זֶ֜ה עָרַ֧ב אֶת־לִבּ֛וֹ לָגֶ֥שֶׁת אֵלַ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
His chieftain shall be one of his own,
His ruler shall come from his midst;
I will bring him near, that he may approach Me
—declares GOD—
For who would otherwise dare approach Me?
Transliteration: vehayah adiyrvo mimenu umoshelvo mikirevvo eitse vehikeravetiyv venigash elay khiy miy hu-zeh arav et-livvo lageshet elay neum-yehovah

Hebrew: וִהְיִ֥יתֶם לִ֖י לְעָ֑ם וְאָ֣נֹכִ֔י אֶהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
You shall be My people,
And I will be your God.
Transliteration: viheyiytem liy leam veanokhiy eheyeh lakhem lelohiym {s}

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ סַעֲרַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֗ה חֵמָה֙ יָֽצְאָ֔ה סַ֖עַר מִתְגּוֹרֵ֑ר עַ֛ל רֹ֥אשׁ רְשָׁעִ֖ים יָחֽוּל׃
Translated:
Lo, GOD’s storm goes forth in fury,
A raging tempest;
It shall whirl down upon the head of the wicked.
Transliteration: hineh saarat yehovah chemah yatseah saar mitegvorer al rosh reshaiym yachul

Hebrew: לֹ֣א יָשׁ֗וּב חֲרוֹן֙ אַף־יְהֹוָ֔ה עַד־עֲשֹׂת֥וֹ וְעַד־הֲקִימ֖וֹ מְזִמּ֣וֹת לִבּ֑וֹ בְּאַחֲרִ֥ית הַיָּמִ֖ים תִּתְבּ֥וֹנְנוּ בָֽהּ׃
Translated:
The anger of GOD shall not turn back
Till it has fulfilled and completed God’s purposes.
In the days to come
You shall perceive it.
Transliteration: lo yashuv charvon af-yehovah ad-ashotvo vead-hakiymvo mezimvot livvo veachariyt hayamiym titevvonenu vah

Hebrew: בָּעֵ֤ת הַהִיא֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶֽהְיֶה֙ לֵֽאלֹהִ֔ים לְכֹ֖ל מִשְׁפְּח֣וֹת יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהֵ֖מָּה יִֽהְיוּ־לִ֥י לְעָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: At that time—declares G<small>OD</small>—I will be God to all the clans of Israel, and they shall be My people.
Transliteration: vaet hahiy neum-yehovah eheyeh lelohiym lekhol mishefechvot yisherael vehemah yiheyu-liy leam {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה מָצָ֥א חֵן֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר עַ֖ם שְׂרִ֣ידֵי חָ֑רֶב הָל֥וֹךְ לְהַרְגִּיע֖וֹ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
The people escaped from the sword,
Found favor in the wilderness;
When Israel was marching homeward
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah matsa chen vamidevar am sheriydey charev halvokhe leharegiyvo yisherael

Hebrew: מֵרָח֕וֹק יְהֹוָ֖ה נִרְאָ֣ה לִ֑י וְאַהֲבַ֤ת עוֹלָם֙ אֲהַבְתִּ֔יךְ עַל־כֵּ֖ן מְשַׁכְתִּ֥יךְ חָֽסֶד׃
Translated:
GOD was revealed long ago.
Eternal love I conceived for you then;
Therefore I continue My grace to you.
Transliteration: merachvok yehovah nireah liy veahavat volam ahavetiykhe al-khen meshakhetiykhe chased

Hebrew: ע֤וֹד אֶבְנֵךְ֙ וְֽנִבְנֵ֔ית בְּתוּלַ֖ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל ע֚וֹד תַּעְדִּ֣י תֻפַּ֔יִךְ וְיָצָ֖את בִּמְח֥וֹל מְשַׂחֲקִֽים׃
Translated:
I will build you firmly again,
O Maiden Israel!
Again you shall take up your hand-drums
And go forth to the rhythm of the dancers.
Transliteration: vod evenekhe veniveneyt vetulat yisherael vod taediy tufayiikhe veyatsat vimechvol meshachakiym

Hebrew: ע֚וֹד תִּטְּעִ֣י כְרָמִ֔ים בְּהָרֵ֖י שֹֽׁמְר֑וֹן נָטְע֥וּ נֹטְעִ֖ים וְחִלֵּֽלוּ׃
Translated:
Again you shall plant vineyards
On the hills of Samaria;
You shall plant and live to enjoy the fruit.
Transliteration: vod titeiy kheramiym veharey shomervon nateu noteiym vechilelu

Hebrew: כִּ֣י יֶשׁ־י֔וֹם קָרְא֥וּ נֹצְרִ֖ים בְּהַ֣ר אֶפְרָ֑יִם ק֚וּמוּ וְנַעֲלֶ֣ה צִיּ֔וֹן אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
For the day is coming when watchmen
Shall proclaim on the heights of Ephraim:
Come, let us go up to Zion,
To the ETERNAL our God!
Transliteration: khiy yesh-yvom kareu notseriym vehar eferayiim kumu venaaleh tsiyyvon el-yehovah eloheynu {f}

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה רׇנּ֤וּ לְיַֽעֲקֹב֙ שִׂמְחָ֔ה וְצַהֲל֖וּ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ הַגּוֹיִ֑ם הַשְׁמִ֤יעוּ הַֽלְלוּ֙ וְאִמְר֔וּ הוֹשַׁ֤ע יְהֹוָה֙ אֶֽת־עַמְּךָ֔ אֵ֖ת שְׁאֵרִ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
For thus said GOD:
Cry out in joy for Jacob,
Shout at the crossroads of the nations!
Sing aloud in praise, and say:
Save, O ETERNAL One, Your people,
The remnant of Israel.
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah rׇnu leyaakov shimechah vetsahalu verosh hagvoyim hashemiyu halelu veimeru hvosha yehovah et-amekha et sheeriyt yisherael

Hebrew: הִנְנִי֩ מֵבִ֨יא אוֹתָ֜ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ צָפ֗וֹן וְקִבַּצְתִּים֮ מִיַּרְכְּתֵי־אָ֒רֶץ֒ בָּ֚ם עִוֵּ֣ר וּפִסֵּ֔חַ הָרָ֥ה וְיֹלֶ֖דֶת יַחְדָּ֑ו קָהָ֥ל גָּד֖וֹל יָשׁ֥וּבוּ הֵֽנָּה׃
Translated:
I will bring them in from the northland,
Gather them from the ends of the earth—
The blind and the lame among them,
Those with child and those in labor—
In a vast throng they shall return here.
Transliteration: hineniy meviy votam meerets tsafvon vekivatsetiym miyarekhetey-arets vam iver ufisecha harah veyoledet yachedav kahal gadvol yashuvu henah

Hebrew: בִּבְכִ֣י יָבֹ֗אוּ וּֽבְתַחֲנוּנִים֮ אֽוֹבִילֵם֒ אֽוֹלִיכֵם֙ אֶל־נַ֣חֲלֵי מַ֔יִם בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ יָשָׁ֔ר לֹ֥א יִכָּשְׁל֖וּ בָּ֑הּ כִּֽי־הָיִ֤יתִי לְיִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לְאָ֔ב וְאֶפְרַ֖יִם בְּכֹ֥רִי הֽוּא׃ {פ}
Translated:
They shall come with weeping,
And with compassion will I guide them.
I will lead them to streams of water,
By a level road where they will not stumble.
For I am ever a Father to Israel,
Ephraim is My first-born.
Transliteration: vivekhiy yavou uvetachanuniym voviylem voliykhem el-nachaley mayiim vederekhe yashar lo yikhashelu vah khiy-hayiytiy leyisherael leav veeferayiim vekhoriy hu {f}

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֤וּ דְבַר־יְהֹוָה֙ גּוֹיִ֔ם וְהַגִּ֥ידוּ בָאִיִּ֖ים מִמֶּרְחָ֑ק וְאִמְר֗וּ מְזָרֵ֤ה יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ יְקַבְּצֶ֔נּוּ וּשְׁמָר֖וֹ כְּרֹעֶ֥ה עֶדְרֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Hear the word of GOD, O nations,
And tell it in the isles afar.
Say:
The One who scattered Israel will gather them,
And will guard them as a shepherd his flock.
Transliteration: shimeu devar-yehovah gvoyim vehagiydu vaiyiym mimerechak veimeru mezareh yisherael yekavetsenu ushemarvo kheroeh edervo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־פָדָ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֑ב וּגְאָל֕וֹ מִיַּ֖ד חָזָ֥ק מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
For GOD will ransom Jacob,
Redeem him from one too strong for him.
Transliteration: khiy-fadah yehovah et-yaakov ugealvo miyad chazak mimenu

Hebrew: וּבָ֘אוּ֮ וְרִנְּנ֣וּ בִמְרוֹם־צִיּוֹן֒ וְנָהֲר֞וּ אֶל־ט֣וּב יְהֹוָ֗ה עַל־דָּגָן֙ וְעַל־תִּירֹ֣שׁ וְעַל־יִצְהָ֔ר וְעַל־בְּנֵי־צֹ֖אן וּבָקָ֑ר וְהָיְתָ֤ה נַפְשָׁם֙ כְּגַ֣ן רָוֶ֔ה וְלֹא־יוֹסִ֥יפוּ לְדַאֲבָ֖ה עֽוֹד׃
Translated:
They shall come and shout on the heights of Zion,
Radiant over GOD’s bounty—
Over new grain and wine and oil,
And over sheep and cattle.
They shall fare like a watered garden,
They shall never languish again.
Transliteration: uvau verinenu vimervom-tsiyyvon venaharu el-tuv yehovah al-dagan veal-tiyrosh veal-yitsehar veal-veney-tson uvakar vehayetah nafesham khegan raveh velo-yvosiyfu ledaavah vod

Hebrew: אָ֣ז תִּשְׂמַ֤ח בְּתוּלָה֙ בְּמָח֔וֹל וּבַחֻרִ֥ים וּזְקֵנִ֖ים יַחְדָּ֑ו וְהָפַכְתִּ֨י אֶבְלָ֤ם לְשָׂשׂוֹן֙ וְנִ֣חַמְתִּ֔ים וְשִׂמַּחְתִּ֖ים מִיגוֹנָֽם׃
Translated:
Then shall maidens dance gaily,
Young men and old alike.
I will turn their mourning to joy,
I will comfort them and cheer them in their grief.
Transliteration: az tishemach vetulah vemachvol uvachuriym uzekeniym yachedav vehafakhetiy evelam leshashvon venichametiym veshimachetiym miygvonam

Hebrew: וְרִוֵּיתִ֛י נֶ֥פֶשׁ הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים דָּ֑שֶׁן וְעַמִּ֛י אֶת־טוּבִ֥י יִשְׂבָּ֖עוּ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
I will give the priests their fill of fatness,
And My people shall enjoy My full bounty
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: veriveytiy nefesh hakhohaniym dashen veamiy et-tuviy yishevau neum-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה ק֣וֹל בְּרָמָ֤ה נִשְׁמָע֙ נְהִי֙ בְּכִ֣י תַמְרוּרִ֔ים רָחֵ֖ל מְבַכָּ֣ה עַל־בָּנֶ֑יהָ מֵאֲנָ֛ה לְהִנָּחֵ֥ם עַל־בָּנֶ֖יהָ כִּ֥י אֵינֶֽנּוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
A cry is heard in Ramah—
Wailing, bitter weeping—
Rachel weeping for her children.
She refuses to be comforted
For her children, who are gone.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah kvol veramah nishema nehiy vekhiy tameruriym rachel mevakhah al-vaneyha meanah lehinachem al-vaneyha khiy eynenu {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה מִנְעִ֤י קוֹלֵךְ֙ מִבֶּ֔כִי וְעֵינַ֖יִךְ מִדִּמְעָ֑ה כִּי֩ יֵ֨שׁ שָׂכָ֤ר לִפְעֻלָּתֵךְ֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְשָׁ֖בוּ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ אוֹיֵֽב׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
Restrain your voice from weeping,
Your eyes from shedding tears;
For there is a reward for your labor
—declares GOD:
They shall return from the enemy’s land.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah mineiy kvolekhe mivekhiy veeynayiikhe midimeah khiy eish shakhar lifeulatekhe neum-yehovah veshavu meerets voeiv

Hebrew: וְיֵשׁ־תִּקְוָ֥ה לְאַחֲרִיתֵ֖ךְ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְשָׁ֥בוּ בָנִ֖ים לִגְבוּלָֽם׃
Translated:
And there is hope for your future
—declares GOD:
Your children shall return to their country.
Transliteration: veeish-tikevah leachariytekhe neum-yehovah veshavu vaniym ligevulam

Hebrew: שָׁמ֣וֹעַ שָׁמַ֗עְתִּי אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ מִתְנוֹדֵ֔ד יִסַּרְתַּ֙נִי֙ וָֽאִוָּסֵ֔ר כְּעֵ֖גֶל לֹ֣א לֻמָּ֑ד הֲשִׁבֵ֣נִי וְאָשׁ֔וּבָה כִּ֥י אַתָּ֖ה יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָֽי׃
Translated:
I can hear Ephraim lamenting:
“You have chastised me, and I am chastised
Like a calf that has not been broken.
Receive me back, let me return,
For You, O ETERNAL One, are my God.
Transliteration: shamvoa shamaetiy eferayiim mitenvoded yisaretaniy vaivaser kheegel lo lumad hashiveniy veashuvah khiy atah yehovah elohay

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַחֲרֵ֤י שׁוּבִי֙ נִחַ֔מְתִּי וְאַֽחֲרֵי֙ הִוָּ֣דְעִ֔י סָפַ֖קְתִּי עַל־יָרֵ֑ךְ בֹּ֚שְׁתִּי וְגַם־נִכְלַ֔מְתִּי כִּ֥י נָשָׂ֖אתִי חֶרְפַּ֥ת נְעוּרָֽי׃
Translated:
Now that I have turned back, I am filled with remorse;
Now that I am made aware, I strike my thigh.
I am ashamed and humiliated,
For I bear the disgrace of my youth.”
Transliteration: khiy-acharey shuviy nichametiy veacharey hivadeiy safaketiy al-yarekhe voshetiy vegam-nikhelametiy khiy nashatiy cherefat neuray

Hebrew: הֲבֵן֩ יַקִּ֨יר לִ֜י אֶפְרַ֗יִם אִ֚ם יֶ֣לֶד שַׁעֲשֻׁעִ֔ים כִּֽי־מִדֵּ֤י דַבְּרִי֙ בּ֔וֹ זָכֹ֥ר אֶזְכְּרֶ֖נּוּ ע֑וֹד עַל־כֵּ֗ן הָמ֤וּ מֵעַי֙ ל֔וֹ רַחֵ֥ם אֲֽרַחֲמֶ֖נּוּ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Truly, Ephraim is a dear son to Me,
A child that is dandled!
Whenever I have turned against him,
My thoughts would dwell on him still.
That is why My heart yearns for him;
I will receive him back in love
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: haven yakiyr liy eferayiim im yeled shaashuiym khiy-midey daveriy vvo zakhor ezekherenu vod al-khen hamu meay lvo rachem arachamenu neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: הַצִּ֧יבִי לָ֣ךְ צִיֻּנִ֗ים שִׂ֤מִי לָךְ֙ תַּמְרוּרִ֔ים שִׁ֣תִי לִבֵּ֔ךְ לַֽמְסִלָּ֖ה דֶּ֣רֶךְ (הלכתי) [הָלָ֑כְתְּ] שׁ֚וּבִי בְּתוּלַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שֻׁ֖בִי אֶל־עָרַ֥יִךְ אֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated:
Erect markers,
Set up signposts;
Keep in mind the highway,
The road that you traveled.
Return, Maiden Israel!
Return to these towns of yours!
Transliteration: hatsiyviy lakhe tsiyuniym shimiy lakhe tameruriym shitiy livekhe lamesilah derekhe (hlkhty) [halakhete] shuviy vetulat yisherael shuviy el-arayiikhe eleh

Hebrew: עַד־מָתַי֙ תִּתְחַמָּקִ֔ין הַבַּ֖ת הַשּֽׁוֹבֵבָ֑ה כִּֽי־בָרָ֨א יְהֹוָ֤ה חֲדָשָׁה֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ נְקֵבָ֖ה תְּס֥וֹבֵֽב גָּֽבֶר׃ {פ}
Translated:
How long will you waver,
O rebellious daughter?
(For GOD has created something new on earth:
A woman courts a man.)
Transliteration: ad-matay titechamakiyn havat hashvovevah khiy-vara yehovah chadashah vaarets nekevah tesvovev gaver {f}

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־אָמַ֞ר יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל ע֣וֹד יֹאמְר֞וּ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֗ה בְּאֶ֤רֶץ יְהוּדָה֙ וּבְעָרָ֔יו בְּשׁוּבִ֖י אֶת־שְׁבוּתָ֑ם יְבָרֶכְךָ֧ יְהֹוָ֛ה נְוֵה־צֶ֖דֶק הַ֥ר הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD of Hosts, the God of Israel: They shall again say this in the land of Judah and in its towns, when I restore their fortunes:
“ GOD bless you,
Abode of righteousness,
O holy mountain!”
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael vod yomeru et-hadavar hazeh veerets yehudah uvearayv veshuviy et-shevutam yevarekhekha yehovah neveh-tsedek har hakodesh

Hebrew: וְיָ֥שְׁבוּ בָ֛הּ יְהוּדָ֥ה וְכׇל־עָרָ֖יו יַחְדָּ֑ו אִכָּרִ֕ים וְנָסְע֖וּ בַּעֵֽדֶר׃
Translated: Judah and all its towns alike shall be inhabited by the farmers and such as move about with the flocks.
Transliteration: veyashevu vah yehudah vekhׇl-arayv yachedav ikhariym venaseu vaeder

Hebrew: כִּ֥י הִרְוֵ֖יתִי נֶ֣פֶשׁ עֲיֵפָ֑ה וְכׇל־נֶ֥פֶשׁ דָּאֲבָ֖ה מִלֵּֽאתִי׃
Translated: For I will give the thirsty abundant drink, and satisfy all who languish.
Transliteration: khiy hireveytiy nefesh aeifah vekhׇl-nefesh daavah miletiy

Hebrew: עַל־זֹ֖את הֱקִיצֹ֣תִי וָאֶרְאֶ֑ה וּשְׁנָתִ֖י עָ֥רְבָה לִּֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: At this I awoke and looked about, and my sleep had been pleasant to me.
Transliteration: al-zot hekiytsotiy vaereeh ushenatiy arevah liy {s}

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֛ה יָמִ֥ים בָּאִ֖ים נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְזָרַעְתִּ֗י אֶת־בֵּ֤ית יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאֶת־בֵּ֣ית יְהוּדָ֔ה זֶ֥רַע אָדָ֖ם וְזֶ֥רַע בְּהֵמָֽה׃
Translated: See, a time is coming—declares G<small>OD</small>—when I will sow the House of Israel and the House of Judah with seed of people and seed of cattle;
Transliteration: hineh yamiym vaiym neum-yehovah vezaraetiy et-veyt yisherael veet-veyt yehudah zera adam vezera vehemah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֧ר שָׁקַ֣דְתִּי עֲלֵיהֶ֗ם לִנְת֧וֹשׁ וְלִנְת֛וֹץ וְלַהֲרֹ֖ס וּלְהַאֲבִ֣יד וּלְהָרֵ֑עַ כֵּ֣ן אֶשְׁקֹ֧ד עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם לִבְנ֥וֹת וְלִנְטֹ֖עַ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and just as I was watchful over them to uproot and to pull down, to overthrow and to destroy and to bring disaster, so I will be watchful over them to build and to plant—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vehayah khaasher shakadetiy aleyhem linetvosh velinetvots velaharos ulehaaviyd uleharea khen eshekod aleyhem livenvot velinetoa neum-yehovah

Hebrew: בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם לֹא־יֹאמְר֣וּ ע֔וֹד אָב֖וֹת אָ֣כְלוּ בֹ֑סֶר וְשִׁנֵּ֥י בָנִ֖ים תִּקְהֶֽינָה׃
Translated: In those days, they shall no longer say, “Parents have eaten sour grapes and children’s teeth are blunted.”
Transliteration: vayamiym hahem lo-yomeru vod avvot akhelu voser veshiney vaniym tikeheynah

Hebrew: כִּ֛י אִם־אִ֥ישׁ בַּעֲוֺנ֖וֹ יָמ֑וּת כׇּל־הָֽאָדָ֛ם הָאֹכֵ֥ל הַבֹּ֖סֶר תִּקְהֶ֥ינָה שִׁנָּֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: But every one shall die for their own sins: whosoever eats sour grapes, their teeth shall be blunted.
Transliteration: khiy im-iysh vaavonvo yamut khׇl-haadam haokhel havoser tikeheynah shinayv {s}

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֛ה יָמִ֥ים בָּאִ֖ים נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְכָרַתִּ֗י אֶת־בֵּ֧ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל וְאֶת־בֵּ֥ית יְהוּדָ֖ה בְּרִ֥ית חֲדָשָֽׁה׃
Translated: See, a time is coming—declares G<small>OD</small>—when I will make a new covenant with the House of Israel and the House of Judah.
Transliteration: hineh yamiym vaiym neum-yehovah vekharatiy et-veyt yisherael veet-veyt yehudah veriyt chadashah

Hebrew: לֹ֣א כַבְּרִ֗ית אֲשֶׁ֤ר כָּרַ֙תִּי֙ אֶת־אֲבוֹתָ֔ם בְּיוֹם֙ הֶחֱזִיקִ֣י בְיָדָ֔ם לְהוֹצִיאָ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֜מָּה הֵפֵ֣רוּ אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֗י וְאָנֹכִ֛י בָּעַ֥לְתִּי בָ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: It will not be like the covenant I made with their ancestors, when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt, a covenant that they broke, though I espoused them—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: lo khaveriyt asher kharatiy et-avvotam veyvom hecheziykiy veyadam lehvotsiyam meerets mitserayiim asher-hemah heferu et-veriytiy veanokhiy vaaletiy vam neum-yehovah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י זֹ֣את הַבְּרִ֡ית אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶכְרֹת֩ אֶת־בֵּ֨ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אַחֲרֵ֨י הַיָּמִ֤ים הָהֵם֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה נָתַ֤תִּי אֶת־תּֽוֹרָתִי֙ בְּקִרְבָּ֔ם וְעַל־לִבָּ֖ם אֶכְתְּבֶ֑נָּה וְהָיִ֤יתִי לָהֶם֙ לֵֽאלֹהִ֔ים וְהֵ֖מָּה יִֽהְיוּ־לִ֥י לְעָֽם׃
Translated: But such is the covenant I will make with the House of Israel after these days—declares G<small>OD</small>: I will put My Teaching into their inmost being and inscribe it upon their hearts. Then I will be their God, and they shall be My people.
Transliteration: khiy zot haveriyt asher ekherot et-veyt yisherael acharey hayamiym hahem neum-yehovah natatiy et-tvoratiy vekirevam veal-livam ekhetevenah vehayiytiy lahem lelohiym vehemah yiheyu-liy leam

Hebrew: וְלֹ֧א יְלַמְּד֣וּ ע֗וֹד אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־רֵעֵ֜הוּ וְאִ֤ישׁ אֶת־אָחִיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר דְּע֖וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּֽי־כוּלָּם֩ יֵדְע֨וּ אוֹתִ֜י לְמִקְּטַנָּ֤ם וְעַד־גְּדוֹלָם֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֤י אֶסְלַח֙ לַֽעֲוֺנָ֔ם וּלְחַטָּאתָ֖ם לֹ֥א אֶזְכָּר־עֽוֹד׃ {ס}
Translated:
No longer will they need to teach one another and say to one another, “Heed GOD”; for all of them, from the least of them to the greatest, shall heed Me—declares GOD.
For I will forgive their iniquities,
And remember their sins no more.
Transliteration: velo yelamedu vod iysh et-reehu veiysh et-achiyv lemor deu et-yehovah khiy-khulam eideu votiy lemiketanam vead-gedvolam neum-yehovah khiy eselach laavonam ulechatatam lo ezekhar-vod {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה נֹתֵ֥ן שֶׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ לְא֣וֹר יוֹמָ֔ם חֻקֹּ֛ת יָרֵ֥חַ וְכוֹכָבִ֖ים לְא֣וֹר לָ֑יְלָה רֹגַ֤ע הַיָּם֙ וַיֶּהֱמ֣וּ גַלָּ֔יו יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת שְׁמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD,
Who established the sun for light by day,
The laws of moon and stars for light by night,
Who stirs up the sea into roaring waves,
Whose name is GOD of Hosts:
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah noten shemesh levor yvomam chukot yarecha vekhvokhaviym levor layelah roga hayam vayehemu galayv yehovah tsevavot shemvo

Hebrew: אִם־יָמֻ֜שׁוּ הַחֻקִּ֥ים הָאֵ֛לֶּה מִלְּפָנַ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה גַּם֩ זֶ֨רַע יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל יִשְׁבְּת֗וּ מִהְי֥וֹת גּ֛וֹי לְפָנַ֖י כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
If these laws should ever be annulled by Me
—declares GOD—
Only then would the offspring of Israel cease
To be a nation before Me for all time.
Transliteration: im-yamushu hachukiym haeleh milefanay neum-yehovah gam zera yisherael yishevetu miheyvot gvoy lefanay khׇl-hayamiym {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אִם־יִמַּ֤דּוּ שָׁמַ֙יִם֙ מִלְמַ֔עְלָה וְיֵחָקְר֥וּ מוֹסְדֵי־אֶ֖רֶץ לְמָ֑טָּה גַּם־אֲנִ֞י אֶמְאַ֨ס בְּכׇל־זֶ֧רַע יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל עַֽל־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשׂ֖וּ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: If the heavens above could be measured, and the foundations of the earth below could be fathomed, only then would I reject all the offspring of Israel for all that they have done—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah im-yimadu shamayiim milemaelah veeichakeru mvosedey-erets lematah gam-aniy emeas vekhׇl-zera yisherael al-khׇl-asher ashu neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֛ה יָמִ֥ים [בָּאִ֖ים] נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְנִבְנְתָ֤ה הָעִיר֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה מִמִּגְדַּ֥ל חֲנַנְאֵ֖ל שַׁ֥עַר הַפִּנָּֽה׃
Translated: See, a time is coming—declares G<small>OD</small>—when the city shall be rebuilt for G<small>OD</small> from the Tower of Hananel to the Corner Gate;
Transliteration: hineh yamiym [vaiym] neum-yehovah venivenetah haiyr layhovah mimigedal chananeel shaar hafinah

Hebrew: וְיָצָ֨א ע֜וֹד (קוה) [קָ֤ו] הַמִּדָּה֙ נֶגְדּ֔וֹ עַ֖ל גִּבְעַ֣ת גָּרֵ֑ב וְנָסַ֖ב גֹּעָֽתָה׃
Translated: and the measuring line shall go straight out to the Gareb Hill, and then turn toward Goah.
Transliteration: veyatsa vod (kvh) [kav] hamidah negedvo al giveat garev venasav goatah

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הָעֵ֣מֶק הַפְּגָרִ֣ים ׀ וְהַדֶּ֡שֶׁן וְכׇֽל־[הַשְּׁדֵמוֹת֩] (השרמות) עַד־נַ֨חַל קִדְר֜וֹן עַד־פִּנַּ֨ת שַׁ֤עַר הַסּוּסִים֙ מִזְרָ֔חָה קֹ֖דֶשׁ לַיהֹוָ֑ה לֹא־יִנָּתֵ֧שׁ וְֽלֹא־יֵהָרֵ֛ס ע֖וֹד לְעוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: And the entire Valley of the Corpses and Ashes, and all the fields as far as the Wadi Kidron, and the corner of the Horse Gate on the east, shall be holy to G<small>OD</small>. They shall never again be uprooted or overthrown.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-haemek hafegariym vehadeshen vekhׇl-[hashedemvot] (hshrmvt) ad-nachal kidervon ad-finat shaar hasusiym mizerachah kodesh layhovah lo-yinatesh velo-eihares vod levolam {f}

Hebrew: הַדָּבָ֞ר אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֤ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֙הוּ֙ מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה (בשנת) [בַּשָּׁנָה֙] הָעֲשִׂרִ֔ית לְצִדְקִיָּ֖הוּ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה הִ֧יא הַשָּׁנָ֛ה שְׁמֹנֶֽה־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה שָׁנָ֖ה לִנְבֽוּכַדְרֶאצַּֽר׃
Translated: The word that came to Jeremiah from G<small>OD</small> in the tenth year of King Zedekiah of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar.
Transliteration: hadavar asher-hayah el-yiremeyahu meet yehovah (vshnt) [vashanah] haashiriyt letsidekiyahu melekhe yehudah hiy hashanah shemoneh-eshereh shanah linevukhaderetsar

Hebrew: וְאָ֗ז חֵ֚יל מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֔ל צָרִ֖ים עַל־יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְיִרְמְיָ֣הוּ הַנָּבִ֗יא הָיָ֤ה כָלוּא֙ בַּחֲצַ֣ר הַמַּטָּרָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בֵּֽית־מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: At that time the army of the king of Babylon was besieging Jerusalem, and the prophet Jeremiah was confined in the prison compound attached to the palace of the king of Judah.
Transliteration: veaz cheyl melekhe vavel tsariym al-yerushala͏im veyiremeyahu hanaviy hayah khalu vachatsar hamatarah asher veyt-melekhe yehudah

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר כְּלָא֔וֹ צִדְקִיָּ֥הוּ מֶֽלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר מַדּ֩וּעַ֩ אַתָּ֨ה נִבָּ֜א לֵאמֹ֗ר כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנְנִ֨י נֹתֵ֜ן אֶת־הָעִ֥יר הַזֹּ֛את בְּיַ֥ד מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל וּלְכָדָֽהּ׃
Translated: For King Zedekiah of Judah had confined him, saying, “How dare you prophesy: ‘Thus said G<small>OD</small>: I am delivering this city into the hands of the king of Babylon, and he shall capture it.
Transliteration: asher khelavo tsidekiyahu melekhe-yehudah lemor madua atah niva lemor khoh amar yehovah hineniy noten et-haiyr hazot veyad melekhe-vavel ulekhadah

Hebrew: וְצִדְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה לֹ֥א יִמָּלֵ֖ט מִיַּ֣ד הַכַּשְׂדִּ֑ים כִּ֣י הִנָּתֹ֤ן יִנָּתֵן֙ בְּיַ֣ד מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֔ל וְדִבֶּר־פִּ֣יו עִם־פִּ֔יו וְעֵינָ֖יו אֶת־עֵינָ֥ו תִּרְאֶֽינָה׃
Translated: And King Zedekiah of Judah shall not escape from the Chaldeans; he shall be delivered into the hands of the king of Babylon, and he shall speak to him face to face and see him in person.
Transliteration: vetsidekiyahu melekhe yehudah lo yimalet miyad hakhashediym khiy hinaton yinaten veyad melekhe-vavel vediver-fiyv im-fiyv veeynayv et-eynav tireeynah

Hebrew: וּבָבֶ֞ל יוֹלִ֤ךְ אֶת־צִדְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ וְשָׁ֣ם יִֽהְיֶ֔ה עַד־פׇּקְדִ֥י אֹת֖וֹ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֧י תִֽלָּחֲמ֛וּ אֶת־הַכַּשְׂדִּ֖ים לֹ֥א תַצְלִֽיחוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: And Zedekiah shall be brought to Babylon, there to remain until I take note of him—declares G<small>OD</small>. When you wage war against the Chaldeans, you shall not be successful.’”
Transliteration: uvavel yvolikhe et-tsidekiyahu vesham yiheyeh ad-fׇkediy otvo neum-yehovah khiy tilachamu et-hakhashediym lo tatseliychu {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר יִרְמְיָ֑הוּ הָיָ֥ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Jeremiah said: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayomer yiremeyahu hayah devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה חֲנַמְאֵ֗ל בֶּן־שַׁלֻּם֙ דֹּֽדְךָ֔ בָּ֥א אֵלֶ֖יךָ לֵאמֹ֑ר קְנֵ֣ה לְךָ֗ אֶת־שָׂדִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּעֲנָת֔וֹת כִּ֥י לְךָ֛ מִשְׁפַּ֥ט הַגְּאֻלָּ֖ה לִקְנֽוֹת׃
Translated: Hanamel, the son of your uncle Shallum, will come to you and say, “Buy my land in Anathoth, for you are next in succession to redeem it by purchase.”
Transliteration: hineh chanameel ven-shalum dodekha va eleykha lemor keneh lekha et-shadiy asher vaanatvot khiy lekha mishefat hageulah likenvot

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א אֵ֠לַ֠י חֲנַמְאֵ֨ל בֶּן־דֹּדִ֜י כִּדְבַ֣ר יְהֹוָה֮ אֶל־חֲצַ֣ר הַמַּטָּרָה֒ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֡י קְנֵ֣ה נָ֠א אֶת־שָׂדִ֨י אֲשֶׁר־בַּעֲנָת֜וֹת אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ בִּנְיָמִ֗ין כִּֽי־לְךָ֞ מִשְׁפַּ֧ט הַיְרֻשָּׁ֛ה וּלְךָ֥ הַגְּאֻלָּ֖ה קְנֵה־לָ֑ךְ וָאֵדַ֕ע כִּ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה הֽוּא׃
Translated: And just as G<small>OD</small> had said, my cousin Hanamel came to me in the prison compound and said to me, “Please buy my land in Anathoth, in the territory of Benjamin; for the right of succession is yours, and you have the duty of redemption. Buy it.” Then I knew that it was indeed the word of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayavo elay chanameel ven-dodiy khidevar yehovah el-chatsar hamatarah vayomer elay keneh na et-shadiy asher-vaanatvot asher veerets vineyamiyn khiy-lekha mishefat hayerushah ulekha hageulah keneh-lakhe vaeda khiy devar-yehovah hu

Hebrew: וָֽאֶקְנֶה֙ אֶת־הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה מֵאֵ֛ת חֲנַמְאֵ֥ל בֶּן־דֹּדִ֖י אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּעֲנָת֑וֹת וָֽאֶשְׁקְלָה־לּוֹ֙ אֶת־הַכֶּ֔סֶף שִׁבְעָ֥ה שְׁקָלִ֖ים וַעֲשָׂרָ֥ה הַכָּֽסֶף׃
Translated: So I bought the land in Anathoth from my cousin Hanamel. I weighed out the money to him, seventeen shekels of silver.
Transliteration: vaekeneh et-hashadeh meet chanameel ven-dodiy asher vaanatvot vaeshekelah-lvo et-hakhesef shiveah shekaliym vaasharah hakhasef

Hebrew: וָאֶכְתֹּ֤ב בַּסֵּ֙פֶר֙ וָֽאֶחְתֹּ֔ם וָאָעֵ֖ד עֵדִ֑ים וָאֶשְׁקֹ֥ל הַכֶּ֖סֶף בְּמֹאזְנָֽיִם׃
Translated: I wrote a deed, sealed it, and had it witnessed; and I weighed out the silver on a balance.
Transliteration: vaekhetov vasefer vaechetom vaaed ediym vaeshekol hakhesef vemozenayiim

Hebrew: וָאֶקַּ֖ח אֶת־סֵ֣פֶר הַמִּקְנָ֑ה אֶת־הֶֽחָת֛וּם הַמִּצְוָ֥ה וְהַחֻקִּ֖ים וְאֶת־הַגָּלֽוּי׃
Translated: I took the deed of purchase, the sealed text and the open one according to rule and law,
Transliteration: vaekach et-sefer hamikenah et-hechatum hamitsevah vehachukiym veet-hagaluy

Hebrew: וָאֶתֵּ֞ן אֶת־הַסֵּ֣פֶר הַמִּקְנָ֗ה אֶל־בָּר֣וּךְ בֶּן־נֵרִיָּה֮ בֶּן־מַחְסֵיָה֒ לְעֵינֵי֙ חֲנַמְאֵ֣ל דֹּדִ֔י וּלְעֵינֵי֙ הָֽעֵדִ֔ים הַכֹּתְבִ֖ים בְּסֵ֣פֶר הַמִּקְנָ֑ה לְעֵינֵי֙ כׇּל־הַיְּהוּדִ֔ים הַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים בַּחֲצַ֥ר הַמַּטָּרָֽה׃
Translated: and gave the deed to Baruch son of Neriah son of Mahseiah in the presence of my kinsman Hanamel, of the witnesses who were named in the deed, and all the Judeans who were sitting in the prison compound.
Transliteration: vaeten et-hasefer hamikenah el-varukhe ven-neriyah ven-macheseyah leeyney chanameel dodiy uleeyney haediym hakhoteviym vesefer hamikenah leeyney khׇl-hayehudiym hayosheviym vachatsar hamatarah

Hebrew: וָאֲצַוֶּה֙ אֶת־בָּר֔וּךְ לְעֵינֵיהֶ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: In their presence I charged Baruch as follows:
Transliteration: vaatsaveh et-varukhe leeyneyhem lemor

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה צְבָא֜וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לָק֣וֹחַ אֶת־הַסְּפָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֡לֶּה אֵ֣ת סֵ֩פֶר֩ הַמִּקְנָ֨ה הַזֶּ֜ה וְאֵ֣ת הֶחָת֗וּם וְאֵ֨ת סֵ֤פֶר הַגָּלוּי֙ הַזֶּ֔ה וּנְתַתָּ֖ם בִּכְלִי־חָ֑רֶשׂ לְמַ֥עַן יַעַמְד֖וּ יָמִ֥ים רַבִּֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: “Take these documents, this deed of purchase, the sealed text and the open one, and put them into an earthen jar, so that they may last a long time.”
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael lakvocha et-hasefariym haeleh et sefer hamikenah hazeh veet hechatum veet sefer hagaluy hazeh unetatam vikheliy-charesh lemaan yaamedu yamiym raviym {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֥ה אָמַ֛ר יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל ע֣וֹד יִקָּנ֥וּ בָתִּ֛ים וְשָׂד֥וֹת וּכְרָמִ֖ים בָּאָ֥רֶץ הַזֹּֽאת׃ {פ}
Translated: For thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: “Houses, fields, and vineyards shall again be purchased in this land.”
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael vod yikanu vatiym veshadvot ukheramiym vaarets hazot {f}

Hebrew: וָאֶתְפַּלֵּ֖ל אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה אַחֲרֵ֤י תִתִּי֙ אֶת־סֵ֣פֶר הַמִּקְנָ֔ה אֶל־בָּר֥וּךְ בֶּן־נֵרִיָּ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: But after I had given the deed to Baruch son of Neriah, I prayed to G<small>OD</small>:
Transliteration: vaetefalel el-yehovah acharey titiy et-sefer hamikenah el-varukhe ven-neriyah lemor

Hebrew: אֲהָהּ֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ אַתָּ֣ה עָשִׂ֗יתָ אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ וְאֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ בְּכֹֽחֲךָ֙ הַגָּד֔וֹל וּבִֽזְרֹעֲךָ֖ הַנְּטוּיָ֑ה לֹֽא־יִפָּלֵ֥א מִמְּךָ֖ כׇּל־דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: “Ah, my Sovereign G<small>OD</small>! You made heaven and earth with Your great might and outstretched arm. Nothing is too wondrous for You!
Transliteration: ahah adonay yehovih hineh atah ashiyta et-hashamayiim veet-haarets vekhochakha hagadvol uvizeroakha hanetuyah lo-yifale mimekha khׇl-davar

Hebrew: עֹ֤שֶׂה חֶ֙סֶד֙ לַֽאֲלָפִ֔ים וּמְשַׁלֵּם֙ עֲוֺ֣ן אָב֔וֹת אֶל־חֵ֥יק בְּנֵיהֶ֖ם אַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם הָאֵ֤ל הַגָּדוֹל֙ הַגִּבּ֔וֹר יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת שְׁמֽוֹ׃
Translated: You show kindness to the thousandth generation, but visit the guilt of the parents upon their children after them. O great and mighty God whose name is G<small>OD</small> of Hosts,
Transliteration: osheh chesed laalafiym umeshalem avon avvot el-cheyk veneyhem achareyhem hael hagadvol hagivvor yehovah tsevavot shemvo

Hebrew: גְּדֹל֙ הָֽעֵצָ֔ה וְרַ֖ב הָעֲלִֽילִיָּ֑ה אֲשֶׁר־עֵינֶ֣יךָ פְקֻח֗וֹת עַל־כׇּל־דַּרְכֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י אָדָ֔ם לָתֵ֤ת לְאִישׁ֙ כִּדְרָכָ֔יו וְכִפְרִ֖י מַעֲלָלָֽיו׃
Translated: wondrous in purpose and mighty in deed, whose eyes observe all the ways of mortals, so as to repay each one according to their ways, and with the proper fruit of their deeds!
Transliteration: gedol haetsah verav haaliyliyah asher-eyneykha fekuchvot al-khׇl-darekhey veney adam latet leiysh khiderakhayv vekhiferiy maalalayv

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֠מְתָּ אֹת֨וֹת וּמֹפְתִ֤ים בְּאֶֽרֶץ־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ עַד־הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה וּבְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וּבָאָדָ֑ם וַתַּעֲשֶׂה־לְּךָ֥ שֵׁ֖ם כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: You displayed signs and marvels in the land of Egypt with lasting effect, and won renown in Israel and among humankind to this very day.
Transliteration: asher-shameta otvot umofetiym veerets-mitserayiim ad-hayyvom hazeh uveyisherael uvaadam vataasheh-lekha shem khayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וַתֹּצֵ֛א אֶת־עַמְּךָ֥ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם בְּאֹת֣וֹת וּבְמוֹפְתִ֗ים וּבְיָ֤ד חֲזָקָה֙ וּבְאֶזְר֣וֹעַ נְטוּיָ֔ה וּבְמוֹרָ֖א גָּדֽוֹל׃
Translated: You freed Your people Israel from the land of Egypt with signs and marvels, with a strong hand and an outstretched arm, and with great terror.
Transliteration: vatotse et-amekha et-yisherael meerets mitserayiim veotvot uvemvofetiym uveyad chazakah uveezervoa netuyah uvemvora gadvol

Hebrew: וַתִּתֵּ֤ן לָהֶם֙ אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֥עְתָּ לַאֲבוֹתָ֖ם לָתֵ֣ת לָהֶ֑ם אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָֽשׁ׃
Translated: You gave them this land that You had sworn to their fathers to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey,
Transliteration: vatiten lahem et-haarets hazot asher-nishevaeta laavvotam latet lahem erets zavat chalav udevash

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ וַיִּֽרְשׁ֣וּ אֹתָ֗הּ וְלֹֽא־שָׁמְע֤וּ בְקוֹלֶ֙ךָ֙ (ובתרותך) [וּבְתוֹרָתְךָ֣] לֹא־הָלָ֔כוּ אֵת֩ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוִּ֧יתָה לָהֶ֛ם לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת לֹ֣א עָשׂ֑וּ וַתַּקְרֵ֣א אֹתָ֔ם אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הָרָעָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: and they came and took possession of it. But they did not listen to You or follow Your Teaching; they did nothing of what You commanded them to do. Therefore you have caused all this misfortune to befall them.
Transliteration: vayavou vayireshu otah velo-shameu vekvolekha (vvtrvtkh) [uvetvoratekha] lo-halakhu et khׇl-asher tsiviytah lahem laashvot lo ashu vatakere otam et khׇl-haraah hazot

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה הַסֹּלְל֗וֹת בָּ֣אוּ הָעִיר֮ לְלׇכְדָהּ֒ וְהָעִ֣יר נִתְּנָ֗ה בְּיַ֤ד הַכַּשְׂדִּים֙ הַנִּלְחָמִ֣ים עָלֶ֔יהָ מִפְּנֵ֛י הַחֶ֥רֶב וְהָרָעָ֖ב וְהַדָּ֑בֶר וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֛רְתָּ הָיָ֖ה וְהִנְּךָ֥ רֹאֶֽה׃
Translated: Here are the siege mounds, raised against the city to storm it; and the city, because of sword and famine and pestilence, is at the mercy of the Chaldeans who are attacking it. What You threatened has come to pass—as You see.
Transliteration: hineh hasolelvot vau haiyr lelׇkhedah vehaiyr nitenah veyad hakhashediym hanilechamiym aleyha mifeney hacherev veharaav vehadaver vaasher divareta hayah vehinekha roeh

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֞ה אָמַ֤רְתָּ אֵלַי֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה קְנֵֽה־לְךָ֧ הַשָּׂדֶ֛ה בַּכֶּ֖סֶף וְהָעֵ֣ד עֵדִ֑ים וְהָעִ֥יר נִתְּנָ֖ה בְּיַ֥ד הַכַּשְׂדִּֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: Yet You, my Sovereign G<small>OD</small>, said to me: Buy the land for money and call in witnesses—when the city is at the mercy of the Chaldeans!”
Transliteration: veatah amareta elay adonay yehovih keneh-lekha hashadeh vakhesef vehaed ediym vehaiyr nitenah veyad hakhashediym {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Then the word of G<small>OD</small> came to Jeremiah:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-yiremeyahu lemor

Hebrew: הִנֵּה֙ אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה אֱלֹהֵ֖י כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֑ר הֲֽמִמֶּ֔נִּי יִפָּלֵ֖א כׇּל־דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: Behold I am G<small>OD</small>, the God of all flesh. Is anything too wondrous for Me?
Transliteration: hineh aniy yehovah elohey khׇl-vashar hamimeniy yifale khׇl-davar

Hebrew: לָכֵ֕ן כֹּ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה הִנְנִ֣י נֹתֵן֩ אֶת־הָעִ֨יר הַזֹּ֜את בְּיַ֣ד הַכַּשְׂדִּ֗ים וּבְיַ֛ד נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֥ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל וּלְכָדָֽהּ׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said G<small>OD</small>: I am delivering this city into the hands of the Chaldeans and of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, and he shall capture it.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar yehovah hineniy noten et-haiyr hazot veyad hakhashediym uveyad nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel ulekhadah

Hebrew: וּבָ֣אוּ הַכַּשְׂדִּ֗ים הַנִּלְחָמִים֙ עַל־הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את וְהִצִּ֜יתוּ אֶת־הָעִ֥יר הַזֹּ֛את בָּאֵ֖שׁ וּשְׂרָפ֑וּהָ וְאֵ֣ת הַבָּתִּ֡ים אֲשֶׁר֩ קִטְּר֨וּ עַל־גַּגּוֹתֵיהֶ֜ם לַבַּ֗עַל וְהִסִּ֤כוּ נְסָכִים֙ לֵאלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים לְמַ֖עַן הַכְעִסֵֽנִי׃
Translated: And the Chaldeans who have been attacking this city shall come and set this city on fire and burn it down—with the houses on whose roofs they made offerings to Baal and poured out libations to other gods, so as to vex Me.
Transliteration: uvau hakhashediym hanilechamiym al-haiyr hazot vehitsiytu et-haiyr hazot vaesh usherafuha veet havatiym asher kiteru al-gagvoteyhem lavaal vehisikhu nesakhiym lelohiym acheriym lemaan hakheiseniy

Hebrew: כִּי־הָי֨וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל וּבְנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֗ה אַ֣ךְ עֹשִׂ֥ים הָרַ֛ע בְּעֵינַ֖י מִנְּעֻרֹֽתֵיהֶ֑ם כִּ֣י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אַ֣ךְ מַכְעִסִ֥ים אֹתִ֛י בְּמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יְדֵיהֶ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: For the people of Israel and Judah have done nothing but evil in My sight since their youth; the people of Israel have done nothing but vex Me by their conduct—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: khiy-hayu veney-yisherael uveney yehudah akhe oshiym hara veeynay mineuroteyhem khiy veney-yisherael akhe makheisiym otiy vemaasheh yedeyhem neum-yehovah

Hebrew: כִּ֧י עַל־אַפִּ֣י וְעַל־חֲמָתִ֗י הָ֤יְתָה לִּי֙ הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את לְמִן־הַיּוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּנ֣וּ אוֹתָ֔הּ וְעַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה לַהֲסִירָ֖הּ מֵעַ֥ל פָּנָֽי׃
Translated: This city has aroused My anger and My wrath from the day it was built until this day; so that it must be removed from My sight
Transliteration: khiy al-afiy veal-chamatiy hayetah liy haiyr hazot lemin-hayyvom asher vanu votah vead hayyvom hazeh lahasiyrah meal fanay

Hebrew: עַל֩ כׇּל־רָעַ֨ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל וּבְנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשׂוּ֙ לְהַכְעִסֵ֔נִי הֵ֤מָּה מַלְכֵיהֶם֙ שָׂרֵיהֶ֔ם כֹּהֲנֵיהֶ֖ם וּנְבִיאֵיהֶ֑ם וְאִ֣ישׁ יְהוּדָ֔ה וְיֹשְׁבֵ֖י יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: because of all the wickedness of the people of Israel and Judah who have so acted as to vex Me—they, their kings, their officials, their priests and prophets, and the citizenry of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: al khׇl-raat veney-yisherael uveney yehudah asher ashu lehakheiseniy hemah malekheyhem shareyhem khohaneyhem uneviyeyhem veiysh yehudah veyoshevey yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּפְנ֥וּ אֵלַ֛י עֹ֖רֶף וְלֹ֣א פָנִ֑ים וְלַמֵּ֤ד אֹתָם֙ הַשְׁכֵּ֣ם וְלַמֵּ֔ד וְאֵינָ֥ם שֹׁמְעִ֖ים לָקַ֥חַת מוּסָֽר׃
Translated: They turned their backs to Me, not their faces; though I have taught them persistently, they do not give heed or accept rebuke.
Transliteration: vayifenu elay oref velo faniym velamed otam hashekhem velamed veeynam shomeiym lakachat musar

Hebrew: וַיָּשִׂ֣ימוּ שִׁקּוּצֵיהֶ֗ם בַּבַּ֛יִת אֲשֶׁר־נִקְרָֽא־שְׁמִ֥י עָלָ֖יו לְטַמְּאֽוֹ׃
Translated: They placed their abominations in the House that bears My name and defiled it;
Transliteration: vayashiymu shikutseyhem vavayiit asher-nikera-shemiy alayv letamevo

Hebrew: וַיִּבְנוּ֩ אֶת־בָּמ֨וֹת הַבַּ֜עַל אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ בְּגֵ֣יא בֶן־הִנֹּ֗ם לְ֠הַעֲבִ֠יר אֶת־בְּנֵיהֶ֣ם וְאֶת־בְּנוֹתֵיהֶם֮ לַמֹּ֒לֶךְ֒ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־צִוִּיתִ֗ים וְלֹ֤א עָֽלְתָה֙ עַל־לִבִּ֔י לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת הַתּוֹעֵבָ֣ה הַזֹּ֑את לְמַ֖עַן הַחֲטִ֥י אֶת־יְהוּדָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: and they built the shrines of Baal that are in the Valley of Ben-hinnom, where they offered up their sons and daughters to Molech—when I had never commanded, or even thought [of commanding], that they should do such an abominable thing, and so bring guilt on Judah.
Transliteration: vayivenu et-vamvot havaal asher vegey ven-hinom lehaaviyr et-veneyhem veet-venvoteyhem lamolekhe asher lo-tsiviytiym velo aletah al-liviy laashvot hatvoevah hazot lemaan hachatiy et-yehudah {s}

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה לָכֵ֛ן כֹּה־אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֶל־הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ אַתֶּ֣ם אֹמְרִ֗ים נִתְּנָה֙ בְּיַ֣ד מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֔ל בַּחֶ֖רֶב וּבָרָעָ֥ב וּבַדָּֽבֶר׃
Translated: But now, assuredly, thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, concerning this city of which you say, “It is being delivered into the hands of the king of Babylon through the sword, through famine, and through pestilence”:
Transliteration: veatah lakhen khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael el-haiyr hazot asher atem omeriym nitenah veyad melekhe-vavel vacherev uvaraav uvadaver

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֤י מְקַבְּצָם֙ מִכׇּל־הָ֣אֲרָצ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִדַּחְתִּ֥ים שָׁ֛ם בְּאַפִּ֥י וּבַחֲמָתִ֖י וּבְקֶ֣צֶף גָּד֑וֹל וַהֲשִֽׁבֹתִים֙ אֶל־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה וְהֹשַׁבְתִּ֖ים לָבֶֽטַח׃
Translated: See, I will gather them from all the lands to which I have banished them in My anger and wrath, and in great rage; and I will bring them back to this place and let them dwell secure.
Transliteration: hineniy mekavetsam mikhׇl-haaratsvot asher hidachetiym sham veafiy uvachamatiy uveketsef gadvol vahashivotiym el-hamakvom hazeh vehoshavetiym lavetach

Hebrew: וְהָ֥יוּ לִ֖י לְעָ֑ם וַאֲנִ֕י אֶהְיֶ֥ה לָהֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: They shall be My people, and I will be their God.
Transliteration: vehayu liy leam vaaniy eheyeh lahem lelohiym

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֨י לָהֶ֜ם לֵ֤ב אֶחָד֙ וְדֶ֣רֶךְ אֶחָ֔ד לְיִרְאָ֥ה אוֹתִ֖י כׇּל־הַיָּמִ֑ים לְט֣וֹב לָהֶ֔ם וְלִבְנֵיהֶ֖ם אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: I will give them a single heart and a single nature to revere Me for all time, and it shall be well with them and their children after them.
Transliteration: venatatiy lahem lev echad vederekhe echad leyireah votiy khׇl-hayamiym letvov lahem veliveneyhem achareyhem

Hebrew: וְכָרַתִּ֤י לָהֶם֙ בְּרִ֣ית עוֹלָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־אָשׁוּב֙ מֵאַ֣חֲרֵיהֶ֔ם לְהֵיטִיבִ֖י אוֹתָ֑ם וְאֶת־יִרְאָתִי֙ אֶתֵּ֣ן בִּלְבָבָ֔ם לְבִלְתִּ֖י ס֥וּר מֵעָלָֽי׃
Translated: And I will make an everlasting covenant with them that I will not turn away from them and that I will treat them graciously; and I will put into their hearts reverence for Me, so that they do not turn away from Me.
Transliteration: vekharatiy lahem veriyt volam asher lo-ashuv meachareyhem leheytiyviy votam veet-yireatiy eten vilevavam leviletiy sur mealay

Hebrew: וְשַׂשְׂתִּ֥י עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם לְהֵטִ֣יב אוֹתָ֑ם וּנְטַעְתִּ֞ים בָּאָ֤רֶץ הַזֹּאת֙ בֶּאֱמֶ֔ת בְּכׇל־לִבִּ֖י וּבְכׇל־נַפְשִֽׁי׃ {ס}
Translated: I will delight in treating them graciously, and I will plant them in this land faithfully, with all My heart and soul.
Transliteration: veshashetiy aleyhem lehetiyv votam unetaetiym vaarets hazot veemet vekhׇl-liviy uvekhׇl-nafeshiy {s}

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹה֙ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר הֵבֵ֙אתִי֙ אֶל־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה אֵ֛ת כׇּל־הָרָעָ֥ה הַגְּדוֹלָ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את כֵּ֣ן אָנֹכִ֞י מֵבִ֤יא עֲלֵיהֶם֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הַטּוֹבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י דֹּבֵ֥ר עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: For thus said G<small>OD</small>: As I have brought this terrible disaster upon this people, so I am going to bring upon them the vast good fortune that I have promised for them.
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah khaasher hevetiy el-haam hazeh et khׇl-haraah hagedvolah hazot khen anokhiy meviy aleyhem et-khׇl-hatvovah asher anokhiy dover aleyhem

Hebrew: וְנִקְנָ֥ה הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ אַתֶּ֣ם אֹמְרִ֗ים שְׁמָמָ֥ה הִיא֙ מֵאֵ֤ין אָדָם֙ וּבְהֵמָ֔ה נִתְּנָ֖ה בְּיַ֥ד הַכַּשְׂדִּֽים׃
Translated: And fields shall again be purchased in this land of which you say, “It is a desolation, without humans or animals; it is delivered into the hands of the Chaldeans.”
Transliteration: venikenah hashadeh vaarets hazot asher atem omeriym shemamah hiy meeyn adam uvehemah nitenah veyad hakhashediym

Hebrew: שָׂד֞וֹת בַּכֶּ֣סֶף יִקְנ֗וּ וְכָת֨וֹב בַּסֵּ֥פֶר ׀ וְחָתוֹם֮ וְהָעֵ֣ד עֵדִים֒ בְּאֶ֨רֶץ בִּנְיָמִ֜ן וּבִסְבִיבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם וּבְעָרֵ֤י יְהוּדָה֙ וּבְעָרֵ֣י הָהָ֔ר וּבְעָרֵ֥י הַשְּׁפֵלָ֖ה וּבְעָרֵ֣י הַנֶּ֑גֶב כִּֽי־אָשִׁ֥יב אֶת־שְׁבוּתָ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Fields shall be purchased, and deeds written and sealed, and witnesses called in the land of Benjamin and in the environs of Jerusalem, and in the towns of Judah; the towns of the hill country, the towns of the Shephelah, and the towns of the Negeb. For I will restore their fortunes—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: shadvot vakhesef yikenu vekhatvov vasefer vechatvom vehaed ediym veerets vineyamin uviseviyvey yerushala͏im uvearey yehudah uvearey hahar uvearey hashefelah uvearey hanegev khiy-ashiyv et-shevutam neum-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֧י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ שֵׁנִ֑ית וְהוּא֙ עוֹדֶ֣נּוּ עָצ֔וּר בַּחֲצַ֥ר הַמַּטָּרָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to Jeremiah a second time, while he was still confined in the prison compound, as follows:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-yiremeyahu sheniyt vehu vodenu atsur vachatsar hamatarah lemor

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה עֹשָׂ֑הּ יְהֹוָ֗ה יוֹצֵ֥ר אוֹתָ֛הּ לַהֲכִינָ֖הּ יְהֹוָ֥ה שְׁמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD who is planning it,
GOD who is shaping it to bring it about,
Whose name is GOD:
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah oshah yehovah yvotser votah lahakhiynah yehovah shemvo

Hebrew: קְרָ֥א אֵלַ֖י וְאֶעֱנֶ֑ךָּ וְאַגִּ֧ידָה לְּךָ֛ גְּדֹל֥וֹת וּבְצֻר֖וֹת לֹ֥א יְדַעְתָּֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
Call to Me, and I will answer you,
And I will tell you wondrous things,
Secrets you have not known.
Transliteration: kera elay veeenekha veagiydah lekha gedolvot uvetsurvot lo yedaetam {f}

Hebrew: כִּי֩ כֹ֨ה אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עַל־בָּתֵּי֙ הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את וְעַל־בָּתֵּ֖י מַלְכֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה הַנְּתֻצִ֕ים אֶל־הַסֹּלְל֖וֹת וְאֶל־הֶחָֽרֶב׃
Translated: For thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, concerning the houses of this city and the palaces of the kings of Judah that were torn down for [defense] against the siege mounds and against the sword,
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar yehovah elohey yisherael al-vatey haiyr hazot veal-vatey malekhey yehudah hanetutsiym el-hasolelvot veel-hecharev

Hebrew: בָּאִ֗ים לְהִלָּחֵם֙ אֶת־הַכַּשְׂדִּ֔ים וּלְמַלְאָם֙ אֶת־פִּגְרֵ֣י הָאָדָ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הִכֵּ֥יתִי בְאַפִּ֖י וּבַחֲמָתִ֑י וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר הִסְתַּ֤רְתִּי פָנַי֙ מֵהָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את עַ֖ל כׇּל־רָעָתָֽם׃
Translated: and were filled by those who went to fight the Chaldeans—with the corpses of those whom I struck down in My anger and rage, hiding My face from this city because of all their wickedness:
Transliteration: vaiym lehilachem et-hakhashediym ulemaleam et-figerey haadam asher-hikheytiy veafiy uvachamatiy vaasher hisetaretiy fanay mehaiyr hazot al khׇl-raatam

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֧י מַעֲלֶה־לָּ֛הּ אֲרֻכָ֥ה וּמַרְפֵּ֖א וּרְפָאתִ֑ים וְגִלֵּיתִ֣י לָהֶ֔ם עֲתֶ֥רֶת שָׁל֖וֹם וֶאֱמֶֽת׃
Translated: I am going to bring her relief and healing. I will heal them and reveal to them abundance of true favor.
Transliteration: hineniy maaleh-lah arukhah umarefe urefatiym vegileytiy lahem ateret shalvom veemet

Hebrew: וַהֲשִֽׁבֹתִי֙ אֶת־שְׁב֣וּת יְהוּדָ֔ה וְאֵ֖ת שְׁב֣וּת יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּבְנִתִ֖ים כְּבָרִֽאשֹׁנָֽה׃
Translated: And I will restore the fortunes of Judah and Israel, and I will rebuild them as of old.
Transliteration: vahashivotiy et-shevut yehudah veet shevut yisherael uvenitiym khevarishonah

Hebrew: וְטִ֣הַרְתִּ֔ים מִכׇּל־עֲוֺנָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָֽטְאוּ־לִ֑י וְסָלַחְתִּ֗י (לכול) [לְכׇל־]עֲוֺנֽוֹתֵיהֶם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָֽטְאוּ־לִ֔י וַאֲשֶׁ֖ר פָּ֥שְׁעוּ בִֽי׃
Translated: And I will purge them of all the sins that they committed against Me, and I will pardon all the sins that they committed against Me, by which they rebelled against Me.
Transliteration: vetiharetiym mikhׇl-avonam asher chateu-liy vesalachetiy (lkhvl) [lekhׇl-]avonvoteyhem asher chateu-liy vaasher fasheu viy

Hebrew: וְהָ֣יְתָה לִּ֗י לְשֵׁ֤ם שָׂשׂוֹן֙ לִתְהִלָּ֣ה וּלְתִפְאֶ֔רֶת לְכֹ֖ל גּוֹיֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁמְע֜וּ אֶת־כׇּל־הַטּוֹבָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר אָנֹכִי֙ עֹשֶׂ֣ה אוֹתָ֔ם וּפָחֲד֣וּ וְרָגְז֗וּ עַ֤ל כׇּל־הַטּוֹבָה֙ וְעַ֣ל כׇּל־הַשָּׁל֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י עֹ֥שֶׂה לָּֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: And she shall gain through Me renown, joy, fame, and glory above all the nations on earth, when they hear of all the good fortune I provide for them. They will thrill and quiver because of all the good fortune and all the prosperity that I provide for her.
Transliteration: vehayetah liy leshem shashvon litehilah uletifeeret lekhol gvoeiy haarets asher yishemeu et-khׇl-hatvovah asher anokhiy osheh votam ufachadu veragezu al khׇl-hatvovah veal khׇl-hashalvom asher anokhiy osheh lah {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה עוֹד֮ יִשָּׁמַ֣ע בַּמָּקוֹם־הַזֶּה֒ אֲשֶׁר֙ אַתֶּ֣ם אֹֽמְרִ֔ים חָרֵ֣ב ה֔וּא מֵאֵ֥ין אָדָ֖ם וּמֵאֵ֣ין בְּהֵמָ֑ה בְּעָרֵ֤י יְהוּדָה֙ וּבְחֻצ֣וֹת יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם הַֽנְשַׁמּ֗וֹת מֵאֵ֥ין אָדָ֛ם וּמֵאֵ֥ין יוֹשֵׁ֖ב וּמֵאֵ֥ין בְּהֵמָֽה׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Again there shall be heard in this place, which you say is ruined, without humans or animals—in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem that are desolate, without humans, without inhabitants, without animals—
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah vod yishama vamakvom-hazeh asher atem omeriym charev hu meeyn adam umeeyn vehemah vearey yehudah uvechutsvot yerushala͏im haneshamvot meeyn adam umeeyn yvoshev umeeyn vehemah

Hebrew: ק֣וֹל שָׂשׂ֞וֹן וְק֣וֹל שִׂמְחָ֗ה ק֣וֹל חָתָן֮ וְק֣וֹל כַּלָּה֒ ק֣וֹל אֹמְרִ֡ים הוֹדוּ֩ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֨ה צְבָא֜וֹת כִּי־ט֤וֹב יְהֹוָה֙ כִּֽי־לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּ֔וֹ מְבִאִ֥ים תּוֹדָ֖ה בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּֽי־אָשִׁ֧יב אֶת־שְׁבוּת־הָאָ֛רֶץ כְּבָרִאשֹׁנָ֖ה אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sound of mirth and gladness, the voice of bridegroom and bride, the voice of those who cry, “Give thanks to G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, for G<small>OD</small>—whose steadfast love is eternal—is good!” as they bring thanksgiving offerings to the House of G<small>OD</small>. For I will restore the fortunes of the land as of old—said G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: kvol shashvon vekvol shimechah kvol chatan vekvol khalah kvol omeriym hvodu et-yehovah tsevavot khiy-tvov yehovah khiy-levolam chasedvo meviiym tvodah veyt yehovah khiy-ashiyv et-shevut-haarets khevarishonah amar yehovah {s}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַר֮ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָאוֹת֒ ע֞וֹד יִהְיֶ֣ה ׀ בַּמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֗ה הֶחָרֵ֛ב מֵאֵין־אָדָ֥ם וְעַד־בְּהֵמָ֖ה וּבְכׇל־עָרָ֑יו נְוֵ֣ה רֹעִ֔ים מַרְבִּצִ֖ים צֹֽאן׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts: In this ruined place, without humans or animals, and in all its towns, there shall again be a pasture for shepherds, where they can rest their flocks.
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot vod yiheyeh vamakvom hazeh hecharev meeyn-adam vead-vehemah uvekhׇl-arayv neveh roiym marevitsiym tson

Hebrew: בְּעָרֵ֨י הָהָ֜ר בְּעָרֵ֤י הַשְּׁפֵלָה֙ וּבְעָרֵ֣י הַנֶּ֔גֶב וּבְאֶ֧רֶץ בִּנְיָמִ֛ן וּבִסְבִיבֵ֥י יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם וּבְעָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה עֹ֣ד תַּעֲבֹ֧רְנָה הַצֹּ֛אן עַל־יְדֵ֥י מוֹנֶ֖ה אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: In the towns of the hill country, in the towns of the Shephelah, and in the towns of the Negeb, in the land of Benjamin and in the environs of Jerusalem and in the towns of Judah, sheep shall pass again under the hands of one who counts them—said G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vearey hahar vearey hashefelah uvearey hanegev uveerets vineyamin uviseviyvey yerushala͏im uvearey yehudah od taavorenah hatson al-yedey mvoneh amar yehovah {s}

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֛ה יָמִ֥ים בָּאִ֖ים נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַהֲקִֽמֹתִי֙ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַטּ֔וֹב אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֛רְתִּי אֶל־בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְעַל־בֵּ֥ית יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: See, days are coming—declares G<small>OD</small>—when I will fulfill the promise that I made concerning the House of Israel and the House of Judah.
Transliteration: hineh yamiym vaiym neum-yehovah vahakimotiy et-hadavar hatvov asher divaretiy el-veyt yisherael veal-veyt yehudah

Hebrew: בַּיָּמִ֤ים הָהֵם֙ וּבָעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔יא אַצְמִ֥יחַ לְדָוִ֖ד צֶ֣מַח צְדָקָ֑ה וְעָשָׂ֛ה מִשְׁפָּ֥ט וּצְדָקָ֖ה בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: In those days and at that time, I will raise up a true branch of David’s line, and he shall do what is just and right in the land.
Transliteration: vayamiym hahem uvaet hahiy atsemiycha ledavid tsemach tsedakah veashah mishefat utsedakah vaarets

Hebrew: בַּיָּמִ֤ים הָהֵם֙ תִּוָּשַׁ֣ע יְהוּדָ֔ה וִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם תִּשְׁכּ֣וֹן לָבֶ֑טַח וְזֶ֥ה אֲשֶׁר־יִקְרָא־לָ֖הּ יְהֹוָ֥ה ׀ צִדְקֵֽנוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: In those days Judah shall be delivered and Jerusalem shall dwell secure. And this is what it shall be called: “G<small>OD</small> is our Vindicator.”
Transliteration: vayamiym hahem tivasha yehudah viyrushala͏im tishekhvon lavetach vezeh asher-yikera-lah yehovah tsidekenu {s}

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹא־יִכָּרֵ֣ת לְדָוִ֔ד אִ֕ישׁ יֹשֵׁ֖ב עַל־כִּסֵּ֥א בֵֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: For thus said G<small>OD</small>: There shall never be an end to those of David’s line who sit upon the throne of the House of Israel.
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah lo-yikharet ledavid iysh yoshev al-khise veyt-yisherael

Hebrew: וְלַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם לֹא־יִכָּרֵ֥ת אִ֖ישׁ מִלְּפָנָ֑י מַעֲלֶ֨ה עוֹלָ֜ה וּמַקְטִ֥יר מִנְחָ֛ה וְעֹ֥שֶׂה זֶּ֖בַח כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: Nor shall there ever be an end to the line of the levitical priests before Me, of those who present burnt offerings and turn the grain offering to smoke and perform sacrifices.
Transliteration: velakhohaniym haleviyim lo-yikharet iysh milefanay maaleh volah umaketiyr minechah veosheh zevach khׇl-hayamiym {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ לֵאמֽוֹר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to Jeremiah:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-yiremeyahu lemvor

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אִם־תָּפֵ֙רוּ֙ אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֣י הַיּ֔וֹם וְאֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י הַלָּ֑יְלָה וּלְבִלְתִּ֛י הֱי֥וֹת יֽוֹמָם־וָלַ֖יְלָה בְּעִתָּֽם׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: If you could break My covenant with the day and My covenant with the night, so that day and night should not come at their proper time,
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah im-taferu et-veriytiy hayyvom veet-veriytiy halayelah uleviletiy heyvot yvomam-valayelah veitam

Hebrew: גַּם־בְּרִיתִ֤י תֻפַר֙ אֶת־דָּוִ֣ד עַבְדִּ֔י מִהְיֽוֹת־ל֥וֹ בֵ֖ן מֹלֵ֣ךְ עַל־כִּסְא֑וֹ וְאֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֥ם הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים מְשָֽׁרְתָֽי׃
Translated: only then could My covenant with My servant David be broken—so that he would not have a descendant reigning upon his throne—or with My ministrants, the levitical priests.
Transliteration: gam-veriytiy tufar et-david avediy miheyvot-lvo ven molekhe al-khisevo veet-haleviyim hakhohaniym mesharetay

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־יִסָּפֵר֙ צְבָ֣א הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְלֹ֥א יִמַּ֖ד ח֣וֹל הַיָּ֑ם כֵּ֣ן אַרְבֶּ֗ה אֶת־זֶ֙רַע֙ דָּוִ֣ד עַבְדִּ֔י וְאֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֖ם מְשָֽׁרְתֵ֥י אֹתִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Like the host of heaven that cannot be counted, and the sand of the sea that cannot be measured, so will I multiply the offspring of My servant David, and of the Levites who minister to Me.
Transliteration: asher lo-yisafer tseva hashamayiim velo yimad chvol hayam khen areveh et-zera david avediy veet-haleviyim mesharetey otiy {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to Jeremiah:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-yiremeyahu lemor

Hebrew: הֲל֣וֹא רָאִ֗יתָ מָֽה־הָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ דִּבְּר֣וּ לֵאמֹ֔ר שְׁתֵּ֣י הַמִּשְׁפָּח֗וֹת אֲשֶׁ֨ר בָּחַ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה בָּהֶ֖ם וַיִּמְאָסֵ֑ם וְאֶת־עַמִּי֙ יִנְאָצ֔וּן מִֽהְי֥וֹת ע֖וֹד גּ֥וֹי לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: You see what this people said: “The two families that G<small>OD</small> chose have now been rejected.” Thus they despise My people, and regard them as no longer a nation.
Transliteration: halvo raiyta mah-haam hazeh diveru lemor shetey hamishefachvot asher vachar yehovah vahem vayimeasem veet-amiy yineatsun miheyvot vod gvoy lifeneyhem {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אִם־לֹ֥א בְרִיתִ֖י יוֹמָ֣ם וָלָ֑יְלָה חֻקּ֛וֹת שָׁמַ֥יִם וָאָ֖רֶץ לֹא־שָֽׂמְתִּי׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: As surely as I have established My covenant with day and night—the laws of heaven and earth—
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah im-lo veriytiy yvomam valayelah chukvot shamayiim vaarets lo-shametiy

Hebrew: גַּם־זֶ֣רַע יַעֲקוֹב֩ וְדָוִ֨ד עַבְדִּ֜י אֶמְאַ֗ס מִקַּ֤חַת מִזַּרְעוֹ֙ מֹֽשְׁלִ֔ים אֶל־זֶ֥רַע אַבְרָהָ֖ם יִשְׂחָ֣ק וְיַעֲקֹ֑ב כִּי־[אָשִׁ֥יב] (אשוב) אֶת־שְׁבוּתָ֖ם וְרִחַמְתִּֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: so I will never reject the offspring of Jacob and My servant David; I will never fail to take from his offspring rulers for the descendants of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Indeed, I will restore their fortunes and take them back in love.
Transliteration: gam-zera yaakvov vedavid avediy emeas mikachat mizarevo mosheliym el-zera averaham yishechak veyaakov khiy-[ashiyv] (shvv) et-shevutam verichametiym {f}

Hebrew: הַדָּבָ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֥ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וּנְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֣ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֣ל <small>׀</small> וְכׇל־חֵיל֡וֹ וְכׇל־מַמְלְכ֣וֹת אֶ֩רֶץ֩ מֶמְשֶׁ֨לֶת יָד֜וֹ וְכׇל־הָעַמִּ֗ים נִלְחָמִ֧ים עַל־יְרוּשָׁלַ֛͏ִם וְעַל־כׇּל־עָרֶ֖יהָ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word that came to Jeremiah from G<small>OD</small>, when King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon and all his army, and all the kingdoms of the earth and all the peoples under his sway, were waging war against Jerusalem and all its towns:
Transliteration: hadavar asher-hayah el-yiremeyahu meet yehovah unevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel <small></small> vekhׇl-cheylvo vekhׇl-mamelekhvot erets memeshelet yadvo vekhׇl-haamiym nilechamiym al-yerushala͏im veal-khׇl-areyha lemor

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הָלֹךְ֙ וְאָ֣מַרְתָּ֔ אֶל־צִדְקִיָּ֖הוּ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֗יו כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנְנִ֨י נֹתֵ֜ן אֶת־הָעִ֤יר הַזֹּאת֙ בְּיַ֣ד מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֔ל וּשְׂרָפָ֖הּ בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: Go speak to King Zedekiah of Judah, and say to him: “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: I am going to deliver this city into the hands of the king of Babylon, and he will destroy it by fire.
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael halokhe veamareta el-tsidekiyahu melekhe yehudah veamareta elayv khoh amar yehovah hineniy noten et-haiyr hazot veyad melekhe-vavel usherafah vaesh

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֗ה לֹ֤א תִמָּלֵט֙ מִיָּד֔וֹ כִּ֚י תָּפֹ֣שׂ תִּתָּפֵ֔שׂ וּבְיָד֖וֹ תִּנָּתֵ֑ן וְֽ֠עֵינֶ֠יךָ אֶת־עֵינֵ֨י מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֜ל תִּרְאֶ֗ינָה וּפִ֛יהוּ אֶת־פִּ֥יךָ יְדַבֵּ֖ר וּבָבֶ֥ל תָּבֽוֹא׃
Translated: And you will not escape from him; you will be captured and handed over to him. And you will see the king of Babylon face to face and speak to him in person; and you will be brought to Babylon.
Transliteration: veatah lo timalet miyadvo khiy tafosh titafesh uveyadvo tinaten veeyneykha et-eyney melekhe-vavel tireeynah ufiyhu et-fiykha yedaver uvavel tavvo

Hebrew: אַ֚ךְ שְׁמַ֣ע דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה צִדְקִיָּ֖הוּ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ עָלֶ֔יךָ לֹ֥א תָמ֖וּת בֶּחָֽרֶב׃
Translated: But hear the word of G<small>OD</small>, O King Zedekiah of Judah! Thus said G<small>OD</small> concerning you: You will not die by the sword.
Transliteration: akhe shema devar-yehovah tsidekiyahu melekhe yehudah khoh-amar yehovah aleykha lo tamut vecharev

Hebrew: בְּשָׁל֣וֹם תָּמ֗וּת וּֽכְמִשְׂרְפ֣וֹת אֲ֠בוֹתֶ֠יךָ הַמְּלָכִ֨ים הָרִאשֹׁנִ֜ים אֲשֶׁר־הָי֣וּ לְפָנֶ֗יךָ כֵּ֚ן יִשְׂרְפוּ־לָ֔ךְ וְה֥וֹי אָד֖וֹן יִסְפְּדוּ־לָ֑ךְ כִּֽי־דָבָ֥ר אֲנִֽי־דִבַּ֖רְתִּי נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: You will die a peaceful death; and as incense was burned for your ancestors, the earlier kings who preceded you, so they will burn incense for you, and they will lament for you ‘Ah, lord!’ For I Myself have made the promise—declares G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: veshalvom tamut ukhemisherefvot avvoteykha hamelakhiym harishoniym asher-hayu lefaneykha khen yisherefu-lakhe vehvoy advon yisefedu-lakhe khiy-davar aniy-divaretiy neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּר֙ יִרְמְיָ֣הוּ הַנָּבִ֔יא אֶל־צִדְקִיָּ֖הוּ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה אֵ֛ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: The prophet Jeremiah spoke all these words to King Zedekiah of Judah in Jerusalem,
Transliteration: vayedaver yiremeyahu hanaviy el-tsidekiyahu melekhe yehudah et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וְחֵ֣יל מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֗ל נִלְחָמִים֙ עַל־יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְעַ֛ל כׇּל־עָרֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה הַנּוֹתָר֑וֹת אֶל־לָכִישׁ֙ וְאֶל־עֲזֵקָ֔ה כִּ֣י הֵ֗נָּה נִשְׁאֲר֛וּ בְּעָרֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה עָרֵ֥י מִבְצָֽר׃ {פ}
Translated: when the army of the king of Babylon was waging war against Jerusalem and against the remaining towns of Judah—against Lachish and Azekah, for they were the only fortified towns of Judah that were left.
Transliteration: vecheyl melekhe-vavel nilechamiym al-yerushala͏im veal khׇl-arey yehudah hanvotarvot el-lakhiysh veel-azekah khiy henah nishearu vearey yehudah arey mivetsar {f}

Hebrew: הַדָּבָ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֥ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה אַחֲרֵ֡י כְּרֹת֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ צִדְקִיָּ֜הוּ בְּרִ֗ית אֶת־כׇּל־הָעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּירוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם לִקְרֹ֥א לָהֶ֖ם דְּרֽוֹר׃
Translated: The word that came to Jeremiah from G<small>OD</small> after King Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people in Jerusalem to proclaim a release among them—
Transliteration: hadavar asher-hayah el-yiremeyahu meet yehovah acharey kherot hamelekhe tsidekiyahu veriyt et-khׇl-haam asher viyrushala͏im likero lahem dervor

Hebrew: לְ֠שַׁלַּ֠ח אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־עַבְדּ֞וֹ וְאִ֧ישׁ אֶת־שִׁפְחָת֛וֹ הָעִבְרִ֥י וְהָעִבְרִיָּ֖ה חׇפְשִׁ֑ים לְבִלְתִּ֧י עֲבׇד־בָּ֛ם בִּיהוּדִ֥י אָחִ֖יהוּ אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: that everyone should set free their Hebrew slaves, both male and female, and that no one should keep their fellow Judean enslaved.
Transliteration: leshalach iysh et-avedvo veiysh et-shifechatvo haiveriy vehaiveriyah chׇfeshiym leviletiy avׇd-vam viyhudiy achiyhu iysh

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמְעוּ֩ כׇל־הַשָּׂרִ֨ים וְכׇל־הָעָ֜ם אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֣אוּ בַבְּרִ֗ית לְ֠שַׁלַּ֠ח אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־עַבְדּ֞וֹ וְאִ֤ישׁ אֶת־שִׁפְחָתוֹ֙ חׇפְשִׁ֔ים לְבִלְתִּ֥י עֲבׇד־בָּ֖ם ע֑וֹד וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֖וּ וַיְשַׁלֵּֽחוּ׃
Translated: Everyone, officials and people, who had entered into the covenant agreed to set their male and female slaves free and not keep them enslaved any longer; they complied and let them go.
Transliteration: vayishemeu khׇl-hashariym vekhׇl-haam asher-vau vaveriyt leshalach iysh et-avedvo veiysh et-shifechatvo chׇfeshiym leviletiy avׇd-vam vod vayishemeu vayeshalechu

Hebrew: וַיָּשׁ֙וּבוּ֙ אַחֲרֵי־כֵ֔ן וַיָּשִׁ֗בוּ אֶת־הָֽעֲבָדִים֙ וְאֶת־הַשְּׁפָח֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר שִׁלְּח֖וּ חׇפְשִׁ֑ים (ויכבישום) [וַֽיִּכְבְּשׁ֔וּם] לַעֲבָדִ֖ים וְלִשְׁפָחֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: But afterward they turned about and brought back the men and women they had set free, and forced them into slavery again.
Transliteration: vayashuvu acharey-khen vayashivu et-haavadiym veet-hashefachvot asher shilechu chׇfeshiym (vykhvyshvm) [vayikheveshum] laavadiym velishefachvot {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י דְבַר־יְהֹוָה֙ אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ מֵאֵ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Then it was that the word of G<small>OD</small> came to Jeremiah from G<small>OD</small>:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-yiremeyahu meet yehovah lemor

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אָנֹכִ֗י כָּרַ֤תִּֽי בְרִית֙ אֶת־אֲב֣וֹתֵיכֶ֔ם בְּי֨וֹם הוֹצִאִ֤י אוֹתָם֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם מִבֵּ֥ית עֲבָדִ֖ים לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: I made a covenant with your ancestors when I brought them out of the land of Egypt, the house of bondage, saying:
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael anokhiy kharatiy veriyt et-avvoteykhem veyvom hvotsiiy votam meerets mitserayiim miveyt avadiym lemor

Hebrew: מִקֵּ֣ץ שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֡ים תְּֽשַׁלְּח֡וּ אִישׁ֩ אֶת־אָחִ֨יו הָעִבְרִ֜י אֲשֶֽׁר־יִמָּכֵ֣ר לְךָ֗ וַעֲבָֽדְךָ֙ שֵׁ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים וְשִׁלַּחְתּ֥וֹ חׇפְשִׁ֖י מֵעִמָּ֑ךְ וְלֹֽא־שָׁמְע֤וּ אֲבֽוֹתֵיכֶם֙ אֵלַ֔י וְלֹ֥א הִטּ֖וּ אֶת־אׇזְנָֽם׃
Translated: “In the seventh year each of you must let go any fellow Hebrew who may be sold to you; when they have served you six years, you must set them free.” But your ancestors would not obey Me or give ear.
Transliteration: mikets sheva shaniym teshalechu iysh et-achiyv haiveriy asher-yimakher lekha vaavadekha shesh shaniym veshilachetvo chׇfeshiy meimakhe velo-shameu avvoteykhem elay velo hitu et-ׇzenam

Hebrew: וַתָּשֻׁ֨בוּ אַתֶּ֜ם הַיּ֗וֹם וַתַּעֲשׂ֤וּ אֶת־הַיָּשָׁר֙ בְּעֵינַ֔י לִקְרֹ֥א דְר֖וֹר אִ֣ישׁ לְרֵעֵ֑הוּ וַתִּכְרְת֤וּ בְרִית֙ לְפָנַ֔י בַּבַּ֕יִת אֲשֶׁר־נִקְרָ֥א שְׁמִ֖י עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: Lately you turned about and did what is proper in My sight, and all of you proclaimed a release to your compatriots; and you made a covenant accordingly before Me in the House that bears My name.
Transliteration: vatashuvu atem hayyvom vataashu et-hayashar veeynay likero dervor iysh lereehu vatikheretu veriyt lefanay vavayiit asher-nikera shemiy alayv

Hebrew: וַתָּשֻׁ֙בוּ֙ וַתְּחַלְּל֣וּ אֶת־שְׁמִ֔י וַתָּשִׁ֗בוּ אִ֤ישׁ אֶת־עַבְדּוֹ֙ וְאִ֣ישׁ אֶת־שִׁפְחָת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁר־שִׁלַּחְתֶּ֥ם חׇפְשִׁ֖ים לְנַפְשָׁ֑ם וַתִּכְבְּשׁ֣וּ אֹתָ֔ם לִֽהְי֣וֹת לָכֶ֔ם לַעֲבָדִ֖ים וְלִשְׁפָחֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: But now you have turned back and have profaned My name; each of you has brought back the men and women whom you had given their freedom, and forced them to be your slaves again.
Transliteration: vatashuvu vatechalelu et-shemiy vatashivu iysh et-avedvo veiysh et-shifechatvo asher-shilachetem chׇfeshiym lenafesham vatikheveshu otam liheyvot lakhem laavadiym velishefachvot {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵן֮ כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָה֒ אַתֶּם֙ לֹא־שְׁמַעְתֶּ֣ם אֵלַ֔י לִקְרֹ֣א דְר֔וֹר אִ֥ישׁ לְאָחִ֖יו וְאִ֣ישׁ לְרֵעֵ֑הוּ הִנְנִ֣י קֹרֵא֩ לָכֶ֨ם דְּר֜וֹר נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶל־הַחֶ֙רֶב֙ אֶל־הַדֶּ֣בֶר וְאֶל־הָרָעָ֔ב וְנָתַתִּ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ (לזועה) [לְזַעֲוָ֔ה] לְכֹ֖ל מַמְלְכ֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said G<small>OD</small>: You would not obey Me and proclaim a release, each to your kin and neighbor. Lo! I proclaim your release—declares G<small>OD</small>—to the sword, to pestilence, and to famine; and I will make you a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah atem lo-shemaetem elay likero dervor iysh leachiyv veiysh lereehu hineniy kore lakhem dervor neum-yehovah el-hacherev el-hadever veel-haraav venatatiy etekhem (lzvh) [lezaavah] lekhol mamelekhvot haarets

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֣י אֶת־הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים הָעֹֽבְרִים֙ אֶת־בְּרִתִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹא־הֵקִ֙ימוּ֙ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֣י הַבְּרִ֔ית אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּרְת֖וּ לְפָנָ֑י הָעֵ֙גֶל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר כָּרְת֣וּ לִשְׁנַ֔יִם וַיַּעַבְר֖וּ בֵּ֥ין בְּתָרָֽיו׃
Translated: I will make the parties who violated My covenant, who did not fulfill the terms of the covenant that they made before Me, [like] the calf that they cut in two so as to pass between the halves:
Transliteration: venatatiy et-haanashiym haoveriym et-veritiy asher lo-hekiymu et-diverey haveriyt asher kharetu lefanay haegel asher kharetu lishenayiim vayaaveru veyn vetarayv

Hebrew: שָׂרֵ֨י יְהוּדָ֜ה וְשָׂרֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם הַסָּֽרִסִים֙ וְהַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים וְכֹ֖ל עַ֣ם הָאָ֑רֶץ הָעֹ֣בְרִ֔ים בֵּ֖ין בִּתְרֵ֥י הָעֵֽגֶל׃
Translated: The officers of Judah and Jerusalem, the officials, the priests, and all the people of the land who passed between the halves of the calf
Transliteration: sharey yehudah vesharey yerushala͏im hasarisiym vehakhohaniym vekhol am haarets haoveriym veyn viterey haegel

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֤י אוֹתָם֙ בְּיַ֣ד אֹֽיְבֵיהֶ֔ם וּבְיַ֖ד מְבַקְשֵׁ֣י נַפְשָׁ֑ם וְהָיְתָ֤ה נִבְלָתָם֙ לְמַֽאֲכָ֔ל לְע֥וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וּלְבֶהֱמַ֥ת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: shall be handed over to their enemies, to those who seek to kill them. Their carcasses shall become food for the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth.
Transliteration: venatatiy votam veyad oyeveyhem uveyad mevakeshey nafesham vehayetah nivelatam lemaakhal levof hashamayiim ulevehemat haarets

Hebrew: וְאֶת־צִדְקִיָּ֨הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֜ה וְאֶת־שָׂרָ֗יו אֶתֵּן֙ בְּיַ֣ד אֹֽיְבֵיהֶ֔ם וּבְיַ֖ד מְבַקְשֵׁ֣י נַפְשָׁ֑ם וּבְיַ֗ד חֵ֚יל מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֔ל הָעֹלִ֖ים מֵעֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: I will hand over King Zedekiah of Judah and his officers to their enemies, who seek to kill them—to the army of the king of Babylon that has withdrawn from you.
Transliteration: veet-tsidekiyahu melekhe-yehudah veet-sharayv eten veyad oyeveyhem uveyad mevakeshey nafesham uveyad cheyl melekhe vavel haoliym mealeykhem

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֨י מְצַוֶּ֜ה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֗ה וַהֲשִׁ֨בֹתִ֜ים אֶל־הָעִ֤יר הַזֹּאת֙ וְנִלְחֲמ֣וּ עָלֶ֔יהָ וּלְכָד֖וּהָ וּשְׂרָפֻ֣הָ בָאֵ֑שׁ וְאֶת־עָרֵ֧י יְהוּדָ֛ה אֶתֵּ֥ן שְׁמָמָ֖ה מֵאֵ֥ין יֹשֵֽׁב׃ {פ}
Translated: I hereby give the command—declares G<small>OD</small>—by which I will bring them back against this city. They shall attack it and capture it, and burn it down. I will make the towns of Judah a desolation, without inhabitant.
Transliteration: hineniy metsaveh neum-yehovah vahashivotiym el-haiyr hazot venilechamu aleyha ulekhaduha usherafuha vaesh veet-arey yehudah eten shemamah meeyn yoshev {f}

Hebrew: הַדָּבָ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֥ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה בִּימֵ֨י יְהוֹיָקִ֧ים בֶּן־יֹאשִׁיָּ֛הוּ מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word that came to Jeremiah from G<small>OD</small> in the days of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah:
Transliteration: hadavar asher-hayah el-yiremeyahu meet yehovah viymey yehvoyakiym ven-yoshiyahu melekhe yehudah lemor

Hebrew: הָלוֹךְ֮ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית הָרֵכָבִים֒ וְדִבַּרְתָּ֣ אוֹתָ֔ם וַהֲבִֽאוֹתָם֙ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־אַחַ֖ת הַלְּשָׁכ֑וֹת וְהִשְׁקִיתָ֥ אוֹתָ֖ם יָֽיִן׃
Translated: Go to the house of the Rechabites and speak to them, and bring them to the House of G<small>OD</small>, to one of the chambers, and give them wine to drink.
Transliteration: halvokhe el-veyt harekhaviym vedivareta votam vahavivotam veyt yehovah el-achat haleshakhvot vehishekiyta votam yayiin

Hebrew: וָאֶקַּ֞ח אֶת־יַאֲזַנְיָ֤ה בֶֽן־יִרְמְיָ֙הוּ֙ בֶּן־חֲבַצִּנְיָ֔ה וְאֶת־אֶחָ֖יו וְאֶת־כׇּל־בָּנָ֑יו וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־בֵּ֥ית הָרֵכָבִֽים׃
Translated: So I took Jaazaniah son of Jeremiah son of Habazziniah, and his brothers, all his sons, and all the men in the household of the Rechabites;
Transliteration: vaekach et-yaazaneyah ven-yiremeyahu ven-chavatsineyah veet-echayv veet-khׇl-vanayv veet khׇl-veyt harekhaviym

Hebrew: וָאָבִ֤א אֹתָם֙ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־לִשְׁכַּ֗ת בְּנֵ֛י חָנָ֥ן בֶּן־יִגְדַּלְיָ֖הוּ אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים אֲשֶׁר־אֵ֙צֶל֙ לִשְׁכַּ֣ת הַשָּׂרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר מִמַּ֗עַל לְלִשְׁכַּ֛ת מַעֲשֵׂיָ֥הוּ בֶן־שַׁלֻּ֖ם שֹׁמֵ֥ר הַסַּֽף׃
Translated: and I brought them to the House of G<small>OD</small>, to the chamber of the sons of Hanan son of Igdaliah, the agent of God, which is next to the chamber of the officials and above the chamber of Maaseiah son of Shallum, the guardian of the threshold.
Transliteration: vaavi otam veyt yehovah el-lishekhat veney chanan ven-yigedaleyahu iysh haElohim asher-etsel lishekhat hashariym asher mimaal lelishekhat maasheyahu ven-shalum shomer hasaf

Hebrew: וָאֶתֵּ֞ן לִפְנֵ֣י ׀ בְּנֵ֣י בֵית־הָרֵכָבִ֗ים גְּבִעִ֛ים מְלֵאִ֥ים יַ֖יִן וְכֹס֑וֹת וָאֹמַ֥ר אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁתוּ־יָֽיִן׃
Translated: I set bowls full of wine and cups before the Rechabites, and said to them, “Have some wine.”
Transliteration: vaeten lifeney veney veyt-harekhaviym geviiym meleiym yayiin vekhosvot vaomar aleyhem shetu-yayiin

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ לֹ֣א נִשְׁתֶּה־יָּ֑יִן כִּי֩ יוֹנָדָ֨ב בֶּן־רֵכָ֜ב אָבִ֗ינוּ צִוָּ֤ה עָלֵ֙ינוּ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹ֧א תִשְׁתּוּ־יַ֛יִן אַתֶּ֥ם וּבְנֵיכֶ֖ם עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: They replied, “We will not drink wine, for our ancestor, Jonadab son of Rechab, commanded us: ‘You shall never drink wine, either you or your children.
Transliteration: vayomeru lo nisheteh-yayiin khiy yvonadav ven-rekhav aviynu tsivah aleynu lemor lo tishetu-yayiin atem uveneykhem ad-volam

Hebrew: וּבַ֣יִת לֹֽא־תִבְנ֗וּ וְזֶ֤רַע לֹֽא־תִזְרָ֙עוּ֙ וְכֶ֣רֶם לֹֽא־תִטָּ֔עוּ וְלֹ֥א יִהְיֶ֖ה לָכֶ֑ם כִּ֠י בׇּאֳהָלִ֤ים תֵּֽשְׁבוּ֙ כׇּל־יְמֵיכֶ֔ם לְמַ֨עַן תִּֽחְי֜וּ יָמִ֤ים רַבִּים֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֖ם גָּרִ֥ים שָֽׁם׃
Translated: Nor shall you build houses or sow fields or plant vineyards, nor shall you own such things; but you shall live in tents all your days, so that you may live long upon the land where you sojourn.’
Transliteration: uvayiit lo-tivenu vezera lo-tizerau vekherem lo-titau velo yiheyeh lakhem khiy vׇohaliym teshevu khׇl-yemeykhem lemaan ticheyu yamiym raviym al-feney haadamah asher atem gariym sham

Hebrew: וַנִּשְׁמַ֗ע בְּק֨וֹל יְהוֹנָדָ֤ב בֶּן־רֵכָב֙ אָבִ֔ינוּ לְכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֑נוּ לְבִלְתִּ֤י שְׁתֽוֹת־יַ֙יִן֙ כׇּל־יָמֵ֔ינוּ אֲנַ֣חְנוּ נָשֵׁ֔ינוּ בָּנֵ֖ינוּ וּבְנֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: And we have obeyed our ancestor Jonadab son of Rechab in all that he commanded us: we never drink wine, neither we nor our wives nor our sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vanishema vekvol yehvonadav ven-rekhav aviynu lekhol asher tsivanu leviletiy shetvot-yayiin khׇl-yameynu anachenu nasheynu vaneynu uvenoteynu

Hebrew: וּלְבִלְתִּ֛י בְּנ֥וֹת בָּתִּ֖ים לְשִׁבְתֵּ֑נוּ וְכֶ֧רֶם וְשָׂדֶ֛ה וָזֶ֖רַע לֹ֥א יִֽהְיֶה־לָּֽנוּ׃
