Translated: Nor do we build houses to live in, and we do not own vineyards or fields for sowing;
Transliteration: uleviletiy venvot vatiym leshivetenu vekherem veshadeh vazera lo yiheyeh-lanu

Hebrew: וַנֵּ֖שֶׁב בׇּאֳהָלִ֑ים וַנִּשְׁמַ֣ע וַנַּ֔עַשׂ כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֖נוּ יוֹנָדָ֥ב אָבִֽינוּ׃
Translated: but we live in tents. We have obeyed and done all that our ancestor Jonadab commanded us.
Transliteration: vaneshev vׇohaliym vanishema vanaash khekhol asher-tsivanu yvonadav aviynu

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בַּעֲל֨וֹת נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֥ר מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶל֮ אֶל־הָאָ֒רֶץ֒ וַנֹּ֗אמֶר בֹּ֚אוּ וְנָב֣וֹא יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם מִפְּנֵי֙ חֵ֣יל הַכַּשְׂדִּ֔ים וּמִפְּנֵ֖י חֵ֣יל אֲרָ֑ם וַנֵּ֖שֶׁב בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {פ}
Translated: But when King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon invaded the country, we said, ‘Come, let us go into Jerusalem because of the army of the Chaldeans and the army of Aram.’ And so we are living in Jerusalem.”
Transliteration: vayehiy vaalvot nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel el-haarets vanomer vou venavvo yerushala͏im mifeney cheyl hakhashediym umifeney cheyl aram vaneshev viyrushala͏im {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Then the word of G<small>OD</small> came to Jeremiah:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-yiremeyahu lemor

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הָלֹ֤ךְ וְאָֽמַרְתָּ֙ לְאִ֣ישׁ יְהוּדָ֔ה וּלְיוֹשְׁבֵ֖י יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם הֲל֨וֹא תִקְח֥וּ מוּסָ֛ר לִשְׁמֹ֥עַ אֶל־דְּבָרַ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: Go say to the citizenry of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem: “You can learn a lesson [here] about obeying My commands—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael halokhe veamareta leiysh yehudah uleyvoshevey yerushala͏im halvo tikechu musar lishemoa el-devaray neum-yehovah

Hebrew: הוּקַ֡ם אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֣י יְהוֹנָדָ֣ב בֶּן־רֵ֠כָ֠ב אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֨ה אֶת־בָּנָ֜יו לְבִלְתִּ֣י שְׁתֽוֹת־יַ֗יִן וְלֹ֤א שָׁתוּ֙ עַד־הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה כִּ֣י שָֽׁמְע֔וּ אֵ֖ת מִצְוַ֣ת אֲבִיהֶ֑ם וְאָ֨נֹכִ֜י דִּבַּ֤רְתִּי אֲלֵיכֶם֙ הַשְׁכֵּ֣ם וְדַבֵּ֔ר וְלֹ֥א שְׁמַעְתֶּ֖ם אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: The commands of Jonadab son of Rechab have been fulfilled: he charged his children not to drink wine, and to this day they have not drunk, in obedience to the charge of their ancestor. But I spoke to you persistently, and you did not listen to Me.
Transliteration: hukam et-diverey yehvonadav ven-rekhav asher-tsivah et-vanayv leviletiy shetvot-yayiin velo shatu ad-hayyvom hazeh khiy shameu et mitsevat aviyhem veanokhiy divaretiy aleykhem hashekhem vedaver velo shemaetem elay

Hebrew: וָאֶשְׁלַ֣ח אֲלֵיכֶ֣ם אֶת־כׇּל־עֲבָדַ֣י הַנְּבִאִ֣ים <small>׀</small> הַשְׁכֵּ֣ם וְשָׁלֹ֣חַ <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹ֡ר שֻֽׁבוּ־נָ֡א אִישׁ֩ מִדַּרְכּ֨וֹ הָרָעָ֜ה וְהֵיטִ֣יבוּ מַעַלְלֵיכֶ֗ם וְאַל־תֵּ֨לְכ֜וּ אַחֲרֵ֨י אֱלֹהִ֤ים אֲחֵרִים֙ לְעׇבְדָ֔ם וּשְׁבוּ֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תִּי לָכֶ֖ם וְלַאֲבֹֽתֵיכֶ֑ם וְלֹ֤א הִטִּיתֶם֙ אֶֽת־אׇזְנְכֶ֔ם וְלֹ֥א שְׁמַעְתֶּ֖ם אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: I persistently sent you all My servants, the prophets, to say: ‘Turn back, every one of you, from your wicked ways and mend your deeds; do not follow other gods or serve them. Then you may remain on the land that I gave to you and your ancestors.’ But you did not give ear or listen to Me.
Transliteration: vaeshelach aleykhem et-khׇl-avaday haneviiym <small></small> hashekhem veshalocha <small></small> lemor shuvu-na iysh midarekhvo haraah veheytiyvu maaleleykhem veal-telekhu acharey Elohim acheriym leׇvedam ushevu el-haadamah asher-natatiy lakhem velaavoteykhem velo hitiytem et-ׇzenekhem velo shemaetem elay

Hebrew: כִּ֣י הֵקִ֗ימוּ בְּנֵי֙ יְהוֹנָדָ֣ב בֶּן־רֵכָ֔ב אֶת־מִצְוַ֥ת אֲבִיהֶ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֑ם וְהָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה לֹ֥א שָׁמְע֖וּ אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: The family of Jonadab son of Rechab have indeed fulfilled the charge that their ancestor gave them; but this people has not listened to Me.
Transliteration: khiy hekiymu veney yehvonadav ven-rekhav et-mitsevat aviyhem asher tsivam vehaam hazeh lo shameu elay

Hebrew: לָ֠כֵ֠ן כֹּֽה־אָמַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י צְבָאוֹת֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הִנְנִ֧י מֵבִ֣יא אֶל־יְהוּדָ֗ה וְאֶ֤ל כׇּל־יֽוֹשְׁבֵי֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הָ֣רָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם יַ֣עַן דִּבַּ֤רְתִּי אֲלֵיהֶם֙ וְלֹ֣א שָׁמֵ֔עוּ וָאֶקְרָ֥א לָהֶ֖ם וְלֹ֥א עָנֽוּ׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to bring upon Judah and upon all the inhabitants of Jerusalem all the disaster with which I have threatened them; for I spoke to them, but they would not listen; I called to them, but they would not respond.”
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah elohey tsevavot elohey yisherael hineniy meviy el-yehudah veel khׇl-yvoshevey yerushala͏im et khׇl-haraah asher divaretiy aleyhem yaan divaretiy aleyhem velo shameu vaekera lahem velo anu

Hebrew: וּלְבֵ֨ית הָרֵכָבִ֜ים אָמַ֣ר יִרְמְיָ֗הוּ כֹּֽה־אָמַ֞ר יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יַ֚עַן אֲשֶׁ֣ר שְׁמַעְתֶּ֔ם עַל־מִצְוַ֖ת יְהוֹנָדָ֣ב אֲבִיכֶ֑ם וַֽתִּשְׁמְרוּ֙ אֶת־כׇּל־מִצְוֺתָ֔יו וַֽתַּעֲשׂ֔וּ כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֖ה אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: And to the family of the Rechabites Jeremiah said: “Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: Because you have obeyed the charge of your ancestor Jonadab and kept all his commandments, and done all that he enjoined upon you,
Transliteration: uleveyt harekhaviym amar yiremeyahu khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael yaan asher shemaetem al-mitsevat yehvonadav aviykhem vatishemeru et-khׇl-mitsevotayv vataashu khekhol asher-tsivah etekhem

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֛ר יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לֹא־יִכָּרֵ֨ת אִ֜ישׁ לְיוֹנָדָ֧ב בֶּן־רֵכָ֛ב עֹמֵ֥ד לְפָנַ֖י כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: assuredly, thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: There shall never cease to be someone from the line of Jonadab son of Rechab standing before Me.”
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael lo-yikharet iysh leyvonadav ven-rekhav omed lefanay khׇl-hayamiym {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בַּשָּׁנָ֣ה הָרְבִעִ֔ית לִיהוֹיָקִ֥ים בֶּן־יֹאשִׁיָּ֖הוּ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה הָיָ֞ה הַדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ מֵאֵ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: In the fourth year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from G<small>OD</small>:
Transliteration: vayehiy vashanah hareviiyt liyhvoyakiym ven-yoshiyahu melekhe yehudah hayah hadavar hazeh el-yiremeyahu meet yehovah lemor

Hebrew: קַח־לְךָ֮ מְגִלַּת־סֵ֒פֶר֒ וְכָתַבְתָּ֣ אֵלֶ֗יהָ אֵ֣ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֞ים אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֧רְתִּי אֵלֶ֛יךָ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל וְעַל־יְהוּדָ֖ה וְעַל־כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֑ם מִיּ֞וֹם דִּבַּ֤רְתִּי אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ מִימֵ֣י יֹאשִׁיָּ֔הוּ וְעַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Get a scroll and write upon it all the words that I have spoken to you—concerning Israel and Judah and all the nations—from the time I first spoke to you in the days of Josiah to this day.
Transliteration: kach-lekha megilat-sefer vekhataveta eleyha et khׇl-hadevariym asher-divaretiy eleykha al-yisherael veal-yehudah veal-khׇl-hagvoyim miyyvom divaretiy eleykha miymey yoshiyahu vead hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: אוּלַ֤י יִשְׁמְעוּ֙ בֵּ֣ית יְהוּדָ֔ה אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הָ֣רָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י חֹשֵׁ֖ב לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת לָהֶ֑ם לְמַ֣עַן יָשׁ֗וּבוּ אִ֚ישׁ מִדַּרְכּ֣וֹ הָרָעָ֔ה וְסָלַחְתִּ֥י לַעֲוֺנָ֖ם וּלְחַטָּאתָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Perhaps when the House of Judah hear of all the disasters I intend to bring upon them, they will turn back from their wicked ways, and I will pardon their iniquity and their sin.
Transliteration: ulay yishemeu veyt yehudah et khׇl-haraah asher anokhiy choshev laashvot lahem lemaan yashuvu iysh midarekhvo haraah vesalachetiy laavonam ulechatatam {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ אֶת־בָּר֖וּךְ בֶּן־נֵֽרִיָּ֑ה וַיִּכְתֹּ֨ב בָּר֜וּךְ מִפִּ֣י יִרְמְיָ֗הוּ אֵ֣ת כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֧י יְהֹוָ֛ה אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר אֵלָ֖יו עַל־מְגִלַּת־סֵֽפֶר׃
Translated: So Jeremiah called Baruch son of Neriah; and Baruch wrote down in the scroll, at Jeremiah’s dictation, all the words that G<small>OD</small> had spoken to him.
Transliteration: vayikera yiremeyahu et-varukhe ven-neriyah vayikhetov varukhe mifiy yiremeyahu et khׇl-diverey yehovah asher-diver elayv al-megilat-sefer

Hebrew: וַיְצַוֶּ֣ה יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ אֶת־בָּר֖וּךְ לֵאמֹ֑ר אֲנִ֣י עָצ֔וּר לֹ֣א אוּכַ֔ל לָב֖וֹא בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Jeremiah instructed Baruch, “I am in hiding; I cannot go to the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayetsaveh yiremeyahu et-varukhe lemor aniy atsur lo ukhal lavvo veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וּבָאתָ֣ אַתָּ֡ה וְקָרָ֣אתָ בַמְּגִלָּ֣ה אֲשֶׁר־כָּתַֽבְתָּ־מִפִּי֩ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֨י יְהֹוָ֜ה בְּאׇזְנֵ֥י הָעָ֛ם בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּי֣וֹם צ֑וֹם וְגַ֨ם בְּאׇזְנֵ֧י כׇל־יְהוּדָ֛ה הַבָּאִ֥ים מֵעָרֵיהֶ֖ם תִּקְרָאֵֽם׃
Translated: But you go and read aloud G<small>OD</small>’s words from the scroll that you wrote at my dictation, to all the people in the House of G<small>OD</small> on a fast day; thus you will also be reading them to all the Judeans who come in from the towns.
Transliteration: uvata atah vekarata vamegilah asher-khataveta-mifiy et-diverey yehovah veׇzeney haam veyt yehovah veyvom tsvom vegam veׇzeney khׇl-yehudah havaiym meareyhem tikeraem

Hebrew: אוּלַ֞י תִּפֹּ֤ל תְּחִנָּתָם֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וְיָשֻׁ֕בוּ אִ֖ישׁ מִדַּרְכּ֣וֹ הָרָעָ֑ה כִּֽי־גָד֤וֹל הָאַף֙ וְהַ֣חֵמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Perhaps their entreaty will be accepted by G<small>OD</small>, if they turn back from their wicked ways. For great is the anger and wrath with which G<small>OD</small> has threatened this people.”
Transliteration: ulay tifol techinatam lifeney yehovah veyashuvu iysh midarekhvo haraah khiy-gadvol haaf vehachemah asher-diver yehovah el-haam hazeh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֗עַשׂ בָּרוּךְ֙ בֶּן־נֵ֣רִיָּ֔ה כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֖הוּ יִרְמְיָ֣הוּ הַנָּבִ֑יא לִקְרֹ֥א בַסֵּ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Baruch son of Neriah did just as the prophet Jeremiah had instructed him, about reading G<small>OD</small>’s words from the scroll in the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayaash varukhe ven-neriyah khekhol asher-tsivahu yiremeyahu hanaviy likero vasefer diverey yehovah veyt yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַ֠חֲמִשִׁ֠ית לִיהוֹיָקִ֨ים בֶּן־יֹאשִׁיָּ֤הוּ מֶֽלֶךְ־יְהוּדָה֙ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַתְּשִׁעִ֔י קָרְא֨וּ צ֜וֹם לִפְנֵ֧י יְהֹוָ֛ה כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְכׇל־הָעָ֗ם הַבָּאִ֛ים מֵעָרֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: In the ninth month of the fifth year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah, all the people in Jerusalem and all the people coming from Judah proclaimed a fast before G<small>OD</small> in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayehiy vashanah hachamishiyt liyhvoyakiym ven-yoshiyahu melekhe-yehudah vachodesh hateshiiy kareu tsvom lifeney yehovah khׇl-haam viyrushala͏im vekhׇl-haam havaiym mearey yehudah viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א בָר֥וּךְ בַּסֵּ֛פֶר אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּלִשְׁכַּ֡ת גְּמַרְיָ֩הוּ֩ בֶן־שָׁפָ֨ן הַסֹּפֵ֜ר בֶּחָצֵ֣ר הָעֶלְי֗וֹן פֶּ֣תַח שַׁ֤עַר בֵּית־יְהֹוָה֙ הֶחָדָ֔שׁ בְּאׇזְנֵ֖י כׇּל־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: It was then that Baruch—in the chamber of Gemariah son of Shaphan the scribe, in the upper court, near the new gateway of the House of G<small>OD</small>—read the words of Jeremiah from the scroll to all the people in the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayikera varukhe vasefer et-diverey yiremeyahu veyt yehovah velishekhat gemareyahu ven-shafan hasofer vechatser haeleyvon fetach shaar veyt-yehovah hechadash veׇzeney khׇl-haam

Hebrew: וַ֠יִּשְׁמַ֠ע מִכָ֨יְהוּ בֶן־גְּמַרְיָ֧הוּ בֶן־שָׁפָ֛ן אֶת־כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה מֵעַ֥ל הַסֵּֽפֶר׃
Translated: Micaiah son of Gemariah son of Shaphan heard all the words of G<small>OD</small> [read] from the scroll,
Transliteration: vayishema mikhayehu ven-gemareyahu ven-shafan et-khׇl-diverey yehovah meal hasefer

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֤רֶד בֵּית־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ עַל־לִשְׁכַּ֣ת הַסֹּפֵ֔ר וְהִ֨נֵּה־שָׁ֔ם כׇּל־הַשָּׂרִ֖ים יוֹשְׁבִ֑ים אֱלִישָׁמָ֣ע הַסֹּפֵ֡ר וּדְלָיָ֣הוּ בֶן־שְׁ֠מַֽעְיָ֠הוּ וְאֶלְנָתָ֨ן בֶּן־עַכְבּ֜וֹר וּגְמַרְיָ֧הוּ בֶן־שָׁפָ֛ן וְצִדְקִיָּ֥הוּ בֶן־חֲנַנְיָ֖הוּ וְכׇל־הַשָּׂרִֽים׃
Translated: and he went down to the king’s palace, to the chamber of the scribe. There he found all the officials in session: Elishama the scribe, Delaiah son of Shemaiah, Elnathan son of Achbor, Gemariah son of Shaphan, Zedekiah son of Hananiah, and all the other officials.
Transliteration: vayered veyt-hamelekhe al-lishekhat hasofer vehineh-sham khׇl-hashariym yvosheviym eliyshama hasofer udelayahu ven-shemaeyahu veelenatan ven-akhevvor ugemareyahu ven-shafan vetsidekiyahu ven-chananeyahu vekhׇl-hashariym

Hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֤ד לָהֶם֙ מִכָ֔יְהוּ אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁמֵ֑עַ בִּקְרֹ֥א בָר֛וּךְ בַּסֵּ֖פֶר בְּאׇזְנֵ֥י הָעָֽם׃
Translated: And Micaiah told them all that he had heard as Baruch read from the scroll in the hearing of the people.
Transliteration: vayaged lahem mikhayehu et khׇl-hadevariym asher shamea vikero varukhe vasefer veׇzeney haam

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלְח֨וּ כׇל־הַשָּׂרִ֜ים אֶל־בָּר֗וּךְ אֶת־יְהוּדִ֡י בֶּן־נְ֠תַנְיָ֠הוּ בֶּן־שֶׁלֶמְיָ֣הוּ בֶן־כּוּשִׁי֮ לֵאמֹר֒ הַמְּגִלָּ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר קָרָ֤אתָ בָּהּ֙ בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י הָעָ֔ם קָחֶ֥נָּה בְיָדְךָ֖ וָלֵ֑ךְ וַ֠יִּקַּ֠ח בָּר֨וּךְ בֶּן־נֵרִיָּ֤הוּ אֶת־הַמְּגִלָּה֙ בְּיָד֔וֹ וַיָּבֹ֖א אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Then all the officials sent Jehudi son of Nethaniah son of Shelemiah son of Cushi to say to Baruch, “Take that scroll from which you read to the people, and come along!” And Baruch took the scroll and came to them.
Transliteration: vayishelechu khׇl-hashariym el-varukhe et-yehudiy ven-netaneyahu ven-shelemeyahu ven-khushiy lemor hamegilah asher karata vah veׇzeney haam kachenah veyadekha valekhe vayikach varukhe ven-neriyahu et-hamegilah veyadvo vayavo aleyhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֔יו שֵׁ֣ב נָ֔א וּקְרָאֶ֖נָּה בְּאׇזְנֵ֑ינוּ וַיִּקְרָ֥א בָר֖וּךְ בְּאׇזְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: They said, “Sit down and read it to us.” And Baruch read it to them.
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv shev na ukeraenah veׇzeneynu vayikera varukhe veׇzeneyhem

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כְּשׇׁמְעָם֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים פָּחֲד֖וּ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֑הוּ וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אֶל־בָּר֔וּךְ הַגֵּ֤יד נַגִּיד֙ לַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: When they heard all these words, they turned to each other in fear; and they said to Baruch, “We must report all this to the king.”
Transliteration: vayehiy kheshׇmeam et-khׇl-hadevariym fachadu iysh el-reehu vayomeru el-varukhe hageyd nagiyd lamelekhe et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh

Hebrew: וְאֶ֨ת־בָּר֔וּךְ שָׁאֲל֖וּ לֵאמֹ֑ר הַגֶּד־נָ֣א לָ֔נוּ אֵ֗יךְ כָּתַ֛בְתָּ אֶת־כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה מִפִּֽיו׃
Translated: And they questioned Baruch further, “Tell us how you wrote down all these words that he spoke.”
Transliteration: veet-varukhe shaalu lemor haged-na lanu eykhe khataveta et-khׇl-hadevariym haeleh mifiyv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ בָּר֔וּךְ מִפִּיו֙ יִקְרָ֣א אֵלַ֔י אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַאֲנִ֛י כֹּתֵ֥ב עַל־הַסֵּ֖פֶר בַּדְּיֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: He answered them, “He himself recited all those words to me, and I would write them down in the scroll in ink.”
Transliteration: vayomer lahem varukhe mifiyv yikera elay et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh vaaniy khotev al-hasefer vadeyvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ הַשָּׂרִים֙ אֶל־בָּר֔וּךְ לֵ֥ךְ הִסָּתֵ֖ר אַתָּ֣ה וְיִרְמְיָ֑הוּ וְאִ֥ישׁ אַל־יֵדַ֖ע אֵיפֹ֥ה אַתֶּֽם׃
Translated: The officials said to Baruch, “Go into hiding, you and Jeremiah. Don’t let a soul know where you are!”
Transliteration: vayomeru hashariym el-varukhe lekhe hisater atah veyiremeyahu veiysh al-eida eyfoh atem

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤אוּ אֶל־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ חָצֵ֔רָה וְאֶת־הַמְּגִלָּ֣ה הִפְקִ֔דוּ בְּלִשְׁכַּ֖ת אֱלִישָׁמָ֣ע הַסֹּפֵ֑ר וַיַּגִּ֙ידוּ֙ בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִֽים׃
Translated: And they went to the king in the court, after leaving the scroll in the chamber of the scribe Elishama. And they reported all these matters to the king.
Transliteration: vayavou el-hamelekhe chatserah veet-hamegilah hifekidu velishekhat eliyshama hasofer vayagiydu veׇzeney hamelekhe et khׇl-hadevariym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֶת־יְהוּדִ֗י לָקַ֙חַת֙ אֶת־הַמְּגִלָּ֔ה וַיִּ֨קָּחֶ֔הָ מִלִּשְׁכַּ֖ת אֱלִישָׁמָ֣ע הַסֹּפֵ֑ר וַיִּקְרָאֶ֤הָ יְהוּדִי֙ בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וּבְאׇזְנֵי֙ כׇּל־הַשָּׂרִ֔ים הָעֹמְדִ֖ים מֵעַ֥ל הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: The king sent Jehudi to get the scroll and he fetched it from the chamber of the scribe Elishama. Jehudi read it to the king and to all the officials who were in attendance on the king.
Transliteration: vayishelach hamelekhe et-yehudiy lakachat et-hamegilah vayikacheha milishekhat eliyshama hasofer vayikeraeha yehudiy veׇzeney hamelekhe uveׇzeney khׇl-hashariym haomediym meal hamelekhe

Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֗לֶךְ יוֹשֵׁב֙ בֵּ֣ית הַחֹ֔רֶף בַּחֹ֖דֶשׁ הַתְּשִׁיעִ֑י וְאֶת־הָאָ֖ח לְפָנָ֥יו מְבֹעָֽרֶת׃
Translated: Since it was the ninth month, the king was sitting in the winter house, with a fire burning in the brazier before him.
Transliteration: vehamelekhe yvoshev veyt hachoref vachodesh hateshiyiy veet-haach lefanayv mevoaret

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כִּקְר֣וֹא יְהוּדִ֗י שָׁלֹ֣שׁ דְּלָתוֹת֮ וְאַרְבָּעָה֒ יִֽקְרָעֶ֙הָ֙ בְּתַ֣עַר הַסֹּפֵ֔ר וְהַשְׁלֵ֕ךְ אֶל־הָאֵ֖שׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶל־הָאָ֑ח עַד־תֹּם֙ כׇּל־הַמְּגִלָּ֔ה עַל־הָאֵ֖שׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־הָאָֽח׃
Translated: And every time Jehudi read three or four columns, [the king] would cut it up with a scribe’s knife and throw it into the fire in the brazier, until the entire scroll was consumed by the fire in the brazier.
Transliteration: vayehiy khikervo yehudiy shalosh delatvot vearevaah yikeraeha vetaar hasofer vehashelekhe el-haesh asher el-haach ad-tom khׇl-hamegilah al-haesh asher al-haach

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א פָחֲד֔וּ וְלֹ֥א קָרְע֖וּ אֶת־בִּגְדֵיהֶ֑ם הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ וְכׇל־עֲבָדָ֔יו הַשֹּׁ֣מְעִ֔ים אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: Yet the king and all his courtiers who heard all these words showed no fear and did not tear their garments;
Transliteration: velo fachadu velo kareu et-vigedeyhem hamelekhe vekhׇl-avadayv hashomeiym et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh

Hebrew: וְגַם֩ אֶלְנָתָ֨ן וּדְלָיָ֤הוּ וּגְמַרְיָ֙הוּ֙ הִפְגִּ֣עוּ בַמֶּ֔לֶךְ לְבִלְתִּ֥י שְׂרֹ֖ף אֶת־הַמְּגִלָּ֑ה וְלֹ֥א שָׁמַ֖ע אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: moreover, Elnathan, Delaiah, and Gemariah begged the king not to burn the scroll, but he would not listen to them.
Transliteration: vegam elenatan udelayahu ugemareyahu hifegiu vamelekhe leviletiy sherof et-hamegilah velo shama aleyhem

Hebrew: וַיְצַוֶּ֣ה הַ֠מֶּ֠לֶךְ אֶת־יְרַחְמְאֵ֨ל בֶּן־הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ וְאֶת־שְׂרָיָ֣הוּ בֶן־עַזְרִיאֵ֗ל וְאֶת־שֶׁלֶמְיָ֙הוּ֙ בֶּֽן־עַבְדְּאֵ֔ל לָקַ֙חַת֙ אֶת־בָּר֣וּךְ הַסֹּפֵ֔ר וְאֵ֖ת יִרְמְיָ֣הוּ הַנָּבִ֑יא וַיַּסְתִּרֵ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The king ordered Jerahmeel, the king’s son, and Seraiah son of Azriel, and Shelemiah son of Abdeel to arrest the scribe Baruch and the prophet Jeremiah. But G<small>OD</small> hid them.
Transliteration: vayetsaveh hamelekhe et-yerachemeel ven-hamelekhe veet-sherayahu ven-azeriyel veet-shelemeyahu ven-avedeel lakachat et-varukhe hasofer veet yiremeyahu hanaviy vayasetirem yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֑הוּ אַחֲרֵ֣י ׀ שְׂרֹ֣ף הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ אֶת־הַמְּגִלָּה֙ וְאֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר כָּתַ֥ב בָּר֛וּךְ מִפִּ֥י יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to Jeremiah after the king had burned the scroll containing the words that Baruch had written at Jeremiah’s dictation:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-yiremeyahu acharey sherof hamelekhe et-hamegilah veet-hadevariym asher khatav varukhe mifiy yiremeyahu lemor

Hebrew: שׁ֥וּב קַח־לְךָ֖ מְגִלָּ֣ה אַחֶ֑רֶת וּכְתֹ֣ב עָלֶ֗יהָ אֵ֤ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִים֙ הָרִ֣אשֹׁנִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָי֗וּ עַל־הַמְּגִלָּה֙ הָרִ֣אשֹׁנָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׂרַ֖ף יְהוֹיָקִ֥ים מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Get yourself another scroll, and write upon it the same words that were in the first scroll that was burned by King Jehoiakim of Judah.
Transliteration: shuv kach-lekha megilah acheret ukhetov aleyha et khׇl-hadevariym harishoniym asher hayu al-hamegilah harishonah asher sharaf yehvoyakiym melekhe-yehudah

Hebrew: וְעַל־יְהוֹיָקִ֤ים מֶֽלֶךְ־יְהוּדָה֙ תֹּאמַ֔ר כֹּ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה אַ֠תָּ֠ה שָׂרַ֜פְתָּ אֶת־הַמְּגִלָּ֤ה הַזֹּאת֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר מַדּ֩וּעַ֩ כָּתַ֨בְתָּ עָלֶ֜יהָ לֵאמֹ֗ר בֹּֽא־יָב֤וֹא מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶל֙ וְהִשְׁחִית֙ אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את וְהִשְׁבִּ֥ית מִמֶּ֖נָּה אָדָ֥ם וּבְהֵמָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: And concerning King Jehoiakim of Judah you shall say: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: You burned that scroll, saying, “How dare you write in it that the king of Babylon will come and destroy this land and cause human and animal to cease from it?”
Transliteration: veal-yehvoyakiym melekhe-yehudah tomar khoh amar yehovah atah sharafeta et-hamegilah hazot lemor madua khataveta aleyha lemor vo-yavvo melekhe-vavel vehishechiyt et-haarets hazot vehisheviyt mimenah adam uvehemah {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן כֹּֽה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה עַל־יְהֽוֹיָקִים֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה לֹא־יִֽהְיֶה־לּ֥וֹ יוֹשֵׁ֖ב עַל־כִּסֵּ֣א דָוִ֑ד וְנִבְלָתוֹ֙ תִּהְיֶ֣ה מֻשְׁלֶ֔כֶת לַחֹ֥רֶב בַּיּ֖וֹם וְלַקֶּ֥רַח בַּלָּֽיְלָה׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said G<small>OD</small> concerning King Jehoiakim of Judah: He shall not have any of his line sitting on the throne of David; and his own corpse shall be left exposed to the heat by day and the cold by night.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah al-yehvoyakiym melekhe yehudah lo-yiheyeh-lvo yvoshev al-khise david venivelatvo tiheyeh mushelekhet lachorev vayyvom velakerach valayelah

Hebrew: וּפָקַדְתִּ֨י עָלָ֧יו וְעַל־זַרְע֛וֹ וְעַל־עֲבָדָ֖יו אֶת־עֲוֺנָ֑ם וְהֵבֵאתִ֣י עֲ֠לֵיהֶ֠ם וְעַל־יֹשְׁבֵ֨י יְרוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם וְאֶל־אִ֣ישׁ יְהוּדָ֗ה אֵ֧ת כׇּל־הָרָעָ֛ה אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֥רְתִּי אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם וְלֹ֥א שָׁמֵֽעוּ׃
Translated: And I will punish him and his offspring and his courtiers for their iniquity; I will bring on them and on the inhabitants of Jerusalem and on all the citizenry of Judah all the disasters of which I have warned them—but they would not listen.
Transliteration: ufakadetiy alayv veal-zarevo veal-avadayv et-avonam vehevetiy aleyhem veal-yoshevey yerushala͏im veel-iysh yehudah et khׇl-haraah asher-divaretiy aleyhem velo shameu

Hebrew: וְיִרְמְיָ֜הוּ לָקַ֣ח ׀ מְגִלָּ֣ה אַחֶ֗רֶת וַֽיִּתְּנָהּ֮ אֶל־בָּר֣וּךְ בֶּן־נֵרִיָּ֘הוּ֮ הַסֹּפֵר֒ וַיִּכְתֹּ֤ב עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ מִפִּ֣י יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ אֵ֚ת כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֣י הַסֵּ֔פֶר אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׂרַ֛ף יְהוֹיָקִ֥ים מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֖ה בָּאֵ֑שׁ וְע֨וֹד נוֹסַ֧ף עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם דְּבָרִ֥ים רַבִּ֖ים כָּהֵֽמָּה׃ {פ}
Translated: So Jeremiah got another scroll and gave it to the scribe Baruch son of Neriah. And at Jeremiah’s dictation, he wrote in it the whole text of the scroll that King Jehoiakim of Judah had burned; and more of the like was added.
Transliteration: veyiremeyahu lakach megilah acheret vayitenah el-varukhe ven-neriyahu hasofer vayikhetov aleyha mifiy yiremeyahu et khׇl-diverey hasefer asher sharaf yehvoyakiym melekhe-yehudah vaesh vevod nvosaf aleyhem devariym raviym khahemah {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּ֨מְלׇךְ־מֶ֔לֶךְ צִדְקִיָּ֖הוּ בֶּן־יֹאשִׁיָּ֑הוּ תַּ֗חַת כָּנְיָ֙הוּ֙ בֶּן־יְה֣וֹיָקִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִמְלִ֛יךְ נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֥ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל בְּאֶ֥רֶץ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Zedekiah son of Josiah became king instead of Coniah son of Jehoiakim, for King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon set him up as king over the land of Judah.
Transliteration: vayimelׇkhe-melekhe tsidekiyahu ven-yoshiyahu tachat khaneyahu ven-yehvoyakiym asher himeliykhe nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel veerets yehudah

Hebrew: וְלֹ֥א שָׁמַ֛ע ה֥וּא וַעֲבָדָ֖יו וְעַ֣ם הָאָ֑רֶץ אֶל־דִּבְרֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֔ר בְּיַ֖ד יִרְמְיָ֥הוּ הַנָּבִֽיא׃
Translated: Neither he nor his courtiers nor the people of the land gave heed to the words that G<small>OD</small> spoke through the prophet Jeremiah.
Transliteration: velo shama hu vaavadayv veam haarets el-diverey yehovah asher diver veyad yiremeyahu hanaviy

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ צִדְקִיָּ֜הוּ אֶת־יְהוּכַ֣ל בֶּן־שֶׁלֶמְיָ֗ה וְאֶת־צְפַנְיָ֤הוּ בֶן־מַעֲשֵׂיָה֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן אֶל־יִרְמְיָ֥הוּ הַנָּבִ֖יא לֵאמֹ֑ר הִתְפַּלֶּל־נָ֣א בַעֲדֵ֔נוּ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: Yet King Zedekiah sent Jehucal son of Shelemiah and Zephaniah son of the priest Maaseiah to the prophet Jeremiah, to say, “Please pray on our behalf to the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God.”
Transliteration: vayishelach hamelekhe tsidekiyahu et-yehukhal ven-shelemeyah veet-tsefaneyahu ven-maasheyah hakhohen el-yiremeyahu hanaviy lemor hitefalel-na vaadenu el-yehovah eloheynu

Hebrew: וְיִרְמְיָ֕הוּ בָּ֥א וְיֹצֵ֖א בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעָ֑ם וְלֹא־נָתְנ֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ בֵּ֥ית (הכליא) [הַכְּלֽוּא]׃
Translated: (Jeremiah could still go in and out among the people, for they had not yet put him in prison.
Transliteration: veyiremeyahu va veyotse vetvokhe haam velo-natenu otvo veyt (hkhly) [hakhelu]

Hebrew: וְחֵ֥יל פַּרְעֹ֖ה יָצָ֣א מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וַיִּשְׁמְע֨וּ הַכַּשְׂדִּ֜ים הַצָּרִ֤ים עַל־יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ אֶת־שִׁמְעָ֔ם וַיֵּ֣עָל֔וּ מֵעַ֖ל יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {פ}
Translated: The army of Pharaoh had set out from Egypt; and when the Chaldeans who were besieging Jerusalem heard the report, they raised the siege of Jerusalem.)
Transliteration: vecheyl fareoh yatsa mimitserayiim vayishemeu hakhashediym hatsariym al-yerushala͏im et-shimeam vayealu meal yerushala͏im {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־יִרְמְיָ֥הוּ הַנָּבִ֖יא לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Then the word of G<small>OD</small> came to the prophet Jeremiah:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-yiremeyahu hanaviy lemor

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כֹּ֤ה תֹֽאמְרוּ֙ אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה הַשֹּׁלֵ֧חַ אֶתְכֶ֛ם אֵלַ֖י לְדׇרְשֵׁ֑נִי הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ חֵ֣יל פַּרְעֹ֗ה הַיֹּצֵ֤א לָכֶם֙ לְעֶזְרָ֔ה שָׁ֥ב לְאַרְצ֖וֹ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: Thus shall you say to the king of Judah who sent you to Me to inquire of Me: “The army of Pharaoh, which set out to help you, will return to its own land, to Egypt.
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael khoh tomeru el-melekhe yehudah hasholecha etekhem elay ledׇresheniy hineh cheyl fareoh hayotse lakhem leezerah shav learetsvo mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֙בוּ֙ הַכַּשְׂדִּ֔ים וְנִלְחֲמ֖וּ עַל־הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֑את וּלְכָדֻ֖הָ וּשְׂרָפֻ֥הָ בָאֵֽשׁ׃ {פ}
Translated: And the Chaldeans will come back and attack this city and they will capture it and destroy it by fire.”
Transliteration: veshavu hakhashediym venilechamu al-haiyr hazot ulekhaduha usherafuha vaesh {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אַל־תַּשִּׁ֤אוּ נַפְשֹֽׁתֵיכֶם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הָלֹ֛ךְ יֵלְכ֥וּ מֵעָלֵ֖ינוּ הַכַּשְׂדִּ֑ים כִּי־לֹ֖א יֵלֵֽכוּ׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Do not delude yourselves into thinking, “The Chaldeans will go away from us.” They will not.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah al-tashiu nafeshoteykhem lemor halokhe eilekhu mealeynu hakhashediym khiy-lo eilekhu

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־הִכִּיתֶ֞ם כׇּל־חֵ֤יל כַּשְׂדִּים֙ הַנִּלְחָמִ֣ים אִתְּכֶ֔ם וְנִ֨שְׁאֲרוּ־בָ֔ם אֲנָשִׁ֖ים מְדֻקָּרִ֑ים אִ֤ישׁ בְּאׇֽהֳלוֹ֙ יָק֔וּמוּ וְשָׂ֥רְפ֛וּ אֶת־הָעִ֥יר הַזֹּ֖את בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: Even if you defeated the whole army of the Chaldeans that are fighting against you, and only wounded men were left lying in their tents, they would get up and burn this city down!
Transliteration: khiy im-hikhiytem khׇl-cheyl khashediym hanilechamiym itekhem venishearu-vam anashiym medukariym iysh veׇholvo yakumu vesharefu et-haiyr hazot vaesh

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה בְּהֵעָלוֹת֙ חֵ֣יל הַכַּשְׂדִּ֔ים מֵעַ֖ל יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם מִפְּנֵ֖י חֵ֥יל פַּרְעֹֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: When the army of the Chaldeans raised the siege of Jerusalem on account of the army of Pharaoh,
Transliteration: vehayah vehealvot cheyl hakhashediym meal yerushala͏im mifeney cheyl fareoh {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֤א יִרְמְיָ֙הוּ֙ מִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם לָלֶ֖כֶת אֶ֣רֶץ בִּנְיָמִ֑ן לַחֲלִ֥ק מִשָּׁ֖ם בְּת֥וֹךְ הָעָֽם׃
Translated: Jeremiah was going to leave Jerusalem and go to the territory of Benjamin to share in some property there among the people.
Transliteration: vayetse yiremeyahu miyrushala͏im lalekhet erets vineyamin lachalik misham vetvokhe haam

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־ה֞וּא בְּשַׁ֣עַר בִּנְיָמִ֗ן וְשָׁם֙ בַּ֣עַל פְּקִדֻ֔ת וּשְׁמוֹ֙ יִרְאִיָּ֔יה בֶּן־שֶׁלֶמְיָ֖ה בֶּן־חֲנַנְיָ֑ה וַיִּתְפֹּ֞שׂ אֶֽת־יִרְמְיָ֤הוּ הַנָּבִיא֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אֶל־הַכַּשְׂדִּ֖ים אַתָּ֥ה נֹפֵֽל׃
Translated: When he got to the Benjamin Gate, there was a guard officer there named Irijah son of Shelemiah son of Hananiah; and he arrested the prophet Jeremiah, saying, “You are defecting to the Chaldeans!”
Transliteration: vayehiy-hu veshaar vineyamin vesham vaal fekidut ushemvo yireiyayh ven-shelemeyah ven-chananeyah vayitefosh et-yiremeyahu hanaviy lemor el-hakhashediym atah nofel

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יִרְמְיָ֜הוּ שֶׁ֗קֶר אֵינֶ֤נִּי נֹפֵל֙ עַל־הַכַּשְׂדִּ֔ים וְלֹ֥א שָׁמַ֖ע אֵלָ֑יו וַיִּתְפֹּ֤שׂ יִרְאִיָּיה֙ בְּיִרְמְיָ֔הוּ וַיְבִאֵ֖הוּ אֶל־הַשָּׂרִֽים׃
Translated: Jeremiah answered, “That’s a lie! I’m not defecting to the Chaldeans!” But Irijah would not listen to him; he arrested Jeremiah and brought him to the officials.
Transliteration: vayomer yiremeyahu sheker eyneniy nofel al-hakhashediym velo shama elayv vayitefosh yireiyayh veyiremeyahu vayeviehu el-hashariym

Hebrew: וַיִּקְצְפ֧וּ הַשָּׂרִ֛ים עַֽל־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ וְהִכּ֣וּ אֹת֑וֹ וְנָתְנ֨וּ אוֹת֜וֹ בֵּ֣ית הָאֵס֗וּר בֵּ֚ית יְהוֹנָתָ֣ן הַסֹּפֵ֔ר כִּי־אֹת֥וֹ עָשׂ֖וּ לְבֵ֥ית הַכֶּֽלֶא׃
Translated: The officials were furious with Jeremiah; they beat him and put him into prison, in the house of the scribe Jonathan—for it had been made into a jail.
Transliteration: vayiketsefu hashariym al-yiremeyahu vehikhu otvo venatenu votvo veyt haesur veyt yehvonatan hasofer khiy-otvo ashu leveyt hakhele

Hebrew: כִּ֣י בָ֧א יִרְמְיָ֛הוּ אֶל־בֵּ֥ית הַבּ֖וֹר וְאֶל־הַחֲנֻי֑וֹת וַיֵּשֶׁב־שָׁ֥ם יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ יָמִ֥ים רַבִּֽים׃
Translated: Thus Jeremiah came to the pit and the cells, and Jeremiah remained there a long time.
Transliteration: khiy va yiremeyahu el-veyt havvor veel-hachanuyvot vayeshev-sham yiremeyahu yamiym raviym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ צִדְקִיָּ֜הוּ וַיִּקָּחֵ֗הוּ וַיִּשְׁאָלֵ֨הוּ הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ בְּבֵיתוֹ֙ בַּסֵּ֔תֶר וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הֲיֵ֥שׁ דָּבָ֖ר מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יִרְמְיָ֙הוּ֙ יֵ֔שׁ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר בְּיַ֥ד מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל תִּנָּתֵֽן׃
Translated: Then King Zedekiah sent for him, and the king questioned him secretly in his palace. He asked, “Is there any word from G<small>OD</small>?” “There is!” Jeremiah answered, and he continued, “You will be delivered into the hands of the king of Babylon.”
Transliteration: vayishelach hamelekhe tsidekiyahu vayikachehu vayishealehu hamelekhe veveytvo vaseter vayomer haeish davar meet yehovah vayomer yiremeyahu eish vayomer veyad melekhe-vavel tinaten

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ אֶל־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ צִדְקִיָּ֑הוּ מֶה֩ חָטָ֨אתִֽי לְךָ֤ וְלַעֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ וְלָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה כִּֽי־נְתַתֶּ֥ם אוֹתִ֖י אֶל־בֵּ֥ית הַכֶּֽלֶא׃
Translated: And Jeremiah said to King Zedekiah, “What wrong have I done to you, to your courtiers, and to this people, that you have put me in jail?
Transliteration: vayomer yiremeyahu el-hamelekhe tsidekiyahu meh chatatiy lekha velaavadeykha velaam hazeh khiy-netatem votiy el-veyt hakhele

Hebrew: (ואיו) [וְאַיֵּה֙] נְבִ֣יאֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־נִבְּא֥וּ לָכֶ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר לֹא־יָבֹ֤א מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶל֙ עֲלֵיכֶ֔ם וְעַ֖ל הָאָ֥רֶץ הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: And where are those prophets of yours who prophesied to you that the king of Babylon would never move against you and against this land?
Transliteration: (vyv) [veayeh] neviyeykhem asher-niveu lakhem lemor lo-yavo melekhe-vavel aleykhem veal haarets hazot

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה שְֽׁמַֽע־נָ֖א אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ תִּפׇּל־נָ֤א תְחִנָּתִי֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ וְאַל־תְּשִׁבֵ֗נִי בֵּ֚ית יְהוֹנָתָ֣ן הַסֹּפֵ֔ר וְלֹ֥א אָמ֖וּת שָֽׁם׃
Translated: Now, please hear me, O lord king, and grant my plea: Don’t send me back to the house of the scribe Jonathan to die there.”
Transliteration: veatah shema-na adoniy hamelekhe tifׇl-na techinatiy lefaneykha veal-teshiveniy veyt yehvonatan hasofer velo amut sham

Hebrew: וַיְצַוֶּ֞ה הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ צִדְקִיָּ֗הוּ וַיַּפְקִ֣דוּ אֶֽת־יִרְמְיָ֘הוּ֮ בַּחֲצַ֣ר הַמַּטָּרָה֒ וְנָתֹן֩ ל֨וֹ כִכַּר־לֶ֤חֶם לַיּוֹם֙ מִח֣וּץ הָאֹפִ֔ים עַד־תֹּ֥ם כׇּל־הַלֶּ֖חֶם מִן־הָעִ֑יר וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ בַּחֲצַ֖ר הַמַּטָּרָֽה׃
Translated: So King Zedekiah gave instructions to lodge Jeremiah in the prison compound and to supply him daily with a loaf of bread from the Bakers’ Street—until all the bread in the city was gone. Jeremiah remained in the prison compound.
Transliteration: vayetsaveh hamelekhe tsidekiyahu vayafekidu et-yiremeyahu vachatsar hamatarah venaton lvo khikhar-lechem layyvom michuts haofiym ad-tom khׇl-halechem min-haiyr vayeshev yiremeyahu vachatsar hamatarah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֞ע שְׁפַטְיָ֣ה בֶן־מַתָּ֗ן וּגְדַלְיָ֙הוּ֙ בֶּן־פַּשְׁח֔וּר וְיוּכַל֙ בֶּן־שֶׁ֣לֶמְיָ֔הוּ וּפַשְׁח֖וּר בֶּן־מַלְכִּיָּ֑ה אֶ֨ת־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֧ר יִרְמְיָ֛הוּ מְדַבֵּ֥ר אֶל־כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Shephatiah son of Mattan, Gedaliah son of Pashhur, Jucal son of Shelemiah, and Pashhur son of Malchiah heard what Jeremiah was saying to all the people:
Transliteration: vayishema shefateyah ven-matan ugedaleyahu ven-fashechur veyukhal ven-shelemeyahu ufashechur ven-malekhiyah et-hadevariym asher yiremeyahu medaver el-khׇl-haam lemor

Hebrew: כֹּה֮ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָה֒ הַיֹּשֵׁב֙ בָּעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את יָמ֕וּת בַּחֶ֖רֶב בָּרָעָ֣ב וּבַדָּ֑בֶר וְהַיֹּצֵ֤א אֶל־הַכַּשְׂדִּים֙ (יחיה) [וְחָיָ֔ה] וְהָיְתָה־לּ֥וֹ נַפְשׁ֛וֹ לְשָׁלָ֖ל וָחָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Whoever remains in this city shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence; but whoever surrenders to the Chaldeans shall live; he shall at least gain his life and shall live.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah hayoshev vaiyr hazot yamut vacherev varaav uvadaver vehayotse el-hakhashediym (ychyh) [vechayah] vehayetah-lvo nafeshvo leshalal vachay {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה הִנָּתֹ֨ן תִּנָּתֵ֜ן הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֗את בְּיַ֛ד חֵ֥יל מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל וּלְכָדָֽהּ׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: This city shall be delivered into the hands of the king of Babylon’s army, and he shall capture it.”
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah hinaton tinaten haiyr hazot veyad cheyl melekhe-vavel ulekhadah

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ הַשָּׂרִ֜ים אֶל־הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ י֣וּמַת נָא֮ אֶת־הָאִ֣ישׁ הַזֶּה֒ כִּֽי־עַל־כֵּ֡ן הֽוּא־מְרַפֵּ֡א אֶת־יְדֵי֩ אַנְשֵׁ֨י הַמִּלְחָמָ֜ה הַֽנִּשְׁאָרִ֣ים ׀ בָּעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֗את וְאֵת֙ יְדֵ֣י כׇל־הָעָ֔ם לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם כַּדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה כִּ֣י ׀ הָאִ֣ישׁ הַזֶּ֗ה אֵינֶ֨נּוּ דֹרֵ֧שׁ לְשָׁל֛וֹם לָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה כִּ֥י אִם־לְרָעָֽה׃
Translated: Then the officials said to the king, “Let that man be put to death, for he disheartens the soldiers, and all the people who are left in this city, by speaking such things to them. That man is not seeking the welfare of this people, but their harm!”
Transliteration: vayomeru hashariym el-hamelekhe yumat na et-haiysh hazeh khiy-al-khen hu-merafe et-yedey aneshey hamilechamah hanisheariym vaiyr hazot veet yedey khׇl-haam ledaver aleyhem khadevariym haeleh khiy haiysh hazeh eynenu doresh leshalvom laam hazeh khiy im-leraah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ צִדְקִיָּ֔הוּ הִנֵּה־ה֖וּא בְּיֶדְכֶ֑ם כִּֽי־אֵ֣ין הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ יוּכַ֥ל אֶתְכֶ֖ם דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: King Zedekiah replied, “He is in your hands; the king cannot oppose you in anything!”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe tsidekiyahu hineh-hu veyedekhem khiy-eyn hamelekhe yukhal etekhem davar

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֣וּ אֶֽת־יִרְמְיָ֗הוּ וַיַּשְׁלִ֨כוּ אֹת֜וֹ אֶל־הַבּ֣וֹר ׀ מַלְכִּיָּ֣הוּ בֶן־הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ אֲשֶׁר֙ בַּחֲצַ֣ר הַמַּטָּרָ֔ה וַיְשַׁלְּח֥וּ אֶֽת־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ בַּחֲבָלִ֑ים וּבַבּ֤וֹר אֵֽין־מַ֙יִם֙ כִּ֣י אִם־טִ֔יט וַיִּטְבַּ֥ע יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ בַּטִּֽיט׃ {ס}
Translated: So they took Jeremiah and put him down in the pit of Malchiah, the king’s son, which was in the prison compound; they let Jeremiah down by ropes. There was no water in the pit, only mud, and Jeremiah sank into the mud.
Transliteration: vayikechu et-yiremeyahu vayashelikhu otvo el-havvor malekhiyahu ven-hamelekhe asher vachatsar hamatarah vayeshalechu et-yiremeyahu vachavaliym uvavvor eyn-mayiim khiy im-tiyt vayiteva yiremeyahu vatiyt {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֡ע עֶבֶד־מֶ֨לֶךְ הַכּוּשִׁ֜י אִ֣ישׁ סָרִ֗יס וְהוּא֙ בְּבֵ֣ית הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ כִּֽי־נָתְנ֥וּ אֶֽת־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ אֶל־הַבּ֑וֹר וְהַמֶּ֥לֶךְ יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּשַׁ֥עַר בִּנְיָמִֽן׃
Translated: Ebed-melech the Cushite, a eunuch who was in the king’s palace, heard that they had put Jeremiah in the pit. The king was then sitting at the Benjamin Gate;
Transliteration: vayishema eved-melekhe hakhushiy iysh sariys vehu veveyt hamelekhe khiy-natenu et-yiremeyahu el-havvor vehamelekhe yvoshev veshaar vineyamin

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א עֶבֶד־מֶ֖לֶךְ מִבֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אֶל־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: so Ebed-melech left the king’s palace, and spoke to the king:
Transliteration: vayetse eved-melekhe miveyt hamelekhe vayedaver el-hamelekhe lemor

Hebrew: אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ הֵרֵ֜עוּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֤ים הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ אֵ֣ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשׂוּ֙ לְיִרְמְיָ֣הוּ הַנָּבִ֔יא אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־הִשְׁלִ֖יכוּ אֶל־הַבּ֑וֹר וַיָּ֤מׇת תַּחְתָּיו֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י הָרָעָ֔ב כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין הַלֶּ֛חֶם ע֖וֹד בָּעִֽיר׃
Translated: “O lord king, those men have acted wickedly in all they did to the prophet Jeremiah; they have put him down in the pit, to die there of hunger.” For there was no more bread in the city.
Transliteration: adoniy hamelekhe hereu haanashiym haeleh et khׇl-asher ashu leyiremeyahu hanaviy et asher-hisheliykhu el-havvor vayamׇt tachetayv mifeney haraav khiy eyn halechem vod vaiyr

Hebrew: וַיְצַוֶּ֣ה הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֵ֛ת עֶבֶד־מֶ֥לֶךְ הַכּוּשִׁ֖י לֵאמֹ֑ר קַ֣ח בְּיָדְךָ֤ מִזֶּה֙ שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וְֽהַעֲלִ֜יתָ אֶֽת־יִרְמְיָ֧הוּ הַנָּבִ֛יא מִן־הַבּ֖וֹר בְּטֶ֥רֶם יָמֽוּת׃
Translated: Then the king instructed Ebed-melech the Cushite, “Take with you thirty men from here, and pull the prophet Jeremiah up from the pit before he dies.”
Transliteration: vayetsaveh hamelekhe et eved-melekhe hakhushiy lemor kach veyadekha mizeh sheloshiym anashiym vehaaliyta et-yiremeyahu hanaviy min-havvor veterem yamut

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח ׀ עֶבֶד־מֶ֨לֶךְ אֶת־הָאֲנָשִׁ֜ים בְּיָד֗וֹ וַיָּבֹ֤א בֵית־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֶל־תַּ֣חַת הָאוֹצָ֔ר וַיִּקַּ֤ח מִשָּׁם֙ בְּלוֹיֵ֣ (הסחבות) [סְחָב֔וֹת] וּבְלוֹיֵ֖ מְלָחִ֑ים וַיְשַׁלְּחֵ֧ם אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֛הוּ אֶל־הַבּ֖וֹר בַּחֲבָלִֽים׃
Translated: So Ebed-melech took the men with him, and went to the king’s palace, to a place below the treasury. There they got worn cloths and rags, which they let down to Jeremiah in the pit by ropes.
Transliteration: vayikach eved-melekhe et-haanashiym veyadvo vayavo veyt-hamelekhe el-tachat havotsar vayikach misham velvoei (hschvvt) [sechavvot] uvelvoei melachiym vayeshalechem el-yiremeyahu el-havvor vachavaliym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֡אמֶר עֶבֶד־מֶ֨לֶךְ הַכּוּשִׁ֜י אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֗הוּ שִׂ֣ים נָ֠א בְּלוֹאֵ֨י הַסְּחָב֤וֹת וְהַמְּלָחִים֙ תַּ֚חַת אַצִּל֣וֹת יָדֶ֔יךָ מִתַּ֖חַת לַחֲבָלִ֑ים וַיַּ֥עַשׂ יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ כֵּֽן׃
Translated: And Ebed-melech the Cushite called to Jeremiah, “Put the worn cloths and rags under your armpits, inside the ropes.” Jeremiah did so,
Transliteration: vayomer eved-melekhe hakhushiy el-yiremeyahu shiym na velvoey hasechavvot vehamelachiym tachat atsilvot yadeykha mitachat lachavaliym vayaash yiremeyahu khen

Hebrew: וַיִּמְשְׁכ֤וּ אֶֽת־יִרְמְיָ֙הוּ֙ בַּחֲבָלִ֔ים וַיַּעֲל֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ מִן־הַבּ֑וֹר וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ בַּחֲצַ֖ר הַמַּטָּרָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: and they pulled Jeremiah up by the ropes and got him out of the pit. And Jeremiah remained in the prison compound.
Transliteration: vayimeshekhu et-yiremeyahu vachavaliym vayaalu otvo min-havvor vayeshev yiremeyahu vachatsar hamatarah {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֞ח הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ צִדְקִיָּ֗הוּ וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶֽת־יִרְמְיָ֤הוּ הַנָּבִיא֙ אֵלָ֔יו אֶל־מָבוֹא֙ הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֗הוּ שֹׁאֵ֨ל אֲנִ֤י אֹֽתְךָ֙ דָּבָ֔ר אַל־תְּכַחֵ֥ד מִמֶּ֖נִּי דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: King Zedekiah sent for the prophet Jeremiah, and had him brought to him at the third entrance of the House of G<small>OD</small>. And the king said to Jeremiah, “I want to ask you something; don’t conceal anything from me.”
Transliteration: vayishelach hamelekhe tsidekiyahu vayikach et-yiremeyahu hanaviy elayv el-mavvo hasheliyshiy asher veveyt yehovah vayomer hamelekhe el-yiremeyahu shoel aniy otekha davar al-tekhached mimeniy davar

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יִרְמְיָ֙הוּ֙ אֶל־צִדְקִיָּ֔הוּ כִּ֚י אַגִּ֣יד לְךָ֔ הֲל֖וֹא הָמֵ֣ת תְּמִיתֵ֑נִי וְכִי֙ אִיעָ֣צְךָ֔ לֹ֥א תִשְׁמַ֖ע אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: Jeremiah answered the king, “If I tell you, you’ll surely kill me; and if I give you advice, you won’t listen to me.”
Transliteration: vayomer yiremeyahu el-tsidekiyahu khiy agiyd lekha halvo hamet temiyteniy vekhiy iyatsekha lo tishema elay

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׁבַ֞ע הַמֶּ֧לֶךְ צִדְקִיָּ֛הוּ אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ בַּסֵּ֣תֶר לֵאמֹ֑ר חַי־יְהֹוָ֞ה (את) אֲשֶׁר֩ עָשָׂה־לָ֨נוּ אֶת־הַנֶּ֤פֶשׁ הַזֹּאת֙ אִם־אֲמִיתֶ֔ךָ וְאִם־אֶתֶּנְךָ֗ בְּיַד֙ הָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֥ר מְבַקְשִׁ֖ים אֶת־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: Thereupon King Zedekiah secretly promised Jeremiah on oath: “As G<small>OD</small> lives who has given us this life, I will not put you to death or leave you in the hands of those who seek your life.”
Transliteration: vayishava hamelekhe tsidekiyahu el-yiremeyahu vaseter lemor chay-yehovah (t) asher ashah-lanu et-hanefesh hazot im-amiytekha veim-etenekha veyad haanashiym haeleh asher mevakeshiym et-nafeshekha {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יִרְמְיָ֣הוּ אֶל־צִדְקִיָּ֡הוּ {ס} כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָה֩ אֱלֹהֵ֨י צְבָא֜וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אִם־יָצֹ֨א תֵצֵ֜א אֶל־שָׂרֵ֤י מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶל֙ וְחָיְתָ֣ה נַפְשֶׁ֔ךָ וְהָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את לֹ֥א תִשָּׂרֵ֖ף בָּאֵ֑שׁ וְחָיִ֖תָה אַתָּ֥ה וּבֵיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, “Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Hosts, the God of Israel: If you surrender to the officers of the king of Babylon, your life will be spared and this city will not be burned down. You and your household will live.
Transliteration: vayomer yiremeyahu el-tsidekiyahu {s} khoh-amar yehovah elohey tsevavot elohey yisherael im-yatso tetse el-sharey melekhe-vavel vechayetah nafeshekha vehaiyr hazot lo tisharef vaesh vechayitah atah uveytekha

Hebrew: וְאִ֣ם לֹֽא־תֵצֵ֗א אֶל־שָׂרֵי֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֔ל וְנִתְּנָ֞ה הָעִ֤יר הַזֹּאת֙ בְּיַ֣ד הַכַּשְׂדִּ֔ים וּשְׂרָפ֖וּהָ בָּאֵ֑שׁ וְאַתָּ֖ה לֹא־תִמָּלֵ֥ט מִיָּדָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: But if you do not surrender to the officers of the king of Babylon, this city will be delivered into the hands of the Chaldeans, who will burn it down; and you will not escape from them.”
Transliteration: veim lo-tetse el-sharey melekhe vavel venitenah haiyr hazot veyad hakhashediym usherafuha vaesh veatah lo-timalet miyadam {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ צִדְקִיָּ֖הוּ אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֑הוּ אֲנִ֧י דֹאֵ֣ג אֶת־הַיְּהוּדִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָֽפְלוּ֙ אֶל־הַכַּשְׂדִּ֔ים פֶּֽן־יִתְּנ֥וּ אֹתִ֛י בְּיָדָ֖ם וְהִתְעַלְּלוּ־בִֽי׃
Translated: King Zedekiah said to Jeremiah, “I am worried about the Judeans who have defected to the Chaldeans; that they [the Chaldeans] might hand me over to them to abuse me.”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe tsidekiyahu el-yiremeyahu aniy doeg et-hayehudiym asher nafelu el-hakhashediym fen-yitenu otiy veyadam vehitealelu-viy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ לֹ֣א יִתֵּ֑נוּ שְֽׁמַֽע־נָ֣א ׀ בְּק֣וֹל יְהֹוָ֗ה לַאֲשֶׁ֤ר אֲנִי֙ דֹּבֵ֣ר אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְיִ֥יטַב לְךָ֖ וּתְחִ֥י נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated: “They will not hand you over,” Jeremiah replied. “Listen to G<small>OD</small>’s voice, to what I tell you, that it may go well with you and your life be spared.
Transliteration: vayomer yiremeyahu lo yitenu shema-na vekvol yehovah laasher aniy dover eleykha veyiytav lekha utechiy nafeshekha

Hebrew: וְאִם־מָאֵ֥ן אַתָּ֖ה לָצֵ֑את זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִרְאַ֖נִי יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: For this is what G<small>OD</small> has shown me if you refuse to surrender:
Transliteration: veim-maen atah latset zeh hadavar asher hireaniy yehovah

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה כׇל־הַנָּשִׁ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר נִשְׁאֲרוּ֙ בְּבֵ֣ית מֶֽלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֔ה מוּצָא֕וֹת אֶל־שָׂרֵ֖י מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֑ל וְהֵ֣נָּה אֹמְרֹ֗ת הִסִּית֜וּךָ וְיָכְל֤וּ לְךָ֙ אַנְשֵׁ֣י שְׁלֹמֶ֔ךָ הׇטְבְּע֥וּ בַבֹּ֛ץ רַגְלֶ֖ךָ נָסֹ֥גוּ אָחֽוֹר׃
Translated:
All the women who are left in the palace of the king of Judah shall be brought out to the officers of the king of Babylon; and they shall say:
Those who were your friends
Have seduced you and vanquished you.
Now that your feet are sunk in the mire,
They have turned their backs [on you].
Transliteration: vehineh khׇl-hanashiym asher nishearu veveyt melekhe-yehudah mutsavot el-sharey melekhe vavel vehenah omerot hisiytukha veyakhelu lekha aneshey shelomekha hׇteveu vavots ragelekha nasogu achvor

Hebrew: וְאֶת־כׇּל־נָשֶׁ֣יךָ וְאֶת־בָּנֶ֗יךָ מֽוֹצִאִים֙ אֶל־הַכַּשְׂדִּ֔ים וְאַתָּ֖ה לֹא־תִמָּלֵ֣ט מִיָּדָ֑ם כִּ֣י בְיַ֤ד מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶל֙ תִּתָּפֵ֔שׂ וְאֶת־הָעִ֥יר הַזֹּ֖את תִּשְׂרֹ֥ף בָּאֵֽשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated: They will bring out all your wives and children to the Chaldeans, and you yourself will not escape from them. You will be captured by the king of Babylon, and this city shall be burned down.”
Transliteration: veet-khׇl-nasheykha veet-vaneykha mvotsiiym el-hakhashediym veatah lo-timalet miyadam khiy veyad melekhe-vavel titafesh veet-haiyr hazot tisherof vaesh {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר צִדְקִיָּ֜הוּ אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֗הוּ אִ֛ישׁ אַל־יֵדַ֥ע בַּדְּבָֽרִים־הָאֵ֖לֶּה וְלֹ֥א תָמֽוּת׃
Translated: Zedekiah said to Jeremiah, “Don’t let a soul know about this conversation, or you will die.
Transliteration: vayomer tsidekiyahu el-yiremeyahu iysh al-eida vadevariym-haeleh velo tamut

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִשְׁמְע֣וּ הַשָּׂרִים֮ כִּי־דִבַּ֣רְתִּי אִתָּךְ֒ וּבָ֣אוּ אֵלֶ֣יךָ וְֽאָמְר֪וּ אֵלֶ֟יךָ הַגִּידָה־נָּ֨א לָ֜נוּ מַה־דִּבַּ֧רְתָּ אֶל־הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ אַל־תְּכַחֵ֥ד מִמֶּ֖נּוּ וְלֹ֣א נְמִיתֶ֑ךָ וּמַה־דִּבֶּ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יךָ הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: If the officials should hear that I have spoken with you, and they should come and say to you, ‘Tell us what you said to the king; hide nothing from us, or we’ll kill you. And what did the king say to you?’
Transliteration: vekhiy-yishemeu hashariym khiy-divaretiy itakhe uvau eleykha veameru eleykha hagiydah-na lanu mah-divareta el-hamelekhe al-tekhached mimenu velo nemiytekha umah-diver eleykha hamelekhe

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם מַפִּיל־אֲנִ֥י תְחִנָּתִ֖י לִפְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ לְבִלְתִּ֧י הֲשִׁיבֵ֛נִי בֵּ֥ית יְהוֹנָתָ֖ן לָמ֥וּת שָֽׁם׃ {פ}
Translated: say to them, ‘I was presenting my petition to the king not to send me back to the house of Jonathan to die there.’”
Transliteration: veamareta aleyhem mafiyl-aniy techinatiy lifeney hamelekhe leviletiy hashiyveniy veyt yehvonatan lamut sham {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨אוּ כׇל־הַשָּׂרִ֤ים אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֙הוּ֙ וַיִּשְׁאֲל֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ וַיַּגֵּ֤ד לָהֶם֙ כְּכׇל־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֖ה הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיַּחֲרִ֣שׁוּ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ כִּ֥י לֹֽא־נִשְׁמַ֖ע הַדָּבָֽר׃
Translated: All the officials did come to Jeremiah to question him; and he replied to them just as the king had instructed him. So they stopped questioning him, for the conversation had not been overheard.
Transliteration: vayavou khׇl-hashariym el-yiremeyahu vayishealu otvo vayaged lahem khekhׇl-hadevariym haeleh asher tsivah hamelekhe vayacharishu mimenu khiy lo-nishema hadavar

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֤שֶׁב יִרְמְיָ֙הוּ֙ בַּחֲצַ֣ר הַמַּטָּרָ֔ה עַד־י֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־נִלְכְּדָ֣ה יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם {ס} וְהָיָ֕ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר נִלְכְּדָ֖ה יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated:
Jeremiah remained in the prison compound until the day Jerusalem was captured.
When Jerusalem was captured…
Transliteration: vayeshev yiremeyahu vachatsar hamatarah ad-yvom asher-nilekhedah yerushala͏im {s} vehayah khaasher nilekhedah yerushala͏im

Hebrew: בַּשָּׁנָ֣ה הַ֠תְּשִׁעִ֠ית לְצִדְקִיָּ֨הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֜ה בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָעֲשִׂרִ֗י בָּ֠א נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֨ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֤ל וְכׇל־חֵילוֹ֙ אֶל־יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וַיָּצֻ֖רוּ עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: In the ninth year of King Zedekiah of Judah, in the tenth month, King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon moved against Jerusalem with his whole army, and they laid siege to it.
Transliteration: vashanah hateshiiyt letsidekiyahu melekhe-yehudah vachodesh haashiriy va nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel vekhׇl-cheylvo el-yerushala͏im vayatsuru aleyha

Hebrew: בְּעַשְׁתֵּֽי־עֶשְׂרֵ֤ה שָׁנָה֙ לְצִדְקִיָּ֔הוּ בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ הָרְבִיעִ֖י בְּתִשְׁעָ֣ה לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ הׇבְקְעָ֖ה הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: And in the eleventh year of Zedekiah, on the ninth day of the fourth month, the [walls of] the city were breached.
Transliteration: veashetey-eshereh shanah letsidekiyahu vachodesh hareviyiy vetisheah lachodesh hׇvekeah haiyr

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֗אוּ כֹּ֚ל שָׂרֵ֣י מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֔ל וַיֵּשְׁב֖וּ בְּשַׁ֣עַר הַתָּ֑וֶךְ נֵרְגַ֣ל שַׂ֠רְאֶ֠צֶר סַֽמְגַּר־נְב֞וּ שַׂר־סְכִ֣ים רַב־סָרִ֗יס נֵרְגַ֤ל שַׂרְאֶ֙צֶר֙ רַב־מָ֔ג וְכׇ֨ל־שְׁאֵרִ֔ית שָׂרֵ֖י מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: All the officers of the king of Babylon entered, and took up quarters at the middle gate—Nergal-sarezer, Samgar-nebo, Sarsechim the Rab-saris, Nergal-sarezer the Rab-mag, and all the rest of the officers of the king of Babylon.
Transliteration: vayavou khol sharey melekhe-vavel vayeshevu veshaar hatavekhe neregal shareetser samegar-nevu shar-sekhiym rav-sariys neregal shareetser rav-mag vekhׇl-sheeriyt sharey melekhe vavel

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֡י כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר רָ֠אָ֠ם צִדְקִיָּ֨הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֜ה וְכֹ֣ל ׀ אַנְשֵׁ֣י הַמִּלְחָמָ֗ה וַֽ֠יִּבְרְח֠וּ וַיֵּצְא֨וּ לַ֤יְלָה מִן־הָעִיר֙ דֶּ֚רֶךְ גַּ֣ן הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ בְּשַׁ֖עַר בֵּ֣ין הַחֹמֹתָ֑יִם וַיֵּצֵ֖א דֶּ֥רֶךְ הָעֲרָבָֽה׃
Translated: When King Zedekiah of Judah saw them, he and all the soldiers fled. They left the city at night, by way of the king’s garden, through the gate between the double walls; and he set out toward the Arabah.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher raam tsidekiyahu melekhe-yehudah vekhol aneshey hamilechamah vayiverechu vayetseu layelah min-haiyr derekhe gan hamelekhe veshaar veyn hachomotayiim vayetse derekhe haaravah

Hebrew: וַיִּרְדְּפ֨וּ חֵיל־כַּשְׂדִּ֜ים אַחֲרֵיהֶ֗ם וַיַּשִּׂ֣גוּ אֶת־צִדְקִיָּ֘הוּ֮ בְּעַֽרְב֣וֹת יְרֵחוֹ֒ וַיִּקְח֣וּ אוֹת֗וֹ וַֽ֠יַּעֲלֻ֠הוּ אֶל־נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֧ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֛ל רִבְלָ֖תָה בְּאֶ֣רֶץ חֲמָ֑ת וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ מִשְׁפָּטִֽים׃
Translated: But the Chaldean troops pursued them, and they overtook Zedekiah in the steppes of Jericho. They captured him and brought him before King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon at Riblah in the region of Hamath; and he put him on trial.
Transliteration: vayiredefu cheyl-khashediym achareyhem vayashigu et-tsidekiyahu vearevvot yerechvo vayikechu votvo vayaaluhu el-nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel rivelatah veerets chamat vayedaver itvo mishefatiym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁחַט֩ מֶ֨לֶךְ בָּבֶ֜ל אֶת־בְּנֵ֧י צִדְקִיָּ֛הוּ בְּרִבְלָ֖ה לְעֵינָ֑יו וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־חֹרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה שָׁחַ֖ט מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: The king of Babylon had Zedekiah’s sons slaughtered at Riblah before his eyes; the king of Babylon had all the nobles of Judah slaughtered.
Transliteration: vayishechat melekhe vavel et-veney tsidekiyahu verivelah leeynayv veet khׇl-chorey yehudah shachat melekhe vavel

Hebrew: וְאֶת־עֵינֵ֥י צִדְקִיָּ֖הוּ עִוֵּ֑ר וַיַּאַסְרֵ֙הוּ֙ בַּֽנְחֻשְׁתַּ֔יִם לָבִ֥יא אֹת֖וֹ בָּבֶֽלָה׃
Translated: Then the eyes of Zedekiah were put out and he was chained in bronze fetters, that he might be brought to Babylon.
Transliteration: veet-eyney tsidekiyahu iver vayaaserehu vanechushetayiim laviy otvo vavelah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בֵּ֤ית הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ וְאֶת־בֵּ֣ית הָעָ֔ם שָׂרְפ֥וּ הַכַּשְׂדִּ֖ים בָּאֵ֑שׁ וְאֶת־חֹמ֥וֹת יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם נָתָֽצוּ׃
Translated: The Chaldeans burned down the king’s palace and the houses of the people by fire, and they tore down the walls of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: veet-veyt hamelekhe veet-veyt haam sharefu hakhashediym vaesh veet-chomvot yerushala͏im natatsu

Hebrew: וְאֵת֩ יֶ֨תֶר הָעָ֜ם הַנִּשְׁאָרִ֣ים בָּעִ֗יר וְאֶת־הַנֹּֽפְלִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָפְל֣וּ עָלָ֔יו וְאֵ֛ת יֶ֥תֶר הָעָ֖ם הַנִּשְׁאָרִ֑ים הֶגְלָ֛ה נְבוּזַרְאֲדָ֥ן רַב־טַבָּחִ֖ים בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: The remnant of the people that was left in the city, and the defectors who had gone over to him—the remnant of the people that was left—were exiled by Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, to Babylon.
Transliteration: veet yeter haam hanisheariym vaiyr veet-hanofeliym asher nafelu alayv veet yeter haam hanisheariym hegelah nevuzareadan rav-tavachiym vavel

Hebrew: וּמִן־הָעָ֣ם הַדַּלִּ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֵין־לָהֶם֙ מְא֔וּמָה הִשְׁאִ֛יר נְבוּזַרְאֲדָ֥ן רַב־טַבָּחִ֖ים בְּאֶ֣רֶץ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיִּתֵּ֥ן לָהֶ֛ם כְּרָמִ֥ים וִיגֵבִ֖ים בַּיּ֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
Translated: But some of the poorest people who owned nothing were left in the land of Judah by Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, and he gave them vineyards and fields at that time.
Transliteration: umin-haam hadaliym asher eyn-lahem meumah hisheiyr nevuzareadan rav-tavachiym veerets yehudah vayiten lahem kheramiym viygeviym vayyvom hahu

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֛ו נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֥ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל עַֽל־יִרְמְיָ֑הוּ בְּיַ֛ד נְבוּזַרְאֲדָ֥ן רַב־טַבָּחִ֖ים לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon had given orders to Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, concerning Jeremiah:
Transliteration: vayetsav nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel al-yiremeyahu veyad nevuzareadan rav-tavachiym lemor

Hebrew: קָחֶ֗נּוּ וְעֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ שִׂ֣ים עָלָ֔יו וְאַל־תַּ֥עַשׂ ל֖וֹ מְא֣וּמָה רָּ֑ע כִּ֗י (אם) כַּֽאֲשֶׁר֙ יְדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלֶ֔יךָ כֵּ֖ן עֲשֵׂ֥ה עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: “Take him and look after him; do him no harm, but grant whatever he asks of you.”
Transliteration: kachenu veeyneykha shiym alayv veal-taash lvo meumah ra khiy (m) khaasher yedaver eleykha khen asheh imvo

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֞ח נְבוּזַרְאֲדָ֣ן רַב־טַבָּחִ֗ים וּנְבֽוּשַׁזְבָּ<small>ן֙</small> רַב־סָרִ֔יס וְנֵרְגַ֥ל שַׂרְאֶ֖צֶר רַב־מָ֑ג וְכֹ֖ל רַבֵּ֥י מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: So Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, and Nebushazban the Rab-saris, and Nergal-sarezer the Rab-mag, and all the commanders of the king of Babylon sent
Transliteration: vayishelach nevuzareadan rav-tavachiym unevushazeva<small>n</small> rav-sariys veneregal shareetser rav-mag vekhol ravey melekhe-vavel

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלְחוּ֩ וַיִּקְח֨וּ אֶֽת־יִרְמְיָ֜הוּ מֵחֲצַ֣ר הַמַּטָּרָ֗ה וַיִּתְּנ֤וּ אֹתוֹ֙ אֶל־גְּדַלְיָ֙הוּ֙ בֶּן־אֲחִיקָ֣ם בֶּן־שָׁפָ֔ן לְהוֹצִאֵ֖הוּ אֶל־הַבָּ֑יִת וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב בְּת֥וֹךְ הָעָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: and had Jeremiah brought from the prison compound. They committed him to the care of Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan, that he might be left at liberty in a house. So he dwelt among the people.
Transliteration: vayishelechu vayikechu et-yiremeyahu mechatsar hamatarah vayitenu otvo el-gedaleyahu ven-achiykam ven-shafan lehvotsiehu el-havayiit vayeshev vetvokhe haam {s}

Hebrew: וְאֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ הָיָ֣ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֑ה בִּֽהְיֹת֣וֹ עָצ֔וּר בַּחֲצַ֥ר הַמַּטָּרָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> had come to Jeremiah while he was still confined in the prison compound:
Transliteration: veel-yiremeyahu hayah devar-yehovah viheyotvo atsur vachatsar hamatarah lemor

Hebrew: הָל֣וֹךְ וְאָמַרְתָּ֡ לְעֶבֶד־מֶ֨לֶךְ הַכּוּשִׁ֜י לֵאמֹ֗ר כֹּֽה־אָמַ֞ר יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הִנְנִי֩ מֵבִ֨י אֶת־דְּבָרַ֜י אֶל־הָעִ֥יר הַזֹּ֛את לְרָעָ֖ה וְלֹ֣א לְטוֹבָ֑ה וְהָי֥וּ לְפָנֶ֖יךָ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
Translated: Go and say to Ebed-melech the Cushite: “Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to fulfill My words concerning this city—for disaster, not for good—and they shall come true on that day in your presence.
Transliteration: halvokhe veamareta leeved-melekhe hakhushiy lemor khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael hineniy meviy et-devaray el-haiyr hazot leraah velo letvovah vehayu lefaneykha vayyvom hahu

Hebrew: וְהִצַּלְתִּ֥יךָ בַיּוֹם־הַה֖וּא נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹ֤א תִנָּתֵן֙ בְּיַ֣ד הָאֲנָשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה יָג֖וֹר מִפְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: But I will save you on that day—declares G<small>OD</small>; you shall not be delivered into the hands of those you dread.
Transliteration: vehitsaletiykha vayyvom-hahu neum-yehovah velo tinaten veyad haanashiym asher-atah yagvor mifeneyhem

Hebrew: כִּ֤י מַלֵּט֙ אֲמַלֶּטְךָ֔ וּבַחֶ֖רֶב לֹ֣א תִפֹּ֑ל וְהָיְתָ֨ה לְךָ֤ נַפְשְׁךָ֙ לְשָׁלָ֔ל כִּֽי־בָטַ֥חְתָּ בִּ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: I will rescue you, and you shall not fall by the sword. You shall escape with your life, because you trusted Me—declares G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: khiy malet amaletekha uvacherev lo tifol vehayetah lekha nafeshekha leshalal khiy-vatacheta viy neum-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: הַדָּבָ֞ר אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֤ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֙הוּ֙ מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה אַחַ֣ר ׀ שַׁלַּ֣ח אֹת֗וֹ נְבוּזַרְאֲדָ֛ן רַב־טַבָּחִ֖ים מִן־הָרָמָ֑ה בְּקַחְתּ֣וֹ אֹת֗וֹ וְהֽוּא־אָס֤וּר בָּֽאזִקִּים֙ בְּת֨וֹךְ כׇּל־גָּל֤וּת יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ וִֽיהוּדָ֔ה הַמֻּגְלִ֖ים בָּבֶֽלָה׃
Translated: The word that came to Jeremiah from G<small>OD</small>, after Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, set him free at Ramah, to which he had taken him, chained in fetters, among those from Jerusalem and Judah who were being exiled to Babylon.
Transliteration: hadavar asher-hayah el-yiremeyahu meet yehovah achar shalach otvo nevuzareadan rav-tavachiym min-haramah vekachetvo otvo vehu-asur vazikiym vetvokhe khׇl-galut yerushala͏im viyhudah hamugeliym vavelah

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֥ח רַב־טַבָּחִ֖ים לְיִרְמְיָ֑הוּ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ דִּבֶּר֙ אֶת־הָרָעָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: The chief of the guards took charge of Jeremiah, and he said to him, “The E<small>TERNAL</small> your God threatened this place with this disaster;
Transliteration: vayikach rav-tavachiym leyiremeyahu vayomer elayv yehovah eloheykha diver et-haraah hazot el-hamakvom hazeh

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֥א וַיַּ֛עַשׂ יְהֹוָ֖ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֵּ֑ר כִּֽי־חֲטָאתֶ֤ם לַֽיהֹוָה֙ וְלֹא־שְׁמַעְתֶּ֣ם בְּקוֹל֔וֹ וְהָיָ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם (דבר) [הַדָּבָ֥ר] הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: and now G<small>OD</small> has brought it about, by acting on the threat—because you sinned against G<small>OD</small> and did not pay heed. That is why this has happened to you.
Transliteration: vayave vayaash yehovah khaasher diver khiy-chatatem layhovah velo-shemaetem vekvolvo vehayah lakhem (dvr) [hadavar] hazeh

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֞ה הִנֵּ֧ה פִתַּחְתִּ֣יךָ הַיּ֗וֹם מִֽן־הָאזִקִּים֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־יָדֶ֒ךָ֒ אִם־ט֨וֹב בְּעֵינֶ֜יךָ לָב֧וֹא אִתִּ֣י בָבֶ֗ל בֹּ֚א וְאָשִׂ֤ים אֶת־עֵינִי֙ עָלֶ֔יךָ וְאִם־רַ֧ע בְּעֵינֶ֛יךָ לָבֽוֹא־אִתִּ֥י בָבֶ֖ל חֲדָ֑ל רְאֵה֙ כׇּל־הָאָ֣רֶץ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ אֶל־ט֨וֹב וְאֶל־הַיָּשָׁ֧ר בְּעֵינֶ֛יךָ לָלֶ֥כֶת שָׁ֖מָּה לֵֽךְ׃
Translated: Now, I release you this day from the fetters that were on your hands. If you would like to go with me to Babylon, come, and I will look after you. And if you don’t want to come with me to Babylon, you need not. See, the whole land is before you: go wherever seems good and right to you.”—
Transliteration: veatah hineh fitachetiykha hayyvom min-hazikiym asher al-yadekha im-tvov veeyneykha lavvo itiy vavel vo veashiym et-eyniy aleykha veim-ra veeyneykha lavvo-itiy vavel chadal reeh khׇl-haarets lefaneykha el-tvov veel-hayashar veeyneykha lalekhet shamah lekhe

Hebrew: וְעוֹדֶ֣נּוּ לֹֽא־יָשׁ֗וּב וְשֻׁ֡בָה אֶל־גְּדַלְיָ֣ה בֶן־אֲחִיקָ֣ם בֶּן־שָׁפָ֡ן אֲשֶׁר֩ הִפְקִ֨יד מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֜ל בְּעָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֗ה וְשֵׁ֤ב אִתּוֹ֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעָ֔ם א֠וֹ אֶל־כׇּל־הַיָּשָׁ֧ר בְּעֵינֶ֛יךָ לָלֶ֖כֶת לֵ֑ךְ וַיִּתֶּן־ל֧וֹ רַב־טַבָּחִ֛ים אֲרֻחָ֥ה וּמַשְׂאֵ֖ת וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
But [Jeremiah] still did not turn back.—“Or go to Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon has put in charge of the towns of Judah, and stay with him among the people, or go wherever you want to go.”
The chief of the guards gave him an allowance of food, and dismissed him.
Transliteration: vevodenu lo-yashuv veshuvah el-gedaleyah ven-achiykam ven-shafan asher hifekiyd melekhe-vavel vearey yehudah veshev itvo vetvokhe haam vo el-khׇl-hayashar veeyneykha lalekhet lekhe vayiten-lvo rav-tavachiym aruchah umasheet vayeshalechehu

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֧א יִרְמְיָ֛הוּ אֶל־גְּדַלְיָ֥ה בֶן־אֲחִיקָ֖ם הַמִּצְפָּ֑תָה וַיֵּ֤שֶׁב אִתּוֹ֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעָ֔ם הַנִּשְׁאָרִ֖ים בָּאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated: So Jeremiah came to Gedaliah son of Ahikam at Mizpah, and stayed with him among the people who were left in the land.
Transliteration: vayavo yiremeyahu el-gedaleyah ven-achiykam hamitsefatah vayeshev itvo vetvokhe haam hanisheariym vaarets {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמְעוּ֩ כׇל־שָׂרֵ֨י הַחֲיָלִ֜ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֗ה הֵ֚מָּה וְאַנְשֵׁיהֶ֔ם כִּֽי־הִפְקִ֧יד מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֛ל אֶת־גְּדַלְיָ֥הוּ בֶן־אֲחִיקָ֖ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ וְכִ֣י ׀ הִפְקִ֣יד אִתּ֗וֹ אֲנָשִׁ֤ים וְנָשִׁים֙ וָטָ֔ף וּמִדַּלַּ֣ת הָאָ֔רֶץ מֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־הׇגְל֖וּ בָּבֶֽלָה׃
Translated: The army officers in the open country, and their men with them, heard that the king of Babylon had put Gedaliah son of Ahikam in charge of the region, and that he had put in his charge the men, women, and children—of the poorest in the land—those who had not been exiled to Babylon.
Transliteration: vayishemeu khׇl-sharey hachayaliym asher vashadeh hemah veanesheyhem khiy-hifekiyd melekhe-vavel et-gedaleyahu ven-achiykam vaarets vekhiy hifekiyd itvo anashiym venashiym vataf umidalat haarets measher lo-hׇgelu vavelah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ אֶל־גְּדַלְיָ֖ה הַמִּצְפָּ֑תָה וְיִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל בֶּן־נְתַנְיָ֡הוּ וְיוֹחָנָ֣ן וְיוֹנָתָ֣ן בְּנֵֽי־קָ֠רֵ֠חַ וּשְׂרָיָ֨ה בֶן־תַּנְחֻ֜מֶת וּבְנֵ֣י ׀ (עופי) [עֵיפַ֣י] הַנְּטֹפָתִ֗י וִֽיזַנְיָ֙הוּ֙ בֶּן־הַמַּ֣עֲכָתִ֔י הֵ֖מָּה וְאַנְשֵׁיהֶֽם׃
Translated: So they with their men came to Gedaliah at Mizpah—Ishmael son of Nethaniah; Johanan and Jonathan the sons of Kareah; Seraiah son of Tanhumeth; the sons of Ephai the Netophathite; and Jezaniah son of the Maacathite.
Transliteration: vayavou el-gedaleyah hamitsefatah veyishemael ven-netaneyahu veyvochanan veyvonatan veney-karecha usherayah ven-tanechumet uveney (vfy) [eyfay] hanetofatiy viyzaneyahu ven-hamaakhatiy hemah veanesheyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׁבַ֨ע לָהֶ֜ם גְּדַלְיָ֨הוּ בֶן־אֲחִיקָ֤ם בֶּן־שָׁפָן֙ וּלְאַנְשֵׁיהֶ֣ם לֵאמֹ֔ר אַל־תִּֽירְא֖וּ מֵעֲב֣וֹד הַכַּשְׂדִּ֑ים שְׁב֣וּ בָאָ֗רֶץ וְעִבְד֛וּ אֶת־מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶ֖ל וְיִיטַ֥ב לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan reassured them and their men, saying, “Do not be afraid to serve the Chaldeans. Stay in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and it will go well with you.
Transliteration: vayishava lahem gedaleyahu ven-achiykam ven-shafan uleanesheyhem lemor al-tiyreu meavvod hakhashediym shevu vaarets veivedu et-melekhe vavel veyiytav lakhem

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י הִנְנִ֤י יֹשֵׁב֙ בַּמִּצְפָּ֔ה לַֽעֲמֹד֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַכַּשְׂדִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָבֹ֖אוּ אֵלֵ֑ינוּ וְאַתֶּ֡ם אִסְפוּ֩ יַ֨יִן וְקַ֜יִץ וְשֶׁ֗מֶן וְשִׂ֙מוּ֙ בִּכְלֵיכֶ֔ם וּשְׁב֖וּ בְּעָרֵיכֶ֥ם אֲשֶׁר־תְּפַשְׂתֶּֽם׃
Translated: I am going to stay in Mizpah to attend upon the Chaldeans who will come to us. But you may gather wine and figs and oil and put them in your own vessels, and settle in the towns you have occupied.”
Transliteration: vaaniy hineniy yoshev vamitsefah laamod lifeney hakhashediym asher yavou eleynu veatem isefu yayiin vekayiits veshemen veshimu vikheleykhem ushevu veareykhem asher-tefashetem

Hebrew: וְגַ֣ם כׇּֽל־הַיְּהוּדִ֡ים אֲשֶׁר־בְּמוֹאָ֣ב ׀ וּבִבְנֵֽי־עַמּ֨וֹן וּבֶאֱד֜וֹם וַאֲשֶׁ֤ר בְּכׇל־הָֽאֲרָצוֹת֙ שָֽׁמְע֔וּ כִּֽי־נָתַ֧ן מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֛ל שְׁאֵרִ֖ית לִיהוּדָ֑ה וְכִי֙ הִפְקִ֣יד עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם אֶת־גְּדַלְיָ֖הוּ בֶּן־אֲחִיקָ֥ם בֶּן־שָׁפָֽן׃
Translated: Likewise, all the Judeans who were in Moab, Ammon, and Edom, or who were in other lands, heard that the king of Babylon had let a remnant stay in Judah, and that he had put Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan in charge of them.
Transliteration: vegam khׇl-hayehudiym asher-vemvoav uviveney-amvon uveedvom vaasher vekhׇl-haaratsvot shameu khiy-natan melekhe-vavel sheeriyt liyhudah vekhiy hifekiyd aleyhem et-gedaleyahu ven-achiykam ven-shafan

Hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֣בוּ כׇל־הַיְּהוּדִ֗ים מִכׇּל־הַמְּקֹמוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִדְּחוּ־שָׁ֔ם וַיָּבֹ֧אוּ אֶרֶץ־יְהוּדָ֛ה אֶל־גְּדַלְיָ֖הוּ הַמִּצְפָּ֑תָה וַיַּאַסְפ֛וּ יַ֥יִן וָקַ֖יִץ הַרְבֵּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃ {ס}
Translated: All these Judeans returned from all the places to which they had scattered. They came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah at Mizpah, and they gathered large quantities of wine and figs.
Transliteration: vayashuvu khׇl-hayehudiym mikhׇl-hamekomvot asher nidechu-sham vayavou erets-yehudah el-gedaleyahu hamitsefatah vayaasefu yayiin vakayiits hareveh meod {s}

Hebrew: וְיֽוֹחָנָן֙ בֶּן־קָרֵ֔חַ וְכׇל־שָׂרֵ֥י הַחֲיָלִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה בָּ֥אוּ אֶל־גְּדַלְיָ֖הוּ הַמִּצְפָּֽתָה׃
Translated: Johanan son of Kareah, and all the army officers in the open country, came to Gedaliah at Mizpah
Transliteration: veyvochanan ven-karecha vekhׇl-sharey hachayaliym asher vashadeh vau el-gedaleyahu hamitsefatah

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו הֲיָדֹ֤עַ תֵּדַע֙ כִּ֞י בַּעֲלִ֣יס ׀ מֶ֣לֶךְ בְּנֵֽי־עַמּ֗וֹן שָׁלַח֙ אֶת־יִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל בֶּן־נְתַנְיָ֔ה לְהַכֹּתְךָ֖ נָ֑פֶשׁ וְלֹא־הֶאֱמִ֣ין לָהֶ֔ם גְּדַלְיָ֖הוּ בֶּן־אֲחִיקָֽם׃
Translated: and said to him, “Do you know that King Baalis of Ammon has sent Ishmael son of Nethaniah to kill you?” But Gedaliah son of Ahikam would not believe them.
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv hayadoa teda khiy vaaliys melekhe veney-amvon shalach et-yishemael ven-netaneyah lehakhotekha nafesh velo-heemiyn lahem gedaleyahu ven-achiykam

Hebrew: וְיוֹחָנָ֣ן בֶּן־קָרֵ֡חַ אָמַ֣ר אֶל־גְּדַלְיָהוּ֩ בַסֵּ֨תֶר בַּמִּצְפָּ֜ה לֵאמֹ֗ר אֵ֤לְכָה נָּא֙ וְאַכֶּה֙ אֶת־יִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל בֶּן־נְתַנְיָ֔ה וְאִ֖ישׁ לֹ֣א יֵדָ֑ע לָ֧מָּה יַכֶּ֣כָּה נֶּ֗פֶשׁ וְנָפֹ֙צוּ֙ כׇּל־יְהוּדָה֙ הַנִּקְבָּצִ֣ים אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְאָבְדָ֖ה שְׁאֵרִ֥ית יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Johanan son of Kareah also said secretly to Gedaliah at Mizpah, “Let me go and strike down Ishmael son of Nethaniah—and nobody else will know about it; otherwise he will kill you, and all the Judeans who have gathered about you will be dispersed, and the remnant of Judah will perish!”
Transliteration: veyvochanan ven-karecha amar el-gedaleyahu vaseter vamitsefah lemor elekhah na veakheh et-yishemael ven-netaneyah veiysh lo eida lamah yakhekhah nefesh venafotsu khׇl-yehudah hanikevatsiym eleykha veavedah sheeriyt yehudah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר גְּדַלְיָ֤הוּ בֶן־אֲחִיקָם֙ אֶל־יוֹחָנָ֣ן בֶּן־קָרֵ֔חַ אַֽל־[תַּעֲשֵׂ֖ה] (תעש) אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה כִּי־שֶׁ֛קֶר אַתָּ֥ה דֹבֵ֖ר אֶל־יִשְׁמָעֵֽאל׃ {פ}
Translated: But Gedaliah son of Ahikam answered Johanan son of Kareah, “Do not do such a thing: what you are saying about Ishmael is not true!”
Transliteration: vayomer gedaleyahu ven-achiykam el-yvochanan ven-karecha al-[taasheh] (tsh) et-hadavar hazeh khiy-sheker atah dover el-yishemael {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י בָּ֣א יִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל בֶּן־נְתַנְיָ֣ה בֶן־אֱלִישָׁמָ֣ע מִזֶּ֣רַע הַ֠מְּלוּכָ֠ה וְרַבֵּ֨י הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ וַעֲשָׂרָ֨ה אֲנָשִׁ֥ים אִתּ֛וֹ אֶל־גְּדַלְיָ֥הוּ בֶן־אֲחִיקָ֖ם הַמִּצְפָּ֑תָה וַיֹּ֨אכְלוּ שָׁ֥ם לֶ֛חֶם יַחְדָּ֖ו בַּמִּצְפָּֽה׃
Translated: In the seventh month, Ishmael son of Nethaniah son of Elishama, who was of royal descent and one of the king’s commanders, came with ten men to Gedaliah son of Ahikam at Mizpah; and they ate together there at Mizpah.
Transliteration: vayehiy vachodesh hasheviyiy va yishemael ven-netaneyah ven-eliyshama mizera hamelukhah veravey hamelekhe vaasharah anashiym itvo el-gedaleyahu ven-achiykam hamitsefatah vayokhelu sham lechem yachedav vamitsefah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֩קׇם֩ יִשְׁמָעֵ֨אל בֶּן־נְתַנְיָ֜ה וַעֲשֶׂ֥רֶת הָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים ׀ אֲשֶׁר־הָי֣וּ אִתּ֗וֹ וַ֠יַּכּ֠וּ אֶת־גְּדַלְיָ֨הוּ בֶן־אֲחִיקָ֧ם בֶּן־שָׁפָ֛ן בַּחֶ֖רֶב וַיָּ֣מֶת אֹת֑וֹ אֲשֶׁר־הִפְקִ֥יד מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Then Ishmael son of Nethaniah and the ten men who were with him arose and struck down Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan with the sword and killed him, because the king of Babylon had put him in charge of the land.
Transliteration: vayakׇm yishemael ven-netaneyah vaasheret haanashiym asher-hayu itvo vayakhu et-gedaleyahu ven-achiykam ven-shafan vacherev vayamet otvo asher-hifekiyd melekhe-vavel vaarets

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת כׇּל־הַיְּהוּדִ֗ים אֲשֶׁר־הָי֨וּ אִתּ֤וֹ אֶת־גְּדַלְיָ֙הוּ֙ בַּמִּצְפָּ֔ה וְאֶת־הַכַּשְׂדִּ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִמְצְאוּ־שָׁ֑ם אֵ֚ת אַנְשֵׁ֣י הַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה הִכָּ֖ה יִשְׁמָעֵֽאל׃
Translated: Ishmael also killed all the Judeans who were with him—with Gedaliah in Mizpah—and the Chaldean soldiers who were stationed there.
Transliteration: veet khׇl-hayehudiym asher-hayu itvo et-gedaleyahu vamitsefah veet-hakhashediym asher nimetseu-sham et aneshey hamilechamah hikhah yishemael

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשֵּׁנִ֖י לְהָמִ֣ית אֶת־גְּדַלְיָ֑הוּ וְאִ֖ישׁ לֹ֥א יָדָֽע׃
Translated: The second day after Gedaliah was killed, when no one else knew about it,
Transliteration: vayehiy vayyvom hasheniy lehamiyt et-gedaleyahu veiysh lo yada

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ אֲ֠נָשִׁ֠ים מִשְּׁכֶ֞ם מִשִּׁל֤וֹ וּמִשֹּֽׁמְרוֹן֙ שְׁמֹנִ֣ים אִ֔ישׁ מְגֻלְּחֵ֥י זָקָ֛ן וּקְרֻעֵ֥י בְגָדִ֖ים וּמִתְגֹּֽדְדִ֑ים וּמִנְחָ֤ה וּלְבוֹנָה֙ בְּיָדָ֔ם לְהָבִ֖יא בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: some men came from Shechem, Shiloh, and Samaria—eighty of them, their beards shaved, their garments torn, and their bodies gashed—carrying grain offerings and frankincense to present at the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayavou anashiym mishekhem mishilvo umishomervon shemoniym iysh megulechey zakan ukeruey vegadiym umitegodediym uminechah ulevvonah veyadam lehaviy veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַ֠יֵּצֵ֠א יִשְׁמָעֵ֨אל בֶּן־נְתַנְיָ֤ה לִקְרָאתָם֙ מִן־הַמִּצְפָּ֔ה הֹלֵ֥ךְ הָלֹ֖ךְ וּבֹכֶ֑ה וַֽיְהִי֙ כִּפְגֹ֣שׁ אֹתָ֔ם וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם בֹּ֖אוּ אֶל־גְּדַלְיָ֥הוּ בֶן־אֲחִיקָֽם׃
Translated: Ishmael son of Nethaniah went out from Mizpah to meet them, weeping as he walked. As he met them, he said to them, “Come to Gedaliah son of Ahikam.”
Transliteration: vayetse yishemael ven-netaneyah likeratam min-hamitsefah holekhe halokhe uvokheh vayehiy khifegosh otam vayomer aleyhem vou el-gedaleyahu ven-achiykam

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כְּבוֹאָ֖ם אֶל־תּ֣וֹךְ הָעִ֑יר וַיִּשְׁחָטֵ֞ם יִשְׁמָעֵ֤אל בֶּן־נְתַנְיָה֙ אֶל־תּ֣וֹךְ הַבּ֔וֹר ה֖וּא וְהָאֲנָשִׁ֥ים אֲשֶׁר־אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: When they came inside the town, Ishmael son of Nethaniah and the men who were with him slaughtered them [and threw their bodies] into a cistern.
Transliteration: vayehiy khevvoam el-tvokhe haiyr vayishechatem yishemael ven-netaneyah el-tvokhe havvor hu vehaanashiym asher-itvo

Hebrew: וַעֲשָׂרָ֨ה אֲנָשִׁ֜ים נִמְצְאוּ־בָ֗ם וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ אֶל־יִשְׁמָעֵאל֙ אַל־תְּמִתֵ֔נוּ כִּֽי־יֶשׁ־לָ֤נוּ מַטְמֹנִים֙ בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה חִטִּ֥ים וּשְׂעֹרִ֖ים וְשֶׁ֣מֶן וּדְבָ֑שׁ וַיֶּחְדַּ֕ל וְלֹ֥א הֱמִיתָ֖ם בְּת֥וֹךְ אֲחֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: But there were ten men among them who said to Ishmael, “Don’t kill us! We have stores hidden in a field—wheat, barley, oil, and honey.” So he stopped, and did not kill them along with their fellows.—
Transliteration: vaasharah anashiym nimetseu-vam vayomeru el-yishemael al-temitenu khiy-yesh-lanu matemoniym vashadeh chitiym usheoriym veshemen udevash vayechedal velo hemiytam vetvokhe acheyhem

Hebrew: וְהַבּ֗וֹר אֲשֶׁר֩ הִשְׁלִ֨יךְ שָׁ֤ם יִשְׁמָעֵאל֙ אֵ֣ת ׀ כׇּל־פִּגְרֵ֣י הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר הִכָּה֙ בְּיַד־גְּדַלְיָ֔הוּ ה֗וּא אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשָׂה֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אָסָ֔א מִפְּנֵ֖י בַּעְשָׁ֣א מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֹת֗וֹ מִלֵּ֛א יִשְׁמָעֵ֥אל בֶּן־נְתַנְיָ֖הוּ חֲלָלִֽים׃
Translated: The cistern into which Ishmael threw all the corpses of the men he had killed in the affair of Gedaliah was the one that King Asa had constructed on account of King Baasha of Israel. That was the one which Ishmael son of Nethaniah filled with corpses.—
Transliteration: vehavvor asher hisheliykhe sham yishemael et khׇl-figerey haanashiym asher hikhah veyad-gedaleyahu hu asher ashah hamelekhe asa mifeney vaesha melekhe-yisherael otvo mile yishemael ven-netaneyahu chalaliym

Hebrew: וַיִּ֣שְׁבְּ ׀ יִ֠שְׁמָעֵ֠אל אֶת־כׇּל־שְׁאֵרִ֨ית הָעָ֜ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּמִּצְפָּ֗ה אֶת־בְּנ֤וֹת הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־הָעָם֙ הַנִּשְׁאָרִ֣ים בַּמִּצְפָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִפְקִ֗יד נְבֽוּזַרְאֲדָן֙ רַב־טַבָּחִ֔ים אֶת־גְּדַלְיָ֖הוּ בֶּן־אֲחִיקָ֑ם וַיִּשְׁבֵּם֙ יִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל בֶּן־נְתַנְיָ֔ה וַיֵּ֕לֶךְ לַעֲבֹ֖ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃ {ס}
Translated: Ishmael carried off all the rest of the people who were in Mizpah, including the daughters of the king—all the people left in Mizpah, over whom Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, had appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam. Ishmael son of Nethaniah carried them off, and set out to cross over to the Ammonites.
Transliteration: vayisheve yishemael et-khׇl-sheeriyt haam asher vamitsefah et-venvot hamelekhe veet-khׇl-haam hanisheariym vamitsefah asher hifekiyd nevuzareadan rav-tavachiym et-gedaleyahu ven-achiykam vayishevem yishemael ven-netaneyah vayelekhe laavor el-veney amvon {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַע֙ יוֹחָנָ֣ן בֶּן־קָרֵ֔חַ וְכׇל־שָׂרֵ֥י הַחֲיָלִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֑וֹ אֵ֤ת כׇּל־הָרָעָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה יִשְׁמָעֵ֖אל בֶּן־נְתַנְיָֽה׃
Translated: Johanan son of Kareah, and all the army officers with him, heard of all the crimes committed by Ishmael son of Nethaniah.
Transliteration: vayishema yvochanan ven-karecha vekhׇl-sharey hachayaliym asher itvo et khׇl-haraah asher ashah yishemael ven-netaneyah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְחוּ֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָ֣אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וַיֵּ֣לְכ֔וּ לְהִלָּחֵ֖ם עִם־יִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל בֶּן־נְתַנְיָ֑ה וַיִּמְצְא֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ אֶל־מַ֥יִם רַבִּ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּגִבְעֽוֹן׃
Translated: They took all their men and went to fight against Ishmael son of Nethaniah; and they encountered him by the great pool in Gibeon.
Transliteration: vayikechu et-khׇl-haanashiym vayelekhu lehilachem im-yishemael ven-netaneyah vayimetseu otvo el-mayiim raviym asher vegivevon

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כִּרְא֤וֹת כׇּל־הָעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶת־יִשְׁמָעֵ֔אל אֶת־יֽוֹחָנָן֙ בֶּן־קָרֵ֔חַ וְאֵ֛ת כׇּל־שָׂרֵ֥י הַחֲיָלִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֑וֹ וַיִּשְׂמָֽחוּ׃
Translated: When all the people held by Ishmael saw Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers with him, they were glad;
Transliteration: vayehiy khirevot khׇl-haam asher et-yishemael et-yvochanan ven-karecha veet khׇl-sharey hachayaliym asher itvo vayishemachu

Hebrew: וַיָּסֹ֙בּוּ֙ כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־שָׁבָ֥ה יִשְׁמָעֵ֖אל מִן־הַמִּצְפָּ֑ה וַיָּשֻׁ֙בוּ֙ וַיֵּ֣לְכ֔וּ אֶל־יוֹחָנָ֖ן בֶּן־קָרֵֽחַ׃
Translated: all the people whom Ishmael had carried off from Mizpah turned back and went over to Johanan son of Kareah.
Transliteration: vayasovu khׇl-haam asher-shavah yishemael min-hamitsefah vayashuvu vayelekhu el-yvochanan ven-karecha

Hebrew: וְיִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל בֶּן־נְתַנְיָ֗ה נִמְלַט֙ בִּשְׁמֹנָ֣ה אֲנָשִׁ֔ים מִפְּנֵ֖י יוֹחָנָ֑ן וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃ {ס}
Translated: But Ishmael son of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with eight men, and went to the Ammonites.
Transliteration: veyishemael ven-netaneyah nimelat vishemonah anashiym mifeney yvochanan vayelekhe el-veney amvon {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֩ יוֹחָנָ֨ן בֶּן־קָרֵ֜חַ וְכׇל־שָׂרֵ֧י הַחֲיָלִ֣ים אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֗וֹ אֵ֣ת כׇּל־שְׁאֵרִ֤ית הָעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֵ֠שִׁ֠יב מֵאֵ֨ת יִשְׁמָעֵ֤אל בֶּן־נְתַנְיָה֙ מִן־הַמִּצְפָּ֔ה אַחַ֣ר הִכָּ֔ה אֶת־גְּדַלְיָ֖ה בֶּן־אֲחִיקָ֑ם גְּבָרִ֞ים אַנְשֵׁ֣י הַמִּלְחָמָ֗ה וְנָשִׁ֤ים וְטַף֙ וְסָ֣רִסִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֵשִׁ֖יב מִגִּבְעֽוֹן׃
Translated: Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers with him took all the rest of the people whom he had rescued from Ishmael son of Nethaniah from Mizpah after he had murdered Gedaliah son of Ahikam—the men, soldiers, women, children, and eunuchs whom [Johanan] had brought back from Gibeon.
Transliteration: vayikach yvochanan ven-karecha vekhׇl-sharey hachayaliym asher-itvo et khׇl-sheeriyt haam asher heshiyv meet yishemael ven-netaneyah min-hamitsefah achar hikhah et-gedaleyah ven-achiykam gevariym aneshey hamilechamah venashiym vetaf vesarisiym asher heshiyv migivevon

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֗וּ וַיֵּֽשְׁבוּ֙ בְּגֵר֣וּת (כמוהם) [כִּמְהָ֔ם] אֲשֶׁר־אֵ֖צֶל בֵּ֣ית לָ֑חֶם לָלֶ֖כֶת לָב֥וֹא מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: They set out, and they stopped at Geruth Chimham, near Bethlehem, on their way to go to Egypt
Transliteration: vayelekhu vayeshevu vegerut (khmvhm) [khimeham] asher-etsel veyt lachem lalekhet lavvo mitserayiim

Hebrew: מִפְּנֵי֙ הַכַּשְׂדִּ֔ים כִּ֥י יָֽרְא֖וּ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם כִּֽי־הִכָּ֞ה יִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל בֶּן־נְתַנְיָ֗ה אֶת־גְּדַלְיָ֙הוּ֙ בֶּן־אֲחִיקָ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הִפְקִ֥יד מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל בָּאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated: because of the Chaldeans. For they were afraid of them, because Ishmael son of Nethaniah had killed Gedaliah son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon had put in charge of the land.
Transliteration: mifeney hakhashediym khiy yareu mifeneyhem khiy-hikhah yishemael ven-netaneyah et-gedaleyahu ven-achiykam asher-hifekiyd melekhe-vavel vaarets {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיִּגְּשׁוּ֙ כׇּל־שָׂרֵ֣י הַחֲיָלִ֔ים וְיֽוֹחָנָן֙ בֶּן־קָרֵ֔חַ וִיזַנְיָ֖ה בֶּן־הוֹשַֽׁעְיָ֑ה וְכׇל־הָעָ֖ם מִקָּטֹ֥ן וְעַד־גָּדֽוֹל׃
Translated: Then all the army officers, with Johanan son of Kareah, Jezaniah son of Hoshaiah, and all the rest of the people, great and small, approached
Transliteration: vayigeshu khׇl-sharey hachayaliym veyvochanan ven-karecha viyzaneyah ven-hvoshaeyah vekhׇl-haam mikaton vead-gadvol

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֞וּ אֶל־יִרְמְיָ֣הוּ הַנָּבִ֗יא תִּפׇּל־נָ֤א תְחִנָּתֵ֙נוּ֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ וְהִתְפַּלֵּ֤ל בַּעֲדֵ֙נוּ֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּעַ֖ד כׇּל־הַשְּׁאֵרִ֣ית הַזֹּ֑את כִּֽי־נִשְׁאַ֤רְנֽוּ מְעַט֙ מֵֽהַרְבֵּ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עֵינֶ֖יךָ רֹא֥וֹת אֹתָֽנוּ׃
Translated: the prophet Jeremiah and said, “Grant our plea, and pray for us to the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God, for all this remnant! For we remain but a few out of many, as you can see.
Transliteration: vayomeru el-yiremeyahu hanaviy tifׇl-na techinatenu lefaneykha vehitefalel vaadenu el-yehovah eloheykha vead khׇl-hasheeriyt hazot khiy-nishearenu meat mehareveh khaasher eyneykha rovot otanu

Hebrew: וְיַגֶּד־לָ֙נוּ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ אֶת־הַדֶּ֖רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נֵֽלֶךְ־בָּ֑הּ וְאֶת־הַדָּבָ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר נַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: Let the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God tell us where we should go and what we should do.”
Transliteration: veyaged-lanu yehovah eloheykha et-haderekhe asher nelekhe-vah veet-hadavar asher naasheh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם יִרְמְיָ֤הוּ הַנָּבִיא֙ שָׁמַ֔עְתִּי הִנְנִ֧י מִתְפַּלֵּ֛ל אֶל־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם כְּדִבְרֵיכֶ֑ם וְֽהָיָ֡ה כׇּֽל־הַדָּבָר֩ אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲנֶ֨ה יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶתְכֶם֙ אַגִּ֣יד לָכֶ֔ם לֹא־אֶמְנַ֥ע מִכֶּ֖ם דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: The prophet Jeremiah answered them, “Agreed: I will pray to the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God as you request, and I will tell you whatever response G<small>OD</small> gives for you. I will withhold nothing from you.”
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem yiremeyahu hanaviy shamaetiy hineniy mitefalel el-yehovah eloheykhem khedivereykhem vehayah khׇl-hadavar asher-yaaneh yehovah etekhem agiyd lakhem lo-emena mikhem davar

Hebrew: וְהֵ֙מָּה֙ אָמְר֣וּ אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ יְהִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ בָּ֔נוּ לְעֵ֖ד אֱמֶ֣ת וְנֶאֱמָ֑ן אִם־לֹ֡א כְּֽכׇל־הַ֠דָּבָ֠ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִֽשְׁלָחֲךָ֜ יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ אֵלֵ֖ינוּ כֵּ֥ן נַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: Thereupon they said to Jeremiah, “Let G<small>OD</small> be a true and faithful witness against us! We swear that we will do exactly as the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God instructs us through you—
Transliteration: vehemah ameru el-yiremeyahu yehiy yehovah vanu leed emet veneeman im-lo khekhׇl-hadavar asher yishelachakha yehovah eloheykha eleynu khen naasheh

Hebrew: אִם־ט֣וֹב וְאִם־רָ֔ע בְּק֣וֹל ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ אֲשֶׁ֨ר (אנו) [אֲנַ֜חְנוּ] שֹׁלְחִ֥ים אֹתְךָ֛ אֵלָ֖יו נִשְׁמָ֑ע לְמַ֙עַן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִֽיטַב־לָ֔נוּ כִּ֣י נִשְׁמַ֔ע בְּק֖וֹל יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: Whether it is pleasant or unpleasant, we will obey the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God to whom we send you, in order that it may go well with us when we obey the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God.”
Transliteration: im-tvov veim-ra vekvol yehovah eloheynu asher (nv) [anachenu] sholechiym otekha elayv nishema lemaan asher yiytav-lanu khiy nishema vekvol yehovah eloheynu {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י מִקֵּ֖ץ עֲשֶׂ֣רֶת יָמִ֑ים וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָֽהוּ׃
Translated: After ten days, the word of G<small>OD</small> came to Jeremiah.
Transliteration: vayehiy mikets asheret yamiym vayehiy devar-yehovah el-yiremeyahu

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֗א אֶל־יֽוֹחָנָן֙ בֶּן־קָרֵ֔חַ וְאֶ֛ל כׇּל־שָׂרֵ֥י הַחֲיָלִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֑וֹ וּ֨לְכׇל־הָעָ֔ם לְמִקָּטֹ֖ן וְעַד־גָּדֽוֹל׃
Translated: He called Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers, and the rest of the people, great and small,
Transliteration: vayikera el-yvochanan ven-karecha veel khׇl-sharey hachayaliym asher itvo ulekhׇl-haam lemikaton vead-gadvol
