Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם כֹּה־אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר שְׁלַחְתֶּ֤ם אֹתִי֙ אֵלָ֔יו לְהַפִּ֥יל תְּחִנַּתְכֶ֖ם לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: and said to them, “Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, to whom you sent me to present your supplication:
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael asher shelachetem otiy elayv lehafiyl techinatekhem lefanayv

Hebrew: אִם־שׁ֤וֹב תֵּֽשְׁבוּ֙ בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את וּבָנִ֤יתִי אֶתְכֶם֙ וְלֹ֣א אֶהֱרֹ֔ס וְנָטַעְתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם וְלֹ֣א אֶתּ֑וֹשׁ כִּ֤י נִחַ֙מְתִּי֙ אֶל־הָ֣רָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֖יתִי לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: If you remain in this land, I will build you and not overthrow, I will plant you and not uproot; for I regret the punishment I have brought upon you.
Transliteration: im-shvov teshevu vaarets hazot uvaniytiy etekhem velo eheros venataetiy etekhem velo etvosh khiy nichametiy el-haraah asher ashiytiy lakhem

Hebrew: אַל־תִּֽירְא֗וּ מִפְּנֵי֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־אַתֶּ֥ם יְרֵאִ֖ים מִפָּנָ֑יו אַל־תִּֽירְא֤וּ מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּֽי־אִתְּכֶ֣ם אָ֔נִי לְהוֹשִׁ֧יעַ אֶתְכֶ֛ם וּלְהַצִּ֥יל אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִיָּדֽוֹ׃
Translated: Do not be afraid of the king of Babylon, whom you fear; do not be afraid of him—declares G<small>OD</small>—for I am with you to save you and to rescue you from his hands.
Transliteration: al-tiyreu mifeney melekhe vavel asher-atem yereiym mifanayv al-tiyreu mimenu neum-yehovah khiy-itekhem aniy lehvoshiya etekhem ulehatsiyl etekhem miyadvo

Hebrew: וְאֶתֵּ֥ן לָכֶ֛ם רַחֲמִ֖ים וְרִחַ֣ם אֶתְכֶ֑ם וְהֵשִׁ֥יב אֶתְכֶ֖ם אֶל־אַדְמַתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: I will dispose him to be merciful to you: he shall show you mercy and bring you back to your own land.
Transliteration: veeten lakhem rachamiym vericham etekhem veheshiyv etekhem el-adematekhem

Hebrew: וְאִם־אֹמְרִ֣ים אַתֶּ֔ם לֹ֥א נֵשֵׁ֖ב בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את לְבִלְתִּ֣י שְׁמֹ֔עַ בְּק֖וֹל יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: “But if you say, ‘We will not stay in this land’—thus disobeying the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God—
Transliteration: veim-omeriym atem lo neshev vaarets hazot leviletiy shemoa vekvol yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: לֵאמֹ֗ר לֹ֚א כִּ֣י אֶ֤רֶץ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ נָב֔וֹא אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־נִרְאֶה֙ מִלְחָמָ֔ה וְק֥וֹל שׁוֹפָ֖ר לֹ֣א נִשְׁמָ֑ע וְלַלֶּ֥חֶם לֹֽא־נִרְעָ֖ב וְשָׁ֥ם נֵשֵֽׁב׃
Translated: if you say, ‘No! We will go to the land of Egypt, so that we may not see war or hear the sound of the horn, and so that we may not hunger for bread; there we will stay,’
Transliteration: lemor lo khiy erets mitserayiim navvo asher lo-nireeh milechamah vekvol shvofar lo nishema velalechem lo-nireav vesham neshev

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה לָכֵ֛ן שִׁמְע֥וּ דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה שְׁאֵרִ֣ית יְהוּדָ֑ה כֹּֽה־אָמַר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה צְבָא֜וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אִם־אַ֠תֶּ֠ם שׂ֣וֹם תְּשִׂמ֤וּן פְּנֵיכֶם֙ לָבֹ֣א מִצְרַ֔יִם וּבָאתֶ֖ם לָג֥וּר שָֽׁם׃
Translated: then hear the word of G<small>OD</small>, O remnant of Judah! Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: If you turn your faces toward Egypt, and you go and sojourn there,
Transliteration: veatah lakhen shimeu devar-yehovah sheeriyt yehudah khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael im-atem shvom teshimun feneykhem lavo mitserayiim uvatem lagur sham

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֣ה הַחֶ֗רֶב אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתֶּם֙ יְרֵאִ֣ים מִמֶּ֔נָּה שָׁ֛ם תַּשִּׂ֥יג אֶתְכֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְהָרָעָ֞ב אֲשֶׁר־אַתֶּ֣ם ׀ דֹּאֲגִ֣ים מִמֶּ֗נּוּ שָׁ֣ם יִדְבַּ֧ק אַחֲרֵיכֶ֛ם מִצְרַ֖יִם וְשָׁ֥ם תָּמֻֽתוּ׃
Translated: the sword that you fear shall overtake you there, in the land of Egypt, and the famine you worry over shall follow at your heels in Egypt too; and there you shall die.
Transliteration: vehayetah hacherev asher atem yereiym mimenah sham tashiyg etekhem veerets mitserayiim veharaav asher-atem doagiym mimenu sham yidevak achareykhem mitserayiim vesham tamutu

Hebrew: וְיִֽהְי֣וּ כׇל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֨מוּ אֶת־פְּנֵיהֶ֜ם לָב֤וֹא מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לָג֣וּר שָׁ֔ם יָמ֕וּתוּ בַּחֶ֖רֶב בָּרָעָ֣ב וּבַדָּ֑בֶר וְלֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֤ה לָהֶם֙ שָׂרִ֣יד וּפָלִ֔יט מִפְּנֵי֙ הָרָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י מֵבִ֥יא עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: All those who turn their faces toward Egypt, in order to sojourn there, shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence. They shall have no surviving remnant of the disaster that I will bring upon them.
Transliteration: veyiheyu khׇl-haanashiym asher-shamu et-feneyhem lavvo mitserayiim lagur sham yamutu vacherev varaav uvadaver velo-yiheyeh lahem shariyd ufaliyt mifeney haraah asher aniy meviy aleyhem

Hebrew: כִּי֩ כֹ֨ה אָמַ֜ר יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָאוֹת֮ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ נִתַּ֨ךְ אַפִּ֜י וַחֲמָתִ֗י עַל־יֹֽשְׁבֵי֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם כֵּ֣ן תִּתַּ֤ךְ חֲמָתִי֙ עֲלֵיכֶ֔ם בְּבֹאֲכֶ֖ם מִצְרָ֑יִם וִהְיִיתֶ֞ם לְאָלָ֤ה וּלְשַׁמָּה֙ וְלִקְלָלָ֣ה וּלְחֶרְפָּ֔ה וְלֹא־תִרְא֣וּ ע֔וֹד אֶת־הַמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: For thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: As My anger and wrath were poured out upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so will My wrath be poured out on you if you go to Egypt. You shall become an execration of woe, a curse and a mockery; and you shall never again see this place.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael khaasher nitakhe afiy vachamatiy al-yoshevey yerushala͏im khen titakhe chamatiy aleykhem vevoakhem mitserayiim viheyiytem lealah uleshamah velikelalah ulecherefah velo-tireu vod et-hamakvom hazeh

Hebrew: דִּבֶּ֨ר יְהֹוָ֤ה עֲלֵיכֶם֙ שְׁאֵרִ֣ית יְהוּדָ֔ה אַל־תָּבֹ֖אוּ מִצְרָ֑יִם יָדֹ֙עַ֙ תֵּדְע֔וּ כִּֽי־הַעִידֹ֥תִי בָכֶ֖ם הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> has spoken against you, O remnant of Judah! Do not go to Egypt! Know well, then—for I warn you this day
Transliteration: diver yehovah aleykhem sheeriyt yehudah al-tavou mitserayiim yadoa tedeu khiy-haiydotiy vakhem hayyvom

Hebrew: כִּ֣י (התעתים) [הִתְעֵיתֶם֮] בְּנַפְשׁוֹתֵיכֶם֒ כִּֽי־אַתֶּ֞ם שְׁלַחְתֶּ֣ם אֹתִ֗י אֶל־יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הִתְפַּלֵּ֣ל בַּעֲדֵ֔נוּ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וּכְכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יֹאמַ֜ר יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵ֛ינוּ כֵּ֥ן הַגֶּד־לָ֖נוּ וְעָשִֽׂינוּ׃
Translated: that you were deceitful at heart when you sent me to the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God, saying, ‘Pray for us to the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God; and whatever the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God may say, just tell us and we will do it.’
Transliteration: khiy (httym) [hiteeytem] venafeshvoteykhem khiy-atem shelachetem otiy el-yehovah eloheykhem lemor hitefalel vaadenu el-yehovah eloheynu ukhekhol asher yomar yehovah eloheynu khen haged-lanu veashiynu

Hebrew: וָאַגִּ֥ד לָכֶ֖ם הַיּ֑וֹם וְלֹ֣א שְׁמַעְתֶּ֗ם בְּקוֹל֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֔ם וּלְכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁר־שְׁלָחַ֥נִי אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: I told you today, and you have not obeyed the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God in respect to all that I was sent to tell you—
Transliteration: vaagid lakhem hayyvom velo shemaetem vekvol yehovah eloheykhem ulekhol asher-shelachaniy aleykhem

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ יָדֹ֣עַ תֵּדְע֔וּ כִּ֗י בַּחֶ֛רֶב בָּרָעָ֥ב וּבַדֶּ֖בֶר תָּמ֑וּתוּ בַּמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חֲפַצְתֶּ֔ם לָב֖וֹא לָג֥וּר שָֽׁם׃ {ס}
Translated: know well, then, that you shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence in the place where you want to go and sojourn.”
Transliteration: veatah yadoa tedeu khiy vacherev varaav uvadever tamutu vamakvom asher chafatsetem lavvo lagur sham {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כְּכַלּ֨וֹת יִרְמְיָ֜הוּ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־כׇּל־הָעָ֗ם אֶת־כׇּל־דִּבְרֵי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֧ר שְׁלָח֛וֹ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֖ם אֲלֵיהֶ֑ם אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃ {ס}
Translated: When Jeremiah had finished speaking all these words to all the people—all the words of the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God, with which the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God had sent him to them—
Transliteration: vayehiy khekhalvot yiremeyahu ledaver el-khׇl-haam et-khׇl-diverey yehovah eloheyhem asher shelachvo yehovah eloheyhem aleyhem et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר עֲזַרְיָ֤ה בֶן־הוֹשַֽׁעְיָה֙ וְיוֹחָנָ֣ן בֶּן־קָרֵ֔חַ וְכׇל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים הַזֵּדִ֑ים אֹמְרִ֣ים אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֗הוּ שֶׁ֚קֶר אַתָּ֣ה מְדַבֵּ֔ר לֹ֣א שְׁלָחֲךָ֞ יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹא־תָבֹ֥אוּ מִצְרַ֖יִם לָג֥וּר שָֽׁם׃
Translated: Azariah son of Hoshaiah and Johanan son of Kareah and all the arrogant men said to Jeremiah, “You are lying! The E<small>TERNAL</small> our God did not send you to say, ‘Don’t go to Egypt and sojourn there’!
Transliteration: vayomer azareyah ven-hvoshaeyah veyvochanan ven-karecha vekhׇl-haanashiym hazediym omeriym el-yiremeyahu sheker atah medaver lo shelachakha yehovah eloheynu lemor lo-tavou mitserayiim lagur sham

Hebrew: כִּ֗י בָּרוּךְ֙ בֶּן־נֵ֣רִיָּ֔ה מַסִּ֥ית אֹתְךָ֖ בָּ֑נוּ לְמַ֩עַן֩ תֵּ֨ת אֹתָ֤נוּ בְיַֽד־הַכַּשְׂדִּים֙ לְהָמִ֣ית אֹתָ֔נוּ וּלְהַגְל֥וֹת אֹתָ֖נוּ בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: It is Baruch son of Neriah who is inciting you against us, so that we will be delivered into the hands of the Chaldeans to be killed or to be exiled to Babylon!”
Transliteration: khiy varukhe ven-neriyah masiyt otekha vanu lemaan tet otanu veyad-hakhashediym lehamiyt otanu ulehagelvot otanu vavel

Hebrew: וְלֹא־שָׁמַע֩ יוֹחָנָ֨ן בֶּן־קָרֵ֜חַ וְכׇל־שָׂרֵ֧י הַחֲיָלִ֛ים וְכׇל־הָעָ֖ם בְּק֣וֹל יְהֹוָ֑ה לָשֶׁ֖בֶת בְּאֶ֥רֶץ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: So Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers and the rest of the people did not obey G<small>OD</small>’s command to remain in the land of Judah.
Transliteration: velo-shama yvochanan ven-karecha vekhׇl-sharey hachayaliym vekhׇl-haam vekvol yehovah lashevet veerets yehudah

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֞ח יוֹחָנָ֤ן בֶּן־קָרֵ֙חַ֙ וְכׇל־שָׂרֵ֣י הַחֲיָלִ֔ים אֵ֖ת כׇּל־שְׁאֵרִ֣ית יְהוּדָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֗בוּ מִכׇּל־הַגּוֹיִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִדְּחוּ־שָׁ֔ם לָג֖וּר בְּאֶ֥רֶץ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Instead, Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers took the entire remnant of Judah—those who had returned from all the countries to which they had been scattered and had sojourned in the land of Judah,
Transliteration: vayikach yvochanan ven-karecha vekhׇl-sharey hachayaliym et khׇl-sheeriyt yehudah asher-shavu mikhׇl-hagvoyim asher nidechu-sham lagur veerets yehudah

Hebrew: אֶֽת־הַ֠גְּבָרִ֠ים וְאֶת־הַנָּשִׁ֣ים וְאֶת־הַטַּף֮ וְאֶת־בְּנ֣וֹת הַמֶּ֒לֶךְ֒ וְאֵ֣ת כׇּל־הַנֶּ֗פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הִנִּ֙יחַ֙ נְבוּזַרְאֲדָ֣ן רַב־טַבָּחִ֔ים אֶת־גְּדַלְיָ֖הוּ בֶּן־אֲחִיקָ֣ם בֶּן־שָׁפָ֑ן וְאֵת֙ יִרְמְיָ֣הוּ הַנָּבִ֔יא וְאֶת־בָּר֖וּךְ בֶּן־נֵרִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: men, women, and children; and the daughters of the king and all the people whom Nebuzaradan the chief of the guards had left with Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan, as well as the prophet Jeremiah and Baruch son of Neriah—
Transliteration: et-hagevariym veet-hanashiym veet-hataf veet-venvot hamelekhe veet khׇl-hanefesh asher hiniycha nevuzareadan rav-tavachiym et-gedaleyahu ven-achiykam ven-shafan veet yiremeyahu hanaviy veet-varukhe ven-neriyahu

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם כִּ֛י לֹ֥א שָׁמְע֖וּ בְּק֣וֹל יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ עַד־תַּחְפַּנְחֵֽס׃ {ס}
Translated:
and they went to Egypt. They did not obey GOD.
They arrived at Tahpanhes,
Transliteration: vayavou erets mitserayiim khiy lo shameu vekvol yehovah vayavou ad-tachefaneches {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י דְבַר־יְהֹוָה֙ אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ בְּתַחְפַּנְחֵ֖ס לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: and the word of G<small>OD</small> came to Jeremiah in Tahpanhes:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-yiremeyahu vetachefaneches lemor

Hebrew: קַ֣ח בְּיָדְךָ֞ אֲבָנִ֣ים גְּדֹל֗וֹת וּטְמַנְתָּ֤ם בַּמֶּ֙לֶט֙ בַּמַּלְבֵּ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֛ר בְּפֶ֥תַח בֵּית־פַּרְעֹ֖ה בְּתַחְפַּנְחֵ֑ס לְעֵינֵ֖י אֲנָשִׁ֥ים יְהוּדִֽים׃
Translated: Get yourself large stones, and embed them in mortar in the brick structure at the entrance to Pharaoh’s palace in Tahpanhes, with some Judeans looking on.
Transliteration: kach veyadekha avaniym gedolvot utemanetam vamelet vamaleven asher vefetach veyt-fareoh vetachefaneches leeyney anashiym yehudiym

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֡ם כֹּה־אָמַר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה צְבָא֜וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הִנְנִ֤י שֹׁלֵ֙חַ֙ וְ֠לָקַחְתִּ֠י אֶת־נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֤ר מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶל֙ עַבְדִּ֔י וְשַׂמְתִּ֣י כִסְא֔וֹ מִמַּ֛עַל לָאֲבָנִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֣ר טָמָ֑נְתִּי וְנָטָ֥ה אֶת־[שַׁפְרִיר֖וֹ] (שפרורו) עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: And say to them: “Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am sending for My servant King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, and I will set his throne over these stones that I have embedded. He will spread out his pavilion over them.
Transliteration: veamareta aleyhem khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael hineniy sholecha velakachetiy et-nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel avediy veshametiy khisevo mimaal laavaniym haeleh asher tamanetiy venatah et-[shaferiyrvo] (shfrvrv) aleyhem

Hebrew: (ובאה) [וּבָ֕א] וְהִכָּ֖ה אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם אֲשֶׁ֧ר לַמָּ֣וֶת לַמָּ֗וֶת וַאֲשֶׁ֤ר לַשְּׁבִי֙ לַשֶּׁ֔בִי וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר לַחֶ֖רֶב לֶחָֽרֶב׃
Translated:
He will come and attack the land of Egypt, delivering
Those destined for the plague, to the plague,
Those destined for captivity, to captivity,
And those destined for the sword, to the sword.
Transliteration: (vvh) [uva] vehikhah et-erets mitserayiim asher lamavet lamavet vaasher lasheviy lasheviy vaasher lacherev lecharev

Hebrew: וְהִצַּ֣תִּי אֵ֗שׁ בְּבָתֵּי֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י מִצְרַ֔יִם וּשְׂרָפָ֖ם וְשָׁבָ֑ם וְעָטָה֩ אֶת־אֶ֨רֶץ מִצְרַ֜יִם כַּֽאֲשֶׁר־יַעְטֶ֤ה הָרֹעֶה֙ אֶת־בִּגְד֔וֹ וְיָצָ֥א מִשָּׁ֖ם בְּשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: And I will set fire to the temples of the gods of Egypt; he will burn them down and carry them off. He shall wrap himself up in the land of Egypt, as a shepherd wraps himself up in his garment. And he shall depart from there in safety.
Transliteration: vehitsatiy esh vevatey elohey mitserayiim usherafam veshavam veatah et-erets mitserayiim khaasher-yaeteh haroeh et-vigedvo veyatsa misham veshalvom

Hebrew: וְשִׁבַּ֗ר אֶֽת־מַצְּבוֹת֙ בֵּ֣ית שֶׁ֔מֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְאֶת־בָּתֵּ֥י אֱלֹהֵֽי־מִצְרַ֖יִם יִשְׂרֹ֥ף בָּאֵֽשׁ׃ {פ}
Translated: He shall smash the obelisks of the Temple of the Sun that is in the land of Egypt, and he shall burn down the temples of the gods of Egypt.”
Transliteration: veshivar et-matsevvot veyt shemesh asher veerets mitserayiim veet-vatey elohey-mitserayiim yisherof vaesh {f}

Hebrew: הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָיָ֣ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ אֶ֚ל כׇּל־הַיְּהוּדִ֔ים הַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם הַיֹּשְׁבִ֤ים בְּמִגְדֹּל֙ וּבְתַחְפַּנְחֵ֣ס וּבְנֹ֔ף וּבְאֶ֥רֶץ פַּתְר֖וֹס לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word that came to Jeremiah for all the Judeans living in the land of Egypt, living in Migdol, Tahpanhes, and Noph, and in the land of Pathros:
Transliteration: hadavar asher hayah el-yiremeyahu el khׇl-hayehudiym hayosheviym veerets mitserayiim hayosheviym vemigedol uvetachefaneches uvenof uveerets fatervos lemor

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַתֶּ֣ם רְאִיתֶ֗ם אֵ֤ת כׇּל־הָֽרָעָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הֵבֵ֙אתִי֙ עַל־יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־עָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה וְהִנָּ֤ם חׇרְבָּה֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה וְאֵ֥ין בָּהֶ֖ם יוֹשֵֽׁב׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: You have seen all the disaster that I brought on Jerusalem and on all the towns of Judah. They are a ruin today, and no one inhabits them,
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael atem reiytem et khׇl-haraah asher hevetiy al-yerushala͏im veal khׇl-arey yehudah vehinam chׇrevah hayyvom hazeh veeyn vahem yvoshev

Hebrew: מִפְּנֵ֣י רָעָתָ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשׂוּ֙ לְהַכְעִסֵ֔נִי לָלֶ֣כֶת לְקַטֵּ֔ר לַעֲבֹ֖ד לֵאלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א יְדָע֔וּם הֵ֖מָּה אַתֶּ֥ם וַאֲבֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: on account of the wicked things they did to vex Me, going to make offerings in worship of other gods that they had not known—neither they nor you nor your ancestors.
Transliteration: mifeney raatam asher ashu lehakheiseniy lalekhet lekater laavod lelohiym acheriym asher lo yedaum hemah atem vaavoteykhem

Hebrew: וָאֶשְׁלַ֤ח אֲלֵיכֶם֙ אֶת־כׇּל־עֲבָדַ֣י הַנְּבִיאִ֔ים הַשְׁכֵּ֥ים וְשָׁלֹ֖חַ לֵאמֹ֑ר אַל־נָ֣א תַעֲשׂ֗וּ אֵ֛ת דְּבַֽר־הַתֹּעֵבָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׂנֵֽאתִי׃
Translated: Yet I persistently sent to you all My servants the prophets, to say, “I beg you not to do this abominable thing that I hate.”
Transliteration: vaeshelach aleykhem et-khׇl-avaday haneviyiym hashekheym veshalocha lemor al-na taashu et devar-hatoevah hazot asher shanetiy

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א שָֽׁמְעוּ֙ וְלֹא־הִטּ֣וּ אֶת־אׇזְנָ֔ם לָשׁ֖וּב מֵרָעָתָ֑ם לְבִלְתִּ֥י קַטֵּ֖ר לֵאלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִֽים׃
Translated: But they would not listen or give ear, to turn back from their wickedness and not make offerings to other gods;
Transliteration: velo shameu velo-hitu et-ׇzenam lashuv meraatam leviletiy kater lelohiym acheriym

Hebrew: וַתִּתַּ֤ךְ חֲמָתִי֙ וְאַפִּ֔י וַתִּבְעַר֙ בְּעָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וּבְחֻצ֖וֹת יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַתִּהְיֶ֛ינָה לְחׇרְבָּ֥ה לִשְׁמָמָ֖ה כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: so My fierce anger was poured out, and it blazed against the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem. And they became a desolate ruin, as they still are today.
Transliteration: vatitakhe chamatiy veafiy vativear vearey yehudah uvechutsvot yerushala͏im vatiheyeynah lechׇrevah lishemamah khayyvom hazeh {s}

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֡ה כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָה֩ אֱלֹהֵ֨י צְבָא֜וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לָמָה֩ אַתֶּ֨ם עֹשִׂ֜ים רָעָ֤ה גְדוֹלָה֙ אֶל־נַפְשֹׁ֣תֵכֶ֔ם לְהַכְרִ֨ית לָכֶ֧ם אִישׁ־וְאִשָּׁ֛ה עוֹלֵ֥ל וְיוֹנֵ֖ק מִתּ֣וֹךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה לְבִלְתִּ֛י הוֹתִ֥יר לָכֶ֖ם שְׁאֵרִֽית׃
Translated: And now, thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Hosts, the God of Israel: Why are you doing such great harm to yourselves, so that every man and woman, child and infant of yours shall be cut off from the midst of Judah, and no remnant shall be left of you?
Transliteration: veatah khoh-amar yehovah elohey tsevavot elohey yisherael lamah atem oshiym raah gedvolah el-nafeshotekhem lehakheriyt lakhem iysh-veishah volel veyvonek mitvokhe yehudah leviletiy hvotiyr lakhem sheeriyt

Hebrew: לְהַכְעִסֵ֙נִי֙ בְּמַעֲשֵׂ֣י יְדֵיכֶ֔ם לְקַטֵּ֞ר לֵאלֹהִ֤ים אֲחֵרִים֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁר־אַתֶּ֥ם בָּאִ֖ים לָג֣וּר שָׁ֑ם לְמַ֙עַן֙ הַכְרִ֣ית לָכֶ֔ם וּלְמַ֤עַן הֱיֽוֹתְכֶם֙ לִקְלָלָ֣ה וּלְחֶרְפָּ֔ה בְּכֹ֖ל גּוֹיֵ֥ הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: For you vex Me by your deeds, making offering to other gods in the land of Egypt where you have come to sojourn, so that you shall be cut off and become a curse and a mockery among all the nations of earth.
Transliteration: lehakheiseniy vemaashey yedeykhem lekater lelohiym acheriym veerets mitserayiim asher-atem vaiym lagur sham lemaan hakheriyt lakhem ulemaan heyvotekhem likelalah ulecherefah vekhol gvoei haarets

Hebrew: הַֽשְׁכַחְתֶּם֩ אֶת־רָע֨וֹת אֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֜ם וְאֶת־רָע֣וֹת ׀ מַלְכֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֗ה וְאֵת֙ רָע֣וֹת נָשָׁ֔יו וְאֵת֙ רָעֹ֣תֵכֶ֔ם וְאֵ֖ת רָעֹ֣ת נְשֵׁיכֶ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשׂוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ יְהוּדָ֔ה וּבְחֻצ֖וֹת יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Have you forgotten the wicked acts of your ancestors, of the kings of Judah and their wives, and your own wicked acts and those of your wives, that were committed in the land of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
Transliteration: hashekhachetem et-ravot avvoteykhem veet-ravot malekhey yehudah veet ravot nashayv veet raotekhem veet raot nesheykhem asher ashu veerets yehudah uvechutsvot yerushala͏im

Hebrew: לֹ֣א דֻכְּא֔וּ עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וְלֹ֣א יָֽרְא֗וּ וְלֹא־הָלְכ֤וּ בְתֽוֹרָתִי֙ וּבְחֻקֹּתַ֔י אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תִּי לִפְנֵיכֶ֖ם וְלִפְנֵ֥י אֲבוֹתֵיכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: No one has shown contrition to this day, and no one has shown reverence. You have not followed the Teaching and the laws that I set before you and before your ancestors.
Transliteration: lo dukheu ad hayyvom hazeh velo yareu velo-halekhu vetvoratiy uvechukotay asher-natatiy lifeneykhem velifeney avvoteykhem {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הִנְנִ֨י שָׂ֥ם פָּנַ֛י בָּכֶ֖ם לְרָעָ֑ה וּלְהַכְרִ֖ית אֶת־כׇּל־יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to set My face against you for punishment, to cut off all of Judah.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael hineniy sham fanay vakhem leraah ulehakheriyt et-khׇl-yehudah

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתִּ֞י אֶת־שְׁאֵרִ֣ית יְהוּדָ֗ה אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֨מוּ פְנֵיהֶ֜ם לָב֣וֹא אֶרֶץ־מִצְרַ֘יִם֮ לָג֣וּר שָׁם֒ וְתַ֨מּוּ כֹ֜ל בְּאֶ֧רֶץ מִצְרַ֣יִם יִפֹּ֗לוּ בַּחֶ֤רֶב בָּרָעָב֙ יִתַּ֔מּוּ מִקָּטֹן֙ וְעַד־גָּד֔וֹל בַּחֶ֥רֶב וּבָרָעָ֖ב יָמֻ֑תוּ וְהָיוּ֙ לְאָלָ֣ה לְשַׁמָּ֔ה וְלִקְלָלָ֖ה וּלְחֶרְפָּֽה׃
Translated: I will take the remnant of Judah who turned their faces toward the land of Egypt, to go and sojourn there, and they shall be utterly consumed in the land of Egypt. They shall fall by the sword, they shall be consumed by famine; great and small alike shall die by the sword and by famine, and they shall become an execration and a desolation, a curse and a mockery.
Transliteration: velakachetiy et-sheeriyt yehudah asher-shamu feneyhem lavvo erets-mitserayiim lagur sham vetamu khol veerets mitserayiim yifolu vacherev varaav yitamu mikaton vead-gadvol vacherev uvaraav yamutu vehayu lealah leshamah velikelalah ulecherefah

Hebrew: וּפָקַדְתִּ֗י עַ֤ל הַיּֽוֹשְׁבִים֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר פָּקַ֖דְתִּי עַל־יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם בַּחֶ֖רֶב בָּרָעָ֥ב וּבַדָּֽבֶר׃
Translated: I will punish those who live in the land of Egypt as I punished Jerusalem, with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence.
Transliteration: ufakadetiy al hayyvosheviym veerets mitserayiim khaasher fakadetiy al-yerushala͏im vacherev varaav uvadaver

Hebrew: וְלֹ֨א יִהְיֶ֜ה פָּלִ֤יט וְשָׂרִיד֙ לִשְׁאֵרִ֣ית יְהוּדָ֔ה הַבָּאִ֥ים לָגֽוּר־שָׁ֖ם בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְלָשׁ֣וּב ׀ אֶ֣רֶץ יְהוּדָ֗ה אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֜מָּה מְנַשְּׂאִ֤ים אֶת־נַפְשָׁם֙ לָשׁוּב֙ לָשֶׁ֣בֶת שָׁ֔ם כִּ֥י לֹֽא־יָשׁ֖וּבוּ כִּ֥י אִם־פְּלֵטִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: Of the remnant of Judah who came to sojourn here in the land of Egypt, no survivor or fugitive shall be left to return to the land of Judah. Though they all long to return and dwell there, none shall return except [a few] survivors.
Transliteration: velo yiheyeh faliyt veshariyd lisheeriyt yehudah havaiym lagur-sham veerets mitserayiim velashuv erets yehudah asher-hemah menasheiym et-nafesham lashuv lashevet sham khiy lo-yashuvu khiy im-feletiym {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲנ֣וּ אֶֽת־יִרְמְיָ֗הוּ כׇּל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֤ים הַיֹּֽדְעִים֙ כִּֽי־מְקַטְּר֤וֹת נְשֵׁיהֶם֙ לֵאלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וְכׇל־הַנָּשִׁ֥ים הָעֹמְד֖וֹת קָהָ֣ל גָּד֑וֹל וְכׇל־הָעָ֛ם הַיֹּשְׁבִ֥ים בְּאֶרֶץ־מִצְרַ֖יִם בְּפַתְר֥וֹס לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Thereupon they answered Jeremiah—all the men who knew that their wives made offerings to other gods; all the women present, a large gathering; and all the people who lived in Pathros in the land of Egypt:
Transliteration: vayaanu et-yiremeyahu khׇl-haanashiym hayodeiym khiy-mekatervot nesheyhem lelohiym acheriym vekhׇl-hanashiym haomedvot kahal gadvol vekhׇl-haam hayosheviym veerets-mitserayiim vefatervos lemor

Hebrew: הַדָּבָ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֥רְתָּ אֵלֵ֖ינוּ בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה אֵינֶ֥נּוּ שֹׁמְעִ֖ים אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: “We will not listen to you in the matter about which you spoke to us in the name of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: hadavar asher-divareta eleynu veshem yehovah eynenu shomeiym eleykha

Hebrew: כִּי֩ עָשֹׂ֨ה נַעֲשֶׂ֜ה אֶֽת־כׇּל־הַדָּבָ֣ר ׀ אֲשֶׁר־יָצָ֣א מִפִּ֗ינוּ לְקַטֵּ֞ר לִמְלֶ֣כֶת הַשָּׁמַ֘יִם֮ וְהַסֵּֽיךְ־לָ֣הּ נְסָכִים֒ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשִׂ֜ינוּ אֲנַ֤חְנוּ וַאֲבֹתֵ֙ינוּ֙ מְלָכֵ֣ינוּ וְשָׂרֵ֔ינוּ בְּעָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וּבְחֻצ֖וֹת יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַנִּֽשְׂבַּֽע־לֶ֙חֶם֙ וַנִּהְיֶ֣ה טוֹבִ֔ים וְרָעָ֖ה לֹ֥א רָאִֽינוּ׃
Translated: On the contrary, we will do everything that we have vowed—to make offerings to the Queen of Heaven and to pour libations to her, as we used to do, we and our ancestors, our kings and our officials, in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem. For then we had plenty to eat, we were well-off, and suffered no misfortune.
Transliteration: khiy ashoh naasheh et-khׇl-hadavar asher-yatsa mifiynu lekater limelekhet hashamayiim vehaseykhe-lah nesakhiym khaasher ashiynu anachenu vaavoteynu melakheynu veshareynu vearey yehudah uvechutsvot yerushala͏im vanisheva-lechem vaniheyeh tvoviym veraah lo raiynu

Hebrew: וּמִן־אָ֡ז חָדַ֜לְנוּ לְקַטֵּ֨ר לִמְלֶ֧כֶת הַשָּׁמַ֛יִם וְהַסֵּֽךְ־לָ֥הּ נְסָכִ֖ים חָסַ֣רְנוּ כֹ֑ל וּבַחֶ֥רֶב וּבָרָעָ֖ב תָּֽמְנוּ׃
Translated: But ever since we stopped making offerings to the Queen of Heaven and pouring libations to her, we have lacked everything, and we have been consumed by the sword and by famine.
Transliteration: umin-az chadalenu lekater limelekhet hashamayiim vehasekhe-lah nesakhiym chasarenu khol uvacherev uvaraav tamenu

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־אֲנַ֤חְנוּ מְקַטְּרִים֙ לִמְלֶ֣כֶת הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וּלְהַסֵּ֥ךְ לָ֖הּ נְסָכִ֑ים הֲמִֽבַּלְעֲדֵ֣י אֲנָשֵׁ֗ינוּ עָשִׂ֨ינוּ לָ֤הּ כַּוָּנִים֙ לְהַ֣עֲצִבָ֔הֿ וְהַסֵּ֥ךְ לָ֖הּ נְסָכִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: And when we make offerings to the Queen of Heaven and pour libations to her, is it without our husbands’ approval that we have made cakes in her likeness and poured libations to her?”
Transliteration: vekhiy-anachenu mekateriym limelekhet hashamayiim ulehasekhe lah nesakhiym hamivaleadey anasheynu ashiynu lah khavaniym lehaatsivahֿ vehasekhe lah nesakhiym {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ אֶל־כׇּל־הָעָ֑ם עַל־הַגְּבָרִ֤ים וְעַל־הַנָּשִׁים֙ וְעַל־כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם הָעֹנִ֥ים אֹת֛וֹ דָּבָ֖ר לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Jeremiah replied to all the people, men and women—all the people who argued with him. He said,
Transliteration: vayomer yiremeyahu el-khׇl-haam al-hagevariym veal-hanashiym veal-khׇl-haam haoniym otvo davar lemor

Hebrew: הֲל֣וֹא אֶת־הַקִּטֵּ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר קִטַּרְתֶּ֜ם בְּעָרֵ֤י יְהוּדָה֙ וּבְחֻצ֣וֹת יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם אַתֶּ֧ם וַאֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֛ם מַלְכֵיכֶ֥ם וְשָׂרֵיכֶ֖ם וְעַ֣ם הָאָ֑רֶץ אֹתָם֙ זָכַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה וַֽתַּעֲלֶ֖ה עַל־לִבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: “Indeed, the offerings you presented in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem—you, your ancestors, your kings, your officials, and the people of the land—were remembered by G<small>OD</small> and brought to mind!
Transliteration: halvo et-hakiter asher kitaretem vearey yehudah uvechutsvot yerushala͏im atem vaavvoteykhem malekheykhem veshareykhem veam haarets otam zakhar yehovah vataaleh al-livvo

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יוּכַל֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה ע֜וֹד לָשֵׂ֗את מִפְּנֵי֙ רֹ֣עַ מַעַלְלֵיכֶ֔ם מִפְּנֵ֥י הַתּוֹעֵבֹ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲשִׂיתֶ֑ם וַתְּהִ֣י אַ֠רְצְכֶ֠ם לְחׇרְבָּ֨ה וּלְשַׁמָּ֧ה וְלִקְלָלָ֛ה מֵאֵ֥ין יוֹשֵׁ֖ב כְּהַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: When G<small>OD</small> could no longer bear your evil practices and the abominations you committed, your land became a desolate ruin and a curse, without inhabitant, as is still the case.
Transliteration: velo-yukhal yehovah vod lashet mifeney roa maaleleykhem mifeney hatvoevot asher ashiytem vatehiy aretsekhem lechׇrevah uleshamah velikelalah meeyn yvoshev khehayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: מִפְּנֵי֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר קִטַּרְתֶּ֜ם וַאֲשֶׁ֧ר חֲטָאתֶ֣ם לַיהֹוָ֗ה וְלֹ֤א שְׁמַעְתֶּם֙ בְּק֣וֹל יְהֹוָ֔ה וּבְתֹרָת֧וֹ וּבְחֻקֹּתָ֛יו וּבְעֵדְוֺתָ֖יו לֹ֣א הֲלַכְתֶּ֑ם עַל־כֵּ֞ן קָרָ֥את אֶתְכֶ֛ם הָרָעָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Because you burned incense and sinned against G<small>OD</small> and did not obey G<small>OD</small>—whose Teaching, whose laws, and whose exhortations you did not follow—therefore this disaster has befallen you, as is still the case.”
Transliteration: mifeney asher kitaretem vaasher chatatem layhovah velo shemaetem vekvol yehovah uvetoratvo uvechukotayv uveedevotayv lo halakhetem al-khen karat etekhem haraah hazot khayyvom hazeh {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יִרְמְיָ֙הוּ֙ אֶל־כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם וְאֶ֖ל כׇּל־הַנָּשִׁ֑ים שִׁמְעוּ֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה כׇּל־יְהוּדָ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Jeremiah further said to all the people, including all the women: “Hear the word of G<small>OD</small>, all Judeans in the land of Egypt!
Transliteration: vayomer yiremeyahu el-khׇl-haam veel khׇl-hanashiym shimeu devar-yehovah khׇl-yehudah asher veerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָֽה־צְבָאוֹת֩ אֱלֹהֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל לֵאמֹ֗ר אַתֶּ֨ם וּנְשֵׁיכֶ֜ם וַתְּדַבֵּ֣רְנָה בְּפִיכֶם֮ וּבִידֵיכֶ֣ם מִלֵּאתֶ֣ם ׀ לֵאמֹר֒ עָשֹׂ֨ה נַעֲשֶׂ֜ה אֶת־נְדָרֵ֗ינוּ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָדַ֙רְנוּ֙ לְקַטֵּר֙ לִמְלֶ֣כֶת הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וּלְהַסֵּ֥ךְ לָ֖הּ נְסָכִ֑ים הָקֵ֤ים תָּקִ֙ימְנָה֙ אֶת־נִדְרֵיכֶ֔ם וְעָשֹׂ֥ה תַעֲשֶׂ֖ינָה אֶת־נִדְרֵיכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: You and your wives have confirmed by deed what you spoke in words: ‘We will fulfill the vows that we made, to burn incense to the Queen of Heaven and to pour libations to her.’ So fulfill your vows; perform your vows!
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah-tsevavot elohey yisherael lemor atem unesheykhem vatedaverenah vefiykhem uviydeykhem miletem lemor ashoh naasheh et-nedareynu asher nadarenu lekater limelekhet hashamayiim ulehasekhe lah nesakhiym hakeym takiymenah et-nidereykhem veashoh taasheynah et-nidereykhem {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵן֙ שִׁמְע֣וּ דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה כׇּל־יְהוּדָ֕ה הַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם הִנְנִ֨י נִשְׁבַּ֜עְתִּי בִּשְׁמִ֤י הַגָּדוֹל֙ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אִם־יִהְיֶה֩ ע֨וֹד שְׁמִ֜י נִקְרָ֣א ׀ בְּפִ֣י ׀ כׇּל־אִ֣ישׁ יְהוּדָ֗ה אֹמֵ֛ר חַי־אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִ֖ה בְּכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: “Yet hear the word of G<small>OD</small>, all Judeans who dwell in the land of Egypt! Lo, I swear by My great name—said G<small>OD</small>—that none of Judah’s contingent in all the land of Egypt shall ever again invoke My name, saying, ‘As my Sovereign G<small>OD</small> lives!’
Transliteration: lakhen shimeu devar-yehovah khׇl-yehudah hayosheviym veerets mitserayiim hineniy nishevaetiy vishemiy hagadvol amar yehovah im-yiheyeh vod shemiy nikera vefiy khׇl-iysh yehudah omer chay-adonay yehovih vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֨י שֹׁקֵ֧ד עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם לְרָעָ֖ה וְלֹ֣א לְטוֹבָ֑ה וְתַ֩מּוּ֩ כׇל־אִ֨ישׁ יְהוּדָ֜ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר בְּאֶֽרֶץ־מִצְרַ֛יִם בַּחֶ֥רֶב וּבָרָעָ֖ב עַד־כְּלוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: I will be watchful over them to their hurt, not to their benefit; all of Judah’s contingent in the land of Egypt shall be consumed by sword and by famine, until they cease to be.
Transliteration: hineniy shoked aleyhem leraah velo letvovah vetamu khׇl-iysh yehudah asher veerets-mitserayiim vacherev uvaraav ad-khelvotam

Hebrew: וּפְלִיטֵ֨י חֶ֜רֶב יְשֻׁב֨וּן מִן־אֶ֧רֶץ מִצְרַ֛יִם אֶ֥רֶץ יְהוּדָ֖ה מְתֵ֣י מִסְפָּ֑ר וְֽיָדְע֞וּ כׇּל־שְׁאֵרִ֣ית יְהוּדָ֗ה הַבָּאִ֤ים לְאֶֽרֶץ־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לָג֣וּר שָׁ֔ם דְּבַר־מִ֥י יָק֖וּם מִמֶּ֥נִּי וּמֵהֶֽם׃
Translated: Only the few who survive the sword shall return from the land of Egypt to the land of Judah. All the remnant of Judah who came to the land of Egypt to sojourn there shall learn whose word will be fulfilled—Mine or theirs!
Transliteration: ufeliytey cherev yeshuvun min-erets mitserayiim erets yehudah metey misefar veyadeu khׇl-sheeriyt yehudah havaiym leerets-mitserayiim lagur sham devar-miy yakum mimeniy umehem

Hebrew: וְזֹאת־לָכֶ֤ם הָאוֹת֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּי־פֹקֵ֥ד אֲנִ֛י עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם בַּמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה לְמַ֙עַן֙ תֵּֽדְע֔וּ כִּי֩ ק֨וֹם יָק֧וּמוּ דְבָרַ֛י עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם לְרָעָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: “And this shall be the sign to you—declares G<small>OD</small>—that I am going to deal with you in this place, so that you may know that My threats of punishment against you will be fulfilled:
Transliteration: vezot-lakhem havot neum-yehovah khiy-foked aniy aleykhem vamakvom hazeh lemaan tedeu khiy kvom yakumu devaray aleykhem leraah {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה הִנְנִ֣י נֹ֠תֵ֠ן אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֨ה חׇפְרַ֤ע מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ בְּיַ֣ד אֹֽיְבָ֔יו וּבְיַ֖ד מְבַקְשֵׁ֣י נַפְשׁ֑וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֜תִּי אֶת־צִדְקִיָּ֣הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֗ה בְּיַ֨ד נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֧ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֛ל אֹיְב֖וֹ וּמְבַקֵּ֥שׁ נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: I will deliver Pharaoh Hophra, king of Egypt, into the hands of his enemies, those who seek his life, just as I delivered King Zedekiah of Judah into the hands of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, his enemy who sought his life.”
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah hineniy noten et-fareoh chׇfera melekhe-mitserayiim veyad oyevayv uveyad mevakeshey nafeshvo khaasher natatiy et-tsidekiyahu melekhe-yehudah veyad nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel oyevvo umevakesh nafeshvo {s}

Hebrew: הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֤ר דִּבֶּר֙ יִרְמְיָ֣הוּ הַנָּבִ֔יא אֶל־בָּר֖וּךְ בֶּן־נֵרִיָּ֑ה בְּכׇתְבוֹ֩ אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֨ים הָאֵ֤לֶּה עַל־סֵ֙פֶר֙ מִפִּ֣י יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ בַּשָּׁנָה֙ הָרְבִעִ֔ית לִיהוֹיָקִ֧ים בֶּן־יֹאשִׁיָּ֛הוּ מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word that the prophet Jeremiah spoke to Baruch son of Neriah, when he was writing these words in a scroll at Jeremiah’s dictation, in the fourth year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah:
Transliteration: hadavar asher diver yiremeyahu hanaviy el-varukhe ven-neriyah vekhׇtevvo et-hadevariym haeleh al-sefer mifiy yiremeyahu vashanah hareviiyt liyhvoyakiym ven-yoshiyahu melekhe yehudah lemor

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עָלֶ֖יךָ בָּרֽוּךְ׃
Translated: Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, concerning you, Baruch:
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael aleykha varukhe

Hebrew: אָמַ֙רְתָּ֙ אֽוֹי־נָ֣א לִ֔י כִּֽי־יָסַ֧ף יְהֹוָ֛ה יָג֖וֹן עַל־מַכְאֹבִ֑י יָגַ֙עְתִּי֙ בְּאַנְחָתִ֔י וּמְנוּחָ֖ה לֹ֥א מָצָֽאתִי׃
Translated: You say, “Woe is me! G<small>OD</small> has added grief to my pain. I am worn out with groaning, and I have found no rest.”
Transliteration: amareta voy-na liy khiy-yasaf yehovah yagvon al-makheoviy yagaetiy veanechatiy umenuchah lo matsatiy

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ תֹּאמַ֣ר אֵלָ֗יו כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנֵּ֤ה אֲשֶׁר־בָּנִ֙יתִי֙ אֲנִ֣י הֹרֵ֔ס וְאֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־נָטַ֖עְתִּי אֲנִ֣י נֹתֵ֑שׁ וְאֶת־כׇּל־הָאָ֖רֶץ הִֽיא׃
Translated: Thus shall you speak to him: “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: I am going to overthrow what I have built, and uproot what I have planted—this applies to the whole land.
Transliteration: khoh tomar elayv khoh amar yehovah hineh asher-vaniytiy aniy hores veet asher-nataetiy aniy notesh veet-khׇl-haarets hiy

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֛ה תְּבַקֶּשׁ־לְךָ֥ גְדֹל֖וֹת אַל־תְּבַקֵּ֑שׁ כִּ֡י הִנְנִי֩ מֵבִ֨יא רָעָ֤ה עַל־כׇּל־בָּשָׂר֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְנָתַתִּ֨י לְךָ֤ אֶֽת־נַפְשְׁךָ֙ לְשָׁלָ֔ל עַ֥ל כׇּל־הַמְּקֹמ֖וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר תֵּלֶךְ־שָֽׁם׃ {פ}
Translated: And do you expect great things for yourself? Don’t expect them. For I am going to bring disaster upon all flesh—declares G<small>OD</small>—but I will at least grant you your life in all the places where you may go.”
Transliteration: veatah tevakesh-lekha gedolvot al-tevakesh khiy hineniy meviy raah al-khׇl-vashar neum-yehovah venatatiy lekha et-nafeshekha leshalal al khׇl-hamekomvot asher telekhe-sham {f}

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר הָיָ֧ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־יִרְמְיָ֥הוּ הַנָּבִ֖יא עַל־הַגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> to the prophet Jeremiah concerning the nations.
Transliteration: asher hayah devar-yehovah el-yiremeyahu hanaviy al-hagvoyim

Hebrew: לְמִצְרַ֗יִם עַל־חֵ֨יל פַּרְעֹ֤ה נְכוֹ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֥ה עַל־נְהַר־פְּרָ֖ת בְּכַרְכְּמִ֑שׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִכָּ֗ה נְבֽוּכַדְרֶאצַּר֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֔ל בִּשְׁנַת֙ הָרְבִיעִ֔ית לִיהוֹיָקִ֥ים בֶּן־יֹאשִׁיָּ֖הוּ מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Concerning Egypt, about the army of Pharaoh Neco, king of Egypt, which was at the river Euphrates near Carchemish, and which was defeated by King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, in the fourth year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah.
Transliteration: lemitserayiim al-cheyl fareoh nekhvo melekhe mitserayiim asher-hayah al-nehar-ferat vekharekhemish asher hikhah nevukhaderetsar melekhe vavel vishenat hareviyiyt liyhvoyakiym ven-yoshiyahu melekhe yehudah

Hebrew: עִרְכ֤וּ מָגֵן֙ וְצִנָּ֔ה וּגְשׁ֖וּ לַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
Get ready buckler and shield,
And move forward to battle!
Transliteration: irekhu magen vetsinah ugeshu lamilechamah

Hebrew: אִסְר֣וּ הַסּוּסִ֗ים וַֽעֲלוּ֙ הַפָּ֣רָשִׁ֔ים וְהִֽתְיַצְּב֖וּ בְּכוֹבָעִ֑ים מִרְקוּ֙ הָרְמָחִ֔ים לִבְשׁ֖וּ הַסִּרְיֹנֹֽת׃
Translated:
Harness the horses;
Mount, you riders!
Fall in line, helmets on!
Burnish the lances,
Don your armor!
Transliteration: iseru hasusiym vaalu hafarashiym vehiteyatsevu vekhvovaiym mireku haremachiym liveshu hasireyonot

Hebrew: מַדּ֣וּעַ רָאִ֗יתִי הֵ֣מָּה חַתִּים֮ נְסֹגִ֣ים אָחוֹר֒ וְגִבּוֹרֵיהֶ֣ם יֻכַּ֔תּוּ וּמָנ֥וֹס נָ֖סוּ וְלֹ֣א הִפְנ֑וּ מָג֥וֹר מִסָּבִ֖יב נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Why do I see them dismayed,
Yielding ground?
Their fighters are crushed,
They flee in haste
And do not turn back—
Terror all around!
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: madua raiytiy hemah chatiym nesogiym achvor vegivvoreyhem yukhatu umanvos nasu velo hifenu magvor misaviyv neum-yehovah

Hebrew: אַל־יָנ֣וּס הַקַּ֔ל וְאַל־יִמָּלֵ֖ט הַגִּבּ֑וֹר צָפ֙וֹנָה֙ עַל־יַ֣ד נְהַר־פְּרָ֔ת כָּשְׁל֖וּ וְנָפָֽלוּ׃
Translated:
The swift cannot get away,
The warrior cannot escape.
In the north, by the river Euphrates,
They stagger and fall.
Transliteration: al-yanus hakal veal-yimalet hagivvor tsafvonah al-yad nehar-ferat khashelu venafalu

Hebrew: מִי־זֶ֖ה כַּיְאֹ֣ר יַעֲלֶ֑ה כַּנְּהָר֕וֹת יִֽתְגָּעֲשׁ֖וּ מֵימָֽיו׃
Translated:
Who is this that rises like the Nile,
Like streams whose waters surge?
Transliteration: miy-zeh khayeor yaaleh khaneharvot yitegaashu meymayv

Hebrew: מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ כַּיְאֹ֣ר יַעֲלֶ֔ה וְכַנְּהָר֖וֹת יִתְגֹּ֣עֲשׁוּ מָ֑יִם וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אַֽעֲלֶה֙ אֲכַסֶּה־אֶ֔רֶץ אֹבִ֥ידָה עִ֖יר וְיֹ֥שְׁבֵי בָֽהּ׃
Translated:
It is Egypt that rises like the Nile,
Like streams whose waters surge,
That said, “I will rise,
I will cover the earth,
I will wipe out towns
And those who dwell in them.
Transliteration: mitserayiim khayeor yaaleh vekhaneharvot yitegoashu mayiim vayomer aaleh akhaseh-erets oviydah iyr veyoshevey vah

Hebrew: עֲל֤וּ הַסּוּסִים֙ וְהִתְהֹלְל֣וּ הָרֶ֔כֶב וְיֵצְא֖וּ הַגִּבּוֹרִ֑ים כּ֤וּשׁ וּפוּט֙ תֹּפְשֵׂ֣י מָגֵ֔ן וְלוּדִ֕ים תֹּפְשֵׂ֖י דֹּ֥רְכֵי קָֽשֶׁת׃
Translated:
Advance, O horses,
Dash madly, O chariots!
Let the warriors go forth,
Cush and Put, that grasp the shield,
And the Ludim who grasp and draw the bow!”
Transliteration: alu hasusiym vehiteholelu harekhev veeitseu hagivvoriym khush ufut tofeshey magen veludiym tofeshey dorekhey kashet

Hebrew: וְֽהַיּ֨וֹם הַה֜וּא לַֽאדֹנָ֧י יֱהֹוִ֣ה צְבָא֗וֹת י֤וֹם נְקָמָה֙ לְהִנָּקֵ֣ם מִצָּרָ֔יו וְאָכְלָ֥ה חֶ֙רֶב֙ וְשָׂ֣בְעָ֔ה וְרָוְתָ֖ה מִדָּמָ֑ם כִּ֣י זֶ֠בַח לַאדֹנָ֨י יֱהֹוִ֧ה צְבָא֛וֹת בְּאֶ֥רֶץ צָפ֖וֹן אֶל־נְהַר־פְּרָֽת׃
Translated: But that day shall be for my Sovereign G<small>OD</small> of Hosts a day for exacting retribution from all foes. The sword shall devour; it shall be sated and drunk with their blood. For my Sovereign G<small>OD</small> of Hosts is preparing a sacrifice in the northland, by the river Euphrates.
Transliteration: vehayyvom hahu ladonay yehovih tsevavot yvom nekamah lehinakem mitsarayv veakhelah cherev veshaveah veravetah midamam khiy zevach ladonay yehovih tsevavot veerets tsafvon el-nehar-ferat

Hebrew: עֲלִ֤י גִלְעָד֙ וּקְחִ֣י צֳרִ֔י בְּתוּלַ֖ת בַּת־מִצְרָ֑יִם לַשָּׁוְא֙ (הרביתי) [הִרְבֵּ֣ית] רְפֻא֔וֹת תְּעָלָ֖ה אֵ֥ין לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
Go up to Gilead and get balm,
Fair Maiden Egypt.
In vain do you seek many remedies,
There is no healing for you.
Transliteration: aliy gilead ukechiy tsoriy vetulat vat-mitserayiim lashave (hrvyty) [hireveyt] refuvot tealah eyn lakhe

Hebrew: שָׁמְע֤וּ גוֹיִם֙ קְלוֹנֵ֔ךְ וְצִוְחָתֵ֖ךְ מָלְאָ֣ה הָאָ֑רֶץ כִּֽי־גִבּ֤וֹר בְּגִבּוֹר֙ כָּשָׁ֔לוּ יַחְדָּ֖יו נָפְל֥וּ שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
Nations have heard your shame;
The earth resounds with your screams.
For warrior stumbles against warrior;
The two fall down together.
Transliteration: shameu gvoyim kelvonekhe vetsivechatekhe maleah haarets khiy-givvor vegivvor khashalu yachedayv nafelu sheneyhem {f}

Hebrew: הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶֽל־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ הַנָּבִ֑יא לָב֗וֹא נְבֽוּכַדְרֶאצַּר֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֔ל לְהַכּ֖וֹת אֶת־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: The word that G<small>OD</small> spoke to the prophet Jeremiah about the coming of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon to attack the land of Egypt:
Transliteration: hadavar asher diver yehovah el-yiremeyahu hanaviy lavvo nevukhaderetsar melekhe vavel lehakhvot et-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: הַגִּ֤ידוּ בְמִצְרַ֙יִם֙ וְהַשְׁמִ֣יעֽוּ בְמִגְדּ֔וֹל וְהַשְׁמִ֥יעוּ בְנֹ֖ף וּבְתַחְפַּנְחֵ֑ס אִמְר֗וּ הִתְיַצֵּב֙ וְהָכֵ֣ן לָ֔ךְ כִּֽי־אָכְלָ֥ה חֶ֖רֶב סְבִיבֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Declare in Egypt, proclaim in Migdol,
Proclaim in Noph and Tahpanhes!
Say: Take your posts and stand ready,
For the sword has devoured all around you!
Transliteration: hagiydu vemitserayiim vehashemiyu vemigedvol vehashemiyu venof uvetachefaneches imeru hiteyatsev vehakhen lakhe khiy-akhelah cherev seviyveykha

Hebrew: מַדּ֖וּעַ נִסְחַ֣ף אַבִּירֶ֑יךָ לֹ֣א עָמַ֔ד כִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה הֲדָפֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Why are your stalwarts swept away?
They did not stand firm,
For GOD thrust them down;
Transliteration: madua nisechaf aviyreykha lo amad khiy yehovah hadafvo

Hebrew: הִרְבָּ֖ה כּוֹשֵׁ֑ל גַּם־נָפַ֞ל אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֗הוּ וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ ק֣וּמָה ׀ וְנָשֻׁ֣בָה אֶל־עַמֵּ֗נוּ וְאֶל־אֶ֙רֶץ֙ מוֹלַדְתֵּ֔נוּ מִפְּנֵ֖י חֶ֥רֶב הַיּוֹנָֽה׃
Translated:
Many were made to stumble,
They fell over one another.
They said:
“Up! let us return to our people,
To the land of our birth,
Because of the deadly sword.”
Transliteration: hirevah khvoshel gam-nafal iysh el-reehu vayomeru kumah venashuvah el-amenu veel-erets mvoladetenu mifeney cherev hayyvonah

Hebrew: קָרְא֖וּ שָׁ֑ם פַּרְעֹ֤ה מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ שָׁא֔וֹן הֶעֱבִ֖יר הַמּוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated:
There they called Pharaoh king of Egypt:
“Braggart who let the hour go by.”
Transliteration: kareu sham fareoh melekhe-mitserayiim shavon heeviyr hamvoed

Hebrew: חַי־אָ֙נִי֙ נְאֻם־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת שְׁמ֑וֹ כִּ֚י כְּתָב֣וֹר בֶּהָרִ֔ים וּכְכַרְמֶ֖ל בַּיָּ֥ם יָבֽוֹא׃
Translated:
As I live—declares the King,
Whose name is GOD of Hosts—
As surely as Tabor is among the mountains
And Carmel is by the sea,
So shall this come to pass.
Transliteration: chay-aniy neum-hamelekhe yehovah tsevavot shemvo khiy khetavvor vehariym ukhekharemel vayam yavvo

Hebrew: כְּלֵ֤י גוֹלָה֙ עֲשִׂ֣י לָ֔ךְ יוֹשֶׁ֖בֶת בַּת־מִצְרָ֑יִם כִּי־נֹף֙ לְשַׁמָּ֣ה תִֽהְיֶ֔ה וְנִצְּתָ֖ה מֵאֵ֥ין יוֹשֵֽׁב׃ {ס}
Translated:
Equip yourself for exile,
Fair Egypt, you who dwell secure!
For Noph shall become a waste,
Desolate, without inhabitants.
Transliteration: kheley gvolah ashiy lakhe yvoshevet vat-mitserayiim khiy-nof leshamah tiheyeh venitsetah meeyn yvoshev {s}

Hebrew: עֶגְלָ֥ה יְפֵה־פִיָּ֖ה מִצְרָ֑יִם קֶ֥רֶץ מִצָּפ֖וֹן בָּ֥א בָֽא׃
Translated:
Egypt is a handsome heifer—
A gadfly from the north is coming, coming!
Transliteration: egelah yefeh-fiyah mitserayiim kerets mitsafvon va va

Hebrew: גַּם־שְׂכִרֶ֤יהָ בְקִרְבָּהּ֙ כְּעֶגְלֵ֣י מַרְבֵּ֔ק כִּֽי־גַם־הֵ֧מָּה הִפְנ֛וּ נָ֥סוּ יַחְדָּ֖יו לֹ֣א עָמָ֑דוּ כִּ֣י י֥וֹם אֵידָ֛ם בָּ֥א עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם עֵ֥ת פְּקֻדָּתָֽם׃
Translated:
The mercenaries, too, in her midst
Are like stall-fed calves;
They too shall turn tail,
Flee as one, and make no stand.
Their day of disaster is upon them,
The hour of their doom.
Transliteration: gam-shekhireyha vekirevah kheegeley marevek khiy-gam-hemah hifenu nasu yachedayv lo amadu khiy yvom eydam va aleyhem et fekudatam

Hebrew: קוֹלָ֖הּ כַּנָּחָ֣שׁ יֵלֵ֑ךְ כִּֽי־בְחַ֣יִל יֵלֵ֔כוּ וּבְקַרְדֻּמּוֹת֙ בָּ֣אוּ לָ֔הּ כְּחֹטְבֵ֖י עֵצִֽים׃
Translated:
She shall rustle away like a snake
As they come marching in force;
They shall come against her with axes,
Like hewers of wood.
Transliteration: kvolah khanachash eilekhe khiy-vechayiil eilekhu uvekaredumvot vau lah khechotevey etsiym

Hebrew: כָּרְת֤וּ יַעְרָהּ֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֖י לֹ֣א יֵחָקֵ֑ר כִּ֤י רַבּוּ֙ מֵֽאַרְבֶּ֔ה וְאֵ֥ין לָהֶ֖ם מִסְפָּֽר׃
Translated:
They shall cut down her forest
—declares GOD—
Though it cannot be measured;
For they are more numerous than locusts,
And cannot be counted.
Transliteration: kharetu yaerah neum-yehovah khiy lo eichaker khiy ravu meareveh veeyn lahem misefar

Hebrew: הֹבִ֖ישָׁה בַּת־מִצְרָ֑יִם נִתְּנָ֖ה בְּיַ֥ד עַם־צָפֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Fair Egypt shall be shamed,
Handed over to the people of the north.
Transliteration: hoviyshah vat-mitserayiim nitenah veyad am-tsafvon

Hebrew: אָמַר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה צְבָא֜וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הִנְנִ֤י פוֹקֵד֙ אֶל־אָמ֣וֹן מִנֹּ֔א וְעַל־פַּרְעֹה֙ וְעַל־מִצְרַ֔יִם וְעַל־אֱלֹהֶ֖יהָ וְעַל־מְלָכֶ֑יהָ וְעַ֨ל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְעַ֥ל הַבֹּטְחִ֖ים בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel, has said: I will inflict punishment on Amon of No and on Pharaoh—on Egypt, her gods, and her kings—on Pharaoh and all who rely on him.
Transliteration: amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael hineniy fvoked el-amvon mino veal-fareoh veal-mitserayiim veal-eloheyha veal-melakheyha veal-fareoh veal havotechiym vvo

Hebrew: וּנְתַתִּ֗ים בְּיַד֙ מְבַקְשֵׁ֣י נַפְשָׁ֔ם וּבְיַ֛ד נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֥ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל וּבְיַד־עֲבָדָ֑יו וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֛ן תִּשְׁכֹּ֥ן כִּֽימֵי־קֶ֖דֶם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: I will deliver them into the hands of those who seek to kill them, into the hands of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon and into the hands of his subjects. But afterward she shall be inhabited again as in former days, declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: unetatiym veyad mevakeshey nafesham uveyad nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel uveyad-avadayv veacharey-khen tishekhon khiymey-kedem neum-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וְ֠אַתָּ֠ה אַל־תִּירָ֞א עַבְדִּ֤י יַֽעֲקֹב֙ וְאַל־תֵּחַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֠י הִנְנִ֤י מוֹשִֽׁעֲךָ֙ מֵרָח֔וֹק וְאֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֖ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ שִׁבְיָ֑ם וְשָׁ֧ב יַעֲק֛וֹב וְשָׁקַ֥ט וְשַׁאֲנַ֖ן וְאֵ֥ין מַחֲרִֽיד׃
Translated:
But you,
Have no fear, My servant Jacob,
Be not dismayed, O Israel!
I will deliver you from far away,
Your folk from their land of captivity;
And Jacob again shall have calm
And quiet, with none to trouble him.
Transliteration: veatah al-tiyra avediy yaakov veal-techat yisherael khiy hineniy mvoshiakha merachvok veet-zareakha meerets shiveyam veshav yaakvov veshakat veshaanan veeyn machariyd

Hebrew: אַ֠תָּ֠ה אַל־תִּירָ֞א עַבְדִּ֤י יַֽעֲקֹב֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֥י אִתְּךָ֖ אָ֑נִי כִּי֩ אֶעֱשֶׂ֨ה כָלָ֜ה בְּכׇֽל־הַגּוֹיִ֣ם ׀ אֲשֶׁ֧ר הִדַּחְתִּ֣יךָ שָּׁ֗מָּה וְאֹֽתְךָ֙ לֹא־אֶעֱשֶׂ֣ה כָלָ֔ה וְיִסַּרְתִּ֙יךָ֙ לַמִּשְׁפָּ֔ט וְנַקֵּ֖ה לֹ֥א אֲנַקֶּֽךָּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
But you, have no fear,
My servant Jacob
—declares GOD—
For I am with you.
I will make an end of all the nations
Among which I have banished you,
But I will not make an end of you!
I will not leave you unpunished,
But I will chastise you in measure.
Transliteration: atah al-tiyra avediy yaakov neum-yehovah khiy itekha aniy khiy eesheh khalah vekhׇl-hagvoyim asher hidachetiykha shamah veotekha lo-eesheh khalah veyisaretiykha lamishefat venakeh lo anakekha {f}

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר הָיָ֧ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־יִרְמְיָ֥הוּ הַנָּבִ֖יא אֶל־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים בְּטֶ֛רֶם יַכֶּ֥ה פַרְעֹ֖ה אֶת־עַזָּֽה׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> that came to the prophet Jeremiah concerning the Philistines, before Pharaoh conquered Gaza.
Transliteration: asher hayah devar-yehovah el-yiremeyahu hanaviy el-felishetiym veterem yakheh fareoh et-azah

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה הִנֵּה־מַ֜יִם עֹלִ֤ים מִצָּפוֹן֙ וְהָיוּ֙ לְנַ֣חַל שׁוֹטֵ֔ף וְיִשְׁטְפוּ֙ אֶ֣רֶץ וּמְלוֹאָ֔הּ עִ֖יר וְיֹ֣שְׁבֵי בָ֑הּ וְזָעֲקוּ֙ הָאָדָ֔ם וְהֵילִ֕ל כֹּ֖ל יוֹשֵׁ֥ב הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
See, waters are rising from the north,
They shall become a raging torrent,
They shall flood the land and its creatures,
The towns and their inhabitants.
People shall cry out,
All the inhabitants of the land shall howl,
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah hineh-mayiim oliym mitsafvon vehayu lenachal shvotef veyishetefu erets umelvoah iyr veyoshevey vah vezaaku haadam veheylil khol yvoshev haarets

Hebrew: מִקּ֗וֹל שַֽׁעֲטַת֙ פַּרְס֣וֹת אַבִּירָ֔יו מֵרַ֣עַשׁ לְרִכְבּ֔וֹ הֲמ֖וֹן גַּלְגִּלָּ֑יו לֹא־הִפְנ֤וּ אָבוֹת֙ אֶל־בָּנִ֔ים מֵרִפְי֖וֹן יָדָֽיִם׃
Translated:
At the clatter of the stamping hoofs of Pharaoh’s stallions,
At the noise of his chariots,
The rumbling of their wheels,
Parents shall not look to their children
Out of sheer helplessness
Transliteration: mikvol shaatat faresvot aviyrayv meraash lerikhevvo hamvon galegilayv lo-hifenu avvot el-vaniym merifeyvon yadayiim

Hebrew: עַל־הַיּ֗וֹם הַבָּא֙ לִשְׁד֣וֹד אֶת־כׇּל־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים לְהַכְרִ֤ית לְצֹר֙ וּלְצִיד֔וֹן כֹּ֖ל שָׂרִ֣יד עֹזֵ֑ר כִּֽי־שֹׁדֵ֤ד יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים שְׁאֵרִ֖ית אִ֥י כַפְתּֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Because of the day that is coming
For ravaging all the Philistines,
For cutting off every last ally
Of Tyre and Sidon.
For GOD will ravage the Philistines,
The remnant from the island of Caphtor.
Transliteration: al-hayyvom hava lishedvod et-khׇl-felishetiym lehakheriyt letsor uletsiydvon khol shariyd ozer khiy-shoded yehovah et-felishetiym sheeriyt iy khafetvor

Hebrew: בָּ֤אָה קׇרְחָה֙ אֶל־עַזָּ֔ה נִדְמְתָ֥ה אַשְׁקְל֖וֹן שְׁאֵרִ֣ית עִמְקָ֑ם עַד־מָתַ֖י תִּתְגּוֹדָֽדִי׃
Translated:
Baldness has come upon Gaza,
Ashkelon is destroyed.
O remnant of their valley,
How long will you gash yourself?
Transliteration: vaah kׇrechah el-azah nidemetah ashekelvon sheeriyt imekam ad-matay titegvodadiy

Hebrew: ה֗וֹי חֶ֚רֶב לַיהֹוָ֔ה עַד־אָ֖נָה לֹ֣א תִשְׁקֹ֑טִי הֵאָֽסְפִי֙ אֶל־תַּעְרֵ֔ךְ הֵרָגְעִ֖י וָדֹֽמִּי׃
Translated:
“O sword of GOD,
When will you be quiet at last?
Withdraw into your sheath,
Rest and be still!”
Transliteration: hvoy cherev layhovah ad-anah lo tishekotiy heasefiy el-taerekhe herageiy vadomiy

Hebrew: אֵ֣יךְ תִּשְׁקֹ֔טִי וַיהֹוָ֖ה צִוָּה־לָ֑הּ אֶֽל־אַשְׁקְל֛וֹן וְאֶל־ח֥וֹף הַיָּ֖ם שָׁ֥ם יְעָדָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
How can it be quiet
When GOD has given it orders
Against Ashkelon and the seacoast,
Given it assignment there?
Transliteration: eykhe tishekotiy vayhovah tsivah-lah el-ashekelvon veel-chvof hayam sham yeadah {f}

Hebrew: לְמוֹאָ֡ב כֹּה־אָמַר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה צְבָא֜וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל ה֤וֹי אֶל־נְבוֹ֙ כִּ֣י שֻׁדָּ֔דָה הֹבִ֥ישָׁה נִלְכְּדָ֖ה קִרְיָתָ֑יִם הֹבִ֥ישָׁה הַמִּשְׂגָּ֖ב וָחָֽתָּה׃
Translated:
Concerning Moab.
Thus said GOD of Hosts, the God of Israel:
Alas, that Nebo should be ravaged,
Kiriathaim captured and shamed,
The stronghold shamed and dismayed!
Transliteration: lemvoav khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael hvoy el-nevvo khiy shudadah hoviyshah nilekhedah kireyatayiim hoviyshah hamishegav vachatah

Hebrew: אֵ֣ין עוֹד֮ תְּהִלַּ֣ת מוֹאָב֒ בְּחֶשְׁבּ֗וֹן חָשְׁב֤וּ עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ רָעָ֔ה לְכ֖וּ וְנַכְרִיתֶ֣נָּה מִגּ֑וֹי גַּם־מַדְמֵ֣ן תִּדֹּ֔מִּי אַחֲרַ֖יִךְ תֵּ֥לֶךְ חָֽרֶב׃
Translated:
Moab’s glory is no more;
In Heshbon they have planned evil against her:
“Come, let us make an end of her as a nation!”
You too, O Madmen, shall be silenced;
The sword is following you.
Transliteration: eyn vod tehilat mvoav vecheshevvon chashevu aleyha raah lekhu venakheriytenah migvoy gam-mademen tidomiy acharayiikhe telekhe charev

Hebrew: ק֥וֹל צְעָקָ֖ה מֵחֹרוֹנָ֑יִם שֹׁ֖ד וָשֶׁ֥בֶר גָּדֽוֹל׃
Translated:
Hark! an outcry from Horonaim,
Destruction and utter ruin!
Transliteration: kvol tseakah mechorvonayiim shod vashever gadvol

Hebrew: נִשְׁבְּרָ֖ה מוֹאָ֑ב הִשְׁמִ֥יעוּ זְּעָקָ֖ה (צעוריה) [צְעִירֶֽיהָ]׃
Translated:
Moab is broken;
Her young ones cry aloud;
Transliteration: nisheverah mvoav hishemiyu zeakah (tsvryh) [tseiyreyha]

Hebrew: כִּ֚י מַעֲלֵ֣ה (הלחות) [הַלֻּחִ֔ית] בִּבְכִ֖י יַעֲלֶה־בֶּ֑כִי כִּ֚י בְּמוֹרַ֣ד חוֹרֹנַ֔יִם צָרֵ֥י צַעֲקַת־שֶׁ֖בֶר שָׁמֵֽעוּ׃
Translated:
They climb to Luhith
Weeping continually;
On the descent to Horonaim
A distressing cry of anguish is heard:
Transliteration: khiy maaleh (hlchvt) [haluchiyt] vivekhiy yaaleh-vekhiy khiy vemvorad chvoronayiim tsarey tsaakat-shever shameu

Hebrew: נֻ֖סוּ מַלְּט֣וּ נַפְשְׁכֶ֑ם וְתִֽהְיֶ֔ינָה כַּעֲרוֹעֵ֖ר בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated:
Flee, save your lives!
And be like Aroer in the desert.
Transliteration: nusu maletu nafeshekhem vetiheyeynah khaarvoer vamidevar

Hebrew: כִּ֠י יַ֣עַן בִּטְחֵ֤ךְ בְּמַעֲשַׂ֙יִךְ֙ וּבְא֣וֹצְרוֹתַ֔יִךְ גַּם־אַ֖תְּ תִּלָּכֵ֑דִי וְיָצָ֤א (כמיש) [כְמוֹשׁ֙] בַּגּוֹלָ֔ה כֹּהֲנָ֥יו וְשָׂרָ֖יו (יחד) [יַחְדָּֽיו]׃
Translated:
Surely, because of your trust
In your wealth and in your treasures,
You too shall be captured.
And Chemosh shall go forth to exile,
Together with his priests and attendants.
Transliteration: khiy yaan vitechekhe vemaashayiikhe uvevotservotayiikhe gam-ate tilakhediy veyatsa (khmysh) [khemvosh] vagvolah khohanayv vesharayv (ychd) [yachedayv]

Hebrew: וְיָבֹ֨א שֹׁדֵ֜ד אֶל־כׇּל־עִ֗יר וְעִיר֙ לֹ֣א תִמָּלֵ֔ט וְאָבַ֥ד הָעֵ֖מֶק וְנִשְׁמַ֣ד הַמִּישֹׁ֑ר אֲשֶׁ֖ר אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
The ravager shall come to every town;
No town shall escape.
The valley shall be devastated
And the tableland laid waste
—because GOD has spoken.
Transliteration: veyavo shoded el-khׇl-iyr veiyr lo timalet veavad haemek venishemad hamiyshor asher amar yehovah

Hebrew: תְּנוּ־צִ֣יץ לְמוֹאָ֔ב כִּ֥י נָצֹ֖א תֵּצֵ֑א וְעָרֶ֙יהָ֙ לְשַׁמָּ֣ה תִֽהְיֶ֔ינָה מֵאֵ֥ין יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בָּהֵֽן׃
Translated:
Give wings to Moab,
For she must go hence.
Her towns shall become desolate,
With no one living in them.
Transliteration: tenu-tsiyts lemvoav khiy natso tetse veareyha leshamah tiheyeynah meeyn yvoshev vahen

Hebrew: אָר֗וּר עֹשֶׂ֛ה מְלֶ֥אכֶת יְהֹוָ֖ה רְמִיָּ֑ה וְאָר֕וּר מֹנֵ֥עַ חַרְבּ֖וֹ מִדָּֽם׃
Translated: Cursed be he who is slack in doing G<small>OD</small>’s work! Cursed be he who withholds his sword from blood!
Transliteration: arur osheh melekhet yehovah remiyah vearur monea charevvo midam

Hebrew: שַׁאֲנַ֨ן מוֹאָ֜ב מִנְּעוּרָ֗יו וְשֹׁקֵ֥ט הוּא֙ אֶל־שְׁמָרָ֔יו וְלֹֽא־הוּרַ֤ק מִכְּלִי֙ אֶל־כֶּ֔לִי וּבַגּוֹלָ֖ה לֹ֣א הָלָ֑ךְ עַל־כֵּ֗ן עָמַ֤ד טַעְמוֹ֙ בּ֔וֹ וְרֵיח֖וֹ לֹ֥א נָמָֽר׃ {ס}
Translated:
Moab has been secure from his youth on—
He is settled on his lees
And has not been poured from vessel to vessel—
He has never gone into exile.
Therefore his fine flavor has remained
And his bouquet is unspoiled.
Transliteration: shaanan mvoav mineurayv veshoket hu el-shemarayv velo-hurak mikheliy el-kheliy uvagvolah lo halakhe al-khen amad taemvo vvo vereychvo lo namar {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן הִנֵּֽה־יָמִ֤ים בָּאִים֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְשִׁלַּחְתִּי־ל֥וֹ צֹעִ֖ים וְצֵעֻ֑הוּ וְכֵלָ֣יו יָרִ֔יקוּ וְנִבְלֵיהֶ֖ם יְנַפֵּֽצוּ׃
Translated: But days are coming—declares G<small>OD</small>—when I will send to him those who will decant him; they shall empty his vessels and smash his jars.
Transliteration: lakhen hineh-yamiym vaiym neum-yehovah veshilachetiy-lvo tsoiym vetseuhu vekhelayv yariyku veniveleyhem yenafetsu

Hebrew: וּבֹ֥שׁ מוֹאָ֖ב מִכְּמ֑וֹשׁ כַּֽאֲשֶׁר־בֹּ֙שׁוּ֙ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִבֵּ֥ית אֵ֖ל מִבְטֶחָֽם׃
Translated: And Moab shall be shamed because of Chemosh, as the House of Israel were shamed because of Bethel, on whom they relied.
Transliteration: uvosh mvoav mikhemvosh khaasher-voshu veyt yisherael miveyt el mivetecham

Hebrew: אֵ֚יךְ תֹּֽאמְר֔וּ גִּבּוֹרִ֖ים אֲנָ֑חְנוּ וְאַנְשֵׁי־חַ֖יִל לַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
How can you say: We are warriors,
Valiant men for war?
Transliteration: eykhe tomeru givvoriym anachenu veaneshey-chayiil lamilechamah

Hebrew: שֻׁדַּ֤ד מוֹאָב֙ וְעָרֶ֣יהָ עָלָ֔ה וּמִבְחַ֥ר בַּחוּרָ֖יו יָרְד֣וּ לַטָּ֑בַח נְאֻ֨ם־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת שְׁמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Moab is ravaged,
His towns have been entered,
His choice young men
Have gone down to the slaughter
—declares the King whose name is GOD of Hosts.
Transliteration: shudad mvoav veareyha alah umivechar vachurayv yaredu latavach neum-hamelekhe yehovah tsevavot shemvo

Hebrew: קָר֥וֹב אֵיד־מוֹאָ֖ב לָב֑וֹא וְרָ֣עָת֔וֹ מִהֲרָ֖ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
The doom of Moab is coming close,
His downfall is approaching swiftly.
Transliteration: karvov eyd-mvoav lavvo veraatvo miharah meod

Hebrew: נֻ֤דוּ לוֹ֙ כׇּל־סְבִיבָ֔יו וְכֹ֖ל יֹדְעֵ֣י שְׁמ֑וֹ אִמְר֗וּ אֵיכָ֤ה נִשְׁבַּר֙ מַטֵּה־עֹ֔ז מַקֵּ֖ל תִּפְאָרָֽה׃
Translated:
Condole with him, all who live near him,
All you who know him by name!
Say: “Alas, the strong rod is broken,
The lordly staff!”
Transliteration: nudu lvo khׇl-seviyvayv vekhol yodeey shemvo imeru eykhah nishevar mateh-oz makel tifearah

Hebrew: רְדִ֤י מִכָּבוֹד֙ (ישבי) [וּשְׁבִ֣י] בַצָּמָ֔א יֹשֶׁ֖בֶת בַּת־דִּיב֑וֹן כִּֽי־שֹׁדֵ֤ד מוֹאָב֙ עָ֣לָה בָ֔ךְ שִׁחֵ֖ת מִבְצָרָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
Descend from glory
And sit in thirst,
O inhabitant of Fair Dibon;
For the ravager of Moab has entered your town,
He has destroyed your fortresses.
Transliteration: rediy mikhavvod (yshvy) [usheviy] vatsama yoshevet vat-diyvvon khiy-shoded mvoav alah vakhe shichet mivetsarayiikhe

Hebrew: אֶל־דֶּ֛רֶךְ עִמְדִ֥י וְצַפִּ֖י יוֹשֶׁ֣בֶת עֲרוֹעֵ֑ר שַׁאֲלִי־נָ֣ס וְנִמְלָ֔טָה אִמְרִ֖י מַה־נִּֽהְיָֽתָה׃
Translated:
Stand by the road and look out,
O inhabitant of Aroer.
Ask of him who is fleeing
And of her who is escaping:
Say, “What has happened?”
Transliteration: el-derekhe imediy vetsafiy yvoshevet arvoer shaaliy-nas venimelatah imeriy mah-niheyatah

Hebrew: הֹבִ֥ישׁ מוֹאָ֛ב כִּי־חַ֖תָּה (הילילי וזעקי) [הֵילִ֣ילוּ ׀ וּֽזְעָ֑קוּ] הַגִּ֣ידוּ בְאַרְנ֔וֹן כִּ֥י שֻׁדַּ֖ד מוֹאָֽב׃
Translated:
Moab is shamed and dismayed;
Howl and cry aloud!
Tell at the Arnon
That Moab is ravaged!
Transliteration: hoviysh mvoav khiy-chatah (hylyly vzky) [heyliylu uzeaku] hagiydu vearenvon khiy shudad mvoav

Hebrew: וּמִשְׁפָּ֥ט בָּ֖א אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַמִּישֹׁ֑ר אֶל־חֹל֥וֹן וְאֶל־יַ֖הְצָה וְעַל־(מופעת) [מֵיפָֽעַת]׃
Translated: Judgment has come upon the tableland—upon Holon, Jahzah, and Mephaath;
Transliteration: umishefat va el-erets hamiyshor el-cholvon veel-yahetsah veal-(mvft) [meyfaat]

Hebrew: וְעַל־דִּיב֣וֹן וְעַל־נְב֔וֹ וְעַל־בֵּ֖ית דִּבְלָתָֽיִם׃
Translated: upon Dibon, Nebo, and Beth-diblathaim;
Transliteration: veal-diyvvon veal-nevvo veal-veyt divelatayiim

Hebrew: וְעַ֧ל קִרְיָתַ֛יִם וְעַל־בֵּ֥ית גָּמ֖וּל וְעַל־בֵּ֥ית מְעֽוֹן׃
Translated: upon Kiriathaim, Beth-gamul, and Beth-meon;
Transliteration: veal kireyatayiim veal-veyt gamul veal-veyt mevon

Hebrew: וְעַל־קְרִיּ֖וֹת וְעַל־בׇּצְרָ֑ה וְעַ֗ל כׇּל־עָרֵי֙ אֶ֣רֶץ מוֹאָ֔ב הָרְחֹק֖וֹת וְהַקְּרֹבֽוֹת׃
Translated: upon Kerioth and Bozrah—upon all the towns of the land of Moab, far and near.
Transliteration: veal-keriyyvot veal-vׇtserah veal khׇl-arey erets mvoav harechokvot vehakerovvot

Hebrew: נִגְדְּעָה֙ קֶ֣רֶן מוֹאָ֔ב וּזְרֹע֖וֹ נִשְׁבָּ֑רָה נְאֻ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
The might of Moab has been cut down,
His strength is broken
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: nigedeah keren mvoav uzerovo nishevarah neum yehovah

Hebrew: הַשְׁכִּירֻ֕הוּ כִּ֥י עַל־יְהֹוָ֖ה הִגְדִּ֑יל וְסָפַ֤ק מוֹאָב֙ בְּקִיא֔וֹ וְהָיָ֥ה לִשְׂחֹ֖ק גַּם־הֽוּא׃
Translated:
Get him drunk
For he vaunted himself against GOD.
Moab shall vomit till he is drained,
And he too shall be a laughingstock.
Transliteration: hashekhiyruhu khiy al-yehovah higediyl vesafak mvoav vekiyvo vehayah lishechok gam-hu

Hebrew: וְאִ֣ם ׀ ל֣וֹא הַשְּׂחֹ֗ק הָיָ֤ה לְךָ֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אִם־בְּגַנָּבִ֖ים (נמצאה) [נִמְצָ֑א] כִּֽי־מִדֵּ֧י דְבָרֶ֛יךָ בּ֖וֹ תִּתְנוֹדָֽד׃
Translated:
Wasn’t Israel a laughingstock to you?
Was he ever caught among thieves,
That you should shake your head
Whenever you speak of him?
Transliteration: veim lvo hashechok hayah lekha yisherael im-veganaviym (nmtsh) [nimetsa] khiy-midey devareykha vvo titenvodad

Hebrew: עִזְב֤וּ עָרִים֙ וְשִׁכְנ֣וּ בַסֶּ֔לַע יֹשְׁבֵ֖י מוֹאָ֑ב וִֽהְי֣וּ כְיוֹנָ֔ה תְּקַנֵּ֖ן בְּעֶבְרֵ֥י פִי־פָֽחַת׃
Translated:
Desert the cities
And dwell in the crags,
O inhabitants of Moab!
Be like a dove that nests
In the sides of a pit.
Transliteration: izevu ariym veshikhenu vasela yoshevey mvoav viheyu kheyvonah tekanen veeverey fiy-fachat

Hebrew: שָׁמַ֥עְנוּ גְאוֹן־מוֹאָ֖ב גֵּאֶ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד גׇּבְה֧וֹ וּגְאוֹנ֛וֹ וְגַאֲוָת֖וֹ וְרֻ֥ם לִבּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
We have heard of Moab’s pride—
Most haughty is he—
Of his arrogance and pride,
His haughtiness and self-exaltation.
Transliteration: shamaenu gevon-mvoav geeh meod gׇvehvo ugevonvo vegaavatvo verum livvo

Hebrew: אֲנִ֤י יָדַ֙עְתִּי֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה עֶבְרָת֖וֹ וְלֹא־כֵ֑ן בַּדָּ֖יו לֹא־כֵ֥ן עָשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: I know his insolence—declares G<small>OD</small>—the wickedness that is in him, the wickedness he has committed.
Transliteration: aniy yadaetiy neum-yehovah everatvo velo-khen vadayv lo-khen ashu

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּן֙ עַל־מוֹאָ֣ב אֲיֵלִ֔יל וּלְמוֹאָ֥ב כֻּלֹּ֖ה אֶזְעָ֑ק אֶל־אַנְשֵׁ֥י קִֽיר־חֶ֖רֶשׂ יֶהְגֶּֽה׃
Translated:
Therefore I will howl for Moab,
I will cry out for all Moab,
I will moan for the people of Kir-heres.
Transliteration: al-khen al-mvoav aeiliyl ulemvoav khuloh ezeak el-aneshey kiyr-cheresh yehegeh

Hebrew: מִבְּכִ֨י יַעְזֵ֤ר אֶבְכֶּה־לָּךְ֙ הַגֶּ֣פֶן שִׂבְמָ֔ה נְטִישֹׁתַ֙יִךְ֙ עָ֣בְרוּ יָ֔ם עַ֛ד יָ֥ם יַעְזֵ֖ר נָגָ֑עוּ עַל־קֵיצֵ֥ךְ וְעַל־בְּצִירֵ֖ךְ שֹׁדֵ֥ד נָפָֽל׃
Translated:
With greater weeping than for Jazer
I weep for you, O vine of Sibmah,
Whose tendrils crossed the sea,
Reached to the sea, to Jazer.
A ravager has come down
Upon your fig and grape harvests.
Transliteration: mivekhiy yaezer evekheh-lakhe hagefen shivemah netiyshotayiikhe averu yam ad yam yaezer nagau al-keytsekhe veal-vetsiyrekhe shoded nafal

Hebrew: וְנֶאֶסְפָ֨ה שִׂמְחָ֥ה וָגִ֛יל מִכַּרְמֶ֖ל וּמֵאֶ֣רֶץ מוֹאָ֑ב וְיַ֙יִן֙ מִיקָבִ֣ים הִשְׁבַּ֔תִּי לֹא־יִדְרֹ֣ךְ הֵידָ֔ד הֵידָ֖ד לֹ֥א הֵידָֽד׃
Translated:
Rejoicing and gladness
Are gone from the farmland,
From the country of Moab;
I have put an end to wine in the presses,
No one treads [the grapes] with shouting—
The shout is a shout no more.
Transliteration: veneesefah shimechah vagiyl mikharemel umeerets mvoav veyayiin miykaviym hishevatiy lo-yiderokhe heydad heydad lo heydad

Hebrew: מִזַּעֲקַ֨ת חֶשְׁבּ֜וֹן עַד־אֶלְעָלֵ֗ה עַד־יַ֙הַץ֙ נָתְנ֣וּ קוֹלָ֔ם מִצֹּ֙עַר֙ עַד־חֹ֣רֹנַ֔יִם עֶגְלַ֖ת שְׁלִֽשִׁיָּ֑ה כִּ֚י גַּם־מֵ֣י נִמְרִ֔ים לִמְשַׁמּ֖וֹת יִהְיֽוּ׃
Translated:
There is an outcry from Heshbon to Elealeh,
They raise their voices as far as Jahaz,
From Zoar to Horonaim and Eglath-shelishiah.
The Waters of Nimrim
Shall also become desolation.
Transliteration: mizaakat cheshevvon ad-elealeh ad-yahats natenu kvolam mitsoar ad-choronayiim egelat shelishiyah khiy gam-mey nimeriym limeshamvot yiheyu

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁבַּתִּ֥י לְמוֹאָ֖ב נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה מַעֲלֶ֣ה בָמָ֔ה וּמַקְטִ֖יר לֵאלֹהָֽיו׃
Translated:
And I will make an end in Moab
—declares GOD—
Of those who offer at a shrine
And burn incense to their god.
Transliteration: vehishevatiy lemvoav neum-yehovah maaleh vamah umaketiyr lelohayv

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֞ן לִבִּ֤י לְמוֹאָב֙ כַּחֲלִלִ֣ים יֶהֱמֶ֔ה וְלִבִּי֙ אֶל־אַנְשֵׁ֣י קִֽיר־חֶ֔רֶשׂ כַּחֲלִילִ֖ים יֶהֱמֶ֑ה עַל־כֵּ֛ן יִתְרַ֥ת עָשָׂ֖ה אָבָֽדוּ׃
Translated:
Therefore,
My heart moans for Moab like a flute;
Like a flute my heart moans
For the people of Kir-heres—
Therefore,
The gains they have made shall vanish—
Transliteration: al-khen liviy lemvoav khachaliliym yehemeh veliviy el-aneshey kiyr-cheresh khachaliyliym yehemeh al-khen yiterat ashah avadu

Hebrew: כִּ֤י כׇל־רֹאשׁ֙ קׇרְחָ֔ה וְכׇל־זָקָ֖ן גְּרֻעָ֑ה עַ֤ל כׇּל־יָדַ֙יִם֙ גְּדֻדֹ֔ת וְעַל־מׇתְנַ֖יִם שָֽׂק׃
Translated:
For every head is bald
And every beard is shorn;
On all hands there are gashes,
And on the loins sackcloth.
Transliteration: khiy khׇl-rosh kׇrechah vekhׇl-zakan geruah al khׇl-yadayiim gedudot veal-mׇtenayiim shak

Hebrew: עַ֣ל כׇּל־גַּגּ֥וֹת מוֹאָ֛ב וּבִרְחֹבֹתֶ֖יהָ כֻּלֹּ֣ה מִסְפֵּ֑ד כִּי־שָׁבַ֣רְתִּי אֶת־מוֹאָ֗ב כִּכְלִ֛י אֵֽין־חֵ֥פֶץ בּ֖וֹ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
On all the roofs of Moab,
And in its squares
There is naught but lamentation;
For I have broken Moab
Like a vessel no one wants
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: al khׇl-gagvot mvoav uvirechovoteyha khuloh misefed khiy-shavaretiy et-mvoav khikheliy eyn-chefets vvo neum-yehovah

Hebrew: אֵ֥יךְ חַ֙תָּה֙ הֵילִ֔ילוּ אֵ֛יךְ הִפְנָה־עֹ֥רֶף מוֹאָ֖ב בּ֑וֹשׁ וְהָיָ֥ה מוֹאָ֛ב לִשְׂחֹ֥ק וְלִמְחִתָּ֖ה לְכׇל־סְבִיבָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated:
How he is dismayed! Wail!
How Moab has turned his back in shame!
Moab shall be a laughingstock
And a shock to all those near him.
Transliteration: eykhe chatah heyliylu eykhe hifenah-oref mvoav vvosh vehayah mvoav lishechok velimechitah lekhׇl-seviyvayv {s}

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹה֙ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנֵּ֥ה כַנֶּ֖שֶׁר יִדְאֶ֑ה וּפָרַ֥שׂ כְּנָפָ֖יו אֶל־מוֹאָֽב׃
Translated:
For thus said GOD:
See, he soars like an eagle
And spreads out his wings against Moab!
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah hineh khanesher yideeh ufarash khenafayv el-mvoav

Hebrew: נִלְכְּדָה֙ הַקְּרִיּ֔וֹת וְהַמְּצָד֖וֹת נִתְפָּ֑שָׂה וְֽ֠הָיָ֠ה לֵ֞ב גִּבּוֹרֵ֤י מוֹאָב֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא כְּלֵ֖ב אִשָּׁ֥ה מְצֵרָֽה׃
Translated:
Kerioth shall be captured
And the strongholds shall be seized.
In that day, the heart of Moab’s warriors
Shall be like the heart of a woman in travail.
Transliteration: nilekhedah hakeriyyvot vehametsadvot nitefashah vehayah lev givvorey mvoav vayyvom hahu khelev ishah metserah

Hebrew: וְנִשְׁמַ֥ד מוֹאָ֖ב מֵעָ֑ם כִּ֥י עַל־יְהֹוָ֖ה הִגְדִּֽיל׃
Translated:
And Moab shall be destroyed as a people,
For he vaunted himself against GOD.
Transliteration: venishemad mvoav meam khiy al-yehovah higediyl

Hebrew: פַּ֥חַד וָפַ֖חַת וָפָ֑ח עָלֶ֛יךָ יוֹשֵׁ֥ב מוֹאָ֖ב נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Terror, and pit, and trap
Upon you who dwell in Moab!
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: fachad vafachat vafach aleykha yvoshev mvoav neum-yehovah

Hebrew: (הניס) [הַנָּ֞ס] מִפְּנֵ֤י הַפַּ֙חַד֙ יִפֹּ֣ל אֶל־הַפַּ֔חַת וְהָֽעֹלֶה֙ מִן־הַפַּ֔חַת יִלָּכֵ֖ד בַּפָּ֑ח כִּֽי־אָבִ֨יא אֵלֶ֧יהָ אֶל־מוֹאָ֛ב שְׁנַ֥ת פְּקֻדָּתָ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
He who flees from the terror
Shall fall into the pit;
And he who climbs out of the pit
Shall be caught in the trap.
For I will bring upon Moab
The year of their doom
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: (hnys) [hanas] mifeney hafachad yifol el-hafachat vehaoleh min-hafachat yilakhed vafach khiy-aviy eleyha el-mvoav shenat fekudatam neum-yehovah

Hebrew: בְּצֵ֥ל חֶשְׁבּ֛וֹן עָמְד֖וּ מִכֹּ֣חַ נָסִ֑ים כִּי־אֵ֞שׁ יָצָ֣א מֵחֶשְׁבּ֗וֹן וְלֶהָבָה֙ מִבֵּ֣ין סִיח֔וֹן וַתֹּ֙אכַל֙ פְּאַ֣ת מוֹאָ֔ב וְקׇדְקֹ֖ד בְּנֵ֥י שָׁאֽוֹן׃
Translated:
In the shelter of Heshbon
Fugitives halt exhausted;
For fire went forth from Heshbon,
Flame from the midst of Sihon,
Consuming the brow of Moab,
The pate of the people of Shaon.
Transliteration: vetsel cheshevvon amedu mikhocha nasiym khiy-esh yatsa mecheshevvon velehavah miveyn siychvon vatokhal feat mvoav vekׇdekod veney shavon

Hebrew: אוֹי־לְךָ֣ מוֹאָ֔ב אָבַ֖ד עַם־כְּמ֑וֹשׁ כִּֽי־לֻקְּח֤וּ בָנֶ֙יךָ֙ בַּשֶּׁ֔בִי וּבְנֹתֶ֖יךָ בַּשִּׁבְיָֽה׃
Translated:
Woe to you, O Moab!
The people of Chemosh are undone,
For your sons are carried off into captivity,
Your daughters into exile.
Transliteration: voy-lekha mvoav avad am-khemvosh khiy-lukechu vaneykha vasheviy uvenoteykha vashiveyah

Hebrew: וְשַׁבְתִּ֧י שְׁבוּת־מוֹאָ֛ב בְּאַחֲרִ֥ית הַיָּמִ֖ים נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה עַד־הֵ֖נָּה מִשְׁפַּ֥ט מוֹאָֽב׃ {ס}
Translated:
But I will restore the fortunes of Moab in the days to come—declares GOD.
Thus far is the judgment on Moab.
Transliteration: veshavetiy shevut-mvoav veachariyt hayamiym neum-yehovah ad-henah mishefat mvoav {s}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י עַמּ֗וֹן כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הֲבָנִ֥ים אֵין֙ לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אִם־יוֹרֵ֖שׁ אֵ֣ין ל֑וֹ מַדּ֗וּעַ יָרַ֤שׁ מַלְכָּם֙ אֶת־גָּ֔ד וְעַמּ֖וֹ בְּעָרָ֥יו יָשָֽׁב׃
Translated:
Concerning the Ammonites.
Thus said GOD:
Has Israel no sons,
Has he no heir?
Then why has Milcom dispossessed Gad,
And why have his people settled in Gad’s towns?
Transliteration: liveney amvon khoh amar yehovah havaniym eyn leyisherael im-yvoresh eyn lvo madua yarash malekham et-gad veamvo vearayv yashav

Hebrew: לָכֵ֡ן הִנֵּה֩ יָמִ֨ים בָּאִ֜ים נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֗ה וְ֠הִשְׁמַעְתִּ֠י אֶל־רַבַּ֨ת בְּנֵי־עַמּ֜וֹן תְּרוּעַ֣ת מִלְחָמָ֗ה וְהָֽיְתָה֙ לְתֵ֣ל שְׁמָמָ֔ה וּבְנֹתֶ֖יהָ בָּאֵ֣שׁ תִּצַּ֑תְנָה וְיָרַ֧שׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־יֹרְשָׁ֖יו אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Assuredly, days are coming
—declares GOD—
When I will sound the alarm of war
Against Rabbah of the Ammonites;
It shall become a desolate mound,
And its villages shall be set on fire.
And Israel shall dispossess
Those who dispossessed him
—said GOD.
Transliteration: lakhen hineh yamiym vaiym neum-yehovah vehishemaetiy el-ravat veney-amvon teruat milechamah vehayetah letel shemamah uvenoteyha vaesh titsatenah veyarash yisherael et-yoreshayv amar yehovah

Hebrew: הֵילִ֨ילִי חֶשְׁבּ֜וֹן כִּ֣י שֻׁדְּדָה־עַ֗י צְעַ֘קְנָה֮ בְּנ֣וֹת רַבָּה֒ חֲגֹ֣רְנָה שַׂקִּ֔ים סְפֹ֕דְנָה וְהִתְשׁוֹטַ֖טְנָה בַּגְּדֵר֑וֹת כִּ֤י מַלְכָּם֙ בַּגּוֹלָ֣ה יֵלֵ֔ךְ כֹּהֲנָ֥יו וְשָׂרָ֖יו יַחְדָּֽיו׃
Translated:
Howl, O Heshbon, for Ai is ravaged!
Cry out, O daughters of Rabbah!
Gird on sackcloth, lament,
And run to and fro in the sheepfolds.
For Milcom shall go into exile,
Together with his priests and attendants.
Transliteration: heyliyliy cheshevvon khiy shudedah-ay tseakenah venvot ravah chagorenah shakiym sefodenah vehiteshvotatenah vagedervot khiy malekham vagvolah eilekhe khohanayv vesharayv yachedayv

Hebrew: מַה־תִּתְהַֽלְלִי֙ בָּעֲמָקִ֔ים זָ֣ב עִמְקֵ֔ךְ הַבַּ֖ת הַשּׁוֹבֵבָ֑ה הַבֹּֽטְחָה֙ בְּאֹ֣צְרֹתֶ֔יהָ מִ֖י יָב֥וֹא אֵלָֽי׃
Translated:
Why do you glory in strength,
Your strength is drained,
O rebellious daughter,
You who relied on your treasures,
[Who said:] Who dares attack me?
Transliteration: mah-titehaleliy vaamakiym zav imekekhe havat hashvovevah havotechah veotseroteyha miy yavvo elay

Hebrew: הִנְנִי֩ מֵבִ֨יא עָלַ֜יִךְ פַּ֗חַד נְאֻם־אֲדֹנָ֧י יֱהֹוִ֛ה צְבָא֖וֹת מִכׇּל־סְבִיבָ֑יִךְ וְנִדַּחְתֶּם֙ אִ֣ישׁ לְפָנָ֔יו וְאֵ֥ין מְקַבֵּ֖ץ לַנֹּדֵֽד׃
Translated:
I am bringing terror upon you
—declares my Sovereign GOD of Hosts—
From all those around you.
Every one of you shall be driven in every direction,
And none shall gather in the fugitives.
Transliteration: hineniy meviy alayiikhe fachad neum-adonay yehovih tsevavot mikhׇl-seviyvayiikhe venidachetem iysh lefanayv veeyn mekavets lanoded

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֗ן אָשִׁ֛יב אֶת־שְׁב֥וּת בְּנֵֽי־עַמּ֖וֹן נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: But afterward I will restore the fortunes of the Ammonites—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: veacharey-khen ashiyv et-shevut veney-amvon neum-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: לֶאֱד֗וֹם כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת הַאֵ֥ין ע֛וֹד חׇכְמָ֖ה בְּתֵימָ֑ן אָבְדָ֤ה עֵצָה֙ מִבָּנִ֔ים נִסְרְחָ֖ה חׇכְמָתָֽם׃
Translated:
Concerning Edom.
Thus said GOD of Hosts:
Is there no more wisdom in Teman?
Has counsel vanished from the prudent?
Has their wisdom gone stale?
Transliteration: leedvom khoh amar yehovah tsevavot haeyn vod chׇkhemah veteyman avedah etsah mivaniym niserechah chׇkhematam

Hebrew: נֻ֤סוּ הׇפְנוּ֙ הֶעְמִ֣יקוּ לָשֶׁ֔בֶת יֹשְׁבֵ֖י דְּדָ֑ן כִּ֣י אֵ֥יד עֵשָׂ֛ו הֵבֵ֥אתִי עָלָ֖יו עֵ֥ת פְּקַדְתִּֽיו׃
Translated:
Flee, turn away, sit down low,
O inhabitants of Dedan,
For I am bringing Esau’s doom upon him,
The time when I deal with him.
Transliteration: nusu hׇfenu heemiyku lashevet yoshevey dedan khiy eyd eshav hevetiy alayv et fekadetiyv

Hebrew: אִם־בֹּֽצְרִים֙ בָּ֣אוּ לָ֔ךְ לֹ֥א יַשְׁאִ֖רוּ עוֹלֵל֑וֹת אִם־גַּנָּבִ֥ים בַּלַּ֖יְלָה הִשְׁחִ֥יתוּ דַיָּֽם׃
Translated:
If vintagers were to come upon you,
Would they leave no gleanings?
Even thieves in the night
Would destroy only for their needs!
Transliteration: im-votseriym vau lakhe lo yasheiru volelvot im-ganaviym valayelah hishechiytu dayam

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אֲנִ֞י חָשַׂ֣פְתִּי אֶת־עֵשָׂ֗ו גִּלֵּ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־מִסְתָּרָ֔יו וְנֶחְבָּ֖ה לֹ֣א יוּכָ֑ל שֻׁדַּ֥ד זַרְע֛וֹ וְאֶחָ֥יו וּשְׁכֵנָ֖יו וְאֵינֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
But it is I who have bared Esau,
Have exposed his place of concealment;
He cannot hide.
His offspring is ravaged,
His kin and his neighbors—
He is no more.
Transliteration: khiy-aniy chashafetiy et-eshav gileytiy et-misetarayv venechevah lo yukhal shudad zarevo veechayv ushekhenayv veeynenu

Hebrew: עׇזְבָ֥ה יְתֹמֶ֖יךָ אֲנִ֣י אֲחַיֶּ֑ה וְאַלְמְנוֹתֶ֖יךָ עָלַ֥י תִּבְטָֽחוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
“Leave your orphans with me,
I will rear them;
Let your widows rely on me!”
Transliteration: ׇzevah yetomeykha aniy achayeh vealemenvoteykha alay tivetachu {s}

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה הִ֠נֵּ֠ה אֲשֶׁר־אֵ֨ין מִשְׁפָּטָ֜ם לִשְׁתּ֤וֹת הַכּוֹס֙ שָׁת֣וֹ יִשְׁתּ֔וּ וְאַתָּ֣ה ה֔וּא נָקֹ֖ה תִּנָּקֶ֑ה לֹ֣א תִנָּקֶ֔ה כִּ֥י שָׁתֹ֖ה תִּשְׁתֶּֽה׃
Translated: For thus said G<small>OD</small>: If they who rightly should not drink of the cup must drink it, are you the one to go unpunished? You shall not go unpunished: you will have to drink!
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah hineh asher-eyn mishefatam lishetvot hakhvos shatvo yishetu veatah hu nakoh tinakeh lo tinakeh khiy shatoh tisheteh

Hebrew: כִּ֣י בִ֤י נִשְׁבַּ֙עְתִּי֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּֽי־לְשַׁמָּ֧ה לְחֶרְפָּ֛ה לְחֹ֥רֶב וְלִקְלָלָ֖ה תִּהְיֶ֣ה בׇצְרָ֑ה וְכׇל־עָרֶ֥יהָ תִהְיֶ֖ינָה לְחׇרְב֥וֹת עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: For by Myself I swear—declares G<small>OD</small>—Bozrah shall become a desolation, a mockery, a ruin, and a curse; and all its towns shall be ruins for all time.
Transliteration: khiy viy nishevaetiy neum-yehovah khiy-leshamah lecherefah lechorev velikelalah tiheyeh vׇtserah vekhׇl-areyha tiheyeynah lechׇrevvot volam

Hebrew: שְׁמוּעָ֤ה שָׁמַ֙עְתִּי֙ מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה וְצִ֖יר בַּגּוֹיִ֣ם שָׁל֑וּחַ הִֽתְקַבְּצוּ֙ וּבֹ֣אוּ עָלֶ֔יהָ וְק֖וּמוּ לַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
I have received tidings from GOD,
And an envoy is sent out among the nations:
Assemble, and move against her,
And rise up for war!
Transliteration: shemuah shamaetiy meet yehovah vetsiyr vagvoyim shalucha hitekavetsu uvou aleyha vekumu lamilechamah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֥ה קָטֹ֛ן נְתַתִּ֖יךָ בַּגּוֹיִ֑ם בָּז֖וּי בָּאָדָֽם׃
Translated:
For I will make you least among nations,
Most despised among humankind.
Transliteration: khiy-hineh katon netatiykha vagvoyim vazuy vaadam

Hebrew: תִּֽפְלַצְתְּךָ֞ הִשִּׁ֤יא אֹתָךְ֙ זְד֣וֹן לִבֶּ֔ךָ שֹֽׁכְנִי֙ בְּחַגְוֵ֣י הַסֶּ֔לַע תֹּפְשִׂ֖י מְר֣וֹם גִּבְעָ֑ה כִּֽי־תַגְבִּ֤יהַּ כַּנֶּ֙שֶׁר֙ קִנֶּ֔ךָ מִשָּׁ֥ם אוֹרִֽידְךָ֖ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Your horrible nature,
Your arrogant heart has seduced you,
You who dwell in clefts of the rock,
Who occupy the height of the hill!
Should you nest as high as the eagle,
From there I will pull you down
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: tifelatsetekha hishiy otakhe zedvon livekha shokheniy vechagevey hasela tofeshiy mervom giveah khiy-tageviyha khanesher kinekha misham voriydekha neum-yehovah

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֥ה אֱד֖וֹם לְשַׁמָּ֑ה כֹּ֚ל עֹבֵ֣ר עָלֶ֔יהָ יִשֹּׁ֥ם וְיִשְׁרֹ֖ק עַל־כׇּל־מַכּוֹתֶֽהָ׃
Translated: And Edom shall be a cause of appallment; whoever passes by will be appalled and will hiss at all its wounds.
Transliteration: vehayetah edvom leshamah khol over aleyha yishom veyisherok al-khׇl-makhvoteha

Hebrew: כְּֽמַהְפֵּכַ֞ת סְדֹ֧ם וַעֲמֹרָ֛ה וּשְׁכֵנֶ֖יהָ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹא־יֵשֵׁ֥ב שָׁם֙ אִ֔ישׁ וְלֹא־יָג֥וּר בָּ֖הּ בֶּן־אָדָֽם׃
Translated: It shall be like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighbors—said G<small>OD</small>: nobody shall live there, no human shall sojourn there.
Transliteration: khemahefekhat sedom vaamorah ushekheneyha amar yehovah lo-eishev sham iysh velo-yagur vah ven-adam

Hebrew: הִ֠נֵּ֠ה כְּאַרְיֵ֞ה יַעֲלֶ֨ה מִגְּא֣וֹן הַיַּרְדֵּן֮ אֶל־נְוֵ֣ה אֵיתָן֒ כִּֽי־אַרְגִּ֤יעָה אֲרִיצֶ֙נּוּ֙ מֵעָלֶ֔יהָ וּמִ֥י בָח֖וּר אֵלֶ֣יהָ אֶפְקֹ֑ד כִּ֣י מִ֤י כָמ֙וֹנִי֙ וּמִ֣י יֹעִידֶ֔נִּי וּמִי־זֶ֣ה רֹעֶ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַעֲמֹ֖ד לְפָנָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: It shall be as when a lion comes up out of the jungle of the Jordan against a secure pasture: in a moment I can harry him out of it and appoint over it anyone I choose. Then who is like Me? Who can summon Me? Who is the shepherd that can stand up against Me?
Transliteration: hineh kheareeih yaaleh migevon hayareden el-neveh eytan khiy-aregiyah ariytsenu mealeyha umiy vachur eleyha efekod khiy miy khamvoniy umiy yoiydeniy umiy-zeh roeh asher yaamod lefanay {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן שִׁמְע֣וּ עֲצַת־יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר יָעַץ֙ אֶל־אֱד֔וֹם וּמַ֨חְשְׁבוֹתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָשַׁ֖ב אֶל־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י תֵימָ֑ן אִם־ל֤וֹא יִסְחָבוּם֙ צְעִירֵ֣י הַצֹּ֔אן אִם־לֹ֥א יַשִּׁ֛ים עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם נְוֵהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Hear, then, the plan that GOD has devised against Edom, and what has been purposed against the inhabitants of Teman:
Surely the shepherd boys
Shall drag them away;
Surely the pasture shall be
Aghast because of them.
Transliteration: lakhen shimeu atsat-yehovah asher yaats el-edvom umacheshevvotayv asher chashav el-yoshevey teyman im-lvo yisechavum tseiyrey hatson im-lo yashiym aleyhem nevehem

Hebrew: מִקּ֣וֹל נִפְלָ֔ם רָעֲשָׁ֖ה הָאָ֑רֶץ צְעָקָ֕ה בְּיַם־ס֖וּף נִשְׁמַ֥ע קוֹלָֽהּ׃
Translated:
At the sound of their downfall
The earth shall shake;
The sound of screaming
Shall be heard at the Sea of Reeds.
Transliteration: mikvol nifelam raashah haarets tseakah veyam-suf nishema kvolah

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה כַנֶּ֙שֶׁר֙ יַעֲלֶ֣ה וְיִדְאֶ֔ה וְיִפְרֹ֥שׂ כְּנָפָ֖יו עַל־בׇּצְרָ֑ה וְֽ֠הָיָ֠ה לֵ֞ב גִּבּוֹרֵ֤י אֱדוֹם֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא כְּלֵ֖ב אִשָּׁ֥ה מְצֵרָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
See, like an eagle he flies up,
He soars and spreads his wings against Bozrah;
And the heart of Edom’s warriors in that day
Shall be like the heart of a woman in travail.
Transliteration: hineh khanesher yaaleh veyideeh veyiferosh khenafayv al-vׇtserah vehayah lev givvorey edvom vayyvom hahu khelev ishah metserah {f}

Hebrew: לְדַמֶּ֗שֶׂק בּ֤וֹשָֽׁה חֲמָת֙ וְאַרְפָּ֔ד כִּֽי־שְׁמֻעָ֥ה רָעָ֛ה שָׁמְע֖וּ נָמֹ֑גוּ בַּיָּ֣ם דְּאָגָ֔ה הַשְׁקֵ֖ט לֹ֥א יוּכָֽל׃
Translated:
Concerning Damascus.
Hamath and Arpad are shamed,
For they have heard bad news.
They shake with anxiety,
Like the sea that cannot rest.
Transliteration: ledameshek vvoshah chamat vearefad khiy-shemuah raah shameu namogu vayam deagah hasheket lo yukhal

Hebrew: רָפְתָ֥ה דַמֶּ֛שֶׂק הִפְנְתָ֥ה לָנ֖וּס וְרֶ֣טֶט <small>׀</small> הֶחֱזִ֑יקָה צָרָ֧ה וַחֲבָלִ֛ים אֲחָזַ֖תָּה כַּיּוֹלֵדָֽה׃
Translated:
Damascus has grown weak,
She has turned around to flee;
Trembling has seized her,
Pain and anguish have taken hold of her,
Like a woman in childbirth.
Transliteration: rafetah dameshek hifenetah lanus veretet <small></small> hecheziykah tsarah vachavaliym achazatah khayyvoledah

Hebrew: אֵ֥יךְ לֹֽא־עֻזְּבָ֖ה עִ֣יר (תהלה) [תְּהִלָּ֑ת] קִרְיַ֖ת מְשׂוֹשִֽׂי׃
Translated:
How has the glorious city not been deserted,
The citadel of my joy!
Transliteration: eykhe lo-uzevah iyr (thlh) [tehilat] kireyat meshvoshiy

Hebrew: לָכֵ֛ן יִפְּל֥וּ בַחוּרֶ֖יהָ בִּרְחֹבֹתֶ֑יהָ וְכׇל־אַנְשֵׁ֨י הַמִּלְחָמָ֤ה יִדַּ֙מּוּ֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא נְאֻ֖ם יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָאֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Assuredly, her young men shall lie fallen in her squares.
And all her warriors shall be stilled in that day
—declares GOD of Hosts.
Transliteration: lakhen yifelu vachureyha virechovoteyha vekhׇl-aneshey hamilechamah yidamu vayyvom hahu neum yehovah tsevavot

Hebrew: וְהִצַּ֥תִּי אֵ֖שׁ בְּחוֹמַ֣ת דַּמָּ֑שֶׂק וְאָכְלָ֖ה אַרְמְנ֥וֹת בֶּן־הֲדָֽד׃ {פ}
Translated:
I will set fire to the wall of Damascus,
And it shall consume the fortresses of Ben-hadad.
Transliteration: vehitsatiy esh vechvomat damashek veakhelah aremenvot ven-hadad {f}

Hebrew: לְקֵדָ֣ר ׀ וּֽלְמַמְלְכ֣וֹת חָצ֗וֹר אֲשֶׁ֤ר הִכָּה֙ (נבוכדראצור) [נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֣ר] מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֔ל כֹּ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה ק֚וּמוּ עֲל֣וּ אֶל־קֵדָ֔ר וְשׇׁדְד֖וּ אֶת־בְּנֵי־קֶֽדֶם׃
Translated:
Concerning Kedar and the kingdoms of Hazor, which King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon conquered.
Thus said GOD:
Arise, march against Kedar,
And ravage the Kedemites!
Transliteration: lekedar ulemamelekhvot chatsvor asher hikhah (nvvkhdrtsvr) [nevukhaderetsar] melekhe-vavel khoh amar yehovah kumu alu el-kedar veshׇdedu et-veney-kedem

Hebrew: אׇהֳלֵיהֶ֤ם וְצֹאנָם֙ יִקָּ֔חוּ יְרִיעוֹתֵיהֶ֧ם וְכׇל־כְּלֵיהֶ֛ם וּגְמַלֵּיהֶ֖ם יִשְׂא֣וּ לָהֶ֑ם וְקָרְא֧וּ עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם מָג֖וֹר מִסָּבִֽיב׃
Translated:
They will take away their tents and their flocks,
Their tent cloths and all their gear;
They shall carry off their camels,
And shall proclaim against them:
Terror all around!
Transliteration: ׇholeyhem vetsonam yikachu yeriyvoteyhem vekhׇl-kheleyhem ugemaleyhem yisheu lahem vekareu aleyhem magvor misaviyv

Hebrew: נֻ֩סוּ֩ נֻּ֨דוּ מְאֹ֜ד הֶעְמִ֧יקוּ לָשֶׁ֛בֶת יֹשְׁבֵ֥י חָצ֖וֹר נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּֽי־יָעַ֨ץ עֲלֵיכֶ֜ם נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֤ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶל֙ עֵצָ֔ה וְחָשַׁ֥ב (עליהם) [עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם] מַחֲשָׁבָֽה׃
Translated:
Flee, wander far,
Sit down low, O inhabitants of Hazor
—says GOD.
For King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon
Has devised a plan against you
And formed a purpose against you:
Transliteration: nusu nudu meod heemiyku lashevet yoshevey chatsvor neum-yehovah khiy-yaats aleykhem nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel etsah vechashav (lyhm) [aleykhem] machashavah

Hebrew: ק֣וּמֽוּ עֲל֗וּ אֶל־גּ֥וֹי שְׁלֵ֛יו יוֹשֵׁ֥ב לָבֶ֖טַח נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹא־דְלָתַ֧יִם וְלֹֽא־בְרִ֛יחַ ל֖וֹ בָּדָ֥ד יִשְׁכֹּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Rise up, attack a tranquil nation
That dwells secure
—says GOD—
That has no barred gates,
That dwells alone.
Transliteration: kumu alu el-gvoy sheleyv yvoshev lavetach neum-yehovah lo-delatayiim velo-veriycha lvo vadad yishekhonu

Hebrew: וְהָי֨וּ גְמַלֵּיהֶ֜ם לָבַ֗ז וַהֲמ֤וֹן מִקְנֵיהֶם֙ לְשָׁלָ֔ל וְזֵרִתִ֥ים לְכׇל־ר֖וּחַ קְצוּצֵ֣י פֵאָ֑ה וּמִכׇּל־עֲבָרָ֛יו אָבִ֥יא אֶת־אֵידָ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
