Their camels shall become booty,
And their abundant flocks a spoil;
And I will scatter to every quarter
Those who have their hair clipped;
And from every direction I will bring
Disaster upon them
—says GOD.
Transliteration: vehayu gemaleyhem lavaz vahamvon mikeneyhem leshalal vezeritiym lekhׇl-rucha ketsutsey feah umikhׇl-avarayv aviy et-eydam neum-yehovah

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֨ה חָצ֜וֹר לִמְע֥וֹן תַּנִּ֛ים שְׁמָמָ֖ה עַד־עוֹלָ֑ם לֹא־יֵשֵׁ֥ב שָׁם֙ אִ֔ישׁ וְלֹא־יָג֥וּר בָּ֖הּ בֶּן־אָדָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
Hazor shall become a lair of jackals,
A desolation for all time.
No one shall live there,
No human shall sojourn there.
Transliteration: vehayetah chatsvor limevon taniym shemamah ad-volam lo-eishev sham iysh velo-yagur vah ven-adam {s}

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר הָיָ֧ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־יִרְמְיָ֥הוּ הַנָּבִ֖יא אֶל־עֵילָ֑ם בְּרֵאשִׁ֗ית מַלְכ֛וּת צִדְקִיָּ֥ה מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> that came to the prophet Jeremiah concerning Elam, at the beginning of the reign of King Zedekiah of Judah:
Transliteration: asher hayah devar-yehovah el-yiremeyahu hanaviy el-eylam vereshiyt malekhut tsidekiyah melekhe-yehudah lemor

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת הִנְנִ֥י שֹׁבֵ֖ר אֶת־קֶ֣שֶׁת עֵילָ֑ם רֵאשִׁ֖ית גְּבוּרָתָֽם׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts: I am going to break the bow of Elam, the mainstay of their strength.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah tsevavot hineniy shover et-keshet eylam reshiyt gevuratam

Hebrew: וְהֵבֵאתִ֨י אֶל־עֵילָ֜ם אַרְבַּ֣ע רוּח֗וֹת מֵֽאַרְבַּע֙ קְצ֣וֹת הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְזֵ֣רִתִ֔ים לְכֹ֖ל הָרֻח֣וֹת הָאֵ֑לֶּה וְלֹא־יִהְיֶ֣ה הַגּ֔וֹי אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־יָב֥וֹא שָׁ֖ם נִדְּחֵ֥י (עולם) [עֵילָֽם]׃
Translated: And I shall bring four winds against Elam from the four quarters of heaven, and scatter them to all those winds. There shall not be a nation to which the fugitives from Elam do not come.
Transliteration: vehevetiy el-eylam areva ruchvot meareva ketsvot hashamayiim vezeritiym lekhol haruchvot haeleh velo-yiheyeh hagvoy asher lo-yavvo sham nidechey (vlm) [eylam]

Hebrew: וְהַחְתַּתִּ֣י אֶת־עֵ֠ילָ֠ם לִפְנֵ֨י אֹיְבֵיהֶ֜ם וְלִפְנֵ֣י ׀ מְבַקְשֵׁ֣י נַפְשָׁ֗ם וְהֵבֵאתִ֨י עֲלֵיהֶ֧ם ׀ רָעָ֛ה אֶת־חֲר֥וֹן אַפִּ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְשִׁלַּחְתִּ֤י אַחֲרֵיהֶם֙ אֶת־הַחֶ֔רֶב עַ֥ד כַּלּוֹתִ֖י אוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: And I will break Elam before their enemies, before those who seek their lives; and I will bring disaster upon them, My flaming wrath—declares G<small>OD</small>. And I will dispatch the sword after them until I have consumed them.
Transliteration: vehachetatiy et-eylam lifeney oyeveyhem velifeney mevakeshey nafesham vehevetiy aleyhem raah et-charvon afiy neum-yehovah veshilachetiy achareyhem et-hacherev ad khalvotiy votam

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֥י כִסְאִ֖י בְּעֵילָ֑ם וְהַאֲבַדְתִּ֥י מִשָּׁ֛ם מֶ֥לֶךְ וְשָׂרִ֖ים נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
And I will set My throne in Elam,
And wipe out from there king and officials
—says GOD.
Transliteration: veshametiy khiseiy veeylam vehaavadetiy misham melekhe veshariym neum-yehovah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ בְּאַחֲרִ֣ית הַיָּמִ֗ים (אשוב) [אָשִׁ֛יב] אֶת־[שְׁב֥וּת] (שבית) עֵילָ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: But in the days to come I will restore the fortunes of Elam—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vehayah veachariyt hayamiym (shvv) [ashiyv] et-[shevut] (shvyt) eylam neum-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־בָּבֶ֖ל אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ כַּשְׂדִּ֑ים בְּיַ֖ד יִרְמְיָ֥הוּ הַנָּבִֽיא׃
Translated: The word that G<small>OD</small> spoke concerning Babylon, the land of the Chaldeans, through the prophet Jeremiah:
Transliteration: hadavar asher diver yehovah el-vavel el-erets khashediym veyad yiremeyahu hanaviy

Hebrew: הַגִּ֨ידוּ בַגּוֹיִ֤ם וְהַשְׁמִ֙יעוּ֙ וּֽשְׂאוּ־נֵ֔ס הַשְׁמִ֖יעוּ אַל־תְּכַחֵ֑דוּ אִמְרוּ֩ נִלְכְּדָ֨ה בָבֶ֜ל הֹבִ֥ישׁ בֵּל֙ חַ֣ת מְרֹדָ֔ךְ הֹבִ֣ישׁוּ עֲצַבֶּ֔יהָ חַ֖תּוּ גִּלּוּלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
Declare among the nations, and proclaim;
Raise a standard, proclaim;
Hide nothing! Say:
Babylon is captured,
Bel is shamed,
Merodach is dismayed.
Her idols are shamed,
Her fetishes dismayed.
Transliteration: hagiydu vagvoyim vehashemiyu usheu-nes hashemiyu al-tekhachedu imeru nilekhedah vavel hoviysh vel chat merodakhe hoviyshu atsaveyha chatu giluleyha

Hebrew: כִּ֣י עָלָה֩ עָלֶ֨יהָ גּ֜וֹי מִצָּפ֗וֹן הֽוּא־יָשִׁ֤ית אֶת־אַרְצָהּ֙ לְשַׁמָּ֔ה וְלֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בָּ֑הּ מֵאָדָ֥ם וְעַד־בְּהֵמָ֖ה נָ֥דוּ הָלָֽכוּ׃
Translated:
For a nation from the north has attacked her,
It will make her land a desolation.
No one shall dwell in it,
Both human and animal shall wander away.
Transliteration: khiy alah aleyha gvoy mitsafvon hu-yashiyt et-aretsah leshamah velo-yiheyeh yvoshev vah meadam vead-vehemah nadu halakhu

Hebrew: בַּיָּמִ֨ים הָהֵ֜מָּה וּבָעֵ֤ת הַהִיא֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה יָבֹ֧אוּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל הֵ֥מָּה וּבְנֵי־יְהוּדָ֖ה יַחְדָּ֑ו הָל֤וֹךְ וּבָכוֹ֙ יֵלֵ֔כוּ וְאֶת־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֖ם יְבַקֵּֽשׁוּ׃
Translated: In those days and at that time—declares G<small>OD</small>—the people of Israel together with the people of Judah shall come, and they shall weep as they go to seek the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God.
Transliteration: vayamiym hahemah uvaet hahiy neum-yehovah yavou veney-yisherael hemah uveney-yehudah yachedav halvokhe uvakhvo eilekhu veet-yehovah eloheyhem yevakeshu

Hebrew: צִיּ֣וֹן יִשְׁאָ֔לוּ דֶּ֖רֶךְ הֵ֣נָּה פְנֵיהֶ֑ם בֹּ֚אוּ וְנִלְו֣וּ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּרִ֥ית עוֹלָ֖ם לֹ֥א תִשָּׁכֵֽחַ׃
Translated: They shall inquire for Zion; in that direction their faces shall turn; they shall come and attach themselves to G<small>OD</small> by a covenant for all time, which shall never be forgotten.
Transliteration: tsiyyvon yishealu derekhe henah feneyhem vou venilevu el-yehovah veriyt volam lo tishakhecha

Hebrew: צֹ֤אן אֹֽבְדוֹת֙ (היה) [הָי֣וּ] עַמִּ֔י רֹעֵיהֶ֣ם הִתְע֔וּם הָרִ֖ים (שובבים) [שׁוֹבְב֑וּם] מֵהַ֤ר אֶל־גִּבְעָה֙ הָלָ֔כוּ שָׁכְח֖וּ רִבְצָֽם׃
Translated: My people were lost sheep: their shepherds led them astray, they drove them out to the mountains, they roamed from mount to hill, they forgot their own resting place.
Transliteration: tson ovedvot (hyh) [hayu] amiy roeyhem hiteum hariym (shvvvym) [shvovevum] mehar el-giveah halakhu shakhechu rivetsam

Hebrew: כׇּל־מוֹצְאֵיהֶ֣ם אֲכָל֔וּם וְצָרֵיהֶ֥ם אָמְר֖וּ לֹ֣א נֶאְשָׁ֑ם תַּ֗חַת אֲשֶׁ֨ר חָטְא֤וּ לַֽיהֹוָה֙ נְוֵה־צֶ֔דֶק וּמִקְוֵ֥ה אֲבוֹתֵיהֶ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: All who encountered them devoured them; and their foes said, “We shall not be held guilty, because they have sinned against G<small>OD</small>, the true Pasture, the Hope of their ancestors—G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: khׇl-mvotseeyhem akhalum vetsareyhem ameru lo neesham tachat asher chateu layhovah neveh-tsedek umikeveh avvoteyhem yehovah {s}

Hebrew: נֻ֚דוּ מִתּ֣וֹךְ בָּבֶ֔ל וּמֵאֶ֥רֶץ כַּשְׂדִּ֖ים (יצאו) [צֵ֑אוּ] וִֽהְי֕וּ כְּעַתּוּדִ֖ים לִפְנֵי־צֹֽאן׃
Translated:
Flee from Babylon,
Leave the land of the Chaldeans,
And be like he-goats that lead the flock!
Transliteration: nudu mitvokhe vavel umeerets khashediym (ytsv) [tseu] viheyu kheatudiym lifeney-tson

Hebrew: כִּ֣י הִנֵּ֣ה אָנֹכִ֡י מֵעִיר֩ וּמַעֲלֶ֨ה עַל־בָּבֶ֜ל קְהַל־גּוֹיִ֤ם גְּדֹלִים֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ צָפ֔וֹן וְעָ֣רְכוּ לָ֔הּ מִשָּׁ֖ם תִּלָּכֵ֑ד חִצָּיו֙ כְּגִבּ֣וֹר מַשְׁכִּ֔יל לֹ֥א יָשׁ֖וּב רֵיקָֽם׃
Translated:
For see, I am rousing and leading
An assemblage of great nations against Babylon
From the lands of the north.
They shall draw up their lines against her,
There she shall be captured.
Their arrows are like those of a skilled warrior
Who does not turn back without hitting the mark.
Transliteration: khiy hineh anokhiy meiyr umaaleh al-vavel kehal-gvoyim gedoliym meerets tsafvon vearekhu lah misham tilakhed chitsayv khegivvor mashekhiyl lo yashuv reykam

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֥ה כַשְׂדִּ֖ים לְשָׁלָ֑ל כׇּל־שֹׁלְלֶ֥יהָ יִשְׂבָּ֖עוּ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Chaldea shall be despoiled,
All her spoilers shall be sated
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: vehayetah khashediym leshalal khׇl-sholeleyha yishevau neum-yehovah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י (תשמחי) [תִשְׂמְחוּ֙] כִּ֣י (תעלזי) [תַעַלְז֔וּ] שֹׁסֵ֖י נַחֲלָתִ֑י כִּ֤י (תפושי) [תָפ֙וּשׁוּ֙] כְּעֶגְלָ֣ה דָשָׁ֔ה (ותצהלי) [וְתִצְהֲל֖וּ] כָּאַבִּרִֽים׃
Translated:
For you rejoiced, you exulted,
You who plundered My possession;
You stamped like a heifer treading grain,
You neighed like steeds.
Transliteration: khiy (tshmchy) [tishemechu] khiy (tlzy) [taalezu] shosey nachalatiy khiy (tfvshy) [tafushu] kheegelah dashah (vttshly) [vetitsehalu] khaaviriym

Hebrew: בּ֤וֹשָׁה אִמְּכֶם֙ מְאֹ֔ד חָפְרָ֖ה יוֹלַדְתְּכֶ֑ם הִנֵּה֙ אַחֲרִ֣ית גּוֹיִ֔ם מִדְבָּ֖ר צִיָּ֥ה וַעֲרָבָֽה׃
Translated:
So your mother will be utterly shamed,
She who bore you will be disgraced.
Behold the end of the nations—
Wilderness, desert, and steppe!
Transliteration: vvoshah imekhem meod chaferah yvoladetekhem hineh achariyt gvoyim midevar tsiyah vaaravah

Hebrew: מִקֶּ֤צֶף יְהֹוָה֙ לֹ֣א תֵשֵׁ֔ב וְהָיְתָ֥ה שְׁמָמָ֖ה כֻּלָּ֑הּ כֹּ֚ל עֹבֵ֣ר עַל־בָּבֶ֔ל יִשֹּׁ֥ם וְיִשְׁרֹ֖ק עַל־כׇּל־מַכּוֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
Because of GOD’s wrath she shall not be inhabited;
She shall be utterly desolate.
Whoever passes by Babylon will be appalled
And will hiss at all her wounds.
Transliteration: miketsef yehovah lo teshev vehayetah shemamah khulah khol over al-vavel yishom veyisherok al-khׇl-makhvoteyha

Hebrew: עִרְכ֨וּ עַל־בָּבֶ֤ל <small>׀</small> סָבִיב֙ כׇּל־דֹּ֣רְכֵי קֶ֔שֶׁת יְד֣וּ אֵלֶ֔יהָ אַֽל־תַּחְמְל֖וּ אֶל־חֵ֑ץ כִּ֥י לַיהֹוָ֖ה חָטָֽאָה׃
Translated:
Range yourselves round about Babylon,
All you who draw the bow;
Shoot at her, don’t spare arrows,
For she has sinned against GOD.
Transliteration: irekhu al-vavel <small></small> saviyv khׇl-dorekhey keshet yedu eleyha al-tachemelu el-chets khiy layhovah chataah

Hebrew: הָרִ֨יעוּ עָלֶ֤יהָ סָבִיב֙ נָתְנָ֣ה יָדָ֔הּ נָֽפְלוּ֙ (אשויתיה) [אׇשְׁיוֹתֶ֔יהָ] נֶהֶרְס֖וּ חוֹמוֹתֶ֑יהָ כִּי֩ נִקְמַ֨ת יְהֹוָ֥ה הִיא֙ הִנָּ֣קְמוּ בָ֔הּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשְׂתָ֖ה עֲשׂוּ־לָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Raise a shout against her all about!
She has surrendered;
Her bastions have fallen,
Her walls are thrown down—
This is GOD’s vengeance.
Take vengeance on her,
Do to her as she has done!
Transliteration: hariyu aleyha saviyv natenah yadah nafelu (shvytyh) [ׇsheyvoteyha] neheresu chvomvoteyha khiy nikemat yehovah hiy hinakemu vah khaasher ashetah ashu-lah

Hebrew: כִּרְת֤וּ זוֹרֵ֙עַ֙ מִבָּבֶ֔ל וְתֹפֵ֥שׂ מַגָּ֖ל בְּעֵ֣ת קָצִ֑יר מִפְּנֵי֙ חֶ֣רֶב הַיּוֹנָ֔ה אִ֤ישׁ אֶל־עַמּוֹ֙ יִפְנ֔וּ וְאִ֥ישׁ לְאַרְצ֖וֹ יָנֻֽסוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Make an end in Babylon of sowers,
And of wielders of the sickle at harvest time.
Because of the deadly sword,
Everyone shall turn back to their own people,
All shall flee to their own land.
Transliteration: khiretu zvorea mivavel vetofesh magal veet katsiyr mifeney cherev hayyvonah iysh el-amvo yifenu veiysh learetsvo yanusu {s}

Hebrew: שֶׂ֧ה פְזוּרָ֛ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֲרָי֣וֹת הִדִּ֑יחוּ הָרִאשׁ֤וֹן אֲכָלוֹ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר וְזֶ֤ה הָאַֽחֲרוֹן֙ עִצְּמ֔וֹ נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֖ר מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: Israel are scattered sheep, harried by lions. First the king of Assyria devoured them, and in the end King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon crunched their bones.
Transliteration: sheh fezurah yisherael arayvot hidiychu harishvon akhalvo melekhe ashur vezeh haacharvon itsemvo nevukhaderetsar melekhe vavel {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הִנְנִ֥י פֹקֵ֛ד אֶל־מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶ֖ל וְאֶל־אַרְצ֑וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר פָּקַ֖דְתִּי אֶל־מֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּֽׁוּר׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel: I will deal with the king of Babylon and his land as I dealt with the king of Assyria.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael hineniy foked el-melekhe vavel veel-aretsvo khaasher fakadetiy el-melekhe ashur

Hebrew: וְשֹׁבַבְתִּ֤י אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶל־נָוֵ֔הוּ וְרָעָ֥ה הַכַּרְמֶ֖ל וְהַבָּשָׁ֑ן וּבְהַ֥ר אֶפְרַ֛יִם וְהַגִּלְעָ֖ד תִּשְׂבַּ֥ע נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated: And I will lead Israel back to his pasture, and he shall graze in Carmel and Bashan, and eat his fill in the hill country of Ephraim and in Gilead.
Transliteration: veshovavetiy et-yisherael el-navehu veraah hakharemel vehavashan uvehar eferayiim vehagilead tisheva nafeshvo

Hebrew: בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵם֩ וּבָעֵ֨ת הַהִ֜יא נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֗ה יְבֻקַּ֞שׁ אֶת־עֲוֺ֤ן יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאֵינֶ֔נּוּ וְאֶת־חַטֹּ֥את יְהוּדָ֖ה וְלֹ֣א תִמָּצֶ֑אינָה כִּ֥י אֶסְלַ֖ח לַאֲשֶׁ֥ר אַשְׁאִֽיר׃ {פ}
Translated:
In those days and at that time
—declares GOD—
The iniquity of Israel shall be sought,
And there shall be none;
The sins of Judah,
And none shall be found;
For I will pardon those I allow to survive.
Transliteration: vayamiym hahem uvaet hahiy neum-yehovah yevukash et-avon yisherael veeynenu veet-chatot yehudah velo timatseynah khiy eselach laasher asheiyr {f}

Hebrew: עַל־הָאָ֤רֶץ מְרָתַ֙יִם֙ עֲלֵ֣ה עָלֶ֔יהָ וְאֶל־יוֹשְׁבֵ֖י פְּק֑וֹד חֲרֹ֨ב וְהַחֲרֵ֤ם אַחֲרֵיהֶם֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַעֲשֵׂ֕ה כְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּיתִֽיךָ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Advance against her—the land of Merathaim—
And against the inhabitants of Pekod;
Ruin and destroy after them to the last
—says GOD—
Do just as I have commanded you.
Transliteration: al-haarets meratayiim aleh aleyha veel-yvoshevey fekvod charov vehacharem achareyhem neum-yehovah vaasheh khekhol asher tsiviytiykha {s}

Hebrew: ק֥וֹל מִלְחָמָ֖ה בָּאָ֑רֶץ וְשֶׁ֖בֶר גָּדֽוֹל׃
Translated:
Hark! War in the land
And vast destruction!
Transliteration: kvol milechamah vaarets veshever gadvol

Hebrew: אֵ֤יךְ נִגְדַּע֙ וַיִּשָּׁבֵ֔ר פַּטִּ֖ישׁ כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ אֵ֣יךְ הָיְתָ֧ה לְשַׁמָּ֛ה בָּבֶ֖ל בַּגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
How the hammer of the whole earth
Has been hacked and shattered!
How Babylon has become
An appallment among the nations!
Transliteration: eykhe nigeda vayishaver fatiysh khׇl-haarets eykhe hayetah leshamah vavel vagvoyim

Hebrew: יָקֹ֨שְׁתִּי לָ֤ךְ וְגַם־נִלְכַּדְתְּ֙ בָּבֶ֔ל וְאַ֖תְּ לֹ֣א יָדָ֑עַתְּ נִמְצֵאת֙ וְגַם־נִתְפַּ֔שְׂתְּ כִּ֥י בַיהֹוָ֖ה הִתְגָּרִֽית׃
Translated:
I set a snare for you, O Babylon,
And you were trapped unawares;
You were found and caught,
Because you challenged GOD.
Transliteration: yakoshetiy lakhe vegam-nilekhadete vavel veate lo yadaate nimetset vegam-nitefashete khiy vayhovah hitegariyt

Hebrew: פָּתַ֤ח יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־א֣וֹצָר֔וֹ וַיּוֹצֵ֖א אֶת־כְּלֵ֣י זַעְמ֑וֹ כִּֽי־מְלָאכָ֣ה הִ֗יא לַאדֹנָ֧י יֱהֹוִ֛ה צְבָא֖וֹת בְּאֶ֥רֶץ כַּשְׂדִּֽים׃
Translated:
GOD has opened the divine armory
And brought out the weapons of wrath;
For that is the task
Of my Sovereign GOD of Hosts
In the land of the Chaldeans.
Transliteration: fatach yehovah et-votsarvo vayyvotse et-kheley zaemvo khiy-melakhah hiy ladonay yehovih tsevavot veerets khashediym

Hebrew: בֹּֽאוּ־לָ֤הּ מִקֵּץ֙ פִּתְח֣וּ מַאֲבֻסֶ֔יהָ סׇלּ֥וּהָ כְמֽוֹ־עֲרֵמִ֖ים וְהַחֲרִימ֑וּהָ אַל־תְּהִי־לָ֖הּ שְׁאֵרִֽית׃
Translated:
Come against her from every quarter;
Break open her granaries,
Pile her up like heaps of grain,
And destroy her, let her have no remnant!
Transliteration: vou-lah mikets fitechu maavuseyha sׇluha khemvo-aremiym vehachariymuha al-tehiy-lah sheeriyt

Hebrew: חִרְבוּ֙ כׇּל־פָּרֶ֔יהָ יֵרְד֖וּ לַטָּ֑בַח ה֣וֹי עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם כִּי־בָ֥א יוֹמָ֖ם עֵ֥ת פְּקֻדָּתָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
Destroy all her bulls,
Let them go down to slaughter.
Alas for them, their day is come,
The hour of their doom!
Transliteration: chirevu khׇl-fareyha eiredu latavach hvoy aleyhem khiy-va yvomam et fekudatam {s}

Hebrew: ק֥וֹל נָסִ֛ים וּפְלֵטִ֖ים מֵאֶ֣רֶץ בָּבֶ֑ל לְהַגִּ֣יד בְּצִיּ֗וֹן אֶת־נִקְמַת֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ נִקְמַ֖ת הֵיכָלֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Hark! fugitives are escaping
From the land of Babylon,
To tell in Zion of the vengeance of the ETERNAL our God,
Vengeance for the holy temple.
Transliteration: kvol nasiym ufeletiym meerets vavel lehagiyd vetsiyyvon et-nikemat yehovah eloheynu nikemat heykhalvo

Hebrew: הַשְׁמִ֣יעוּ אֶל־בָּבֶ֣ל ׀ רַ֠בִּ֠ים כׇּל־דֹּ֨רְכֵי קֶ֜שֶׁת חֲנ֧וּ עָלֶ֣יהָ סָבִ֗יב אַל־יְהִי־[לָהּ֙] פְּלֵיטָ֔ה שַׁלְּמוּ־לָ֣הּ כְּפׇעֳלָ֔הּ כְּכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשְׂתָ֖ה עֲשׂוּ־לָ֑הּ כִּ֧י אֶל־יְהֹוָ֛ה זָ֖דָה אֶל־קְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Summon archers against Babylon,
All who draw the bow!
Encamp against her round about,
Let none of her people escape.
Pay her back for her actions,
Do to her just what she has done;
For she has acted insolently against GOD,
The Holy One of Israel.
Transliteration: hashemiyu el-vavel raviym khׇl-dorekhey keshet chanu aleyha saviyv al-yehiy-[lah] feleytah shalemu-lah khefׇolah khekhol asher ashetah ashu-lah khiy el-yehovah zadah el-kedvosh yisherael

Hebrew: לָכֵ֛ן יִפְּל֥וּ בַחוּרֶ֖יהָ בִּרְחֹבֹתֶ֑יהָ וְכׇל־אַנְשֵׁ֨י מִלְחַמְתָּ֥הּ יִדַּ֛מּוּ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Assuredly, her young men shall fall in her squares,
And all her warriors shall perish in that day
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: lakhen yifelu vachureyha virechovoteyha vekhׇl-aneshey milechametah yidamu vayyvom hahu neum-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֤י אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ זָד֔וֹן נְאֻם־אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִ֖ה צְבָא֑וֹת כִּ֛י בָּ֥א יוֹמְךָ֖ עֵ֥ת פְּקַדְתִּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I am going to deal with you, O Insolence
—declares my Sovereign GOD of Hosts—
For your day is come, the time when I doom you:
Transliteration: hineniy eleykha zadvon neum-adonay yehovih tsevavot khiy va yvomekha et fekadetiykha

Hebrew: וְכָשַׁ֤ל זָדוֹן֙ וְנָפַ֔ל וְאֵ֥ין ל֖וֹ מֵקִ֑ים וְהִצַּ֤תִּי אֵשׁ֙ בְּעָרָ֔יו וְאָכְלָ֖ה כׇּל־סְבִיבֹתָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated:
Insolence shall stumble and fall,
With none to raise her up.
I will set her cities on fire,
And it shall consume everything around her.
Transliteration: vekhashal zadvon venafal veeyn lvo mekiym vehitsatiy esh vearayv veakhelah khׇl-seviyvotayv {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת עֲשׁוּקִ֛ים בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל וּבְנֵי־יְהוּדָ֖ה יַחְדָּ֑ו וְכׇל־שֹֽׁבֵיהֶם֙ הֶחֱזִ֣יקוּ בָ֔ם מֵאֲנ֖וּ שַׁלְּחָֽם׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD of Hosts:
The people of Israel are oppressed,
And so too the people of Judah;
All their captors held them,
They refused to let them go.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah tsevavot ashukiym veney-yisherael uveney-yehudah yachedav vekhׇl-shoveyhem hecheziyku vam meanu shalecham

Hebrew: גֹּאֲלָ֣ם ׀ חָזָ֗ק יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ שְׁמ֔וֹ רִ֥יב יָרִ֖יב אֶת־רִיבָ֑ם לְמַ֙עַן֙ הִרְגִּ֣יעַ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְהִרְגִּ֖יז לְיֹשְׁבֵ֥י בָבֶֽל׃
Translated:
Their mighty Redeemer,
Whose name is GOD of Hosts,
Will champion their cause—
So as to give rest to the earth,
And unrest to the inhabitants of Babylon.
Transliteration: goalam chazak yehovah tsevavot shemvo riyv yariyv et-riyvam lemaan hiregiya et-haarets vehiregiyz leyoshevey vavel

Hebrew: חֶ֥רֶב עַל־כַּשְׂדִּ֖ים נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאֶל־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י בָבֶ֔ל וְאֶל־שָׂרֶ֖יהָ וְאֶל־חֲכָמֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
A sword against the Chaldeans
—declares GOD—
And against the inhabitants of Babylon,
Against its officials and its sages!
Transliteration: cherev al-khashediym neum-yehovah veel-yoshevey vavel veel-shareyha veel-chakhameyha

Hebrew: חֶ֥רֶב אֶל־הַבַּדִּ֖ים וְנֹאָ֑לוּ חֶ֥רֶב אֶל־גִּבּוֹרֶ֖יהָ וָחָֽתּוּ׃
Translated:
A sword against the diviners, that they be made fools of!
A sword against the warriors, that they be dismayed!
Transliteration: cherev el-havadiym venoalu cherev el-givvoreyha vachatu

Hebrew: חֶ֜רֶב אֶל־סוּסָ֣יו וְאֶל־רִכְבּ֗וֹ וְאֶל־כׇּל־הָעֶ֛רֶב אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּתוֹכָ֖הּ וְהָי֣וּ לְנָשִׁ֑ים חֶ֥רֶב אֶל־אוֹצְרֹתֶ֖יהָ וּבֻזָּֽזוּ׃
Translated:
A sword against its horses and chariots,
And against all the motley crowd in its midst,
That they become women!
A sword against its treasuries, that they be pillaged!
Transliteration: cherev el-susayv veel-rikhevvo veel-khׇl-haerev asher vetvokhah vehayu lenashiym cherev el-votseroteyha uvuzazu

Hebrew: חֹ֥רֶב אֶל־מֵימֶ֖יהָ וְיָבֵ֑שׁוּ כִּ֣י אֶ֤רֶץ פְּסִלִים֙ הִ֔יא וּבָאֵימִ֖ים יִתְהֹלָֽלוּ׃
Translated:
A drought against its waters, that they be dried up!
For it is a land of idols;
They are besotted by their dread images.
Transliteration: chorev el-meymeyha veyaveshu khiy erets fesiliym hiy uvaeymiym yiteholalu

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן יֵשְׁב֤וּ צִיִּים֙ אֶת־אִיִּ֔ים וְיָ֥שְׁבוּ בָ֖הּ בְּנ֣וֹת יַעֲנָ֑ה וְלֹא־תֵשֵׁ֥ב עוֹד֙ לָנֶ֔צַח וְלֹ֥א תִשְׁכּ֖וֹן עַד־דּ֥וֹר וָדֹֽר׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
Wildcats and hyenas shall dwell [there],
And ostriches shall dwell there;
It shall never be settled again,
Nor inhabited throughout the ages.
Transliteration: lakhen eishevu tsiyiym et-iyiym veyashevu vah venvot yaanah velo-teshev vod lanetsach velo tishekhvon ad-dvor vador

Hebrew: כְּמַהְפֵּכַ֨ת אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֶת־סְדֹ֧ם וְאֶת־עֲמֹרָ֛ה וְאֶת־שְׁכֵנֶ֖יהָ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹא־יֵשֵׁ֥ב שָׁם֙ אִ֔ישׁ וְלֹא־יָג֥וּר בָּ֖הּ בֶּן־אָדָֽם׃
Translated: It shall be as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighbors—declares G<small>OD</small>; nobody shall live there, no human shall sojourn there.
Transliteration: khemahefekhat Elohim et-sedom veet-amorah veet-shekheneyha neum-yehovah lo-eishev sham iysh velo-yagur vah ven-adam

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֛ה עַ֥ם בָּ֖א מִצָּפ֑וֹן וְג֤וֹי גָּדוֹל֙ וּמְלָכִ֣ים רַבִּ֔ים יֵעֹ֖רוּ מִיַּרְכְּתֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Lo, a people comes from the northland;
A great nation and many kings are roused
From the remotest parts of the earth.
Transliteration: hineh am va mitsafvon vegvoy gadvol umelakhiym raviym eioru miyarekhetey-arets

Hebrew: קֶ֣שֶׁת וְכִידֹ֞ן יַחֲזִ֗יקוּ אַכְזָרִ֥י הֵ֙מָּה֙ וְלֹ֣א יְרַחֵ֔מוּ קוֹלָם֙ כַּיָּ֣ם יֶהֱמֶ֔ה וְעַל־סוּסִ֖ים יִרְכָּ֑בוּ עָר֗וּךְ כְּאִישׁ֙ לַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה עָלַ֖יִךְ בַּת־בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated:
They grasp the bow and javelin,
They are cruel, they show no mercy;
The sound of them is like the roaring sea.
They ride upon horses,
Accoutered like a man for battle,
Against you, O Fair Babylon!
Transliteration: keshet vekhiydon yachaziyku akhezariy hemah velo yerachemu kvolam khayam yehemeh veal-susiym yirekhavu arukhe kheiysh lamilechamah alayiikhe vat-vavel

Hebrew: שָׁמַ֧ע מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֛ל אֶת־שִׁמְעָ֖ם וְרָפ֣וּ יָדָ֑יו צָרָה֙ הֶחֱזִיקַ֔תְהוּ חִ֖יל כַּיּוֹלֵדָֽה׃
Translated:
The king of Babylon has heard the report of them,
And his hands are weakened;
Anguish seizes him,
Pangs like a woman in childbirth.
Transliteration: shama melekhe-vavel et-shimeam verafu yadayv tsarah hecheziykatehu chiyl khayyvoledah

Hebrew: הִ֠נֵּ֠ה כְּאַרְיֵ֞ה יַעֲלֶ֨ה מִגְּא֣וֹן הַיַּרְדֵּן֮ אֶל־נְוֵ֣ה אֵיתָן֒ כִּֽי־אַרְגִּ֤עָה (ארוצם) [אֲרִיצֵם֙] מֵעָלֶ֔יהָ וּמִ֥י בָח֖וּר אֵלֶ֣יהָ אֶפְקֹ֑ד כִּ֣י מִ֤י כָמ֙וֹנִי֙ וּמִ֣י יוֹעִדֶ֔נִּי וּמִי־זֶ֣ה רֹעֶ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַעֲמֹ֖ד לְפָנָֽי׃
Translated: It shall be as when a lion comes out of the jungle of the Jordan against a secure pasture: in a moment I can harry them out of it and appoint over it anyone I choose. Then who is like Me? Who can summon Me? Who is the shepherd that can stand up against Me?
Transliteration: hineh kheareeih yaaleh migevon hayareden el-neveh eytan khiy-aregiah (rvtsm) [ariytsem] mealeyha umiy vachur eleyha efekod khiy miy khamvoniy umiy yvoideniy umiy-zeh roeh asher yaamod lefanay

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן שִׁמְע֣וּ עֲצַת־יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר יָעַץ֙ אֶל־בָּבֶ֔ל וּמַ֨חְשְׁבוֹתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָשַׁ֖ב אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ כַּשְׂדִּ֑ים אִם־לֹ֤א יִסְחָבוּם֙ צְעִירֵ֣י הַצֹּ֔אן אִם־לֹ֥א יַשִּׁ֛ים עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם נָוֶֽה׃
Translated:
Hear, then, the plan that GOD has devised against Babylon, and has purposed against the land of Chaldea:
Surely the shepherd boys
Shall drag them away;
Surely the pasture shall be
Aghast because of them.
Transliteration: lakhen shimeu atsat-yehovah asher yaats el-vavel umacheshevvotayv asher chashav el-erets khashediym im-lo yisechavum tseiyrey hatson im-lo yashiym aleyhem naveh

Hebrew: מִקּוֹל֙ נִתְפְּשָׂ֣ה בָבֶ֔ל נִרְעֲשָׁ֖ה הָאָ֑רֶץ וּזְעָקָ֖ה בַּגּוֹיִ֥ם נִשְׁמָֽע׃ {ס}
Translated:
At the sound of Babylon’s capture
The earth quakes,
And an outcry is heard among the nations.
Transliteration: mikvol nitefeshah vavel nireashah haarets uzeakah vagvoyim nishema {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנְנִי֙ מֵעִ֣יר עַל־בָּבֶ֔ל וְאֶל־יֹשְׁבֵ֖י לֵ֣ב קָמָ֑י ר֖וּחַ מַשְׁחִֽית׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
See, I am rousing a destructive wind
Against Babylon and the inhabitants of Leb-kamai.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah hineniy meiyr al-vavel veel-yoshevey lev kamay rucha mashechiyt

Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּחְתִּ֨י לְבָבֶ֤ל <small>׀</small> זָרִים֙ וְזֵר֔וּהָ וִיבֹקְק֖וּ אֶת־אַרְצָ֑הּ כִּי־הָי֥וּ עָלֶ֛יהָ מִסָּבִ֖יב בְּי֥וֹם רָעָֽה׃
Translated:
I will send strangers against Babylon, and they shall winnow her.
And they shall strip her land bare;
They shall beset her on all sides
On the day of disaster.
Transliteration: veshilachetiy levavel <small></small> zariym vezeruha viyvokeku et-aretsah khiy-hayu aleyha misaviyv veyvom raah

Hebrew: אֶֽל־יִדְרֹ֤ךְ (ידרך) הַדֹּרֵךְ֙ קַשְׁתּ֔וֹ וְאֶֽל־יִתְעַ֖ל בְּסִרְיֹנ֑וֹ וְאַֽל־תַּחְמְלוּ֙ אֶל־בַּ֣חֻרֶ֔יהָ הַחֲרִ֖ימוּ כׇּל־צְבָאָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Let the archer draw his bow,
And let him stand ready in his coat of mail!
Show no pity to her young men,
Wipe out all her host!
Transliteration: el-yiderokhe (ydrkh) hadorekhe kashetvo veel-yiteal vesireyonvo veal-tachemelu el-vachureyha hachariymu khׇl-tsevaah

Hebrew: וְנָפְל֥וּ חֲלָלִ֖ים בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כַּשְׂדִּ֑ים וּמְדֻקָּרִ֖ים בְּחוּצוֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
Let them fall slain in the land of Chaldea,
Pierced through in her streets.
Transliteration: venafelu chalaliym veerets khashediym umedukariym vechutsvoteyha

Hebrew: כִּ֠י לֹא־אַלְמָ֨ן יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל וִֽיהוּדָה֙ מֵאֱלֹהָ֔יו מֵיְהֹוָ֖ה צְבָא֑וֹת כִּ֤י אַרְצָם֙ מָלְאָ֣ה אָשָׁ֔ם מִקְּד֖וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
For Israel and Judah were not bereft
Of their God— GOD of Hosts,
But their land was filled with guilt
Before the Holy One of Israel.
Transliteration: khiy lo-aleman yisherael viyhudah meelohayv meyehovah tsevavot khiy aretsam maleah asham mikedvosh yisherael

Hebrew: נֻ֣סוּ ׀ מִתּ֣וֹךְ בָּבֶ֗ל וּמַלְּטוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ נַפְשׁ֔וֹ אַל־תִּדַּ֖מּוּ בַּעֲוֺנָ֑הּ כִּי֩ עֵ֨ת נְקָמָ֥ה הִיא֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה גְּמ֕וּל ה֥וּא מְשַׁלֵּ֖ם לָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Flee from the midst of Babylon
And save your lives, each of you!
Do not perish for her iniquity;
For this is a time of vengeance for GOD,
Who will deal retribution to her.
Transliteration: nusu mitvokhe vavel umaletu iysh nafeshvo al-tidamu vaavonah khiy et nekamah hiy layhovah gemul hu meshalem lah

Hebrew: כּוֹס־זָהָ֤ב בָּבֶל֙ בְּיַד־יְהֹוָ֔ה מְשַׁכֶּ֖רֶת כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ מִיֵּינָהּ֙ שָׁת֣וּ גוֹיִ֔ם עַל־כֵּ֖ן יִתְהֹלְל֥וּ גוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
Babylon was a golden cup in GOD’s hand,
It made the whole earth drunk;
The nations drank of her wine—
That is why the nations are mad.
Transliteration: khvos-zahav vavel veyad-yehovah meshakheret khׇl-haarets miyeynah shatu gvoyim al-khen yiteholelu gvoyim

Hebrew: פִּתְאֹ֛ם נָפְלָ֥ה בָבֶ֖ל וַתִּשָּׁבֵ֑ר הֵילִ֣ילוּ עָלֶ֗יהָ קְח֤וּ צֳרִי֙ לְמַכְאוֹבָ֔הּ אוּלַ֖י תֵּרָפֵֽא׃
Translated:
Suddenly Babylon has fallen and is shattered;
Howl over her!
Get balm for her wounds:
Perhaps she can be healed.
Transliteration: fiteom nafelah vavel vatishaver heyliylu aleyha kechu tsoriy lemakhevovah ulay terafe

Hebrew: רִפִּ֤אנוּ אֶת־בָּבֶל֙ וְלֹ֣א נִרְפָּ֔תָה עִזְב֕וּהָ וְנֵלֵ֖ךְ אִ֣ישׁ לְאַרְצ֑וֹ כִּֽי־נָגַ֤ע אֶל־הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ מִשְׁפָּטָ֔הּ וְנִשָּׂ֖א עַד־שְׁחָקִֽים׃
Translated:
We tried to cure Babylon
But she was incurable.
Let us leave her and go,
Each to our own land;
For her punishment reaches to heaven,
It is as high as the sky.
Transliteration: rifinu et-vavel velo nirefatah izevuha venelekhe iysh learetsvo khiy-naga el-hashamayiim mishefatah venisha ad-shechakiym

Hebrew: הוֹצִ֥יא יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־צִדְקֹתֵ֑ינוּ בֹּ֚אוּ וּנְסַפְּרָ֣ה בְצִיּ֔וֹן אֶֽת־מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
GOD has proclaimed our vindication;
Come, let us recount in Zion
The deeds of the ETERNAL our God.
Transliteration: hvotsiy yehovah et-tsidekoteynu vou unesaferah vetsiyyvon et-maasheh yehovah eloheynu {s}

Hebrew: הָבֵ֣רוּ הַחִצִּים֮ מִלְא֣וּ הַשְּׁלָטִים֒ הֵעִ֣יר יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶת־ר֙וּחַ֙ מַלְכֵ֣י מָדַ֔י כִּֽי־עַל־בָּבֶ֥ל מְזִמָּת֖וֹ לְהַשְׁחִיתָ֑הּ כִּֽי־נִקְמַ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ הִ֔יא נִקְמַ֖ת הֵיכָלֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Polish the arrows,
Fill the quivers!
GOD has roused the spirit of the kings of Media,
For the divine plan against Babylon is to destroy her.
This is GOD’s vengeance,
Vengeance for the holy temple.
Transliteration: haveru hachitsiym mileu hashelatiym heiyr yehovah et-rucha malekhey maday khiy-al-vavel mezimatvo lehashechiytah khiy-nikemat yehovah hiy nikemat heykhalvo

Hebrew: אֶל־חוֹמֹ֨ת בָּבֶ֜ל שְׂאוּ־נֵ֗ס הַחֲזִ֙יקוּ֙ הַמִּשְׁמָ֔ר הָקִ֙ימוּ֙ שֹֽׁמְרִ֔ים הָכִ֖ינוּ הָאֹֽרְבִ֑ים כִּ֚י גַּם־זָמַ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה גַּם־עָשָׂ֕ה אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֖ר אֶל־יֹשְׁבֵ֥י בָבֶֽל׃
Translated:
Raise a standard against the walls of Babylon!
Set up a blockade; station watchmen;
Prepare those in ambush.
For GOD has both planned and performed
What was decreed against the inhabitants of Babylon.
Transliteration: el-chvomot vavel sheu-nes hachaziyku hamishemar hakiymu shomeriym hakhiynu haoreviym khiy gam-zamam yehovah gam-ashah et asher-diver el-yoshevey vavel

Hebrew: (שכנתי) [שֹׁכַנְתְּ֙] עַל־מַ֣יִם רַבִּ֔ים רַבַּ֖ת אוֹצָרֹ֑ת בָּ֥א קִצֵּ֖ךְ אַמַּ֥ת בִּצְעֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
O you who dwell by great waters,
With vast storehouses,
Your time is come, the hour of your end.
Transliteration: (shkhnty) [shokhanete] al-mayiim raviym ravat votsarot va kitsekhe amat vitseekhe

Hebrew: נִשְׁבַּ֛ע יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת בְּנַפְשׁ֑וֹ כִּ֣י אִם־מִלֵּאתִ֤יךְ אָדָם֙ כַּיֶּ֔לֶק וְעָנ֥וּ עָלַ֖יִךְ הֵידָֽד׃ {ס}
Translated:
GOD of Hosts has wholeheartedly sworn:
I will fill you with enemies like a locust swarm,
They will raise a shout against you.
Transliteration: nisheva yehovah tsevavot venafeshvo khiy im-miletiykhe adam khayelek veanu alayiikhe heydad {s}

Hebrew: עֹשֵׂ֥ה אֶ֙רֶץ֙ בְּכֹח֔וֹ מֵכִ֥ין תֵּבֵ֖ל בְּחׇכְמָת֑וֹ וּבִתְבוּנָת֖וֹ נָטָ֥ה שָׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated:
[God] made the earth by might,
Established the world by wisdom,
And with understanding stretched out the skies.
Transliteration: osheh erets vekhochvo mekhiyn tevel vechׇkhematvo uvitevunatvo natah shamayiim

Hebrew: לְק֨וֹל תִּתּ֜וֹ הֲמ֥וֹן מַ֙יִם֙ בַּשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַיַּ֥עַל נְשִׂאִ֖ים מִקְצֵה־אָ֑רֶץ בְּרָקִ֤ים לַמָּטָר֙ עָשָׂ֔ה וַיּ֥וֹצֵא ר֖וּחַ מֵאֹצְרֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
When [God] bellows,
There is a rumbling of waters in the skies;
Vapors rise from the end of the earth,
Lightning accompanies the rain,
And wind is brought forth from God’s treasuries.
Transliteration: lekvol titvo hamvon mayiim vashamayiim vayaal neshiiym miketseh-arets verakiym lamatar ashah vayyvotse rucha meotserotayv

Hebrew: נִבְעַ֤ר כׇּל־אָדָם֙ מִדַּ֔עַת הֹבִ֥ישׁ כׇּל־צֹרֵ֖ף מִפָּ֑סֶל כִּ֛י שֶׁ֥קֶר נִסְכּ֖וֹ וְלֹא־ר֥וּחַ בָּֽם׃
Translated:
Every mortal is proved dull, without knowledge;
Every goldsmith is put to shame because of the idol,
For their molten images are a deceit—
There is no breath in them.
Transliteration: nivear khׇl-adam midaat hoviysh khׇl-tsoref mifasel khiy sheker nisekhvo velo-rucha vam

Hebrew: הֶ֣בֶל הֵ֔מָּה מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה תַּעְתֻּעִ֑ים בְּעֵ֥ת פְּקֻדָּתָ֖ם יֹאבֵֽדוּ׃
Translated:
They are delusion, a work of mockery;
In their hour of doom, they shall perish.
Transliteration: hevel hemah maasheh taetuiym veet fekudatam yovedu

Hebrew: לֹֽא־כְאֵ֜לֶּה חֵ֣לֶק יַעֲק֗וֹב כִּֽי־יוֹצֵ֤ר הַכֹּל֙ ה֔וּא וְשֵׁ֖בֶט נַחֲלָת֑וֹ יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת שְׁמֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Not like these is the Portion of Jacob—
The One who formed all things,
With Israel as a permanent possession—
Whose name is GOD of Hosts.
Transliteration: lo-kheeleh chelek yaakvov khiy-yvotser hakhol hu veshevet nachalatvo yehovah tsevavot shemvo {f}

Hebrew: מַפֵּץ־אַתָּ֣ה לִ֔י כְּלֵ֖י מִלְחָמָ֑ה וְנִפַּצְתִּ֤י בְךָ֙ גּוֹיִ֔ם וְהִשְׁחַתִּ֥י בְךָ֖ מַמְלָכֽוֹת׃
Translated:
You are My war club, [My] weapons of battle;
With you I clubbed nations,
With you I destroyed kingdoms;
Transliteration: mafets-atah liy kheley milechamah venifatsetiy vekha gvoyim vehishechatiy vekha mamelakhvot

Hebrew: וְנִפַּצְתִּ֣י בְךָ֔ ס֖וּס וְרֹכְב֑וֹ וְנִפַּצְתִּ֣י בְךָ֔ רֶ֖כֶב וְרֹכְבֽוֹ׃
Translated:
With you I clubbed horse and rider,
With you I clubbed chariot and driver,
Transliteration: venifatsetiy vekha sus verokhevvo venifatsetiy vekha rekhev verokhevvo

Hebrew: וְנִפַּצְתִּ֤י בְךָ֙ אִ֣ישׁ וְאִשָּׁ֔ה וְנִפַּצְתִּ֥י בְךָ֖ זָקֵ֣ן וָנָ֑עַר וְנִפַּצְתִּ֣י בְךָ֔ בָּח֖וּר וּבְתוּלָֽה׃
Translated:
With you I clubbed man and woman,
With you I clubbed graybeard and boy,
With you I clubbed youth and maiden;
Transliteration: venifatsetiy vekha iysh veishah venifatsetiy vekha zaken vanaar venifatsetiy vekha vachur uvetulah

Hebrew: וְנִפַּצְתִּ֤י בְךָ֙ רֹעֶ֣ה וְעֶדְר֔וֹ וְנִפַּצְתִּ֥י בְךָ֖ אִכָּ֣ר וְצִמְדּ֑וֹ וְנִפַּצְתִּ֣י בְךָ֔ פַּח֖וֹת וּסְגָנִֽים׃
Translated:
With you I clubbed shepherd and flock,
With you I clubbed plower and team,
With you I clubbed governors and prefects.
Transliteration: venifatsetiy vekha roeh veedervo venifatsetiy vekha ikhar vetsimedvo venifatsetiy vekha fachvot useganiym

Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּמְתִּ֨י לְבָבֶ֜ל וּלְכֹ֣ל ׀ יוֹשְׁבֵ֣י כַשְׂדִּ֗ים אֵ֧ת כׇּל־רָעָתָ֛ם אֲשֶׁר־עָשׂ֥וּ בְצִיּ֖וֹן לְעֵינֵיכֶ֑ם נְאֻ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
But I will requite Babylon and all the inhabitants of Chaldea
For all the wicked things they did to Zion before your eyes
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: veshilametiy levavel ulekhol yvoshevey khashediym et khׇl-raatam asher-ashu vetsiyyvon leeyneykhem neum yehovah {s}

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֨י אֵלֶ֜יךָ הַ֤ר הַמַּשְׁחִית֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה הַמַּשְׁחִ֖ית אֶת־כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְנָטִ֨יתִי אֶת־יָדִ֜י עָלֶ֗יךָ וְגִלְגַּלְתִּ֙יךָ֙ מִן־הַסְּלָעִ֔ים וּנְתַתִּ֖יךָ לְהַ֥ר שְׂרֵפָֽה׃
Translated:
See, I will deal with you, O mountain of the destroyer
—declares GOD—
Destroyer of the whole earth!
I will stretch out My hand against you
And roll you down from the crags,
And make you a burnt-out mountain.
Transliteration: hineniy eleykha har hamashechiyt neum-yehovah hamashechiyt et-khׇl-haarets venatiytiy et-yadiy aleykha vegilegaletiykha min-haselaiym unetatiykha lehar sherefah

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יִקְח֤וּ מִמְּךָ֙ אֶ֣בֶן לְפִנָּ֔ה וְאֶ֖בֶן לְמוֹסָד֑וֹת כִּֽי־שִׁמְמ֥וֹת עוֹלָ֛ם תִּהְיֶ֖ה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
They shall never take from you
A cornerstone or foundation stone;
You shall be a desolation for all time
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: velo-yikechu mimekha even lefinah veeven lemvosadvot khiy-shimemvot volam tiheyeh neum-yehovah

Hebrew: שְׂאוּ־נֵ֣ס בָּאָ֗רֶץ תִּקְע֨וּ שׁוֹפָ֤ר בַּגּוֹיִם֙ קַדְּשׁ֤וּ עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ גּוֹיִ֔ם הַשְׁמִ֧יעוּ עָלֶ֛יהָ מַמְלְכ֥וֹת אֲרָרַ֖ט מִנִּ֣י וְאַשְׁכְּנָ֑ז פִּקְד֤וּ עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ טִפְסָ֔ר הַעֲלוּ־ס֖וּס כְּיֶ֥לֶק סָמָֽר׃
Translated:
Raise a standard on earth,
Sound a horn among the nations,
Appoint nations against her,
Assemble kingdoms against her—
Ararat, Minni, and Ashkenaz—
Designate a marshal against her,
Bring up horses like swarming locusts!
Transliteration: sheu-nes vaarets tikeu shvofar vagvoyim kadeshu aleyha gvoyim hashemiyu aleyha mamelekhvot ararat miniy veashekhenaz fikedu aleyha tifesar haalu-sus kheyelek samar

Hebrew: קַדְּשׁ֨וּ עָלֶ֤יהָ גוֹיִם֙ אֶת־מַלְכֵ֣י מָדַ֔י אֶת־פַּחוֹתֶ֖יהָ וְאֶת־כׇּל־סְגָנֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־אֶ֥רֶץ מֶמְשַׁלְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Appoint nations for war against her—
The kings of Media,
Her governors and all her prefects,
And all the lands they rule!
Transliteration: kadeshu aleyha gvoyim et-malekhey maday et-fachvoteyha veet-khׇl-seganeyha veet khׇl-erets memeshaletvo

Hebrew: וַתִּרְעַ֥שׁ הָאָ֖רֶץ וַתָּחֹ֑ל כִּ֣י קָ֤מָה עַל־בָּבֶל֙ מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת יְהֹוָ֔ה לָשׂ֞וּם אֶת־אֶ֧רֶץ בָּבֶ֛ל לְשַׁמָּ֖ה מֵאֵ֥ין יוֹשֵֽׁב׃
Translated:
Then the earth quakes and writhes,
For GOD’s purpose is fulfilled against Babylon,
To make the land of Babylon
A waste without inhabitant.
Transliteration: vatireash haarets vatachol khiy kamah al-vavel macheshevvot yehovah lashum et-erets vavel leshamah meeyn yvoshev

Hebrew: חָדְלוּ֩ גִבּוֹרֵ֨י בָבֶ֜ל לְהִלָּחֵ֗ם יָֽשְׁבוּ֙ בַּמְּצָד֔וֹת נָשְׁתָ֥ה גְבוּרָתָ֖ם הָי֣וּ לְנָשִׁ֑ים הִצִּ֥יתוּ מִשְׁכְּנֹתֶ֖יהָ נִשְׁבְּר֥וּ בְרִיחֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
The warriors of Babylon stop fighting,
They sit in the strongholds,
Their might is dried up,
They become women.
Her dwellings are set afire,
Her bars are broken.
Transliteration: chadelu givvorey vavel lehilachem yashevu vametsadvot nashetah gevuratam hayu lenashiym hitsiytu mishekhenoteyha nisheveru veriycheyha

Hebrew: רָ֤ץ לִקְרַאת־רָץ֙ יָר֔וּץ וּמַגִּ֖יד לִקְרַ֣את מַגִּ֑יד לְהַגִּיד֙ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֔ל כִּֽי־נִלְכְּדָ֥ה עִיר֖וֹ מִקָּצֶֽה׃
Translated:
Runner dashes to meet runner,
Messenger to meet messenger,
To report to the king of Babylon
That his city is captured, from end to end.
Transliteration: rats likerat-rats yaruts umagiyd likerat magiyd lehagiyd lemelekhe vavel khiy-nilekhedah iyrvo mikatseh

Hebrew: וְהַמַּעְבָּר֣וֹת נִתְפָּ֔שׂוּ וְאֶת־הָאֲגַמִּ֖ים שָׂרְפ֣וּ בָאֵ֑שׁ וְאַנְשֵׁ֥י הַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה נִבְהָֽלוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
The fords are captured,
And the swamp thickets are consumed in fire;
And the warriors are in panic.
Transliteration: vehamaevarvot nitefashu veet-haagamiym sharefu vaesh veaneshey hamilechamah nivehalu {s}

Hebrew: כִּי֩ כֹ֨ה אָמַ֜ר יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בַּת־בָּבֶ֕ל כְּגֹ֖רֶן עֵ֣ת הִדְרִיכָ֑הּ ע֣וֹד מְעַ֔ט וּבָ֥אָה עֵֽת־הַקָּצִ֖יר לָֽהּ׃
Translated:
For thus said GOD of Hosts, the God of Israel:
Fair Babylon is like a threshing floor
Ready to be trodden;
In a little while her harvesttime will come.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael vat-vavel khegoren et hideriykhah vod meat uvaah et-hakatsiyr lah

Hebrew: (אכלנו) [אֲכָלַ֣נִי] (הממנו) [הֲמָמַ֗נִי] נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר֮ מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶל֒ (הציגנו) [הִצִּיגַ֙נִי֙] כְּלִ֣י רִ֔יק (בלענו) [בְּלָעַ֙נִי֙] כַּתַּנִּ֔ין מִלָּ֥א כְרֵשׂ֖וֹ מֵעֲדָנָ֑י (הדיחנו) [הֱדִיחָֽנִי]׃
Translated:
“Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon
Devoured me and discomfited me;
He swallowed me like a dragon,
He filled his belly with my dainties,
And set me down like an empty dish;
Then he rinsed me out.
Transliteration: (khlnv) [akhalaniy] (hmmnv) [hamamaniy] nevukhaderetsar melekhe vavel (htsygnv) [hitsiyganiy] kheliy riyk (vlnv) [velaaniy] khataniyn mila khereshvo meadanay (hdychnv) [hediychaniy]

Hebrew: חֲמָסִ֤י וּשְׁאֵרִי֙ עַל־בָּבֶ֔ל תֹּאמַ֖ר יֹשֶׁ֣בֶת צִיּ֑וֹן וְדָמִי֙ אֶל־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י כַשְׂדִּ֔ים תֹּאמַ֖ר יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated:
Let the violence done me and my kindred
Be upon Babylon,”
Says the inhabitant of Zion;
“And let my blood be upon the inhabitants of Chaldea,”
Says Jerusalem.
Transliteration: chamasiy usheeriy al-vavel tomar yoshevet tsiyyvon vedamiy el-yoshevey khashediym tomar yerushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנְנִי־רָב֙ אֶת־רִיבֵ֔ךְ וְנִקַּמְתִּ֖י אֶת־נִקְמָתֵ֑ךְ וְהַֽחֲרַבְתִּי֙ אֶת־יַמָּ֔הּ וְהֹֽבַשְׁתִּ֖י אֶת־מְקוֹרָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Assuredly, thus said GOD:
I am going to uphold your cause
And take vengeance for you;
I will dry up her sea
And make her fountain run dry.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar yehovah hineniy-rav et-riyvekhe venikametiy et-nikematekhe vehacharavetiy et-yamah vehovashetiy et-mekvorah

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָה֩ בָבֶ֨ל <small>׀</small> לְגַלִּ֧ים <small>׀</small> מְעוֹן־תַּנִּ֛ים שַׁמָּ֥ה וּשְׁרֵקָ֖ה מֵאֵ֥ין יוֹשֵֽׁב׃
Translated:
Babylon shall become rubble,
A den for jackals,
An object of horror and hissing,
Without inhabitant.
Transliteration: vehayetah vavel <small></small> legaliym <small></small> mevon-taniym shamah usherekah meeyn yvoshev

Hebrew: יַחְדָּ֖ו כַּכְּפִרִ֣ים יִשְׁאָ֑גוּ נָעֲר֖וּ כְּגוֹרֵ֥י אֲרָיֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Like lions, they roar together,
They growl like lion cubs.
Transliteration: yachedav khakhefiriym yisheagu naaru khegvorey arayvot

Hebrew: בְּחֻמָּ֞ם אָשִׁ֣ית אֶת־מִשְׁתֵּיהֶ֗ם וְהִשְׁכַּרְתִּים֙ לְמַ֣עַן יַעֲלֹ֔זוּ וְיָשְׁנ֥וּ שְׁנַת־עוֹלָ֖ם וְלֹ֣א יָקִ֑יצוּ נְאֻ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
When they are heated, I will set out their drink
And get them drunk, that they may become hilarious
And then sleep an endless sleep,
Never to awake
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: vechumam ashiyt et-misheteyhem vehishekharetiym lemaan yaalozu veyashenu shenat-volam velo yakiytsu neum yehovah

Hebrew: אוֹרִידֵ֖ם כְּכָרִ֣ים לִטְב֑וֹחַ כְּאֵילִ֖ים עִם־עַתּוּדִֽים׃
Translated:
I will bring them down like lambs for slaughter,
Like rams and he-goats.
Transliteration: voriydem khekhariym litevvocha kheeyliym im-atudiym

Hebrew: אֵ֚יךְ נִלְכְּדָ֣ה שֵׁשַׁ֔ךְ וַתִּתָּפֵ֖שׂ תְּהִלַּ֣ת כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ אֵ֣יךְ הָיְתָ֧ה לְשַׁמָּ֛ה בָּבֶ֖ל בַּגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
How has Sheshach been captured,
The praise of the whole earth been taken!
How has Babylon become
A horror to the nations!
Transliteration: eykhe nilekhedah sheshakhe vatitafesh tehilat khׇl-haarets eykhe hayetah leshamah vavel vagvoyim

Hebrew: עָלָ֥ה עַל־בָּבֶ֖ל הַיָּ֑ם בַּהֲמ֥וֹן גַּלָּ֖יו נִכְסָֽתָה׃
Translated:
The sea has risen over Babylon,
She is covered by its roaring waves.
Transliteration: alah al-vavel hayam vahamvon galayv nikhesatah

Hebrew: הָי֤וּ עָרֶ֙יהָ֙ לְשַׁמָּ֔ה אֶ֖רֶץ צִיָּ֣ה וַעֲרָבָ֑ה אֶ֗רֶץ לֹֽא־יֵשֵׁ֤ב בָּהֵן֙ כׇּל־אִ֔ישׁ וְלֹא־יַעֲבֹ֥ר בָּהֵ֖ן בֶּן־אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
Her towns are a desolation,
A land of desert and steppe,
A land nobody at all lives in
And no human passes through.
Transliteration: hayu areyha leshamah erets tsiyah vaaravah erets lo-eishev vahen khׇl-iysh velo-yaavor vahen ven-adam

Hebrew: וּפָקַדְתִּ֨י עַל־בֵּ֜ל בְּבָבֶ֗ל וְהֹצֵאתִ֤י אֶת־בִּלְעוֹ֙ מִפִּ֔יו וְלֹא־יִנְהֲר֥וּ אֵלָ֛יו ע֖וֹד גּוֹיִ֑ם גַּם־חוֹמַ֥ת בָּבֶ֖ל נָפָֽלָה׃
Translated:
And I will deal with Bel in Babylon,
And make him disgorge what he has swallowed,
And nations shall no more gaze on him with joy.
Even the wall of Babylon shall fall.
Transliteration: ufakadetiy al-vel vevavel vehotsetiy et-vilevo mifiyv velo-yineharu elayv vod gvoyim gam-chvomat vavel nafalah

Hebrew: צְא֤וּ מִתּוֹכָהּ֙ עַמִּ֔י וּמַלְּט֖וּ אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־נַפְשׁ֑וֹ מֵחֲר֖וֹן אַף־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Depart from there, O My people,
Save your lives, each of you,
From GOD’s furious anger.
Transliteration: tseu mitvokhah amiy umaletu iysh et-nafeshvo mecharvon af-yehovah

Hebrew: וּפֶן־יֵרַ֤ךְ לְבַבְכֶם֙ וְתִֽירְא֔וּ בַּשְּׁמוּעָ֖ה הַנִּשְׁמַ֣עַת בָּאָ֑רֶץ וּבָ֧א בַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשְּׁמוּעָ֗ה וְאַחֲרָ֤יו בַּשָּׁנָה֙ הַשְּׁמוּעָ֔ה וְחָמָ֣ס בָּאָ֔רֶץ וּמֹשֵׁ֖ל עַל־מֹשֵֽׁל׃
Translated:
Do not be downhearted or afraid
At the rumors heard in the land:
A rumor will come one year,
And another rumor the next year
Of violence in the land,
And of ruler against ruler.
Transliteration: ufen-eirakhe levavekhem vetiyreu vashemuah hanishemaat vaarets uva vashanah hashemuah veacharayv vashanah hashemuah vechamas vaarets umoshel al-moshel

Hebrew: לָכֵן֙ הִנֵּ֣ה יָמִ֣ים בָּאִ֔ים וּפָֽקַדְתִּי֙ עַל־פְּסִילֵ֣י בָבֶ֔ל וְכׇל־אַרְצָ֖הּ תֵּב֑וֹשׁ וְכׇל־חֲלָלֶ֖יהָ יִפְּל֥וּ בְתוֹכָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Assuredly, days are coming,
When I will deal with Babylon’s images;
Her whole land shall be shamed,
And all her slain shall fall in her midst.
Transliteration: lakhen hineh yamiym vaiym ufakadetiy al-fesiyley vavel vekhׇl-aretsah tevvosh vekhׇl-chalaleyha yifelu vetvokhah

Hebrew: וְרִנְּנ֤וּ עַל־בָּבֶל֙ שָׁמַ֣יִם וָאָ֔רֶץ וְכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּהֶ֑ם כִּ֧י מִצָּפ֛וֹן יָבוֹא־לָ֥הּ הַשּׁוֹדְדִ֖ים נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Heavens and earth and all that is in them
Shall shout over Babylon;
For the ravagers shall come upon her from the north
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: verinenu al-vavel shamayiim vaarets vekhol asher vahem khiy mitsafvon yavvo-lah hashvodediym neum-yehovah

Hebrew: גַּם־בָּבֶ֕ל לִנְפֹּ֖ל חַֽלְלֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל גַּם־לְבָבֶ֥ל נָפְל֖וּ חַֽלְלֵ֥י כׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Yes, Babylon is to fall
[For] the slain of Israel,
As the slain of all the earth
Have fallen through Babylon.
Transliteration: gam-vavel linefol chaleley yisherael gam-levavel nafelu chaleley khׇl-haarets

Hebrew: פְּלֵטִ֣ים מֵחֶ֔רֶב הִלְכ֖וּ אַֽל־תַּעֲמֹ֑דוּ זִכְר֤וּ מֵרָחוֹק֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה וִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם תַּעֲלֶ֥ה עַל־לְבַבְכֶֽם׃
Translated:
You fugitives from the sword,
Go, don’t delay!
Remember GOD from afar,
And call Jerusalem to mind.
Transliteration: feletiym mecherev hilekhu al-taamodu zikheru merachvok et-yehovah viyrushala͏im taaleh al-levavekhem

Hebrew: בֹּ֚שְׁנוּ כִּֽי־שָׁמַ֣עְנוּ חֶרְפָּ֔ה כִּסְּתָ֥ה כְלִמָּ֖ה פָּנֵ֑ינוּ כִּ֚י בָּ֣אוּ זָרִ֔ים עַֽל־מִקְדְּשֵׁ֖י בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
“We were shamed, we heard taunts;
Humiliation covered our faces,
When aliens entered
The sacred areas of GOD’s House.”
Transliteration: voshenu khiy-shamaenu cherefah khisetah khelimah faneynu khiy vau zariym al-mikedeshey veyt yehovah {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן הִנֵּֽה־יָמִ֤ים בָּאִים֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וּפָקַדְתִּ֖י עַל־פְּסִילֶ֑יהָ וּבְכׇל־אַרְצָ֖הּ יֶאֱנֹ֥ק חָלָֽל׃
Translated:
Assuredly, days are coming
—declares GOD—
When I will deal with her images,
And throughout her land the dying shall groan.
Transliteration: lakhen hineh-yamiym vaiym neum-yehovah ufakadetiy al-fesiyleyha uvekhׇl-aretsah yeenok chalal

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תַעֲלֶ֤ה בָבֶל֙ הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְכִ֥י תְבַצֵּ֖ר מְר֣וֹם עֻזָּ֑הּ מֵאִתִּ֗י יָבֹ֧אוּ שֹׁדְדִ֛ים לָ֖הּ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Though Babylon should climb to the skies,
Though she fortify her strongholds up to heaven,
The ravagers would come against her from Me
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: khiy-taaleh vavel hashamayiim vekhiy tevatser mervom uzah meitiy yavou shodediym lah neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: ק֥וֹל זְעָקָ֖ה מִבָּבֶ֑ל וְשֶׁ֥בֶר גָּד֖וֹל מֵאֶ֥רֶץ כַּשְׂדִּֽים׃
Translated:
Hark! an outcry from Babylon,
Great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans.
Transliteration: kvol zeakah mivavel veshever gadvol meerets khashediym

Hebrew: כִּֽי־שֹׁדֵ֤ד יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־בָּבֶ֔ל וְאִבַּ֥ד מִמֶּ֖נָּה ק֣וֹל גָּד֑וֹל וְהָמ֤וּ גַלֵּיהֶם֙ כְּמַ֣יִם רַבִּ֔ים נִתַּ֥ן שְׁא֖וֹן קוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
For GOD is ravaging Babylon;
He will put an end to her great din,
Whose roar is like waves of mighty waters,
Whose tumultuous noise resounds.
Transliteration: khiy-shoded yehovah et-vavel veivad mimenah kvol gadvol vehamu galeyhem khemayiim raviym nitan shevon kvolam

Hebrew: כִּי֩ בָ֨א עָלֶ֤יהָ עַל־בָּבֶל֙ שׁוֹדֵ֔ד וְנִלְכְּדוּ֙ גִּבּוֹרֶ֔יהָ חִתְּתָ֖ה קַשְּׁתוֹתָ֑ם כִּ֣י אֵ֧ל גְּמֻל֛וֹת יְהֹוָ֖ה שַׁלֵּ֥ם יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃
Translated:
For a ravager is coming upon Babylon,
Her warriors shall be captured, their bows shall be snapped.
For the ETERNAL is a God of requital—
Who deals retribution.
Transliteration: khiy va aleyha al-vavel shvoded venilekhedu givvoreyha chitetah kashetvotam khiy el gemulvot yehovah shalem yeshalem

Hebrew: וְ֠הִשְׁכַּרְתִּ֠י שָׂרֶ֨יהָ וַחֲכָמֶ֜יהָ פַּחוֹתֶ֤יהָ וּסְגָנֶ֙יהָ֙ וְגִבּוֹרֶ֔יהָ וְיָשְׁנ֥וּ שְׁנַת־עוֹלָ֖ם וְלֹ֣א יָקִ֑יצוּ נְאֻ֨ם־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת שְׁמֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
I will make her officials and her sages drunk,
Her governors and prefects and warriors;
And they shall sleep an endless sleep,
Never to awaken
—declares the King whose name is GOD of Hosts.
Transliteration: vehishekharetiy shareyha vachakhameyha fachvoteyha useganeyha vegivvoreyha veyashenu shenat-volam velo yakiytsu neum-hamelekhe yehovah tsevavot shemvo {s}

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־אָמַ֞ר יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֗וֹת חֹ֠מ֠וֹת בָּבֶ֤ל הָרְחָבָה֙ עַרְעֵ֣ר תִּתְעַרְעָ֔ר וּשְׁעָרֶ֥יהָ הַגְּבֹהִ֖ים בָּאֵ֣שׁ יִצַּ֑תּוּ וְיִֽגְע֨וּ עַמִּ֧ים בְּדֵי־רִ֛יק וּלְאֻמִּ֥ים בְּדֵי־אֵ֖שׁ וְיָעֵֽפוּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Thus said GOD of Hosts:
Babylon’s broad wall shall be knocked down,
And her high gates set afire.
Peoples shall labor for naught,
And nations have wearied themselves for fire.
Transliteration: khoh-amar yehovah tsevavot chomvot vavel harechavah areer titearear usheareyha hagevohiym vaesh yitsatu veyigeu amiym vedey-riyk uleumiym vedey-esh veyaefu {s}

Hebrew: הַדָּבָ֞ר אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֣ה ׀ יִרְמְיָ֣הוּ הַנָּבִ֗יא אֶת־שְׂרָיָ֣ה בֶן־נֵרִיָּה֮ בֶּן־מַחְסֵיָה֒ בְּלֶכְתּ֞וֹ אֶת־צִדְקִיָּ֤הוּ מֶֽלֶךְ־יְהוּדָה֙ בָּבֶ֔ל בִּשְׁנַ֥ת הָרְבִעִ֖ית לְמׇלְכ֑וֹ וּשְׂרָיָ֖ה שַׂ֥ר מְנוּחָֽה׃
Translated: The instructions that the prophet Jeremiah gave to Seraiah son of Neriah son of Mahseiah, when the latter went with King Zedekiah of Judah to Babylonia, in the fourth year of [Zedekiah’s] reign. Seraiah was quartermaster.
Transliteration: hadavar asher-tsivah yiremeyahu hanaviy et-sherayah ven-neriyah ven-macheseyah velekhetvo et-tsidekiyahu melekhe-yehudah vavel vishenat hareviiyt lemׇlekhvo usherayah shar menuchah

Hebrew: וַיִּכְתֹּ֣ב יִרְמְיָ֗הוּ אֵ֧ת כׇּל־הָרָעָ֛ה אֲשֶׁר־תָּב֥וֹא אֶל־בָּבֶ֖ל אֶל־סֵ֣פֶר אֶחָ֑ד אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה הַכְּתֻבִ֖ים אֶל־בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: Jeremiah wrote down in one scroll all the disaster that would come upon Babylon, all these things that are written concerning Babylon.
Transliteration: vayikhetov yiremeyahu et khׇl-haraah asher-tavvo el-vavel el-sefer echad et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh hakhetuviym el-vavel

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ אֶל־שְׂרָיָ֑ה כְּבֹאֲךָ֣ בָבֶ֔ל וְֽרָאִ֔יתָ וְֽקָרָ֔אתָ אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, “When you get to Babylon, see that you read out all these words.
Transliteration: vayomer yiremeyahu el-sherayah khevoakha vavel veraiyta vekarata et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֗ יְהֹוָה֙ אַתָּ֨ה דִבַּ֜רְתָּ אֶל־הַמָּק֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ לְהַכְרִית֔וֹ לְבִלְתִּ֤י הֱיֽוֹת־בּוֹ֙ יוֹשֵׁ֔ב לְמֵאָדָ֖ם וְעַד־בְּהֵמָ֑ה כִּֽי־שִׁמְמ֥וֹת עוֹלָ֖ם תִּהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: And say, ‘O E<small>TERNAL</small> One, You Yourself have declared concerning this place that it shall be cut off, without inhabitants—humans or animals; that it shall be a desolation for all time.’
Transliteration: veamareta yehovah atah divareta el-hamakvom hazeh lehakheriytvo leviletiy heyvot-vvo yvoshev lemeadam vead-vehemah khiy-shimemvot volam tiheyeh

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ כְּכַלֹּ֣תְךָ֔ לִקְרֹ֖א אֶת־הַסֵּ֣פֶר הַזֶּ֑ה תִּקְשֹׁ֤ר עָלָיו֙ אֶ֔בֶן וְהִשְׁלַכְתּ֖וֹ אֶל־תּ֥וֹךְ פְּרָֽת׃
Translated: And when you finish reading this scroll, tie a stone to it and hurl it into the Euphrates.
Transliteration: vehayah khekhalotekha likero et-hasefer hazeh tikeshor alayv even vehishelakhetvo el-tvokhe ferat

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֗ כָּ֠כָה תִּשְׁקַ֨ע בָּבֶ֤ל וְלֹֽא־תָקוּם֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י הָרָעָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י מֵבִ֥יא עָלֶ֖יהָ וְיָעֵ֑פוּ עַד־הֵ֖נָּה דִּבְרֵ֥י יִרְמְיָֽהוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: And say, ‘Thus shall Babylon sink and never rise again, because of the disaster that I will bring upon it. And [nations] shall have wearied themselves [for fire].’” Thus far the words of Jeremiah.
Transliteration: veamareta khakhah tisheka vavel velo-takum mifeney haraah asher anokhiy meviy aleyha veyaefu ad-henah diverey yiremeyahu {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֨ים וְאַחַ֤ת שָׁנָה֙ צִדְקִיָּ֣הוּ בְמׇלְכ֔וֹ וְאַחַ֤ת עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ (חמיטל) [חֲמוּטַ֥ל] בַּֽת־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ מִלִּבְנָֽה׃
Translated: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem for eleven years. His mother’s name was Hamutal, daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
Transliteration: ven-esheriym veachat shanah tsidekiyahu vemׇlekhvo veachat eshereh shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo (chmytl) [chamutal] vat-yiremeyahu milivenah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֖ה יְהוֹיָקִֽם׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>, just as Jehoiakim had done.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah khekhol asher-ashah yehvoyakim

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ עַל־אַ֣ף יְהֹוָ֗ה הָֽיְתָה֙ בִּירוּשָׁלַ֣͏ִם וִֽיהוּדָ֔ה עַד־הִשְׁלִיכ֥וֹ אוֹתָ֖ם מֵעַ֣ל פָּנָ֑יו וַיִּמְרֹ֥ד צִדְקִיָּ֖הוּ בְּמֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated:
Indeed, Jerusalem and Judah were a cause of anger for GOD, so that they were cast out of the divine presence.
Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
Transliteration: khiy al-af yehovah hayetah viyrushala͏im viyhudah ad-hisheliykhvo votam meal fanayv vayimerod tsidekiyahu vemelekhe vavel

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ בַשָּׁנָ֨ה הַתְּשִׁעִ֜ית לְמׇלְכ֗וֹ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָעֲשִׂירִי֮ בֶּעָשׂ֣וֹר לַחֹ֒דֶשׁ֒ בָּ֠א נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֨ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֜ל ה֤וּא וְכׇל־חֵילוֹ֙ עַל־יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ עָלֶ֑יהָ וַיִּבְנ֥וּ עָלֶ֛יהָ דָּיֵ֖ק סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: And in the ninth year of his reign, on the tenth day of the tenth month, King Nebuchadrezzar moved against Jerusalem with his whole army. They besieged it and built towers against it all around.
Transliteration: vayehiy vashanah hateshiiyt lemׇlekhvo vachodesh haashiyriy veashvor lachodesh va nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel hu vekhׇl-cheylvo al-yerushala͏im vayachanu aleyha vayivenu aleyha daeik saviyv

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֥א הָעִ֖יר בַּמָּצ֑וֹר עַ֚ד עַשְׁתֵּ֣י עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֔ה לַמֶּ֖לֶךְ צִדְקִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: The city continued in a state of siege until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.
Transliteration: vatavo haiyr vamatsvor ad ashetey eshereh shanah lamelekhe tsidekiyahu

Hebrew: בַּחֹ֤דֶשׁ הָרְבִיעִי֙ בְּתִשְׁעָ֣ה לַחֹ֔דֶשׁ וַיֶּחֱזַ֥ק הָרָעָ֖ב בָּעִ֑יר וְלֹא־הָיָ֥ה לֶ֖חֶם לְעַ֥ם הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: By the ninth day of the fourth month, the famine had become acute in the city; there was no food left for the common people.
Transliteration: vachodesh hareviyiy vetisheah lachodesh vayechezak haraav vaiyr velo-hayah lechem leam haarets

Hebrew: וַתִּבָּקַ֣ע הָעִ֗יר וְכׇל־אַנְשֵׁ֣י הַמִּלְחָמָ֡ה יִבְרְחוּ֩ וַיֵּצְא֨וּ מֵהָעִ֜יר לַ֗יְלָה דֶּ֜רֶךְ שַׁ֤עַר בֵּין־הַחֹמֹתַ֙יִם֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־גַּ֣ן הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְכַשְׂדִּ֥ים עַל־הָעִ֖יר סָבִ֑יב וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ דֶּ֥רֶךְ הָעֲרָבָֽה׃
Translated: Then [the wall of] the city was breached. All the soldiers fled; they left the city by night through the gate between the double walls, which is near the king’s garden—the Chaldeans were all around the city—and they set out for the Arabah.
Transliteration: vativaka haiyr vekhׇl-aneshey hamilechamah yiverechu vayetseu mehaiyr layelah derekhe shaar veyn-hachomotayiim asher al-gan hamelekhe vekhashediym al-haiyr saviyv vayelekhu derekhe haaravah

Hebrew: וַיִּרְדְּפ֤וּ חֵיל־כַּשְׂדִּים֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיַּשִּׂ֥יגוּ אֶת־צִדְקִיָּ֖הוּ בְּעַֽרְבֹ֣ת יְרֵח֑וֹ וְכׇ֨ל־חֵיל֔וֹ נָפֹ֖צוּ מֵעָלָֽיו׃
Translated: But the Chaldean troops pursued the king, and they overtook Zedekiah in the steppes of Jericho, as his entire force left him and scattered.
Transliteration: vayiredefu cheyl-khashediym acharey hamelekhe vayashiygu et-tsidekiyahu vearevot yerechvo vekhׇl-cheylvo nafotsu mealayv

Hebrew: וַֽיִּתְפְּשׂוּ֙ אֶת־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיַּעֲל֨וּ אֹת֜וֹ אֶל־מֶ֧לֶךְ בָּבֶ֛ל רִבְלָ֖תָה בְּאֶ֣רֶץ חֲמָ֑ת וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ מִשְׁפָּטִֽים׃
Translated: They captured the king and brought him before the king of Babylon at Riblah, in the region of Hamath; and he put him on trial.
Transliteration: vayitefeshu et-hamelekhe vayaalu otvo el-melekhe vavel rivelatah veerets chamat vayedaver itvo mishefatiym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁחַ֧ט מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֛ל אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י צִדְקִיָּ֖הוּ לְעֵינָ֑יו וְגַ֛ם אֶת־כׇּל־שָׂרֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה שָׁחַ֥ט בְּרִבְלָֽתָה׃
Translated: The king of Babylon had Zedekiah’s sons slaughtered before his eyes; he also had all the officials of Judah slaughtered at Riblah.
Transliteration: vayishechat melekhe-vavel et-veney tsidekiyahu leeynayv vegam et-khׇl-sharey yehudah shachat verivelatah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־עֵינֵ֥י צִדְקִיָּ֖הוּ עִוֵּ֑ר וַיַּאַסְרֵ֣הוּ בַֽנְחֻשְׁתַּ֗יִם וַיְבִאֵ֤הוּ מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶל֙ בָּבֶ֔לָה וַיִּתְּנֵ֥הוּ (בבית) [בֵֽית־]הַפְּקֻדֹּ֖ת עַד־י֥וֹם מוֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then the eyes of Zedekiah were put out, and he was chained in bronze fetters. The king of Babylon brought him to Babylon and put him in prison, [where he remained] to the day of his death.
Transliteration: veet-eyney tsidekiyahu iver vayaaserehu vanechushetayiim vayeviehu melekhe-vavel vavelah vayitenehu (vvyt) [veyt-]hafekudot ad-yvom mvotvo

Hebrew: וּבַחֹ֤דֶשׁ הַֽחֲמִישִׁי֙ בֶּעָשׂ֣וֹר לַחֹ֔דֶשׁ הִ֗יא שְׁנַת֙ תְּשַֽׁע־עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֔ה לַמֶּ֖לֶךְ נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֣ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֑ל בָּ֗א נְבֽוּזַרְאֲדָן֙ רַב־טַבָּחִ֔ים עָמַ֛ד לִפְנֵ֥י מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: On the tenth day of the fifth month—that was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadrezzar, the king of Babylon—Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, came to represent the king of Babylon in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: uvachodesh hachamiyshiy veashvor lachodesh hiy shenat tesha-eshereh shanah lamelekhe nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel va nevuzareadan rav-tavachiym amad lifeney melekhe-vavel viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂרֹ֥ף אֶת־בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֖ה וְאֶת־בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־בָּתֵּ֧י יְרוּשָׁלַ֛͏ִם וְאֶת־כׇּל־בֵּ֥ית הַגָּד֖וֹל שָׂרַ֥ף בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: He burned the House of G<small>OD</small>, the king’s palace, and all the houses of Jerusalem; he burned down the house of every notable person.
Transliteration: vayisherof et-veyt-yehovah veet-veyt hamelekhe veet khׇl-vatey yerushala͏im veet-khׇl-veyt hagadvol sharaf vaesh

Hebrew: וְאֶת־כׇּל־חֹמ֥וֹת יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם סָבִ֑יב נָֽתְצוּ֙ כׇּל־חֵ֣יל כַּשְׂדִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֶת־רַב־טַבָּחִֽים׃
Translated: The entire Chaldean force that was with the chief of the guards tore down all the walls of Jerusalem on every side.
Transliteration: veet-khׇl-chomvot yerushala͏im saviyv natetsu khׇl-cheyl khashediym asher et-rav-tavachiym

Hebrew: וּמִדַּלּ֨וֹת הָעָ֜ם וְֽאֶת־יֶ֥תֶר הָעָ֣ם ׀ הַנִּשְׁאָרִ֣ים בָּעִ֗יר וְאֶת־הַנֹּֽפְלִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָֽפְלוּ֙ אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֔ל וְאֵ֖ת יֶ֣תֶר הָאָמ֑וֹן הֶגְלָ֕ה נְבוּזַרְאֲדָ֖ן רַב־טַבָּחִֽים׃
Translated: The remnant of the people left in the city, the defectors who had gone over to the king of Babylon, and what remained of the artisans were taken into exile by Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards. But some of the poorest elements of the population—
Transliteration: umidalvot haam veet-yeter haam hanisheariym vaiyr veet-hanofeliym asher nafelu el-melekhe vavel veet yeter haamvon hegelah nevuzareadan rav-tavachiym

Hebrew: וּמִדַּלּ֣וֹת הָאָ֔רֶץ הִשְׁאִ֕יר נְבוּזַרְאֲדָ֖ן רַב־טַבָּחִ֑ים לְכֹרְמִ֖ים וּלְיֹגְבִֽים׃
Translated: some of the poorest in the land—were left by Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, to be vine-dressers and field hands.
Transliteration: umidalvot haarets hisheiyr nevuzareadan rav-tavachiym lekhoremiym uleyogeviym

Hebrew: וְאֶת־עַמּוּדֵ֨י הַנְּחֹ֜שֶׁת אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְבֵית־יְהֹוָ֗ה וְֽאֶת־הַמְּכֹנ֞וֹת וְאֶת־יָ֧ם הַנְּחֹ֛שֶׁת אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּבֵית־יְהֹוָ֖ה שִׁבְּר֣וּ כַשְׂדִּ֑ים וַיִּשְׂא֥וּ אֶת־כׇּל־נְחֻשְׁתָּ֖ם בָּבֶֽלָה׃
Translated: The Chaldeans broke up the bronze columns of the House of G<small>OD</small>, the stands, and the bronze tank that was in the House of G<small>OD</small>; and they carried all the bronze away to Babylon.
Transliteration: veet-amudey hanechoshet asher leveyt-yehovah veet-hamekhonvot veet-yam hanechoshet asher veveyt-yehovah shiveru khashediym vayisheu et-khׇl-nechushetam vavelah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַ֠סִּר֠וֹת וְאֶת־הַיָּעִ֨ים וְאֶת־הַֽמְזַמְּר֜וֹת וְאֶת־הַמִּזְרָקֹ֣ת וְאֶת־הַכַּפּ֗וֹת וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־כְּלֵ֧י הַנְּחֹ֛שֶׁת אֲשֶׁר־יְשָׁרְת֥וּ בָהֶ֖ם לָקָֽחוּ׃
Translated: They also took the pails, scrapers, snuffers, sprinkling bowls, ladles, and all the other bronze vessels used in the service.
Transliteration: veet-hasirvot veet-hayaiym veet-hamezamervot veet-hamizerakot veet-hakhafvot veet khׇl-kheley hanechoshet asher-yesharetu vahem lakachu

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַ֠סִּפִּ֠ים וְאֶת־הַמַּחְתּ֨וֹת וְאֶת־הַמִּזְרָק֜וֹת וְאֶת־הַסִּיר֣וֹת וְאֶת־הַמְּנֹר֗וֹת וְאֶת־הַכַּפּוֹת֙ וְאֶת־הַמְּנַקִּיּ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֤ר זָהָב֙ זָהָ֔ב וַאֲשֶׁר־כֶּ֖סֶף כָּ֑סֶף לָקַ֖ח רַב־טַבָּחִֽים׃
Translated: The chief of the guards took whatever was of gold and whatever was of silver: basins, fire pans, sprinkling bowls, pails, lampstands, ladles, and jars.
Transliteration: veet-hasifiym veet-hamachetvot veet-hamizerakvot veet-hasiyrvot veet-hamenorvot veet-hakhafvot veet-hamenakiyyvot asher zahav zahav vaasher-khesef khasef lakach rav-tavachiym

Hebrew: הָעַמּוּדִ֣ים ׀ שְׁנַ֗יִם הַיָּ֤ם אֶחָד֙ וְהַבָּקָ֞ר שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֤ר נְחֹ֙שֶׁת֙ אֲשֶׁר־תַּ֣חַת הַמְּכֹנ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֛ה הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה לְבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹא־הָיָ֣ה מִשְׁקָ֔ל לִנְחֻשְׁתָּ֖ם כׇּל־הַכֵּלִ֥ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: The two columns, the one tank and the twelve bronze oxen that supported it, and the stands, which King Solomon had provided for the House of G<small>OD</small>—all these objects contained bronze beyond weighing.
Transliteration: haamudiym shenayiim hayam echad vehavakar sheneym-ashar nechoshet asher-tachat hamekhonvot asher ashah hamelekhe shelomoh leveyt yehovah lo-hayah mishekal linechushetam khׇl-hakheliym haeleh

Hebrew: וְהָעַמּוּדִ֗ים שְׁמֹנֶ֨ה עֶשְׂרֵ֤ה אַמָּה֙ (קומה) [קוֹמַת֙] הָעַמֻּ֣ד הָאֶחָ֔ד וְח֛וּט שְׁתֵּים־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה אַמָּ֖ה יְסֻבֶּ֑נּוּ וְעׇבְי֛וֹ אַרְבַּ֥ע אֶצְבָּע֖וֹת נָבֽוּב׃
Translated: As for the columns, each was eighteen cubits high and twelve cubits in circumference; it was hollow, and [the metal] was four fingers thick.
Transliteration: vehaamudiym shemoneh eshereh amah (kvmh) [kvomat] haamud haechad vechut sheteym-eshereh amah yesuvenu veׇveyvo areva etsevavot navuv

Hebrew: וְכֹתֶ֨רֶת עָלָ֜יו נְחֹ֗שֶׁת וְקוֹמַ֨ת הַכֹּתֶ֥רֶת הָאַחַת֮ חָמֵ֣שׁ אַמּוֹת֒ וּשְׂבָכָ֨ה וְרִמּוֹנִ֧ים עַֽל־הַכּוֹתֶ֛רֶת סָבִ֖יב הַכֹּ֣ל נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וְכָאֵ֛לֶּה לַעַמּ֥וּד הַשֵּׁנִ֖י וְרִמּוֹנִֽים׃
Translated: It had a bronze capital above it; the height of each capital was five cubits, and there was a meshwork [decorated] with pomegranates about the capital, all made of bronze; and so for the second column, also with pomegranates.
Transliteration: vekhoteret alayv nechoshet vekvomat hakhoteret haachat chamesh amvot ushevakhah verimvoniym al-hakhvoteret saviyv hakhol nechoshet vekhaeleh laamud hasheniy verimvoniym

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ הָרִמֹּנִ֔ים תִּשְׁעִ֥ים וְשִׁשָּׁ֖ה ר֑וּחָה כׇּל־הָרִמּוֹנִ֥ים מֵאָ֛ה עַל־הַשְּׂבָכָ֖ה סָבִֽיב׃ {ס}
Translated: There were ninety-six pomegranates facing outward; all the pomegranates around the meshwork amounted to one hundred.
Transliteration: vayiheyu harimoniym tisheiym veshishah ruchah khׇl-harimvoniym meah al-hashevakhah saviyv {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח רַב־טַבָּחִ֗ים אֶת־שְׂרָיָה֙ כֹּהֵ֣ן הָרֹ֔אשׁ וְאֶת־צְפַנְיָ֖ה כֹּהֵ֣ן הַמִּשְׁנֶ֑ה וְאֶת־שְׁלֹ֖שֶׁת שֹׁמְרֵ֥י הַסַּֽף׃
Translated: The chief of the guards also took Seraiah the chief priest and Zephaniah, the deputy priest, and the three guardians of the threshold.
Transliteration: vayikach rav-tavachiym et-sherayah khohen harosh veet-tsefaneyah khohen hamisheneh veet-sheloshet shomerey hasaf

Hebrew: וּמִן־הָעִ֡יר לָקַח֩ סָרִ֨יס אֶחָ֜ד אֲֽשֶׁר־הָיָ֥ה פָקִ֣יד ׀ עַל־אַנְשֵׁ֣י הַמִּלְחָמָ֗ה וְשִׁבְעָ֨ה אֲנָשִׁ֜ים מֵרֹאֵ֤י פְנֵֽי־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִמְצְא֣וּ בָעִ֔יר וְאֵ֗ת סֹפֵר֙ שַׂ֣ר הַצָּבָ֔א הַמַּצְבִּ֖א אֶת־עַ֣ם הָאָ֑רֶץ וְשִׁשִּׁ֥ים אִישׁ֙ מֵעַ֣ם הָאָ֔רֶץ הַֽנִּמְצְאִ֖ים בְּת֥וֹךְ הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: And from the city he took a eunuch who was in command of the soldiers; seven royal privy councillors, who were present in the city; the scribe of the army commander, who was in charge of mustering the people of the land; and sixty of the common people who were inside the city.
Transliteration: umin-haiyr lakach sariys echad asher-hayah fakiyd al-aneshey hamilechamah veshiveah anashiym meroey feney-hamelekhe asher nimetseu vaiyr veet sofer shar hatsava hamatsevi et-am haarets veshishiym iysh meam haarets hanimetseiym vetvokhe haiyr

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח אוֹתָ֔ם נְבוּזַרְאֲדָ֖ן רַב־טַבָּחִ֑ים וַיֹּ֧לֶךְ אוֹתָ֛ם אֶל־מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶ֖ל רִבְלָֽתָה׃
Translated: Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, took them and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.
Transliteration: vayikach votam nevuzareadan rav-tavachiym vayolekhe votam el-melekhe vavel rivelatah

Hebrew: וַיַּכֶּ֣ה אוֹתָם֩ מֶ֨לֶךְ בָּבֶ֧ל וַיְמִתֵ֛ם בְּרִבְלָ֖ה בְּאֶ֣רֶץ חֲמָ֑ת וַיִּ֥גֶל יְהוּדָ֖ה מֵעַ֥ל אַדְמָתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
The king of Babylon had them struck down and put to death at Riblah, in the region of Hamath.
Thus Judah was exiled from its land.
Transliteration: vayakheh votam melekhe vavel vayemitem verivelah veerets chamat vayigel yehudah meal adematvo {s}

Hebrew: זֶ֣ה הָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶגְלָ֖ה נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֑ר בִּשְׁנַת־שֶׁ֕בַע יְהוּדִ֕ים שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֖ים וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
Translated: This is the number of those whom Nebuchadrezzar exiled in the seventh year: 3,023 Judeans.
Transliteration: zeh haam asher hegelah nevukhaderetsar vishenat-sheva yehudiym sheloshet alafiym veesheriym usheloshah

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֛ת שְׁמוֹנֶ֥ה עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה לִנְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֑ר מִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם נֶ֕פֶשׁ שְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃
Translated: In the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar, 832 persons [were exiled] from Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vishenat shemvoneh eshereh linevukhaderetsar miyrushala͏im nefesh shemoneh mevot sheloshiym ushenayiim

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֨ת שָׁלֹ֣שׁ וְעֶשְׂרִים֮ לִנְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר֒ הֶגְלָ֗ה נְבֽוּזַרְאֲדָן֙ רַב־טַבָּחִ֔ים יְהוּדִ֕ים נֶ֕פֶשׁ שְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת אַרְבָּעִ֣ים וַחֲמִשָּׁ֑ה כׇּל־נֶ֕פֶשׁ אַרְבַּ֥עַת אֲלָפִ֖ים וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: And in the twenty-third year of Nebuchadrezzar, Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, exiled 745 Judeans. The total amounted to 4,600 persons.
Transliteration: vishenat shalosh veesheriym linevukhaderetsar hegelah nevuzareadan rav-tavachiym yehudiym nefesh sheva mevot arevaiym vachamishah khׇl-nefesh arevaat alafiym veshesh mevot {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ בִשְׁלֹשִׁ֨ים וָשֶׁ֜בַע שָׁנָ֗ה לְגָלוּת֙ יְהוֹיָכִ֣ן מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֔ה בִּשְׁנֵ֤ים עָשָׂר֙ חֹ֔דֶשׁ בְּעֶשְׂרִ֥ים וַחֲמִשָּׁ֖ה לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ נָשָׂ֡א אֱוִ֣יל מְרֹדַךְ֩ מֶ֨לֶךְ בָּבֶ֜ל בִּשְׁנַ֣ת מַלְכֻת֗וֹ אֶת־רֹאשׁ֙ יְהוֹיָכִ֣ין מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיֹּצֵ֥א אֹת֖וֹ מִבֵּ֥ית (הכליא) [הַכְּלֽוּא]׃
Translated: In the thirty-seventh year of the exile of King Jehoiachin of Judah, on the twenty-fifth day of the twelfth month, King Evil-merodach of Babylon, in the year he became king, took note of King Jehoiachin of Judah and released him from prison.
Transliteration: vayehiy visheloshiym vasheva shanah legalut yehvoyakhin melekhe-yehudah visheneym ashar chodesh veesheriym vachamishah lachodesh nasha eviyl merodakhe melekhe vavel vishenat malekhutvo et-rosh yehvoyakhiyn melekhe-yehudah vayotse otvo miveyt (hkhly) [hakhelu]

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ טֹב֑וֹת וַיִּתֵּן֙ אֶת־כִּסְא֔וֹ מִמַּ֗עַל לְכִסֵּ֧א (מלכים) [הַמְּלָכִ֛ים] אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ בְּבָבֶֽל׃
Translated: He spoke kindly to him, and gave him a throne above those of other kings who were with him in Babylon.
Transliteration: vayedaver itvo tovvot vayiten et-khisevo mimaal lekhise (mlkhym) [hamelakhiym] asher itvo vevavel

Hebrew: וְשִׁנָּ֕ה אֵ֖ת בִּגְדֵ֣י כִלְא֑וֹ וְאָכַ֨ל לֶ֧חֶם לְפָנָ֛יו תָּמִ֖יד כׇּל־יְמֵ֥י חַיָּֽו׃
Translated: He removed his prison garments and [Jehoiachin] ate regularly in his presence the rest of his life.
Transliteration: veshinah et vigedey khilevo veakhal lechem lefanayv tamiyd khׇl-yemey chayav

Hebrew: וַאֲרֻחָת֗וֹ אֲרֻחַת֩ תָּמִ֨יד נִתְּנָה־לּ֜וֹ מֵאֵ֧ת מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֛ל דְּבַר־י֥וֹם בְּיוֹמ֖וֹ עַד־י֣וֹם מוֹת֑וֹ כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֥י חַיָּֽיו׃
Translated: A regular allotment of food was given him by order of the king of Babylon, an allotment for each day, to the day of his death—all the days of his life.
Transliteration: vaaruchatvo aruchat tamiyd nitenah-lvo meet melekhe-vavel devar-yvom veyvomvo ad-yvom mvotvo khol yemey chayayv
